text: Outstanding service from ground to air This was a direct flight on SQ 35 and SQ 36 between LAX and SIN on the A350 aircraft. Service was great from the Star Alliance lounge to gate staff to the inflight crew. Onboard, the cabin crew was very attentive yet not intrusive. This flight exemplifies the first class service that is the hallmark of Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Danang to Adelaide via Singapore. Our flight over to Vietnam was quite comfortable and good service, however, the return was quite different. My bag was severely damaged in transit from Danang to Singapore. I was given the run around at Changi by staff and have to hope that I can manage a damage claim via email. The Silk air flight (which was code shared on SQ ticket) was very average. Old plane, the meal looked awful. Service was very rushed and impersonal. Singapore to Adelaide flight overnight - no sleep due to extremely badly behaved child that screamed the whole time. Staff seemed oblivious and only intervened to talk to the parents when I requested them to do so. No food served until 5 hrs into the flight despite the fact everyone was awake due to screaming child. Drinks trolley never bought through. No snack service in galley like other flights do. Very disappointed. Food was average and service slow. I found it insulting that the IFE played a video showing all the features of the business class seat not once but twice, a lovely reminder to those in cattle class what they are missing. New A350 has poor leg room and when the person in front reclined i could not bend my legs and had to keep them straightened under the seat in front. IFE very average. Wouldn't go out of my way to fly Singapore again.
label: negative

text: Flight great airline- efficient service and helpful/attentive cabin crew. On time service .great in flight entertainment.
label: positive

text: First time flying SQ business class for my wife and I did not disappoint We have flown Singapore airlines numerous times over the years, always in Economy. So we thought we would spend a heap of frequent flyer points and try Business class with them this time. I have flown Business class in Qantas and Virgin over the years but my wife had never flown Business class. Checkin was efficient and seamless, we were given fast track cards for immigration, advised where the lounge was and that our boarding group was second. The lounge in Melbourne was small dark and adequate, great drink selection and limited food options. The plane for this flight was a 777-300ER wide body plane, leaving at 3.40pm, we had found the legroom in Economy to be better on this aircraft in the past. But nothing compares to the space we had in Business. We were seated in row 12 seats D and F. ( there are only 4 seats per row in Business ) This is in the ‘mini’ cabin just behind first class, and I would absolutely recommend seats in this section, check seat guru or expert flyer websites to check your seats. Remember you can preselect seating months out with SQ. Boarding we were met by name and shown to our seats, our coats were taken and hung up, and a welcome glass of champagne or juice offered. They also cam by later to check what we wanted to drink after take off. This flight was a 7 hour one but still two meal services scheduled. Entree was seared tuna salad, main we had ordered from SQ’s ‘book the cook’, I chose lamb shank curry. There were a selection of warm bread rolls including garlic bread. Desert was a choice of two, ( I got both as there were spare, and I asked ;) ), after desert was a cheese and fruit trolley with a variety of cheese and quince paste, dry nuts, dried fruit and fresh fruit. After this coffee and chocolates were offered. On every course there were matched wines offered, from France, Italy, Spain, Australia and New Zealand, with recommendations made for each course. The chair was able to convert to a fully flat bed. I watched a movie and had a nap reclined but not in bed mode, it was still very comfortable, giving me a 2 hour nap. After my nap, I watched another movie, and another meal was served. Overall a very food rich flight. We had a 4 hour transit in Changi before our next flight to Paris.
label: positive

text: Bisbane to Singspore to Sri Lanka I do use other alines but prefer Singapore Airlines if the ffoute fits my schedule. I recengly flew from Brisbane Australia to Singapore and like most people I changed to another flight at Singapore. As always I was very happy with journey and food was pretty good for airline food. I have long legs so was able to get an exit seat without paying a premium. I trust them as from what I have seen they have very high standards, but zre sometimes mord expensive than other airlines.
label: positive

text: Perth to Zurich return via Singapore. I booked my flight through a flight partner (Virgin Australia) and before this trip I didn't know how flight partners worked, all it did was give me a headache. I wanted to book in my seats, normally you can do that online, however I was unable to do so either through Virgin's website nor through Singapore Airline's. I called Virgin and they told me I need to speak with Singapore. I called Singapore and requested seats. That worked fine. However on the flight over I didn't realise that sitting right at the back was so noisy, I wore earplugs the whole flight and could still hear the noise, but that was fine, I learned my lesson, but when breakfast came, I was the very last person to be served they ran out of the edible meals and the other meal was some kind of fish (which smelled too strong for a confined space). I normally am one to enjoy all kinds of basic airplane food and am really not fussy, but this was too much. Fish for breakfast? I actually was really unhappy because I never got a choice. Knowing all of this, I decided to change my flight home seat booking, so I wasn't the last person on the plane right down the back near all the noise. I emailed Singapore airlines with the request as soon as I landed. It took a couple weeks until they responded with a stock email saying I need to contact Virgin. I emailed back saying Virgin cannot do this as they dont have access to the seating plan, it is Singapore's job and I know as I have done it before. The email response that returned was the same stock email as they had sent again. This time I was really angry and re-iterated that they should please read the content of my email. Third time and I received the same exact response again. This was now 1 month after my original request (lucky I was away for 6 weeks). I had to find a way to call them while overseas (which was a who other headache) because this was not being resolved online. So I called them and had a very long difficult conversation trying to get the guy to help me as he really wasn't actually listening to what I needed and I was getting frustrated. He finally put in the request for me to get the seats changed and when I told him about the food last time he said he could also request a no seafood meal. So I thought great, I'll do that. On my flight home, the seats were all good but this time I discovered that requesting a non seafood meal means that they dont give you any option at all whatsoever, you just get the eggs, even when the meals being served are chicken or beef with no seafood options! When I asked if I get to choose the normal menu as it already is non seafood, I got an abrupt response about taking the meal from someone else. Gosh I had no idea about all this rubbish. So I learned a lot of things this flight. That Singapore Airlines have terrible online support and rubbish food and no matter what I did it didn't get better. I hear all these great things about Singapore Airlines and its probably fine if things are going ok for you but when they go wrong, they dont help you, not without a lot of effort and frustration any way. I will not be using them if I can help it, in the future. FYI I was going to make a complaint to them on their own site but after going through all I did with their online support last time I feel like its pointless and I am probably wasting my time as no one reads the emails (I can assume).
label: negative

text: After transit/change of aircraft From Copenhagen to Singapore, we were on A350 and premium economy was not comfortable. From Singapore to Sydney it was a 777. Great space. Worth the money
label: positive

text: Over all flying with. Singapore Airlines is a lot better than other airlines . Few times we used Singapore Airlines for leisure travel, few occasions they were late , with the schedule hours of flight ,with food and beverages no problem service were always great.
label: neutral

text: Best Airlines - Great Service- Good Food-Variety Inflight Entertainment As always, Singapore Airlines offered great service on A380 aircraft from Sydney to Singapore. Comfortable seats with ample leg space, good reclining angle, wide variety of Inflight Entertainment. Cabin Crew never hesitated to provide food/drinks we wanted. Takeoff and landing was very smooth and minimal vibration. Ontime departure and early arrival at Singapore. Our next flight was from Singapore to Chennai- comfortable and efficient service. Highly recommend Singapore Airlines for everyone. Looking forward for our return journey from Chennai to Sydney.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Amsterdam. Fantastic airline with great food. The plane was quiet and the Skybed came to good use as I slept more than 8 hours. In business class, we are greeted by name and the air crew were friendly and professional. Upon arrival, I even got a friendly Happy New Year hug from a land crew that I got to know through flying SQ all the time. Big hearts to Singapore Airlines - will fly again.
label: positive

text: Superb service From start to finish the service I got was second to none, the food was above par and the response speed from pressing the service button was like a personal service! First time I’ve flown with Singapore airlines and would suggest this airline to anyone
label: positive

text: Munich to Singapore. Unfortunately SQ uses LH services & lounges in MUC. Senator lounge service was extremely poor. We did not feel welcome neither at arrival, neither inside. Wines (of low quality) are not in self-service, quantity served in glasses are severely controlled and personnel (when present) showed agressivity to all customers. Food was inedible (overcooked minced pork), with no other choice. Wi-Fi did not work well. Bad service could also be testified at boarding where LH personnel showed bad mood and did not respect the usual SQ procedures with obvious privileges for their Miles &More passengers. On the other hand we were pleased by the new seats on A350. Plane is fabulous, service was top-notch. We did not want to leave that plane. It is shocking to see that both airlines are quoted 5 stars. LH has a long long way to go to get there.
label: positive

text: Sydney to New Delhi via Singapore. The food (IVML) served on my flight from Sydney to Singapore was horrible. I complained to the cabin crew staff and was not offered a replacement so went without food. The food on Singapore to Delhi flight was also below average. I previously always had an above average experience with SIA but looks like they are cutting costs. I pay a premium to fly with SIA and expect services of acceptable standards. Will not fly with them in future.
label: negative

text: Tech great Passenger comfort not. We looked forward to the flight as it was a new A350-900 - The aircraft was great but the airline economists (bean counters) went for lightweight seats that were not comfortable for a long flight. Seats with an additional 1-2 cm of padding would help with comfort over long distances.
label: neutral

text: Economy 787-10 Pleasantly surprised with the legroom in Economy I am over 6 ft tall and comfort is something I find not great as usually travel Business Class on long haul flights.The entertainment system is generous with programs easy to navigate windows larger seats comfortable have no hesitation in recommending this Airline and aircraft.
label: positive

text: it was a nice safe flight we were traveling with my family. I am with my wife and 2 daughters, one is below 2 yrs old. Since we have a kid we are given a bassinet seat. leg room is superb haha of course its because of the bassinet area :) boarding is ok everyone is helpful as always. Take off and Landing are smooth the kids didnt even bother the changes in their surroundings.
label: positive

text: Best and most comfortable airline in the world Seats are roomy (unlike the wishbone coffin like seats of Cathay and other carriers). Aisles, seating area, and toilets are spotless (unlike Cathay and other carriers). Staff is extreme hospitable, gracious, polite and willing to look after passengers as their chargé d’affaire. This amount of painstaking detail cannot be found in any other carrier period. The pilots need to be commended most of all. The reason being is they arrived early not to chit chat but to speak with ground control across their path and to other arriving pilots which in turn helped them map out a proper flight path that was free of turbulence. In today’s day and age it is erroneous to blame turbulence on anything other than the pilot as it can be mitigated. We have ample satellites and monitoring stations that can outline the pockets of turbulence. Therefore on other carriers it is the pilot’s fault for plotting a rubbish flight path. As the pilots arrived too late adhering to their clock-in rather than their passion for flying. They never bothered to check with ground control along their path or with other pilots on said path. And so they just plot the quickest flight path that will garner them their additional incentive for saving fuel and arriving early; and that is much to the demise of passenger comfort. It is clear those pilots of other carriers such as Cathay have no business flying as they are not passionate about their vocation and are simply there to collect a pay cheque. They are for a lack of a better word - Dead wood that needs to be let go. The pilots of Singapore Airlines are TOP GUNS. They are passionate about their craft (pun intended) and put passenger comfort upfront and above their incentive.
label: positive

text: Like Singapore Airlines Like Singapore Airlines a lot. Very good customer service, very kind and very quick response to passengers needs. The plane was very new and clean, however leg room was not great and the seat felt a little bit small. Food was okay but i noticed the meal sizes have gone smaller since i traveled with them back in 2016. The in flight entertainment system is good but internet is not free. Have used internet services free of charge with different airlines, however i would recommend Singapore Airlines to any one. They got my tick of approval
label: positive

text: Singapore to Stockholm via Moscow. A fantastic experience. Good service and hospitality accorded to me. Nice leg room and array of entertainment options. The transits were well-handled, and despite a short rest at Moscow Airport (less than 1 hour), the plane was cleaned and the next leg from Moscow to Stockholm seems like taking off in a new plane. Staff were attentive and helpful.
label: positive

text: I had an abusive drunk behind me and should not have been allowed on the plane. I normally experience nothing but excellence from this airline, however, in this instance I was really disappointed with the service from the stewards and was amazed that he was allowed on board at Changi. He made the trip to Adelaide the worst I have ever experienced. The stewards were reluctant to shift me or any other passengers effected by him. Apparently the plane was full. I would have to rethink Singapore Airlines again though. But they are a good airline. Usually. I hope this is a once off.
label: neutral

text: Let down Booked and paid for seats well in advance. Was told that seats were no longer available, and separated me, my wife and grandchildren when giving us other seats. Also left two of our cases behind on return. No help or consideration..Left our house key in one case.(I know, very stupid) cost £245 for emergency locksmith...No sympathy from Singapore Airlines..if cases were lost. Then I could have claimed, but they had our cases and refuse to take any responsibility. Lots of other little things went wrong. Ruined a trip of a lifetime....I can honestly say, I can rough it with the best, and except that things can go wrong. But they could have been a lot more understanding with the situations....No more Singapore Airlines for me...
label: negative

text: Average SIA used to be one of the best. Sadly is has deteriorated dramatically. Over past 12 months I have flown Business, Prem Econ and Econ. All have failed to impress me. The lounges in Singapore, Perth and Brisbane are very average with terrible choice of wines and very little in the way of food. Food is very average on flights as well in lounges. I recently flew Aust to US business with Air NZ. Food and beverages are light years in front of SIA. I will avoid them from now on whenever possible... Will never recommend them....
label: neutral

text: Awful service. Worst ever! 3 years agio this business class product used to be a quality one. Now it is absolutely awful. Aircraft is messy, old and dirty, but that's not even the headline of awful. It is the staff. From the minute you enter the lounge to the time you exit the flight, it is so unpleasant bordering on hostile. I have never experienced a worse business class airline experience in my life, and I can't even imagine how bad the economy class must be!!!
label: negative

text: Good flight Good flight. The seats were comfortable and we had enough leg room. It is just annoying when the people in front put there seats back and then watch the entertainment, it seems a case of" I can so I will". The food was good except the breakfast but overall good choice. We would use Singapore airlines again, the cabin crew were very nice and efficient and the flight overall wasn't too bad for such a long time.
label: positive

text: Not Good I have been trying to book an award ticket with KrisFlyer miles. Impossible! waitlist after waitlist. Unacceptable! Either redeem almost double the required miles or pay! Not good Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text: Reliable service I booked my flight in July and was concerned if I would be bumped off the flight given the current cap imposed by the Australian government. I heard horror story that passengers booked Cathay and only been told 3 days beforehand that they are going to be bumped off as cathay oversold their tickets. Luckily this didn't happen. Singapore Airlines honored their service which is highly important. The flights were on schedule. Covid 19 measures were clear and I felt safe.
label: positive

text: Paris to Melbourne via via Singapore. After premium economy to Paris we flew home in Business Class with Singapore Airlines and really enjoyed the experience. Check in at CDG was smooth and we headed to the Star Alliance lounge which is not bad, except getting a seat was a real challenge as it handles so many airlines. Boarding on the A380 was orderly and seated in seats 18 and 19 K on the window. Drinks prior to take-off with French champagne and orders taken for lunch. Flight entertainment was excellent as was the service from a very professional crew. Landed in Singapore about 30 mins early so had time to freshen up in the lounge before boarding for Melbourne. Boeing 777 aircraft with the new Business class seats which again were very comfortable. Daylight flight so had a chance to watch more movies and enjoy the excellent in flight service. Overall you can see why Singapore Airlines are very good at what they do.
label: positive

text: Amazing service We flew out on the airbus a380 on the way there and Boeing 777 on the way back. Both aircraft were a bit dated but they were very clean and nothing seemed broken. What makes Singapore one of the best airlines is the service which is second to none. All staff are polite and nothing is to much of a problem. The food was good both ways. Entertainment is up to date and there is plenty to watch. Overall the flight was smooth and on time. I would highly recommend this airline to anyone.
label: positive

text: Yangon to Adelaide via Singapore and a great experience with Singapore Airlines. The food has improved since previous journeys. Crew friendly and happy to help. The IFE was sufficient for the routes flown with plenty of options. Even on the shorter journey the attention to detail was evident. Both flights couldn't be faulted.
label: positive

text: POOR SERVICE AND CUSTOMER RESPONSE we were denied boarding due to Visa issues and nobody from SFO singporeair staff responded to our questions/concerns. they just ignored us and our questions we reserved front row seats ahead of journey, they still deducted money even though we were denied boarding. when called customer care they said they dont refund whatever is the case we managed to get visa and move the trip to 2 days after with extra charges, the SFO staff made us waiting for almost 1 hour as their credit card system is not working. even though i offered to pay online they did not accept flight is good but they dont serve food on time. they only served 1 meal and 1 breakfast for 17 hour flight. the first meal they served is after 10 hours after flight started although flight is good, i do not recommend singaporeair as staff and response is very poor and in flight meals service is very bad
label: negative

text: Excellent flight experience On Dreamliner business class. High standard service! Wide variety of food and beverage selection. Pre-booked the cook, the food was great. Cabin Crew were attentive, efficient and genuine. They make me feel comfortable and at ease.
label: positive

text: Slow check in but good flight. We had done an online check in and only had to have our bags weighed and we were thinking that the process will be pretty quick, unfortunately this wasn't to be the case. The queue at check in was not long but it took an extraordinary amount of time to get to the counter. There were numerous people with overweight bags who then set about sorting the contents of their bags out at the counter. I really think these people should be asked to move away from the counter, sort out their bags and then rejoin the queue, holding everyone else up just does not seem right. Other people for reasons unknown took so long to process it had us scratching our heads. Once we reached the counter processing our bags took about 4 minutes and we were out of there. The flight however was very good, the staff are excellent and the meals served were really quite good. The onboard entertainment was more than enough for a flight of that length and even in economy the legroom was quite adequate.
label: positive

text: Good experience Very comfortable, pleasant staff. Great experience! Definitely worth the drive from Hertfordshore the day before. I haven’t flown economy to compare with United or BA economy. The seats were very comfortable.
label: positive

text: A Good Airline to fly My Flight to Brunei onboard SQ 182 on 21/09/2018 at 8.40am, was a very satisfying trip, with the cabin crew doing a great job for the passengers on this flight. The Chief Stewardess did an excellent service during this flight. When I asked for some extra packet of nuts and croissants for breakfast, she readily gave me more than i expected, with a smile on her face. Overall, it was a great way to start the day and a great way to fly SIA.
label: positive

text: Wonderful flights We flew Manchester to Singapore for a 3 day stopover then Singapore to Sydney. Came back same way without stopover in Singapore. Couldn’t fault airline. On time, comfortable and they never stop feeding you! We took up offer to bid for upgrade to premium economy, which we were successful for Singapore to Manchester flight. Wouldn’t do it again. Very little difference to being in economy. We had booked ( and paid for ) extra leg room in economy and this would have been a better option if you can get it.
label: positive

text: Choose yr flight from Brisbane Carefully The problem with this flight was the equipment (an "old" Boeing 777) and the arrival time in Changi. On previous flights (at different times) we have had newer aircraft..which have a few more features...such as USB ports for charging phones etc. If going to Europe - the arrival time in Changi leaves you with about 6-8 hours for connecting flights. Even tho there are transit hotels - they are always booked out. So you have to try and find a comfortable chair to get some sleep. With an arrival of 00:15 - I cannot understand why SQ wants to serve a "full" meal just before landing. The actual meals offered were not so so special. Why not just offer a sandwich or wrap?? Faster and easier to serve, no need for utensils etc etc - so no single use plastics involved. Of the airlines serving the destinations I visit - SQ is still the best of the bunch...
label: positive

text: Great experience flying with a baby We had a great experience flying with Singapore Airlines. This was the first trip we have taken with our 8 month old. The staff onboard all of our flights went above and beyond to make our trip as easy and as comfortable as possible.
label: positive

text: Premium Economy Seating on Singapore Airlines not worth the money! Premium Economy Seating on Singapore Airlines has narrow seats and poor leg room compared to Air NZ or Virgin. Drinks served in plastic beakers, roast chicken tough as was the meat in the noodle dinner. Orange juice concoction was not a premium offering. Toilets - we had to walk half way back down the Economy cabin to queue for the toilet. One toilet on the plane was not working. Having flown with Air NZ the day before the difference in amenities and poor value for money was apparent with Singapore Airlines. Poor Kris Flyer website if you wish to upgrade it doesn't work!
label: negative

text: All airlines are much of a muchness. All airline flights are much of a muchness ,with the cabin crew helpful and friendly , and willing to accommodate where possible . The food always leaves a lot to be desired . Maybe I am spoiled but often the food is just something to eat . This is general for all major airlines.
label: neutral

text: Worst experience ever I been trying to book online for days now and I keep getting an error message so i decided to call and book it over the phone. Due to the language barrier I can bearly understand what the customer service rep is saying. Long story short on the website my premium tickets are 2500.00 after we book everything I get a pending charge for 20k. I call back and they tell me I agreed to the charge. How can I agree to pay 20k for tickets online priced at 2500 that's makes no sense at all. Then they tell me they have to investigate, log online and type in my itinerary and you'll see the price is not 20k, what's to investigate??? Excused the grammatical errors I'm still mad at this whole situation. 20K for premium economy seat ticket? Not business, not first class but economy? The rep couldn't realized she about toncharge someone 20k for economy seats. Smh
label: negative

text: Excellent Flight crew was very friendly, efficient, helpful. A bonus was the flight attendants were pretty, with hair pulled up, not hanging over food service. They were slender and healthy looking such that you could get by them in the aisle, not like US flight attendants who look like they couldn’t save themselves in an emergency let alone save passengers.
label: positive

text: This rating is solely given for the crew's immaculate service & excellent skills of the pilot's on both to & fro trips We travelled on Suite class on SQ A380 both ways to & fro Sin Ldn about 2 weeks ago. We have also done First Class from Singapore and returned from London in 777 suite pre-COVID before. This review is a comparison for these 2 trips both Sin-Ldn and back. Cons: 1) Pre-Covid FOOD served on Board --- We were extremely impressed with our first class trip from Sin - Ldn. I am a foodie. The food served on this leg was very memorable. We always order the lobster from book the cook because my partner loves to eat seafood and for me I was never once impressed with their lobtser served on their business class normaly. This pre-COVID first class trip meal was the best I ever had on SQ. The lobster was done very well and prepared more extravagantly than what we were normally offered on normal business class. U could tell it's first class with a big difference. Pre-COVID, SQ also offer delicious Japanese Kaiseki Meal on First class which we paired with sake. Really felt like having a Michelin star meal. - Recent trip on A380 suite from Sin to Ldn. Food in the Private Room was good. We had lobster in laksa gravy. The lobster was fresh and laksa gravy was good. We did not eat much because we have ordered our meal on board from book the cook. It was a mistake; we should have had our full meal in the private room before boarding the plane because after that all the main courses quality went downhill. We ordered the lobster and beef from Book the Cook. There is no difference in terms of taste, quality or presentation from the Business Class we flew to France 2 months prior. Very ordinary and was not tasty at all. The beef was overly salted. In fact I prefered the beef cheek I have ordered for our business class to France. Didn't expect the Food on Suite can be so disappointing. Total letdown. The only saving grace was a delicious chinese clear soup served from Sin to Ldn. The same soup was served on our returned flight and was not tasty at all. Food on both return flights from London to Sin was not palatable. The mains were bad and the dessert was even worse. i even commented to a flight stewardess that some economy class box meals on regional flights tasted much better. 2) In my opinion the seat for Suite class is not as comfortable as the business or first class seat. The only plus point is you get an extra double bed if you travel with a partner. To be honest I much prefer a business / First Class seat. 3) Business class 2 months ago- Passenger will not be provided with amenity kit if one does not request. Unlike in the past the stewardess will ask if you would like to have one. 4) Suite class Feb 2023 - There is no lip gross in the amenity bag. Luckily I brought one along myself. SQ used to include little crystal fishes' ornament in the past for your collection but now not anymore. There are not many items provided. So please bring your own. Pro: 1) It's spacious. You will have the feeling that you're staying in a small hotel room rather than on an airplane. 2) Service. i) Pre-Covid service on First Sin- London was excellent + excellent returned trip on SQ 777 suite was forgettable ii) Recent trip to & fro Sin - London on A380 suite, all the crews were very attentive and prefessional. I flew with my partner. SQ has sent an email to my partner requesting for a review but I didn't received one. Hence this review.
label: neutral

text: Not as nice as I expected & seating issues Even though our travel agent had booked our tickets at the same time, Singapore Airlines was going to seat my husband and I in separate rows. I frantically contacted our travel agent back in New Zealand hoping she could do something but she said it was out of her control. Singapore Airlines wasn't particularly empathetic to the situation and offered to ask if one passenger could swap their seat so we could sit together. They weren't willing to ask others (or demand). Thankfully the person said yes. The plane was older than expected. Service on the plane and the food were rather average.
label: neutral

text: SQ23 in Premium Economy Solo Seat. 1730 Arrived at The counter. Instantly was approached, and greeted by a extremely professional gentleman, Asking which flight I was on. When I told him SQ23, he asked “could you please wait?”. Well I went to get water, came back, and instantly he reengaged me, stating the counter was ready for me, and took me straight to the head of the line. Check in fast, with agent verifying information. Boarding was quick. Upon boarding a Red Uniformed Cabin Attendant welcomed me aboard, and directed me to my seat. As I passed others they acknowledged me and welcomed me aboard. One even said “Happy Thanksgiving”. Aircraft seemed extremely cold, and rather uncomfortable. We seemed to be late pushing back, and The Red Uniformed staff was going around talking to passengers. She approached me, and began to engage in conversation. She thanked me for flying SQ for 14 years. Finally we Took off. I had to use the provided blanket. Champagne is back on the menu. When they arrived with Dinner, they ran out of food, so the Steward said he had to go to Business to get entrees. He came back and said what he had. I ordered the Beef. He kept checking in, with estimated time of completion. Constant Champagne rounds followed through the flight. After dinner I slept. Standalone seat extremely comfortable, and excellent value. Second meal came out. I had the Stir Fry Shrimp which was Delicious. Constant Champagne refills continued. On approach to Changi, I switched to Coffee, which also continued with multiple rounds. Arriving in SIN on Thanksgiving morning, crew wished us well as we debarked. I have been flying with Singapore Airlines since 2008. This flight maybe the best experience I have ever had with them!!!
label: positive

text: Krysflyer Customer Service I have never and I mean never been treated so poorly by the Krisflyer redemption desk. I’ve been trying to book my first class plane ticket for over four months and I cannot get any answers out of anyone. All they do is hang up on me and I am being really nice? They cannot speak good English so I’m very patient and kind and they always put me on hold for long periods of time and then hang up. I can say, I wish I never transferred my miles to Singapore because this will be my last trip I ever do and I have not even gotten off the ground yet! We are so excited about flying Singapore but after the ground experience I am not so sure that this is going to be as good as we thought? I have the miles and the money but they just want to overcharge me for a first class ticket from LAX to BKK. The system will only let you book the last segment because it is business class so all you should have to do is call and ask to add the last segment at no extra miles but I always want to charge more miles and more money! Can anyone help at Singapore airlines?
label: negative

text: BUSINESS CLASS DAMAGED LUGGAGE London to Singapore our cases came off the carousel just like new (we purchased them especially for our long haul flight). HOWEVER, Singapore to Darwin and the luggage was covered in thick oil spots when we collected from the carousel. It was not easy to find the correct member of staff to explain our horror. When we eventually had a response from Silk Air they offered a 'gesture of goodwill' dry clean. On their return from the cleaners the cases showed obvious signs of ingrained oil and we were advised that two of the cases had been steam cleaned which had resulted in water marks on the inside of the cases. We explained that that overall end result of the 'dry cleaning' was not satisfactory and unsuitable for further business travel. We requested a staring refund for the value of the cases. We had a copy of the receipt of purchase and phots of the cases before and afterwards. This was BUSINESS CLASS. You expect your baggage to not be damaged to this extent. Their reply was they could take our issue no further and their recommendation for future travels is that we may wish to 'wrap all your bags to keep them protected from marks and stains'. I feel their sarcastic comment added nothing but an insult to our ask of replacement. Be warned!
label: negative

text: Great Flight from Singapore to London The Singapore Airlines A380 flight from Singapore to London, UK offers excellent service and value for your money in Premium Economy Class. The flight staff were attentive, professional and friendly and the long direct flight of 13 hours and 35 minutes seemed to go by quickly. I highly recommend Premium Economy Class for this flight with wide and comfortable seats in a 2-4-2 configuration especially in the window and isle combination (2). You do not have to share an armrest, you have extra legroom and an additional recline angle for your seat that allows for sleeping on this overnight flight to London. The food was well above average and there is a wide range of entertainment options for movies, TV shows, news and music for those who do not want to sleep. For those who do choose to sleep after the main meal and before breakfast, Singapore Airlines offers large blankets and reasonably comfortable pillows. This A380 flight is great for those that have business or tourism in London. Compared with many long haul flights, Singapore Airlines flight SQ306 is one of the better options available and it lives up to the Singapore Airlines ranking as one of the best airlines in the world. It certainly met with my needs and expectations and I would book this flight again. Put it on your list of options as it offers competitive cost, good service and the quality of a first class airline from Singapore to London. While you can ask for a sleep mask and earplugs, Singapore Airlines, should include these for everyone who chooses to fly in premium economy class on a flight of this duration.
label: positive

text: First flight on 26th April was a tatty 777-300. The saving grace was no passenger in the middle seat. The carpet in the aisle was threadbare. The seating upholstery was no better, very scruffy. No fruit, no salad, no cheese & crackers and only one choice for breakfast. A cold roll was served but only butter to put on it, no conserves. No pre meal drink service. One beer or 1 glass of wine served with the meal. No wifi all flight. The in flight entertainment had to be rebooted 5 times. The crew were very good on this leg regularly passing through the cabin with water. SIN - BKK a more modern A350. I was looking forward to my 1st flight on an A350. The seats were thin with little support. Again the only saving grace was no centre seat occupant. The crew seemed to be in training with young people following older crew members around. I purposely selected Singapore Airlines for my flight following their pre-covid reputation at extra expense.
label: negative

text: First class from Singapore to Narita with Singapore Airlines. An old plane (compared to the ones advertised recently) huge seat. Very personalised service from check in to the plane. Pyjamas offered on board, even for this relatively short (around 6 hours flight). Book the cook service offered an amazing selection of food, however I chose the inflight menu with the Japanese selection. It was fantastic for a supper menu! The bed is made by collapsing the back of the seat and is quite comfortable. Inflight entertainment was a bit tough (the remote was quite old). There was inflight wifi however I didn't use it. The whole experience is definitely recommendable.
label: positive

text: Long daylight flight Exit row seat, so plenty of leg room. 13 hours full day light flight, so no sleep. Food was OK and the cabin crew were great as usual.
label: positive

text: Superb Service Always fly SQ. Never seen better service from any other cabin crew. The crew genuinely makes you feel comfortable up in the air. Friendly, professional and super caring. Nice conversations. Also the airline doesn’t cut corners in Quality. Truly amazing airline.
label: positive

text: Great entertainment but shame about the continuous high pitched whine! Check in was a breeze with automatic machines which give you the labels. The plane, a huge 380 was jam packed, not a spare seat anywhere. The seats were comfortable and the entertainment system was superb, the best of any flight we’ve been on. The screens are very large, and very easy to use, with a huge range of excellent movies. The staff, as usual, were charming and happy to serve you. The meal was better than most, and there were snacks available from the galley during the flight. As an economy flight it was better than most. Our only complaint was the continuous high pitched whine which we believe was the refrigeration compressors. It was very disturbing and made the journey almost intolerable - hence only 3 stars. Even headphones didn’t block the noise out. Apart from that it was a good flight.
label: neutral

text: Live up to the number one airline in the world I have a connecting flight from Bangkok to Singapore. I was exhausted from the previous long haul flight from Rome as I wasn’t able to sleep due to jet lag. I slept once I got on board and didn’t eat anything on board. The flight attendants were very helpful. They helped me hang my jackets, placed my luggages on the compartment and came to check with me constantly. Will definitely fly with Singapore Airlines again. I am not so sure if the aircraft for all route is as dated as the one that I was on. The seat is dated but functional. Well, not a super long flight so it doesn’t matter much. Short flight with flat bed (picture as attached), price is also competitive.
label: positive

text: Trip Home Fabulous service, from the movement of luggage, to sorting out a hotel room, and the care and attention that all staff gave to me. I cannot recommend the people that work for this airline enough. Food was fab.
label: positive

text: SIA demands client's credit card b/4 boarding the plane & AVOID seat 41C or 41H! My client in Japan purchased the ticket for me in August and I flew 1 Dec, SIN to Tokyo. Only 1 week prior did they tell me I needed to present the actual credit card on which the ticket was purchased. This had happened once before but only on SIA. Japan SIA told my client no need to present the card. I tried to verify with SIA in Singapore but they said cc was needed. Japanese client checked again with SIA in Japan... no card needed. Back @ SIA Singapore & guy in charge writes, I MUST have the card to board. Finally, I'm told the client paid cash. AHH...cannot show cash. 6 years ago with SIA same problem and the cancelled my ticket and I had to buy a new one at 3 times the fee from their ticket counter to get on the plane. Never with any other airline and I've flown over 2 million miles, ONLY SIA. Archaic, foolish system. At the airport, no one there to check for a card anyway! Never had this problem with Emirates, Oman Air, Etihad, American, Delta, Malaysian Air, Garuda, Air France, British Air, Namibian Air, South African Airways, Air Israel or any other airline... just SIA. One problem ON the flight. I paid extra for a bulkhead seat, 41H flying out of SIN and 41C on the return. BAD SEAT! The seat selection map shows the aisles are straight. They are NOT. No TV screen in front of me... it's folded down on the side. The aisle makes a dogleg to the window side. My feet ended up in the aisle and I had to keep moving them because the crew had to pull the cart over my foot area and people leaving the premium economy to use the toilets behind me kept stepping on my feet... both coming and going to the toilets. Why pay $32+ to have your feet walked on AND no overhead bin or place to store luggage in front?
label: negative

text: Brilliant crew and great service. The business class seating is superb. Everything you could wish for on a long flight or in our case 2 flights Melb to Singapore and then Singapore to Copenhagen. We were in good shape when we arrived. The crew were so obliging and the meals superb. Entertainment was plentiful on the screen, but you could read if you wanted to or sleep. Recommend highly.
label: positive

text: Tokyo Narita to Los Angeles with Singapore Airlines (SQ12). A380 on the upper level Business Class section. Service on Singapore Airlines is top notch, staff are very friendly and professional and treat passengers quite well. Food and drinks selections are excellent with a wide range of choices available. Having flown on several A380's primarily those operated by Singapore Airlines, I have found that this one offers some of the older seating which I am not terribly fond of. My problem with the seats is that the foot rest shelf is offset and does not allow for one to site with their legs straight ahead, instead you have to angle your legs slightly which is uncomfortable. Also on these older planes, the electrical controls for the seats are showing their age and heavy use by being slow to respond or not respond at all. For converting your seat into a bed, there is unfortunately no information provided and either requires you to spend a great deal of time figuring it out or waiting for an attendant to help you (or watch them while they help someone else). Basically the latch to release the seat back is located on the upper outer edge towards the aisle, but is well concealed so not easy to find even by touch. You must also make sure that the seat is in the full upright position before trying to convert it to a bed. Another problem that I have encountered is that the temperature in the cabins is usually on the warm side which makes it difficult to sleep well. With regards to inflight WiFi, it would be nice if this was included for Business Class and Suites passengers considering the cost of tickets on Singapore Airlines. Overall though I greatly enjoy taking this flight from Narita to LAX since the A380 is quite comfortable and less prone to the effects of turbulence.
label: positive

text: So impressed!!! i flew back a couple of days ago with singapore airlines, all the way from new zealand to amsterdam. I was a bit scared to go because of the whole corona, but was met with such kindness and understanding by the phone operator even before I left which calmed my nerves. during the flight everybody was so kind and understanding, which is admirable because they are constantly being exposed to all kinds of people/maybe corona. everything was thought out off, even guiding us through singapore airport, so that we would never come in contact with anyone who was staying there (i was a transit ofcourse) forever grateful for all the happy faces and impeccable customer service. will always fly with Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: No staff at the transfer desk to issue boarding pass. I was told to proceed to the boarding gate for service. After one hour of waiting in a queue, several people including me were finally get their passes. While we were lining up, many travellers (probably first and business class) cut the queue to insist on going to the aircraft first. From what I feel, they need a bigger crew to service the A380. Staff avoided eye contact with me to speed up their service. Food was not ready for the first meal. I had to wait half an hour for my main meal after finishing everything else. I was not offered a drink and when I asked, they signalled me to wait. I waited for another half an hour without any drink from the crew yet the guy two rows in front of me asked for a refill and was offered immediately. Second meal was a total disaster, it took an hour for our cabin to be served. To the point that, many people who were already served, they expected their trays to be cleared but nothing happened and many people took the matters into their own hands by bringing trays to cabin crew. Drinks were offered and served very minimally. I can confidently say it because my second flight later with an A350, it was a joy again. Everything ran on time. Polite and civilized boarding. No late service. I still can feel a drop in service as compared to pre-pandemic time.
label: positive

text: Round trip to Myanmar Great service, comfortable airline, love using them. I would use them again and have no issue recommending them.
label: positive

text: Brand new A350 from Singapore to Moscow, didn't want to get off ! Really blown away by the comfort level on this flight. IFE was bang up to date and super quality, service excellent and the aircraft is very comfortable.
label: positive

text: The worst experience ever I am yet to fly with Singapore Airlines as my tickets are booked for October but I can honestly say this is the worst booking experience we have ever had. We booked through an authorised agent and the booking including an infant in seat. We checked all the requirements on Singapore Airlines website and purchased a car sear which fit all their criteria. This was particularly expensive as the seat needed to be CAA certified. We were then notified by SA that we couldn't have the infant with seat even though we had paid for it and even though we had followed their own guidelines. They advised that the infant had to be over 6 months which it doesn't state on any of their literature. SA took weeks looking into this issue during which time my tickets were voided incorrectly causing issues with my credit card. I called 11 times to the helpline when managers promised to call back but failed to do so. The whole process has been a nightmare and other than offering hollow apologies Singapore Airlines have been incredibly unhelpful. I would never book with them again and would warn anyone else used to Emirates or Etihad to steer clear.
label: negative

text: Disappointing Yes, Jetstar give better service. Poor attitude by some stewardess. I expected better than that, especially paying for business class.
label: negative

text: good airlines to travel long haul good service prompt plenty to eat on board and varied and interesting entertainment for both adults and children
label: positive

text: Old Business Class Product but a Great Way to Fly Singapore Airlines uses the A330-300 to ply the route between Singapore and Hanoi. The interior of the aircraft felt old, Singapore Airlines A330-300 comes with a two-class configuration. The Business Class cabin has a total of 30 seats while the Economy Class cabin has 255 seats. The white-walled Business Class cabin feels spacious and the seats are clad in beige and dark brown, making it look both comfortable and classy. The seats in Business Class cabin onboard Singapore Airlines A330-300 are arranged in a 2-2-2 configuration. There are two lavatories at the back of the Business Class cabin serving the passengers. The lavatory feels spacious, thanks to the clever use of mirrors in the lavatory coupled with the bright lighting and the choice of white colour for the paint in the lavatory. There are two cabinets on either side of the sink. The left cabinet is where passengers can find handkerchiefs, tissues, paper towels and paper cups to be used with the mouth wash. Beneath this cabinet is the trash can, which can be operated with a pedal near to the floor of the lavatory. The right cabinet is well stocked with amenities. Here is where combs, sanitary napkins, toothbrushes and razors are stowed. Beneath the right cabinet is bottles of amenities such as mouth wash, facial mist, hand lotion and eau de toilette. The sink in Singapore Airlines A330-300 Business Class is fitted with the old touch button tap. The toilet seat is clad with a leather cover, making it look more premium than those ones would find in Economy Class lavatories. There are a couple of coat hooks on the door of the lavatory. Singapore Airlines A330-300 features a Regional Business Class seats in the Business Class cabins. Each seat is cocooned in a shell clad in soft brown leather, which is very comfortable to sit one, measures 60" in pitch and 24.5" wide. The seat controls are in the armrest of the seat, above the storage for the IFE controller. The legroom in the Business Class seats onboard Singapore Airlines A330-300 is excellent, where I can fully stretch out my legs even when the seat is in an upright position. Each seat onboard Singapore Airlines A330-300 is treated to three window panels. A large pillow and a soft blanket are already placed on the seat when I arrived at my seat during boarding. I find the pillow firm and very comfortable to rest my head. The Business Class seats are preset to four modes: an upright position for take-off/landing or for passengers who prefer to sit upright during meal times; a lounging position which I find the most comfortable for relaxing in when watching movies from the IFE; a semi flatbed mode which I find the best position for sleeping; and a full flatbed mode. The seats are angled slightly in full flatbed mode and are not 180º flat, sleeping on this mode feels as though one would slide off the bed. Apart from these preset seat positions, there are buttons that allow passengers to adjust the recline of the seat to a position that one finds most comfortable. There are two reading lights for each seat in the Singapore Airlines Business Class seats, one on the bulkhead of the seat, which can be turned on and off from the seat control panel; and one inside the seat which can be activated by pushing the light itself. There is no lack of storage space in the Singapore Airlines A330-300 Business Class seats. Under the IFE TV screen, there are two huge storage bins for passengers to store small items such as phones, passports or compact cameras. However as these bins are rather shallow, it will not be able to hold bigger cameras or laptops/iPads. There are also two smaller shelves between the two seats and these shelves are capable of holding iPods or smaller phones. There is another more hidden storage bin underneath one of the armrests. This bin allows passengers to place their laptops and iPads. This is where the power outlet and two USB ports are located for passengers to charge their lifestyle devices. There are two cup holders between the two seats, which allows passengers to place their drinks without having the need to deploy the tray tables. Seat tables are hidden in between the seats. These tables can be a tad difficult to pull out as they seem to be rather heavy. The tables are large enough for passengers to place their laptop on to do some work. These tables can be slide back and forth, however, to get out of the seat, one would have to put away the table. Seat pockets where the in-flight literature such as in-flight magazine, duty-free shopping catalogue and Singapore Airline's lifestyle magazine along with the in-flight menu, airsick bag and aircraft safety card are found in front of the seat between the two IFE TV screens. The noise-cancelling headphones are also found here when I board the aircraft. There is a divider between the two seats, providing guests with great privacy especially when one is sitting next to a stranger. All Singapore Airlines A330-300 Business Class seats are fitted with a 15.4" personal TV. Kris World is the Singapore Airline In-Flight Entertainment System. As this is a rather old product, these TVs does not have touchscreen function. Controls for the Kris World is done through the remote control, stowed on the left side of the sit. Despite being old, the IFE system is still responsive. There are numerous entertainment options on Kris World for passengers on board, ranging from movies to TV programmes to games which kept me entertained throughout the 3hr 30 min flight. Kris World is arranged in an intuitive menu that is easy to navigate through. All Business Class seats come with noise-cancelling headphones that keeps out noise effectively. The remote controller for the IFE is stored on the left seat armrest. The front side of the IFE controller has some quick access menus for flight information, movies and radio. The LCD screen on the front of the controller provides flight information. Other buttons such as volume control, screen brightness control and menu controls are also found on the front side of the remote control. On the back of the remote control are some buttons and directional dials for playing of games on the IFE. There is a qwerty keyboard also found on the back of the remote control, which does not seem to serve any function in the IFE system. Passengers flying out of Singapore (and some other countries) have the option of using the famed "Book the Cook" service. There are several options for passengers to choose from. My friend and I used the "Book the Cook" and ordered the Classic Lobster Thermidor. Pre-departure drinks are offered as soon as we settled into our seats. The cabin crew came around and offer Champagne, Apple Juice or still water. I took the apple juice. As this is a medium-haul flight, food is served in a tray with a pre-laid table cloth. Cabin crews sprung into action and went around the cabin to serve passengers the appetiser about 30 mins after taking off. The appetiser, Prawn Salad, was tasty. The prawn tasted fresh and the sauce is amazing. Another cabin crew came by with a basket of an assortment of bread. I opted for the Garlic Bread, which is famous on Singapore Airlines Business and First Class cabins. The Garlic Bread is flavourful with the garlic taste not too overpowering. I had four Garlic Bread throughout the meal service. For the appetiser, we had Marinated Prawns with Asparagus and Mesclun Shortly after cabin crews noticed passengers have finished our appetisers, They went around and served the main meal that we have chosen. As I am allergic to mushrooms, which mushrooms are not stated as one of the main ingredients in the "Book the Cook" menu, I did not have too much of the lobster. I tasted a small portion of the lobster (and started to get some allergic reactions), and it tasted creamy and fresh. The rice that comes together with the Classic Lobster Thermidor was fragrant. The final course of the meal, Raspberry Bavarois, was served after cabin crews collected the trays from the passengers. The dessert was not too sweet and light, the taste of raspberry was just right. Cabin crews came by to take orders for coffee or tea. I ordered a cup of Latte to finish with the meal. Throughout the flight, cabin crews went around asking passengers if we want any drinks and the drinks were constantly topped up. The service in Business Class onboard Singapore Airlines is top-notch. Cabin crews greeted us by our last names the moment we present our boarding passes during boarding. Whenever the cabin crews interact with us, they will address us by our last names, which makes us feel personalised service is provided. Cabin crews would constantly patrol the cabin after meal times to check and see if passengers require any refill of water. Call buttons are answered almost immediately where the diligent cabin crews attended to passengers needs. Cabin crews are also seen interacting with passengers and taking interest in striking up conversations. During my two flights with Singapore Airlines, I had great chats with the cabin crews. The cabin crews on this flight nothing short of amazing. It is a pity I did not manage to get their names. They were seen helping passengers with storing their carry-on luggage in the overhead compartment, other than standing at the door to greet passengers. During boarding, cabin crews went around taking meal orders in every seat. The cabin crew came by to confirm our booking for food that we have pre-booked our meals through the "Book the Cook" service. They were seen sprung into action as soon as the seat belt sign has been turned off after taking off. The cabin crew also checked if we had any food allergies when she was serving the appetiser. When I sounded out that I am allergic to mushroom and my friend allergic to prawns, she quickly checked with the menu to confirm if there are any allergens to us. She came back with her supervisor and inform us that the Classic Lobster Thermidor contains mushrooms. The supervisor also assured me that they will help us register our allergies in their system (which I have tried to do several times prior to departure via the KrisFlyer hotline, which apparently the call centre staff did not do so). However, the mushrooms seem to have been infused into the meat of the lobster, which caused a slight swell on my lips. The cabin crew came by to check if the lobster had triggered any reactions. I casually mention to the cabin crew that I feel a little swell on my lips, she quickly came back with her supervisor to see if there is any help they can render. This goes to show the level of care the cabin crew has for their passengers. As the appetiser on this leg of the flight contains prawns, the cabin crew came back with a potato salad for my friend. When the cabin crew learnt that I did not have much during the main course, she returned to my seat with two packets of cookies in case I feel hungry. Flying with Singapore Airlines Business Class is an enjoyable experience. The good service started at the airport during check-in and continues into the flight. Despite being an old product, Singapore Airlines A330-300 Business Class was comfortable to fly for Singapore-Hanoi route. The Business Class seat is very comfortable to sit in during the flight. However, the fully flat bed mode was a tad too sloppy for my liking, but since it is a relatively short flight, it does not really matter. There is plenty of storage in the seat that allows us to store some of our knick-knacks. The In-Flight Entertainment system is packed with entertainment options that make us feel the 3hr 30 min flight time zooms past quicker than it seems. The thing that leaves me wanting to fly with Singapore Airlines again is the service that we have received on board. The service was exceptional and the cabin crew was not only friendly, but their caring for their passengers felt genuine. They kept their smiles throughout the entire flight and was seen helping passengers during boarding and in-flight.
label: positive

text: Where is the usual SQ standard This was a chartered flight by Scoot. Could it be the difference? The plane, a 777-200 was not a modern plane but it's the seat and run down material letting the whole experience down. After few hours, most passengers could feel the pain at the back. The screen was of low resolution and poor audio, connecting by a 20 years' old handset control. The air draft from the top was dry and strong, making the whole trip hard to bear. Service by SQ cabin crew was good though but not the meal. It's hard to imagine this was one of SQ typical flying quality.
label: neutral

text: Awesome Fly from Singapore to Melbourne for my family holiday trip. Singapore airlines, absolutely awesome. Crew are very efficient, polite and helpful. Provide delicious meal and seats are comfrontable. Look forward to my next SQ flight to NZ in Feb 2020 for my next holiday trip. I will definitely continue to fly SQ.
label: positive

text: One of the better airlines. I have flown with them many times and they are consistently very good. The one BIG negative to me is that they provide the front seats to people with infants to utilise bassinet clips. One previous flight I was in Premium Economy and had a screaming infant directly behind me on the bulkhead, hence I won't pay the extra any more. It is also a dangerous practice as they rows with extra room are those to be utilised in an emergency, for example one exit side is blocked these rows would be the crossover point. The staff are always friendly and efficient and food better than average. With the exception of their bassinet policy one of my favourite airlines.
label: positive

text: SIN-FCO-SIN on SQ366/365. The crews on both flights were outstanding and accommodating to our requests. Nonetheless there was a handful of crew members who whilst polite were rather cold and didn't appear to be interested in going the extra mile. I've noticed this lately on SIA but this was made up by the exceptional service rendered by the rest of the crew. We ordered special meals. Food on the outbound was excellent though our vegetarian meal on the inbound was very bland and not fulfilling at all. IFE selection was mediocre at best. Movie and TV selection was limited and disappointing. This tends to be the case on SIA it's a bit of a hit and miss. Emirates has its act together much better in this area. We got a refurbished 772 which was nice. Legroom was great. However the hard seat cushions made sitting down a bit uncomfortable after a while and ill-placed IFE remotes which were on the armrests. Your legs would keep knocking against the controls. Overall it was an above average flight and I would use SQ again. Though I wouldn't be adamant. It wasn't spectacular and I'm sure they're competitors can offer equally good flights.
label: positive

text: Fabulous flight I fly with Singapore airlines frequently and they are always efficient, friendly, on time and have excellent customer service.
label: positive

text: Flew on Thursday 9th Jan 2020 from Singapore to Brisbane. Endured some turbulence flying out of Singapore for a few hours. I became nauseated and uncomfortable. Staff were very kind and helpful making sure I was looked after. Checked on me numerous times, throughout the flight. Very impressed with the cabin crew and would recommend flying with this airline in the future.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Excellent care and service. From check in to baggage claim. The seat was a wee tight but the good food and videos made up for it. I liked the assortment of food, but the little snacks were not too good.
label: positive

text: Mean spirited bunch of ****’s The airline is regimented and inflexible. Don’t ask for anything extra or anything out of the extraordinary. Just pay the money, sit in the seat, shut-up and do your time. Or, consider taking Qantas, Virgin or a myriad of better and friendlier airlines
label: negative

text: ***AVOID AT ALL COSTS*** ***AVOID AT ALL COSTS*** An absolute scam of an airline company, I wanted to change my flight ticket on 20th of April and was rushed to send a confirmation for a flight change before 21st of April which involved a payment of 300 SGD which I agreed to. Upon calling back a few days later after checking that my flight has not been booked over the website, the agent over the phone tried to salvage the situation by LYING to me insisting that my original flight change booking flight was cancelled and instead, I now would have to pay SGD 1700 to rebook the flight change. There was no such cancellation of flights as the flight number of the "cancelled" flight was the exact same flight as the one that he proposed. I tried calling on multiple occasions and even though Singapore Airlines admitted their fault for SCREWING UP my booking and LYING to me, they would not change my flight at the original price that was agreed upon. As a result, I had to miss my other travel plans to London. Kudos to you idiots at Singapore Airlines for this. My main issues are these: 1) After rushing me to confirm the flight changes before 21st of April, which I did on 20th of April, why was the flight not booked at the original agreed price of SGD 300. Is it a lack of competence that your staff can't operate a computer? The agent responsible for this is Shifana Khan, Customer Service Executive at Singapore Airlines. 2) When I called to enquire about the unconfirmed flight change, why did your agent lie to me and say that the original flight that I was supposed to change to was cancelled, and try to scam me for SGD 1700? IS IT ETHICAL TO LIE? Unfortunately I do not have the name of this agent as I was too shocked over the phone when I heard this. In summary, if you want to get overcharged for non existent customer service and want your travel plans to go up into flames, use Singapore Airlines. And also do check out their Facebook page to see a log of unhappy customers who are facing/ faced similar issues as me, who had their travel experience spoilt because of their incompetency.
label: negative

text: Treated like a King/Queen A trusted source had always raved about Singapore Airlines to me. It remains my only flight with them, a return one in 2016, but I can say the customer service is second to none, and I have Qatar Airways and Cathay Pacific top of my list. They make sure you are hydrated and well fed, constantly bringing around drinks and snacks and walking up and down the aisles to collect your rubbish. I had a special meal so I wasn't entitled to the ice-cream dessert for the standard meals, but the lovely air stewardess remembered and gave the spare one leftover to me. Not only do they have metal cutlery, but the air steward I asked many questions to answered them all. Changi Airport is familiar to me and rates highly on my list of best airports in the World and they did not disappoint. Instead of an hour until boarding for my connecting flight, I had twenty minutes due to the pilots arriving late at Heathrow: as soon as we set foot in Changi airport, there was one staff person waiting to tell us where to go and they gave me very clear instructions. I did not miss my flight.
label: positive

text: Service Level Service level for SQ is good. The staffs is very friendly, the leg room and the seat is big enough. The prawns noodles is nice. 1 of their signature dish. Singapore Airlines always is our first choice.
label: positive

text: Could be better The flight to Singapore was great, however we have flown Singapore airlines previously & the standard of food & service was much better.
label: neutral

text: never disappoints Singapore airlines is one of my best airlines, the service, food is always really good. The planes are clean, spacious and comfortable.
label: positive

text: Only one is the best I have 3 lifetime airline memberships 1+ mil on 1 2 mil+ on the second and Singapore Air is the third. But I don’t work any more so these miles only taught me what to expect, I only fly about 60,000 miles per year, so my business isn’t interesting any more. I have flown to Singapore possibly 60 times on more than 7 air lines only one was the same the first time and every time Singapore what ever you expect they will exceed it every time. Simply the best at what they do.
label: positive

text: Just Average At Best I have flown to Perth WA with Singapore Airlines on 2 occasions now. I must start with a positive which is the Premium economy seat on the 380 is superior to the 777 The second let from Singapore to Perth is a poor seat on an aging aircraft. The main issue is lack of attention from the air crew. You don’t really see them apart from serving meals in Premium because they are attending a large capacity economy class. I have in the past flown Business and the gap in service is too wide considering the cost of Premuim I will not fly Singapore Airlines again but in future will try the Qantas none stop flight from London to Perth.
label: neutral

text: Yeah Singapore Airlines! I had a great experience on this airline from check in to boarding service meals to disembarking. We got help with luggage hot towels to clean hands and a tasty meal. My one tip would be to fly at least premium economy!
label: positive

text: Singapore flight The flight was good there were no delays quick check in Some food and drinks are not always available also the meals on the menu are short and you have to take what they have. Some flight attendant don’t like people coming in the kitchen to ask for snacks
label: positive

text: Pleasant flight New plane with variety of entertainment which helps you a lot for such long flight. Though the meal is good, what I enjoy the most is magnum ice cream. Changi airport is also the great place to spend time.
label: positive

text: Excellent customer service by LEO (based in LAX - Los Angeles Airport) My sharing was experienced last year, 2022. I just got to busy when I arrived home last October 2022, but then, I feel that I have to be fair and share my gratitude for SAL event though my review is 3 months late. So, bear with me and read so you can decide whether to fly Singapore airlines in your next travel or not. We boarded for our trip from Cebu to Los Angeles, U.S.A last September 3, 2022. We had to fly via Scoot airlines from Cebu to Singapore, where we had a lay over of about 2 hours before our departure for L.A on the same day via Singapore Airlines flight SQ038. When we arrived L.A. at around 9:30 in the evening, we found out that 1 of our checked-in luggage was missing. Accompanied by my L.A. based sister-in-law, we went to file an irregularity report in LAX because none from the Singapore airlines was around that late evening. Honestly, it was such a disappointing feeling for a tourist to miss a luggage and not being able to speak personally with personnel from the airlines. And upon arriving the place where we staying in California, I found out we had another issue with Singapore airlines. One of my luggage got badly damaged and that it was impossible to be fixed. We had to throw it away as it was useless already. Since the luggage that had all of my clothing as well as most of my husband’s, we had to buy everything we needed especially that our tour includes places with different weather conditions. We were to go to Temecula, where the heat wave was really mean. And had to go to Oakley and San Francisco where the weather was cold especially for us, who are used to the tropical weather. At first, I was very much disappointed with Singapore airlines because there was no way for me to contact them from L.A. I had to get help from a cousin who lives in Singapore to contact them. I also got help from my brother-in-law, James, who works at LAX. He found a way to relay my concern to SAL and to connect me with the said airlines. It took several days for the airlines to locate my lost luggage, which was eventually found in Singapore. I learned from my cousin that my lost luggage never got on board the flight I was in. To cut the long story short, my lost luggage was delivered to my sister-in-law’s residence sometime on the 23rd day since our arrival. Prior to that, I have been communicating with Leo of Singapore airlines. He was the person who ensured that I get my luggage back, as well as, be compensated well for my damaged luggage. Aside from my luggage returned and delivered to me, he promised me an extra check-in luggage with a weight of 32 kilos to be free of charged and that the airlines was going to compensate for my lost luggage and damaged suitcase when we fly back home. I was flying back home on Oct. 10, 2022 via SQ 037 with my 3 children and we had free check-in luggage of 23kilos times 2 each passenger PLUS the bonus of 32 kilos that Leo promised me. However, my to-be-checked in luggage reached 10 and all 10 exceeded the required 23 kilos weight. So, I tried to pre-purchase extra baggage via online but failed. I’ve contacted the same contact number I was using to contact Leo but then he was unavailable. It was another guy who took the call. I just forgot his name but he sounded Indian and I’d like to mention that he was quite unhelpful. I am definitely not being racist but I wanted to share that I was one unhappy customer with how he communicated with me. He doubted that I couldn’t purchase extra baggage online. He thought that I was doing it the wrong way so I had to send him screenshots to prove to him that it was impossible. Anyway, he only told me to take screenshots and if I could prove that it was impossible even though I was doing it correctly, then he would give me the discount for excess baggage. But clearly, he doubted that I was doing it right. He probably thought I was that incapable of using their website. When I arrived the Singapore Airlines counter (in the airport) before my flight to check in, I was politely greeted by a guy named Brennon ( I hope I got the name right). When I told him that I was supposed to meet Leo, he asked me if I was “me” (he mentioned my complete name). And then he smiled upon my approval, and mentioned that we spoke on the phone. Just to clarify, Brennon is not the same guy I was speaking to regarding the excess baggage. I actually saw the (Indian) guy in the other counter. (If I remember it right, his name was Nash.) Anyway, Brennon introduced me to the guy behind him in a suit and it was Leo. I was super glad to see the smiling face of Leo. A lady, whom I presume is a co-worker, handed me the cash settlement (for the lost baggage and damaged suitcase) and Release and Indemnity form that I needed to sign. Leo made up for the hassles I’ve gone through BIG TIME. He checked in all my 10 luggage at no extra cost. (Remember, everything was over 23kilos each!), gave us (the whole family) free access to the Star Alliance Lounge, boarded with the business class (It’s always convenient to board ahead of the rest so you get to put your hand carried items on the cabin above you), seats in the forward seat zone for all 4 of us, and 3 of us were in the extra leg room seats (it was like seating in the Premium Economy or even better. I only booked on economy class, just so you know). And all these were for FREE! I could not thank Leo enough for making up for everything. When we were entering the boarding area, I could not help but be teary eyed for all the blessings that the Lord has bestowed upon me and my family. It was a trip worth remembering! We are all so glad to have flown via Singapore airlines. Would love to travel again with them this year. God bless Singapore Airlines! P.S. The amount I received from the settlement? It was an amount that I would always be grateful for. 😊
label: positive

text: Disappointing for SQ Flew Premium Economy fm FCO to MEL via SIN. Flight No’s : SQ365 A350-900, SQ217 A380. Overall SQ Prem Y class is okay but that’s reflective of SQ pricing which is quite reasonable of this quality airline. Basically the extra $ you pay for is just for the bigger seat. The service is very much still Economy. SQ is known for its excellent cabin crew and service levels in all classes , however this was not evident in premium economy cabin on either flights. Believe Economy crew were responsible for Premium Economy cabin and as Economy was quite busy the premium cabin felt “forgotten about “. Food & drinks was very much Economy class, except in FCO they served a complimentary champagne after take off (but only one glass per pax, when I asked for another glass the crew simply forgot it and when enquiring about it with meal service , they said they could not serve it now only at take off?!) Curtains couldn’t be drawn as premium cabin uses Economy bathrooms so again gave it a more Economy feel than premium. Overall - good price for bigger seat , but don’t expect famous SQ service levels everyone talks about. If you want the big seat with all the bells and whistles - fly CX or QF (but note the price increase)! My advice to SQ - appoint dedicated cabin crew to Premium Economy cabin will surely improve the service and feel of this class.
label: neutral

text: Best airport deserves best airline Notwithstanding my latest flight on SIA, a review is overdue for me - they have been my favorite airline for about 20 years now. It started with my yearly Frankfurt-NY flights, and I've been upping my quota of SIA flights significantly ever since moving to Singapore. Just about everybody who travels a lot knows that Changi Airport in Singapore is in a class of its own - the new Jewel mallvaganza its crowning achievement, for now - but Singapore Airlines is a befitting counterpiece. Great service, surprisingly decent food (I always enjoy the breakfast), great entertainment, on time most of the time (once I had a long delay and they refunded most of the ticket), really a class act.
