Can't wait for my July nonstop SG-San Francisco flight and many more beyond that...
label: positive

text: Wonderful experience This is the greatest airline! Their food is real, highly quality cuisine, no fluff. The staff are friendly and professional. The movies on board were also wonderful. After a long haul flight of 20 hours, we were not even tired. I highly recommend them!
label: positive

text: Singapore holiday First class flight with all our food requierments met to a excellent standard. Gluten free meals where excellent and service was also excellent. Direct flight from Adelaide being only 7 hours 30 minutes.
label: positive

text: I fly for work and do not find Singapore Airlines value for money. Flew from Singapore to Bangkok. The planes are getting old and quality depends on the type of planes. The newest A350 is equally horrible as the cabin space in economy is tightly squeezed to optimise seats for $, but missed out on comfort. The soft touches of SIA being premium such as haagen daaz ice cream, food menus, biz class toiletries pouch or previous-palatable local food in economy have been discarded for margins and this is where I feel SIA have lost their direction/plot. Flying SIA is no longer an experience of delight. One finds too many issues and only is contented to reach the destination safely.
label: neutral

text: Has the food quality dropped? I must say that we had always been happy customers of Singapore Airlines - although my last review was negative due to a very unpleasant check-in experience in Jan 2018. This time, it was mostly about the food. Normally, I can’t fault the professionalism of the flight attendants. However, something was awry on this flight. We took off at 8.40 pm Singapore time, but dinner wasn’t served until 11ish pm - that’s 3 hours later. After the meal and tray collection, we managed to have some sleep, only to be woken up at 2ish am as they were serving breakfast. The dinner was just ok, but the breakfast was the worst ever - a stale bread roll and a cold muffin. Seemed like a cost-cutting measure to me. Very disappointing in-flight experience.
label: negative

text: Melbourne to Singapore. First I flew in SQ and experience the lounges in both Sydney and Melbourne this month. I must say it's the worst experience I have ever had. Running out of food, decor bland and functional (barely) at best, staff sombre and angry. It is tragic for SQ to sell itself as a premium airline with such tired conditions. All in all disappointing experience on SQ
label: negative

text: The Best Airlines We had gone in December 2011, to New Zealand and it was one of the best experiences we had in Singapore airlines. The cabin crew was so modest and caring that they arranged for a vegan meal which was not on their menu. Also if you travel to Australia or NZ on Singapore airlines, make sure you have stop gap of more than 5 hours so that you get to visit Singapore in transit without doing the immigration check at Changi.
label: positive

text: Zoos needs improving As always with Singapore Airlines everything runs like a Swiss Watch. Aircraft is clean, staff pleasant and efficient, good choices on the entertainment system but the food is not up to standard. This flight has an early lunch, the main choices looked as though they had been prepared days in advance. I think they'd be better off offering salads or even rolls. Food for thought.
label: positive

text: I Would Travel this airlines even if we never touched down. It is a LONG WAY from LAX to Singapore. But if you have to be in an airplane for 17 hours count yourself blessed to travel via Singapore airlines. I did have the luxury of traveling Business Class, but 17 hours is still 17 hours. The flight crew were so friendly and attentive. I even received a little Singapore AirlinesTeddy Bear when they found out I was going to be a grandma. The seats were superb. The crew made the bed for me when I was ready to take a nap. Lying recumbent on the seat was very comfortable. Only draw back was the leg cubby. It was small and restrictive. If you can, choose the bulkhead seats which offer double the leg room when in lying position. And choose the Book the Cook menu. There are many more choices available. You must do this in advance of your flight. If you have a choice for your final destination, I highly recommend Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Wow, choose your flight carefully. Excellent outbound flight on an Airbus 380 excellent service and easy journey. Return flight such a different experience. We flew on a Boeing 777-300 it was the worst most uncomfortable trip I have ever had in a Business Class seat. Terrible configuration you have to sit almost sideways and screw your neck around to watch tv. Goodness Singapore Airlines don’t use this configuration you are loosing customers. One guy on the flight said to look around Business Class as it was half empty and the awful discomfort you have to endure for 13 hours was the reason why. Will never fly this plane again, sorry Singapore Airlines, your staff are wonderful, the plane was rubbish!
label: negative

text: While the cabin crew service was ok my food was rubbish. The first meal was a late dinner and the option I chose was not available on the meal trolley the crew member said she would get it from the galley kitchen and deliver it to me. This never happened. The next meal was breakfast. Both choices for this were terrible. Singapore Airlines is rated as one of the best, but this was certainly not the case on this flight.
label: negative

text: coz i am a Filipino? i wonder why other nationalities were given and rendered more special treatments than me - I am a Filipino, the cabin crew didn't even dare to ask me if i wanted a drink
label: negative

text: Terrific Service Service was fantastic. Crew members were extremely helpful and did all they could to make the trip as comfortable as possible. The extra you pay is worth it to go Premium Economy, especially for ththe long haul.
label: positive

text: Adelaide, Bangkok, Phuket and Singapore Comfortable flights with good food and drink service aboard planes and lounges. Only problem was flight home to Adelaide, gate changes (2) were announced but call to board did not happen in the Kris Lounge and we nearly missed the plane, last to board, told staff on boarding but it did not seem to bother them.
label: positive

text: Very good airliner! Travel several trips with Singapore Airline. Business class. Very good service. Good seats. Very good food served. The internet service is a minus! 50 mb data for free? The cost of the flight ticket requires a better benefit when it comes to natural included service! This is the reason for 4 of 5 points from me.
label: positive

text: Expected More Have always heard that Singapore is the highest rated airline, but we weren't impressed . We had premium economy seats, and the only restrooms were behind of first section of economy, which meant all of premium economy and some of economy were waiting for 2 restrooms. Also, we had ordered meals ahead, as suggested online, but it turned out what we ordered wasn't what they were serving that day. They served us what we ordered, but they were old and dried out. Never would have ordered in advance had we known this. Also, on the way back from Bali to San Francisco, even though we had one boarding pass for the whole trip, we had to get off the plane in HongKong taking all of our belongings, and then go through security again, even though we hadn't left the airport. The premium economy seats were comfortable and the entertainment system worked well.
label: neutral

text: Relaxing Flight I continued my lucky upgrade streak with a timely upgrade to business class on my flight from Hong Kong to Singapore. The seats were comfy but a little on the older side. Service was quite attentive and the food was delivery was timely and very good. For brunch, the fresh fruit were sweet and the bowl of crunchy granola came with plump blueberries, cranberries and sliced strawberries. The main entree of beef ribs was a little tough but had a flavorful sauce. The chocolate peanut butter mousse was delicious (highlight of the Meal). I enjoyed the custom drinks they served on this flight which I did not see on other airlines. I only tried the Mid Summer Breeze which was a fizzy concoction of 7-up, pineapple, apple and orange juices. Quite refreshing. When we landed our gate was less than couple minutes walk from immigration. By far the best arrival into Singapore to date.
label: positive

text: Even I was surprised I’d sometimes wondered why SingaporeAir bothered flying between Singapore and Canberra but on my flight there were no vacant seats in Business Class and Economy I’d guess was full based on the number of passengers in the departure lounge. It’s an overnight flight There’s only one meal on offer per passenger but you can choose to have it after departure as supper or before arrival as breakfast. The downside of that is that it limits the potential sleeping time. The cabin crew bustled around quietly after departure but the cabin lights were all on. They came on again two hours before arrival. I reckon I was able to doze for a maximum of four hours. They show a video on how to assemble your seat so it folds into a flat bed. I’ve seen it twice and I had to be helped to set it up and then make it back into a bed. I wasn’t the only passenger in that situation. Seat Guru doesn’t recommend the rows nearest the galley and lavatories. I can’t say was my experience but every flight is different Which brings me to the crew. The “Singapore Girl” has a certain reputation for being cool, calm and collected. Unkind people have suggested “automaton” would be an appropriate description. I don’t think I noticed her name badge but the Singapore Girl who most interacted me did precisely that - she interacted. She was friendly. She actively looked after me. I was pleasantly surprised. Not quite so the Singapore Boys. Efficient certainly, and helpful - but not engaged
label: positive

text: Fantastic service - great experience! I would recommend this airline anyday! In flight entertainment is really good. The food and beverages were tasty and good variety. The hostess’ were friendly and helpful. Leg room is very good for economy. Modern aircraft. Seats are comfortable. I can’t fault this flight!
label: positive

text: Short haul flight and it’s nice as usual, everything’s fine and this is the best option for CGK-SIN flight. It’s value for money and it’s best if you compare to other airlines based on travel duration and price. SQ is one of my favourite Asian airlines u til today.
label: positive

text: Beware I paid for a business class ticket. Was surprised to find that there were scoot passengers on the same flight that paid a fraction of the price. Apparently this happen very often. Scoot will cancel their flights when there is not enough passengers and put them on SQ flights. Scoot will give the reason as engine problems but 2 weeks in advance they informed their passengers. They can predict that they will be engine trouble 2 weeks in advance. The same is also happening in the economy class. Wake up SQ.
label: negative

text: First time on SQ business for a very long time so we were excited to see what it was like especially during COVID. Compared to the Qatar the hard product is not as good especially the Q suite. The book the cook worked well with course by course service with the chicken satay as amuse bush. Meal was excellent by any standard as was the service. Where they went above and beyond was when my 2 year old son was feeling unwell, they assisted more than I would ever have hoped for. Flight was a bit more turbulent than normal due to the different route to avoid Russia and the Ukraine. The flight landed late due to a headwind. Luggage was out by the time we cleared immigration. Only downside was the lack of a touchscreen and selection of shows was not as good as I remembered.
label: positive

text: Fuel shortage We were due to take off from Changi Airport, Singapore at 23.45 hrs on 31st. December 2018. We were looking forward to possibly having an aerial view of the New Year's Eve fireworks in Marina Bay as the flight took off. However, our hopes were soon dashed when the captain wished us all a Happy New Year as we were still sitting on the aircraft at the departure gate. After another 20 minutes of waiting, the captain announced that there was a discrepancy in the fuel volumes being recorded on board the aircraft and different figures being reported from the refueling bowser. Clearly, no-one wanted to take any chances that insufficient fuel was on board for the whole of our flight, and there was nothing left but to wait until the discrepancy was checked and verified. The airline cabin crew set to work making passengers as comfortable and reassured as possible, and eventually we did get away nearly two hours later than scheduled and long after the crowds in Marina Bay had seen the last of the firework display. The rest of the flight passed without further incident, and the crew were their usual serene selves as they served food and drinks etc. The arrival at Heathrow was eventually was just about an hour later than scheduled as some time had been made up in the flight time. All in all we were on board for well over 15 hours.
label: positive

text: Premium economy not worth the extra cost We have flown with Singapore in economy class a few times and decided to give the premium economy a try. After watching a documentary on the airline and their supposed attention to detail we went ahead and booked. What a disappointment and waste of money. The short leg to Singapore was fine but the onward leg to the UK and return was absolutely terrible. Broken seat, very little service,entertainment system not working,ran out of refreshments or then just didn’t offer anything,no room to get in an out of seats if the row in front were reclining. When we spoke to the staff they said there was nothing they could do. Not sure we will fly with them again.
label: negative

text: An airline is only as good as its staff! It really does grieve me to say this, because I am a big fan of Singapore Airlines and a Gold Kriss Flyer member. Unfortunately this was a flight spoilt by the manner and attitude of one or maybe two members of staff. The flight started really well when we were upgraded to Premium Economy. I had flown PE before with Air new Zealand, but not Singapore. We had the two seats at the front baulked (A+C). The first noticeable thing was, there are only three rows of seats (2x4x2) and no real separation from economy, in fact the menu and food was identical to economy. If i had paid the Premium fare I would not have been impressed, there was no noticeable attention, that isn't afforded in economy either. In fact it would fair to say, that there was not much attention at all. This all accumulated when a stewardess, whilst serving my wife and I a beer with our meal, used one beer can to fill two cups and in doing it so fast, it overflowed the cup. I had to hold the cup over aisle before I could place it on my tray. There was not so much as a backward glance from the stewardess. My only comparison was Air New Zealand and I am afraid they left Singapore for dead in all departments, including seat space, comfort, attention, quality of food and indeed manners. Manners and customer service is something I have never had cause to question whilst using the airline on many, many other occasions. However on this occasion it was missing. It certainly won't stop me flying with them again, because a flight is only as good as its crew. There were a few on this flight that i don't think will be making a career with Singapore Airlines for much longer.
label: neutral

text: Flew Singapore to Bangkok. The flight SQ970 departing 07.15h is during weekdays always very busy as business people are traveling for a one day business trip to Bangkok. Obviously many are not able to book a business class seat due to limited availability. The cabin crew therefore during boarding were busy with those people handing over their jackets and luggage into a safe storage. Even here, all is done with a smile on and on. It is a short flight but I still feel the comfort and great hospitality of Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Amazing for long haul Really comfortable and cabin crew great. No complaints. Even for an upgrade to business in one leg. Choice of food. Plenty of leg room.
label: positive

text: Somewhat undewhelmed This was my first long-haul sector on Singapore Airlines in Business Class and I was looking forward to what is reputed to be one of the beat airline experiences in the world. I was somewhat disappointed. The strongest point is the size of the seats/pods, with a 1-2-1 configuration on the upper deck of an A380 allowing for an enormous amount of personal space....probably the most personal space in any airline that I have flown. The service was also very good and friendly, though maybe somewhat canned. Thats about where the strong points end however. The seat/bed are at an awkward angle with the footrest to one side.....its was somewhat uncomfortable to fall asleep in this positioning. My seat, though vast, was very hard....too hard to allow a very comfortable rest. The rest of the experience was somewhat average, as was the inflight entertainment. For sure not the beat experience in the sky.
label: neutral

text: London to Sydney LHR/SIN on the 777-300ER with new business class and SIN/SYD on the A380-800 with the older business product. The food and service was superb. I used book the cook for both legs lamb chops on the second leg were memorable. Champagne was Bollinger. The new business seats are excellent but suffer from the requirement to place ones feet in a small pocket to sleep diagonally. If you can get the bulkhead seats do so as this avoids the problem. I got bulkhead seats for the second leg on the A380. SIA do not offer sleeping suits in business.
label: positive

text: Relaxed and Easy Entry onto the plane was easy and relaxed. Economy seats were comfortable. Food was very good except the mushroom pie😝 staff were professional, kind and caring. Choice of in flight movies was good on the way over but although we travelled back in October, movies were much the same 😔I would recommend Singapore Air to all travellers.
label: positive

text: Longest flight to Singapore The flight left on time and got in the air on time. The quality of the food was excellent and was served by energetic cabin crew. The gave what ever you asked for. We flew at 43000ft and 16700km to Singapore so it was long and delightful flight.
label: positive

text: Disappointed...but no real problems I am United 1K, Emirates Gold, and Star Alliance Gold...a well seasoned traveller. This was my first time flying on Singapore Airlines and I’m disappointed. For years people have been telling me that SQ is one of the best airlines in the world, so I was quite looking forward to the experience. Overall, nothing went wrong on this flight at all. However it did not meet my expectations given all the good feedback my colleagues have given me, and I feel they failed a star alliance member who they are expected to provide a better quality service to. The flight was on time. Plane and seats were clean. Entertainment system worked fine, however it had a poor variety of movies for such a long haul flight. There was literally nothing I wanted to watch, which left me wondering how I’m going to pass a 13 hour daytime flight. Both me and my wife were sat next to each other and had vegetarian meals. I noticed they serve all the people with special meals first, and then the rest. I just found it a bit odd that there was over a 5 min gap between meals coming out for my wife and then me. Not really a big deal, but just something I noticed, and something a service industry normally pays attention to. The food was okay. Not as flavourful as I was expecting for an Asian airline. But they did give stainless steel cutlery instead of plastic...pretty good for economy. My biggest disappointment is around the lack of service for a star alliance member. First, there is a 5-6 month ongoing dispute with United. Apparently Singapore airlines are blocking United from having seat availability on their flights...I.e. I could have used my United points to book this entire trip for free, but whatever is going on prevented me from doing that, and I had to pay like anyone else. The check-in agent did his best to give us better seats in the absence of offering any upgrade. Very nice which he didn’t have to do. Gold gets you fast track security, and for others on your booking. Well, not with SQ. I got fast track, but my wife had to go through regular security. Not a problem this time as there were no queues. But what is the point of only some of the travellers getting fast track when you’re all travelling together? By contrast, United give everyone on the booking fast track. We went to the Singapore lounge at Heathrow, and promptly left. It was small, dingy and has poor vegetarian food choices. We went to the united lounge next door instead which is significantly better. Although we had the same tickets, I was in boarding group 3, and my wife in group 6. Again, we’re travelling together and sitting next to each other. Why split us up? Whichever boarding group you give us, it should be the same. I also noticed that they give a lot of priority to their own Kris flyer programme and not much to star alliance gold (which they’re supposed to). So no priority boarding. I’m 6ft3 and I was worried about leg room in economy. I was pleasantly surprised. I had about 2-3 inches between my knees and the seat back. Enough for me not to get cramp and wiggle about a bit on such a long flight. I know for most travellers, you won’t care about most of my comments. But for frequent flyers, the perks of status, make flying so much, a little bit more comfortable. And what I feel is that Singapore airlines treat star alliance gold customers very badly. By contrast, on United and emirates, regardless of the class of travel, the cabin director comes over to me soon after boarding to thank me for my loyalty, and mention if there’s anything I need, just to ask for them...blah blah. Not that I need any of this, but just another example of how other airlines treat their customers better. My wife, who is not a frequent flyer, also said she preferred flying economy on emirates or United vs on Singapore. She seperately said the same thing about the entertainment system. As I mentioned at the start. Nothing important went wrong on this flight. They just failed to offer the perks expected for those who have frequent flyer status on their partner airlines. I wouldn’t go out of my way to fly with SQ again. Overall the whole experience wasn’t as awesome as I was expecting.
label: neutral

text: Up up away Faultless crew both air and land. Comfortable flight but disappointing film choice, thankfully music choices made time go by. Heard and read nothing but praise for airline so surprised to be disappointed. Food horrible but then maybe just my taste! Impressed with cleanliness of the WC. First time have travelled since having to use and take wheelchair, not a hindrance at all. All went very smoothly.
label: positive

text: Benchmark of hospitality and comfort Travelled through SQ several times, I am glad to say that it always fulfilled the expectations. The are always on schedule, travel with well trained crew, have comfy seats with reasonable leg room at reasonable price and well maintained.
label: positive

text: manchester to Singapore good flight ,usual high level of service .Meals were on a par with emirates and much better than Air NZ the only problem i had i could not book exit row seats as it was a code share ,despite going via Singapore Customer Care this was frustrating as i am 6,3 .Otherwise i did the identiacl trip 4 weeks earlier with Emirates ,the only difference was the A380 is a more roomy plane particulary if you go to the front sector of economy
label: positive

text: Redeemed Suite with miles Impeccable and efficient service. Helpful crew who take great pictures and always made sure my champagne glass wasn’t empty. Mediocre breakfast catering at private room and onboard
label: positive

text: Smooth experience, on par with Cathay This was my first time flying SG airlines and I thought the service was superb. The seat was huge widthwise and cushy too, and I loved that there was so much space for me to stretch out. However the old seat buttons are hard to manoeuvre and were slow to respond. I think the food on Cathay tasted better though, and there was definitely a stronger air of luxury & modernity there than the SG airlines plane I was on. Would still recommend the biz class for flyers!
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines from Singapore to Sydney. Why the check in staff decided to put a couple in the center 2 seats of the 4 seat center row, with 2 men flanking us, on a long flight after already being in transit for 13 hours is beyond me. Very difficult to go to the toilet or even move at all. If they had put us on the side of the row we could have helped each other and not try to convince a strange man who cannot understand you or is asleep to let you up. This made a 22 hour travel day a lot harder than it needed to be. Staff on the aircraft could have assisted with the problem also.
label: neutral

text: Better than BA or any US carrier for Manchester to Houston Excellent service and great in flight meal and entertainment choices. Have to travel from Manchester to Austin frequently and now use the singapore flight to Houston and drive the 3 hours to austin as the service is far superior to the old aircraft and poor service offered by BA and any US carrier on that route
label: positive

text: Boarding shambles Flew Sydney to Paris via Singapore. In general it was a good flight, although the leg-room in the Singapore-Paris leg (A330) was very cramped. My only complaint concerns the boarding procedures, both at Sydney and Singapore. There was little organisation, and even though in Singapore they called for 'Section D' (towards the back of the craft), nobody took any notice - customers or boarding staff - so by the time we finally got to our seats at the rear, after waiting for all the people at the front of the plane who were loading their hand-luggage, there were no spaces left in the overhead lockers for us. Meals were good for airline fare, but the selection of entertainment was limited.
label: neutral

text: helpful and friendly services Singapore Airline is Moslem friendly. I requested for Moslem meals when I checked in on website. The food was delicious, the services were great, the toilet was clean and the entertainment flight was great. It's always updated with new movies and musics. Thank you Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Disappointing! Very disappointed with amount of leg room compared to Air New Zealand who we had flown with from Auckland to Singapore. The food was appalling - I have no idea how they could justify saying it was Premium Economy. If that is the case I dread to think what they served in Economy. The service was not wonderful and the bathrooms were pretty disgusting after a few hours.
label: negative

text: SQ markets itself as a premium brand airline. My recent experience SIN-MEL-SIN does not confirm this: small seats in economy class food and beverages left a lot to be desired and slow service. The one positive thing I can say is that they were on-time. All in all a poor value-for-money performance.
label: negative

text: Trip to UK Have used Singapore Airlines many times and cannot fault the airline at all. They are very attenuative and nothing is a problem for the stewards. The plane is clean and plenty of legroom. I would strongly recommend using Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines to Bali The check in system at Changi was all system based. We did it by our self and was hassle free. Even though we reached 3 hours prior to our flight, me and my wife could not get seats together. May be the seats were already taken beforehand/online. The flight experience was excellent and cabin crew were very helpful and polite. The 2 hours 40 minutes flight was perfect and smooth.
label: positive

text: Very ordinary business class flight We had high expectations of Business class with Singapore Airlines. Sadly they fell way short of expectation. Our flights from Sydney to Singapore and Singapore to London were very ordinary. We had gone online to "Book the cook" and unfortunately it did not record on our booking. The food served was awful - really could not eat it. Staff were good and the rest of the flight was good. There were no little bags of cosmetics or pyjamas as other airlines have. As we could not get book the cook to record on our booking back, I phoned Singapore Airlines in Singapore and asked them to book it for us which they did. Our flights back form Paris to Singapore and Singapore to Sydney were much better, with excellent food and the planes were more modern as well. There was an experimental pack of cosmetics too, which was appreciated.
label: neutral

text: A very comfortable journey Great staff making a long journey a good and pleasant experience. We have flown by a few different airlines and Singapore Airlines is by far the best in our option would not hesitate to recommend them.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines A great airline Singapore Airlines is a reflection of Singapore itself. Clean, efficient, professional and has a sense of style.
label: positive

text: Comfortable Old Business Class Product, Service is Top Notch Singapore Airlines uses the A330-300 to ply the route between Hanoi and Singapore. Singapore Airlines A330-300 comes with a two-class configuration. The Business Class cabin has a total of 30 seats while the Economy Class cabin has 255 seats. The white-walled Business Class cabin feels spacious and the seats are clad in beige and dark brown, making it look both comfortable and classy. The seats in Business Class cabin onboard Singapore Airlines A330-300 are arranged in a 2-2-2 configuration. There are two lavatories at the back of the Business Class cabin serving the passengers. The lavatory feels spacious, thanks to the clever use of mirrors in the lavatory coupled with the bright lighting and the choice of white colour for the paint in the lavatory. There are two cabinets on either side of the sink. The left cabinet is where passengers can find handkerchiefs, tissues, paper towels and paper cups to be used with the mouth wash. Beneath this cabinet is the trash can, which can be operated with a pedal near to the floor of the lavatory. The right cabinet is well stocked with amenities. Here is where combs, sanitary napkins, toothbrushes and razors are stowed. Beneath the right cabinet is bottles of amenities such as mouth wash, facial mist, hand lotion and eau de toilette. The sink in Singapore Airlines A330-300 Business Class is fitted with the old touch button tap. The toilet seat is clad with a leather cover, making it look more premium than those ones would find in Economy Class lavatories. There are a couple of coat hooks on the door of the lavatory. Singapore Airlines A330-300 features a Regional Business Class seats in the Business Class cabins. Each seat is cocooned in a shell clad in soft brown leather, which is very comfortable to sit one, measures 60" in pitch and 24.5" wide. The seat controls are in the armrest of the seat, above the storage for the IFE controller. The legroom in the Business Class seats onboard Singapore Airlines A330-300 is excellent, where I can fully stretch out my legs even when the seat is in an upright position. Each seat onboard Singapore Airlines A330-300 is treated to three window panels. A large pillow and a soft blanket are already placed on the seat when I arrived at my seat during boarding. I find the pillow firm and very comfortable to rest my head. The Business Class seats are preset to four modes: an upright position for take-off/landing or for passengers who prefer to sit upright during meal times; a lounging position which I find the most comfortable for relaxing in when watching movies from the IFE; a semi flatbed mode which I find the best position for sleeping; and a full flatbed mode. The seats are angled slightly in full flatbed mode and are not 180º flat, sleeping on this mode feels as though one would slide off the bed. Apart from these preset seat positions, there are buttons that allow passengers to adjust the recline of the seat to a position that one finds most comfortable. There are two reading lights for each seat in the Singapore Airlines Business Class seats, one on the bulkhead of the seat, which can be turned on and off from the seat control panel; and one inside the seat which can be activated by pushing the light itself. There is no lack of storage space in the Singapore Airlines A330-300 Business Class seats. Under the IFE TV screen, there are two huge storage bins for passengers to store small items such as phones, passports or compact cameras. However as these bins are rather shallow, it will not be able to hold bigger cameras or laptops/iPads. There are also two smaller shelves between the two seats and these shelves are capable of holding iPods or smaller phones. There is another more hidden storage bin underneath one of the armrests. This bin allows passengers to place their laptops and iPads. This is where the power outlet and two USB ports are located for passengers to charge their lifestyle devices. There are two cup holders between the two seats, which allows passengers to place their drinks without having the need to deploy the tray tables. Seat tables are hidden in between the seats. These tables can be a tad difficult to pull out as they seem to be rather heavy. The tables are large enough for passengers to place their laptop on to do some work. These tables can be slide back and forth, however, to get out of the seat, one would have to put away the table. Seat pockets where the in-flight literature such as in-flight magazine, duty-free shopping catalogue and Singapore Airline's lifestyle magazine along with the in-flight menu, airsick bag and aircraft safety card are found in front of the seat between the two IFE TV screens. The noise-cancelling headphones are also found here when I board the aircraft. There is a divider between the two seats, providing guests with great privacy especially when one is sitting next to a stranger. All Singapore Airlines A330-300 Business Class seats are fitted with a 15.4" personal TV. Kris World is the Singapore Airline In-Flight Entertainment System. As this is a rather old product, these TVs does not have touchscreen function. Controls for the Kris World is done through the remote control, stowed on the left side of the sit. Despite being old, the IFE system is still responsive. There are numerous entertainment options on Kris World for passengers on board, ranging from movies to TV programmes to games which kept me entertained throughout the 3hr 30 min flight. Kris World is arranged in an intuitive menu that is easy to navigate through. All Business Class seats come with noise-cancelling headphones that keeps out noise effectively. The remote controller for the IFE is stored on the left seat armrest. The front side of the IFE controller has some quick access menus for flight information, movies and radio. The LCD screen on the front of the controller provides flight information. Other buttons such as volume control, screen brightness control and menu controls are also found on the front side of the remote control. On the back of the remote control are some buttons and directional dials for playing of games on the IFE. There is a qwerty keyboard also found on the back of the remote control, which does not seem to serve any function in the IFE system. Singapore Airlines "Book the Cook" service was not available for flights out of Hanoi. Instead, passengers can preview the in-flight menu from the Singapore Airlines App and order their main course in advanced. I used the app and ordered the Seared Salmon Trout Fillet in Tomato-Black Olive Vinaigrette, while my friend opted for the Nasi Ayam. As soon as we boarded the plane, a cabin crew offered us pre-departure drinks. I decided to try out the champagne. As I seldom drink, I regretted my choice of drink after having a slip or two. When the cabin crew came by to collect the empty glasses and learnt that I did not like the champagne, he offered me Orange Juice or water. I opted for the Orange Juice. As with the outbound flight from Singapore, cabin crews on this leg of the flight sprung into action and served the appetiser about 30 mins into the flight. For the appetiser, I was served the Marinated Seafood Salad which comes with papaya slaw. As my friend is allergic to prawns, he was served with potato salad instead. The prawn tasted fresh and well seasoned. The lime pepper vinaigrette complemented the prawns well. The appetiser also comes with scallops which tasted fresh as well. Another cabin crew came around with a basket of bread, the choice of bread is clear, I opted for the Garlic Bread again. Soon after passengers were done with our appetiser, our main course was served next. The Seared Salmon Trout Fillet, which is cooked to perfection, was well seasoned and was not dry at all. The Black Olive Vinaigrette tasted well with the salmon. I had a taste of the lentil carrot stew which the salmon fillet was placed on, but did not like the bed of black lentils. I had a taste of my friend's Nasi Ayam, the chicken was fried to perfection and did not taste soggy. The seasoning on the chicken was good and the chicken was not dry as well. For desserts, we were served Strawberry Cream Cake, which did not taste too sweet. The cake was tasty and the crust at the bottom of the cake is still crunchy. The cabin crew served me some Latte for after-meal drinks as well. Shortly after the tray table is cleared, one of the cabin crews came by and offered me a Magnum ice-cream she snagged from Economy Class. I would never say no to ice-cream. Throughout the flight, the cabin crews topped up our drinks and constantly checked if we would like our drinks to be topped up. The service in Business Class onboard Singapore Airlines is top-notch. Cabin crews greeted us by our last names the moment we present our boarding passes during boarding. Whenever the cabin crews interact with us, they will address us by our last names, which makes us feel personalised service is provided. Cabin crews would constantly patrol the cabin after meal times to check and see if passengers require any refill of water. Call buttons are answered almost immediately where the diligent cabin crews attended to passengers needs. Cabin crews are also seen interacting with passengers and taking interest in striking up conversations. The cabin crews onboard this leg of the flight provided impeccable service during the flight, making flying on Singapore Airlines in Business Class cabin enjoyable. During boarding, I was hesitant to try champagne, the cabin crew encouraged me to try it out. When he subsequently found out that I do not like champagne after having a sip, he offered to bring me another beverage. The cabin crew was also seen helping passengers with their carry-on luggage during boarding and ensure passengers were comfortable during boarding. The service provided by Lay Hoon, the in-flight manager was amazing. She assured me that our allergies were registered and that the food does not contain the ingredients that we were allergic to, less the appetiser, which Lay Hoon mentioned that she has made arrangements to swap out with potato salad so that my friend can enjoy his meal. Lay Hoon also constantly checked if we liked the meal on board and even offered an additional portion of the main course after I remarked that the Nasi Ayam looks delicious. Lay Hoon brought us additional Garlic Bread when she saw how fast we consume the bread. Lay Hoon and her crew, Museika as well as Yaw Huah, were very friendly and kept smiles on their faces despite having a long day at work. They took well care of all passengers during the flight. I had the opportunity to strike up a conversation with Lay Hoon and she was amazing with her knowledge of the destination we came from and was generous to share with us the work of a cabin crew and some of the plans that Singapore Airlines have when it comes to the upgrading of equipment. Museika was seen patrolling the cabin and constantly topped up our drinks and took care of us very well to ensure we were well hydrated during the flight. Flying with Singapore Airlines Business Class is an enjoyable experience. The good service started at the airport during check-in and continues into the flight. Despite being an old product, Singapore Airlines A330-300 Business Class was comfortable to fly for Singapore-Hanoi route. The Business Class seat is very comfortable to sit in during the flight. However, the fully flat bed mode was a tad too sloppy for my liking, but since it is a relatively short flight, it does not really matter. There is plenty of storage in the seat that allows us to store some of our knick-knacks. The In-Flight Entertainment system is packed with entertainment options that make us feel the 3hr 30 min flight time zooms past quicker than it seems. The thing that leaves me wanting to fly with Singapore Airlines again is the service that we have received on board. The service was exceptional and the cabin crew was not only friendly, but their caring for their passengers felt genuine. They kept their smiles throughout the entire flight and was seen helping passengers during boarding and in-flight. Singapore Airlines truly stands up to its company tagline of "A great way to fly".
label: positive

text: SQ38 SIN-LAX on May 9th on a 359. This is the longest leg of return trip from SE Asia with Hubby. The flight is full, mostly with couples and single travelers. In Singapore there is another security check at the waiting room gate, and most travelers didn't realize they have to go through it to go to the waiting room. Many of the these are the infrequent or first time travelers who don't know that they have to scan their electronics and take off their belts jackets and caps off again, making a long line that moved very slow. Boarding was done by zone and was quite orderly, however there was still a line of latecomers going through the waiting room gate check when the boarding begins. This makes the flight have to leave 25 minutes later than scheduled. The FAs were all wearing masks as per their company's precaution and safety awareness policy. However they were all still very friendly, personable, helpful, courteous and polite, and dedicated in giving their best service. The service started as soon as we reached cruising altitude, started with a drink service then dinner, and a second drink service after that. Many of the travelers are Indians so the FAs quickly ran out of the vegetarian meal option that my Hubby was interested in and he had to settle for chicken with pasta, which is very good. After dinner the lights were turned off so people can sleep, but we were told that snacks is available in between the dinner and lunch that will be served 2 hours prior to landing. The cockpit crew communicated well, explaining about the flight plan before we leave and updating us of LAX condition before our descent. They were very good in identifying possible turbulence ahead so we always get notifications to fasten our seat belts before it hits. Restrooms were always kept clean and the FA frequently refresh them with deodorizer. The entertainment system is amazing and full of latest movies as usual, and it's hard to pick and choose what you want to watch next. As with our previous SQ flight, this aircraft has large 11" touchscreen with a USB "A" that works, and the headphone plug requires two prongs, however it still works well with my wireless headphone adapter which only has one plug. The seat slides forward as you recline so it is a better position to get some rest in a semi reclining position. The lights were turned on just before drink service and lunch was served, and the FAs worked hard to serve us and get everything done before we start our descent into LAX. We arrived at LAX 1 hour ahead of schedule thanks to the strong tailwind. During a bathroom break I casually mentioned to one of the FAs that the day before was my birthday and this trip is to celebrate both our birthdays and our 10 years anniversary. After lunch suddenly we were given two cakes with two glasses of champagne with a "happy anniversary" written on the plate, and a card from the crew! Wow, I didn't see that coming! Shout out to all SQ38 crews on May 9th 2023! Thank you for your kindness and gifts!
label: positive

text: Very pleasant experience, if you can afford it :-( Late overnight flight to LHR, departing Singapore. Krisflyer lounge at T3 was really quite busy for that time of night - so don't look for a relaxed peaceful experience. Boarding was efficient, as always. Flying on A380-800 version 3, which comes with the latest 2017 J seating (see MainlyMiles.com for more details). Business class on an all-upper deck configuration. The cabin is missing the centre row of luggage compartments, which gives the cabin a very airy spacious feel. The seating is really luxurious, with ample storage space and the latest touch screen IFE boasting crystal clear vision for those of you who *must* watch these things. Seats have a privacy divider for the centre aisles, which allows you to interact or shelter from your neighbour. The wraparound wings on the seat give you great privacy overall, if that is your wish. Seat controls are electronic and allow you to configure your seat in multiple positions, including the lie flat position. A pair of noise cancelling headphones is provided. I found the lie-flat seats perfectly comfortable, but other feedback was that due to the slant angle, it was slightly difficult to get a comfortable position. All other aspects of service were as good as SQ usually achieves, but then, to be honest, I am not very demanding there - a friendly smile will tick the boxes for me! There is no denying that the price of business class is high on SQ (very high??!), but if you get the new layout, I think this is a really special way to travel.
label: positive

text: It gets old... I have been taking Singapore Airlines every time I go to India, over the years I have noticed the degradation of service... It used to be outstanding to the point that you’ll run out of good things to say but based on my recent flight, the magic is gone. Maybe because they get used to the praises that they became complacent. Or maybe, change of management? The flight crews became transactional, the fleets from MNL to SIN and SIN to MAA need updating, the seats and entertainment system needs to be cleaned and sanitized. I am hoping that this airline revives its glory. For now, I am neutral if I will continue taking this flight or shift airline.
label: neutral

text: Our first flight was delayed more than one hour, so we lost our connecting flight. The new booking provided was horrible. I was travelling with my four-year-old and the new seat provided is far away, and we were separated. All the family members are separated for the whole journey. Miscommunication between the crew members made us to walk between the terminals for 2 times. Didn't get any help from the crew, even though we requested to provide a seat together.
label: negative

text: Puntuality and service at its best The service and punctuality of this airline is very good.The airline procedures are well maintained both on ground and well as during travel.The rates may be a bit higher .The check-in procedures for the luggages and travellers are hassle free.Food and beverages are upto the mark .
label: positive

text: Great food Best food, plenty of films, legroom ok, flew out economy flew back premium economy, not worth the upgrade tho cant exactly lie flat to sleep, for the extra money, really just more room, and a choice from the cook book, yes champagne, didnt see any extra personal service than economy, i think i would go again for long flights short flights dont bother
label: positive

text: Exceptional service My wife and I plus 2 kids (5 and 3 year old) had the pleasure of flying to Singapore on flight SQ232 on 10/05/2019. We were lucky to have the new A380 fit out and absolutely loved it. Besides the fit-out of the business class cabin, the Service by the attendants was exceptional. After we boarded and sat down, my 5 year old son asks me ‘why is everybody so nice here’ (referring to the attendants). For a 5 year old to raise this question just shows how lovely and polite the attendants are. Even greeting me by my name every single time. The meals were great as well and there was a wide variety of onboard entertainment. Would definitely recommend the A380 with the middle seats if planning to travel with young kids. Best to stay away from the Boeing 777-300ER though if possible as the middle divider is too high and it’s difficult to access the next seat.
label: positive

text: dissapointing to say the least flight from Philippines to Singapore to change planes for Australia, Flight was delayed over 3 hours , my connecting flights were disrupted they did make arrangements for other connecting flight to arrive to Mt Isa via Brisbane, however they forget about the loss of wages or income due to their flight delay no compensation forthcoming due to their flight delay, service and meals are among the best even as a gold member of Qantas,Qantas could learn a thing or too as far as customer service especially in the Meal department
label: positive

text: Flew with SQ468 on the 27th of November out of Singapore and I was pleasantly surprised! The aircraft was in a top notch condition and the food was by far the best food I have ever tasted on an airline. The cabin crew were extremely attentive and were very courteous. I should particularly mention how they look after toddlers very well on board. Load factor was full however this wasn’t a challenge for the team at all. The only drawback of an otherwise excellent flight was the fact that the entertainments system malfunctioned so much that I ultimately gave up and went to sleep.
label: positive

text: Singapore to New York. The entertainment center/movies were superb, although some of the plug connections were older, so the voice is low. One time, the flight was making a loud bothering noise, and we were concerned about it especially during take off. The next flight was delayed, they decided to replace the airplane. I appreciate it that they put safety before anything else. The food was satisfying. The attendants smile. They worked fast in getting what the customers need. They are always ready to answer calls.
label: positive

text: The bucket list way to travel As an expat living in Australia for this last 30 years, my wife and I have travelled this route a number of times (as well as many other destinations on business and pleasure). However, we treated ourselves to business class this time, and must say that we were made to feel like royalty. Aside from all the usual trimmings of business class flights (lounge access, express security and boarding), the check-in staff and airline crew were absolutely marvellous and constantly looked after us. Our comfort and wellbeing was clearly their priority. The preselected three-course meals were on par with a first-rate restaurant, and they had a great choice of top shelf spirits and cocktails (which needless to say we sampled a great many). Furthermore, I left my iPad on the final return leg (I blame the 16yo single malt scotch 😊) and was contacted by their cleaning contractor (dnata) on the day of my return to say it was found. Excellent service all round. The only major drawback, is that it is now going to be very difficult to ever do that trip again on economy (as we usually do), now that we’ve tasted this 😁 Highly recommended!
label: positive

text: Cancelled Booking without my Auth i had a reservation with Singapore Airline. i request them to change the destination from Melbourne to Toronto. one of their agent told me they dont have any availability so i asked her refund if i will cancel the reservation what will be the penalty of airline and how much money i am getting in my account. she told me to pay 25000 INR so i asked her if i will pay penalty of airline how much money i am getting in my account she told me for that you will receive a callback. i had never received any call and without my permission they cancelled my reservation and deducted penalty from my refund amount but i never authorized for cancellation. Now i am calling again and again they are not helping me out to resolve this issue.
label: negative

text: poor airline very poor flight with defective seats very poor food and staff who really didn't care. two defective seats on the journey both seats would not recline and on an 11 hour flight a non working monitor as well . complained to the airline and not even an acknowledgement from them let alone an apology.so no not no1 in my world and no will not long or short haul flights with them again.
label: negative

text: Terrible seats. We had no space for our legs due to boxes fixed under the seats in front of us. My girlfriend had these boxes fixed in front of her, leaving her only 60% of space for her feet. Myself had only 70% of normal feet space for economy class.
label: negative

text: Mumbai to Singapore via Sydney. No kids menu provided for a 2.5 year old, they said they did not have any. The age is mentioned when you book the ticket. They gave instant noodles which is not I am some thing paying for, the flight includes meals. We are non-vegetarians but other children with kids menu did not had a vegetarian option either.
label: negative

text: Is Singapore Airlines Losing Its Edge???? Not sure if this was a one off but cabin service in economy was always superior to the other airlines food, service. However, on this flight it was clear some of the attendants did not want to come to work that day, one male attendant looked as though he was in a fowl mood and did not smile and was grumpy to traveler. I think his attitude rubbed off on some of the other crew as there was no smile on this flight, most unusual for Singapore Airline. Maybe it was just a one off the flight out was better, however, maybe Singapore has dropped the ball as there fell to No. 2 spot in rankings this year losing out to Qatar Airlines.
label: neutral

text: Singapore airlines The first leg of our trip was London Heathrow to Changi Singapore. It was a very long 13 hour flight but everything was fine. The food was good and we were offered free wine and other drinks with our meals. Snacks and drinks were also available free of charge throughout the flight. The flight attendants were courteous and friendly and made us feel welcome. We would have liked to have been in premium economy as the seats looked very wide and comfortable but even though we were in economy it wasn't as cramped as with some other airlines. The seat back video screens offered lots of different entertainment such as movies, tv, music and games to keep most people occupied. On the whole a very pleasant flight.
label: positive

text: Stood up to its reputation First time on Singapore Airlines for us and had high hopes due to their reputation for being voted best airline. We weren’t disappointed - up there with Emirates for me. Lovely helpful staff and excellent food and plenty of free drinks including a Singapore Sling! No complaints at all.
label: positive

text: Premium product Our first experience flying Singapore Airlines surpassed our expectations. From the moment we boarded our 777 we were greeted with a warm welcome, chilled champagne and felt like royalty. Travelling for a special birthday the crew surprised my partner with a special gift and card - a beautiful touch that meant so much. Great selection of food and refreshments. Thank you SQ, we look forward to many more flights.
label: positive

text: Great Airlines, Outstanding Service On our flight from SIN-HKG (SG856), my wife and had the best flying experience we have ever had. We just happened to be celebrating our wedding anniversary. The flight crew on the upper deck of the A380 was incredible! From the warm welcome entering the aircraft to the personalized greeting at our seats, the crew made us feel incredibly comfortable. We booked seats 96D/F. They were incredibly comfortable in the upright and lounging positions, and when both seats are in the “full flat” position, they turn into a double bed. Although we were on a 4 hours day time flight, it was fun being able to lay next to my wife. The IFE system was great. The monitor was large and the resolution was great. The noise cancelling head phones worked well and were pretty comfortable. We both took advantage of the “Book the Cook” items for our lunch (she had the ribeye steak and I had the Lobster Thermidor) and there were both delicious. After lunch we were talking with the flight attendants and our anniversary came up during our conversation. About 5 minutes later a group of flight attendants were at our seats. They gave us a couple of Singapore Air A380 teddy bear, a glass of champagne and one of them was carrying a ukulele (they knew we were from Hawaii). They proceeded to sing a Happy Anniversary song to us, this was an incredible surprise and treat. We’d like to send our heart felt thanks to the following flight attendants, Yong Siang, Alice, Celine, Tracy, Colvin, Jeffrey, Govin, Sze Wei and Mariam.
label: positive

text: Fantastic Service Flew from Wellington, New Zealand to London wirh my husband and two children. What fantastic service all the staff provide. Thank you.
label: positive

text: Great Airline There isnt anything bad i have to say about this airline. The crew, the facilities, the food all extremely good. I will definitely be flying with them in the future!!
label: positive

text: Comfortable plane, great Service Very comfortable flight, toilets always cleaned and ready for use by the next passenger. Their experienced pilot gave us a good and restful comfortable ride, by respecting our private space and need for maximum rest. Enjoyed their good selection of cheeses. Had Superb spinach frittata for breakfast. And was treated to a Delicious hot chocolate made with milk. And my entire journey was made special by Marcella Stephany, one of the flight stewards who was amazingly wonderful in all ways! She was sensitive to my requirements, most polite, gentle and superb and serving from her heart, in her responses to requests. Truly the embodiment of Singapore Airlines’ philosophy of service excellence!
label: neutral

text: Fantastic flight Went to the Philippines to visit my daughter, and the flight went from Copenhagen to Singapore to Manila. The Airline does look after you. The service was perfect, very attentive and helpful. Surprisingly and the first time for me they have menu for the economy passenger. Seats and comfort is acceptable and the plains are in good condition. The entertainment selection was great, and on a 12 hour flight, lots to choose from. The lay-over in Singapore is amazing, I have never experienced such an incredible airport.
label: positive

text: excellent very good from checking in to getting off at the other end. The new planes are really nice however seats are a lot more closer together so a lot less leg room. Had an emergency exit seat on one leg of the flight and it was so good did not feel cramped at all. Would recommend these seats even if it was an extra charge. Food was really nice and service could not fault. Movie choice was excellent . I do always choose virgin as first choice and what with singapore being a partner this is so good for us when travelling.
label: positive

text: Comfortable Primium Economy The SQ Primium Economy seats are 2-4-2 configuration, seats are quite wide with adjustable foot rest. One of the better PE I experienced. Two meals are being served, dinner - about an hour after takeoff and breakfast - about an hour before landing. Stanard airplane food and nothing extraordinary ! Being Singapore Airline, services are attentive and courteous ! The inflight restrooms need more cleaning though !
label: positive

text: Great service, new aircrafts It was my first time flying with Singapore. I head a lot of good things about the airline, and they did not disappoint. All the crew where so professional, warm and friendly. The A380 looked very new. The seats reclined back a fair bit and the entertainment was great too, as well as the meals. I would def fly with them again.
label: positive

text: My experience was less convincing. The reservation line was always busy and it takes ages to get through. The seat is large and comfortable to sit, but to sleep it is not comfortable at all: too hard, too narrow footrest and you sleep in a diagonal position which is awkward. I could not sleep at all during the whole flight. And the food was really bad: very tough meat, overcooked and bad taste. Worst food I had in a long time. Staff is friendly but not efficient, sometimes it takes ages to get some water or bread etc. Overall really disappointing experience. A pity as they used to be good some years ago. In any case I will not chose them again.
label: negative

text: Fly with Singapore Airlines Excellent The trip with Singapore Airline was Excellent. The cabin crew was very friendly. Breakfest and diner was okay. Next time again with Singapore Airline
label: positive

text: Singapore Airline great serviece Travelled for a Christmas break in Singapore and then onto Perth. Flights were all on time. the A380 LHR to SIN was clean and comfortable. Last time we flew we were able to book the upstairs economy cabin, sadly seems this is not available anymore. Smooth flight and great service. Stopover in Singapore was worth it, 787 flight SIN to PER seats not so comfy. On the return journey we went straight though, the 13 hours SIN to LHR is gruelling but service again was attentive which made it a bit easier. We have flown this journey before with Singapore Airlines and would do so again. We booked our flights way in advance so cost was comparable to other airlines.
label: positive

text: Economy vs Premium Economy Pros: Awesome in-flight service, solid safety records, young and modern aircraft/fleet, clean, reliable and efficiently operated 5-star airline. Cons: Expensive, the huge price difference between SQ economy and the Premium Economy doesn't match with the service/seat upgrade you get. In-flight wifi is expensive and limited compared to other airlines. Uploading or downloading a single picture on Wifi did not work on my 13+ hour flight due to slow speeds. GSM roaming doesn't work (you will know this only after you have paid).
label: positive

text: Crew service thumb up I will get SQ ticket whenever is within my budget. This round we bring our youngest boy to experience long haul flight A350-900 to Brisbane. We board the flight before other passengers so that we can settle both kids in advance. They did not provide any kids toys for kids at this time. Only one Disney luggage tag on the pocket seat. Our boy feeling unwell when in the flight and we seek advice from the service crew. She is very patient to comfort us and get advice from flight captain. Luckily we can off from the flight. From Brisbane to Singapore, we choose to take midnight flight. The crew give each of the passengers a pouch of amenities kit which include of toothbrush, toothpaste and a pair of socks. Inflight entertainment not good as compare to last year we did take SQ to Bangkok. Breakfast is taste better than previous flight to Brisbane. Keep up the good work!
label: positive

text: A1Service The stewards on the flight were friendly and helpful. The food and refreshments were to our liking. At no time did we feel uncomfortable, however, the passenger sitting in front of my husband reclined his seat, cramping the space that my husband had available, which he found annoying! When we arrived back in Melbourne still on board the plane, our disembarkment was delayed by 15 minutes, due to a passenger requiring specialist medical attention. At no time during that flight were we aware that a passenger was experiencing health issues. Full marks to the stewards for attending to that person’s needs and protecting his/her privacy, without causing unnecessary stress to other passengers
label: positive

text: Sydney to Singapore 27TH august 2018 Sydney to Singapore 27th August 2018. Seat:56H Into the tunnel, we ventured that would take us to our plane. Because we required the assistance of walking sticks we were first. Soon as we approached and could see the doors of the plane, we were welcomed by three sincere smiling faces. We entered the plane. My wife and I hobbling along with our walking sticks, following the flight attendant to our seat. "Take your time please, no rush" we were told as we found our seat. Not just words, because their careful actions showed they did care. They wanted us to enjoy the experience flying with them. We did feel very special and calm and soon we were at our seats. The flight attendance crew worked as one. They made sure we did not need any help putting up our luggage. We knew and felt very comfortable to ask for assistance any time we required it. The other passengers too began slowly entering the plane. There was no rush everyone knew they would be taken care of. They soon with assistance, when required, put their luggage up for the flight. The flight attendants were always within easy reach. They ensured everybody was comfortable and not requiring any assistance. The flight attendance appeared to read each other minds. Just a nod and they would split into three and serving hot white fluffy towels. A wonderful way to prepare us for our flight. Just as efficient as they were given to us, they whisked them away with the same efficiency. It was unbelievable the flight attendants knew when they were required. Wine! for those interested. Juices, coffee, tea and even water to help us feel even more comfortable with the flight in front of us. Food, glorious food. Prepared in a professional manner. The taste, better than most first class restaurants. The passengers sit peacefully, enjoying the gentle hum of the aircraft, or watched a movie.that was situated at the back of each seat. It is so peaceful and relaxing some passengers go to sleep, covered in the blanket provided to all the passengers. The hours ticking away, most not noticing. The flight attendance shows no sign of tiredness or boredom. They continue their watch over their passengers, like a hen looking after her newly hatched chickens. If your eyes meet theirs, they smile, stop to see if you need anything, and ten continue their endless walk up and down the isles of the plane. Another warm while the fluffy towel is provided, so we can prepare, to go to our new destination. A final message from the pilot thanking us for not causing problems and hoped we had enjoyed all the crew staff hard work, for our short time together. The plane comes to a halt. The passengers slowly find their luggage and line up to face the outside world. LSS Sandy FS Astin FSS Zoe share with us a final smile and the hope to see each other again soon. I believe I could see a tear of sadness on the corner of their eyes. We slowly walked away, saying goodbye to the plane as well, who had taken us safely to our new destiny. Graeme McLeod.
label: positive

text: Excellent service for a one hour flight Singapore Airlines manages to deliver service in a short one hour flight. Other airlines struggle and take one hour to get food to the back of the plane where I like to sit, whereas Singapore airlines not only delivered all the food quickly, the food was excellent with great flavour and freshness then collected all the trays and rubbish well and truly before the start of descent of the flight. The staff were running around like a well oiled machine as soon as the seat belt sign went off. In such a short flight with turbulent periods it was a great effort, while maintaining friedliness, I really didn’t expect food to be served at all. The only thing was that they can’t transfer points to my airline rewards program which is unfortunate.
label: positive

text: Best Airline, always excellent and super friendly service Traveled with SQ on the longes non stop flight to SF. Since the service is outstanding in SQ as on most of my other destinations with SQ the time flies and the comfort in the business class as well as the care for the guests is excellent or better outstanding. They take great care about every detail Congrats to SQ management
label: positive

text: I flew to Singapore from London Heathrow in economy class on the SQ319 Airbus A380. Flight left and arrived on time. The positives: Flight crew were pleasant, friendly and polite. They still have high standards and give you a lovely welcome when you arrive onboard. Seats were fairly comfortable and enough space to stow your belongings and move around the cabin. Was given a sleeping pillow and a blanket. Negatives: Singapore Airlines have cut the quality and diversity of food and drinks that they have on offer. It was not the standard of food previously experienced on SQ flights. Presentation not good - now just mediocre. No juice, water or alcoholic beverages offered when you first get on the plane. No menu. Toilets weren’t clean and very small. You no longer get an amenity kit with toothbrush, eye shades, ear plugs, or socks or a newspaper. Bring back the hot towel service.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Denpasar Bali. Early morning departure from SIN at Chinese New Year, so it was a pretty full flight. Just after security check and with less than one hour to departure, we were told that there was a technical problem with the plane and we needed to switch plane (different gate). Amazingly, the entire flight was only delayed by 1 hour, which given the short notice, I feel is pretty amazing. Flight was on A330, which has the 2-4-2 configuration, and as usual, I opted for the (2) seat which I increasingly like. Seats were slightly narrower than the B777, but it just feels less cramped than the 3 seat options. Flight crew were slightly less charming than usual, but I guess the last minute change probably had something to do with this, and they still dealt very politely with some very demanding customers. Food was reasonably good (had Indonesian option), and IFE was as standard on the A330, if slightly dated. Only slight downside was the toilet, which although clean, had obviously seen better days with some wear and tear. So a good economy experience and I guess the additional cost for the flight (as opposed to the budget airline) pays off when something does wrong, as the recovery was really fast.
label: positive

text: 1st Singapore Air flight On SA due to covid rules excluding non-tax from flying on their airline [Im a gold card customer, so thanks] Not bad in any way just a functional cabin, crew and journey. Some airlines and journeys are memorable, however this was so-so really. Food ok, service ok I flew Prem Eco so certainly harder than flat beds for this long trip - but seat was ok not too much of a problem. Bits of tech didn't work though and some things hard to find. The instructions are online - and you have to register and perhaps pay to get online...its all to much of a fiddle so did not bother. Could watch film etc but this must really wind people up who want the full experience. Crew could have been asked and they did change a faulty headset but again it was not a most attentive cabin crew. Perfunctory.
label: neutral

text: A Harrowing Ordeal of 17 month old's Mother (Business Class) I have been a fan and admirer of the Singapore Airlines for quite some time being based out of Singapore for the past 5 years (KrisFlyer# - 8838199955). However, my recent experience over a long haul flight has forced me to alter my perception of the conduct of the airline staff/the crew as well as the airlines itself. This is with respect to a very unpleasant and downright horrible treatment meted out to my wife Paridhi Gupta and myself while we were travelling with an 17 month old infant. It was totally unexpected since Singapore in itself is one of the most kid friendliest places that I haven been to or lived in. Recently due to business reasons, we had to move out of Singapore and to US and despite having a longer flight duration and a higher premium than the competitors, we chose to book our flights with SQ. We had booked 3 Premium Economy Seats although my son (17 month old) isn't required to have his own seat but for the sake of comfort/space and expected high standards of hospitality we did book an additional seat. Then I chose to upgrade my wife's seat to Business Class using the KrisFlyer Miles since it was a 20+ hour journey that we were (taking not including a layover) and it was suggested to us by the customer service that it would be beneficial since our infant could accompany either of us as and when needed. So we ended up with a Business Class seat (with bassinet) and 2 Premium Economy seats on SQ 326 (SIN-FRA) & SQ 26 (FRA-NY) departing on 16th & 17th August 2018 resp. During the takeoff, we were told that Sparsh (my son) had to "sit" in the seat allotted to him and couldn't be with his mother. It seemed unreasonable but regardless we agreed thinking that it is just for the takeoff as we had been repeatedly assured in my conversations with the customer service that my son could be with his mother as and when reqd over the entire journey (Hence the reason for the bassinet seat allocated to her). Soon after takeoff, we wanted to put Sparsh to sleep and for that it was essential that he was with his mother but Paridhi was refused to take Sparsh to her seat for a nap as it would be against the airline "policies" and it would disrupt the "ambiance/atmosphere" or "travel experience" for the other business class passengers. Our request was to allow him with my wife only for his nap/sleep so that they both could rest and sleep peacefully and we had assured the cabin crew that once awake he will be returned to the premium economy cabin and be with me while awake and "noisier". Despite repeated request and my son getting crankier by the minute due to lack of sleep, he was not allowed to be with my wife. At each and every step, my wife was made to feel as if she didn't belong to the "Business" class and we should have booked the seats together to avoid the situation and as a result she felt embarrassed and humiliated. Some of the reasons given to us for disallowing Sparsh to be with my wife were 1. Policy#1 - His "seat" is in Premium Economy and hence he cant travel business. Really? These rules are applicable for a 17 month old infant? 2. Sparsh would disrupt the "ambiance/atmosphere" of the business cabin 3. Our Business Class passengers will be disturbed by any potential "noise" made by Sparsh. a) Wasn't my wife also a part of the elite business class group, even though she might have gotten her ticket by miles instead of cash? That shouldn't matter in any case. b) Sparsh was well behaved and friendly and even amused most of the passengers. None of the passengers ever complained to our knowledge or to the crew's knowledge which they admitted when asked if they had indeed received any complaints about a young infant being present in the business class cabin/area 4. Policy#2 - The crew wasn't given any knowledge of an infant and they did not have his name "tagged" to the bassinet, and hence he could not be given the bassinet and hence could accompany my wife. 5. Policy#3 - Only Adults can switch seats (I could switch seats with my wife) but seats cant be switched between an adult and a kid. (The suggestion in itself was absurd so there was no "switching" involved. Sparsh could wither with me or my wife as he definitely cant be left unaccompanied) Twice, I left my son with my wife to be fed and put to sleep, but she was approached by the crew cabin within minutes (disrupting Sparsh's light sleep in one instance) and was rudely asked to take Sparsh and go back to his seat. In the end, my wife sorely dejected and stressed out because of this whole experience decided to give up her seat and complete the first leg of the journey with me. Things continued to go downhill on the second leg of our journey (FRA - NY). We made sure to request the ground staff at Frankfurt airport to clearly convey the situation to the cabin crew so that he could be allocated a bassinet but we were told that this decision was solely up to the discretion of the flight crew. This happened despite the crew aboard SQ 326 assuring is that they will forward our request to SQ 26 about the bassinet so that we don't face the same "issues" The crew for SQ 26 seemed well mannered but were very aggressive at the same time in letting us know that in no circumstance Sparsh could be allowed in Business Class since he had his own seat in PE. I can't help but make a note that both the legs of the journey were during the day which was intentional on our part so as to not inconvenience our fellow passengers during the night/sleep time, so the question/point about disrupting the ambiance of any area of the flight becomes downright absurd. We had also let the cabin crew in both flights know that in case they received a single complaint from any of the passengers regarding our son we were more than willing to talk to the concerned passenger(s) and addressing their complaints. At the last 20 mins of the flight to NY, we were "allowed" to be seated in the business class so that we can be together while de-boarding. While this gesture is appreciated, it simply cannot make up for the harrowing experience we faced as a family. Sorely disillusioned and disappointed, we have vowed not only to never travel by SQ ever again but also the elite "Business Class" and also will ensure to create awareness amongst our friends with young kids to be careful while planning to travel with SQ. The whole reason of this email nearly a month after our ordeal is to let the management know of the ground realities and hopefully this leads to a discussion and relaxation of any such rigid policies which could lead to a pleasant experience for travelers especially if a separate seat for an infant has been bought by naive parents. It just feels counter-intuitive that buying a separate seat for Sparsh led to this highly harrowing time for my family, whereas if we had chosen to stick with just 1 seat each for my wife and myself, things might have been simpler. What also struck was the inexplicable attitude of the crew, when dealing with us and refusing to accept the logic for our arguments that if a) being an infant (<2 Yrs old) Sparsh wasn't mandated to have his own seat and would have been travelling with his mother had we opted not to buy a separate seat for him and b) trying to convey to us that even they understood our predicament their hands were tied due to to airline policies.
