I do hope this is taken as a constructive criticism and some steps our taken to improve the policies as well as the hospitality shown by the crew to not only with families with young kids but all travelers with different circumstances.
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines Pleasant flight no problems usual excellent service and very clean modern A380 have used this air line many times and normal high standard.
label: positive

text: we have a good flight and the sevice too The service we have is very good..We request assit with my husband from Perth to Singapore because we celebrate our anniversary for 38 yrs together even though he had his stroke last 7 1/2 weeks before we fly they help us a lot..So appreciated.
label: positive

text: A game of two halves We have flown Singapore Airlines many times and think is a great airline. This review is about the first and last legs on a trip to the Maldives via Singapore . We went Premium Economy and were fortunate to be upgraded to Business Class on the return. The contrast between the two Is huge. If you think of the pricing (Premium Economy is double Economy and Business is double Premium Economy), you might expect the value to reflect the same. But it doesn’t. Flights attendants are great in all classes, so it’s not about the quality of service. The standard of food offered was the biggest difference. Inedible in Premium Economy, delicious in Business. Second is the seating for overnight travel. Sort of OK in Premium Economy, fantastic in Business. So, if your doing the Australia - Singapore flight do it during the day and fly Economy. If you are travelling further overnight and can afford it, go Business - if you can’t afford Business go Premium Economy. For all airlines offering Premium Economy, the offering needs to be upped a bit to match the price point. Having said that I’ll opt to fly Premium Economy most times for that little bit of leg room and a quieter section of the plane. Still love Singapore Airlines, just a little (probably very expensive for them) tweak would make a huge difference.
label: positive

text: Quite disappointed After hearing good things about SA, I must say I am quite disappointed. In all flights, I expected a meal or a snack more. My seat from Brisbane to Singapore was quite uncomfortable. Wifi on the way back didn't work because apparently krisflyers members don't get complimentary wifi anymore, although their app says they do. When I told the crew, they told me the app was out of date and they didn't really help nor offer alternatives. At Brisbane airport I waited 1.5 hours to check in, and the app didn't let me check in online. The app also doesn't really work, it's slow and it's very messy with a lot of hidden pages that are not east to find. Lastly, Singapore airport is so bad. At 6am only a couple of cafes open (waited 25 minutes in a line to get a cappuccino) and not much space to sit.
label: negative

text: Worth spending a lil extra for good customer service. I always buy singapore air for my parents. Its really easy to fly with Singapore as staff is friendly, good food and everything is positive. I would recommend anyone to spend a few extra dollars and buy singapore rather than any other budget airline.
label: positive

text: Friendly Helpful Staff Flew from Heathrow to Singapore, then on to Melbourne with Singapore Airlines, staff always helpful and friendly, make you feel welcome and nothing is too much trouble.
label: positive

text: Always turbulence on Singapore Airlines Even though the airline generally rates really highly, I try to avoid Singapore Airlines as much as possible. In all the times I have flown to Singapore, it appears the airline tries to utilize the tailwinds as much as possible, resulting in excessive turbulence, at least much more so than on United, Cathay Pacific, or the flights to Europe. I wish the airline would take passenger comfort into consideration, and realize there's more to the flying experience than getting there sooner or saving fuel.
label: negative

text: Brisbane to Beijing via Singapore. I'd never flown Singapore Airlines before and was looking forward to it. The FAs were attentive on both sectors (BNE/SIN and SIN/PEK) and the food was nice. That's about it. The IFE on both sectors was well-stocked but I found it difficult to hear because it was crackling and kept starting/stopping. Most of the Singapore Airlines reviews must be for business class. I'd still prefer Emirates over Singapore Airlines having now given them a go.
label: neutral

text: Well looked after with my wheelchair Excellent service as I travel with a wheelchair. Very well looked after. Assisted to bathrooms and first on the plane, last off, met by attendants who took me through the formalities and made travel easy.
label: positive

text: Great service and product Flew on the new first product. Service was amazing as usual, seat was good and the bed even better. A good first class product, highly recommended. Cabin is quiet and the new lalique amenities bag is great as are the pyjamas.
label: positive

text: Disappointed We had high expectations, as I had heard good things about Singapore Airlines, but unfortunately we were left disappointed. We would normally fly Jetstar business class and I wish we had of stayed with them, as Singapore airlines was more expensive. The set up of the plane was poor compared to business class on Jetstar, the toilet situation was undesirable because unlike on business class Jetstar you are only sharing the toilet with about 28 other passengers. On Singapore premium economy you are sharing it with the whole plain. The service was poor. We we not offered refreshments prior to take off and I imagine this was because of the layout of the plane. When we were offered refreshments and food it took forever for the flight attendants to come round and collect the rubbish and empty trays. Overall I would rate Singapore Airlines as poor and would not fly with them again, and I definitely would not recommend them.
label: negative

text: Smooth flight and humorous air steward Great service offered by the air steward that is incharge of our row. And he also makes small talks here and there during this slightly long flight duration (7 hrs plus).
label: positive

text: Chef meal I ordered the chef choice for dinner on my way back. The spicy Thai fish dish was well prepared and way better than the Rock Pool inspired Qantas Business flight. However the lobster thermidor was too creamy for my liking. It was a beautiful flight served by professional airline crew. My favourite is Cathay followed by SQ.
label: positive

text: Amazing Flight We could not fault this Airline we flew with them for the first time in September 2018 and could highly recommend them from the Staff to the Servive it was fantastic. The seats are so comfy and plenty of legroom as my husband has fairly long legs.The food was great and so much of it, the staff were friendly , would differently fly with this airline again.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Medan flight A clean well fitted aircraft with flight attendants who are eager to assist without being overpowering. I have flown them many times into Singapore and am happy to say the standards have not dropped. You can check-in on line to avoid any delays in Changi The food was adequate for such a short flight
label: positive

text: Flying comfort The best airline. . . The food is tasty except the sachet of milk is too small 😁 , good service, entertainment update and all cabin crew friendly, kind and helpfully. . Thank you for accompanying my trip. . See you in next trip
label: positive

text: Very good flight to Bangalore! It has been a while since I have been on a Singapore Airlines flight and am glad that it is still very good. The air-craft is clean, the service is good and the food served is also good. I guess due to tail wind, we made it to Bangalore in under 4 hours. I could have flown out of KUL to BLR but instead I decided to fly via SIN to BLR and hence the flight on Singapore Airlines. Overall, a very good experience.
label: positive

text: FRA to JFK and back. I am a frequent traveller and have been on more than 25 airlines so far. But Singapore airlines always exceeds my expectations! They serve food in economy that could easily be served in business classes of other carriers. The entertainment system is just great and the legroom is good. The great attitude of the friendly crews gives you the feeling that you are welcome onboard and that it is a pleasure for them to make you feel comfortable. This was my second time on Singapore Airlines and definitely not the last one!
label: positive

text: Best flight ever Although the seating space was only a bit bigger than normal, but everything else was amazing. We were fed dinner, snacks, breakfast and were constantly given water during the flight. The stewardesses were so kind and helpful. They were constantly checking on everyone. They offered warm face cloths several during the flight. Their entertainment system had amazing choices of movies, tv, music, etc. Excellent airlines.
label: positive

text: Melbourne to London via Singapore. If you book on line make sure to read all 20 pages of the Terms and Conditions. I have been an Elite Gold KrisFlyer member for 15 years and have previously considered Singapore Airlines as one of my preferred airlines. Not any more. All I wanted to do was buy an Economy Class ticket and use points to upgrade to business class (my daughter was the passenger). So I went on line and selected the cabin class that allowed upgrades. The web site showed a tick that this was possible and the ticket that I subsequently purchased likewise confirmed that class E tickets are eligible for upgrades. What they don't tell you is that upgrades are only permissible to the next available cabin class and that as most international flights have a Premium Economy cabin you can not upgrade from regular economy to business class. This little known rule is buried deep in the terms and conditions (section F, para 24, sub section a)) which almost nobody ever reads, it is 20+ pages long. And if you want your money back then there is a $200 cancellation fee. I have cut up my Elite Gold card and will never fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: negative

text: Even the delay wasn't a problem This was the third tome we'd flown SQ to Singapore then on to Brisbane. Nothing seemed too much trouble for the staff or Business Crew, and they went out of their way to make our journey as stress free as possible.
label: positive

text: Fraudulent.. never refund for flight that cancelled by Singapore Airlines Regarding refund.I had booked a flight for Ahmedabad to Brisbane date 23/01/2022. But due to covid Singapore airline cancelled all flights and sent me email saying apply for full refund through given link. I did apply but never got refund. It is been 5 months from cancellations. And for same I rang four-times singapore airline, each time someone over phone assure me that you will receive an email, a call within 24 hrs but never received an email or any call. It is really frustrating that each time I stay on phone with a customer representative for an hour plus but no outcome, just lies. I emailed them as well but no result. Never travel with Singapore. I lost my money gor nothing. Thank you SINGAPORE AIRLINES .
label: negative

text: Quality While the two flights from Bangkok to Fukuoka (via Changi) are a little long winded. The service and overall quality of Singapore Airlines was superb. Punctuality, efficiency and, high quality staff - all made for a very pleasant journey.
label: positive

text: Best Flight Experience Fantastic service from check in to arrival. On board cabin crew so professional, warm and welcoming entire flight.
label: positive

text: Outstanding service and comfort From the very professional check in to our very comfortable business class double bed configuration the entire flight was a pleasure. The meal service and staff were first class.
label: positive

text: Best flight with 3 small kids This was our first time flying Singapore Airlines and we loved it. From price to booking to requesting children’s meals everything prior to flying was seamless. Check in and bag drop was quick and easy. Nothing was too much trouble for the flight attendants. Special shoutout to Winston! The entertainment system is great and so much food!This is now our first choice airline.
label: positive

text: very disappointed and unhappy The flight between Brisbane to Singapore:The plane was a newer model, good size screen and phone charging through usb, however internet was not available and if it was available it was at a cost. Have used Turkish Airlines and Emirates previously and they provide free internet. Food was terrible and i ended up getting diarrhoea from it. To top it up my connecting flight to Istanbul delayed for 3 hours. The plane Singapore Airlines decided to designate for an 11 hour non stop flight to Istanbul from Singapore, was like an ancient plane and an embarrassment to Singapore Airlines. I could not believe the how overrated they are. There was no mobile phone charging available, tv screens were old and not working, smaller toilets in size. It was an old plane. The funny thing is the plane that i traveled in from Brisbane to Singapore was a much newer and comfortable plane and the travel time is about 8 hours, however Singapore to Istanbul takes about 11 hours to fly and they make their customers travel in a crappy old plane for that long. I do not understand their logic. I thought coming back to Australia, Singapore Airlines would have some sense and logic but unfortunately they do not seem to have one as they have done the same thing by putting the same model of plane to the same destination. 11 hours of torture with no internet or even a phone charging socket. Also in my return trip between Istanbul and Singapore i was not happy with one of the flight attendants which i ended up complaining to the supervisor during the flight. To sum it up, i have always liked Singapore Airlines and had good experiences with them, however this trip was very disappointing.
label: negative

text: I am very disappointed with Singapore Airlines (SQ) which claims to be the World’s Best Airline. Paid the high price and full fare for the First-Class ticket and was refunded only 29% of the full fare without giving the passenger a chance to confirm/consent to the refund amount. Very poor customer service and communication. March 23, 2020: SQ emailed me that my flight was cancelled due to Covid-19 situation. April 5: I wrote back "I would like to get a refund for my ticket. Pls revert." My intention was to ask what was the refund amount and was expecting them to revert. April 7: No response from SQ so wrote asking a few questions about the refund process. April 14: SQ unilaterally refunded the ticket without confirming the amount. As a First-Class passenger and there are only 4 first class seats on the flight to LAX, SQ could, in the very least, confirm with me the refund amount and obtain my consent before refund. And after I disputed the refund amount as being unreasonably low (not enough for me to buy another one-way first-class ticket back), they should have the courtesy to handle the communication with the customer better and in a more timely manner. So, I have requested for a reinstatement of my ticket instead of the refund on by emailing and calling customer service of SQ on June 5 and got a reply on June 30 that still under investigation. Current status as of Aug 20, it has been one and a half months and still no reply from SQ.
label: negative

text: Feels more spacious on B777-300ER than A350 & Tasty Book the Cook Meals Third time on SIA Premium Economy and previously been on the A350, A350ULR and this is the older B777-300ER, however, I have to say it feels much spacious than the A350. Flight was good and managed to get a few hours sleep (guess I was very tired). Book the cool meals out from Singapore was definitely a good choice, and the ability to view the standard menu prior also does help. Using book the cook service, I selected Nasi Biriyani and Nasi Lemak and the former smelled really fragrance and tasted really good. Something about SIA premium economy seats in which I can't pinpoint out that isn't very comfortable in some ways.
label: positive

text: Excellent Flight on Singapore Airlines Medium Haul Business Class product Singapore Airlines A350-900 medium-haul aircraft is fitted with two cabins with 40 Business Class seats and 263 Economy Class seats. The 40 seats in Business Class are split into two sections, with 28 seats in the forward cabin, the larger cabin and 12 seats in the smaller rear cabin. The 1-2-1 seat configuration in Singapore Airlines’ regional Business Class product gives all passengers direct aisle access. There are three lavatories, one located up front right behind the cockpit and another two between the two Business Class sections, serving all 40 passengers in Business Class. Singapore Airlines differentiates its Business Class lavatories from Economy Class by fitting them with brown leather backsplashes on the bulkhead. Singapore Airlines is one of the few airlines that packs its lavatories with amenities for guests’ convenience. Singapore Airlines regional Business Class seats have a seat pitch of 60″ and measure 28″ wide, providing its passengers with excellent legroom and enhanced privacy despite not having a door, thanks to the cacoon seat design. Singapore Airlines regional Business Class seats feature a 180° lie-flat bed. The seats come with several handy modes programmed into the seat control buttons on the side of the seat. Besides the seat controls, Singapore Airlines also included light controls and attendant call buttons on the touch-panelled seat control buttons. pops out in its storage mode, which is half the size of the table. Passengers who do not need the large table can use it in its storage mode. The seat table folds out to its dining mode, which is twice the size of its storage mode. The seat table does not feel wobbly and is perfect for dining and working on a 16″ laptop. Under the IFE screen is a footwell, which is meant for passengers to stretch their feet into when the seat is deployed in its bed mode. Singapore Airlines fully used the space under the footwell by leaving it empty to double up as a space to stow carry-on or for passengers to place their shoes. There is no lack of storage space on Singapore Airlines’ regional Business Class seats. There is a small cabinet at the side of each side for passengers to stow smaller items like mobile phones and passports. The small sliding door installed at the cabinet ensures the items inside remain secure and out of sight. Within the cabinet, passengers can find an international power socket and two USB charging outlets, making it very convenient for passengers to get juice for their devices. A hook next to the cabinet creates space for passengers to hang the headphones provided by Singapore Airlines when not in use. Singapore Airlines designed the space by the cabinet as a side table, which doubles up as a cocktail table, for passengers to place small items on. I thought the biggest flaw with the Singapore Airlines regional Business Class seats was the placement of the seat pocket. The seat pocket is placed at the lower corner of the seat on the back of the seat in front. Passengers wanting to access the seat pocket must unbuckle their seat belts and stretch for it. The seat pocket seems to be meant only for Singapore Airlines to place in-flight magazines and safety cards as it is too shallow (and tight) to fit in anything else. Singapore Airlines fits its Business Class with a large 18″ LED touchscreen TV. The LED TV can be tilted downwards so passengers can still watch the numerous options on KrisWorld lying down on the flatbed mode of the seat. The entertainment options on KrisWorld are laid out in an intuitive menu for passengers to browse and select from hundreds of shows, from the latest blockbuster movies to TV shows and even games. KrisWorld can be accessed via the touchscreen function on the TV or via the mobile phone, like IFE controller found under the seat controls at the side of the seat. Singapore Airlines supplies noise-cancelling headphones to its Business Class passengers. These headphones effectively cancel out the ambient noise from the aircraft cabin and are comfortable to put on. Business Class passengers are given free wifi to use onboard. Singapore Airlines does not offer its signature “Book the Cook” service for flights originating from Bangkok. I opted for the Indonesian Fried Rice, while my friend chose the Pan Fried Salmon. Of the three courses of the meal served, I thought only the appetiser was tasty. The Indonesian Fried Rice I had was disappointing in taste and presentation. I thought the presentation of the meal did not enhance its appetising appeal, the fried rice looked haphazardly splattered on the china, and the vegetables looked like a mess. The grilled chicken tasted blend, the fried rice tasted like plain steamed rice, and the vegetable was overpowered with spiciness. The sticky pudding dessert looked like some mouldy bread, but I tasted the dessert nonetheless. The pudding was too sweet for my liking that I had to wash the taste with Coke. My friend also commented the Pan Fried Salmon he opted for tasted bland and dry. Service on Singapore Airlines Business Class was exceptional. The excellent service started the moment I boarded the aircraft. Cabin crew offered me pre-departure drinks, introducing Singapore Airlines’ latest cocktail, Bellini. When told I do not drink too much, the cabin crew offered me another glass of orange juice in case I was not too fond of the cocktail. Before taking off, the cabin crew – Stephanie stopped by every seat under her charge to introduce herself to all the passengers she would be taking care of during the flight. Despite a full flight, I find cabin crews onboard made an effort to check in with passengers if we required anything else. Towards the end of the flight, a passenger sitting across from me started to make noise about the requirement to submit an online arrival card in Singapore. He kicked up a ruckus that the ground staff did not inform him of this requirement. Instead of brushing him aside, I witness Stephanie patiently helping the passenger fill out an online form while her colleagues stand in for her to conduct pre-landing checks. I overheard Stephaine volunteering to share her mobile data with him when we landed to ensure the passenger could enter Singapore smoothly. Despite it being the passenger’s fault for not checking the immigration requirements, Stephaine handled the situation with much patience and professionalism.
label: positive

text: very memorable flight for my infant grandson We booked a SQ flight to Bangkok in July and was pleasantly surprised that we get to choose the seat as a whole family travelling with the infant. However, when we wanted to check in for the flight back to Singapore, was shocked to find out the all the family members were separated with only the infant and the father alone. Managed to get in touch with the Singapore airlines office in Singapore and was relieved to find out that the seats has already been allocated to us by default. The whole team on both flights were very helpful and pleasant. The seats and bassinet provided were very comfortable. It was a very smooth and memorable flight from Singapore to Bangkok and from Bangkok to Singapore and my grandchild definitely has a very wonderful first time experience on board Singapore Airlines. Thank you very much for your wonderful service!
label: positive

text: great airline Great service, lovely food, seats were comfortable and lots of leg room in the upper deck! Couldn't fault it at all
label: positive

text: Great customer service The crew on this flight couldn't have been more accommodating. My husband had an issue with his screen and everyone did their best to resolve the issue. They rebooted the system at least 4 times to try and make it work, but to no avail. We think the actual handset had been compromised on a previous flight. As a result we were served breakfast prior to other flyers, offered additional drinks, reading material and many apologies. Towards the end of the flight my husband was also given a voucher as compensation for the lack of provision of the in-flight entertainment. We thought this was amazing service as they couldn't offer a seat change together as the flight was too full so this was a great gesture to receive which pre-empted the possibility of a complaint. Sometimes system failures cannot be helped. It is service that makes a difference and the way the Singapore airlines staff handled this was exceptional. Would definitely recommend flying with them
label: positive

text: AMS-SIN-CGK. Flight was on time. Arrived at Singapore Changi airport on time nice airport for transit. Aircraft from AMS-SIN was refitted B777-200ER. which is quiet old but clean nice and comfortable (use 3x3x3 configuration). Staff on both flights were attentive they also offered drinks every several times. However the LCD screen for the entertainment is quite old so the resolution of the screen wasn't really clear.
label: positive

text: Los Angeles to Singapore, 16.5hrs overnight. 2 adults, 3 children (7yrs, 5yrs and 8 months old) at gate \i am told that the entertainment system does not work. 4 rows of seats are not working. in flight for 16.5hrs, no lights as windows required to be shut, no lights on the seats, not charger for phone, no entertainment, they offered me to move my 2 kids to the back of the airplane so they can watch movies, I guess they have no children. then offered me ~$110 USD voucher to use on the flight for the inconvenience. I had to play with my kids, draw and color using my phone flashlight, my wife feeding my 8mths old with her phone flashlight. This was Premium Economy seats that do not cost few dollars?? I complained and their response was, "you received a voucher for the inconvenience and you rejected the two available seats." I understand some issues are out of their control such as the system not operating but a $110 for the inconvenience, also, on the way back, our system works, but other passengers experience the same. Completely disappointed with Singapore Airlines Customer Relations. Will not travel with them again.
label: negative

text: Exceptional experience The most exquisite flight I have ever taken. Excellent facilities, service, and degree of comfort. Would highly recommend Business Class if financially possible.
label: positive

text: Flying to Melbourne Whats the problem with flying to Australia? There were no food Menus or bottled water when we boarded. We had no idea what the food was going to be until they came round.No amenity pack. When i compare Singapore to Air New Zealand, they have a long way to go. Air New Zealand have toilets close to Premium for our use. Singapore's Premium toilets were way down in Economy. The toilets were old and became dirty very quickly. When I pay for Premium, I expect to get it, on every flight. Singapore has been our Airline of choice for a long time. What do we do, use a different airline to Singapore and then travel with them? Perhaps, just change Airlines. We simply love Singapore, but there are other Airlines.
label: neutral

text: Still the best! I was actually longing to travel with Singapore Airlines since the first time I flew with them a few years ago. I'm so glad I paid a bit of a premium and selected this airline to fly me to New Zealand. My faith in their services has been restored. I hope they keep up the good work.
label: positive

text: Amazing Airlines I tried Singapore Airlines several times and I consider it as a one of the best Airlines that take you to the places you love.
label: positive

text: Very disappointed with Singapore Airlines. Dated and uncomfortable old seat in business class combined with below average food. Ok cabin crews. Last but not least they lost my bag. I would fly SQ again on short haul on a discount economy class ticket…
label: negative

text: Overall a very good flight experience :) Flew to Hong Kong via the Economy Class back in March 2019. Was a really smooth plane ride for me. Good variety of movies to watch and would definitely take Singapore Airlines again :)
label: positive

text: Enjoyable flight I have recently flown from Manchester to Melbourne and back, stopping off in Singapore with Singapore Airlines and all my flights were great! The flight attendants couldn’t do enough for you which made the flights that I was on my own on, that bit easier. I was able to select my seat way in advance to put my mind at ease and all the processes were easy. Inflight entertain was relatively up to date and the plane was kept clean the whole time.
label: positive

text: First travel on Singapore Airlines Me and my husband were travelling to Singapore to his cousins and decided to take Singapore Airlines as we had heard so much about the service. Must say the service was definitely better than other airlines I have travelled with so far. But in my mind it was close to what Jet Airways used to offer in its good days :) The leg room was amazing; you wont get this in any other airline today. The food selection was good in general, but limited for vegetarians. The hostesses were polite and quick to service. However, the headrests were really bad; you can keep adjusting it to your head and after a few minutes it returns to its original shape. So they were essentially useless. On our return journey the seats were not as comfortable and were stiffer. Also, there was just too much turbulence during the journey so I don't think I was able to focus on the finer details.
label: neutral

text: On time and safe Whenever I travel, SQ is always my 1st choice of Airline; the plane is new, on time schedule and good service. Online booking of SQ flight and online check-in process is easy, inflight entertainment is great too. Highly recommended. :)
label: positive

text: My friends and I flew Singapore Airlines from Manila to Ho Chi Minh City via Singapore last week for a holiday. From updating a companion's passport details through their reservations line in Manila to the orderly boarding procedure, one gets a sense of the quality. The meals, particularly the pork pasta dish served on the Ho Chi Minh City to Singapore sector, were divine. The frequent drinks run was very highly appreciated. The cabin staff were efficient and effective, particularly with regard to safety, with polite but firm requests to stow bags and trays when necessary. The Boeing 777-200 is on the senior side with a minute screen but the A330-300 on the SIN-SGN vv. route is another story.
label: positive

text: The only way to fly We flew Premium Economy and were very happy with the level of comfort and service For long haul travel, Singapore Airlines is the only way to fly for us - no one else comes close the the level of service and brilliant airline staff.
label: positive

text: Pleasant flight We boarded the aircraft and was welcomed with warmth smile. Seats were comfortable with sufficient leg space. The 5 hour journey seemed short with very good inflight entertainment. Food served was good and the crew were all friendly except for one stewardess who had an unfriendly face, didn’t smile. Most importantly we had a safe flight and had never doubted taking our home brand anytime.
label: positive

text: Great service in Singapore Airline I have been flying frequently with Singapore airline. Their flight attendants are always very courteous and friendly. Flight often departs on time. Hope they continue to keep up with the good service on board.
label: positive

text: Great service, great food Pleasant daytime flight in economy. Seats comfortable. Had order bland meals for dietary reasons and the breakfast,lunch and dinner were all very tasty. Checkin at Sydney airport was quick and baggage readily available in Hanoi when we arrived. Plenty of water and juice available throughout flight. Staff friendly.
label: positive

text: BOOKING EXPERIENCE With all the technology at disposal in Singapore Airlines. The one thing SA could simply not get right is a non- functional website. Your booking engine sucks, redemption online is a complete disgrace, doesnt allow passengers to book redemption only over the phone, had to call singapore, because there was no official office in UAE, although they have a third party who has no control over redemption (krisflyer.) Even the worlds worst low cost carrier probably has a better user-friendly website. Calls for some IT dept ovehaul. Website always crashes, payment system doesnt work. And no one can explain, and give answers. THIS IS A NIGHTMARE. THANK YOU, HAVE BURNT THROUGH ALL THE MILES. NEVER WILL I GIVE ANOTHER PENNY TO SA FOR THEIR CRAPPY SERVICE.
label: negative

text: Return trip to Adelaide via Singapore. Would not use this airline again nor would I recommend travelling with Singapore Airlines. The seating was uncomfortable and cramped extremely poor inflight entertainment the food was an ice cream dessert that was still frozen and inedible. One of the meals contained pork so tough I could not cut through it. Another meal that was supposed to be beef just consisted mainly of gristle. The only good part of all four flights was that most of the cabin staff were efficient and helpful. I found the whole experience extremely disappointing and certainly poor value for money.
label: negative

text: Enjoyable Business Class Experience Osaka to Singapore A relatively short but enjoyable overnight flight. Check-in only starts around 2.5hrs before departure. For business class passengers, you get a choice of using either the JAL Sakura Lounge or some restaurants as the lounge gets very crowded with a couple of airlines using it. However, I don't think a crowded lounge is of any big issue to me as long as I can get a seat, in which mostly, people do. Offerings wise quite standard but not too bad overall. Three different type of beers available and spirits and Japanese plum wines. As having been on the Dreamliner several times in business, hence, seat is pretty good as usual. As flight time is only around 6 hours and they offer a sleeper service in which you can have your meal either after take off or 2.5hrs before touch down in which they will wake you up. I selected right after take off and had the hot soba with tempura, changing from the famous Hanakoireki as the outbound from SIN didn't taste as good as expected. The soba definitely tasted very good. Something happened just before meal service (I will not say it..haha) but as a result, chatted with the crew, the IFM Ms. E. Chan whom was really amazing. She is probably the second best ever SIA crew I ever encountered and ask her about the sleeper service as it did say passenger can choose to have a meal after take off or 2.5hrs before landing or both. I asked how does 'both' works and she say if there are remaining, they will try to serve passenger requesting for second, but she say will wake me up for the second meal. Second time round try the Hanakoireki and it certainly tasted much better than the outbound from SIN one, and being a supper service, it was half the portion which was just enough.
label: positive

text: Excellent Service from Singapore Airlines Singapore Airlines continues to provide an excellent service. They also allow an unbelievable 30kg of luggage per passenger in economy. This proved to be extremely helpful as we had been on a cruise and had huge suitcases. I can't fault them.
label: positive

text: Jakarta to London via Singapore. Absolutely top notch service, fabulous food and beverage choices,cabin ambience looks great IFE is world class and the seats are so comfortable and spacious that I slept like a baby! Still the best airline by a long way.
label: positive

text: professional and friendly This airline was as usual very professional and all but one of the four flights I took on this journey was on time, the last being 15 minutes late. The food was good as far as airline food goes and the service was as usual excellent. I would always recommend Singapore airlines, but as a rule I don't stick to one airline and take the shortest and most cost effective flight available.
label: positive

text: Delightful inflight experience from SQ Given the on-going outbreak of Corona Virus, I salute those crews who still showed up to work on a flight some crews may consider "sensitive" for various legitimate reasons. Those cabin crews in this particular flight worked very well, supporting each others' tasks, with impeccable attention to details throughout the flight. A special shout out to one of the Cabin Crew, Yan Ting LAM, for the most courteous service, delivered with genuine care and concern for her passengers. It's staff like Ms LAM and others like her that truly set SQ apart from others.
label: positive

text: Excellent service Just took a flight from Or Tambo International to Singapore on Singapore Airlines,Staff is excellent friendly.and helpfully the food is also excellent,We had too much to drink and eat with a variety of food and drinks. Will definitely use them again
label: positive

text: A great airline with excellent service. I flew Canberra to Singapore return. It was a great journey. Very comfortable! The cabin crew were excellent and always on hand to assist.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Melbourne. I have taken SQ many times and each time is a little worse than the flight before. This flight was on time and passengers were boarded according to section. I was lucky that there was a spare seat between myself and the guy with the aisle seat. Once we took off, the passenger in front reclined (day flight) and it sure makes economy feel so squeezy. Unlike their promise on the website that you won’t be packed like sardines, you are. I can’t eat fish but I guess SQ decided to save money by incorporating all allergies. My breakfast was gluten free (revolting hard dry roll), no dairy and no sugar. I was appalled by it compared to the normal breakfast. I am glad I brought snacks like chocolate and cookies. The selection of entertainment was fine and the toilets are kept clean. However paying so much more to go with SQ I expected the standards to be maintained not reduced. I think I will only base future travel on price as this so called great airline is not so great.
label: negative

text: Friendly and Pleasent Service Singapore airlines Economy Class is better than most. Cabin crew are most attentive and food served is quite good as well. Good seats with adequate legroom and head support, though the entertainment screen, remote and ports need a overhaul.
label: positive

text: Attention to Detail? Always a pleasure to fly in Business Class with SIA. The choice of food and drink is good and it is served correctly. They understand in Business about service. Not so in the lower classes! The seats are comfortable and there is a lot of legroom. They knew my name, but my younger son Oliver was called Olivia, even though he looks like a young boy.
label: positive

text: London to Melbourne via Singapore. Average at best. Check in and baggage drop off hassle free. Lounge doesn’t have a great selection of food. As a gold velocity member with a third family member travelling on a different Star Alliance flight, she was refused entry despite gold membership allowing a guest, and travelling business class. I was met with 3 staff members who stuck to their guns. The lounge was quiet, but they assured me it would fill. I will never use this airline again.
label: negative

text: Flew SIA business class Christchurch - Singapore - Istanbul and then London - Singapore - Auckland. Staff service was superb. My only negatives are the smallish TV screens and rather overly warm cabin.
label: positive

text: Enjoyable long haul Check-In: Not applicable a connecting flight Boarding - Organised, zone-wise boarding and fast Departure - On-Time InFlight Entertainment - Good range of movies to select from InFlight Meals - Okay tasting and portions were right Singapore Ground Handling - Not applicable as I had an onward connection
label: positive

text: Not what I expected Having only flown charter or budget airlines we were excited to fly on this renowned airline. Was left dissapointed to be honest. The seats weren't very comfortable and less room than Thomas Cook or Tui in long haul. The food was hit and miss. Some OK some absolutely disgusting, with fish bones and scales in a meal described as chicken. Getting water was a chore and served in thimbles. Worrying on a 13 hour flight. Had no idea until near the end of a 13 hour flight that you could request snacks and alcohol (as none offered) from back of plane but pretty poor selection. IFE system very poor, irritating to navigate and poor selection. Games didn't work on any of the 4 legs we had. Again, much better selection on the cheap charter airlines. Only positives were the short legs from Singapore to siem reap and back. Much better service, same size seats! 737 cleaner and newer than the a380 or 777. Also enjoyed flying a380, very smooth flight on such a large aircraft. Would recommend Changi airport as a layover but not their national carrier.
label: neutral

text: Amazing service The service provided by Singapore airlines was superior to any other airline I have flown with and this includes many of the other international carriers.
label: positive

text: a pleasure to fly after a long week of business it's always a pleasure to travel SQ home relaxing and rejuvenated on the red eye for a packed few days of more work, SQ makes it easier to travel and manage work at the same time
label: positive

text: Wonderful cabin crew On our recent trip to Australia and back to the UK we flew with Singapore Airlines, business Class. The aircraft were all roomy and comfortable and the cabin crew were simply amazing - such lovely girls who spoiled the passengers to bits! Will always fly with them in future where possible.
label: positive

text: Disappointing Experience with SQ We were disappointed with the SQ for the following reasons: 1. No amenities kit for business class. One has to ask for each item ( socks, slippers, ear plugs, eyes mask, lotion……..) individually 2. Only two meals were offered on an 18 hours flight. The rest are only snacks for you to ask 3. Wi Fi were unstable on and off for the whole flight. It’s very frustrating to get any work done 4. Lie flat seat need flight attendant to help set up 5. The “chicken rice” meal I had was inedible. The meat was hard and dry. I guessed it’s because of being reheated too many time
label: negative

text: The have redeemed themselves My last review was less than flattering because of the bad flight attendant experience I had on the flight from Singapore to Newark. This time the staff redeemed themselves in a very good way. The service was so much better and the staff on this flight was highly trained. The crew worked like clockwork and I was never thirsty or hungry. The attendants were all very polite and experienced. I spoke with the male attendant before alighting and he was very good. Singapore airlines, PLEASE keep these kind of crew on this flight and I will continue to purchase this route and even spend more for business class.
label: positive

text: Very Good Service Travel was with change over in Singapore. Staff were friendly and helpful to my wife as she needs a wheelchair to get to and from the airplane. Never had a problem with Singapore Airlines. I consider the food they provide on the inflight menu to be bland and boring so always use Book the Cook to order something different. The entertainment provided did not offer much to suit our tastes. Notwithstanding those minor points always happy to recommend this airline.
label: positive

text: A five-star airline? Not exactly The expectations for a five-star airline are always high and this review reflects our high expectations vs the reality we experienced on our recent flights BOM-SIN-BKK: THE PROS 1 Cabin crew: highly motivated & upbeat. Excellent ambassadors of SIA. THE CONS 1 Aircraft B777W: a noisy aircraft (when sitting next to the engine, 18 A). Avoid! 2 Seat: if you love sitting in an angled position during take-off and landing, go for it! The captain switched off the seatbelt sign 45 min into the flight due to heavy rains in India and 30 min before landing, a back ache as a result. The bed is comfortable, though, managed some 1-hour sleep on the flight. 3 Meal: didn't book the cook. Very spicy ex-Mumbai. When flying a five-star airline and spending a small fortune after Covid-19 for the flights, the expectations are really high. Those were not met by SIA, unfortunately, partly due to the poor transit experience at Changi Airport (i.e. T2 under renovation, T2 lounge poor). SIA seems to be OK the air, but poor on the ground at present (T2 in particular). Five star? No, not at all. The cabin crew are absolutely great; the rest of the product leaves a lot to be desired (at T2 at least).
label: neutral

text: Singapore Airlines maintained its excellent standard on this 5-hour flight. A pillow and blanket were available on the seat when we boarded. The cabin was clean and despite the flight being nearly full, it was still a very good experience. Furthermore, the legroom of the seat was excellent and the seat was very comfortable. The tray table was wide and sturdy, and there was sufficient storage with a nice pocket for my phone and nice pouches for me to put things in. There was a wide selection of movies available as well. The cabin crew were as usual, excellent and provided great service. A meal service was provided for this red-eye flight, and my Chicken meal was good. Despite being delayed on departure, we arrived in Shanghai on time. SIA’s newest product on the 787 is indeed very well designed and the flight was very good overall.
label: positive

text: I am a Kris Flyer "Silver Elite" member and I have recently travelled the Suites from Hong Kong to Singapore. I enjoyed every moment of the flight. A nice glass of bubbles (Dom Perignon) was offered before take off. The cabin crews were very attentive and helpful on every aspect of my flight. The food was more than adequate for me. A nice touch when a head cabin service officer apologized to me about the delay when the flight took off behind schedule from HKG was due to late arrival to HKG from Singapore. I'll recommend this airline.
label: positive

text: Kuala Lumpur to Cape Town via Singapore. As usual, they are famous of their top notch quality, service, and efficiency. Crews were very attentive and helpful. Upon boarding the aircraft, you could already feel their warmth hospitality. Food is good and IFE is fantastic. Cabin crew go around with drinks and snacks in the mid of flight very frequent (every 20 mins) which is hardly seen on the other major airlines. It's definitely worth it for the price I pay for. I will choose to fly with SIA again.
label: positive

text: First Class not really worth the money It isn obviously a 'first world problem', but I was disappointed with the standard of Singapore's 1st class - it was very similar to Business Class in other airlines such as Emirates. The seats were ok, but relatively narrow. While there were privacy screens, you were still very much 'exposed' to people walking by. The work space was quite awkward. Overall it was pleasant, but I would not have spent the money upgrading from business if I had known that it was so much 'lesser' than other airlines.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines is on Top of their game when it comes to customer service & comport Everytime i Fly with Singapore Airlines i get wowed with their service , seats for comfortable , Entertainment is on point , well experienced staff , great food selection , Ecomomy class is so good no need to Fly business class.
label: positive

text: Deterioration of service and food quality and, surprisingly cabin crew a bit rude I have been flying Singapore Airlines for past 15 years and in my recent travel I noticed that its cabin crew professionalism and food quality have certainly deteriorated. I was travelling economy class, the cabin crew banged the food trolley against my knee but did not stop to apologize. It was a safety issue more than a behavioral issue and i assume that the crew was not trained enough to handle the in flight drinks trolley. One of the crew member came across rude, maybe she was having a bad day. I found rubbish not cleaned from previous flight which was brought to the notice of the cabin crew. On the positive side, boarding was well coordinated and flight schedule was on time.
label: neutral

text: Poor service, no refund for seats re-allocation Singapore Air was good years ago, not anymore. We bought tickets with prepaid seats. A month before flying Singapore Air changed our seats without paying a refund. It is unclear what we paid for if seats can be changed by Singapore Air without giving our money back. Service was very average. We will avoid flying with Singapore Air in future.
label: negative

text: Not what I expected Everyone told us Singapore airlines were first class ?!? Flight out not to bad but constantly had to ask for water/ any drinks . Food seems rushed . In flight entrainment good ... Now flight back from Singapore ! The airline booked our seat at no extra charge , however it seems all the children/babies had been booked in at the back of the plane also , was a night flight so not much sleeping done . First meal served noddles and chicken , which still had the skin on and not good quality . Breakfast was served about an hour before landing and again rushed , noodles again or omelette , asked for the second but told not sure if enough after giving me mine my husband was told because he had omelete that meant one of the cabin crew wouldn’t eat !! Yet cabin crew were still giving the choice to people around us , not the service I expected , and wouldn’t choose Singapore air lines as my first choice next time I fly .
label: neutral

text: Two trouble free flights to Auckland We were off to visit our son and grandson in New Zealand and chose to go via Singapore stopping for a couple of nights before flying on to Auckland. The booking in and luggage drop at Heathrow was quick and simple with no queues to speak of, also boarding was organised and easy. The crew on the plane were as friendly and helpful as normal and the food was better then expected for economy class. The A380 seemed to be new and comfortable. Our short stay in Singapore was very good but when i went to book in for the flight to Auckland I hit a problem in that NZ immagration said my visa was not valid and so I went to the Singapore Airline and a young lady there got it sorted speaking to NZ immagration to find the problem then got it sorted so I could fly and I can't speak to highly of the service she gave us. Our 2nd flight from Singapore to Auckland was not so good with a much older A380 plane and the food not to our tastes but the service was as good as ever.
label: positive

text: The Flight Crew on all legs of our recent travel with Singapore Airlines were exceptional. My husband and I completed 4 legs with Singapore Airlines in October and November. The service from checking in to getting off can not be faulted. One small glitch on the final leg to Brisbane from Singapore. Being in Premium Economy we found it surprising that they were out of a particular meal and the ice-cream when they came to us. As I say, it can be the little things and these certainly were small in the overall experience. Service, attentiveness throughout the whole trip, top shelf. Assistance getting overhead bags organised etc. Best thing - another small thing however in the air for 14 hours also a big thing. The loos were constantly cleaned and freshened. Just lovely!
label: positive

text: Pleasant flying Very good cabin staff plenty of fluids all through the flight,meals better quality than most airlines.Economy seats satisfactory, looked at the premium economy seats but not worth the extra money.
label: positive

text: Recommendable First time flew in Premium Economy, quite interesting, good service, only two Toilets by PE always occupied due to used by PABS from Economy, should change. if some one has stomach problem, then he has a real problem. Flight was smooth and on time, Nothing to complain about, Price quite reasonable,
label: positive

text: As good as we hoped they would be Does economy get any better than this? Excellent modern plane, a brilliant selection of IFE and plenty to eat. Ok it's food from a plane "microwave" in a little plastic carton, but you have to be realistic about what you will get! Our plane was delayed and we missed out connection, but they were brilliant at rebooking us. They brought our young son's meal before starting the main meal service, but were kind enough to bring his older brother's early too.
label: positive

text: Amazing service Best service I have ever had on an airline which is really really important if the flight is extra long - 17 hours!
label: positive

text: Munich to Singapore. Boarding was quick and efficient and the departure was on time. The crew were friendly and visible throughout the flight, a lunch was served a few hours after take-off with a hot breakfast delivered 2 hours before landing. Drinks were brought out every hour to ensure that people stayed hydrated. Plane was clean and so were the bathrooms at least when I used them. As usual a wide selection of entertainment was available. The A350 is a great plane to travel on and SQ has made sure there is plenty of legroom, the storage pockets are great for holding phones instead of having just one big pocket. Once again a really good flight.
label: positive

text: Singapore to London. Incredibly inept Admin. I spent time establishing parameters for which my elderly mother could get a seat close to the lavatory and after many calls direct to Singapore I had confirmation that the range of seats we would get was limited but acceptable. I got this in an email. At boarding, it became clear the layout for our flight was vastly different to that which had been shown previously. She was as far from the lavatory as she could be. Other passengers could not pass us in the aisle and the journey to the lavatory took 10 minutes with the turbulence we encountered. No aisle seats was available in Business class despite a prior agreement that one would be aboard. I may as well have not bothered dealing with the airline. That SIA failed to deliver on this flight and the ensuing return later, shows the customer what the airline think of even their Business Class passengers - absolutely nothing. There is little their superb in-flight service did to improve the bitter resentment on my part. I expected much better after the initial discussions, I got contempt.
label: negative

text: trip to singapore very helpful cabin crews and keeping right time or early landing easy baggage facilities and comfortable fly
label: positive

text: Very Good, but perhaps not as good as expected We had very high expectations about going business on Singapore Airlines on a long distance flight. Having read reviews about service etc. Outbound we were on a 777-300 which had very good seats with good storage space for "things". Return was on a A380 that was nearly empty and 4.5 hours delayed due to problems with a generator on one of the engines. Seats were very wide with plenty of space (Old business class seats ?) but there was really lack of storage space for books, glasses etc. Foot was very good as one should expect on a business class flight. Vine selection good. Return flight being a day-flight was kept with windows close during all flight. Not sure why. We arrived at Heathrow early evening so keeping it dark did not in my case help on my jet-lag.
label: positive

text: Airline Punctuality Departure & arrival time were puncture. Service was decent and Meal was good. Check-in was a breeze because we reach the airport early about 2 1/2 hrs ahead of fight schedule.
label: positive

text: Excellent Airline This was the first time we used Singapore Airlines and it was superb! The excellent service started when I contacted them and they booked all my flights, incl stopover in Singapore with no hassle. Check in staff, cabin crew, food, cleanliness were all great. What a good experience!
label: positive

text: Singapore Air is the best for Special Care Children !! Flying with Singapore Air from Istanbul to Singapore and then Surabaya and back to Istanbul was fabulous! Particularly with the professional approach and care of Ms. Zulfiye Keles from Singapore Air-Istanbul , she organized all details for our special son with wheelchair; as get in-out of airplane, seat(cannot sit-posture problems), food(cannot chew/feeding problems), and all for my son’s needs that she took care of our son was wonderful. We are very thankful to Ms. Keles and all Singapore Air team. We had great service on airplane for our son’s special needs. All the people from check in to gate people and flight attendants were great and helpful; made us all feel safe and comfortable. We will fly again with Singapore Air in 6 months everything works out wonderfully. Happy we chose Singapore Air. Thank you very much.
label: positive

text: Quite comfortable flight for 10 hours Movies quite updated and also food was great. The plane appeared to be a quite new so its comfy too.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines is slowly losing it on their long-haul business class compared to other Middle Eastern airlines. I used to love this seat 7 years ago when they launched it however today it doesn't measure up to its competition. Especially given the price. You always tend to sit sideways which is discomforting after a while especially on this long-haul flight from Singapore to LA via Tokyo on the A380. This must have been one of their oldest A380's for the seat was tattered and basically a lot of wear-and-tear was evident in the cabin and lavatories. Moreover the IFE didn't work in my seat which was very annoying on this long flight. They tried to fix it onboard as well as during the Tokyo layover with no success. Since the flight was full I couldn't change seats. The food though was outstanding.
label: negative

text: Singapore to Melbourne Service on the aircraft is fine .Lovely to travel during the day as opposed to the overnight flight to Adelaide.
label: positive

text: Good service but place needs upgrade SQ917 on 12 April 2019 Service is always good. Food is good too. But this plane is too old. Tray table to loose, seat cushion is flat and stained, remote not working well. Overall flight was smooth but delayed for an hour. Waited in the plane for 1.5 hours before taking off.
label: neutral

text: SQ185 SGN to SIN Kudos to the crew Flight was in the new Boeing 787, enough leg room and comfortable seats. Special shout out to the crew for the 22 Oct flight, who had to rush through the food service due to a pause in service due to bad weather (and of course the pilot for looking out for the crew). Patient and professional and with a smile.
label: positive

text: More training for your staffs please. Travelled with my family to NZ for our holiday last November. The trip to NZ was fine, its the trip back that made us question if we should ever consider flying Singapore airline again. Recently flying SQ we faced the issue of the meal times were always late. This round the meal time was delayed for more than 1 hour, and when the flight attendant was distributing the snacks, I asked if they can spare one more sandwich for my young child, The attendant had turned me down and said they do not have enough food for everyone. For normal circumstances I can be more understanding, however during the whole flight I witnessed the passengers (a family of 3 - parents and a teenager) seated in front of me had been requesting snacks and drink non-stop. If you are worried that you do not have enough food for all, why ain't your staffs trained to turn down the request from passengers that had been requesting food non-stop? And it was my 1st request for an extra sandwich for my young child, and it was due to your delay in meal time. At the end I had to tell my crying child that the airline does not have enough food. As a well know airline, shouldn't you planned and stocked enough food for all? And the attitude from the flight attendants were very bad.
label: negative

text: Disappointing checkin and boarding VERY different experience ftom we last travelled with Singapore a few years ago. Appallingly slow procedures, insufficient, inexperienced staff. Hoping in flight service will be as remembered!
label: neutral

text: Best flight and service, ever!!!! The Check-in service is spot on and very professional and staff are well trained. On board the new A350 aircraft and you are greeted with sheer luxury. The Singapore girl greets you with a smile as you are directed to your seat. This followed by a lovely breakfast. The seats are very comfortable with good leg-room. The in-flight entertainment is top notch.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines are no longer the benchmark. There are a handful of airlines operating international flights out of Adelaide including Qantas, Emirates, Singapore, Cathay etc. For many international travellers the arrival of Emirates initally challanged the others and they still do. Using Emirates as the benchmark Singapore runs a poor second or even third. First there is no complimentary home to airport transfer for Business Class passengers, a very crowded and air-less lounge, no complimentary toiletries (other than some disposable toothbrushes in the aircraft toilets), new and very narrow seats that convert to cramped beds and although I didn't actually measure it, less leg room. The menu choices are more limited and quite disappointing, the entertainment system less extensive. The connection times out of Changi are extraordinarliy long (from my experience almost 8 hours for a connection to Barcelona and 7 plus hours for a Tokyo connection) and the Business Class lounge in Changi is not the most pleasant place the spent half a day. All that being said it counted for nothing after I experienced Lisbon to Frankfurt (Bus Class) with Lufthansa; but that is whole other dirty plane and substandard story.
label: neutral

text: Best of Business Singapore Airways are fantastic the service in discrete and extremely polite. The book the cook service is great the food, and there plenty of it, is fresh and tasty.
label: positive

text: Business meeting in Bangkok Took early morning flight to Bangkok for business meeting. Flight was smooth and on time. Inflight services was good and friendly. Landing was soft and gentle.
label: positive

text: Your Home in the Air Best service with excellent comfort. provide A380 which is really great for traveller like me who is extremely scared of turbulence. Long hour flight almost 6 but comfortable.
label: positive

text: Inconsistent Having flown Singapore Airlines economy class on both regional and intercontinental, and finding the intercontinental sectors superior to other airlines, this is my first time on regional business class. It is a disappointment. At the very least, I would expect any of its products, regional business class included, to be above the average. But I was really disappointed. First, the A330 aircraft is really tired and has to be retired. The cabin looks really old. The seat was awkward and uncomfortable. Only a few channels of music were working, though there were many more video channels. Staff, especially the female cabin crew, were very efficient and incredibly well groomed, but they were very stern and robotic, and gave out a sense of aggressiveness, making them seem unfriendly and curt. The worse part was the food. I can't begin to say how bad it was -- I had booked in advance the lotus leaf fried rice. It was so dry and totally lacking in any taste or texture -- in other words inedible. The dessert of Oriental nuts jelly was also inedible, and so was the fruit bowl, consisting among other things of a large piece of rock-hard green apple. I ended up just drinking the champagne and wines, which were quite good. I had to ask for some other food, and all they could give me was some insipid biscuits from economy class. As for the lounge at Bangkok airport, it was good, well lit, and had enough variety of food and beverages. I will go on to review the return trip, as it was very different. It was the opposite – the flagship lounge was incredibly lousy while the flight hardware was very good. Upon entering the Singapore airport Terminal 2 lounge, my first thought was -- is this for real? Small, dark, dim, depressing. Food consisted of only a few varieties of depressing local stuff. I then decided to check out the Terminal 3 lounge. It is many times bigger and at least had a little natural light, but the facilities and consumables were equally miserable. Singapore Airlines' flagship lounge at Terminal with intercontinental flights, and not a single decent Western item, but only some lame street-food items? Am I in the wrong country? Isn't this the international city-state par excellence? The return flight was much much better – on a new B787 with very private seating and a beautiful large screen controllable by touch. Book the Cook was available (not available from Bangkok) and fortunately I made use of it, for the standard items looked miserable. Singapore Airlines has to do something better for their food. The hardware is inconsistent. While Singapore does a good job for long-haul economy, I would rather choose Cathay, Thai or Malaysia for business, for their flagship lounges are much better and the cabin service more genuine and warm.
label: neutral

text: One of the best We had a good flight even though we were coming home. Free Singapore slings was great, food options were good. And the staff were friendly. It was our first time flying with Singapore airlines and it won't be our last!
label: positive

text: Great experience Been travelling with this airlines few times, and it's services is always great. Staffs are always helpfull and they are very kind to my mom who needs wheelchair assistant. When we need cabin wheelchair but they don't have any on board at the time, the staff were very patient in helping my mom walking slowly to the door and they always smile!
label: positive

text: Enjoyable Normally we would fly Thai Air to Bangkok, but this time we decided to try Singapore Airlines. Although it wasn't a direct flight, it was still very pleasant and enjoyable experience. Even the few hours stopover at Changi airport was nice as it is very user friendly airport.
label: positive

text: Excellent Flew for the first with Singapore Airlines from Sydney to Singapore for a stopover before our European holiday, then with them to Frankfurt and return Paris to Singapore then Sydney, so spent quite sometime with this airline and found everything was excellent. Everything is well organised and so things run well. Very pleasant, so much food just evrything was wonderful. Also one of the best take off and landing i have experienced so smooth. Highly recommend flying with Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: STILL GREAT First time business class found it fantastic,. Service and food on board very good. Also the Kris Flyer lounges had great food and a good place to rest before flying.
label: positive

text: Awesome service Big thanks to the ground staff at the SQ check-in counter this morning. Apologies can’t remember their full names - but a very pleasant and professional team of two. Mr P and Ms T processed our check-in (SQ 725) with special attentiveness, warmth and friendliness….what refreshingly joyful service! Thank you for the surprise upgrade too!
label: positive

text: I flew from Amsterdam - Singapore - Singapore - Perth. The first leg was probably the best long haul flight I've been on. Service was excellent with drinks served regularly along with snacks and the meals where pretty good. The seat was really comfortable and plenty of leg room (I thought I was in Business class with the amount of leg room).
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Amazing Experience, Attentive Cabin Crew, Lots of Freebie Offerings inflight, direct connection and perfect timing makes this my favourite airline to Singapore, Indonesia and Malaysia
label: positive

text: No complaints Good airline. Plane was not as new as AirNZ planes, but service was good and it was on time. It was a code-shared flight and as a result I didnt get my AirNZ points which is disappointing. Just be aware of this if you are an AirNZ points customer. I complained to AIrNZ about this, since its really their issue.
label: positive

text: My husband and I were very impressed with Singapore Airlines. The cabin crew were polite professional and attentive during the flight. I was impressed with how they kept the bathrooms clean during the flight always with a smile on their faces. The food was very good - we were in economy plus and very impressed with all meals. While the uniforms are beautiful I did wonder how they would perform in any emergency of vacating the plane. We would definitely fly Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Comfortable travel First time flying Airbus A380. Very nice flight. As always good service from the staff. Good food also. In my seat, the entertainment system was not so good.
label: positive

text: Comfy seats, great service for flight Australia to Singapore Always a good option for longer flights. Seats way more comfortable than other budget Airlines and food also far better. Staff are friendly, and service is excellent.
label: positive

text: THE best way to travel to the USA from MANCHESTER end of story !!! I was blown away by the Aircraft the A350, It was fabulous The attendants and service levels where Fantastic What a way to travel to the USA Lots of legroom and Im 6ft 5 inches !0 inch seat back entertainment system Beautiful helpful crew And were always on view somewhere on the flight Top class food....what else ! They just dont seem to still have any onward connections with the Alliance that they are in the USA, which is Poor as it could make them even more money and have more customers travelling with them But still a fabulous airline to fly with
label: positive

text: Singapore to San Francisco. The A350 seats were somewhat closer than the Boeing 777. The seats has the length but does not appear to be as wide. The toilet is very cool with state of the art flushing etc. Normally I am able to sleep well on board but maybe because it is a day flight I suffered from jet lag later in the week. Crew was excellent and attentive to our needs and there were loads of request for food by my fellow passengers.
label: positive

text: Long, long, but okay Return flights from Brisbane to Singapore/Singapore to London were as expected in economy. I always book aisle seats as I am tall and have long legs. The two shorter trips (BNE-SIN and back) were uncomfortable because of the legroom, but the longer legs (ha!) were better. Food acceptable, staff attentive and helpful. I moved seats at one stage as the next door passenger was 'manspreading' and I couldn't even plug in the headset. When I moved I reclined the seat and was treated to a spray by the woman behind me. No, she wasn't eating, it was dark and the lights were dimmed!
label: neutral

text: Dhaka to Shanghai via Singapore. It's my 2nd time fly to Singapore airline. Excellent service. Ground staff are helpful and polite. Cabin crew are very professional and trying their best give service to pessenger. Food choice is really great but wifi is too expensive. Onboard entertainment have many choice.
label: positive

text: Not as good as we thought We flew with Singapore Airlines to Australia in November from Manchester we were looking forward to the flight as we had read some good comments we have flown with many different Airlines over the years I thought that Singapore Airlines would be great we were sat in Rose 48 and the window seat was classed as an extra legroom seat there were two seats in front of us which we're also extra legroom I can honestly say that I would not be happy if I had paid for the extra legroom seat by the window the gentleman sat there was very tall and he looks really cramped and to get out of the seat you have to walk forward the passenger in front did not like this and ask the passenger beside as to not disturb him when getting up and asked if he could go pass myself and my husband this was impossible as there is no way you can walk through so the gentleman had to climb over the seat to get it back into his own seat be aware if you book row 48 and book the extra legroom seats. The food on the flight was nice but unfortunately my husband ordered a drink with his meal he ordered a beer 3 hours into the flight he asked if he could have another beer he was then told that sorry we have run out of beer this is shocking as we were only 3 hours into a 12 our flight and on the way back from Singapore to Manchester my husband did not have a meal as he was driving and wanted to get some sleep then they came round with the breakfast just before we landed by the time they got to us and several passengers behind us they have run out of breakfast and could only offer a beef noodle and did not have any alternative meals to offer anyone so my Husband did not have anything I ask for an extra bread roll this was my breakfast. During both flights I felt that the attendance did not come round as often as they do on any other fly we have been on and for most of the flight going out we were in darkness bearing in mind our flight left England at 12 lunchtime.
label: neutral

text: ALWAYS HELPFUL From the minute you step on the plane you are made feel welcome & special. I required a wheelchair for this trip & the staff kept me informed of what would happen. I was one of the first on board & last off due to time factors & ensuring no-one else was affected. The service during the trip was fabulous and the meals were well presented & very tasty & were over adequate for anyone.
label: positive

text: Worst website ever. Bad business practice of bumping ticketed passengers to less desirable flight routing. Ticketed on direct SFO to Sin for almost 9 months. Then they changed me to a SFO - HKG - SIN that leaves on the next morning simply because they can sell my ticket to another for higher price. They must be investigated and fined for this bad business practice. Unreliable, undependable, crooked. That is Singapore airlines.
label: negative

text: Fabulous flight on Singapour from Kolkata, India to LA, Calif. Another fabulous flight with Singapour Air. Why don’t American Airlines take notes, here? The food was wonderful, the seat became a flat bed with wonderful fluffy blanket, The wine was French and the service was efficiently kind. And, the stewards and stewardesses are polite, very pretty and slim. It was a delightful experience but very long flight back to the US and Singapour Air made it doable. Love this airline.
label: positive

text: Taipei to Singapore, and a fantastic flight, well organised boarding led to early departure. Crew friendly and attentive. Quick response to requests with lovely smiles. Great inflight entertainment with large TV and movie/music selections. Meal was tasty (had the black paper beef, veggies, fry rice). Plenty of seating space.
label: positive

text: Flew today 5th April 2022 on the 1500 flight and the cabin crew were more than fantastic! They were very kind, helpful and caring. I would definitely travel with them again as this was one of the best experiences I've had. Well done SQ and keep up the good work!
label: positive

text: Cabin crew is excellent We've learned not to expect too much when flying economy, i.e. cramped seats. However, the crew on our flight made extra effort to make our experience as pleasant as it could be on such a long flight. They even found a meal my wife wanted when they had run out of her selection. Happy wife, happy life. Food service included a mixture of oriental and western type dishes. Most was good for airline food. Wine for meals was included. We sat in bulkhead seats which provided plenty of legroom but weren't as convenient when it comes to using the entertainment system or having a place to put your things - phone, book etc. The entertainment system worked well and had an excellent selection of movies, TV shows, music, games. The only thing missing in the bulkhead row was a USB port to charge my phone but was able to run my charging cable to the row behind me. If you fly economy this is one of the best airlines I have flown.
label: positive

text: Great crew and Aircraft, Poor food The service and the seat in Business on Singapore airlines was as good or better than most airlines. However, despite a large range of options, either through the normal in flight menu and 'Book the Cook' options, leaving Brisbane at 9:40am seems to have flustered Singapore Airlines and their menu makers. It is a brunch flight, (you are eating at 10:30am), not dinner or even lunch but the options provided were Dinner or Lunch. Ironically they offered cereal followed by steak and scrambled eggs. Or if you wish, an Asian choice. The same problem exists leaving Singapore early in the morning.
label: positive

text: Singapore A In my recent travels to Asia I've found Singapore Airlines to be the best.Their very friendly welcome greeting lasts the entire trip.Given a warm towel to freshen up was a nice touch.
label: positive

text: Da Nang to Perth via Singapore. Had to bring my flights home forward by 2 days due to border shutdowns and Government advice re corona virus. Charged me an extra $520AUD to do so despite having a far longer layover in Singapore. Claim that there is no rebooking charge, but there was a fare difference.
label: negative

text: What has happened to SQ. I believe since COVID they have embarked on a wide ranging cost cutting exercise focusing on charging as much as they can for flights while skimping on what they offer customers. It starts with the lounge which resembles a crowded bus station where you need to search for a seat. Bring back the old lounges! On the flights there are no hot towels. No newspapers. No nuts before dinner. No amenity kits. No mattresses. Food is mediocre. The only thing that hasn’t changed is the first class cabin crew. I have been a flyer with SQ for over 25 years and have never known it so bad.
label: negative

text: Always reliable and comfortable I can always count on SQ for a safe and efficient flight. In-flight food wasn't great though. Kris Flyer programmes were diverse and up-to-date; managed to catch movies like Captain Marvel, Bohemian Rhapsody etc.
label: positive

text: As Always Singapore Airlines deliver excellent service. Checking in was easy as staff were obliging, managed to change seat allocation for the second leg with Singapore Airline Singapore to Frankfurt to extra leg room. Flight itself was pleasant. Cabin crew friendly and although I did not eat the food did look fine.
label: positive

text: First flight on a SQ Dreamliner I recently had a short flight on Singapore Airlines to Bangkok, a flight that utilised a B787 Dreamliner.
