The check-in process was easy and straightforward, with the automated luggage belts working much more efficiently than when I last used them. Boarding was smooth even though the flight was at least 80% full. I was actually most eager on this flight to check out the plane's windows. Designed to dim or lighten at the press of a button, the windows have not attached sliding shades. Furthermore, the Dreamliner's windows are some of the largest, if not the largest, in the business, allowing for an improved view outside the plane. Unfortunately, as the flight was in the early evening, testing of the automatic dimmers had to be shelved. The airline's Krisworld IFE was excellent with a super-extensive range of movies, shows, music and games as usual. If anything, perhaps the only thing missing is a camera mounted outside the plane to allow for a different view during take-off, landing and in flight. Food options were decent although I tend to find that the mains offered in economy somewhat dull, which turned out to be the case again although I was plesantly surprised that the meal came with brown rice, a healthier option compared to white rice. Service standards were also definitely very good. Overall, a good flight where everything worked although it will need another, preferably longer flight, to decide if the Dreamliner's my kind of aircraft.
label: positive

text: Amazing We had a nightmare trip due to my husband's eardrum perforating half an hour into the flight, the aircrew was stunning, caring, helpful and attentive during the flight to Singapore - arranged medical assistance, I can't say enough about them, will definitely be flying with Singapore air again.
label: positive

text: Ok Flight A Very long flight approximately 23 hours total. The flight attendants were friendly and polite. The food was acceptable for airline food. Would fly with them again
label: positive

text: Another great flight with Singapore airlines As always we had a great flight with Singapore airlines, must be top airline. Service and friendliness of staff could not be better. Looking forward to next time we fly to SE Asia as will be with this airline.
label: positive

text: Standard dropped so much! Took from trf/cph/sin&return. It has been years since i flew with SQ (since the early 2000s) so I tot ok give them a chance although their prices are pretty high compared to other airlines like KLM or Finnair or BA cos as a citizen we always support our national carrier. Back then the services were very good but now it's really dropped so so much! See below.. -Preflight- The booking online did not confirm meals for children upon booking only that we will have to arrange it again come 2 weeks prior to departure. (WELL KLM on the other hand automatically register a child seat =a child meal) Then a month or 2 before I fly i received an email saying they hv changed the departure time and that is not good as we had to make arrangements again to ensure our connecting trip timings fits etc. And they said in the mail that we will need to click to agree with the changes as otherwise we will be kicked off the flight and no refunds will be entertained! Well left us with no choice right??! -1st leg of flight(oslo/cph)- Bear in mind cos it's code share, they partner with SAS or wideroe from the leg trf/cph. Sas do not serve snacks nor drinks but on wideroe they serve just beverage. And wideroe&sas planes have smaller overhead compartments so your hand luggage need to comply with their measurements instead of SQ's. But as compared to klm, klm's plames can accommodate bigger hand luggages as their overhead compartments are bigger and they do serve a sandwich/snack+beverage. And SQ's fare is usually more expensive than klm's. -2nd leg of flight (cph-sin) Actual flight was just normal. I like it that they hv 'milo' on request on board. But my husband noticed that the stewardess mostly didn't really know their products on hand and have to always go ask her seniors back in the gallery whenever. So this was some wasted time waiting for a simple question. Example I asked if I can have a silver sling drink but she was unsure and had to ask her senior and had to walk to and fro many times again when my husband asked if he can hv some certain hard liquor. And the amount of hard liquor they offer in the cup is much lesser than what klm offers. And they will take a note (really writing down) of that which seat passenger has already got their liquor. And comes mealtime my children were offered just adult meals and when i enquired they said i had to book a child meal in advanced. I was dumpfolded..klm or either finnair do let u choose when u book the tickets online. But the stewardess was nice though. -sin/cph- Return flight was almost the same service again but this time I encountered a rude steward who is very grumpy. As my children got their meals first than adults, they have finished eating (as it's a night flight they didn't eat much) while he was serving me my meals and I requested him to remove my children's meal tray away and he said he is serving still. But I insisted that he remove it else I do not have the space to eat and settle down my children at the same time. He relented but very apparently annoyed as he just took the tray from me and walked all the way back to the gallery. Is this service?? -others- The children activity kit that SQ gives out now is pathetic. Just some random not good quality colouring set with very very thin tracing paper.. Klm on the other hand gave out a comprehensive children activity set which included child eye shade, klm colouring pencils/cardboard print, tic tac toe games, card game set, amongst other things I forgotten in a felt bag.
label: negative

text: Good service when asked for. This is a relatively short flight so was not expecting that much service. But what we got was OK, obviously with all the problems with Covid-19 the crew wore masks and you had to ask for things perhaps more so than you would expect. But overall was a decent flight.
label: positive

text: Excellent Absolutely amazing to travel with. I have a severe nut allergy and singapore airlines was the only company that happily provided me with nut free meals and snacks. The staff were kind and attentive and made me feel very comfortable. There was a huge range of activities to do inboard such as games, music, TV shows and movies. Would 100% travel with them again.
label: positive

text: Sensational Service ⭐️ The Singapore airlines service we experienced was exceptional on our recent trip from Brisbane Australia to the Maldives. I will find it hard to fly any other airline after our experience. Normally we go business but decided to break flight up and stay a night in Singapore & checked our bags through to Male ! Best thing was to fly through the day & get a good sleep then head off following morning - we landed in Male refreshed ready for our Island adventures !! Flying on the afternoon flight with great headsets and exit row and fab movies with a stop over @ the Crown attached to the airport in Singapore was just the best and I have to say the biggest thank you all the air hostesses and especially to - FSS Ismar Nurlinda Binte Omar (Linda ) on SQ 431 MLE- SIN on 30/08/23 who went above and beyond giving us business class care in our economy seats!! ♥️🙏🏼
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines, Worst airline ever Had the most horrific dealings with Singapore airlines check in manager at Changi airport, firstly my wife is registered as disabled and my wife and i are both in our 60's. We booked extra legroom seats because of my wife's disability and returned from Singapore to London Heathrow on flight SQ306 on Monday 29th May 2023, we had a really upsetting and stressful experience after we boarded the flight, this was also witnessed by the cabin crew who have submitted a separate report by leading steward Benjamin Khoo. The problem was caused by the boarding gate manager in Singapore, we boarded at gate 9. The first issue was that the seats we had booked were 31A and 31C in premium economy were emergency exit seats and we were told that we would have to be moved because of my wife's mobility issues, this was fine and we were allocated seats 32H and 32K, we were taken to the gate (my wife in a wheelchair) and boarded with no issues and got settled into our seats for the long 13 hour flight home. Obviously the people who were originally in the seats that we moved to were offered the free upgrade for the extra legroom seats we had originally booked, this is where the problems started. One of the passengers ( a male in his late 20's early 30's )who was moved was not happy with the free upgrade and there was obviously a lot of discussions taking place which we could witness from where we were seated but did not know the content of, eventually the check in manager entered the plane ( the same man who gave us our new seats ) and after a few minutes of talking to the man in his 20's / 30's came over to where we were now settled and said that the man was not happy with his new upgraded seat and wanted his original seat back, he ordered us to move to seats 33F and 33G which were middle aisle seats, i told the manager that my wife needed to get up and move around to stop her seizing up, but he was not interested and said move or he would have us escorted from the plane, he was extremely rude and arrogant and was not interested in my wife's disability and the pain it then caused her to move again, he was more interested in letting a fit and able young man have his original seat back. this exchange was witnessed by multiple passengers and crew, the lady who was moved with this young man was not happy either and would have been happy to stay in her upgraded extra legroom seat, if this is the quality of management that Singapore airlines wish to employ we will never travel with Singapore airlines again, this man has single handily destroyed my faith in Singapore airlines. The stewards on the plane were very sorry for what they had witnessed and truly did all they could to try to make up for what had happened but ultimately this check in manager represents the whole of Singapore airlines and this individual had no concern or care for my wife's disability, my wife was extremely upset and we both felt stressed and anxious by this extremely unpleasant experience and would like to think that some form of action be taken against the manager that caused this issue. I emailed Singapore airlines on our return and received a reply which blamed the crew on the plane, i replied telling them the facts again but received no reply, i have tried contacting Singapore airlines a few times and have given them plenty of time to reply but now is the time to tell the world just how Singapore airlines deal with disabled passengers. Finally, i was promised a refund for the upgraded seats we had paid for but have still not received anything, my next email will be to the AviationADR as Singapore airlines clearly do not care about disabled passengers
label: negative

text: Singapore airline- Italy Discovery Tour We went to Italy on a small group tour with airfare included. The fact that my husband was recovering from a knee replacement prompted us to upgrade to Permium Economy. Checking in was a breeze and we boarded just after Business Class. Staff were welcoming and friendly. Shown to our seat quickly water bottles waiting. More legroom definitely and wider seats. Bigger tv screens and better recliner seats. Just slightly more than standard economy’s. The service was great and the food was good. Disembarking was easy and quick. Our bags were amongst the first out! Overall a very enjoyable flight. Thanks Singapore Airline
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines remains my favourite. My husband and I flew business class from Heathrow to Singapore. From the extremely efficient check-in to the excellent lounge the preboardi g was perfect. The business class seats are the best I have ever experienced with much more personal space. The service and food were very Good.
label: positive

text: Excellent Airline Great service by friendly, courteous staff, both at check in desk and on board. Good food, and proper cutlery! Grateful thanks to our stewardess who rendered first aid to my injured elbow and checked it with me several times during the flight.
label: positive

text: New 787-10 with refreshed Krisworld and good inflight service Flight was on the new 787-10. Seats width and leg room were adequate for a 1.8m traveller. Red-eye flight that had breakfast service before arriving in Fukuoka. Service is typical SQ, which means it is more than decent and competent. New revised KrisWorld entertainment system is top-notch, both in physical hardware setup and entertainment selection. Excellent!.
label: positive

text: Very good service as usual As always seats enabled me to get some 7 hours sleep. Very smooth flight. Used 'Book the Cook' to preselect my meal. Although the movies choice is now limited found a good movie. All in all a good flight with good service that one expects from Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: Having flown with a few middle east carriers throughout this route, definitely I was putting a high expectations from this SQ flight. Got the best price compare with another middle eastern carriers with extra 300 AED for extra 5kgs checked in luggage. The check in process was smooth and I was lucky enough to get upgraded to premium eco seat from SIN to CGK. The DXB to SIN flight was really bumpy, but the crew was really courteous and helpful throughout the flight. The food was definitely better than the middle eastern carriers and also free wifi was a nice touch comparing to any other airlines. The service was feel more special on SIN to CGK sector though it was a very short flight. Definitely will choose this again (if the price is right, compare to middle eastern carriers). Good job SQ.
label: positive

text: poor service My first flight with SQ after 4 years due to Covid. I am really disappointed with the food. The taste is bad and there was no fruit. Breakfast was not served either. There were also no toys and games provided for children anymore. If this is the standard SIA is maintaining, I will reconsider flying with them in future
label: neutral

text: SQ 978 Biz on Airbus 330. This is a short-haul flight from SIN-BKK. Comfortable seat that lay fully flat. I had a meal of chewy roasted pork. Service from FAs were nice.
label: negative

text: Very happy We had a wonderful experience with Singapore Airlines. We travelled from Sydney to istanbul and returned back to Australia and we had a great experience with Singapore airline team. We have two young toddlers which was challenging to entertain them. The crew in SQ392 Steffanie,Paul,sadiq,yiwen,qing,Ashley and saqinah helped us to keep our toddlers busy and our travel enjoyable. We definitely recommend Singapore airlines.
label: positive

text: Mrs D Watkins Nobody book with this airline they are liars . They cancel flights and don’t tell you with devastating consequences. Don’t book with Scoot or Singapore airlines.
label: negative

text: Good premium economy This was our first experience with Singapore premium economy and it was quite good but still not as good as that with Air New Zealand. The food was good, the seats comfortable and the quality of the wine was good. What lets them down is the personal service. It's good but Air New Zealand seems much more personal and genually friendly.
label: positive

text: From boarding in Dusseldorf to reaching Changi, everything went smooth. We were greeted by professional well-presented crew. Upon reach my seat in Premium Economy I wanted to take photo of my seat, where a cabin crew delightfully approached if she can take a picture for me while sitting and said "it is great to have you on-board Sir and I would like to assure that your special meal is loaded". We left DUS in time. The service followed with hot towel, drinks and nuts and meals. Using book the cook service means getting your meal before your fellow passengers. The meal was okay and we were offered three choices of warm bread and big selection of fancy drinks. After meals, they served ice cream but missed on me, where a crew assured that they are not offering it to me since I am vegetarian and ice cream contains gelatine. Since it was a day flight, crew was actively anticipating needs and were very busy serving to a group of very demanding passengers in economy. This flight had dedicated crew for Premium Economy and they came around at least 3 times to assure if everything is fine. Many rounds of snacks in a basket and drinks on tray and crew looked enthusiastic, service minded and very friendly. We were made to feel like welcomed guests. I walked to see economy class, the crew were happy to chat about A350 product. The aircraft by itself is very quiet, quieter than B787 and toilets are spaciously planned and were kept clean. The air ventilation can be really felt and cabin design made me feel relaxed. The Captain announced turbulence, and crew walked through the cabin to ensure we have fastened seatbelts. Before landing, breakfast was served and immigration cards handed out. We landed in time and I left the aircraft as a happy passenger with a feeling that this was my best flight ever.
label: positive

text: Change of plan, Change of route ....... great new Experience Had missed my original the flight (Etihad airlines), but allowed me the experience for fly an alternative route via Singapore ..... there food and seating was great, and for a short person, i enjoyed the extra leg room (something taller persons will enjoy even more) was a real plus. Their staff from checking-in, boarding and flight attendants were great very attentive. Their local flight operators SILK were great. I really enjoyed my experience .......
label: positive

text: Couples Always fly sinapore airways we left perth no delays ever always fly threw night less stop over and arrive morning food good great movies get front seats or back rows and great service booked for xmas there ajoining flights are just as good they give you newspapers to read and food on even there 2hour flights been to hong kong ,cambodia chaing mai bangkok vietnam all with singapore airlines the best
label: positive

text: Last flight home of the holidays. Excellent service. This was our last leg of our flights home to Brisbane. We had a 12hr layover in Singapore Changai due to the connecting flight out JFK NY being 3hrs late and Singapore airlines rebooking us due to this. They emailed us the morning before the flight to let us know. Noy good having a 12hr layover but they did there best to get us a connecting flight which is good. The flight left a few minutes late as they didn't open the lounge / gate until 40mins before the flight and everyone had to be screened to get through to the gate. We got off about ten minutes late but this was made up in the flight so we landed on time. We were allocated seats 58A&B and were one of the last groups to board. It was a full flight but we still had some space for our bags above us in the overhead luggage bins. We had someone next to us so we couldn't spread out. The crew were excellent and served the meal after taking off. After the meal, the lights were dimmed and I then accessed the excellent inflight entertainment system and watched some movies on it. The staff were on the ball and were constantly bring water and juice around for the whole flight. The only downside to the flight were some inconsiderate people sitting in front of us and putting seats back when you were trying to eat. The crew were excellent and pulled them up on this. Some people just need to be more aware of what they are doing and respect other passengers. Overall, the flight was good with little turbulence only. I love flying Singapore airlines as the planes are clean and well serviced, the crew is fantastic, always polite and courteous and ensure the comfort of there guests. this was highlighted by the flight stewardesses cuddling a baby when the mum was trying to get ready to get off the plane. The genuine care you could see from the staff was excellent. I cant recommend Singapore Airlines enough.
label: positive

text: Amazing! Best crew, food, service and seats. On-ground service also best. Totally recommend!! I have travelled with them more than 12 times but no complaints :)
label: positive

text: Double payment for flight I recently purchased flights from Melbourne to Koh Samui return. Singapore Airlines has taken the payment from my account twice. They tell me that they are holding it for pre-authorisation. So they take the flight money out on 12th July, then take the same amount again on 17th for pre-authorisation? This is ridiculous. Has anyone else ever experienced this before? By going overdrawn on that account, it has given me no end of problems, least of which was being left stranded at a petrol station with no way of paying for the fuel. Singapore Airlines response and concern has been almost non-existent. I've probably been using SA for 50% of my business flights recently. If there isn't a satisfactory outcome to this, I will insist that Singapore Airlines never be used again.
label: negative

text: Singapore sets the standard There is a reason Singapore Air is rated year after year one of the top international carriers. I’ve been flying Singapore for decades and have always been impressed with the level of service. I no longer fly enough to secure business class so this time I elected to travel Premium Economy. I would say that Singapore’s economy is better than any US carrier flying to Asia but due to the length of the flight decided to go Premium Economy. The Premium Economy is not business class but is sufficiently better than economy that if you can get a reasonable price for the seat, it is worth the upgrade. You receive some of the same amenities as business class-convenience package, up graded entertainment center including full head phones and the ability to select your meals in advance. The big difference is the seat. The seat is reclinable and there is a leg support and a foot rest. The seat is also wider. I was able to get a reasonably comfortable sleep in the flight. What sets this airline apart is that the planes and cabins are immaculate and the cabin crew are extremely pleasant and attentive to any needs you may have. I’ve flown on three classes of service on Singapore and they have never disappointed.
label: positive

text: Worlds Best AirLine Singapore to Bali 2 Hour Morning Flight But the crew manage a great Breakfast THANKS to Chief Steward Warren Ovinis and Faheema Quick Ultra Efficient Clean & Service Beyond Expectations So thanks We'll be back Many Thanks .
label: positive

text: dont think the blankets are launder correctly After arriving at Heathrow my son and I developed a rash wich has been diagnosed as scabies wich I think we contracted on our flight from Singapore to Heathrow while being wrapped in our blankets .i think perhaps these blankets are not being properly laundered and need looking into .while scabies is easily treated it has been very annoying I hope Singapore airlines will keep up there high standards as I have always found them excellent.also I may be just me but I didn’t think the meals were as good as usual
label: positive

text: Flights to and from New Zealand Comfortable airline. Food and beverage hoice satisfactory . Pleasant staff. Stopover in Singapore broke the journey going, but long travel time on return. Would consider stopping on return as well next time
label: positive

text: The check-in process at JFK was the worst check-in experience I've experienced. I was waiting for check-in for over 2 hours. The line just didn't move at all. The agent was extremely inefficient. I was one of the last customers to check in and it was about 30 minutes before the departure time. The counter agents was escorting a group of last-to-check-in customers to the security checkpoint so they could skip the line (we were late) and somehow I was the only one who left in the security line on my own. The service on board was terrible despite the high-regarded in-flight service that Singapore Airlines is usually known for. The service was so slow for a flight with only 160 customers. I sat at one of the single seat toward the end of the aircraft and the steward kept bumping into me like I was sitting on the aisle. He didn't even apologize. My food was OK at best. The worst part was probably the lavatories. Truly disgusting, trash was everywhere on the floor.
label: negative

text: Gone downhill Have flown with Singapore quite a few times over the last 15 years. They were always my number one choice when flying and had always had a good experience with them. But a recent flight from Melbourne to Singapore and back has left me very disappointed. While the food (in economy) was fairly good and service and staff are still great, the seating was beyond uncomfortable. I am 6 foot tall and have always found in the past that their planes have good leg room. Not any more. Both flights were horrendous. My knees touched the seat in front of me, l couldn't stretch my legs at all, both flights were very cramped. Don't think l will be flying with them again, way too uncomfortable for a long flight
label: neutral

text: World class service I would like to compliment the crews on the flight SQ 387 from Barcelona to Singapore. It was such an exceptional experience as compared to any other airlines that I had been on. I was welcomed into the aircraft by a steward named Reuben, whom had shown a welcoming smile and pointed me in the direction to my seat. I had sprained my right ankle as I was travelling through Barcelona the day before, up till the flight, I was still walking with a slight limp. I guessed that the slight limp had caught the keen attention of the crews as I was walking to my seat. They had checked for my well-being with empathy and politeness, offered me a change of seats to ensure better convenience which I had declined. Shortly after the first meal service, the crew had made an ice pack for my ankle and it came along with a small towel. It was a great relief as the walking that happened before the flight had caused my ankle to swell even more. The ice pack was changed for a total of 5 times throughout the flight by different cabin crews. They had been so consistent with their sincere and genuine service by doing so. They had also informed me that should I require any assistance for the movement around the aircraft, I could always press the “call” button to alert them, and they would ask the steward to assist me as soon as possible. Even though I had not asked for this assistance during the flight, it was such a warm gesture and an extra mile in service. I was not sure if all the crews in Singapore Airlines had this level of service, but the crews on this flight had definitely set the bar for me. I would like to specially commend these crews Eileen, Pek Yun, Rong Yan, Ee Hua, Charles, Pantha and Sanjani. They had shown me their utmost care and concern in absolute kindness and professionalism throughout the 13 hours of the flight. They had managed to make this flight as enjoyable and comfortable for me to the best of their efforts. The flight had departed smoothly and arrived on time with a great landing, thanks to Captains Morgan and John, and Senior First Officer Jeremy in the flight deck. I would like to thank the airline, the in-flight manager and the crews for making this wonderful experience possible. I would definitely share this experience with others and would surely travel with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: SQ 212 on B777-300 SYD/SIN ; A350-9 SIN/BKK/SIN & SQ 231 on A380 SIN/SYD. First international flight since covid. Two things stand out - as expected, Singapore Airlines were up to their usual high standards with requests, check-in, seating and efficient, friendly cabin service. Despite aircraft being full, a polite request for preferred seating afforded us seats near bulkheads or in exit rows - making the longer sectors far more pleasant with the extra legroom. Flights departed on time, cabin and toilets kept clean at all times. The 2nd issue of significance was that one of my 2 baggage items was nowhere to be seen upon arrival in BKK. This was at a time when all airlines were ramping up after covid and many were having issues with misplaced, lost or late baggage. In fairness to SQ, the item was "oversize" and handled separately AND we had a tight connection of only 1 hour in SIN. It was reported to staff and next morning I received an email saying the smallish item had been located. I received a phone call and then another email updating me of the delayed baggage and that it would be delivered to my home 100km from BKK airport by courier - and it DID arrive as promised !. Excellent communication and service. It was apparent the item had missed the connecting flight in Singapore - as evidenced by the "rush" stickers etc all over the article.. Singapore Airlines - a cut above the others.
label: positive

text: Pleasant Journey Hospitality of Singapore airlines and its wonderful support crew were upto the mark. Meals provided were of good standard and the journey was smooth. It was a pleasant experience Charles wijesinghe
label: positive

text: If the world was run by Singapore airlines it would be near perfect We have travelled with low cost airlines in the past in the belief we were saving money however on this trip is did a quick cost comparison and found I wasn’t saving very much at all so I returned to Singapore airlines. What a relief!checking in is a breeze and almost a pleasure. All the staff whether ground or cabin are courteous and knowledgeable. But get this - we had a late departure from Hong Kong due to weather which gave us less than 20 minutes to make the connection in Singapore which was achieved by us running flat out through the terminal. We made it just as the gate was closing and as we sat on the plane we decided our luggage would arrive some time next week as there was no way they could have loaded it from one aircraft to the other in such a short time. On arriving in Melbourne there was our luggage on the carousel ready for collection - effortless efficiency in every way. Thank you and well done.
label: positive

text: Always feel safe and comfortable to fly with SIA Boarding was systematic and smooth. On board flight staff were cheerful, friendly and helpful. Economy class seats come with more legroom than other airline which I have experienced.
label: positive

text: Great leg space and lot of entertainment options to choose I travelled with my 5 year old and handling him alone over flight was very difficulty, was fully prepared for the nightmarish trip but it turned out to be less than that (cannot blame airlines for his tantrums). My worry point was strong ac during nights as my kid is prone to congestion thankfully they provided socks and blanket and food was good. The staff was very warm and smiling.Thanks you singapore airlines for taking care of us.
label: positive

text: SUB-SIN, SQ931, 28 June. A330-300 on both legs. Hot towels were served shortly after boarding followed by food. Very polite crew members. The aircraft's In-flight entertainment was updated compared to last flight's movie. The seat on A330 was very comfortable with quite a lot of space. Overall a very pleasant experience and it's always a pleasure to fly Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Bit disappointed Having flown with Emirates last year and being told Singapore Airlines was even better we were very excited about our flight. Our experience did not match expectation. Firstly, the seats were not as comfortable as Emirates. Secondly, the plane was a bit grubby. The toilets from the beginning heavily smelt or urine, which wasn't nice. Staff were fairly welcoming, but not massively. We both ordered a non fish meal. Our flight from Heathrow to Singapore meal was OK, but because special meals are served first it means you have to wait a long while for your drink. Our meal for our flight from Singapore to Bali was not good. The roll was not edible, and the rest of the meal was not very nice. We felt penalised for ordering a special meal, as other passengers received a Magnum, when we asked we were told we didn't have one as had a special meal. In fairness the air stewardess did give us a Magnum, although slightly begrudgingly! I have raised a complaint with SA, to which they have replied and are investigating. We're hoping our flight home is better. I wonder whether glowing reviews are from those that travel Business or First. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't the most awful experince, but it didn't meet expectation, and certainly didn't take the position of favourite airline in my opinion.
label: neutral

text: A very comfortable trip The flight was in an A380 that seemed brand new. Premium Economy is very comfortable and the service by the flight crew was excellent. I could not fault it in any way. We were served lunch that was quite palatable accompanied by good quality wine and the entertainment package helped while away the 7 hours or so for the flight.
label: positive

text: Flight SQ 297 from Singapore to Christchurch on 29th April 2022 This flight was an absolute nightmare. Not only were the people who originally had pre-booked meals (which by the way their website did not allow me to do) were serviced almost immediately while the rest of us had to wait more than an hour for our meals. My wife's meal was already opened - and cold! The air hostesses also seem to spent more time with clients with babies than on the rest of us. Breakfast on the morning was also a disaster - the choices we were given were obviously not for a breakfast!
label: negative

text: Premium economy gone downhill Flew from Manchester to Singapore recently on an A350 in Premium Economy and we both agree that this service has gone rapidly downhill since our last flight with then in PE. There does not seem to much legroom and the seats are uncomfortable especially on a 13 hour flight. Food was not good either, very poor selection and the 'book the cook' service is not available on this sector which was disappointing. Did go their offices in Singapore to see how much it would cost one way from Singapore to Manchester. 12,000 sgd!!! Roughly £8,000!!! We declined that. We have always used Singapore Airlines each time we have gone to Singapore and West Australia and been a krisflyer member for 25 years, they were not bothered, all they want to do is make as much money as they can. Will use another airline on the future possibly Qatar as a relative using them and say they are very good and accommodating.
label: neutral

text: The most backward airline I’ve ever experienced My access online to select my dietary preferences were blocked so I tried calling their offices. The number was so difficult to find, as you know they avoid you calling their call centre like the plague. I eventually found an old number which directed me to an insurance company and it seems to happen a lot, as the response I got from the attendant over the phone that the correct number was instead 13 10 11. They have a long queue of pressing at least 3 options to speak with someone and I got a representative who advised me that they only had gluten free or lactose free options, just not together and not “dairy free”. What day and age do you have to be in to not know that dairy and gluten are well known allergens. I was told to medical certificate and I did for extra charge from my specialist doctor to au_reservations@singaporeairlines.com.sg 6 days before my flight back from Singapore. I received an email receipt for my dietary request and another email asking for my booking number. So much bloody effort. I made a direct complaint and their customer affairs officer explained, “any meal needing to be both Low Lactose and Gluten-Free would need to be custom prepared and uplifted by our Catering Department. As we are only able to accede to custom meal requests on medical grounds, rather than passenger taste preferences, our Catering Managers require a medical document outlining the relevant allergies or intolerances in order to accede to requests of this nature.” I got on my flight yesterday and I was so stressed that I burst into bouts of tears when they started serving food and I hadn’t got my meal request I submitted 6 days prior, even after going through the effort to speak to SG call centre and having to provide a medical certificate. What was the run around for? S*ts and giggles? There was a lovely staff member Sidney? that tried to get to the bottom of my distressed sobs of, “I have a medical condition... I submitted a medical certificate” and she tried her best to cater for me on the flight however I was so exhausted by that stage I didn’t give a rats bottom. I consumed about 10 glasses of water in a span of 15mins and had a nap instantly after my meal. She also submitted a report on my behalf to customer relations. What help is that, I realise because the previous passage was their “politically safe” response. I also made a complete fool of myself in front of my surrounding passengers crying out my frustration. Why ask for a medical certificate if you can’t provide? And stating under all your emails that we can guarantee your dietary request is unacceptable for someone with a legitimate medical condition. There is scientific evidence that dairy and gluten are well known allergens, it’s required by law to state them in food and packaging. I have been discriminated against for having a medical condition. Do you also ask people of Muslim, Jewish, Hindu faith to provide religious certificates to show that their meal requests are not one’s “taste preferences”? What caveman mentality is that? I’ve flown with qantas and they managed to provide my meal with less than 24hrs notice because this is a common combination of intolerance, especially as the medical field is advancing. It’s also none of your business what medical condition I have but I still provided because this is ridiculous. Get your act together SG. You’ve just lost a well-travelled customer who have a lot of word power in the community. I hope justice is delivered to your whole company for this distressing experience. I have been traumatised and I almost didn’t say anything because I felt so down trodden but I will fight back the way I know how.
label: negative

text: Experience was quite alright.. Have flown with Singapore Airlines earlier as well but this experience was sub par. Food was bad, toilets were unclean and seats in economy too crammed. Would use their services only if I run out of choices again.. or if there is way too much of a difference in price compared to other airlines.
label: positive

text: Comfortable Flight Differ between SIA and budget airline, other then the price, is that you able to get more comfortable rest while enjoy the various assistance when on flight. the long journey flight will not make you feel tired if taking SIA such airline. Of course the price can be cheaper will be better.
label: positive

text: The most uncomfortable business class seat The service on board Singapore Airlines is excellent and the catering is of a high standard. Unfortunately, the business class seat was one of the most uncomfortable seats I have ever flown in. To put the seat into the flat bed position it is necessary to summon the cabin crew for their assistance. The same thing applies when trying to put the seat into the recline position. The surface of the bed is like sleeping on a board, we were not provided with mattresses,One has to sleep almost diagonally to stretch out your legs, as the place provided for your feet is a small space situated to one side, not directly in front of you! It was a very uncomfortable space to try to sleep in.
label: positive

text: Brisbane to Singapore. This flight was in an older A340 that does not have flat bed seats. It is fine for a day time flight but having flown this at night previously is not good for a refreshing sleep. Check in was a bit slow and rude, being directed by one staff member to a check in agent who put up her hand to my face to indicate for me to stop while she did something else. Lounge was basic but all I wanted was a coffee. Flight left on time, brunch and snacks were both tasty, of a high quality and large in size. Quality of coffee on board was excellent, too. Crew were great and the wine was good. Attempted a couple of hours sleep which was not great due to the seat. Off the plane at the closest gate to immigration and through customs in 5 minutes and the bags were magically waiting to be picked up. All up a very enjoyable trip that would have been improved through travelling on a plane with the new long haul business class seats.
label: positive

text: Manchester-Singapore-Sydney return. Brilliant service good food for economy class. Flight attendants worked hard and were first class. On the outward journey suggested we might want to move to have more space sadly the plane was packed coming back. We will use them again.
label: positive

text: Dropping off baggage at Pudong station there were counters open, long line, lots of sighing, but at least the ground staff were polite. The red-eye back was on a 787-10, another first for me, and I liked the layout. Proper seat pockets instead of flimsy nets, USB and power at each seat, pillows and blankets already waiting, and an IFE system that actually responded when you tapped it. I barely used it though, since I was more focused on sleep. Dinner was twice-cooked pork, a little bland but improved with a glass of white wine. Toilets were conveniently mid-cabin, which helped since I was half-asleep most of the flight. The crew handled everything gracefully, including a fellow passenger who ordered a bland meal then complained it was not vegetarian, and spent the rest of the flight blinding people with their flashlight. Not the crew’s fault, but I had secondhand embarrassment on their behalf. Arrival in Singapore was smooth, and I even had time for shopping and a quick stop before security. For a red-eye, this one was not bad at all, flashlight warriors aside.
label: positive

text: Missing luggage Here we go again. After 5 days we have still not received our luggage and SA will have nothing to do with this, although it is their responsibility to ensure that the luggage is safe No response from SA we don’t understand what is going on.
label: negative

text: Fab flight Great flight, good leg room, fantastic choice of food, very friendly and helpful cabin crew, would use them again
label: positive

text: Best airline in the world, no doubt! This is the best airline in the world, or maybe I'm just biased :) As a Singaporean, I am proud that our airline always makes it to the top of the list. Well, it is definitely not hard to see why. From the check in, to the lounge, to the cabin, the whole flying experience was top notch. We had a few check in counters dedicated to business class passengers, boarding was priority for us, seats were extremely comfortable with ample legroom, lots of in-flight entertainment, crews were friendly and helpful, the food (there were a few courses including dessert!) was nicely plated and to-die-for (we can choose our meals online prior to the flight), toilet was well stocked with mouthwash, toothrushes, body mist etc and everything was EXCELLENT. You will not surely not regret flying with Singapore Airlines, because they are the best for a reason!
label: positive

text: Efficient and comfortable I flew in premium economy for this journey thanks to the bid system available on Singapore Airlines. The system is effective, however for the bids I made it would have made more sense just to book a premium economy seat to begin with as the cost ended up the same. The seat was comfortable and as it was in the exit row had more than enough leg room in front. The missing window however was a bit of a shame. I pre-ordered my meal with the 'book a cook' feature and whilst it was nice not to have to make the decision in the air and have the meal just brought to me when it was ready, the meal didn't quite live up to expectations from the description. The in-flight entertainment system has hundreds of things available to watch making for an easy way to pass time. The screens are responsive and aside from a few pauses in shows, had no issues. There were plenty of times available to order drinks, and the attendants were regularly coming through the cabin. The flight arrived almost an hour ahead of schedule, and luggage was on the carousel almost immediately.
label: positive

text: Still not up to the expectations Well, this was my second trip to Singapore on this flight within three weeks and I was hoping my experience would get better. Unfortunately, it is not the case.... Check-in was smooth, but it is still frustrating to have to take the train and wait like anybody else while Swiss passengers are taken by limousine....Equally frustrating is having no access to the first class lounge (only to the senator lounge which by the way is quite nice). On board, I already some comments about the cabin. Yes, it is very spacious, and the TV set is beautiful. But there are two things really annoying: the seat that you can only turn electronically, and the bed that is adjacent to your neighbour's, only separated by a wall....meaning that he (or she) is probably sleeping a few centimeters away from you. And everytime the person turns around and hits the wall, you will get waken up. The other problem, which frankly I find incredible at this level of (claimed) service is that they did not have the L-size for the pyjamas....how is this possible?. As the food, the menu looked good, and the "Georges Blanc" menu very appealing. The starter was great (Lobsters), but the main course was unfortunately not eatable. The meat was so hard... The movie choice was quite good. In addition, the staff was nice but quite unexperienced. I had to ask to be offered wine. On this route my choice will remain "Swiss" rather than Singapore....
label: neutral

text: Singapore Airlines A380---better that A350..but still inferior In my previous review of the A350 flight to Christchurch, I pointed out that their business class seats were most uncomfortable for stretching out or sleeping, as one could not stretch out straight or lie straight; \but at an acute angle. I expected more from the A380 and was disappointed ; once again you could only stretch at an angle. The angle was less steep in this aircraft and there was better support. The seat belt arrangement too, was better and not uncomfortable. But when Qatar, Emirates, Etihad etc can give you seats that stretch out straight and are super comfortable when fully flat, I wonder why SQ chose such an awkward seat design. The SQ service was , of course, top notch,though one thing stumped me. I ordered a cappucino after lunch; the stewardess brought it and left it on my table without any sugar or a stirrer. I assumed sugar was already added; and tasted it...no sugar. So I had to buzz for sugar and a stirrer. Intrigued, and wondering whether it was just an oversight by my stewardess, I asked my wife to order one. Can you believe it, the same thing happened!
label: neutral

text: Felt cheated and disappointed, have no way to response to SQ due to the way they had design the customer serbice system. Received an email from Singapore Airlines on an upgrade which cost EUR384/pax/per trip. So I quickly jump in and paid, however when I receipt the email, then did I noticed that it was an upgrade for premium economy only. I felt sad and wanted to request to change back to original seats, however was unable to, and also had a hard time trying to contact customer service team of Singapore Airlines. It was like they design the system in a way which we can't get through to a live agent via FB messaging and SQ apps. very disappointed in the service rendered.
label: negative

text: Favorite airline I have flewn different airlines to asia before, but after my 1st flight with SA, i’m stuck. It’s always a pleasure flying with SA - very good connection, service, food, drinks, inflight films and cozy flight.
label: positive

text: Flew from Singapore to Osaka and back in November 2013. Must say that this has to be the best flight I have taken from boarding to the service and the meal as well as the inflight entertainment. It was an experience that is worth the premium.
label: positive

text: Still the best frequent flyer program I'm redeemed my mileages many times with Singapore Airlines. It's one of the easiest online mileage redemption process amongst all airline. The check in and boarding process still also the most efficient.
label: positive

text: First class experience. I choose to fly KL to Mumbai via Singapore on first class in order to experience the world renowned airline. The flight from KL was on airbus 330 business class. It was short 45min on time flight. I had to change terminal in changi airport via shuttle inside the airport. Then proceed to lounge. There was a private room section in the lounge. Very few people were there and most of them were there for a short time. I had 5 and half hour lay over in the lounge. Wow! What an experience. Best wine and dine experience I’ve had. Then the flight from Singapore to Mumbai was an A380. It was a 5 hour flight. The first class was located on the lower deck of the aircraft. It was the second A380 of the Singapore Airlines. The first class cabin was old style. But the service and food were impeccable.
label: positive

text: 3 hours of luxury My gf and I decided to splurge and treat ourselves to a business class flight from Singapore to Manila in January 2020. From the minute we walked into the airplane and graciously guided to our own personal business class booths, we knew this flight was going to be our favorite. We've been on over a hundred airplanes before with numerous airlines around the world, but never in a business class seat with Singapore Airlines. The courteousy, respect and professionalism the staff showed us was above and beyond anything I've experienced. We were constantly being checked on, our meals were incredible, we had bottomless drinks of our choice, cozy personal reclining seat /bed to relax in, the latest in entertainment on my own wide screen TV monitor and the bathroom was literally 4 feet away! If you ever feeling like treating yourself or family and /or friends to luxury in the air, do it with Singapore's business class! It's totally worth it!
label: positive

text: Excellent service We chose to fly Singapore Airlines,as we have always been very satisfied with the service by this Airline. Once again we were not disappointed.
label: positive

text: Premium Economy not worth the money Seat 33D. The extra room over an economy seat was marginal in terms of leg room. The meal service is economy class and the service was poor by Singapore Airlines normal service standards. I had to ask for coffee and extra wine was not offered. After experiencing Air New Zealand's service on the previous leg, SA offering was simply poor. It is not worth upgrading from economy.
label: positive

text: Fabulous flight and service It was a fabulous experience to fly Singapore Airlines business class on this flight. Everything about the food, service, in flight entertainment and actual flight was so enjoyable. We don't usually fly business class but this flight will make us consider the advantages of arriving refreshed (at a cost of course)!!
label: positive

text: Great lunch on board The Japanese chicken with rice was such a great choice! The set came with cold soba and chicken meatballs, alongside some salad. The whole journey was comfortable, and the pilot landed relatively smoothly despite the poor weather.
label: positive

text: Improvements are required I hope by now Singapore has improved its seats and its flat beds in Business class. I flew from Brisbane to London via Singapore and found that the seats where wider than most airlines but did not go fully flat nore didnt really give you room for ur feet when you did try and lie flat. I know the airline was in the process of upgrade / refurbishing their planes so i hope they have done this. I did like the option to select your food before flying and having the extra items that were not on the menu when on the plane. Lets see what the next trip brings.
label: positive

text: great service Upon taking your seat the flight attendant would give out warm towels which is a great gesture of service as it can clean the travel fatigue off travelers face. meal service was very pleasant drinks were being refueled promptly.
label: positive

text: Newer aircraft, good entertainment This is a long overnight flight, but the service was good and the entertainment system was great - a decent sized screen with plenty of movies to choose from. We got dinner after departure and breakfast before arrival - both meals were fine.
label: positive

text: Nice aircraft - nasty food !! Clean tidy aircraft, nice helpful cabin crew. The premium economy cabin was roomy & comfortable. The Airbus A380 took off on time & arrived on schedule. The reason I have marked them down is due to their sub-standard food. Could not eat my pasta starter it was so bad. The main course I chose of fish curry was even worse. A bland piece of white fish, totally lacking in curry sauce & poorly cooked rice (how can they manage that) ??? Was too tired to complain as it was a night flight. Their video film choice was also limited.
label: neutral

text: singapore airlines in general very good from ground staff help to air crew very helpful and polite ,only gripe was 3 out of 4 flights the menu choice was gone by the time we had to pick
label: positive

text: Excellent Experience Best Ground team, Best in flight crew, Excellent Pilots. I had a baggage was not load for my connecting flight Due to rain and late arrival on my other flight. When i reach my destination SIA ground workers had prepared all the relevant documents and i had to just sign and provide the address. On the same night my luggage was send to home. Excellent service here.
label: positive

text: Good service in flight Food needs improvement Shame no direct flights was delayed but positive a great lounge good selection incredible service clean showers etc
label: positive

text: How did they get Best Airline?? We flew Singapore Airlines flight SQ236 Brisbane to Singapore return, in business class. Honestly we have had better service on Jetstar economy. The Singapore lounge in Brisbane was nice , small but modern and clean with great staff and that’s about the only good thing I could say regarding staff, once we hit the air it was downhill . The A350 is a nice plane, seats are wide and comfortable , but for $6000 a return ticket you would expect some service. We booked the cook pre flights , the meal was served mine and my husbands meals 45 mins apart. No drinks were offered during the meal service. I requested water and waited for 25 mins until I had to flag down an attendant and wait again. The return flight service was just as bad , the staff look annoyed to be there. Breakfast was not served flying into Brisbane and it seemed a bother to ask for a coffee. If you could have the plane and swap the staff over with any budget carrier it might be ok. Seriously rude staff, no amenities kits in business , wi fi didn’t work , dirty toilets. Save your money and fly a budget carrier you will get the same service . Singapore is going downhill , charging for a presumed level of service you won’t get .
label: negative

text: Worst Experience Of Any Airline For The Money Paid We actually flew PE from Brisbane to London and back from Paris with stopovers in Singapore with one Economy leg from Brisbane to Singapore. The Economy was actually good, probably because there was no PE on board! We then looked forward to the PE. Unfortunately, it turned out to be a big disappointment and most certainly not worth the extra money. The PE sections were extremely small and cramped with a tiny bit of extra legroom. The food was the same as Economy and mostly bloody awful - excuse the language. On one long flight, we hardly ate anything and asked for some cheese and biscuits. This was not possible! The staff were cold, bossy, and unfriendly and made no effort to greet us by name as Qantas and Virgin do. We were reluctantly served fizzy in paper cups a long time after the plane took off - Qantas and Virgin do it before! SA do not know what the word SERVICE means! By far, the worst flight, however, was the one from Singapore last night. The plane was full, including over one hundred school children who all wanted to use the THREE toilets for the hundreds of PE and Economy passengers at the same time! The food was awful.The cheap Spanish wine doesn't help - there is only a choice of red or white! The entertainment is hopeless. There are hardly any Classic movies, let alone new ones! It mostly consisted of children's cartoons. Unfortunately, my husband thinks that we may travel economy on this airline again. However, if it is my choice, it is Goodbye Singapore Airlines!
label: negative

text: Star flight on air 5* for Staff service, Food & beverages and Inflight entertainment 4* for Seat comfort and Value for money
label: positive

text: Booked a business class flight from Singapore to Manila on a Boeing 787 expecting a lie-flat seat. Upon boarding, we were informed that there was an aircraft change to a very old A330 plane without lie-flat seats. Seat was very uncomfortable, not worth a business class ticket. Plane was probably a decade old or more. Inflight entertainment is likewise outdated, not even a touchscreen. Lobster thermidor was salty, rice and asparagus were overcooked. Do not book Singapore Airlines business class, not worth it.
label: negative

text: The best airline in the world indeed Our return flight home was just as good as the one over. SIA delivered their world class service consistently again!
label: positive

text: Good but has serious competition I had been looking forward to SIA's business class for some time and, overall, was not disappointed. Whether it was the high expectation or the lack of delivery but it was not the greatest of experiences. Istanbul - check-in 3 hours before the flight was excellent and we were directed to the Express Path for Customs/Immigration and into the Turkish Airlines Lounge within minutes. Boarding was good - SIA only has the one flight from Istanbul daily so gets punted to a very remote gate for a very long drive to the aircraft - premium cabin passengers do get priority and a separate bus but in adverse weather it would be an ordeal. On-board - greeting and seating was excellent and I had no initial issues with the seat or cabin. Travelling with my wife and she ended up with a Flight Attendant who was not having a good day and who then was quite curt/brusque with passengers - none of the Singapore Girl's charms on display here. Dining - excellent - food and drink was really good and the Book The Cook option was a good one to explore. Seat/Entertainment - very good but longer-term, the seat was uncomfortable. SIA is often lauded for having a very wide seat but it is necessary as, when reclined, your feet are directed into quite a small cubby-hole towards the centre of the aircraft and you have to lie across you seat to get your feet in. If the seat were any narrower I would not think that you would be at all comfortable. The seat back flips forward to expose the mattress/bedding which is very good and overall the seating/sleeping is good but not great. Etihad offer a more comfortable seat and sleeping experience. To sum up - the best thing about SIA's business class was access to their excellent SilverKris Lounge in Changi Airport - so much better that the very tawdry and very ordinary Gold Kris Lounge. Would I fly Business Class with SIA again? probably, but there are so many other (better) options now available for the sort of $$ that SIA expects - think Etihad, Qatar and the like.
label: positive

text: Newly retrofitted A380 I traveled on SQ856 on the 12 Dec 2018 from Sin to Hkg and had seat 14D.The seating configuration is 1-2-1 and the middle aisles have a partition. i was surprise by the condition of the partition, which had almost "dislocated" at the base. i was afraid that it could fall off the paneling groove. i was a little worried and highlighted this to the stewardess. the flight supervisor came and was helpful and offered me a change of seat. How can the world's best airline treat a customer in this manner, offering a seat with damaged furnishing/parts on a flight? On the return flight SQ863 (A350 - new plane) of 16 Dec 2018, seated at 14F, i could not even get connected to the wifi on board. the stewardess tried to assist, resetting several times but to no avail. The flight supervisor did not even bothered coming to explained what the problem was. This is contrary to what they had advertised as having the best on board entertainment. i am really disappointed with the service standard of this airline.
label: neutral

text: Excellent experiance As ever an excellent service, comfortable smooth and enjoyable. The staff are wonderful and you feel as if nothing is too much trouble. Changi airport is an excellent place to spend a few hours especially if you have access to the business lounge. The food and drinks are very good and most welcome. The seating is comfortable and wide giving a lot of wiggle room, your also able to converse with your travelling companion if your in the middle seats. The screen between you goes totally flat making a virtual double bed (what could possibly happen!)
label: positive

text: In October 2024 I flew with Singapore Airlines return from Sydney to Phnom Phen and the flights between Singapore and Cambodia were on their new 737-MAX 8. It was my first opportunity to experience their regional business class and from row 2 - their much talked about throne seat. Despite the flight time, Male is another destination in their regional network, only this time it was a 787-10 Dreamliner. Given this is a widebody aircraft, the business class seating is 1x2x1 with the single seats on either side staggered – the front row seat is against the aisle followed by a seat against the window. I usually pre-order my meals using their ‘book the cook’ service but forgot on this occasion. That proved to be a big mistake because what arrived was so underwhelming I can’t even remember what it was. But I know I tried it and then handed the tray and everything on it back to a flight attendant and chose to sleep instead. The seat converts into a lay flat bed which was quite comfortable given there’s no bedding provided other than a blanket and pillow. But the footwell is much more accommodating than the 737 throne seat. However, there’s little room between each row, so business class is tightly packed and on a full flight like mine the cabin is no a haven in the sky. Despite that, I managed to get about 2 hours of much needed sleep. Then on arrival, the rather expensive bottle of champagne I purchased on board was seized. I was unaware that you require a license to bring any alcohol into the country; even if it’s just 1 bottle. It would have been nice if the crew said something before, they processed the sale. Did the flight experience live up to my expectations? – I would have to say no. Sure the aircraft was fairly new, but then it’s hard to guess the age of their planes from the inside. I should rate this experience as 5 out of 10 because Singapore Airlines can do much better and usually do. But I’m feeling generous so I’ll give them 6
label: neutral

text: Best Airline Always travel on Singapore Airlines including to Heathrow. The crew are friendly and efficient in the airport and on The flight. Highly recommend this Airline
label: positive

text: Bad We had booked a flight BNE-BKK and return SGN-BNE. We picked SIA for a quality airline and very good connection. Than they delayed the first flight that we could not get the connecting flight in SIN. We had to pick a night flight ( which I hate) and lost a day in Thailand. While in SGN SIA cancelled the afternoon fight and fly 3 hours early. So we hadover 5 h to kill in SIN airport.They treated us like Airasia. Reply to my complaint was they have the right to change flights. We too we change airlines. In the nightflight from BNE as a meal they served a mini taoster 2"x2", that was no meal that was a sample !
label: negative

text: Old Seat Configuration, great in flight service! Singapore Girl still wins! It had been some time flying with Singapore Airlines in Business so I enjoyed coming back to old, tried and trusted SQ. The in flight service was brilliant, great food and some new movies on the relatively short flight from Melbourne to Wellington. Will fly anytime with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Flying from Yangon to Singapore on mid morning flight, really showed that SilkAir struggles to match the SIA product. To be fair, we were accommodated on an Airbus A330-300, which has seatback IFE, wider seats and a generally more spacious ambience. Nonetheless, the in-flight meal for the 3 hour flight was just much better than the SilkAir product, and the IFE at least made the time pass faster. The A330 has a 2-4-2 configuration, which makes travelling as a couple or single slightly more enjoyable. The cabin crew were very engaged, going the extra mile for multiple drink servings.
label: positive

text: Disappointed with broken promises I brought a Ticket from fly365 which went under liquidation last year. In contacting Singapore airlines I was told that my flights were paid for and that I could use it by the end of 2021. I called them on a few occasions to check if the flights were still valid and I was told that Singapore airlines has taken over my flights as it was paid for and if I want to change my flight to a country that has opened their boarder l can with a $50 US change fees. I rang them a month ago to confirm by when can I change my flights and I was told by the end of June, than I don’t have to pay extra fees on top of the $50 US. I called on the 2nd June to rebook my flights and I was told that the money was refunded to the company that went under liquidation in august. This came as a shock as for months I was told that my tickets were paid for and that Singapore airlines will hold my tickets. I also received a email from the airline manager ( Dejan Eminagic), who stated that my tickets were confirmed. I was fed with false information by the Singapore airlines staff for more than a year. I’m so disappointed with the lies I was presented to by the Singapore airline team.. a apology does not mean anything when they can’t honor their word. Very disappointed with the staff and the way they managed my tickets.
label: negative

text: SQ 345 ZRH to SIN 9 Dec 2013. The A380 was late due to non communicated reasons - no Economy Class in Upper Deck were available thus our long lasting reservations were cancelled and we got rather poor seats in the aft of the airplane. The meal was 'overcooked' thus not edible service was non-existent we had to get our drinks ourselves in the galley.¨It was the lousiest flight to Asia we have experienced.
label: negative

text: Hong Kong to Brisbane via Singapore with Singapore Airline. It is a disappointing travel experience. The flight from Hong to Singapore (SQ871) was delayed about 30 minutes and therefore arrived Singapore 10 minutes later than scheduled. Yet my next flight from Singapore to Brisbane (SQ255) was going to depart in about 40 minutes. It was so a rush to transfer flight in such short period of time. A better arrangement would be appreciated as this pattern happens daily. As soon as I landed in Singapore, the staff informed me that my luggage could not get on the same flight as mine because of the time constraint and that I had to make a report after landing in Brisbane. However, no further detail was given and I was not sure where and who to talk to. The flight from Singapore to Brisbane is about 8 hours which would give their staff plenty of time to communicate between Singapore and Brisbane offices about my luggage. When I landed in Brisbane, I was directed to the office after asking a flight attendant and then the counter staff at departure. I would appreciate if I was given a better instruction in Singapore (or at least before landing) so that I would not need to run around in the airport. I told the lady at the office about my situation and showed her my flight tickets and passport. However, she did not check anything about my luggage and kept giving me confusing information. She told me my luggage should be in the baggage claim and I had to wait at the airport for an uncertain amount of time since I went through custom already and could not go back in anymore. Then she said the staff had paged me at baggage claim but I did not respond. However, I did not hear any announcement in baggage claim. When I asked her whether my luggage was in Brisbane or Singapore, she was not sure. I would’ve appreciated if she could check for me before saying anything. I am not upset about my luggage not being able to get on my second flight but I'm deeply disappointed about the service and how the staff handled it. I will never take Singapore Airline or recommend to my family and friends.
label: negative

text: Disappointed faithful customers Having been more than happy with Singapore in the past we booked again - tickets that were more expensive than anyone else. The price did not justify the service. The seat was so cramped I couldn’t sit with my knees together. The toilet stank before we even took off (men’s urinal). Pre dinner drinks don’t exist anymore (on any of the recent 6 Singapore flights we took this only happened on the last one) and it seems that the serving of alcohol is being scaled right down - a gin and tonic was almost too much trouble and not readily available. The food was generally terrible and again been scaled right back - terrible white rolls, ice ctreams for dessert or nothing, gluggy tough meat courses, no fresh fruit or eggs for breakfast. I used to look forward to having a relaxing drink and a meal on Singapore - not on these flights. The staff were generally snappy and it seems, over all that the focus has gone to more expensive seats. Unfair and disappointing for the majority of us in economy as the seats were still damn expensive.
label: negative

text: If Carlsberg did airlines they would be something like this. Staff are immaculate and attentive, verging on being too helpful if that’s possible. Entertainment system as good as anyone else and better than most. Seat becomes a very comfortable bed with the gracious assistance of the aforementioned crew. Lounge experience in LHR and SIN rather less memorable.
label: positive

text: Terrible Check in was very slow, worse then easyJet or Ryanair, boarding was slow, seats were very very cramped on the Boeing 777 plane, the food was inedible! Vegetarian roll was just grated carrot, 1 roll was rock hard, chicken dish all sinew and gristle, tea cold, I expected great things from the world number one, boy was I disappointed!! The stewards were very pleasant and helpful but other than that it was very poor. I have flown with easyJet and Ryanair and both met expectations, but I expected better from Singapore air. . Customer service terrible, complained about daughters flight and didn’t even get a reply.
label: negative

text: Confusing and misleading website As a KrisFlyer Member and loyal customer booking flights online used to be a breeze. Not anymore. On the first page you choose the flight to your destination at the advertised prize then on the second page book your return only to find out that your booking class is no more available and one is forced to pay considerably more. To make matters worse you have to pay extra for a reserved seat, pay some more for a "forward seat" and baggage allowance for the return leg might differ too. All very confusing and misleading. Overall the website resembles more and more a "el cheapo" budget airline. Service on board has been cut too - no more snacks and refreshments before the main meal, asking for water results in a sip out out of plastic cup - what about a 500ml water bottle available in Thailand for 20 cents. It seems obvious that the bean counters are now in charge at headquarters
label: negative

text: Smooth trip with Singapore Airlines Second time flying Singapore. Chose Prem Econ (PE) this time for cost benefit. Quite comfortable, we luckily got a bulkhead behind us, so no one to worry about when reclining the seat. Sleeping in PE is manageable, but nowhere near like Business. Service was typically great from cabin crew, drinks (all kinds) offered regularly to keep us hydrated. I find SA food is good quality, correct temperature for the food being served, and adequate size. Requests are met with a smile and delivered timely. The Airbus A350 performed well.
label: positive

text: Fly the best We have two flights, kolkata-singapore, singapore-bali. Both the flights were very much adhere to the timings. The service given by air hostess and stewards are very much appreciable. The food served was hot and delicious. We thoroughly enjoyed our flight.
label: positive

text: Skip This Flight. Service and Experience Is Trash They had very few items on the business class menu or snack items. If you asked for something the standard answer is that they ran out. I sat in 21k. I would not reccommend flying this airline. The service is slow and poor. If you want a drink they loudly repeat your order. The drink never comes or it comes 30 mins later. The mid flight meal service took 3 hours from start to finish. The toilets smelled and two of the toilets had a perpetual green light on although there was a passenger in the toilet. I was so happy to get off this plane. The seats are horrible. Not restful. Take Cathay and stop in HK. I wish someone else would take up this route
label: negative

text: Perth-Singapore Transit Flight to Maldives As always I had a great flight with SA, they even had Christmas decorations under in the cabin. Food was spot on and cabin staff lovely.
label: positive

text: Comfort and service The aircraft was a bit old, found the seating a bit cramped,Air New Zealand aircraft new and more spacious.. Crew were friendly, good service, good food.
label: positive

text: SQ345 - 24 August 2018 - Smooth ride but... Kudos to the pilot team for a smooth take off and smooth landing! Turbulence situations well controlled. However service crew lack sincerity and smile. Removed food tray without waiting for passenger to say ok. Ice cream was not eaten! Less rounds of beverage and water offerings. For a 12 hour flight, passengers can feel hungry and will expect snack offerings. Nothing was voluntarily offered though menu said delectable items like sandwich, chocolates, chips and fruits are available
label: positive

text: Consistently Great Been flying Singapore for many years & tried some more obscure flights from Chennai (SQ529) & (SQ938) to Denpasar. I can honestly say they are consistently great. Service is always fantastic & staff are always smiling. Planes are always presented neat & tidy. Their food is the best of any airline I’ve used. I’ve already got my return European flights for 2020 booked & at the cheapest price out of all the major airlines.
label: positive

text: Mr & mrs burford Not as we expected cabin seemed ready for re fit Seats very worn Food not to good , not enough choice Paid for wi-fi did not work Cabin crew 10/10 Hope the return journey is better Certainly not worth the extra cost
label: neutral

text: SQ919 MNL-SIN 18/3/2014. Trip was on a refitted B777-200ER registration 9V-SVJ. Actual time inflight was 3hrs 5mins or so. Took off earlier than schedule which was great. Service was good as usual. Crew seem tired since I didn't see any crew change taking place. Drinks service was basic and I still prefer a full drinks cart being pushed out rather than a tray of juices water beer and white wine. Food was great. Had a choice between pork with BBQ flavoured rice and chicken with pasta. I had the pork while my companion had the chicken. My pork dish was excellent with tender pork cubes and vegetables were done right. The rice was a little dry maybe due to overheating. Dessert was bad tasted nothing like mango cream cake. My companion said the chicken tasted good though portions are minuscule. Other than that I asked for 3 cocktails and all of which were honoured. Cabin crew on this leg didn't smile as much understandable due to exhaustion. IFE is a little dated since they used the old IFE but with bigger screens fortunately still AVOD. Seats pretty wide and legroom was standard 32 inches. Aisle seats are bad as they had an IFE box below. The flight was full. I tried asking for souvenirs and was given postcards and playing cards with a smile this time. In conclusion this trip is value for money and good service like always from SQ.
label: positive

text: Remains My Favourite On my annual vacation in December 2018, I chose to fly Singapore Airlines once again after an hiatus of 1 year, as I decided to fly with Qatar Airlines the year before. Although I found absolutely nothing wrong with Qatar Air, I just hate the layover time in Doha - far too long as it is close to 4 hours. The beauty of my flight with Singapore Airlines is that it is the quickest our of South Africa to Changi with a mere hour and thirty minutes layover. I´m amazed time and time again at their impeccable service and more so their willingness to go the extra mile. No request is ever too much as they aim to please and to exceed expectations. Both my outward and inward flight were perfect. I have already secured my flight for December 2019 with no other than Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text: Flight to Milano, Italy Singapore airlines you are absolutely wonderful in your care and support of us as customers. The flight was comfortable from the departure in Auckland to our arrival in Milano, Italy. Excellent meals and complimentarey services
label: positive

text: Not up to usual Singapore Airlines standard We flew from London Heathrow in August to Singapore and were very disappointed at the state and age of the plane we were on. We have flown Singapore many times before and have always been impressed how clean the planes are and the toilets are continually being serviced during the flight. This was definitely not the case on this sector. My tray table was filthy, there was still rubbish from the previous flight in the front pocket, the toilets were filthy from the start of the flight and the plane was very old and shabby - not a good look Singapore Air!!
label: neutral

text: Not to usual SIA standards Not a full flight but the staff were not as attentive as you would expect, maybe as it was a night flight. For the first time the food was inedible, very poor quality. I know this must have been a one off as I have flown SIA many times and they were faultless.
label: positive

text: Class difference glaring I came from Delhi to Sydney in April and shall be flying back to New Delhi on 22 nd of this month. I feel that the airlines makes you realise time and again that in economy class you are last preferred traveller.
