I agree that the higher class passengers should be given more facilities and upgraded food but this should not be apparent to all in welcoming, announcement, And basic courtseys at check-in. The staff was efficient in the flight and tried their best to make everything perfect. On the upcoming flight on 22nd I am not entusiastic rather am scared of the cramped seats and plastic glasses even for beer or drinks. They should at least have the courtesy of giving cans along with a disposable glass. In India whole Shatabdi or Rajdhani trains serve better food in better cutlery to a crowd 20 times that is in the airplane. I think Singapore airlines and others should learn from them. Waiting for the horrific experience to begin on 22nd...
label: positive

text: NOT NO 1 People rave about this airline. The only times I and my family have used it, we have had terrible service, both on the ground and in the air. To the point we would not recommend it and go out of our way to use another carrier. Very disapointed customer.
label: negative

text: Checking in Brisbane Very unhelpful desk staff changed our selection of seats made to feel very uncomfortable and embarrassed Told flight was full but there were at least 8 rows with 1 person in each row we were assigned seats where a stranger was put in middle of us Very difficult to get answers from Singapore Airlines and still waiting for $150 vouchers for 2 people which were offered over 7 months ago It is the ground crew that are outsourced for check in that are the problem no matter how nice you are to them Upon reaching Singapore the staff there were more than accommodating to re seat us
label: negative

text: Singapore airlines sucks I looked forward to travelling my first time with Singapore airlines as I heard good things. What a let down. Delayed times, inedible food, broken seat, crappy inflight entertainment. The list goes on and on. I don’t even mention the trip coming back. You guys suck. Never again.
label: negative

text: Upgrade to Premium Economy My wife and I fly regularly to Australia, we thought we would try Singapore Airways on this trip. Purchased an upgrade to Premium Economy at a cost of £210 each. What a complete waste and money! On the plus side was the larger seats, more leg room and good attendants. On the negative side, was the food , although pre ordered on line, was dreadful, with the beef bourginon awful, choice or one red wine and one white wine, both cheap and undrinkable! Then an hour into our flight, obese economy passengers, who were too fat for the economy seats, were upgraded to Premium Economy free of charge! Don’t waste your money upgrading, or if your obese ask for it free!
label: negative

text: Classy Airline Booked a trip to Australia via an online travel agent and was pleased to find that the airline was Singapore after reading reviews and we werent disappointed. There were 4 of us travelling and I had booked extra legroom seats for 2 of our party as the were 6ft and 6ft 4. We are also tall but were quite comfortable in our regular seats. From the moments we got on board the lovely hostesses in their beautiful "uniforms" made us feel welcome. Nothing was too much trouble and they came around with water and snacks all through the night without disturbing anyone. Meals were served with menus and proper cutlery although the food was average. All there flights boarded (3) on time without delay
label: positive

text: Melbourne to Mumbai via Singapore. Everything from check-in, boarding, cabin service, baggage handling, meals, seats went smoothly on this return flight which we had to book at extremely short notice for a family emergency (booked the flight less than 12 hours hours before departure). The call centre and airport staff did everything they could to sort out our vegetarian meals, and provide a wheelchair for my elderly aunt that travelled with me. Singapore Airlines is generally one of the cheaper options on this route which we travel on quite frequently but I would spend that extra money even if it’s not the cheapest option. No WiFi on any flights.
label: positive

text: The airline take great care if you are feeling ill Amazing staff, amazing service, the food was way too much and so delicious, the on board entertainment was great. I would recommend this airline to anyone traveling abroad. I felt incredibly safe and secure, I slept most of the way and I never sleep on an aircraft.
label: positive

text: holiday We have always travelled with Air New Zealand but decided to go Singapore as they offer more weight in luggage and I found them really good... food was great everything is really good. wil travel with them again.
label: positive

text: Continually best airline in the world for a reason We fly Singapore Airlines when we can as it is always a pleasant experience. It used to be slightly more expensive, but now we find it is on a par with most other airlines for pricing. Our checkin this time was very efficient, the staff were friendly, and luggage was checked through to our destination of Phnom Penh. On board the staff were friendly and helpful as always. Food is reasonable. Toilets are kept reasonably clean considering the number of people using them. In flight entertainment was great, saw a couple of new releases. Music selection suited me as well. All in all as pleasant an experience one could expect for economy class 8 hour flight.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines never disappoints After a two week holiday in Singapore and then Phuket, we just flew home to Melbourne from Phuket via Changi to Tullamarine airports. While the first leg was with Silk Air before our second leg home with Singapore Airlines, at Phuket airport our bags were checked all the way through to Melbourne and our seats for both legs ticketed by a very friendly and efficient staff member. Both flights themselves were also excellent with the very high quality of food, drink & service I have come to expect from Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Comfortable first flight on Airbus A380 It was a pleasant surprise to be seated on the upper deck of the Airbus. Plane was noticeably quieter than other smaller jets. After the 12.5 hour flight we felt less drained than previous experience.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines SQ361/SQ362 - ARN/SIN SIN/ARN Transit via Moscow DME [Update] [This is an update to my earlier post regarding Singapore Airlines SQ361/SQ362 - ARN/SIN SIN/ARN Transit via Moscow DME] When I posted that earlier review I didn't mention that I was travelling business class on SQ361/2, and that I was unable to find a convenient business class lounge for the DME layover. Now that I have travelled this route again here's what I can share with you if you too are travelling business class on SQ361/362 via DME. There is a lounge that business class travellers can use. Its called бизнес зал аэропорта (Airport Business Lounge). Its location and directions to it are actually printed on the reverse of the transit boarding card that you receive at DME. (I only realised that the directions to the lounge were printed on the back of the transit boarding card after my trip was over - easy to miss, and nothing to indicate business class lounge availability after passing through transit security) As you exit from the Transit security area immediately turn left and ascend the escalator (instead of walking along the corridor straight ahead to gate at which you will re-board SQ361/2) to the level above and follow the signs to a corridor on your right that indicates the location of the Airport Business Lounge (there are a couple of other lounges along that corridor). The lounge offers food and drinks and a place to relax. It's about 5 minutes walk back to the departure gate.
label: positive

text: Long haul from Singapore Singapore Airlines normal high standards of service and commitment to their passengers was maintained. An overnight flight, but fed after take off and breakfast before landing broke up what could have been a long 14 hours.
label: positive

text: Perfect flight!!! The best flight I ever had.. steady and calm. Amazing staff, friendly and very helpful all the way through. Good food and beverages, not only at meals but all the way throughout the flight there was water and snacks passing through. Would definitely recommend to everybody this air company and this direct flight from Bcn to Singapure.
label: positive

text: Very good flight as always!!! Great flight connecting in Singapore. Food fantastic with a great menu handed out on take-off. This is the reason for travelling with Singapore airlines as even in economy the small things are taken care of. Staff very helpful at all times Airbus a380 is outstanding and another reason we choose Singapore airlines!! Very comfy + roomy. These planes are much better than the others including the new dreamliner which is small and uncomfortable in comparison.
label: positive

text: As good as ever Travelled on SQ before and their service always good Food reasonable as airline meals go. Singapore Girls all beautiful and immaculately groomed. Movie choices were disappointing both ways. We returned Premium Economy.
label: positive

text: Given an emergency exit seat - Spontaneous points On the return flight from NGO-SIN, we were give. Emergency exit seats, again probably due to our usage of spontaneous points to claim the flight. On our SIN-NGO flight, we were given the last row right next to the toilet. Not allowed to change....This time, we are given emergency exit seats, so not sure if these seats are reserved for points passengers? Need to understand if these are SIA’s policy on points claim.
label: neutral

text: Travelled with a 2.5 year old for the first time Actually quite comfortable and having own tv was a plus. He didn’t wear his earphones but was able to watch the picture. We had wifi which we could purchase on the flight so he could watch his iPad. They provide a pillow and blanket so no need to bring those extra items to lug around. Drinks and meals obviously provided. Loved the wine :) Service is great always smiling and the A380 is a smooth ride. Will definitely fly Singapore again.
label: positive

text: bad flight on return journey We flew Bribane to Tokyo via Singapore. The Brisbane Sigapore flight in the A350 was early in arriving but the food in business class on this route both ways is always bad. The crew on the way to Tokyo were very good.The food Singapore to Tokyo was 5 stars. The return Osaka to Singapore was 5 stars . The B787 on business class was small seats and was very cramped but he food was 5 stars The Singapore to Brisbane had bad food as usual and the crew were the laziest I have ever experienced. A passenger heard them say get the meal done with and turn off the lights.There was not a drink given after takeoff as usual on all Singapore Airlines flights. Ther was no water bottles given to passengers after the first meal. The second meal wa very rushed
label: positive

text: A perfect start to a long distance holiday This was the first leg of our holiday in New Zealand, a stop off in Singapore. Although we hadn't flown with Singapore Airlines before, they came well recommended. The reviewers didn't lie! This was one of the best long distance flights we've had. The aircraft (Boeing 777-300) was reasonably spacious, the food very good and the cabin crew excellent. An overnight flight of 12 hours + was never going to be a sinecure. However, the staff made the whole trip very enjoyable. The in-flight entertainment was very good, with new-rease movies, and satellite box-sets available. We arrived safe and well in Singapore, ready to enjoy what this amazing city has to offer. Thank you to the crew aboard SQ321!
label: positive

text: Great flight and great crew We flew on one of their 777-300er's. It was my first time on that particular type of plane as I usually fly to Asia on the Airbus a380. The plane was well laid out and the seats were comfortable. Boarding was quick and easy for a plane this size. The food was pretty good and plentiful. The crew however was amazing. I somehow injured my arm during the flight and was in extreme pain. The crew made hot and cold packs for me and wrapped my arm for compression. There was an empty row that they allowed me to lay down in to make me more comfortable. The really went above and beyond for me.
label: positive

text: Consistently good Have had the opportunity to fly with Singapore airlines a few times. Always been a pleasure. I order gluten free meals (I have Celiacs), they always have my meals on hand and they even try to find me something when ice creams are handed out on flights.
label: positive

text: It's a great airline The flight was good, there were many good films to choose from Food, I had a chicken meal, it was foul, There were pieces of chicken that had soft skin all over the , I did not eat it, Breakfast, I had continental, which was a bread roll not very impressive Yes I will still fly Singapore again,
label: positive

text: They cancel our flight and push us to an 8h earlier flight, and notify us last minute by calling us internationally about the change. Their customer service put us on hold for more than half of the 25 minute call, something that could have been done online for free, but they found it necessary to call. They even didn't offer food and beverage vouchers to cover the extra 8h on Singapore Airport. Their ground staff was sending us from one side to the other without a solution. After trying to get in touch with them it took 1.5 month to get a reply saying they don't care. Also transfer was unclear as the gates were closed until very close to departure. My inflight food was very bad, and in-flight service almost non-existent. You had to go to the kitchen area to ask for some drinks. In-flight entertainment was good with many recent movies. I will never fly again with Singapore Airlines after this.
label: negative

text: Worst travel experiences for family with toddle. My 2 years old baby was too tired after nearly haft day discover the terminal so he slept right after enter the airplane. But then he was asked to sit up for landing off. Though I tried to explain that he has just slept and we already set the belt on him or I hold him with me but all the crew don’t care about that and still ask me to keep him sit up. My boy then cry out lound for nearly 15mins while the plane go around before landing off but the crew still don’t care at all. Later, he awake and can’t sleep again. Don’t understand why a 5 stars airlines have that stricky way to deal with baby. This might be the first and also the last time me and my family flight with Singapore airlines.
label: negative

text: Once again, brilliant airline, neat faultless We were absolutely delighted with every aspect of the flight. If there are any better than Singapore, I would love to fly them. Comfort, food and especially dedicated and super efficient staff.
label: positive

text: Economy is not my favourite Could not fault the service. Everything clean. Staff helpful. Bathroom clean (tick). Food was okay. Have not flown Singapore for about 15 years and I think the food was better last time.
label: positive

text: Loved the customer service! This is the first time on Singapore Airlines, the airplane we were on was apparently one of their newer ones. We booked Premium Economy, which allows you to choose your meals. They have tons of options and several for those with dietary restrictions. In between each meal you also get "snacks" which includes anywhere from chips to sandwiches! I had the bland meal and boy was it BLAND! I have a lot of stomach sensitivities so this worked for me, however many of the items I couldn't eat because I am also lactose. However, the portions you get are quite decent. As someone mentioned as soon as you get seated you are given a hot towel to wipe your hands on. Each seat has a footrest (thank goodness), however when you use the footrest it doesn't leave you much space underneath the seat in front of you. The seating was two, four and two, then there are actually (at least what I saw) three seats in the back left that are individual seats which look pretty large. The flight looked to only have Business class and Premium Economy. There were tons of movies, shows and music on the flight to keep you busy. Each seat comes with a pillow, blanket and a set of ear phones. There is even a USB port hook up. For the night flight they even give each passenger a small toiletry bag that has socks, ear plugs, sleeping mask, and toothbrush/toothpaste. There are three bathrooms for the back of the plan and then two I believe for those in Business class, however I saw multiple people from my side and sneak in and use those bathrooms! I would say the only “complaint” I would have was trying to get out of the airplane, the Business class were sooooo slow and it took forever! Upside, when you board they have at least two different lines that allow people to go in. However, right as you line up to board they didn’t really call anyone in any specific order, it was more confusing coming back. Overall, we had a good flight, it was quick, staff is efficient, the plane was clean and the staff was extremely courteous!
label: positive

text: Not good as Singapore Airline earned rating Took off from Changi AP at 00:45 13/11/2022 Singapore Air used to be an excellent Airline in the past, not anymore and its service goest down to the tube. Its airfares are not so competitive with other, similar to its cousin SCOOT. Not a welcome drink ( orange juice or water), put guests to sleep straight away and no sign of crew around. Only one meal served during 8 hours flight, 2 hours before landing at Sydney AP, no snack, no refreshment. Crew served meal, rushed out to traveller and did not offer refilling tea or coffee as usual, rudely and walked away with few requests from other travellers. Perhaps guests on board are beggars.
label: negative

text: Singapoor, yes poor, Airlines Lousy help desk at Terminal 3. I flew in from Brisbane. Went to the connecting help desk. She couldn't even tell me which terminal I landed and which terminal my connecting flight is from. The business class didn't even have a choice of food. Only vegetarian. This us after paying $8000 for the trip.
label: negative

text: First time with Singapore will not be the last Flew direct to Auckland via Singapore and decided to up to Premium - great decision. All staff were so attentive and could not be faulted - regularly offered drinks of all types. Returned from Christchurch with an overnight stop in Singapore and again an enjoyable experience. In-house entertainment a great help for someone like myself who does not sleep on flights.
label: positive

text: holiday trip to malasia with singapore airlines. arrived wellington airport, went directly to singapore airlines check in desk, where we were met by a very nice efficient check in girl, who made us feel very welcome. as i required a wheel chair it was promptly bought to me,the service was really great. escorted to the plane I was met by 2 air hostesses who took me tomy seat and helped me buckle in. the meals and the service was supberb. on reaching Canberra I was again assisted to a wheelchair and taken to the lounge. onreturn to the plane Iwas again looked after in a very efficient way being made to feel that I was a VIP again onthe flight to singapore i was well looked after as was my travelling companion.. on arrival in singapore I wastaken by wheelchair to baggage claim, custom etc.andto the taxi ranks where they got us acab to our hotel. I wll definitley be flying air singapore on my next trip over seas.
label: positive

text: Favourite airline - pricy but worthwhile Ease of booking : 5 Ease to amend flight :5 Price : 3 (pays to plan in advance) Pre flight check in : 5 Boarding : 5 Inflight service : 5 Food quality : 4 Beverage variety : 5 Inflight movies : 5 Inflight sales : 5 Cabin / toilet cleanliness : 4 (Sq should freshen toilets more often) On time departure :5 Reliability of airline : 5
label: positive

text: Smooth flight All flights are much the same, but with a slightly different flavour. In flight meals ok and film choice pretty mundane. The crew were beautiful and charming. Connection in Singapore was a bit too tight and meant running through the terminal as well as a monorail ride. Not much to choose between airlines.
label: positive

text: Holiday Time My wife and i flew with Singapore Airlines for the first time in March 2020. Check in was really really good. The lady at check in was really friendly and helpful. She told us about up grades and helped us with the seats we wanted. The flight was awesome. Little turbulence and again really friendly crew. The food was really nice and even an ice cream was offered to customers. It's no wonder they are at the top of Airlines in the world. Will fly again for sure in the future.
label: positive

text: Excellent Service, but issues with new Entertainment System & new seats My feedback was based on both the above-mentioned flight, and the previous flight SQ328 from Singapore to Munich. I flew on SQ328 on 19 May 19 and SQ317 on 3 Jun 19. 1. Professional Cabin Crew and Excellent Service. I would like to commend the cabin crew on both flights, although I was unable to recall any particular names. Especially on SQ317 from LHR to SIN, the cabin crew serving us during the flight when the lights were dimmed have provided excellent service. My wife and I were very grateful that the crew have been very attentive and expedient to our needs, including requests to fill up our water bottle and for cup noodles during the wee hours. 2. Audio on Entertainment System I was initially very pleased to get to use the new Krisworld systems installed on both flights (A350 for SQ328 and A380 for SQ317). The touchscreens are definitely a better interface than using manual controllers in older systems. I was also delighted that I could enter my Krisflyer number or email address to create a personal profile. However, the quality of the audio in the new Krisworld system in Economy class left much to be desired. On SQ328 when I first encountered the issue with the audio, I had thought it was only a one-off perhaps due to faulty earphones. However, my concerns were verified on SQ317 when I experienced the same problem with the audio even though I was on a different aircraft and using a different set of earphones. The bass volume in the audio feed was too loud relative to the treble volume. This was especially apparent when listening to music in flight, as it resulted in muffled, unclear, and even flat tones when playing lower pitch sounds. The higher pitch sounds were okay. What made it worse was that the bass and treble volumes could not be adjusted in the settings. There was only one volume bar to adjust. 3. Lack of Footrest I was rather taken aback that the new economy class seats on the A350 and A380 aircraft now had no footrest.
label: positive

text: Great service Though the flight lasted only a few hours; Singapore Airlines lived up to its reputation. Flight attendants were very attentive and almost always referred to passengers by their names. Food and beverage were excellent. Choice of meal requested was provided. The plane was very clean. Flight was on time. Business class seats were very comfortable. Having flown business class on many airlines; one notices that staff is more attentive to passengers but what I appreciated the most and found most unique was the array of choice in terms of music and movies in their entertainment system - truly amazing - have never experienced such a vast selection. I would fly with them again just for that reason
label: positive

text: Nice flight I feeled comfort during on board. The flight attandance served us very good, the meal varied and delicious. They also served special meal for those who allergy or special need.
label: positive

text: Great airline to fly with! I love flying on the A380 these are my most favourite planes! We were fortunate to be seated by the emergency exit so had plenty of SPACE! The staff were attentive and the toilets the cleanest on any long haul flight I have ever experienced! The inflight entertainment was disappointing but only a mild irritation in the scheme of things!
label: positive

text: Singapore Air - the Family friendly Airlines Travelling / Flying with 2 kids ( 5 & 1.5ys old) is challenging however the onboard c few did their utmost to make our flight a pleasant one and a memorable one too! Always @ hand to offer us early meals for my wife whilst I loooked after the kids n the a later meal served hot for me with an advise - please do not rush take yr time. Kindness with a Smile - what more could anyone ask?? Make Singapore Air your #1 family Airliine (just as we have) and you will never regret it.
label: positive

text: Excellent trip in Boeing 777-200. Flight delayed 45 Minutes. Request for certain seat was accommodated and the flight was only half full resulting in several empty seats given options for sleep. Service good and 2-3 hot meals were served (dinner hot snacks breakfast). Staff hard working and professional. A true 5 star airline with a genuine economy class product.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Manila. Overall a very bad cabin experience. 24 Feb 2019 - SQ917 KrisWorld down for the entire cabin. 26 Feb 2019 - SQ916 KrisWorld still down. reflected that I had feedback a couple of days ago on the return leg from Manila. 28 Feb 2019 - SQ917 KrisWorld still down. Steward was very impatient to the passenger in front of me when asked about the status. Disappointed that my feedback in the last few flights on the same journey wasn't considered at all. 03 Mar 2019 - SQ5254 Preferred meal was forgotten. I had listed a preferred meal in my preference. 10 Mar 2019 - SQ957 Lead steward conveniently forgot about my request. In the end I did not get any meals on board.
label: negative

text: Bit of a disappointment Checked in at Akl airport to start our honeymoon and requested leg room due to my wife’s knee surgery. Was told that the plane was full and we were not even able to get an empty seat next to us which is understandable. However upon take off we noticed an entire row of 3 empty seats right next to us :/. As our seats were right by the toilets at the end of the plane, sleeping on a 10 hr flight was not quite an option. We were checked in all the way to our final destination in Scandinavia when we started the trip but once boarding the second long leg of our trip in Singapore we were not even seated together. That was very disappointing as we told the lady at the check in that we were heading out on our honeymoon and assumed that even if we were given the worst seats on the plane we would at least be seated together since my wife is also a bit of an anxious flyer. So the the next 12 hrs was spent me trying to hold her hand from behind her seat during take off, the turbulent flight and landing. The Actual service on the plane was great. The food was good and the attendants very accommodating. So I guess it was not a total disaster but still not a great start to a trip that is really a once in a lifetime experience.
label: neutral

text: Evangelism School Comfortable flight & great crew. Service is unmatch to other airline. Inflight entertainment is excellent & seat is very comfortable. Direct flight which take 18 hrs is very good as you avoid transit n time wastage.
label: positive

text: Fantastic as always We travelled on two different airlines on this business trip. Singapore was by far the pick of the 2 airlines. Great service, nice meals and a lovely new modern plane. I have flown many times with Singapore both business class and economy, I have always had a great experience. They are my airline of choice.....thanks Singapore 🇸🇬
label: positive

text: LHR to SIN on 15th Feb returning on 26th both legs on 777-200ER. Both legs with window seats. Staff and service excellent food (Asian option) choices excellent and delicious. Plentiful water juice and hot drinks between meals as well as light bites. Hot towels before each meal. IFE selection gargantuan with superb easy to use handset. Seats outbound far more comfortable than on the return sector. For service and inflight experiences one of the nicest I have enjoyed definitely the carrier of choice to South East Asia and Changi airport is a thing of beauty.
label: positive

text: Top notch business class the experience starts at check in .. no queues at business class. After clearing security we head to the business class lounge where we find a great selection of food and drink which is all included in the service ...nothing more to pay .. On this trip we used two planes and the first one was bigger and newer ...I could rattle on for ages but suffice to say everything was exceptional especially the food
label: positive

text: Care about customers The company really cares about their customers. We were about to spend the whole day at the airport when they offered us an earlier flight with an excellent connection. A special thank you to Chris. Unfortunately I don't know his second name, but he was working there on 23/11/2019.
label: positive

text: Great Flight We traveled from Mumbai to Hong Kong via Singapore and back. The flights were on time, the service was really good right from checking in to the in flight service, no room to complain. The food served was good too, being vegetarian causes problems on some flights but not with Singapore Airlines.The seats were comfortable and the in flight entertainment was decent. Will definitely recommend travelling by Singapore Airlines. Additionally, they had an offer running and we received 20 SGD vouchers to shop at Changi Airport, it was a cherry on the cake.
label: positive

text: Use of tired old plans to Perth We were returning from Zurich and took the connecting flight from Singapore to Perth. We were supposed to travel on a 777 but instead they used an old Airbus which was very tired, and had grubby and frayed seats. SIA need to lift their game if they are concerned about their image and either clean up their old Airbuses, or decommission them! It’s not as if we were given a cheap fare deal as we paid a high price for 2 return tickets from Perth to Europe. The customer service onboard is always good but the crew on the day took a very long time to get organised before we eventually got our meals, due to a mixup over the special meals they had to serve first to other passengers. What a shambles!! The meals were not their usual standard on this flight. I am now considering other airlines for our next overseas flight.
label: neutral

text: Good but not Wow, Not no Impressive Catering in/out from Sydney Originally booked on Premium Economy but scored a last minute paid upgrade upon check-in to business class. I was even willing to pay a bit more to score a new suite upgrade, but sadly is full. Beginning at the lounge, perhaps is breakfast and also since it is not a lounge in Asia, hence, the food look and tasted very average or less than average. Fine with the usual western fare but items were mostly lukewarm or doesn't taste very fresh. Asian choice Nasi Lemak also look very sad with limited condiments. Plus point of the lounge is quite spacious and lots of daylight coming in. Perhaps lunch, afternoon and dinner food might be better. Boarding was speedy being is business class despite the entire upper deck of passengers in suites and business. Seated in 97A the last seat in business class was fine. This is my third time being on the new A380 business class. Food wise, have to say catering from Sydney seems not as impressive as from other routes. For many medium, long haul flights it seems satay is the starter but I never get it (haha). Instead gotten a typical Caesar salad but have to say the lettuce was very fresh. Because I was originally in Premium economy, and hence, had already book the cook: Seafood thermidor (the little unwanted brother of lobster thermidor), and have to say this will be the last time I will order this. As they already uploaded my PE BTC meal, and, also I did not want to waste food, nor did find anything particularly exciting from the menu, hence, I stick to my BTC. Just a little note that I find strange that the crew did not ask me if I wanted something from the main menu instead. Now I look back, should have taken the main menu mains. Service wise, was good but not wow. At the beginning, the lady crew serving me was very proper and kind of not very personal. Another male crew was slightly better with little more energy and personality. Would I paid for business class upgrade again? Definitely yes if the price is not too bad and available at check-in. Else, if advance booking, I doubt I will want to pay full price for it.
label: positive

text: Great way to fly and great way to end a holiday... Decided to try the FC product on their 777-300ER. Nice spacious seat and although it is not a Suite product, the way the seat is structured ensure enough privacy. Once again, I have the Kyo Kaiseki for dinner and the cabin is nothing short of fantastic, specially Madeline. Very accommodating and time my meal spacing well.
label: positive

text: Melbourne to London return via Singapore, with A-350 on both MEL-SIN legs, A-80 on SIN-LHR and B-777-300ER on LHR-SIN. Early departure from MEL and very efficient service. The A350 business class seat and fit-out is very modern and high quality. The A380 and B777 is a bit older but still good. Lie down bed takes a bit of getting used to for set-up and pack away, but once you've got the hang of it, it's great. Helps you to sleep much more than when sitting. Meals were very nice and enjoyed book the cook options. The flight attendants felt the need to wake me for meals, even when I had put the Do Not Disturb button on. Perhaps they could say at the start of the flight when meals are expected, or allow you to choose a time within a certain range? The IFE was excellent with a good choice of recent and older movies. I found the headsets pushed into my ears, which got a bit sore after a couple of hours. I wear glasses, so that might be the reason. Amenities were available in the bathroom, although I didn't realise this until the second leg. Perhaps they should announce it or tell you upon boarding, rather than leaving you to wait for a kit? Overall, very pleasant flights despite the length. On MEL-SIN-LHR, the flight arrived at Terminal 3 and departed Terminal 1, which was a bit disappointing for the national carrier's airport. I had gone to the lounge before realising my connecting flight was in a different terminal.
label: positive

text: Very Good A very nice, comfortable round-trip flight Bangkok - Singapore - Bangkok. Everything was as one would expect: a newish plane, clean cabin, quick and easy check-in and boarding, good selection of in-flight entertainment, very beautiful cabin crew (i especially liked their uniforms - very pretty and stylish). I would choose Singapore Airlines again. I recommend them.
label: positive

text: Highest standards This review is for a return journey. We flew the Brisbane Singapore route on the A350 900 regional aircraft and the A380 on the Singapore London route. The regional aircraft is very comfortable in both sitting and lying. We were not as comfortable in the A380. Sitting up straight and lying down was okay but lounging was very uncomfortable with a seam in the seat that ground into one's coccyx. We had window seats mostly and they felt very private. The staff were exceptional as always on all flights and the bathrooms were kept clean and tidy. The choice of food was best from Book the Cook and there was an excellent wine choice. Speciality coffees are welcome. We unfortunately heard criticism from other passengers when we were delayed boarding on one flight. I do think we need to be more generous and understand the world is still getting back on its feet since COVID-19. Thank you Singapore Airlines. You made our trip memorable and nothing was too much trouble.
label: positive

text: Brisbane - Singapore, the flight was smooth, the service was top notch, very professional from entry to exit, nothing was left unturned. It was a red eye flight but the cabin crew were still active throughout the cabin. This is why they're sitting at second place in top 10 airlines in 2015. My only problems were the seat was kind of small for my size but that what you get for flying economy, the in-flight entertainment had a good selection of movies but the screen I felt wasn't clear in this day and age where HD is supreme and lastly the meal was smaller then I remember on my last Singapore Airlines flight 10 years ago. Overall highly recommended airline.
label: positive

text: Flight to Singapore Very comfortable, lovely cabin staff, personal tv’s with not so up to date movies and tv shows but enough to keep you busy. Food leaves a bit to be desired. We flew both ways and one was a day flight and one was a night flight. Hot towels were very nice.
label: positive

text: Good in parts We have flown Singapore airlines for many trips now and always been happy with the service. Don't know what happened this time but it wasn't quite up to scratch. On the way to Singapore my husbands connecting flight (Canberra to Sydney) was cancelled on about 9 occasions which was both frustrating and time consuming. We paid additional money to travel premium economy on the way to Singapore - it was very good and worth the money. Staff were friendly and food was good and plentiful and the additional space in the seats made it comfortable. On the return journey from Singapore to Sydney however we were in economy and there was a limited amount of food. The flight left at 7.30am and we did not eat at the airport. Breakfast on the plane was a bread roll and a container of juice. There didn't seem to be enough staff and those that were there seemed tired and over it (they probably were). It just didn't seem to be up to their normal standard.
label: neutral

text: System fault can’t check in online Due to SA system fault I can’t check in online and therefore have to check in last minute at the airport!! (Can’t check in online means can’t choose seat very annoying) Was given the middle seat which I’m not happy at all as I was travelling alone and always wanted an aisle seat! Despite telling the ground staff at check in counter of my preference they just said ‘sorry we can’t help you should have checked in online) but it’s not my fault that I can’t check in online.. this is not the 1st time... I have since try not to travel with Singapore airline but choose other airline instead because there is no customer service in their vocabulary unfortunately..
label: negative

text: Pleasant flight Flew with SQ in my most recent flight from SGN to SFO via SIN and HKG. In overall, the experience on Premium Economy Class was absolutely great with nice service, good food, thoughtful crew. The aircraft was Boeing 777-300ER. Departure was on time but arrival to SFO was a bit late as we had to wait on tarmac approx 30 minutes before parking.
label: positive

text: Family trip December Business class to Incheon. It was a morning flight. First time on the new plane. Find that the seat seems to be smaller compared to the ones I took previously. Still, the length and position of the leg room is not meant for people with slightly long legs and the slanted angle somehow is not good for long hours of rest should you have a long flight. But still cleanliness and service deserved a thumbs up.
label: positive

text: Wonderful International Experience It was my first flight experience with Singapore airlines on this non stop flight from USA to Japan. I had always used other airlines for my international flights. This was better than I expected. Economy seats are still relatively roomy. Meals and drinks were really good. I'd fly with them again if I can find a good price. Their hub on West coast seems to be at LAX so I would have to connect there to utilize them more. Hope they will expand their stops.
label: positive

text: Flew MEL to SIN using a 777-200. Ever since SQ removed the A380 from Australian flights their value for money is no longer there. The biggest problem is the IFE. During my flight the IFE was not working the movie would break in the middle of the show and during some of the time the voice would disappear. Even with twice re-booting the IFE was not working. During the time that the IFE was working the screen is so small and the picture so blurred that it became impossible to see the picture. The adjustment of the brightness was also futile. Hello SQ these aircraft's should be retired as they are degrading your brand name and definitely not worth the money we are paying for. Even Vietnam Airlines now will be flying the A350 and the B787-900 to Melbourne soon. I'm really disappointed.
label: negative

text: Best flight I have taken! We wanted to try the Singapore Airlines flight to NYC so we booked on this flight which seems to have only Premium Economy seatings. The seats were great and legroom adequate. Service by the flight attendants were great as usual. The in-flight entertainment was a great help as other than sleeping, not much you can do on the plane (to anywhere for that matter). Will fly this route and airline again!
label: positive

text: Lost the Plot Now tried for 3 days to log in as Kris Flyer. Changed my password etc multiple times. Still cannot log in and my experience mirrored by countless others it appears. No customer service. My last flight left late which meant my luggage didn't make my connection at Changi so arrived in Hanoi with no hold baggage. Had to return to airport next day to collect. No a word from the airline re apology etc. Will never use Singapore Airlines again. They are apparently in deep economic trouble which is ONLY due to poor customer service/ management and NOT because of Covid, world current economic climate etc.
label: negative

text: Service and comfort Singapore Airlines always delivers courteous, comfortable amenity. Their meals offer choices for Asian and Western tastes. Staff are always keen to assist customers to have the best flight experience possible. Singapore is a great stop over for Australians on their way to Europe and back, breaking the journey and providing lots of opportunities to shop, to dine, to rest and refresh.
label: positive

text: Day time flight Good flight en excellent service starting by check in, during flight and luggage handling. The food was better than average and a wide range of drinks available.
label: positive

text: Fantastic long haul flight Was dreading a long haul flight but it was really comfortable and easy. The food was surprisingly good and the cabin crew were gracious and unfailingly helpful. The plane was very clean and the change of planes at Singapore was simple. Thank you Singapore Airlines I would certainly fly with you again
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines Cancelled my flight 2 days before my departure and they charged me a $800 cancellation fee ?!!! Worst customer service ever. Haven’t been able to reach anyone from Singapore Airlines customers support in 4 months!!! We lost more than $2,000 when they cancelled our flights!!
label: negative

text: Good Flight and Excellent Services I took an epic holidays in August and September this year. I flew to Singapore for three nights, then to Kuala Lumpur for 3 nights, then to Bali for eight nights and back to Singapore for another six nights before returning to London. Wow what a trip! It was an amazing and memorable holidays. It was therefore very important to choose the right Airline for this trip. It was pretty easy to book Singapore Airline on line and pay extra to choose my seat in advance before getting to the airport. It was also easy to check in by using the Singapore Airline App. I would recommend downloading the app even for one flight. Dropping luggages at the counter were very easy by using the automated facilities at the Heathrow airport. There were staffs at hand in case of any difficulties with tagging the luggages. The flight was full and left more or less on time. The cabin crew were friendly and helpful during the flight. The food was very good and the services were excellent. I found the seat a bit uncomfortable after such a long journey (12hours). Lack of leg room did not help. Yeah, will fly Singapore airline again.
label: positive

text: Better than last time Was heading to KL from Colombo, Sri Lanka this time for a holiday with SQ. It was a disappointment when I flew with Singapore airlines last time but have to say that this time it was way better. The flight crew was friendly and helpful. The meals were average and didn't have better options to choose with. Liked the effort that the team have put in to decorate inside the flight for Christmas. Small things makes a huge difference in the industry. Hope it improves up to the glory they had few years back.
label: positive

text: Poor check-in and boarding logistics and service My trip had the following legs: OSL-CPH-SIN-AKL In OSL there was a long struggle getting around the mandatory visa requirement in the system, which is incorrect, as Norwegians do not require visa to NZ. After some phone calls problem was seemingly resolved, and I was checked-in. In CPH I was called at the gate where a long and tedious processing and questioning ensued as there was an issue with visa - again. They were unwilling to disclose what the problem was, but asked and acted like they tried to solve a new type of problem. After much tos-and-fros I was allowed onboard the SIN flight. In SIN there was not much time between flights, but I made it just in time for boarding only to be denied entry as I did not have a visa. Again - not required. After some discussion the visa track was directed to flight/PNR out of NZ. This flight was never brought up in OSL or in CPH, if it had I would have been able to sort that out well before SIN boarding, and that is also the requirement of Singapore airlines to ensure all requirments of a traveller are met at the beginning of the PNR, meaning that boarding at first flight meets all requirements throught to the end destination. Instead my boarding processes were halted with a system malfuntion requiring a NZ visa. As my NZ flight was booked separately by my travel partner, I had to get that from him. Problem was that he was on a different flight. There was no help from any of the staff in any manner whatsoever, and they did not accept responsibility for this requirement not being communicated to me in OSL or CPH. The only thing that was communicated to me throughout was the errouneous visa requirement. Fortunately my partner had just landed in AKL and thus I got my out-of-NZ PNR and was allowed boarding as one of the last passengers.. He could also inform me that he was not asked for a return ticket out of NZ anywhere on his trip and entered AKL without having showed it to anyone - so this is quite disturbing. No best practices, no adherence to regulations, simply very random. That said the CPH-SIN flight was excellent. Excellent food. Excellent staff. Wide flatbed seat, but it would be nice with a mattress.
label: positive

text: My favorite airline This is our first time to travel for a long flight (14 hours direct) with 1 year old. Flight attendants were helpful and sometimes spoke to my kid when he was a bit cranky. Service was great as usual. I would definitely recommend SQ!
label: positive

text: Singapore to London. Business class with my family for holiday. Daytime flight thus the service quality becomes very important as there were not much sleeping time. A380 has been in service for a while thus the seats are quite worn and despite the best maintenance it still shows, the buttons are tough to press and the inflight entertainment remote is also quite tough to be responsive; having said this they have promised to revamp the seats soon. The seats are quite wide and when converted to a bed the upper part of the seats are wide and comfortable but the lower part where the feet lays are a bit narrow. Food was fantastic as we applied for book the cook facility. The satay was amazing and the subsequent courses did not fail to please my family. Inflight entertainment was very good but I would have loved a wider collection of not-so-recent movies. The cabin service is fantastic; cabin crew makes an effort to recognize us and even some recognized us on other flights where they were on with us on a later date.
label: positive

text: Really disappointing - go BA Had heard great things but service and quality of seating far inferior to that of BA. Food terrible and don't believe it was any different to economy. Poor and slow service. No flight socks, eyeshades, etc. Would not recommend on the basis of this flight.
label: negative

text: The Best Airline ! SIA in my opinion is the best in the world. Charming and well groomed cabin crew, always greeting you with a smile. Going the extra mile to make you feel comfortable. The seat is amazing- leather with full flat bed, with soft duvet and fluffy pillows. It makes the BA business class seat look cheap and tacky. The inflight entertainment always offers the latest movies and a large selection of music from different genres. Food is ok - not one of their strengths. The toilets are always spotlessly clean. The crew actually clean them regularly, compared to horrible smelly toilets on other airlines ie BA -yuck ! There is a reason why they are doing well- they really focus on customer care unlike the other airlines.
label: positive

text: Another amazing trip on our Australian adventure Once again we had amazing service from the airline staff. The food was exceptional, my lobster and lamb meals were restaurant quality and nothing was too much trouble when it came to drink requests, from Singapore Slings to the glass of tawny port with the cheese.
label: positive

text: Excellent service I would like to give a feedback of my SQ983 flight, 25 May 19, Business Class, BKK-SIN. I flew with my dad and mom. Thought it was a short haul flight, I really enjoyed the facility provided in the lounge and aircraft. I would like to especially thanks the Business Class crews, IFS DOREEN AW IFS SEAN LSS MAIRA FS ZACK PEEH FSS LAI The service they provided was excellent. They really care about the comfort of passengers. Although my mom and my dad cannot speak English, the crews try their best to make this flight as smooth as possible. I really really appreciate the service.
label: positive

text: NEVER again ! To leave Singapore airlines a remnant of hounour: The employees are GREAT. Always helpful with a smile. The food is quite good too. Washrooms seem to be cleaned every half hour..... all what one expects when flying with an Asian airline... But just today I completed TWO flights with Singapore Airlines... The first: 2 hours from Ho Chin Minh City to Singapore The 2nd: THIRTEEN hours from Singapore to Frankfurt. And BOTH (different planes) had the SAME PROBLEM. It was FREEZING in the economy cabin. That might be fine for a 2 hour flight, but being wrapped in TWO blankets for 13 whole hours and still being COLD is NOT what I would call world-class air travel. The economy cabin looked like an Obi-Wan-Kenobi convention, everyone wearing their winter jackets and all the blankets they could find...... Turn on the heat, PLEASE!
label: neutral

text: West Jet direct flight available from Calgary to San Diego. it only takes 3 hours and 11 minutes or so. They charged for check in luggage. $30 each bag USD & CAD each way. they provide a drink and snacks. other foods have charges. good flights, but both are delayed.
label: neutral

text: as usual.....great great Flying business on Singapore Air is a treat...Only EVA comes close when flying to Asia. Service is the greatest feature as the staff goes out of their way to assure you of a good experience....
label: positive

text: Rough ride I flew from Singapore to Perth last month after a premium flight from the uk, which was fine but not great. The plane we boarded on the next flight from Singapore to Perth was likened to a cattle truck. Tatty seats uncomfortable , the tv were not working for hardly anyone . Children were standing on seats and parents and children were walking up the isles. Obviously there was no room to nurse a child and I felt sorry for them . Yes I had come off a premium flight of 17 hours but the last five hours of flying on this flight was awful. I won’t fly that route again or with them. The staff were great rushed of their feet.
label: negative

text: In flight service was great, food was pretty good, leg room a little tight for tall husband. The A380 was quiet but the economy seats left my husband a little cramped. The in flight service was efficient, I am gluten free and dairy free and I was provided with plenty of food. Coming home from Singapore to Sydney we upgraded to premium economy, it was fabulous. Much bigger leather seats, lots of leg room, I could move around easily to ease an injured leg and the seats recline a little further than economy. If you can afford the upgrade, do it.
label: positive

text: Not worth the price Constant disappointment with SQ lately. Food is extremely bad, I fell sick after my last short flight to HK. Customer service and benefits for Krisflyer members are mediocre and the website is constantly failing. Not sure what they do with the money they charge cause their product quality has clearly dropped. Not what it used to be. Flying Japanese/Middle Eastern airlines moving forward.
label: negative

text: Best Global Airline I have been a loyal SQ customer since I moved to Singapore over 25 years ago. In that time, Singapore Airlines has only gotten better year to year. The crew are the best I've ever flown with, helpful, always smiling, organized and relaxed boarding, fantastic media access, wi-fi. great equipment, clean comfortable cabins/seatts, arrival/departures always timely...I can go on and on! Of course there is a bit of premium over other airlines but then there is no apple for apple comparison.
label: positive

text: Quickest flight to the UK Flew Wellington, Melbourne, Singapore, Heathrow. It was the fastest we’ve flown, with minimal stopovers (1.5hours) in Melbourne and Singapore. Great way to go if you don’t want to hang around unnecessarily in airports.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Hong Kong, and on boarding I was greeted with a smile, staff directing me to my seat and offering to place my bag in the overhead compartment. I expressed my fear of flying on the A380 because it was a huge plane. The FA reassured me and was able to comfort me despite the fact that it was a rather a bumpy flight. Often, one of the female Flight attendants would come up to me and asked if I was feeling alright. The food served was greatly prepared and Im satisfied. The seats were comfortable and I enjoyed inflight entertainment.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines got us home We booked flights in August 2020 to travel to Australia in November. These flights were cancelled twice: the first time by a flight number change, and the second time by a process error. Thanks to Randi at Singapore Airlines Copenhagen; she ensured we were put back on our flights and worked hard to guarantee our seats. She then took my multiple calls calmly and empathetically when I was worried about changing arrival caps and our ability to travel. Without Randi in Copenhagen, we would never have made it home. Thank you Randi and Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Only one criticism of our flight with Singapore Airlines on A380 The only criticism we have on both flights between Heathrow and Sydney is the poor quality headphones. The sort you have to squash into your ears. Emirates have decent proper headphones. We don't want to have to carry our own headphones with us Please consider changing them. Other than that, the service is wonderful, the food quite adequate and good quality
label: positive

text: They'll get you if they can. I had already booked a seat in cattle class. A situation occurred and I wished to fly business. Well that was easily done but the only problem was that they would charge me for business and not refund any of the money that I had already paid for the cattle class seat. It wasn't like it was a couple of days before the flight but quite some time. The flights were very good and the new aircraft were fantastic. One thing that I did notice on investigation that all the flights were full, meaning that they had been paid for one seat twice. Not a bad scam. A couple of weeks before, I had flown business on Philllipine Airlines. The service was just as good and the food was just a bit better. You know that when they bring the food trolley around on Singapore the smell is always the same and turns you off. I have mostly flown Singapore with family and friends but will look at alternatives in the future.
label: neutral

text: Perfect start to my trip The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, I had no problem with the amount of room around my seat, very comfortable for the 13 hour flight. Drinks were always available, food supplied was a good quality, on board entertainment was exceptional.
label: positive

text: Perth to Singapore to Kochi India and return. Having flown with Singapore Airlines before, I was not disappointed. Beautiful, well presented cabin staff. A little cramped but isn't all economy class? Hassle free check in and bags were waiting for us at both ends.
label: positive

text: There were no manned counters available for economy class at all. Even 2.5 hours before the flight, no staff were available to assist us and staff in Perth airport were not familiar with the self check in kiosk issues. We took a good 2 hours to resolve our check in issues as there was a long line of people waiting in line as all of us had issues checking in via the online kiosks. There were only 2 staff walking around who arrived only 2 hours before flight. We were juggling the queue, our toddler, baggage and when we finally printed our boarding pass, we had to lug everything and our toddler who was cranky at this point from all the waiting and standing and queueing and then self check in our baggage one at a time. It was the worst service ever. Also the captain announced that there will be no wifi for that flight.
label: negative

text: Wonderful flight from Singapore to Hong Kong This was a new plane & it was very comfortable with lots of room. I would highly recommend flying from Singapore to Hong Kong on flight SQ866. Staff were fabulous & flying time was brilliant.
label: positive

text: Comfortable. I flew Singapore Airlines to Munich on a cold, wet morning. I felt pretty grumpy due to the weather and the fact it was so early. Well Singapore Airlines turned that frown upside down. Between the very comfortable seats, great entertainment in the seats and the lovely complimentary breakfast on board my mood changed for the better. Nice job guys!
label: positive

text: YES! YES! YES! Check in has become automated, meaning we were on our own from the printing of boarding pass at at the airport to the checking in of luggage. But there are staff roving to assist anyone if needed. Late boarding due to the late arrival of aircraft but we arrived 30 min earlier than expected. I was lucky as I had the whole row to myself. Thai cabin crew was all smiles and helpful and they were always going around with drinks after the meals. I had to request for some snacks midflight and was given. The special meals I ordered were delicious! Legroom was fantastic. Only complain was, movies were limited. 107 movies but mixed of new and old. But I spent 8 hours sleeping and managed about 3 movies before we landed in BCN!
label: positive

text: By far and away the best there is. We were shown to our seats , which were comfortable and roomy. The food was very good as was the service. Flight entertainment was excellent. I cannot recommend this airline enough.
label: positive

text: Downstairs economy in A380 was not comfortable at all I have flown Singapore Airlines a number of times and never had such an uncomfortable flight. The last time I flew on their A380 I sat in economy upstairs but I think they have since reconfigured and there is no upstairs economy anymore. The seat legroom was really constrained and my sleep uncomfortable (it felt like the seat was also perhaps narrower than other planes?) Aside from that, the bathrooms were kept clean, the crew was efficient and the Hindu meal delicious.
label: neutral

text: Expected a little better First time flying with Singapore Airlines on my way to Sydney, Australia. The service, the crew, the seat comfort, the entertainment, cabin appearance an cleanliness - all great. One thing that bothered me - my flight departed Singapore at 01:30AM local time en route to Sydney. After about 2 hours after take off, I wondered if any food service was going to happen. I walked to the galley and asked one of the crew and was told that they do not serve any food on the Sydney flight after take off, and the ONLY service (on a 9 hour flight) would be before landing. I thought that wasn't quite acceptable. Many, many passengers, including myself, had been travelling for a very long time and some food would've been good.
label: positive

text: A little disappointing This flight was overall pretty good. I like flying with Singapore Airlines. I have to say there were a couple of disappointments. The food was the biggest. I was really surprised at the meal. The presentation was as always top notch, but I found the food bland, did not enjoy the dessert either. I also find it peculiar that SQ does not give business class passengers an amenity kit. On this flight we got a leather pouch with fabric treatment and hand sanitizer. This is not what I expected. The seats are great when upright, wide and comfortable. When set up for bed, if you are a tall person, you have to sleep in a position that is askew. I was in seat 19 A which apparently has a little more room as there is no seat in front of me. Service on the flight is of course top notch. Overall the flight was good, we left on time and got to Singapore ahead of schedule. I used to think of Singapore Airlines as the best business class in the Star Alliance, but I think that title now goes to EVA Air. The difference is the food, including the fact that EVA Air gives you a mid-flight meal great cheese burger available on demand. EVA also gives pajamas to business class
label: positive

text: Great airline Have flown twice with Singapore airlines in the last two years. Manchester to Singapore and Singapore to Perth. Competitive prices. Flights on time. The staff are so polite, pleasant and courteous. Food is good. Economy seats fairly comfortable. Would always choose to fly with them.
label: positive

text: Nightmare Well, after spending an hour on the ground in Auckland waiting for the plane to be repaired we were due to miss our connecting flights however, SIA contacted our flight to say we were rebooked onto connecting flights. Amazing service albeit we ended up with an additional two flights and arriving home 10 hours later than originally planned. The only big disappointment was one member of SIA desk staff at Changi who was obviously close to the end of her shift and did not want to help us to the point of her being very rude. We were even unable to get her name. But she wouldn’t put us off flying with SIA again (unless we came across her again)
label: positive

text: What Happened? I had always trusted and recommended SQ's quality of service until I boarded this flight. The crew did not seem to be fully focused. Our row (last row) was skipped a few times during service. Even when we requested for our food, the cabin crew mixed up our order with other row's passengers. From our seats, we can hear 'ruckus' happening in their service preparation area. There was only one lady who seemed to solo-fight her way saving their flow of service. What happened SQ?
label: neutral

text: Adelaide to London via Singapore was my first experience of Business Class on Singapore Airlines A380, and I was disappointed. Food, IFE, crew etc. were fine (though nothing exceptional) but the seating was a big let-down. With a 1x2x1 configuration, each seat is absurdly wide, which does not make for comfort - with only one armrest usable, the other side requires a pile of cushions as a substitute. The beds do not flatten electronically, and need folding down by hand, a rather cumbersome procedure. When flat the bed is not particularly comfortable, with a small off-set "cubby hole" for one's feet. Furthermore, the overall feel of the cabin was pretty tired; I don't know how old this particular aircraft was, but Singapore Airlines started flying A380's in 2007, and this one was showing its age. All in all, their A380 Business Class accommodation is in need of a radical update.
label: negative

text: Bangkok to Seoul via Singapore in business class. Checkin in BKK efficient, fast track security and immigration took less than 10 min. SQ lounge in BKK efficient. Flight comfortable with decent food. Singapore Changi lounge good, with decent food and drinks. Long flight to Seoul with new business class seat. Seat very comfortable with lots of storage space and good IFE. Food was of poor quality and quantity. This was for sure the worst ever business class meal ever. I pre-ordered the "Signature" lobster thermidor. It was awful. Small overbooked pieces of lobster swimming in butter on a lobster shell. Served with limb overcooked asparagus. The breakfast wasn't any better. I like SQ because of its great service, but the food served on this sector will let me think twice before booking SQ again.
label: negative

text: You Must Be Kidding Me Your website is a joke, stuck in 1995. It is an embarassment to the Airline community. And you can't operate flights on time. ZERO marks for you. Your website was unaivailable for three days and I had to call the Auckland office and spend money to hear it was 'down'. Have you ever heard of 'static pages on websites'. The software developer of your check in page must have finger syncronisation issues, one dialog box out of two is not in sync. Tell them to give me a call, I'll teach them how to fix it. Apalling.
label: negative

text: Not great service We where a bit disapointed with the service and food on this flight. Usually we are very impressed with them but this time they let us down.
label: neutral

text: Two excellent flights The eleven hour flight from Auckland NZ to Singapore was excellent the cabin crew were polite, friendly and very professional, the little extras such as hourly soft drink deliveries allied to two good standard meals made a significant difference. After five and a half hours in Changi airport, were I took the opportunity to visit the 'Jewel', the 14 hour onward flight to Manchester was equally good. The choice of in-flight entertainment was plentiful and as the choices were the same on both flights it meant I could continue watching a film that I'd started on leg one.
label: positive

text: Brisbane to Ho Chi Minh via Singapore. I personally prefer to look for a ticket with Singapore Airlines first before any other airlines unless it's a direct flight. there is no direct service between Brisbane and Ho Chi Minh so I was excited about my flight home with Singapore Airlines. Very friendly and efficient ground service. Cabin crew is the among the nicest. Always up for your request. Food quality has gone down as compared to the past. However, drink game is up from offering cocktails and liquor for economy class. I thought I would enjoy the A350-900 more but turned out I like the Boeing 787-10 better. Too bad that the flight with 787-10 was too short. Overall, Singapore Airlines will still remain my top choice if I have to book a flight.
label: positive

text: Give this airline a miss. A combination of delayed flights and lost baggage for all 4 travellers in our party made this an experience to forget. Waited at the carousel for almost an hour but no sign of luggage. Went to the baggage service desk to be told they already knew our bags were still in Singapore. Why didn't they save us the time and call us on the tannoy??? Customer service person then told us the bags would be arriving that evening and would be couriered to us asap. After 3 days of emails, phone calls and text messages to Singapore Airlines we finally received our luggage. My brand-new hard-shell suitcase had the lock broken off and was also damaged and squashed. I subsequently submitted a complaint to Singapore Air but was told basically to bugger off. Absolutely shocking customer service.
label: negative

text: The Best By Far This airline deserves to be number one, there is an old saying, that the customer is king and yes that is just the way all of Singapore airlines staff treat their customers.
label: positive

text: Flight cancellations, excellent communication and prompt refund Due to Covid-19 all four of our flights from Perth to Hanoi were cancelled. Singapore airlines provided an easy online process to claim for a refund. Money was deposited into account 8 days after the last flight date. Could not fault the service and looking forward to rebooking next year.
label: positive

text: Great airline, now terrible The service and seats were terrible, the business class seats didn't even lie flat. Food was mediocre and some inedible. This could be the worst business class I have ever flown. Drinks limited to white or chilled red wine. I also flew premium economy which was a total waste of money. SA have lost the plot big time!!
label: negative

text: 1st class experience This has to be one of the best airlines in the world. The service from the air stewardess was fantastic. They would pay extra special attention to my 2 year old child making sure that she is enjoying the flight. There were also some toys given to her. The food served were delicious and typical type of drinks of Carbonated drinks, Juices, beers and wine were available. The entertainment were also great as there were alot of latest movies and dramas worldwide available. Hot towels were also served just before the flight. the flight was also safe as well.
label: positive

text: When I checked-in online for this flight, there was a premium economy seat that can be selected even if I only bought an economy class ticket. I selected it and I was able to have the seat with no extra charge. I was pleased with the ground handling, service and quality of food. The Laksa was very delicious! The flight was on-time and the in-flight entertainment was top-notch! One thing that was not working is the Wi-Fi as I was only able to use it for a few minutes. I will definitely fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Take your own food Usually i cannot find fault with Singapore Airlines. I would choose them every time.This journey was the exception. The crew were not a cheerful bunch and the service was poor. The food was even worse! Cold, soggy, tasteless meals with hard, dry bread. It was difficult to get a drink - not just alcohol which I don't drink - water seemed to be restricted.Special Assistance was not booked even though I had 'phoned to double check before flying. Only two months before I wrote to the airline complimenting them on their service. Still, at least it was on time.
label: neutral

text: We flew Singapore Airlines business class on an A350 Brisbane to Tokyo via Singapore. The meals on the Brisbane to Singapore were as normal not interesting but the Singapore Tokyo flight the bento box was 5 star. The flight crew were great. The Osaka flight on a B787 again the bento box was 5 star and all the crew helpful and understanding to everyone. The B787 in business class the seats were smaller than usual and the plane was noisy than the A350. The flight home Singapore to Brisbane, a passenger heard the crew talking that they rush the meals and turn off the lights. Well after take-off they were no drinks supplied but a rushed meal service which was not interesting (why do they not do a meal service that they do from other capitals). They did not even supply bottles of water after the meals service like on other flights. This crew were not efficient.
label: neutral

text: Process rushed and cutting on the essentials Love the plane and the in-flight entertainment but SQ is rushing and cutting back on customer care. This flight was an example of the growing tendency of Singapore Airlines to try and rush their service and forget about customers wishes (experienced on Business and PE too) They don’t have a full drink service after take off preferring to other a limited selection of drinks. They don’t proactively offer socks or sleeping masks even on a 12 hour plus flight. Getting the attention of staff is increasingly difficult as they rush by and this is particularly acute with the stewards. I was offered an extra drink which was promptly forgotten. Eye contact is limited as they rush by. Generally I get the sense there is an attitude of ‘provide the basics fast, get the passengers to sleep and avoid engaging with them’.A shame, all process but limited focus on the individual.
label: neutral

text: Customer Service Is Worthless Don't worry about contacting the airline because the dont exist. They have no customer service and don't care about anyone flying. I tried to change a flight and after spending more than 3 hours twice I never reached an agent. Just know that once you book your flight than you can't change anything ever. They don't have any customer service at all and will never take your call. I will never ever book with this airline again.
label: negative

text: Traveled from Singapore to Zurich on A380. The Kirsworld entertainment system is excellent! but not touchscreen and must be operated by a remote which seemed old to me. The food served on board this Singapore Airlines flight sector was great! I was served two meals and both tasted okay no complains from me. The service standards from the FA is still as good as before! As this was a long haul flight toothbrushes and socks were given out to all the passengers including blankets and pillows. The FA's made lots of trips around serving water and OJ trying not to make the passengers dehydrated because of the flight. The FA's also forced all passengers to shut their window blinds to give passengers more rest as it was in the day. Overall another excellent flight on Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text: Still the best This flight from Manchester employs the Airbus A350-900 whereas the Heathrow option is on the larger A380. I much prefer the benefits of higher pressurisation and humidity with the A350 which do make a difference. Manchester Airport is very busy but efficient and less of a hassle than Heathrow. I have travelled with Qatar and Emirates but still prefer Singapore Airlines for consistency and connections at Changi.
label: positive

text: A pleasure to fly with Singapore For years I've had to change flights when flying MAN to IAH, so the introduction of a direct flight by Singapore airlines was great news to me. But it's not just the faster journey time and the benefit of a single flight that made this journey great... the service provided by Singapore is simply light-years ahead of the alternatives. The planes feel so much better; they are cleaner, more comfortable, the seats feel more spacious, and the entertainment is fantastic. Unlike US airlines, all drinks are included in the price. And also unlike US airlines, the staff are pleasant, helpful and don't make you feel like you are ruining their day simply by being on their plane. Highly recommended... I'll definitely be using Singapore Airlines for all future flights to Houston.
label: positive

text: Great airline to travel long haul Singapore is always my first choice for long haul travel. Modern well equipped planed with lovely staff and good food in economy. The bonus for New Zealand to the UK is only 2 flights and the delight of stopping at Singapore. Looking forward to the flight home tomorrow.
label: positive

text: FLY HIGH Singapore Airlines never fails me. From the moment you check in up to the time you landed they take good care of you. For me one of the best airlines!
label: positive

text: Nice flights, first leg got Premium Economy seat (but still normal Eco-Service) being SQ Gold. Nice hot meal as per the new concept for short flight with SQ. Long layover in SIN, could visit the new Silverkris Lounge and then onwards on SQ's new 737max. Very comfortable plane, nice interacting crew and lovely dinner served, watching a good movie on their in flight entertainment!
label: positive

text: Business Class Flight - First Class Service Seamless check-in made for a good start. As expected the cabin crew were most courteous, friendly and efficient, doing their best to provide a comfortable and relaxing flight. Food and drinks were of a very high quality. Unfortunately the entertainment system and business class cabin design showed this to be an older aircraft which required some updating, having previously experienced the A380 Airbus business class cabin with Emirates. Departure and arrival times were spot on
label: positive

text: Hardworking crew the crew didn't disappoint.. regular walkabout in the cabin with drinks, that is so essential for a long flight. there was something wrong with my entertainment system and it was attended to right away. appreciate the great service. putting the amenity kit on demand basis, didn't bother me too much but thought that its more of a basic gesture if its long flight.
label: positive

text: Services are deteriorating! 1.) Flight delays: SIA flights seemed to have more and more delays over the years. This time, they delayed my flight for 2 hrs and caused me to miss my connecting flight. 2.) Extremely careless Flight stewardesses: On one aisle, one stewardess smashed the food cart on my sleeping spouse's knee. On the other aisle, another stewardess smashed her food cart onto my elbow. I wondered how many other passengers were being hurt. 3.) Re-connecting flight: They promised us a bed of roses on the flight that they would take care of rebooking another connecting flight for us. In reality, they rebooked our flight only when we landed in San Francisco. That was not it. 4.) Irresponsible airport staff: The "airport staff" on the ground took us round and round with 8 pieces of luggage and booked us on a flight next day as early as 6 am in the morning without offering me a night stay of hotel. After I screamed at her, and reasoned they should compensate me with a night of free hotel to rest up before traveling again. The delay was caused by SIA, not other airline. She was obviously inexperienced and tried to push responsibility to other airline. After she disappeared for a while, she came back with a "handwritten note" assuring me the Hyatt Hotel nearby had a room ready for us to rest. She didn't offer me any confirmation number, neither for the re-booked flight nor for the hotel reservation. My gut was telling me the hotel room was not going to show up. True enough, that happened. 5.) Hotel room was not available: When I arrived at Hyatt Hotel, the receptionist checked and said SIA has not faxed over their paperwork. I tried calling SFO office, they were closed until 6 hours later. Thus, Hyatt cannot check me into a room.
