Thanks to Hyatt Hotel's airline agent behind the reception saw my exhaustion through the camera, he advised me to check-in with my own credit card first and he would take care of the business with SIA later. And he or Hyatt did. This shows Hyatt works more efficiently than SIA. 6.) SIA's reimbursement: Only USD$20 per person for this delay which was resulted in the mechanic problem of their flight's battery. It is not our fault. We were not reimbursed with the transit charges between the hotel and the airport. With all these info, you decide for yourself if these troubles were worth the cheap airfare they promote. Even if you purchased Business or First Class, there would not be any difference in their delays or the reckless stewardesses' ramping carts. Mind you, I am a Singaporean at heart living abroad, I have always proud of my own national airlines. This experience has totally disappointed me and changed my view, trust and confidence in SIA. If they don't re-train their staff, at home and abroad, their business will suffer. Their so-called promotional airfare is not that cheap after all. I need to re-look at other airlines for my frequent travel back home. It's my second nightmare traveling with SIA. Good luck to you!
label: positive

text: Cattle class seats really uncomfortable Singapore Airlines used to be great, but their standards have slipped. The economy seats are so uncomfortable. Their budget airline Scoot is far superior in this respect. Flights are often late and no one seems to care any more. The prices are absurd now. The planes are also rather old and tired. They need to get newer planes and make the seats suitable for long flights.
label: neutral

text: Pure Experience This is my Airline of choice because of its pure Service with a smile, from cleanliness to the amenities. Food is just normal. The warm welcome makes me feel comfortable. However, a bit of disappointment due to my seat request. Though, it was granted but I was at the last row in the tail side which makes me feel groggy throughout the flight.
label: positive

text: SQ860 SIN-HKG. 777-200ER. After flying MAN-SIN via MUN this flight was my final leg. I was greeted by FT who when looking at my boarding pass knew straight away that I had a special dietary requirement. Throughout the flight this FT seemed to have remembered a certain number of people's names in our cabin and spoke to us only by using Mr or Mrs as a prefix to our personal names. I was overly impressed as this is something you just don't expect in Economy Class. The service was excellent with refreshments throughout the flight. FT's were friendly and didn't disturb you if you wanted to sleep. A very comfortable trip with personal entertainment lots of leg room and a very high standard of service. What more could you want?
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines - Simply Amazing! Booked an isle seat while my friend booked the window seat with the hope that no-one landed in between. Found on take-off that the seats in the middle row were totally unoccupied and the hostess encouraged me to move there so I put all the arms up and slept all the way to Singapore. That is all I can say about that flight. Then - from Singapore to London. I had 'made an offer' ($900.00) which was 'unsuccessful' so my friend paid over $1,000 for the next leg so she could upgrade to premium economy and I had paid about $30.00 for a specific seat (I really wanted an isle seat as being a bit (OK a lot) older I didn't want to have to climb over two people each time nature called Then...Waiting to board the plane, for the second leg of our journey I said to my friend "I am going to be the last person on so they have to page me and I will record it on my mobile, just for fun." Then they paged me! After asking for my passport, they advised that they had a family travelling together who wanted my seat and was I prepared to give it up. Given that my girlfriend had abandoned me to go premium economy I now wasn't worried about keeping my seat so I agreed to give it up. THEN They put me in a 'premium row' with additional leg room!! The other two people advised that they were 'platinum flyers' but didn't upgrade because they wanted to use their points to fly their whole family on holidays. However, the hostess treated them like VIP's and it rubbed off on me. I got a complimentary goodie bag and lots of attention from the hostie. I may have drunk nearly a whole bottle of Baileys on the trip to London (OK I did) and stocked up on chocolate bars, chips and muesli bars for later consumption. It was an EXCELLENT experience.
label: positive

text: Check-in was fast, because I could use the business-class check-in counters as a PPS-member. Otherwise endless queues. Boarding was slow because the flight was full and I boarded late with the crowds. No recognition as a Solitaire-PPS-member on board as before. Cabin crew busy with 'sorting' the passengers and their cabin-luggage to not miss our slot. Seat in a 3-3-3 configuration very narrow, seat-pitch ok (for me being 1.7m only) sufficient, however. Left channel of my speakers was not working, even after exchanging them. Internet not working on my phone, either. No help given to connect, as on earlier flights, instead 'proof' was given to me by a flight attendant that Internet was working on her iphone. Not really helpful. No reading materials. Very basic and little food-options offered in a tiny cardboard-box, 'designed for a reason' (whatever this reason may be). Very inattentive inflight-cabin-crew: As for the after dinner drink I was ignored by the them while my two seat-members got served their drinks of choice. Minimum seat-recline, similar to those in budget-airlines. No soap in washroom. No disinfectant-kits offered as advertised, I got one after request only. Wearing a mask, which is 'mandatory' was not re-enforced, a man in the middle seat was wearing his mask under his chin - no one of the crew cared. Overall the crew seemed to be overworked and de-motivated. The typical glass of champagne offered to me as a PPS-member when I raised my concerns did not really help, it just would have been good enough if the cabin-crew would have fulfilled their duties. Disembarking was fast and swift as well as delivery of my checked-in baggage.
label: negative

text: Best airline out there! This was my first time flying with Singapore Airlines, but it won't be my last! They made a 15 hour flight "fly" by. With all the entertainment and food/drink options, you aren't bothered by how long your flight may be.
label: positive

text: NO CLAIMS FOR DELAYED BAGS if your bag arrive after 3 to 4 days. They will not give you a penny. Try entering right booking ref. it will not accept and you have no other way
label: negative

text: Surprised by the service for a long haul flight This is not the first time I took SQ for a long haul flight. But this is definitely the first time I have experienced such poor service on board. I do understand that there are definitely new steward/stewardess every year. I believe there would be ample training for them before they started to fly. But I don't know if they are the new stewardess or have been there for some time. There are about 2 main meal serving and 1 teabreak serving. I can understand if you make mistakes for the 1st meal serving. However, each serving was either short of some cutlery or the food was taken wrongly, or the stewardess were busy entertaining themselves while serving. It just makes my whole journey unpleasant. I also do understand that the walkway is a bit small and these stewardess can bump here and there. I don't see it in any other flight, at least. Everyone said it's the best, and I thought I should give a chance again. But, each flight in SQ just make me regret more.
label: neutral

text: They Changed my seat last minute from Bulkhead Waited 5 months to get a round trip ticket with bulkhead seating due to blood clotting Disorders. Finally got middle row bulkhead. Then at last minute they switched me and did not seem to care about my medical condition that could result in DVTs and Pulmonary embolisms on this 18 hour flight. They asked for medical proof, which was sent, and they then ignored the medical need. So so very disappointed. They know I am very prone to blood clots and have a high probability of getting one yet they gave. Away the special seat that would prevent such a problem, a seat I waited for months to get . Also separated me from my wife when they switched my seat. So for 18 hours we are now at opposite ends of the plane.
label: negative

text: Outstanding attention to detail Superb attention to detail from food to personalized service. Outstanding food choices Could have chosen the chef! Ultra-Clean cabin All “trash “ picked up instantly SIA needs to update the App. Propensity to give incorrect information for connecting flights from SIN to LAX The price of airfare was very reasonable compared to all airlines especially US airlines
label: positive

text: Manchester to Houston. 30th anniversary included a bucket list experience on Singapore Airlines new A350-900 aircraft. The experience was fantastic, the service superb, and Singapore Airlines lived up to its ranking. The cabin is so quiet and the seats are the widest. Lie flat seat provides enough space for my 6ft plus frame, even if I did have to tilt a little to fit my feet in the slot. IFE was full of movies on a great screen and the food was delicious, especially Tiramisu. Don't miss the Singapore Sling, the signature cocktail of the airline. Only negative is that the cabin can tend to be warm, and there are no individual vent controls to adjust comfort levels.
label: positive

text: Fab New Seats Loved the new A380 seat design. So much easier to decoy the bed. And even better we cauliflower the divider between us, down to squab level so that we could see each other & chat easily throughout the flight. This airline continues to provide great service & comfort. Been flying with them for 20+ years.
label: positive

text: My first time on SQ since before the pandemic and was looking forward to it. The product has changed however and not for the better. The meal has no menu (WiFi version didn’t work) and there are no branded products on the tray. Alcohol is available but only on request. Drinks are served without snacks or a napkin. Mid flight snacks are available. IFE is poor compared to other premium carriers. Crew were immaculate and excellent as always. Good VFM ticket too.
label: neutral

text: Singapore airlines is not anymore what it used to be I always book emergency exit because I am a quite told person. Today, they have changed the plane and my new seat did not have extra leg space. As a PPS member I requested an upgrade to business because all emergency seats were occupied. After 30 minutes arguing with the person in charge I was told to do an upgrade online ( paying for it!!) dear Singapore airlines people: not everything is money and you have disappointed a very loyal customer.
label: negative

text: Flights are great but the customer service dpt. is a crap My experience of the customer service call center was one of the worst. I needed to do two things: 1) change a flight date. 2) request an unaccompanied minor to travel alone internationally. When you call them, expect to stay on the phone at least a couple of hours. They are so slow, the phone line drops frequently, and they don't really know what they are doing. Keep checking your flight info online. Otherwise you don't notice that your request was completed. They change your flight date without your consent. The email system doesn't work, either. I needed to send a same single form for about ten times- they kept sending me the same email with the questions again and again after I have already returned the forms. After all, they did not have my submitted forms on file at the ticketing counter. It was a mess.
label: neutral

text: Long haul great service I would always choose Singapore Airlines for long haul. The staff are friendly, attentive and helpful, always with a smile in their beautiful outfits. The meals are very good - even in economy - and a good range of films etc on the inboard entertainment. The flight home seemed longer, thanks to someone snoring for 10 hours non-stop, so I will invest in noise cancelling headphones if I do this trip again.
label: positive

text: The way to travel. We mostly fly with Singapore Airlines as we feel they are one of the best. We booked Premium Economy for extra space. When we booked there was a special offer where we were able to "Book the Cook". This meant we had first class food and was served first. Haven't flown for three years and must say that Singapore Airlines have updated their entertainment system with so much more ....films, music and games. The stewardesses/stewards are always obliging in making your flight as comfortable as possible. I would definitely recommend flying with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Surprisingly Disappointing The seat was only ok since it only reclines up to about 40 degrees. The leg room when the legrest was raised is rather small, and I'm not even very big (175cm 72kg). When the seat was folded down into a bed, you end up lying diagonal to the screen and into an even smaller footwell. In the entire ~36 hours of flight time, I don't think I ever found a comfortable position to fall asleep in. Everything just felt very un-ergonomic and just wrong in general. The only positive feedback about the seats would be the many compartments available to store your belongings. I ordered the Halal meal, which ended up being tasteless Indian food (i.e. Tasteless briyani with Tasteless unrecognisable Indian bread and something they try to pass as Curry) for ALL the services. I am sorely disappointed that SQ is not capable of providing decent halal meals like Emirates, Qatar or Malaysian airlines. Heck, even KLM does better. I would think they would be better off just serving me Vegan food instead. Both the "halal" dessert and normal service dessert were very underwhelming. The inflight entertainment was good and I liked that you're able to sync it to your account to resume on other SQ flights. However, both my seat and neighbouring seat had to have our systems reset TWICE on the flight, which takes about 10-15 minutes. Which left me uninterested to resume watching and just carried on with entertainment on my iPad. Overall, for the price I paid for a Business Class ticket, I feel like SQ did not deliver as compared to my other experiences with other Business Class seats in other airlines including KLM, Turkish Air, Malaysia Airlines, Emirates and Qatar Airways. Honestly, this will not be a flight I will ever be taking again. I'd rather have a transit anywhere else and enjoy my flight, rather than take a direct flight from Singapore and just be uncomfortable the whole way. I did enjoy the Virgin Atlantic lounge in EWR but the lounges in KLIA and Changi T3 were a HUGE disappointment in terms of lousy food selection. On a more positive note, the flight crew were attentive and pleasant. They were also very apologetic when we complained about the rather insulting "Muslim Meal".
label: negative

text: A good experience with Singapore Airlines Efficient and on time, Allow stopovers in Singapore and fly into one city and out of another without increasing the fare. Changi Airport amazing.
label: positive

text: First time with Singapore Airlines Our first time trying Singapore Airlines. Very happy with our experience overall (as happy as you can be flying long-haul economy). Just some confusion over whether we had to choose our seats or whether they were already allocated. So I called the customer contact centre who said they couldn’t tell if we were already allocated seating together. The staff member then chose our seats for us for both the outward and return journey. The cabin crew were very attentive and courteous. Unfortunately they ran out of both dinner options on Melbourne/Singapore leg so we could only have seafood or nothing! This happened also on the return flight when they ran out of the omelette option for breakfast and only had seafood on offer. Not much good if you don’t like or can’t tolerate seafood. The seats were ok, actually better on the shorter leg, (Singapore Melbourne, Melbourne Singapore.) Would fly with them again.
label: positive

text: wonderful inflight experience! Half way into the evening flight to Haneda, casually chatted with one of the Japanese crew about sake recommendations in Tokyo. She returned shortly later with a hand written list of premium sake brands, where to get them as well as Tokyo restaurant recommendations! What a delightful service experience, thank you Masako-san!
label: positive

text: An excellent flight with Singapore Airlines from Wellington to Canberra. The flight attendants were exceptionally friendly, professional and attentive. The food was also very good. The seat was perfectly adequate for the three hour flight and looked ok for an overnight service. If I did have one complaint, it would be that the cabin was uncomfortably warm. The flight left on time, arrived early and I was out the front door of Canberra airport ten minutes after touch down, a great new option between the capital cities that I look forward to using on a regular basis.
label: positive

text: Bali Denpasar to Tokyo Narita via Singapore. I was looking forward to flight with SQ after a while. Although the current situation due to global pandemic got me bit worried to kept flying for this holiday. Since it wasn't a cancelled flight/ route, I decided to carry on. The flight for DPS-SIN were rather full and I enjoyed their Boeing 787. It was a short flight and dinner were served during the flight was delightful. We had a quick layover in Singapore for my connecting flight to Tokyo with A380. I sat on lower deck and the plane was merely full. They gave us light meal before turndown service, however a mistake was made by the cabin crew as they gave me a wrong food that am allergic too (I've never requested). I got sick during the flight. They kept apologise to me and one of the senior crew came to approach. They offered me a doctor service upon arrival in Narita which I refused. I got slightly better, but it shouldn't be happen. Despite of the allergic reaction due to their service, overall I was still able to enjoy the trip. It was just hindering me to give them a perfect score.
label: positive

text: excellent have flown with singapore a few times now and never been disappointed,check in easy ,seats comfortable and great legroom for a long flight, food is good for airline food no complaints, service good, overall very good
label: positive

text: Good service doesn't cover everything... The airline was fine. However, several of us booked a round trip to India; subsequently, the event we were attending was canceled. Although we bought trip insurance, Singapore Air did not allow us to change return dates to leave in ten days instead of six weeks. It cost each of us $900 additional! If at all possible, I intend never to use Singapore Air again.
label: neutral

text: It is indeed the best Airline!! I use Singapore airlines for Business. I always fly economy and sometimes economy premium. The service, room, entertainment are simply the best! Price-wise I would say it is also very attractive!! Well done Singapore airlines!!
label: positive

text: Singapore to Shanghai flight Nice and comfortable seats via airbus A380, punctual arrival and departure. Clean toilet and service oriented cabin crew.
label: positive

text: Nice experience We took 4 flights in total. First 3 flights were pleasant but Last flight from Singapore to Sydney was not as expected. Seats were uncomfortable and the service was not up to Singapore airline standards.
label: positive

text: Menu Items not available Am a Kris member and Singapore Airlines is my default airline for travels via Singapore.. Noticing a drop in standards for Economy flights. Last four trips on Singapore Airlines am finding the onboad menu card lists liquers as a drinks selection but told one no liqueurs are available, or only Baileys available (not suitable for me as I'm lactose intolerant). In the past had no problems in getting Drambuie Cognac which took 15 minutes to be served.
label: positive

text: Comfortable Flight Even the flight is about 15 hours, it is very comfortable flight with spacious leg room and a variety of inflight entertainment. The only set back is they did not provide a toiletries like toothbrush
label: positive

text: Had a very pleasant flight on a 787. Very attentive and polite staff despite the fact it was a "red eye" flight out of Perth. Awesome staff, well done. Flight was 20 minutes early. When I tried to register my Kris flyer points on board the aircraft it kept telling me that my membership number was invalid. I will follow this up with SIA in the near future.
label: positive

text: Poor. Lhr to sin Really awful flight. People in seats in front reclined seats for entire flight. It was impossible to: Eat Watch film Go to loo As the space was only 10 inches from face to reclined seat. I asked stewards to request seats to be set to ‘normal’ for food, but this was ignored. 13 hours of discomfort - not great. Avoid if you have a choice ( Vietnam airlines are far better!!!)
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines - Adelaide to Singapore (Changi) Business Class On arrival at Adelaide Airport, the check-in staff we helpful and as a business class traveler received priority express check-in at the airport. Once clearing the security checkpoint at Adelaide airport i was able to quickly approach the immigration area. There was a priority express immigration lane for business travelers and i was the first traveler through immigration and into the secure international departures. Once you clear immigration you have access to a duty-free shop. The Singapore airport lounge at Adelaide Airport is small but has everything you need. There are drinks and a small selection of food. Access to the lounge is via a set of escalators down to the lower level. At the bottom of the escalators turn left and the lounge is right in front of you. When it was time to board, i left the lounge and headed straight to the gate and again received priority boarding past all the other travelers waiting in line to board the plane. Once on board it was a very comfortable flight. The flight was aboard A350-900 (9v-shd) which only entered service at the end of January 2019 so was all of 4 months old. The air crew were all very hosptiable and the food and drink service was very good. This new plane had a large touch screen with a very good selection of movies and tv shows. This is connected to a touch screen remote so you can access your media selections while reclined. There was a single mains outlet for any power you may need (laptop) and 2 x USB charging ports too, which i found very helpful. There was also on-board wi-fi for business travelers which was great. There is a complimentary 30MB of data which lasted me about half of the 7 hour journey. There is the option to buy more data for a small fee, but i opted not to use this. The aircraft had approximately 40 business class seats in a 1-2-1 configuration and only about 50% of the seats were occupied. I purchased my return ticket on sale in March 2019 for approximately $3000 AUD. Baggage allowance permits 40kg checked bag and 2 x cabin bags of 7kg each. Check-in staff did way the cabin baggage at check-in, which i thought was a little surprising, but although one bag was over the 7kg, the other was not and they were happy for me to leave items as they were and just suggested i remove my lap-top from the heavier bag when boarding. On arrival in Singapore the disembarking process was excellent. Within 30 minutes of touch-down, we had taxied to the gate, disembarked, cleared customs, collected bags and checked into my airport hotel (Crowne Plaza). Such a quick and painless process. Highly recommend.
label: positive

text: Great Airline Have been flying recently with Singapore Airlines and use mileage for claim partial airfare on my Hanoi Trip. The fare is worthwhile for a superior class airliner compared with the budget flights. Service is good and always feel at home even high up in the skies.
label: positive

text: I wonder how brilliant First Class can be The hostesses were the nicest, most welcoming people and you could see they actually cared about you. The entertainment was very up to date, the seats were super comfy and clean. The bathroom was clean with luxurious toiletries. I had restaurant worthy food for the 1st time inflight and everything on my plate tasted really fresh. To crown it all they served beautiful ice cream on the way to and an ice cream sandwich on the way from the Philippines. From the point we checked in to the point we got off the airport, we felt like royalty. This is truly the best airline in the world. Flying economy and getting such amazing treatment, I am going to save up and upgrade to Business class on my next flight and be literally on top of the world.
label: positive

text: Singapore airline The flight was good, clean, good services, food was bad, beverages was good, punctual,the food was very bad
label: neutral

text: A Rare Taste of First Class on Singapore Airlines The benefits of being a loyal frequent flyer and a full flight resulted in a rare occasion of an upgrade at the boarding gate. Hey, no complaints on a Sunday morning on SQ 211. While it was a bit too early to try the Dom and Krug, it was relaxing to soak in the pampering service and ample space and privacy. SQ does shower you with amenities such as pyjamas, toiletry kit, B&O headphones and customized dining schedule. I did soak in some caviar with a glass of French Bordeaux and reminiscent of the days when I was frequently upgraded by CX to First class....on one occasion to be seated next to Sting on a Tokyo to HK flight. In any event, I value safety and timely arrival over the class of travel but once in a while, an upgrade is well appreciated.
label: positive

text: Don’t travel Singapore Airlines or you have sick parents Flight SQ 241 - I was treated so rudely by the flight staff when we landed in Singapore. I had booked wheelchair assistance for my 76 year old dad has acute asthma and hip problems and my 73 year old mum with both knee replacements. I was told I need to walk to the buggy area as there didn’t have the staff to assist with the wheelchair. My dad ended up having an asthma attack and my both my parents were distress with high blood pressure. After such a long day for Dehli to Singapore we had to catch a flight to Sydney with two unwell highly distressed parent where no one cared to give them wheelchairs or any empathy. I am utterly disgusted with the way I was spoken to by the flight crew (a guy - I don’t remember his name) however the ground staff was not very helpful either.
label: negative

text: Frankfurt to Singapore. Superb product! Right from boarding till reaching Changi. Boarding began in time and orderly, zone wise boarding which helped in quick boarding and we left within 25 minutes considering it was a fairly full flight. We were greeted by delightful and genuine crew. The aircraft was clean and business class is the best I have seen. Premium economy seats are very comfortable with lots of options to store gadgets, charging point, usb port and big hd screen with many options. As soon as we were airborne, hot towel service followed by snack and drink followed by meals. I used the cook the book service, passengers using such option are served first, this doesn't allow you to dine with your fellow passengers unless you wait. Usual meal service was hurried and crew seemed to be in stress as economy in back was completely booked out. The meal by itself was okay. For premium economy I would have expected to be elaborate. Trays were collected after a while and rolled down service. After some hours I tried thier snack service, crew delightfully greeted and opened snack options and gave me more than requested. Fresh fruits, sandwiches, chocolate waffles and crisps. The crew was also courteous enough to inquire if they could do anything so that I can sleep for a while. I also noticed that crew went through cabin couple of times to anticipate our needs. Although captain announced turbulence and turned on seatbelt sign, crew walked through cabin with torch to check seat belts and ensured we fasten it. They even fasten seat belts for passengers who were sleeping, never seen such care on another airline. Breakfast was served before landing and immigration cards were handed in time. At all times, crew were caring and meticulously dressed. I am very impressed by Singapore Airlines and thier product. Definately my first option to Asia.
label: positive

text: Good clean comfortable SQ never fail to make our flights pleasant. Cabin crew all friendly, cabin clean, toilet clean, in flight entertainment very good. Good enough leg space for me (5ft 10, 1.76m). Food as usual, I didn't like. On board food is never nice, IMHO. Good red and white wines served. Will be flying again with SQ soon. Wholeheartedly recommend.
label: positive

text: Love the airline because of Virgin When flying where Virgin Australia does not go I fly Singapore Airlines. Some of the planes still need to be upgraded but all have a nice feel. I do find they need to recognize there other airline high flyers with a bit of a more personal welcome. The seats in Brisbane lounge need a bit of a upgrade but the food is great. If flying Business class make sure you go online and select the "book the chef" for your meals alot more choice. Lay flat beds would be better if electric but not hard to ask one of the cabin crew to sort it out while you go to the toilet.
label: positive

text: excellent Flight was excellent, the flight crew were fantastic, the seats on the upper deck were comfortable, service was impecable, there are a lot of airlines that would benefit from taking a leaf out of Singapore airlines method of operation
label: positive

text: SIN-CHC overnight flight in economy. Singapore Airlines has been my favorite airline for over 30 years so I am disappointed to write a less than stellar review on this occasion. Flight attendants remain as helpful charming and efficient as ever. Food and wine are excellent down to the after-dinner ice cream. But this old B777 was tired. So much noisier than the A380 we had just been on. After being in premium economy standard economy seats were so tight. Poor tall guy in the seat in front must have found it tough. Even with a free seat in between myself and my wife it was hard getting in and out and a bum in the face is just not a civilised way to travel in my opinion. We really hope Singapore Airlines introduces premium economy and newer aircraft join this route soon! (The airline is scheduled to launch P/E in September). Another letdown was the IFE. Poor choice especially audio. I like to settle down and doze while listening to some relaxing guys. I gave up on both audio and video as the headphones were useless and the white noise too much to hear anything. Improvement required!
label: neutral

text: Comfortable Flight The flight is new and the service offer by the crew are excellent. The have 2 different menu, Asian or Japanese. Usually I will take the japanese set as they serve good quality food. New Osaka flight have a big TV touch screen. They also keep the washroom clean by cleaning them up regularly
label: positive

text: Traveled 4 segments. HKG-SIN-SYD and return on a 772ER 773ER A388 and A333. Haven't flown long haul with them for quite a few years but I think it has deteriorated. Seat pitch is too tight for an airline like SQ and the cost cutting in services is apparent with the bottle of water provided gone and wine glasses replaced by plastic and red and white wines now poured from a large bottle instead of the airline sizes they used to provide. I also remembered when flying long haul some years back they actually provided hot chocolate drinks throughout the night which doesn't exist anymore. It just feels a lot more budget than it used to be. In terms of the cabin and plane 773ER had the best IFE and new seats which i think is slightly more comfortable than the ones on the A388 and A333 which had identical seats and IFE but still I regard those seats as being too hard. While the A333 is supposed to be the newest plane at just 2 years old the fact that it's leased and a bridging plane meant that it was fitted with old seats and IFE the same as the A388 which SIA has flown as much as a decade. Service is OK overall but the SYD-SIN leg had a rather less enthusiastic air steward serving my section but I do accept that there are the occasional bad days. Sharp contrast to EK which I have also used during this trip. Seats better legroom better IFE better food better beverages better.
label: neutral

text: Travelling in comfort Travelling to Europe with Singapore was excellent. Pleasant and helpful staff, and meals hat looked like real food. Lots of water and other drinks to keep hydrated. Staff were not intrusive but were able to assist when needed.
label: positive

text: Melbourne to Mumbai via Singapore. My recent journey with Singapore Airlines was really great, the crew was friendly and helpful. Me and wife were traveling with 1 year old baby and we felt like one of the staff was appointed specially to us. We are very happy with the service. Thank you Singapore Airlines. I would give 10/10 for service, but I have to give only 7/10 for flight as it was very old and noisy flight .
label: positive

text: Premium Economy? Don't bother.... Saved hard to treat myself to all that Singapore Airlines promised for the Premium Evonomy experience and what did I get - more leg room, yes but I'm short so it wasn't the reason to book this. I was looking for all the extra service they promised and did not experience any difference from economy. The seat was hard, the headrest was broken, the blanket was scratchy and the toilets were not kept clean. Drinks service was invisible and the food was ordinary. Not happy. My advice - save your money!
label: negative

text: Always happy to fly on SQ Always happy to fly on SQ. Service and planes are always good. Although slightly pricey, you get your money worth. I stopped over in Changi so that I could visit Jewel and it was impressive. I would reccomend SQ to my friends if its within their budget.
label: positive

text: Boeing 777-300(ER) Premium Economy Extraordinary! Amazing service and very comfortable seat, the lavatories were clean and young/disabled passengers are well taken care of with special amenities. Although there was a slight delay in Sydney due to slot times, the crew was very informative about the situation. I strongly recommend SQ's Premium Economy on the Boeing 777-300(ER)!
label: positive

text: Premium Economy is the New Economy I was excited about the non-stop flight from Singapore Airlines which we always have had incredible experience with. However, with the newly launched non-stop flight to Singapore, there are several misses which I felt degraded the overall experience I had come to expect from Singapore Airlines. While I have no complains with the seats on Premium Economy ("PE"), I am less than enthusiastic with the service on the flight compared to what I used to experience with the A380 on Singapore Airlines from JFK. SQ021 only has business and premium economy seats on the flight. This basically means PE is the new Economy, and it does feel a little that way for the flight as the basis for comparison is just between PE and Business. The plane is definitely smaller than the A380 and it feels that way despite the slightly higher ceiling. There really isn't much room to wander around since the PE class is all the way at the back of the plane, compared to the A380 where there is a galley area to hangout during the long flight, and a much larger economy class area to roam about. Amenities kit is limited to socks and eye mask, but on the bright side, they do serve decent champagne like Moet & Chandon. The Krisworld entertainment is amazing with the touchscreen and full of movie/tv/music options. Service wise, the crew was very attentive, though I feel that there seems to be less interaction with the passengers than the usual flights, perhaps due to the long journey. While the non-stop flight did shaved a couple hours off the journey, I think I would go back to the regular Frankfurt route with the stopover as it was nice break, and being to stretch and walk about for a bit was great.
label: positive

text: We flew to Phuket via Singapore and as with previous trips the flight went without a hitch. The service was great and the staff worked really hard to satisfy all. The food was above average and filling and the drink service well above board.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines new route Singapore - Canberra - Wellington - Canberra - Singapore. Flights to and from Singapore are overnight flights departing 23.00 from Singapore and midnight from Canberra to Singapore. Old plane but has 34 inch pitch in economy, heaven compared to other airlines 31-32 inches. Seats are quite firm but a good 19 inches wide. In both directions the meal is only a snack with a drink after takeoff, served really quickly to be able to turn the lights off. Extra drinks only on request. This allows Wellington passengers to get some sleep as they have already had a 3 hour flight to Canberra and a 1 hour transit. Breakfast is generous served with coffee and tea refills. The other bonus for this flight for Canberra residents is not having to get to Sydney or Melbourne and not having to deal with Sydney airport. For many Canberra residents it is only a fifteen minute drive to Canberra airport, check in is fast as it is the only flight out. With internet check in it is a bag drop. You can leave home two hours before take off and be in the departure lounge with time for a drink before boarding.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Tokyo Very comfortable flight. Food was good, hostess and steward good. And wider seats than SilkAir. Will definitely fly with them again
label: positive

text: London to Singapore. Dedicated first lounges at Heathrow, Singapore and also Hong Kong, unlike Emirates and Etihad that put first customers with business flyers at some airports. When your paying this much money it’s not acceptable. Amazing staff and food, especially book the cook. We had very turbulent flights and as a nervous flyer they couldn’t have been more caring. Absolutely not a bad thing to say about them apart from the fact that we weren’t on a A380 but 777 which is a horrible plane to fly.
label: positive

text: Inconsistent service with SQ Flying with SQ in business class is supposed to exceed our expectations. Unfortunately the service onboard was average this time. It doesn’t reflect the reputation.
label: neutral

text: Poor, nothing to Sing about. Not good, not good at all. Pay a lot more than economy a get very little more. Seats not comfortable and although a little more room than economy they don't recline enough. Vietnam Airlines and EVA so much better. Food was terrible. Ordered diabetic menu and was unbelievably bland. Staff were more concerned about making sure we kept our masks on than making sure we were comfortable. Certainly won't be using them again. Certainly won't be going to Singapore again!
label: negative

text: Their warmth is world class They run their airline like their country. Quietly efficient. Check-in was quick, boarding was seamless and on-board overhead lockers are larger on their new aircraft. They tended to me pre-flight and served a delicious meal. If any passengers experienced discomfort with cabin pressure they'd alert the pilot and a more gradual lift/landing was exercised. I found the seats to be comfortable and roomy with a great selection of in-flight entertainment.
label: positive

text: Economy never again! The slightly more expense to fly Premium Economy rather than Economy is well worth it. If you are only 2 travelling together, then the 2 only seats on either side of plane are perfect. In the middle is a 4 seat configuration. A much smaller secluded seating area with seats more like recliners. Large Entertainment screens, wider seats with more leg room. The best is the Noise cancelling headphones (not the earbud type you get in Economy). Even left it on when having a snooze as it amazingly cuts out all other noise. Needed to take them off when speaking with flying companion as couldn't hear a word spoken. Also have the choice of selecting your own meals by booking on line before flight (Book the Cook). A lot less expensive than upgrading to Business. If you choose to risk it and book Economy, you may receive an email a week before the 1st SIA flight, inviting you to make an upgrade bid. You won't know if your successful until 48hrs before flight. Did that the 1st time (2017) and were succesful. 2019 trip didn't want to risk it so paid for Premium Economy up front. Wasn't much more than our first bid of $480 extra per long flight.
label: positive

text: Paid top dollar for business class. Horrible. New beds horrific I can't understand why the bean counters are able to make a decision without spending the 8 hours in the seat. So easy to go from best airline to worst. Great service great people but at end of day it's all about the seat. Rubbish. This is how airlines die.
label: negative

text: Pretty good, all things considered Flew back to AKL from SIN and after the flight up with Air NZ we were looking forward to comparing the service back with Singapore Airlines. We were in a B777-300ER which with Singapore's service has the cattle class seats configured in 3-3-3 meaning you have slight wider seats and better aisle room that some airlines which fly the B777 with the 3-4-3 configuration. Seats were comfortable and the in-flight entertainment system excellent. Seat recline was too much - the guy on the aisle seat across from me had a real issue with comfort as he was a big fella and had another big guy in front of him who reclined his seat full back, giving my neighbour virtually no personal space. That's probably as much to do with passenger flying etiquette as anything else, but a more restricted seat recline would certainly have helped. Staff service couldn't be faulted, Meals were OK - So much nicer they at least have you eating with stainless steel utensils, and not the plastic knives and forks used locally - so much better environmentally, We had a substantial tail wind coming back which was great given we had a tight transit time in Auckland. Much of this time saving was used up however as it took well over 15 minutes from stopping at the terminal to actually leaving the aircraft, as they let the higher paying passengers off first before the many in the back of the aircraft. It was pretty good service but I still rate their SilkAir regional brand as a better airline.
label: positive

text: Comfortable flight. This is a good airline with very helpful staff and good inflight entertainment but thought the food was average.
label: positive

text: FLEW ECONOMY. but got first class experience Wow.. the staff are so friendly. The sits are comfortable. First class service all the way. Toilets were clean, which isn’t always the case on other airlines. Comfortable pillows. All round the experience was so much better than other airlines.
label: positive

text: London As always we choose to fly with Singapore Air and the trip was part of the visit. Excellent service, comfort, lovely food. We had another wonderful experience and will definitely fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Very unhelpful customer service STAY AWAY FROM THESE JOKERS! They are terrible with customer service. I booked a flight on their website from Houston to Manchester. When I got the reservation, it had me going to Manchester, but then returning from Dublin! Dublin was never even on the site and I double checked. I called the customer service when I noticed this and they wanted an extra $1800 for us to change our tickets. Now we have to find a way to get to Dublin just to turn around and fly right back to Manchester to get back to Houston. It also stuck me in economy after we selected economy plus.They showed no remorse or willingness to help us. I'll stick with United from now on.
label: negative

text: Best Business Class Airline - Worldwide! Awesome business class service, everything was fantastic Staff were awesome - the below staff were highly professional throughout and should be recognized/rewarded, they were a million million times better than BA Lee bian sze Tan hui Juan Faiz Ramdan Tan lye huat I'd fly again with them in a heartbeat.
label: positive

text: Silk Air Singapore airlines in general is good but Silk Air doesnt do justice specially when it comes to travelling with infants. The bassinet provided hardly fits in and is very uncomfortable for little ones. Hope they improve
label: neutral

text: Used to care about customers--not anymore I have flown Singapore Airlines from the past 20 years regularly to India from SFO. They used to care about customers before; apparently, being named the best airline in the world has gone to their head and they think they no longer have to satisfy their customers. I flew Premium economy recently to Bangalore--the flight was ordinary. I was expecting an offer to upgrade to business class before my flight (like Emirates, or even China airlines, offers) and I have more than 50,000 pts. No offer came--I tried to offer a bid, the system didn't allow me to. When I saw the flight, there were plenty of seats empty in Business class. Not sure why they don't want to offer the premium economy passengers to upgrade to business. Warning to everyone travelling from SFO--some connections to India have a very short layover--less than an hour. SA doesn't have any consideration that if the landing is a few minutes late and the connecting flight is within 30 minutes, they shouldn't make the passenger run from one terminal to another even using Skytrain. I barely made it before the gate closed (with my bad knees). Remember, you have to go through security in Singapore when you have a connecting flight. I had to rush from Terminal B to C. While returning from Bangalore, I had ~4 kgs extra. Instead of asking me to pay using my over 50000 points, Singapore airlines charge me for a whole piece. So watch out, even if you are just 3- 4 kgs over the limit, they will charge the cost of a whole suitcase. This is another example of not caring for customers. They can charge per Kg weight instead of an additional piece of luggage like other airlines do--no, they are special because they go the tag of 'World's best airlines' :(. Not allowing me to pay extra baggage with my points, no consideration if you are Kris flyer member with 1000s of points, they just don't care about you but want to make you pay for everything. Flight and food was ordinary (food quality has declined from SF to Singapore) and the bathroom cleanliness while going and coming was not up to par like it used to be. Changi airport is exceptional of course. I am not sure I will be flying this airline again while there are so many carriers who offer upgrades for reasonable price, cheaper tickets. Not sure what to do with more than 50,000 points though.
label: negative

text: Worst customer service ever. Gave us a wrong information and made us buy another ticket for double the price. Convinced us to give a full refund on the initial ticket saying it would take 24 hrs for the refund. Been a month, still haven't heard anything 😕. Do not trust singapore airlines
label: negative

text: Nice comfortable and friendly flight My first experience and I was nicely suprised, everything was clean, staff extreamly nice and helpful, I got even hot water and my vegan meals were tasty. They provide realy good service, thank you
label: positive

text: A great way to fly! It was a treat to fly home to Singapore from NYC after a 12 day business trip in Suites. I usually fly Business and the inflight service and hard product are already very good. In Suites, the service was a notch higher than in Business (if that is at all possible). The food was also a notch higher than in Business (which is already very good). The Suites product (the first generation suites product) is still very good. The full length bed was extremely comfortable. All of this led to an excellent flight.
label: positive

text: 5 star for flight attendants, always friendly and helpful. The A350 seats are thin and hard. Boarding process was very unorganised. Quality of my food was terrible. SilverKris lounge at Changi airport was chaotic, impossible to find a seat.
label: negative

text: Booking nightmare I had an extremely disappointing experience with Singapore Airlines. My holiday plans changed and i needed to make some changes to the dates and times of the flights, but this appeared to be impossible to complete. On 2 or 3 separate occasions i called the Singapore Airlines telephone helpline and talked to operators in the Philippines. On each of these occasions i spent 2 to 3 hours trying to undertake and confirm some simple changes to my flights. On each occasion the operators were not able to process and confirm the requested changes. I also (on numerous occasions) emailed Singapore Airlines with the details of the required changes and the details of the telephones conversations. From all of my attempts to communicate with Singapore Airlines i did not receive a single communication or confirmation in response. Incredibly there was no audit trail or evidence of any of my conversations with them. I checked my itinerary through the Singapore Airlines website about 3 weeks before i was due to leave to find that my return flight to NZ had been completely cancelled. I then decided to cancel the flights, but was incredulous when i found that i would have to pay the flight cancellation fee - this despite the debacle that had occurred up to this point. In the end i had to purchase a last minute, expensive flight with an alternative airline - which was a very simple and straightforward process. In summary, i spent and wasted significant amounts of time dealing with Singapore Airlines, had to pay a cancellation fee and incurred significant additional cost as a result of Singapore Airlines ineptitude. I have flown with Singapore Airlines previously and have found their aircraft and services to be good, but i am disgusted with how i have been treated on this occasion. On this basis i would recommend other airlines (such as Emirates) in preference to Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text: Traveling Premium Economy I was somewhat disappointed with premium economy class travel as the main benefit was good legroom, more baggage allowance and a quick check-in at the airport. Meals were the same as ordinary economy class, we used the same toilets and any other amenities on the aircraft. I would suggest that considering the extra cost, business class offers better value for money
label: positive

text: Always one of the best that I have flown in. One of the best airlines in the world and the Service and inflight crew are consistently excellent,so is the catering and amenities provided
label: positive

text: Very good Nothing to complain about but also nothing that stood out from other airlines. We flew an Airbus 380 on part of journey that was better than the second half with was a Boeing 777 (I think) and it seemed less cramped. Staff were as friendly and helpful as other airlines we have flown with both short and long haul.
label: positive

text: On a recent flight from Perth to Singapore, I was asked by the cabin staff whether I preferred beef rendang or western-style chicken for dinner. I asked for beef and was told that the beef sets on her trolley had run out, and I would have to wait. I was expecting her to get me the beef set from another trolley when, just seconds later, the stewardess abruptly placed a chicken set on my tray. She opened the foil to show me the contents and said that the chicken “looks good too”. Without further explanations, she went on to serve the others. I was bewildered by her unprofessional and amateurish attitude. Not wanting to create a fuss and feeling tired, I just accepted what was given. This incident might seem trivial, but such small things do make an impression and affect my decision to fly with the national carrier again. The crew members just seemed to be rushing to get their jobs done, and the warmth of the Singapore Girl that is so widely advertised simply could not be felt. Apart from personal grooming and the technical aspects of their duties, I wonder if soft skills and proper service attitude are sufficiently emphasized during their training.
label: negative

text: Flying in comfort Singapore airlines has the best food and largest business seats of any carrier. Flight staff was extremely nice and accommodating.
label: positive

text: High quality flying experience Always a very pleasant experience with Singapore Airlines. The plane was spacious, the seats are comfortable and the staff are polite, friendly and helpful. There is good choice at mealtimes and plenty of options from the in-flight entertainment system. I managed a decent amount of sleep to arrive fresh and ready to face the day.
label: positive

text: Upgraded We had a smooth check in at Brisbane even got asked if we were happy with our seats and would we like to change. Our flight was in two stages with a stop in Singapore. Only had a hour to spare between flights but made the connecting flight with plenty of time to spare. We got upgraded to Business Class from Singapore to london which was a first ever for us. The Air Hostess were great and couldn't do enough for us. On the way back we had Premiun Economy seats are we won't be going economy on long flights again. Plenty of room to more and stretch out. Totally Enjoyed our flights.
label: positive

text: Excellent customer service The aircraft is very convenient.The service of the ground staff and inflight crew very helpful and customer oriented. One crew member called Adrian gave me a excellent service.
label: positive

text: Flight Experience on SQ37 Direct Flight LAX to Singapore i've travelled on SQ dozens of times and this is one of my best experiences. it is a long haul and the Chief Stewardess Ms Audrey is really warm and helpful. She is passionate about her job despite being in it over 25 years. She takes initiatives to replace a meal immediately.
label: positive

text: Ripped Off! Totally agree with the review from Warren B (Sydney). Premium Economy with Singapore Airlines is a total rip off. The food was inedible on the way over to London (not too bad coming back) drinks were scarce and had to wait in line to use the Economy bathrooms. I have traveled all over the world several times with a multitude of different airlines but Premium Economy with Singapore Airlines is a sick joke. DO NOT USE THEM!!!!!!
label: negative

text: Selina is Singapore Airlines best Crew member On 16/8 I flew from Paris to Singapore. Throughout the flight I was served by Selina and I have to say, she worked so hard but provided service which was out of the skies! A very smart, well spoken and customer friendly individual! A real credit to the brand. You ask for a drink and she will automatically come to check if you need a top up and bring snacks too, effortless, all done for you by a professional!
label: positive

text: Excellent service onboard I flew Singapore Airlines yesterday and had a great flight. Cabin crew were lovely. Food good, and plentiful. Only negative was the air conditioning on Singapore to Amsterdam flight was too hot and extremely drying. Otherwise a good flight.
label: positive

text: Comfortable On my return flight to Singapore from Taipei, there was a 2 hour flight delay. The ground staffs took care of the passengers really well and ensured that all passengers were comfortable in the waiting area.
label: positive

text: Excellent service We flew Singapore Airlines from Heathrow to Adelaide via Singapore using both the airbus 380 and the dreamliner. The 380 was a brilliant and extremely comfortable plane with plenty of legroom including rockers for your feet, this aircraft was far superior to the dreamliner which we took to and from Changi to Adelaide although this was also a comfortable plane. The service provided throughout all flights was beyond reproach with in flight food and drinks on tap served by the politest staff you can imagine. 5star treatment even in economy class.
label: positive

text: Incredible service! Recently travelled to Kathmandu to trek to Everest Base Camp. Chose to fly on Singapore Airlines which proved to be an excellent decision. The crews were very friendly and provided excellent service. We will definitely fly Singapore in the future!
label: positive

text: Our preferred airline We flew with Singapore Airlines and their partners from Sydney to Vietnam, Cambodia and Singapore returning to Sydney. Our flights were all good and the long haul flights were excellent. They were comfortable, not crammed; service was excellent; facilities were clean. We have flown with other major carriers, two in particular, but their service/cleanliness has been hit and miss and passengers crammed into every seat. Singapore will be our preferred airline.
label: positive

text: Great flight Flew October and November to England via Copenhagen and return to Brisbane. Had a great experience in business class. Service was great. The seats are amazing. Being able to lie down makes a huge difference to long haul travel. Flew premium economy with Singapore last year to England and did think it was a waste of money. Was not impressed. Did not pay that much more to fly business.
label: positive

text: Comfortable flight, plenty of entertainment and friendly staff! We'd flown with Singapore Airlines before Sydney to Thailand and were happy with the comfort and service so chose it for our long haul flights to London via Singapore. We were not disappointed. It was one of the cheapest flights with the shortest duration with transfers. We were very pleased that we could do International Check-in via our domestic airport in Newcastle NSW - only Singapore Airlines offers this so far. The flight was obviously long but comfortable with plenty of entertainment, food and refreshments to distract. Would definitely choose again!
label: positive

text: such a nice experience flying with SG This is my first time flying with SG, I have heard the good comments about them for a long time, and I couldn't agree more with those compliments because it's true. The steward and air hostesses were nice, they provided the best service. I love the thing that they offer you the hot hand towel when you get in the cabin. Which I never experienced that with other airlines.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Tokyo Narita. I'm a Krisflyer gold member and have been spending most of my air travels with this airline, but this time service is a bit disappointing, especially food. While IFE and seats are fantastic as always (and new too!), food and beverages were disappointing. They prepared not enough Japanese menu for breakfast. These day Singapore Airlines seems to be reducing the meal volume. Some flight attendants look like new hires and know little about passenger services.
label: neutral

text: great service awesome service. flight attendants were obliging and walked the plane during the trip to bring drinks and snax . toilets were kept clean . we appeared to have more legroom than previously... it was comfortable enough anyway.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines is not the number 1 airline in the world for nothing I flew with Singapore Airlines from Cape Town to Phuket via Changi Airport. My favourite aircraft is the Airbus A350-900. The seats were comfortable, the legroom was spacious enough for me. The food was magnificent. The staff are very helpful, friendly and efficient. There were pillows and blankets for the passengers. The staff are very professional. I felt safe flying with this airline as they have an impeccable track record. If ever i must fly to Asia i will choose this airlines above any other.
label: positive

text: “GREAT SERVICE – GREAT AIRLINE.” We had good reports about Singapore airline and we were no disappointed. We had a return flight to Singapore from London – in economy class. From the time we bordered the 300-380 aircraft, the service was ‘brilliant’. Helpful and Cheerful stewards. A good amount of space for an economy seat. The food was good with a printed menu from which to choose. The staff [including the male stewards] had a really good empathy with children who were on board. I would travel with this airline again.
label: positive

text: Not so World Class! No so 6 Star Hospatility! I recently flew on flight SQ241 from Singapore to Sydney. Being Thailand based, I fly very often on this route and the carrier I use are mainly Thai Airways or Singapore Airlines. On my several occasions flying on Singapore Airlines, I experience the same reoccurring nightmare on my inflight experience in economy class that I question their sequence of service in this cabin. I am not a fussy nor needy traveler, but I have year of travel experience to give an opinion. This nightmare has become unbearable for me and want to share my experience. We all know that crew members attend briefing, and all crew knows the flight profile of the flight. SQ241 & SQ211 flights, has lots of connecting passengers from India. Lots of special meals, babies & bassinet requests, and wheelchairs etc. Flight often delayed due to connecting passengers. Understandable. First meal service begins from the front of economy class cabin. Continental breakfast (no big deal) easy on the crew, drop food trays on tray tables, coffee/tea/juice etc. Special drinks request is still manageable as crew often don’t stock various soft drinks in their trolleys. The crew must run up and down the aisle to get stock for passengers. Yes, I get it when stock runs down during service but not every time a passenger ask for soda water and the crew keep running back and forth. This part I don’t get it. I have seen in other airlines that I have travelled with has one dedicated crew doing drinks cart (including mixers and cocktails) and one dedicated to doing meal trays. The crew that does the meal services cart than come back to help with drinks services once all the meals trays are on tray tables. Some airlines have some form of liquid to offer you with your meal tray i.e., sealed cup or bottle of water or a terra pack of juice (something small) to tie the pax for the moment until the drinks trolley comes to their section for more drinks or special drinks. For the main meal before landing, the crew took a long time to sort out special meals. Seem like there was lots of confusion and missed meals for passengers. The plane was full of passengers from India. They are around me and I can hear their request/demands to why their meals are not served yet and are wrong meals. As confirmed by a crew member when we asked. I was served my meal 40mins before landing. Being at the front of the cabin, you are being served last because the meal service begins from the back of the cabin this time. We could have been served in a timely manner if your senior crew is organized with their special meals request. 10 mins into my meal, the captain announces to crew to prepare cabin for landing. I had to rush thru my meal and finish quickly. My request for a soda water could not be fulfilled (can you guess why…. crew were trying to feed passengers and clear trays at the same time, plus they do not stock sufficient soft drinks in their trolley.) so I settle for an apple juice. No big deal. It was in the last 20mins before landing that I saw 3 crew members from business class came to economy class to help the crew to prepare the cabin for landing. Stowing away passenger’s luggage/bags, bassinets, taking food trays away etc. Wonder where the co-operations amongst crews went in the earlier part of the crisis. We understand crews has specific duties to perform but it was a crisis in economy class but no sign of any camaraderie on that flight amongst crew. So, with that said, we asked to speak with a senior member of the crew in charge of the cabin (red kabeya) but she did not turn up. It took a second request that she finally came to have a word with us. She knew everything that we had to tell her. She even said that we know more than her and the crew members. Crew members attend pre-flight briefing, if you know that you have over demands for special meals request what would you do? Crisis management, getting help from other cabin crew when there is a crunch in Economy class. Is the senior crew in red kabeya afraid that her integrity be questioned or will she loose face because she did not plan her workflow properly? Or that’s our (SQ) procedure and policy, we are adhering to it! (Heard that excuse from a crew member before on other SQ flights to Sydney) So, in conclusion, Singapore Airlines over the years have hyped up travelers’ expectations when flying on Singapore Airlines. Even more now with this “world class” thing that we see advertised all over the world. It is very difficult to be reasonable and forgiving even in the smallest glitch that may occur, be it the service or the hardware. It’s supposed to be “world class” and that is everything you do; it’s supposed to be perfection. It’s supposed to be 6-star hospitality. With no help from social media, lots of good and bad comments are floating out there, some are legit, and some are just pure unreasonable. I am sure you have a team to look at those to decipher and respond. Personally, I will refrain from flying this route on Singapore Airlines. One less passenger/s will not make a difference to your company’s profitability. One less passenger/s will not make any difference to how “world class” you want to be. It has been an experience/s over time that is unforgettable.
label: negative

text: Good and sweet flight We had a comfy and good flight even it was so long. Breakfast, lunch and brunch included. Thank you Singapore Airlines for your services!
label: positive

text: Really up to the mark ! I flew first leg of my trip from mumbai to Singapore it was wonderful Upper deck on A380 was awesome even in economy Food was great Vegetarians were happy And yes a toilet bag was also given on this 5 and half hour flight! 2nd leg to Pu dong Was comfortable as well Fly always the best!!
label: positive

text: Organised and so friendly Excellent service from beginning to end. My sister was turning 70 on the flight over to Colombo....apart from being a perfect flight, the staff arranged a cake and champagne for our group of four and made a special effort to ensure she had a memorable flight! Meals, movies, service ....all No. 1.
label: positive

text: This is Nightmare!!!! We had!! a booking in Singapore to Lombok and back (on 10 February to 17 in February). A morning when I woke up, an email arrived, that somebody-somhow deleted our booking and we get back the money also, although we didn't want that!!!! We have to fly there, because there are programs and accommodation reservations, what we cannot and don't want to cancel! Since then, two weeks have passed, we wrote more emails, but besides the automatic replay and they we asked for the patinece, I didn't get any answer and solution about what happened. We need this tickets, but the price now much higher, like when we bought it. It is becoming a nightmare! We are about to go, on holiday and have no tickets, but we bought it on time.... Of course I could buy the ticket again, but at a much higher price! But I don't want, because I bought in the right time. I will travel 10,000 kilometers to Singapore to travel to Lombok from there. But how can I get started?
label: negative

text: Left Stranded abroad by Singapore Airlines, with no help or refund I paid for a return flights from London to Brisbane in August 2019 through The People's travel agent in London.I was scheduled to return home on the 7th of May 2020 via Singapore. However,I received an email from Singapore Airlines on 20th of April 2020 to say my return flights were cancelled. Singapore Airlines had been extremely unhelpful to me, I was left stranded. No alternate flight was arranged nor any support or assistance provided by airline or travel agent. I had to buy a separate ticket from Qatar Airline in order to return home safely on 7th of May 2020! I had no refund even though I wrote to the CEO of Singapore Airlines (Mr Goh) in May 2020 to complain which was totally ignored. Singapore Airlines provides very poor customer care and services. I will not travel by Singapore Airlines again and will not use the travel agent.
label: negative

text: Great airline We decided to break from our usual domestic carrier to try Singapore air for our 16 hour flight and were not disappointed. The reviewer were accurate about the cleanliness and impeccable service of the airline. The seats were also way more comfortable than those on American airline carriers flying abroad. We would definitely fly them again.
label: positive

text: Malaysia visit 2018 Airline of choice. Good inflight service, helpful and friendly cabin crew, quick checkin and comfortable seats.
label: positive

text: High service Very high service on Singapore airline. We had pre-order vegan food and it was very good and we allways got our dinners before anyone else😊 Can highly recommed Singapore airlines
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines always good always reliable Singapore airlines is always always good and reliable! excellent staff and good onboard entertainment. We had taken 3 different flights of theirs on this holiday and they had some old and some new aircrafts. So that would be the luck of the draw... but all other points they hit top billing!
label: positive

text: Greatest airline for children We had a baby crib seat meaning big space! The with of the seat is also bigger then on any other airline I have traveled with. Food was good and so was service. They are very accommodating for children so the trip with our 8 months went really smoothly! Did not use the entertainment system but from seeing other use it looked good. One bad thing is that you have to get of in Moscow and take all your carry on and go through security. But it was fast and they did not take our water or baby food.
label: positive

text: A really wonderful experience from start to finish We flew with them in April and May, because of my wife's visual impairment, we used their special assistance. Every single member of each flight was very helpful, polite and very kind. It was a pleasure to fly with them
label: positive

text: First time. Not the last. I have always known that Singapore are good but I have never before flown on an airline where a steward comes out of the rear galley with a tray of beers offering them out to thirsty flyers like myself. The service was everything I expected and more. Nothing really to add. They aren't a five star airline for nothing. One tiny problem. I was cold on all four A350 flights. First time I've used an airline blanket. Next time I'll bring an extra sweater. As long as their prices are competitive they will be the number one choice.
label: positive

text: Preferred choice for long haul flights Over many years Singapore Airlines has been our airline of choice wherever possible. The staff are always wonderful - nothing is too much trouble; they are helpful and courteous. On the whole, the food quality and choice is good. In-flight entertainment has good range of options. My only regret - that we've never been able to travel Busininess Class!
label: positive

text: You can see why this is a top airline We flew Economy Manchester to Singapore and return plus some regional Silk Air flights to Cambodia and from Vietnam. Food was excellent, a full drinks menu including alcohol was served. Films etc were wide ranging and current. I like the fact that on the long haul flight you could get additional food between meals free of charge (sandwiches, chocolate, nuts etc)
label: positive

text: Makes economy travel bearable Ok..the A380 was a bit delayed around the edges. The staff however were great and worked their socks off bringing drinks and snacks around. Food is excellent for economy and you get a menu which is a nice touch. Makes it feel less like cattle class. Seats are not amazing but tell me an airline whose economy seats are comfortable after 13 hours. Overall a bearable experience with totally professional staff who do a great job.
label: positive

text: Best aircraft in the fleet! I was a little apprehensive flying on the 737 Max8 from Phuket but this turned out to be the jewel in the fleet. A beautiful spacious modern aircraft with unusually good legroom. No need to upgrade for this short flight. The catering let the side down. OK it was a short flight but serving wet noodles in a cardboard carton is not sensible. It’s too easy to spill or splash down your shirt, not a good look. There was some turbulence after about 30 minutes and the fasten seatbelt signs came on. Unfortunately, they stayed on for the remainder of the flight even though the turbulence ended after 4-5 minutes barring access to the lavatories. SIN-LHR on an A380. A complete nightmare. I had an aisle seat with a very large male next to me spilling into my seat space for 13+ hours. This was forcing me into the aisle space where the crew repeatedly knocked into me either rushing down the plane or bashing me with the catering trollies resulting in no sleep. There was never an apology from any of the crew. The food was only just enough with many of the previously supplied items missing. I will never use them again.
label: negative

text: Very attentive. Lovely food. Wonderful service, checking in very easy no queue and staff helpful. Cabin crew very attentive. Food selection good, excellent quality and presentation. Would highly recommend Singapore airlines.
label: positive

text: good flight One of the best, Good service, old airplane but no complaints. Always like enjoy Singaporian/Asian smile and support.
label: positive

text: Smooth Flight, Adequate Food Easy to drop your bags and get your boarding passes. We are able to combine our luggage weight instead of having to worry about individual luggage. Highly recommend online check in 48 Hours before flight time. Smooth boarding in groups. Ample luggage storage space on board. Food we had was a choice between asian rendang and international breakfast. Smooth landing to boot. Enjoyed it.
label: positive

text: Appalling experience We were on our last leg of an incredible world tour with star alliance flying from Brisbane to Australia. To start with we were the only two people at the check in counter & yet it took the lady at least 45 minutes to check us in. All this while she chatted mindlessly about her career, family in Indore and her interview with Emirates. She was incompetent of doing a regular check in as the guy on the other counter helped her with all the formalities, while she made no effort whatsoever. She then assured us that the plane was 2-3-2 configuration and that no one was sitting with us. We checked online and the configuration was 3-4-3. The lady said online information is not updated, what she could see on her screen was the correct information. Trusting her with this information we finally put the bags on the belt and made sure we would get the bags in Singapore as the next night we were travelling to Dubai. Once again she assured us that we will receive our bags at the Singapore airport. Another nightmare, we landed in Singapore & there were no bags! We were looking forward to enjoying Singapore for the only one night we were there but unfortunately spent more than two hours at the airport waiting for the bags. It's a terrible feeling when one person can wreck an entire trip.
label: negative

text: Great Experience It was great experience to travel on Singapore Airlines from IGI Airport New Delhi to Singapore and after 5days in Singapore then onward to Kuala Lumpur and again back to New Delhi . The flights were on time rather reached before the arrival time at all the destinations and also very comfortable. The quality of food provided was also very good.
label: positive

text: Royal My flight from SFO to Mumbai was more than pleasant. The cabin assistants were very courteous and friendly. I was very apprehensive as it was a very long flight and I was traveling alone. But the overall experience was simply superlative. I have flown with them before and will certainly do so in future.
label: positive

text: Flight from Penang to Singapore Short flight from Penang to Singapore was very good. Service was excellent and the aircraft very neat and clean. Only problem was checking in due to the very confusing terminal and lack of information on arrival. This is not the airlines fault, but the very poor state of the Penang International Airport. This si an ongoing problem with no relief in sight.
label: positive

text: Best airline In flight services and food good. Services great. Arrive ahead of schedule time. Smooth flying despite a little turbulence. Friendly professional in fight crew.
label: positive

text: Consistently good airline with quality staff & service. Flew on a return journey with a singapore stopover for the Gran Prix. As ysual, great airline & staff - clean on time & friendly. New style aircraft (Airbus 350-900). Modern aircraft, comfy seats & plenty of room. Our seat selection was not ideal being adjacent to storage cupboards, used by flight staff. Meals & service was quite good, though turbulence created problems with breakfast service. Ticketing & check-in was trouble free.
label: positive

text: Excellent airline; would avoid playing music on board during flights Flew LAX-SIN-BWN (Brunei) on award ticket. Reasonably user-friendly website - able to book seat, special meal, etc. without hiccups. Smooth online check-in (boarding pass only at the airport due to document check). Very quick airport check-in. Smooth boarding process. Comfortable economy seats (better than average). Entertainment system with wide selection of movies. Free wifi, which worked well. USB ports and power sockets at each seat on the LAX-SIN flight. On the short SIN-BWN flight there was a USB port only, which was very weak and didn't charge my phone. Special meals were better than average. Both flights arrived early. The only thing I didn't like was the annoying music played on board the LAX-SIN flight for over 30 min prior to landing.
label: positive

text: Frustrating flight It was on the A 380. It was abnormally dirty when we board the plane was smelly and looks not arranged. Magazines in the seat pocket was old and torn off , plane was very hot and we keep asking for temperature control and they said ok because we just came out of the hanger . Food was terrible no taste and no much choice . In between there was no enough things to entertain the passengers in 10 hours flight so poor . Stewards are angry and slow in response
label: negative

text: Paris to Singapore return in seat 41B (seat with more space against extra fee). Service remains 5-star, food, onboard service and entertainment, boarding.
