Have flown several times on this airline in the past in economy class. Boarding on both flights were swift and smooth with clear instructions from airline staff. Choice of food adequate with sandwiches/refreshment available outside of main meal distribution. On the return leg, the breakfast offering was adequate but not available due to short supply on board. I was forced to take noodles as breakfast while preference was for other dish. Boeing 777 seats are of good quality, only drawback is that seat cushion is quite short for a tall person with long legs and the screen is slightly far away from the seat. Movie offering is very extended with quite some recent movies in different languages. (A380 is more comfortable). Seats 41A & B are best, avoid 41C which passenger was hit all the time by transiting galleys As usual Changi airport is fabulous airport even with a transit time of 4 hours with next connection: gardens, swimming pool, butterfly and movie area is unique, European airports should learn and copy.
label: positive

text: Flew Dubai to Melbourne via Singapore. I found the flight very enjoyable and on par with previous flights with Singapore Airlines. Check in on both the going and return trip was smooth and pleasant. The theme was reflected across the rest of the flight meaning at no point was I left feeling stressed or perturbed. I especially enjoyed the return flight from SIN to DXB since they had used a newly refurbished 777-300ER which had all the new bells and whistles, incl. touch screen IFE and refreshed seats. While I did not use the in-flight Wi-fi, it was good to know it was available and operating.
label: positive

text: good excellent great and excellent. Highly recomment to all my friends. Singapore airlines is way best flight ever.
label: positive

text: First long flight We found the food was great. Service was professional and friendly. The plane was clean. We loved the little packs that contained socks and toothbrush kit given out to help with the sleeping or to be used to refresh at the destination. We were text about an auction for the unsold premium economy and first class seats. We bid (but were unsuccessful). Once the plane was fully loaded we did note that all the premium economy and first class seats were not full. We thought it odd that lower bids were not accepted. We enjoyed tracking the flight on the monitor and the movies.
label: positive

text: Deserving to be the world's number 1 airline Two of the flights I booked were on time. The way they managed passenger boarding were highly organized. The in flight entertainment was excellent. Surprisingly, there were couple of movies that were just recently released. Excellent food for economy class passengers. I like their coconut ice cream! The money I paid for this trip is all worth it.
label: positive

text: SQ Suites "bed" is great but let down by poor ground experience No special handling at FRA checkin. LH Senator Lounge very unimpressive - I don't expect to have to pay for Spa treatments when flying in F class. On board experience much better - got "double" bed and slept very well for about three hours on a seven-hour daytime flight. Cabin crew pretty good but forgot to offer wash bag. WiFi absolutely crap - 100 MB limit for free service and took almost 40 mins to download an 11 MB file. Asked for additional data and was told I had to purchase it - not impressed! Arrival at JFK - disembarked first but no ground handling assistance at all. Overall - great for sleeping but not really wow-ed on ground handling. Didn't eat much so can't really comment on that.
label: neutral

text: Singapore Ruined All Other Airlines. I have flown Singapore for the first time in 2018 from JFK to Singapore with a short stop in Germany. It was a very long flight but I really did not mind it. Actually, it was really good. This January, I couldn't find a cheap flight so I flew Cathay from JFK to Hongkong (heading to Philippines on both flights). It was like night and day. I'm traveling again in April so I picked Singapore this time. I think Singapore ruined all other airlines for me. The FA's are so friendly, neat looking, very courteous, clean restroom, and the food taste very good. Service is first class, even in economy.
label: positive

text: Still the best way to fly, but quality beverage offerings is slipping The inflight service is still something to cheer about. And so is the food - the local fare of bak chor mee (minced pork noodles) is most comforting. But the wine offering is getting more and more pedestrian. Also the removal of malt whiskey (used to be Highland Park) choice from the list of beverage offerings for Business Class in a premium airline such as Singapore Airlines is in word - unbecoming
label: positive

text: Good Experience Flew Singapore Airlines - London Heathrow to Singapore and in to Sydney. Stayed two nights in Singapore on the outward journey which was really worthwhile. Flew back with a three hour lay-over in Singapore which was manageable as we had free access to the Singapore Airlines Lounge to shower eat and rest. All the way in one day is however a challenge and what I would say is that paying to upgrade for that flight might have been worth the money as we were economy for all flights. Economy is still a good experience with this airline with excellent in-flight service and very modern aircraft - however for the 14 hours for Singapore to London flying West ... economy plus or even business class would be money well spent and easier all round.Overall Singapore Airlines are nice to fly with, staff and service excellent and worth the money.
label: positive

text: Excellent airline This is an airline I always feel comfortable to fly with. Excellent service. Meals were enjoyable. The only concern this trip was the in-flight movies. I felt they were a bit limited. All elses was great.
label: positive

text: Great Service This is a great Airline and their Business Class product is excellent. I do this trip a lot and it's great news that in December they are upgrading this route to their new A350 product. Look forward to it.
label: positive

text: Seamless Lost and Found! Just flew on a long flight from Singapore to San Francisco (which was extraordinary for economy seating) and left my kindle in the pocket of the plane. Called the airline when I got home (they answered the phone!) and they found it. All I had to do was email them a FedEx address label and they put it in the mail the same day! The communication back and forth with staff person Axel on first locating my item and then instructions on how to proceed was excellent. Very impressive and I am very grateful for their attention to detail and follow-thru. One happy customer!
label: positive

text: Quality as usual As good as it gets for economy always a good experience with Singapore Airlines. All the basic were excellent service ,food, boarding,check in and baggage collection.
label: positive

text: LHR-SIN - return. Another great flight with Singapore Airlines on A380. The crew were all friendly and served drinks throughout the flight. My vegetarian special meals were tasty - one of the best I have had. Good choice of programs on TV.
label: positive

text: Utterly disgusted, discriminatory and prejudice Had a horrible nightmare experience traveling from Vancouver to Singapore with Air Canada (AC) and Singapore Airlines (SQ), supposedly Star “Alliance” partners. The first leg of my flight is YVR airport- HKG airport by AC and the 2nd leg of the flight is HKG-SIN by SQ. After queuing for 1.5 hours at Vancouver airport, I was informed by AC staff that I am not allowed to fly as they are unable to print out the flight tickets for SQ and Hong Kong’s airport transit criteria is to have both printed boarding passes. They brushed me off at the counter and told me bluntly to go purchase a new ticket that does not involve SQ or go fly with another airline. I repurchased the same route on AC for YVR-HKG right at the airport but with a 20 hours layover in Hong Kong flying my second leg with Cathay Pacific. For some bizarre reason, Star “Alliance” partners do not have the rights to issue tickets for their alliances but AC can issue a ticket for Cathay. To avoid a 20h layover, I contacted SQ and was advised to get another ticket for my second leg, the flight I was supposed to be on. To my horror in Hong Kong, not only did SQ not allow me to board with the new ticket that I repurchased under their advice, I was also made aware that there is a White male business class passenger flying the same original route that I was refused boarding with AC7 and SQ883. Would AC and SQ care to explain what’s with the prejudice? Is it due to racism or a flight class discrimination? Maybe sexism? As I thought my nightmare will be over, I looked at my baggage tag sticker and it reads AC7 and SQ883 not Cathay. After spending over 3 hours with the AC staff, he is still unable to locate it in Hong Kong and we had to file a missing baggage report. I left Hong Kong finally after 20 hours without knowing the location of my bag and if it went on the same Cathay flight as me. After the torturous 38 hours journey, I was informed in Singapore that my bag is still in Vancouver and they have no confirmation when it will be arriving. Just when I thought it couldn’t get worse, they told me that there is no AC staff in Singapore and no one will deliver my bag to me while I am serving my quarantine, I had to send someone to the airport to pick it up for me. No word of concern if I have everything I need with me, no apologies nothing just AC faulting me again for their mistakes. My advice, if you are not a white male flying business/first class, do NOT travel with Air Canada and Singapore Airlines. Utterly disgusted.
label: negative

text: Not as good as the airline commercial Just curious about their commercial about Premium economy on their plane. I booked tickets to fly to Europe. The seat is not so comfortable, the food also not so nice taste, even they offer us book by the cook. The food size small, I think same as economy class. The cabin crew also not so nice like I fly several time before with SQ. I think the service from SQ is downgrade. They don't over us extra snack, peanut or anything else. It's not worth with the price that almost double from economy class. They sould increase the service from everything. Specially for the food...
label: neutral

text: Thailand Tour Connecting flight of singapore airlines from changi airport, Singapore. World best airlines experience ever... Meals and service are too good... More space and comfortabel seats... Too good journey...
label: positive

text: Great flight Even though this flight is 15-17 hours long, the business class experience makes the time fly by. The service was terrific. The flight attendants are very friendly and try their hardest to accommodate you. The food was actually quite good and you never felt hungry or thirsty. The seat itself is very wide and has tons of storage areas. I know many people hate the foot well/diagonal sleeping arrangement but I didn’t find it too bad. I am a shade under 6 foot and was still able to sleep for 3-4 hours straight, which for me is a record on a plane. The airline doesn’t offer any amenity kit but there are toothbrushes, combs and razors in the bathrooms. The TV screen is quite large and the media selections were excellent.
label: positive

text: Class pure and Simple From start to finish it is always a pleasure to fly with Singapore airlines firstly we had a flight at 1640 but were at the airport at midday so I approached check in desk trying to get my party of four which included my 13 month old boy on earlier flight no issues on changing flight only that one the party would have to sit on their own not a big deal. Crew made a huge fuss over my baby so warm and welcoming and soon saw without me asking that we as a party were not sitting together , that was soon changed. Food as always very good , flight deck information good , entertainment ok but this is down to me traveling a lot so have seen most of it for that month but others in party though it was excellent. Flying back to Manila this week with SQ already looking forward to it
label: positive

text: Trip to Singapore A night flight to Singapore , very active staff , vegetarian food was hot Tasty . Served very promptly.
label: positive

text: The SQ system can almost never get mileage accrual nor ticket changes right. I have called them 29 times in the last 12 months and the contact number has an average waiting time of just over 1 hour. I wasted so much time with them on the line. The service has been downgraded so much. Most amenities are gone. My food was of very low quality and Book the chef is mostly not available (even if they claim they are on the website).
label: negative

text: Handling of COVID situation appalling I thought we were making a safe choice booking flights with Singapore Airlines in January before COVID blew up. However, on reflection I will not use them again. We are due to fly in 5 weeks time, which we obviously will not be doing, and they dont want to release any flight schedules or provide credits to people who booked before COVID. Never get a real response from a person, just the same copy paste reply saying they will review their schedules and to keep checking....schedules make no difference to us, we wont be going on our holiday regardless. Expected more from this world renowned airline. Really disappointed.
label: negative

text: A long flight made to seem short. One of the best attended flights I"ve had and I travel to 4+ country's per year. The Asian airlines seem to do the best when it comes to customer service. They have nice lounges also. I travel for MotoGP and F1 races for work and pleasure so I fly a lot.
label: positive

text: Comfortable in Economy We used Singapore Airlines for our last journey overseas entailing four flights and couldn’t be happier. The seating is as comfortable as airline seating can be, the service was very friendly and prompt whilst being professional. There was inflight entertainment as well as the capability of WIFI. The amenities were kept clean. The food was good, along with the beverage service. All planes left on time, and check-in and baggage services at all ends went smoothly. Highly recommend Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text: One of the best private business class seats in the sky today I had high expectations, but I was not disappointed. Incredible crew, thank you Rebecca and Juanita taking care of me so well. The seat is 30 inches wide (10 more than most) and you have a side table that is at the right height with several storage compartments. The seat side wall does reduce the visibility out the window somewhat, but this was not a big negative. The seat was very comfortable as long as I found the right sitting position or it it could have felt hard. For sleeping you do need to angel yourself as your feet will go in to the footwell on one side of the seat in front of you. As for the ground staff, I believe that they were all subcontractors so I could not expect them to live up to the standard of the inflight crew.
label: positive

text: Pleasant staff, very helpful We thoroughly enjoyed flying with Singapore Airlines a few years ago and our recent experience was still the same. Attentive staff, pleasant with any requests. The flight was great, very comfortable temperature and meals were very nice. My only issue was with the passenger in front who had no concern for anyone. Seat pushed all the way back pressing against me. Due to my issues I need to walk a lot and this seat impeded this. Very much out of the airlines control.
label: positive

text: Johannesburg to Shanghai via Singapore. I always travel business class (though first time on SIA fleet) and conclude that Singapore Airlines is the best. The aircraft are up to date and so are the facilities. Neat, clean and comfortable. But, it is the staff that take the airline to the next level - courteous, friendly, helpful and efficient especially the cabin crew on flights SQ 479, JHB to Singapore, 10 Feb and SQ 478, Shanghai to Singapore, 28 Feb 2018.
label: positive

text: A First class airline Excellent service from all Singapore Airlines staff. Seats are very comfortable and wide with plenty of legroom and room to move. Seats also fold out flat so you can get a comfortable sleep. The best seats in business class from experience of many airlines.Food is very good and staff will do everything they can to make your flight experience good.
label: positive

text: Flew from Melbourne to Singapore and back. Boeing 777-300 on MEL-SIN had one of the oldest IFE screens I have ever seen on SIA (flying since 2010). Priority meal for other passengers around me meant I had to wait for ages for a meal. SIN to MEL was a brand new A330-300 and had nice IFE and dinner served on board was the best I have had inflight. Serving dinner in the late night and keeping lights on meant there is no way you can sleep properly. I will still fly SIA because of their hospitality and cabin comfort.
label: positive

text: 15th March I was meant to fly back to Sydney from Amsterdam. I was visiting family and friends and with COVID-19 I found it hard to leave. I was checked in but later that day read on the Singapore website that you weren't allowed to enter Singapore airport if you've been to Germany in the last 14 days. I did. I went through Germany for wintersport to Austria just beforey, so I cancelled my flight. I received 83 euros back (which hardly covers my flight) and I didn't have a choice of accepting that money or not. I just got it back. I tried to contact the airline many times about the situation and never got a reply. Now they're saying they can't help me because I already received 83 euro back for my cancellation. Whereas I know and should've had the right to receive flight credits instead for a flight back to Sydney.
label: negative

text: Great Airline! Ended up bidding for the upgrade on premium economy, and ended up getting it for $245/person. Totally worth it as we were able to pre book our meal through Cook the Book. Also, seat reclined pretty far back, the footrest extended out, and the bulkhead on row 31 was real nice. Super service, clean aircraft, and great legroom.
label: positive

text: Flew from Sydney to Zurich then Amsterdam back to Sydney. Staff were attentive and courteous. They worked very hard throughout the flight to keep things running smoothly. The toilets were clean the food was good and the flights were all on time. I would fly with Singapore again.
label: positive

text: Smooth Flight Flown with my family and we are so happy especially my daughter and nephew who enjoyed with the movie marathon :) . They have an early check in service and arrived earlier on schedule. Highly recommend to fly with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: AMAZING STAFF AND LEGROOM To start, Singapore Airlines contacted me before my flight saying that they have changed my seat to an economy seat which has extra legroom (due to the seat in front being missing). This was AMAZING as I had a very comfortable flight!! I must say that the staff in Singapore Airlines are very welcoming and are friendly. They also are very helpful during the flight as well as before departure and once arriving. They offer eyeshades and other amenities at request for economy and to get these you need to ask the cabin crew to get these. Our flight departed LHR at 22:00 and arrived in SIN at around 6pm. Our a 13 hour flight was perfect- enough legroom for my son who's 6ft 2in tall (although the person in front must also have their seat reclined for this to be comfortable). The food service was impeccable; staff were very quick at serving food and cleaning up so we could grab a bit of shuteye. The IFE was quite outdated as the screen was not touchscreen - if this was updated I would say this is the best flight in economy ever!! Also, it's quite difficult to see whether the toilets are vacant or not as the sign is too small and difficult to see from afar (especially when the cabin is dark). Also the passenger who was previously in the toilet before me did not flush the toilet. Perhaps in newer aircraft automatically-flushing toilets or sensor-flushing toilets would be good as this was a bit of a bummer (both metaphorically and actually😂) Overall, GREAT SERVICE, LOVELY STAFF, GOOD FOOD but aircraft IFE needs to be improved for economy flights to and from SIN - retrofitting may be a good option!!
label: positive

text: Could not fault the airline until they cancelled a flight from Singapore to Hong Kong on 16th September 2018. This was due to a pending typhoon affecting Hong Kong. No refund is forthcoming. A small discount was offered on another flight at a future time. This is not possible for us. The pre booked hotel in Hong Kong is reimbursing us the full amount less a small administration fee. If they can do this why can't a large airline do the same.
label: negative

text: Business between Bali and Singapore First time flying with Singapore Airlines. Check in was easy, meals delicious and plenty of it. Getting extra drinks was not difficult. Selection of on board entertainment was good. Great new plane
label: positive

text: First class overrated I took twice First. On 777 first class has one row and 4 seats, located in a small box crating the feeling of claustrophobia. Service is standard and not personalized, food below Swiss and Lufthansa standard. If you take Swiss or Lufthansa as benchmarks you will be quite disappointed. The flight from Singapore to Copenhagen was very late, absolutely no help for catching connecting flight. Something unseen for first class passengers on other airlines.
label: negative

text: Fantastic Airline to Fly with The flight was to depart at 12.00pm, they had started loading Passengers and the storm started, but they still kept loading. Once al Passengers were onboard the Captain made an Announcement, that due to bad weather we were unable to take off. The Cabin Crew made sure we were comfortable, handed out drinks, and cool washers. They looked after us extremely well. On arriving to Singapore, we still were unable to land due to bad weather, once again we were looked after very well. Due to this we had missed our connecting flight into Bangkok, and they had arranged hotel vouchers, car vouchers, and food vouchers, but unable to stay overnight,and making my concerns of having to get to Bangkok, Singapore Ground Staff, ent over backwards to ensure we got on a flight, of which we did, thanks to the The professionalism of Singapore Ground Staff. We highly recommend Singapore Airlines for, Service, Food, Comfort, and most important cleanliness.
label: positive

text: Flew LHR to MNL - to give some context I've done pretty much every route to Manila in recent years usually based on price at the time. I found Singapore Airlines still to be a cut above the rest - but not perfect - and wouldn't hesitate to use again. Main leg on way out was on a modern 777 very nice and clearly more space than competition due to 3-3-3 layout - food all good and I can't remember any other carrier proactively offering so many drinks and refills in Economy. However the Singapore to Manila leg (and same coming back) was a much older 777 cabin with mediocre screens etc. Still no complaints as the equivalent leg on Malaysian (comparable due to distance) is on a real shocker of a 737. On way back my video screen was down for the whole flight and the staff asked me to stay behind to speak to the customer service team at Changi for 'compensation' - they gave me some kind of wallet which was a nice touch but not worth waiting behind on an empty plane for. Singapore to London on A380 upstairs - great flight and great space. All 4 flights were delayed which was frustrating but hey not the airlines' fault. Generally - the long haul legs very impressive the shorter flights average but overall far better than any other route to the Philippines. One frustration is security rules at the gate at Changi - confiscating water bought 2 minutes before at the airport which seems excessive.
label: positive

text: Very helpful Traveled with my elderly Mother in law. Singapore Airlines where extremely willing and helpful to assist with boarding and transfers. They organized a wheelchair and friendly staff to assist at each stop. Would recommend and will fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Pleasant Flight to Geneva Had a pleasant flight on the Singapore Airlines from Singapore to Zurich. Had to transfer to a Swiss Air flight to Geneva.
label: positive

text: Fully Enjoyed #FlySQ I am so happy flying with SQ due to all things are prefect. The served with very professional one. Also I fully enjoyed during my flight to Singapore because I got big portion of meal and also enjoyed my Wine. This is my 3rd time together flight with SQ and its lovely experience ever. Congratulations for being the best airlines and also keep moving forward for future memorable experience with you.
label: positive

text: Singapore to melbourne Picture this, Had the left two seats at the rear of the mid seats, we were concerned about this arrangement, but it was not necessary. Great seats, really good service, cannot go back to economy.
label: positive

text: Great flight The food for coeliacs on board this flight was stunning. Both my son and wife are coeliacs as pointed out before in past reviews. However any long distance flights taken usually result in them having to take food onboard. This time it definitely was not necessary! Full marks for the quality and standard of the food available for them. Definitely use them again. Even if you aren't a coeliac , it was a great flight and my meals were also lovely!
label: positive

text: Never Flying Again!! Our story is a very long and complicated one! For those who are interested please read on, for those who want the short version: I am never flying SingaporeAir again thanks to their total lack of customer service and terrible ability to follow up on issues regarding refunds and changes to flights!! Here we go: I was booking flights for my husband and I flying from Darwin Aus to London UK but when we landed in the UK we were going to the passport office to get his passport updated which would mean his name would change. I called SingaporeAir to confirm if I booked return flights that I could change his name on the way home. They said yes that would be fine as long as you had copies of the old and new passport. So I booked us both return flights!l for our first international holiday together!! On arriving in the UK we got the passport updated and sent through to SingaporeAir straight away to which I got the response, “No we can’t make any changes as it is against SingaporeAir policy” and that I would have to cancel his part of the return flight and re-book him a new flight home. After calling them for 3 days I finally got through to someone who could actually help me (all while on Holidays and not being able to relax and enjoy ourselves) they finally canceled his return flight and re-booked under the new name. I was then told to expect a call back from the refund team in the next 48/72hrs. This was on the 20th of August 2019. We are now at the 10th of September and after 6 phone calls and 3 emails I still have not received this phone call. Each time I do contact them I get the same response! “It has been escalated to the department responsible and to expect a call in the next 48/72 hours”... I thought that meant 2-3 days not 2-3 weeks. Now, for those wondering, when I booked the flights originally I did buy the more expensive tickets that said they allowed changes for a fee so we could make the necessary changes and pay the fee but still have a seat secured for him to fly home. Nowhere in their terms and conditions does it say they cannot change a name (same person new name). But apparently this was against company policy. Oh and lets not forget I was now out of pocket!! I paid something along the lines of $1,800 for return flights but had to pay $1,700 for a ONE WAY FLIGHT!!!!! For a seat he already had but under the wrong name now.... Each time I call I also ask to speak to their supervisor and have always gotten the same response. “Our supervisors are not trained in this matter and will only be able to tell you what I already have”. I always say thats fine I just want to speak to someone with authority and then they say “let me see if I can find someone” and proceed to put me on hold for an indefinite time hoping I will go away. I have waited 20min once!! All on my phone bill. I am lost with what to do now, I am out of pocket, could not enjoy my first international trip with my Husband and now will never fly SingaporeAir again because this is getting beyond ridiculous! Crazy thing, the flight itself was great! Friendly staff, good food and clean plane! Just TERRIBLE SERVICE from their administrative team. So because of that I am NEVER flying SingaporeAir again. NOT HAPPY!
label: negative

text: We used this airline recently for our trip to India and will not recommend this airline . Both ground service and cabin crew service not very friendly neither very welcoming. For a 16 hour straight flight you get two full meals and the snacks are just some nuts. No sandwiches are offered unless you ask for it. Meal services are also different, kids are not served first always.(sometimes yes they do). Meals also has no varieties like others like no fruits or yogurt. We were very excited when we got the tickets as it was our first time using this airline but will not use in the future.
label: negative

text: Flying 1st time in one of the leading airlines of the world I had just passed my exams & to reward myself i decided to travell to singapore & meet my cousins and spend some time to rejuvenate myself. While looking for tickets i got a deal from Singapore airlines, fares cheaper than Indian Carriers - i started thinking - this may not come again - lets just book it. Day of the flight i arrived at the airport early and the chcek in was smooth as well i wanted a window seat so i could take pictures while take off & landing, i was excited to see a nice Boeing 777-200ER waiting for me & rest of the passengers, turns out the flight was relatively empty & got all 3 seats to myself (WINNNN). Flight took off on time even though it was during the monsoons there was hardly any delay and soon we were climbing upwards & outwards from Mumbai Airspace. During the flight the meals served were good prepared by a famous Indian Brand ( had pre booked the kind of meal i wanted with out any additional payments) Once incident happened during the flight was i had asked the cabin crew for some beer to have before i had my meal, while pouring the drink the aircraft hit some turbulence, the stewardess could not pour the drink cleanly and ended up spilling some on my trousers & the seat next to me. She started to apologize profusely, i reassured her it was ok wasn't her fault. She went & got me 3 more beers (Double Winnn) Soon after that i had the meal & slept off, woke just before we were to land, One of the best airline trips of my life so far.... hope can travel more with this wonderful airline.
label: positive

text: Gorgeous but not very comfortable We flew Singapore Airlines from Bangkok to Singapore on a Boeing 777 then Singapore to LAX on an Airbus A359. The Singapore to LAX flight was 14 hours and overnight. The interior of both planes was absolutely gorgeous. Service was fine, though dinner service on the flight to LA was slow and I did have minor GI distress the next day. The A359 had lie-flat seat/bed but it was not comfortable. There was just a small hole for your feet which limited movement and constrained sleeping positions. Also, there was a thin "mattress" but it was not attached to the seat in any way, so every movement caused it to shift. One thing I did love was that they had packages which contained a toothbrush and toothpaste in the lav.
label: neutral

text: Nice but long Singapore Airlines has a good entertainment system, but all good movies from their list I have already watched. Food was decent but nothing spectacular for economy seats. The ordeal was online check-in, it should be open 48 hr before flight, but for some reason I couldn't do it online and called customer service, and even they couldn't help me. They just suggested to check-in personally at the airport, and as we did we received the very end seats in spite of the fact we arrived early for check-in. I am travelling a lot and it was the first time with SA, I have heard only great things about Singapore but for our flight service was no different than one from Delta, or Aeroflot, or Lufthansa..
label: positive

text: Worst possible customer service after canceling the flight Tonight, the flight SQ 325 from Frankfurt to Singapore was canceled. We also had a connection to Denpasar, flight SQ 948, so one day of vacation less! When the flight was canceled, nobody from Singapore Airlines took any care about the passengers. First of all, we were handed over to security staff from the airport at 11:30 PM. They kept us waiting for 15 minutes in a hallway, without anyone knowing why. Then, all the Singapore Airlines staff just DISAPPEARED, like magic. Nobody told us anything about when the flight will be rescheduled, or at least when they will let us know about the new flight. I literally had to carry our asleep son throughout the airport in my arms (and Frankfurt is a big airport) together with the carry on luggage, because nobody even asked if we need a trolley. After about one hour after deplaning us, we also had to wait (at midnight) with our son asleep in my arms for half an hour in the cold, outside of the airport, for the bus to the hotel. Until now, it's the worst experience of my life flying business class, the level of customer care was even lower than low cost airlines.
label: negative

text: STR This was the first time I've had the pleasure flying business class with SQ. Can not speak highly enough of their service, food and IFE. The cabin crew were extremely helpful especially when I started to feel slightly unwell. Looking forward using this exceptional airline again.
label: positive

text: Short & pleasant flight! It was a pleasant & comfortable flight! Almost everything is good except for the food which requires lotsa improvement. Positively...the flight was value for money and flight attendants were attentive. Negatively, the food tastes really bad and does not really represent Singapore at all - this comment on food is given based on a few other Singapore Airline's flight as well.
label: positive

text: A bit squeezie The leg room on this plane was terrible. I am not talll and I was squashed, my tall husband was extremely uncomfortable.
label: neutral

text: Excellent Experience My wife and I used this airline for our trip to Australia and return.The first leg was from LHR to Singapore we then flew from Singapore to Perth.On the return we flew Sydney to LHR. On all the flights the aircraft used were 777s. The experience was excellent throughout with good food and drink and the best service we ve ever had in economy.I would say having flown Emirates that Singapore offer a better product.We will be using this airline again on our next trip to the far east,
label: positive

text: Service isnt as good as before Maybe it was just my luck but we had pretty shoddy service to and from Osaka. Both stewardess had the counldnt care less attitude during service. And we've had similar experiences on some SQ flights too on recent travels. Comparing this to what it used to be years ago, standards have definitely dropped. This is just an SQ vs SQ comparison. By and large they are still better than many. Though Qatar and Emirates have fared better against them on recent travels. Food on SQ is still probably the best. I used to think the entertainment system was also the best on SQ but the said 2 airlines have definitely caught up and maybe even exceeded.
label: neutral

text: Short Trip to Munich We managed to book the front row due to the changes of our booking which cost lot more for the original booking. Overall the flight is good and they are efficient and helpful.
label: neutral

text: What happened to their stellar reputation !😒 Just overall subpar airline , gone are their hay days. Food is atrocious and very cheap . The inflight entertainment is basic at best . Wouldn’t bother flying them again . Qantas kills them .
label: negative

text: Lots of sweet talk in advert, zero action in reality Gave up. Sent 4 emails, filled in forms in their website, tried to call numbers in London and Singapore. Just need a simple clarification but couldn't get through to anyone. Multiple auto-replies :-( Bought another ticket with another airlines. Grateful that there are other airlines. Wasted purchased ticket with Singapore Airlines but wouldn't risk not being able to fly as no confirmation regarding flight can be had. Will not waste money buying their tickets anymore and definitely will not advise anyone to take their flight.
label: negative

text: Good airline but extortionate fees and fare difference to change flight I have flown Singapore Airlines (economy) to and from Australia and the UK or Europe on a number of occasions. The airline is invariably good, with attentive flight attendants, edible food (even in economy) and sufficient inflight entertainment for long haul flights. This time, on the outward flight the cabin was very cold however. I wanted to bring my return flight forward by 7 days and when I contacted Singapore Airlines about doing so I was advised that it would cost in excess of an additional £800 for the same flights at the same times of day but just one week earlier than those originally booked. The most that I was able to have this extortionate fee and fare difference reduced to was £475. As a result I elected not to bring my return flight forward and also as a result I will now be looking for an alternative airline for all of my future Australia to Europe flights. I am a Singapore Airlines KrisFlyer member, but this made no difference at all to the airline. Overcharging for a flight change is a very good way to lose loyal customers.
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines - Bus Class FRA - SIN On a 777-300 Business seats in the middle Row 12. In FRA SQ use the Lufthansa Business Lounge which was very nice. Good service and food/drink selection, close to the departure gate. Quite a wide seat but that's because when the seat is converted to a flat bed there is a gap in front of you to the right where you put your feet. So you actually lay somewhat diagonal. You also need the flight attendant to convert the seat to a bed. It's comfortable enough, but not as good as Etihad/Qantas/Emirates, perhaps the A380 is better, I don't know. The service from the crew was excellent, with a extensive selection of food, drinks (you must order a Singapore Sling for your after takeoff drink) and nibbles. The pilots kept us informed and all up we had a great journey. Priority labelled bags came out early which for some airlines is a novelty. I'd really like to try their A380 service !
label: positive

text: Great flight First time with SA and won’t be our last. Decided to go Premium Economy as a long flight. Glad we did. Seats great and very comfortable. 11am flight so not much chance of sleep but managed a few hours with eyes shut. In flight entertainment top notch. Food really tasty for airline grub. Stewardesses really good and attentive. Looking forward to our next flight with SA
label: positive

text: flight experience As soon as the cabin lights were dimmed the inconsiderate woman in the seat immediately in front of me reclined her seat as far as it would go. My seat wouldn't recline at all, as there was some problem with the chair. Measured with my fingers there was only 17cms between my chest and the set in front! Consequently all the way to Adelaide I felt as if I was in a low cost budget airline. I realise this is not the fault of Singapore Airlines, but combined with quite ordinary airline food it's enough for me to determine never to fly with this airline again.
label: negative

text: Premium Economy - not worth it! First time with Singapore Airlines Premium Economy and the last! You would be thinking all would be better, better seats, better food, better service but not really. My seat on the first leg, Brisbane to Singapore, the remote control for the entertainment system was jammed in so hard from the last flight, had to do without it. Not a big deal really, but then the tray table jammed and 2 flight attendants to push it back into place. Then the footrest wouldn't work properly. Credit to attendants offered to move me into the middle row - 4 seats, but didn't like that prospect. Next leg Singapore to Heathrow on a A380 - toilets backed up! Captain announced 4 hours into the flight, but happened as soon as we took off! Really Singapore - this was a horrible way to fly! Especially 13 hours! Shocking! To top it off - when we arrived at Heathrow - our suitcases came off LAST and damaged. A little bit redeemed on our return flight BUT Premium Economy - NOT with Singapore Airlines....
label: neutral

text: Vomit covered seat and floor, causing us all to get Gastro! We flew the SQ 322 flight from Singapore to London Heathrow on Tuesday 2nd august 2022 arriving at London Heathrow at 6am. When we got on the flight the seat part of my daughters chair was missing. She was seated in 54k next to the window. Somebody came and replaced it so she could sit down. We all fell asleep immediately as it was almost 1am in the morning Sydney time. Half way through the flight my daughter realised her socks were wet. We had a look at them and realised they stank of vomit. We then checked all of her toys and our bags that were on the floor and they were all damp and stank of vomit. All of her things, shoes, socks and bottom of her trousers just absolutely stank of vomit and the ground was soaking wet. I can not believe that after such a terrible pandemic my daughter was allowed to sit in an area where someone had so obviously recently been vomiting. Not to mention how disgusting it has been travelling to our hotel in a car with bags all covered in sick and smelling absolutely terrible. I complained to the air steward and asked her to make a note as it was such a disgusting way to have to sit on a long haul flight. We then of course all began vomiting the day after the flight, having been sat in clearly a gastro covered area. Our short UK holiday absolutely ruined, not being able to see my terminally ill father for 8 days in fear of passing it to him, which his immune system could not have handled. This after not seeing him due to the pandemic for 3 years! I understand we flew economy, but at the very least we expected the seats to be clean and sanitary. I emailed the airline through my husbands official Singapore Airlines account, and we heard nothing. I emailed several times, nothing. I only got a response from the airline when I involved a third party resolver government site that helps consumers. They told me nothing had been reported, and that the airline staff deny this even happened. So at the very least they are not logging and recording the changing of seats which must be a safety issue. I find very hard to believe the air steward doesn't remember covering the vomit floor with a blanket and spraying ai freshener over it for us. I also asked her to log it all, and she said she would. The airline said all the attendants had been interviewed but they all deny this even happened. It's not so much what happened, it is more the absolute denial that it even took place. Had I of known they had not logged my complaint on the flight, I would have asked fellow passengers for witness statements - but who would ever imagine they would need to that! Plus it has taken 3 months for them to look into this for me!! We will never ever fly Singapore airlines again.
label: negative

text: Poor Beyond Expectation Long Queue at Business Class check in at Bangkok Airport with ignorance to manage the queue Your Gate is D2. Your Lounge is opposite your gate In fact the SQ Lounge is opposite Gate D8. If you know airports well enough 6 gates difference is not short, worse than that was time and energy spent to find it around gate 2. Responsible of information sharing??? At Business Class Lounge, food and beverage are available to eat but no service even at the bar with bartender in the middle. It looked like we beg for a drink. In such case just prepare self service style. Or is this cost control policy? First time to experience the whole business class service by 3 staff, trolley service like economy class; perhaps only containers are different. The effort to personalize is to address my name pretentiously and incorrectly before food serving to ask what I want. My glasses of wine and water were collected without permission. Never asked to refill even it is still almost an hour to reach the destination. Is this Singapore Airlines Business Class Service? Or Bus service??? To me the later one. #perhaps SQ has a lot of money to spend for PR and advertising to mislead. Only good is music #neveragain #singaporeairlines
label: negative

text: Best Service and always on time... Travelling with this airline for the last 12 years on a regular basis. Never had a delay or a missed bag. Cabin crew is always pleasant and the service is excellent. Singapore airport is another attraction flying with SIA. Worth the money and would recommend to anyone...
label: positive

text: Very comfortable flight Their staff is helpful and friendly. Their seats are pretty comfy and spacious. In Flight Entertainment is great. In Flight Meal is great. Worth the money.
label: positive

text: Cancelled leg but no followup Bought a business class ticket from Copenhagen to Darwin with a short 2 hours transit in Singapore. Singapore Airlines changed it to a FOUR DAYS stop over in Singapore. Of course this is unacceptable. But you can't get a hold of anyone at customer service. I have called multiple times (waited up to 2 hours on the phone). They don't respond to your emails. You can't change the flights online, you can't cancel. Basically only option is to accept the change. And then what? Sleep in Singapore airport for four days straight? Flying out beginning of April. I still hope someone will have contacted me by then but I am starting to loose hope.
label: negative

text: Good inflight service, flight delays Recently travelled from Malé to Hanoi and return, via Singapore. Noticed a delay of about 30 minutes on each leg of the trip, which is something not that frequent on Singapore airlines. The food, inflight entertainment was good. Cabin crew very helpful and smiling as always
label: positive

text: Awesome Flight Airlines crew were super friendly and warm. Service was outstanding. Inflight food was good. Journey was about 2hours. There weren't any delay with the flight timings. There's entertainment panel for every passenger when you get your flight route details and you can also watch movies. Movies were updated with latest ones. Would love to fly with them again .
label: positive

text: Business trip to Australia Poor/low skilled attendance at the gate. Efficiency during boarding is not optimal and always a struggling between airport crew and early boarding passengers, due too late announcement of the boarding procedure. It's already multiple times I experienced the chaotic scene and that passengers sent back again, due to wrong groupage. Please repare the gate prior to arrival of the passengers in the hall and show your boarding procedure on a screen or signs! And keeep Priority Class passengers really separated, so people don't think the boarding actual is free entry again. Maybe by announcing in more languages
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines is a totally different airline when taking the route Singapore to Stockholm via Moscow. The air hostesses are usually very service minded in Singapore Airlines and thats why I used to like them. But the exception is this flight through Russia. The air hostesses are mainly Russian and do not meet expectations in my eyes of the usual level of service that defines this airline. Furthermore, when exiting the plane in Moscow, prepare yourself for a nightmare. 1 long line which consists of all the passengers on the A350-900, needs to line up for getting a red stamp in your boarding pass. Then you have to stand in a second long line to get a green stamp in your boarding pass. Then there was a third line to the x-ray of the hand luggage before you could stand (not enough seats to sit) by the gate without any restaurant, café or what so ever. And add to the misery that since i stupidly enough forgot my boarding pass to Moscow on the plane, I had to stand in a fourth line. Its very obvious this route is a failure. It is always way more cheap going through DME to and from Singapore than through LHR, FRA or CPH. Avoid Singapore Airlines flying to and from Stockholm through Moscow.
label: negative

text: Excellent Service The Staff at Singapore airlines are all excellent, they go above and beyond to help customers especially families with kids, we choose to fly Singapore airlines as they always exceeds our expectations, not only the air hostess cater to all our needs but the airport staff also take excellent care of us and make sure that all our needs are met as we have two kids with Autism, i don't have words to describe their level of service, that is why whenever we fly each time abroad, we always fly via Singapore airlines.
label: positive

text: great experience, now that service oriented airlines are disappearing amazing service, they try all the best to please you, always with smiles and kindness. free headset, chocolate bars during the night, toilets kept sparkling clean
label: positive

text: Hard to do better in economy 2 daytime flights Syd-Sin return, Daytime sin-lon, o'nite Lon-sin. Had 24hrs @ Singapore en route to the UK and back. Total cost inc. choice of seats & 32kg baggage, app. A$1800 return. While these flights do not compare with business class, the day in Singapore is far cheaper. And Swimming in the pool was a far more enjoyable experience than taking a 2nd leg the same day and feeling wacked for days after arrival.
label: positive

text: Pleasant enough flight After a pleasant stay at the Silver Kris lounge in Brisbane it was time to board the Singapore Airlines A350-900 in their regional medium haul configuration. The service from the crew throughout the flight was great and attentive and nothing was too much trouble. I had ordered their book the cook for dinner from the menu available online and it was delicious but I was also expecting breakfast and they seemed a little surprised when I asked about it as they served other passengers. Seems on the 7-8 flight between Brisbane and Singapore you get a choice of dinner as soon as possible after take-off or breakfast shortly before landing which I wasn’t aware of but they did serve me a delicious breakfast when I asked about it. The champagne and cocktails served in business class were really nice as was the small amenity kit you could ask for which came in a nice zippered pouch which came in useful after the flight on my trip. The main issue I had was the seat itself I constantly kept bumping into the touch seat controls moving the seat and turning on and off the lights and TV screen which became annoying after a while, also I found the wing on the seat really made it hard to get a good view out of the window. The seat seemed to have plenty of storage but just wasn’t as comfortable for me as some other seats I have been lucky enough to fly in over the years. Overall a pleasant enough flight which was on time.
label: positive

text: Service Great comfort and food. But the attitude of the staff leaves something to be desired. I know every airline has a problem with Indian passengers, and most of it is justified. But not everyone is like that. So a little less arrogance by the staff would have been nicer. On the Kolkata to Auckland sector where we traveled Silk Air and Air New Zealand, we did not face this negativity. Especially Air New Zealand had wonderful staff
label: positive

text: Jakarta to Singapore with Singapore Airlines. This flight was really good. The crew were polite and the meal was great. The crew asked many times whether I needed anything that they could make me more comfortable. The inflight entertainment was a bit old school on this flight but even so they have many updated movies and TV shows which has just launched. Overall I really love flying with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: No empathy for situation After suffering food poisoning during Singapore stopover (delaying flight by 48 hrs) my food choices were limited. I was content to just eat bread rolls or dry biscuits, but was confronted by head steward and threatened with being reported to the pilot for refusing meals offered. Food onboard was only for Asian tastes and not suitable for someone in my situation which I tried to explain but was treated with contempt.
label: negative

text: Uneventful flight - just as it should be Nothing out of the extraordinary. Selection of the latest sitcom was good. I only found out they had the latest season of The Big Bang Theory too late and couldn't binge watch and finish up the entire season (I will remind myself to do that the next time). On a side note, just wished SIA will have more than one flight to and from Adelaide. Would have preferred to fly back to Singapore at a later time (This was a 10am flight).
label: positive

text: amazing Amazing service from all the stewardes Great service. great meals Nice entertainment on board. Thanks for all the amazing trip with you.
label: positive

text: Discrimination, rudeness and destroyed property The contribution of my nightmare trip in August, on the way to India another round of rude people, discrimination and smashing my Samsonite hard cover through bad handling! Singapore airline by far the worst airline experience in last few years.
label: negative

text: My group of travellers experienced impeccable service on this flight. One of us fell became nauseous during the flight, and Eva, the leading stewardess, was of great. She managed to find us some vicks, which really helped stem the nausea. She also checked in frequently to ensure that all was well. Lawrence, the chief steward, was also very welcoming and friendly, and had an affable presence that made the otherwise long journey comforting. Cheryl and Maria, who served us, never forgot details. While service was interrupted during turbulence, one episode lasting longer than 30 min, they could resume where they left off, not forgetting details or requests. This was such a wonderful set of crew, and our group agreed that SQ long haul I'd indeed a cut above, and a great way to fly. Grateful for the experience. Pilots were skillful as well, and navigate the turbulence well.
label: positive

text: Non-existent customer service False advertising states that you are able to change the destination of your flight by contacting their office telephonically or by email. It has now been two weeks and despite being on hold for up to 2 hours at times, not once has the phone been answered. No reply to emails. On Instagram they say they have forwarded my concerns to the relevant department. No replies. Our flight date has come and gone and still no reply. We are also due a refund for extra legroom. Might as well write that off. This seem to be their business model. Disgraceful!
label: negative

text: Very Comfortable _ Premium Economy The Premium Class in our A380 was very good. Roomy seats & attentive Cabin Crew. We used "Book the Cook" & were happy with our selections. As always a huge amount of media to choose from with large screens to watch your movies or TV series from.
label: positive

text: Best in the world! Despite having a basic economy ticket, I was able to get a exit row seat on all the flights (free of charge). SQ has one of the most well organised boarding process in the industry. The zone wise boarding is strictly followed. Nothing to complain about the onboard service. Through they are a little more expensive than some carriers, the extra money is will worth.
label: positive

text: An excellent airline to travel with!! We flew 2 12 hour flights with them and the flights were great. Meals were lovely, nothing was any trouble for the staff, and it didn't seem like a 12 flight, with meals, snacks, and drinks. In fact, my husband said it didn't feel like a 12 hour flight!!
label: positive

text: A350 economy Singapore Airlines are a very good airline in the air. Their business class lounges in Singapore are terrible and fail dismally compared to other airlines business class lounges. The A350 is a lovely smooth quiet aircraft and the interior is clean, comfortable for economy and the aircraft is modern and very smooth. It was an overnight flight so service was rather limited as was the food more of a snack, but the cabin and crew are pleasant friendly and attentive. I wish Singapore airline improved their lounges as they are such poor quality but in the air they are a very good airline and always an enjoyable trip. I have flown business and economy on Singapore Airlines A350 and they are both good products and clean, comfortable and this is a good airline to fly with.
label: positive

text: Shanghai to Singapore. Shanghai is currently among a few airports that receive SQ updated A380 service. The new suites, only 6 in total that occupy the whole forward section of the upper deck, are spectacular. For comparison, in the same area, Etihad fits 9 spacious Apartments, while Emirates manages to squeeze in 14 First Class Suites. The armchair was very comfortable with thick padding, and the bed was easily the most comfortable I have experienced on a plane. The suite itself was so spacious that I thought I was sleeping in a small hotel room. Meal service was great with a lot of attention to details, though I did not find the food as tasty as on other top first class services, including SQ own old Suites. I probably chose the wrong menu item then (book-the-cook was not available for Shanghai). On the ground, I got access to Air China First Class Lounge, which offered both buffet and a-la-carte dinning, though I did not try those as I was full from a big lunch in Shanghai.
label: positive

text: Not Fantastic Not very happy as now they have change their policy of paying seat as like the budget airlines. At times even you can't choose a seat for free within 48 hrs as they block all the seats. They are just by forcing you to pay for the seats.
label: neutral

text: Great flights Changi airport has lots of amenities but I think the signage could be improved. The Silver lounge is very good with food and drinks available all the time. The showers are excellent with a towel and foot mat provided along with shampoo, shower gel, toothbrush, hairdryer etc. The flight was very good although I thought the selection of movies poor. I had tried to book my meals in advance but got and error message each time so gave and accepted the choice on the plane, which was fine. The breakfast sausage was strange and if I could have booked would have chosen pancakes. The staff were excellent. The bed quite comfortable so I slept for quite a few hours. The landing was bumpy but it was very windy due to hurricane/storm Ciara. I would always recommend Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Its the best airline in the world for a reason It seems so wrong to sleep in a business class flight that has the potential to check so many boxes for entertainment, food, drink and comfort. However, the wide lay flat bed is exactly the reason it is worth the extra. I love Singapore Airlines and will go well out of my way to fly with them.
label: positive

text: Always a pleasure to fly with Singpaore Airlines !! Have flown with Singapore Airlines on many occasions and have always been amazed by their quiet and efficient service from boarding to arrival. Their crew do everything they can to make your trip pass without problems. Meals are always well chosen with good choices and they always seem to carry sufficient of each type of meal being offered. On an evening flight, once the meal is completed it is easy to get some rest before the breakfast prior to arrival at our destination. Their aircraft are always clean and well maintained. Always a pleasure to fly with Singapore Airlines - thanks.
label: positive

text: Dispeakable & Deplorable act to fleece passengers! My wife & I booked our business class tickets which allow us to change our return flight bookings against payment of USD250 only. This was duly affirmed by SIA's ground representative at SIA ticketing office (Orchard Road ION building) when we purchased the tickets & is also clearly stated on their e-tickets + email confirmation. Yet when we tried to make a change on our return leg, we were asked by SIA's operators to pay the USD$250 PLUS a fare difference of $1000+ each!!! We told the operator that it is clearly not right, and we emailed SIA's operator our documentary proof, but she told us that the matter has to be escalated to SIA’s management who will revert only AFTER 48-72 hours; DESPITE the fact that we have to travel and attend to an important matter. We find the episode UTTERLLY UNFAIR, UNETHICAL, & RIDICULOUS!!! To-date, there is still no response and we are kept waiting!!! We are being held at ransom!!! We have on hand the confirmation that we are only obliged to pay the USD250 admin fee & NOTHING ELSE! SO we can't help but get the feeling that SIA is trying to FLEECE us. We really wonder how & why does SIA's management is so detached from the operations level, and doesn't know that its middle/lower management is sleeping on their job. How on earth did SIA managed to return to its #1 top spot??? There are ethical ways to make money, BUT fleecing passengers who have paid the price on a clear contract is certainly NOT acceptable or honorable!!!
label: negative

text: Great fligth We flew from Jakarta with a transfer in Singapore to San Francisco. The flight from Jakarta was 1 hour late but staff provided everyone with snacks. Really good chicken and pasta on this 1 1/2 flight. We had a 3 hour layover in Singapore and then off on a 16 hour flight to SFO. The flight was long but stqff were professional - the seats were comfortable - my wife and I had window and aisle with seat between us, and food was good. Lots of entertainment choices on flight. Dim lighting allowed me to sleep and adequate seat pitch (compared to United) allowed me to arrive in one piece.
label: positive

text: It was a really good experience It was wonderful. I mean, they had good food and entertainment for the people. They even provided pillows and eye masks and headphones, and I slept nicely.
label: positive

text: Amazing Flight, amazing Airline This was a long flight but was definitely not noticed due to the level of comfort on board. The seats are extremely comfortable and recline just the right amount to get comfortable. The temperature in the cabin was maintained all the way through the flight so was very nice. The level of service from the cabin crew was second to none, nothing was too much for them and they were very attentive to all of their passengers. I loved the flight so much ive already booked up again to do the same next year....just need to save up now as I want to try the first class cabins!! Overall a very nice flight and ive already recommended them to several people
label: positive

text: Very disappointed with the new A350 and premium ecconomy Last time I reviewed Singapore Airlines I gave them a excellent for their service and business class product. This time I tried their premium economy and what a huge disappointment. I can't for the life of me see where they can justify twice the price of economy for very little extra. Leg room is no better than the exit row in economy, seat room is slightly more than economy, service no better than economy and unlike other airlines there's no pre-takeoff drink. You do get noise cancelling headphones, (At that price though I'd rather use my own). You walk back through economy to use their toilet's, (what few there are), You aren't separated from economy as you are from Business. I experienced the same on the onward leg from Singapore to London on their A380. Use Air New Zealand for premium economy as they set the standard by being rated the best in that class. Honestly, never again. I'll avoid Singapore Air until it matches or betters Airlines like Air New Zealand, Cathay Pacific, Quantas, (Yes even Quantas).
label: neutral

text: Review of Singapore Airlines The flight to & from Adelaide to Singapore was most uncomfortable, the seating was uncomfortable, with very little room. The flight to & from Singapore to Heath Row was a little better. The food was very poor quality. We will never fly Singapore Airlines again, & wouldn't recommend anyone else to do so. There appears to be to many seat's crammed into the economy class compartments. The only positive thing I can say, is that the cabin crew's were excellent.
label: negative

text: Very good service Definitely will get the same airline on my next visit to Singapore very good airline and service. Keep up the good work singapore airline.
label: positive

text: Premium Economy is well worth the extra cost for a comfortable flight The seat was the best way to travel the 7 hours from New York- Frankfurt. The Airbus 380 is being replaced by May 2023, but the seat should be the same on the other aircrafts the have. The seat was the best of all premium seats I have flown in, BA, Virgin, Air France -19.5 inches wide seat and double wide armrest, outstanding inflight entertainment where the screen took up almost the whole back of the seat. The set pitch was standard 38 inches but I did not feel that that my space was compromised when the person in front of me reclined. The footrest was in an awkward position as most are so I just left it up so I could stretch my legs underneath. The food was delicsous though the portion was on the small side. I agree with others, the ground staff was not up to par with the inflight crew but that was most likely due to the ground staff was hired help, not Singapore Air staff.
label: positive

text: Fly high and relax Safe efficient flight with great onboard entertainment. Service and food was on time and drinks to match. Always first choice even if a little more expensive...happy to have my cash go to great maintenance programs....say no more !
label: positive

text: Confort The seat is not comfortable. You have to stand up to lay down your seat. When you are in the bed position you have to be in diagonal with your legs. The service is very good , people are very kind. But even in the 380 airbus the seats are in the same way...
label: negative

text: Business trip to China Took SQ flight to Guangdong on business trip. Flight was on time at departure and arrival. Inflight service, entertainment and meal were good. Smooth flight and comfortable landing.
label: positive

text: Economy service with a larger seat We were excited to fly Singapore Airlines for the first time in its premium economy class. I used the book the cook option ..tick. It started very nicely with us handed an express card to expedite our progress through immigration and security..tick. Unlike Cathay Pacific who invite premium customers to board at leisure, we were boarded with economy class on the Singapore Paris leg???? yes, really. xxx Having travelled premium on other airlines before we were actually stunned not to be offered a welcome drink as we reached our seats. A small detail but a detail nonethe less, and details are what you pay for when you pay double. Were also drank from plastic cups not glasses. The onboard service was very prompt and our flights right on time. The toilets became unkempt on all four legs of our flights. Overall a pleasant journey, but after reading glowing reviews about Singapore being the World's leading airline, I guess we expected the airline to outshine Cathay Pacific and Air New Zealand, but it did not.
label: positive

text: No wonder SQ is rated #1 As part of a 6 flight 3 week vacation we caught SQ978 to Bangkok in Business Class. Whilst it was a short flight it was enjoyable. The 787 Dreamliner was new & modern & we had a far better experience than we had endured on BA16 from Sydney to Singapore in First Class, in their very old 777-300. With all the features in a new aircraft & fine in-flight service the trip was very enjoyable.
label: positive

text: Comfortable Although the flight from Singapore to Manila was delayed for operational reasons,the Airlines more than compensated that with their hospitality and the delicious food. The communication was unambiguous and the satisfaction of the passengers was ensured.
label: positive

text: Great experience.. maybe could be better? Flew business class from Perth to Zurich - I know, how lucky. The flight, the aircraft, the crew - fabulous. 10/10 The Business Lounge at Changi Airport... getting a bit tired and a bit busy. From what I read, there are better lounges than these out there. It was ok... but Business Class aint cheap and expectations high...
label: positive

text: I travelled business class SQ218 from Melbourne to Cebu flight was great and comfortable. Had the new pod seats. Upon my return travelling home to Melbourne SQ237 was disappointing. The Business seats were tiny old and seat was at a very uncomfortable angle. A couple of hours into the flight my back was aching. I've flown a few times business class with this airline but this would have been the worst I have experienced. I think it's time the old planes are upgraded and the seats are refurbished. For the money we pay I think all passengers deserve a comfortable trip.
label: negative

text: Excellent service and comfort Flew with Singapore Airlines for the F1 Grand Prix, not for the first time. But this time I thought I would add a review. As always, a class service and well catered for. Comfort and safety is always important to me and Singapore Airlines never fail on these. Anytime I'm traveling to Asia I will fly Singapore Airlines. Keep up the good work!
label: positive

text: AMAZING SERVICE, VERY COMFORTABLE FLIGHT It's been many years since I've flown Singapore air and they still have the edge. Superb customer service with excellent facilities on board the air craft. The pods for business class have numerous little storage areas, the entertainment system screen is huge and the seats a pretty comfortable (although even for me a little short when in the laydown mode) I thought the headphones they provide were substandard. No noise cancellation feature so there was a lot of background noise. The meal was tasty and they looked after you from start til finish.
label: positive

text: I was pleasantly surprised with our flight on Singapore Airlines from Singapore to Mumbai. The meals were standard aircraft food, seats comfortable enough and cabin crew very attentive and approachable. Aircraft was reasonably clean too. Could do better by improving the cleanliness of toilets. For the price paid, I am happy on overall service from Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Excellent Service First time with Singapore Airlines...excellent service considering I was only flying economy class and had an amazing cheap deal on the flight ! The cabin crew were so attentive and professional. What impressed me was the way they always seemed to be cleaning, picking things up all the time aswell as serving on a busy flight. Usually when you leave an aircraft it looks like a dump site..you could have almost let passengers on to this one it was so tidy. The food wasnt to my taste but was nicely presented and a range of snacks including sandwiches if you were peckish inbetween ;meals. I usually fly Emirates but if I can get Singapore Airlines again to my destination I would book them first. My worst experience was Qatar Airlines last year - same journey - seriously never again !.. Service was awful..plane was cramped Boeing 777 - dreadful aircraft - rather go for the A350 .
label: positive

text: Quality, legroom and baggage allowance The extra legroom compared to some carriers gave comfort, the quality of service, food and entertainment was impressive and the baggage weight allowance removes the headaches when packing. First time flown SA and thoroughly recommend them. Good number of staff at Heathrow to help, great Changi Airport was a breeze for plane change. Note, you are screened again at the gate - reassuring.
label: positive

text: MEL-SIN-KIX and FUK-SIN-MEL in Economy with MEL-SIN on A380 and all others on A330. Enjoyable flights in terms of comfort food and entertainment although the seats on the SIN-KIX leg was definitely a bit firmer than expected. Excellent service from cabin & ground service on all flights with the latter especially friendly & efficient at FUK. Probably the most consistently enjoyable food my wife and I have had on SIA or on any other carrier in Economy over the past 5 years or so. The entertainment system is extensive with more than enough choice for us although the advertising can be annoying after a while. A problem I experienced with the unit on the SIN-MEL flight was overcome when a particularly helpful cabin staff member re-started my system several times and then checked with me 2 or 3 times after that to ensure there had not been any further issues. SIA continues to be our airline of choice between MEL and Asia.
label: positive

text: Bigger but could be better Slightly bigger seat than usual business class Big screen ; limited choice Lots of storage space Restroom not so clean and no spray Also when recline there is no space for legs to go fully in
label: positive

text: good service from air hostesses/hosts. Seats spacious but Beds at an angle, not as comfortable as it looks. attentive service, selection of food & beverages good. left Singapore at an awkward time 01:30, declined refreshments & had a good few hours sleep without interruption.
label: positive

text: Very nice experience Great service, always smiling, quick to response, new A350 and so on. There is nothing bad to say about our trip,
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines I found the economy section lacking in leg room and width compared to other long haul economy class. Food good and plenty of drinks. Stewards very kind and friendly
label: positive

text: Worth the extra $ for premium economy Booked almost a year prior to departure when Singapore Airlines had a very cheap fare to London for economy. Looked at the premium economy fares, $3300, and decided to splash out. The deal at the time even for economy included a $1 night stopover in Singapore, including hotel and transfers. I thought this would break up the long journey and provide a real bed for a sleep. One important point that our travel agent did not know/tell us is that checked baggage can be forwarded, e.i. does not have to be collected for stays of less than 48 hours in Singapore. Would have been much easier to only have to take an overnight bag. The other important point is that you are not met at the arrivals hall by a transport person carrying a sign but have to make your way to the Singapore holidays desk. This was a challenge to learn and find but there are many helpful airport staff to direct one. They then book the transport which meant a further wait of 20 minutes. The hotel, Crown on Royal, was clean and comfortable. Transport back to the airport was on time. Certainly made the 14 hour flight to London much more manageable after 8 hours sleep. The extra leaf room and seat width assisted also. The flight crew were efficient and pleasant. The food is apparently different to economy but like most airline food is not gourmet. They do have a system where you can order, in advance, from a completely different menu. I notice there is a similar deal being promoted at present so take a look if you intend to travel to London.
label: positive

text: Holiday We have been flying wjth Singapore Air fot the last 15 years always The Best. Staff service all the best. Right trough the night theyvwill serve you and be there for your comfort. Thanjpks to staff of Singapore
label: positive

text: Singapore to Perth, SQ215 is a Boeing 787 that has flat beds in business class. The business class seats lie flat but is rather cramped once the table is out. In terms of comfort, it is ok - not as good as the Airbus used for long haul flights. The compartment for legs is rather narrow, so could be uncomfortable for someone taller who needs to bend his/her knees. The food is good, which maintains the Singapore Airlines standard of food. Service is good. The number of drink services is not as frequent as other flights. Overall, I am still happy with SQ and will fly again.
label: positive

text: first class experience i flew economy, i was treated first class, i got alot of perks and freebies + great customer service from the crew, just the remote was not that hightech.. but furthermore, still the best airline byfar
label: positive

text: Why SIA is Rated #1 Beginning in 1977, we have traveled extensively with SIA. Our experience is always superb but on this recent flight, we must relay our utmost delight in the services of our cabin crew. While all flights have offered impeccable food and beverage service, this group of attendants were most courteous and friendly. We realize that it is a difficult task to serve many disparate needs over the course of many hours while maintaining a demeanor of grace, elegance and charm along with comfort and understanding. Our cabin crew completely fulfilled this role and deserve, in our opinion, to be individually recognized for their excellent performance. IMF Derrick, CSS Cyndi (Tan), LS Joseph, FS Gilbert, FSS Katherine, FSS JJ
label: positive

text: Enjoyable Flight It was my first experience with Premium Economy having previously been an economy flyer. I guess when you turn 60 you realise that a bit of extra comfort could be in order! Found the extra width of seat to be very pleasant and the understanding that tilting your seat back was what you paid for to be a positive contributing factor. Seemed to be sharing toilets with the economy group so felt that a toilet of our own class wuld have been better. Overall a pleasant experience and will have difficulty reverting back to economy class again.
label: positive

text: No Improvement Unfortunately Singapore Air once my airline of choice, but no more. For whatever reason their very high standard slowly continues to decline. Even the standard of food is falling. You get boiling hot hand towels and cold hard bread rolls....maybe they should swap? The new planes now have the TV screens at a ridiculously high angle unless you are about 6 feet. On a long trip you have neck ache from looking up. I had a brand new 'Guess' suitcase that cost me several hundred dollars. on arrival at brisbane Airport on return it was covered in sever scuff marks that even WD40 couldn't remove, and had 3 chips out of the case. Many tours have pre booked Singapore Flights which I will actually request be changed in future. Don't even care if it cost me extra. Had enough!
label: neutral
