text: Perth to Singapore. Very pleasant flight and found seats very comfortable. Found the meal tasty and decent portions. Singapore Airlines is one of the few airlines to offer cognac. Cabin crew were attentive and offered refreshments throughout the flight . Would definitely try to take them again when planning my next trip.
label: positive

text: Europe stopover We travelled to Singapore on our way to Europe to visit family. We flew a number of different airlines, all Star Alliance members. If I rated them they would go like this; Singapore 10, Air New Zealand 9, Swiss 6, Lufthansa 4. We also flew with Air Lingus. I’d rate them at 7.5 - this was short haul though while all others were over 11 hour flights. In future we’ll pay a bit more and fly Singapore the whole way. On Singapore Airlines we were treated extremely well. Staff were really friendly and helpful and it felt like they genuinely wanted to make you feel looked after. Food was good and snacks available anytime. The plane seats were modern and comfortable and we weren’t too cramped.
label: positive

text: SQ947 and SQ378 Aug 19 2014. DPS-SIN and SIN-MXP. Nice flights attendants were perfect meal ok too many uninteresting movies.
label: positive

text: Holiday Stopped over in Singapore on route to Australia. Brilliant service, food and facilities on board .Good choice of films. Just brilliant all round
label: positive

text: Enjoyable and efficient One of our shorter flights (2 hours) on the overall Asia trip, but very comfortable. Flight attendants were great with a meal and drinks. Always heard the airline was one of the best in the world and they did not disappoint. Glad we used them to fly to their home country as they take pride in the name.
label: positive

text: Seats uncomfortable Try to travel business class on long haul for flat beds. These seats were wide but quite firm and after a long time sitting got very uncomfortable. Also to get the flat bed you can’t just recline but need to flip seat so you either have flat bed or chair. It’s not easy to flip between the two so not ideal. Much prefer the reclining type like Emirates or BA. food was excellent and service ok.
label: neutral

text: Popular flight Flight timing is perfect, depart BKK at 1830pm gave us ample time to have a relaxing lunch and go to the airport at 1500pm and to do some duty free shopping. Therefore it's not surprising to find this flight is extremely popular with travellers especially those with codeshares. I did not reserve seat with fees so was not able to get window seats in this flight of 2-4-2 configuration, still not bad getting aisle & middle seat. Inflight entertainment and Krisshop were great, I managed to purchase one item with discount.
label: positive

text: As always As always the staff particularly the aircrew are what makes long distance flying in economy class bearable. Singapore airlines crew are hugely respectful whilst being in control. Always responsive and where possible positive to requests.
label: positive

text: Visiting Australia Great airline. Really looked after. Loved the flights. Staff on board were very attentive. Choosing meals before flight was amazing. Great seat room in premium economy. Won’t travel any other way again on long haul.
label: positive

text: Non stop flight Great Flight, Great In Flight service and the crew was awesome and super duper comfortable and you lay flat for a good sleep.
label: positive

text: Express To or from Singa is the same. It should be counted as a express flight as it’s just over 6 hours either way. They were supposed to serve us ‘lunch’ at midnight Singa time? Staff seemed a little disorganised with a new employee and a casual approach on way back to adelaide. Pretty standard run I guess - for them!
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Customer Service I travel frequently and i have to Singapore Airlines is one of my favorites. Great customer care, very attentive staff; Always kind and helpful. In general flights leave and arrive in time (I am based in china where this is very often not the case). I enjoy the entertainment system, good quality and many new movies to watch. I was seated in the Economy Premium this time and found the seating quite spacious and enjoyed the extra leg space. Singapore Airlines = Happy landings.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Sydney on a pretty tired and shabby Singapore Airlines Boeing 777. Seemed to be few cabin crew and lacking on inflight entertainment options. This felt like it had been flying since the mid 90s. No floor space as there was an IFE box that took up most of the legroom in the footwell area.
label: negative

text: to fly, to serve OK, I know the above title is BA's tag line but in the case of Singapore Airlines it really feels sincere and authentic, at least at the front of the plane. The welcome, attention and recognition is quite extraordinary compared to Britain's flag carrier. Sure, prices are higher but the difference in customer experience is palpable at all levels - from the priority boarding which really differentiates and works, through the (old fashioned) provision of newspapers and periodicals on board and the outstanding service, to the quality of the offering in terms of seating space/equipment and the quality of the products (Dom Perignon for example - BA used to have Krug, now it's Perrier-Jouet). Is everything perfect ? No, for instance in the take-off/landing position I found the seats rather uncomfortable even if they're roomy but overall SQ is a class apart and it starts with the crew who come across as really caring about the passengers by comparison to the hit and miss standards of some BA flight staff nowadays.
label: positive

text: Treated like a Lord We have never flown long haul before. We were not apprehensive in any way. From check in to arriving in Australia the staff were attentive,courteous,friendly and efficient. Nothing was too much trouble. When we next go to Australia SingaporeAir will be our 1st choice
label: positive

text: Outstanding service from 1 person made up for really poor service from 2 Booked to fly HCM to Singapore to Auckland. Requested a change to fly Siem Reap to Singapore to Auckland. Told no. Followed original plan. Flight into Singapore on time, but then told a delay to Brisbane/ Auckland as no plans. Probably 2 hours but no guarantee.This would then have compounded for us and caused an additional 6 hour delay in Brisbane so at least 8hr delay. Asked service desk 1 for option. Told nothing they can do in a very rude way. Changed terminal asked at service desk tthere and same rude attitude and no options offered. On the office chance walked to service desk at other end of same terminal. Guy couldn't have been more helpful. PUt us on a flight to Sydney connecting through and we got home at original time. Now that is service
label: positive

text: A wonderful flight with Singapore as usual. We fly reasonably regularly to London Heathrow and we just love Singapore business. My wife now needs wheelchair assistance at big international airports like Changi and Heathrow and this is organised seamlessly. The lounges are comfortable well stocked and have very helpful staff. Seating in business is spacious and very comfortable with seemingly endless adjustments. The flat bed allows a pretty good sleep although I can never work out how to get it in sleeping mode although there is always cabin crew there to help me. The food is very good and beautifully presented. There is a huge entertainment library and the system is easy to use. Deservedly Singapore is always at the very top of best long haul airlines. We would always prefer to use SIA business.
label: positive

text: Apart from my Mileage Plus problem, the IFE, crew attitude and food were amazing. They mostly gave me Salmon for my seafood meals. They were also willing to answer to my curiosity about the laughter coming from the rear galley. Another problem encountered was the Wi-Fi because I had to pay for it. However, neither the Wi-Fi nor my Mileage Plus problems were as big as the problem encountered in 2014. I can say, quite a big improvement in service from 2016. All in all, the problems (Mileage Plus & Wi-Fi) were much smaller
label: positive

text: THE WORLDS BEST AIRLINES Amazing services , being a PPS member i am always treated with best of everything , staff courtesy beyond expectation , choice of food , drinks are amazing. cannot forget the services offered . the pampring is truly Royale.
label: positive

text: Business Class Singapore Airlines The service was superb. After flight take off, flight attendance serve my food (around 1.00 am) then I sleep without anybody disturb me (no disturbing light is on). Thank you to Singapore Airlines highly recommend.
label: positive

text: Outstanding Food and Service Even in Coach Coach is Coach with tight seating, but the service is outstanding. Good food and attentive personnel. Constant attention. Two full meals with snacks in between.
label: positive

text: This was my first time for me to travel with Singapore Airlines. I had an amazing experience, food was wow and customer service excellent, very neat and tidy well organized. I will recommend to my Aussie kiwi and Fiji friends.
label: positive

text: Excellent service but food could be better As usual SQ has an excellent service and there is no denying that. The food (on the way forward and back) was not great. It was edible - that's the most I can say about it. SQ can do better with food !!! Wines were great; champagne was excellent.
label: positive

text: The check-in process at JFK T4 was seamless. We got access to the Wingtips Lounge, which was fine but there was nothing to be excited about. Boarding was orderly despite the fact that there were many passengers (our A380 flight that night was almost full). On board, the seat looks nice and comfortable, though one of the windows is blocked by the seat design. Staff were nice and attentive, something you would expect from SQ anyway. The food was excellent (I booked my main course from the Book-the-Cook menu). The flight arrived in Frankfurt a bit late, but not a problem at all. Overall, this is what a good flight should be.
label: positive

text: Tedious Manual Process for Redemption Ticket I needed to use all my accrued points that were about to expire from not being able to travel during the last 2 +years of Covid. The process of trying to get a flight was 100% manual, i.e. calling in to speak with an associate, and relying on the associates to verbally relay to you what flight is available. The website and app do not work. I have been playing with it for a long time. I consider myself to be a tech. savvy user. I had to call 4 times, and finally actually got the mileage redemption ticket via United associates who were able to identify the mileage redemption class ticket on Eva Air for me. Shame on KrisFlyer team! Singapore airline is totally overrated. Having a good in-flight service is only one component of customer experience. But having an outdated system that does not bring convenience needs to be highlighted when considering being a long-term value member.
label: negative

text: perfect service In these days of economy travel where all frills are taken away, Singapore airlines is like a whiff of fresh air. Beginning with a great smile from the hostess to the superb meal which is absent in most other flights and the comfortable seats, everything in Singapore airlines is transfomed from economy to heavenly. I would anyday select Singapore airlines over any other option. The pricing is also great.
label: positive

text: very good airline, excellent service and great food, very punctual airline. great flight, great service and excellent food, I have often travelled in Singapore airlines, and its a great airline to fly. they are very efficient and punctual. I even wrote a review for the crew on board
label: positive

text: First time It's my first fly with Singapore Airlines and Im excited to experience their service. And for me it's amazing it didnt let me down I'm just an economy passenger who availed a promo rate airfare but still the service for me was like I'm in a first class hehehe and I really enjoyed the food even the entertainment they provided..it's even my first time not to take a sleep..since most of my flights I will be dozing off right after the aircraft's take off but no way Im still fully awake and enjoying my movies hehehe like a kid..keep it up guys the flight attendants are all polite😊😊😊..God bless you all hopefully on my next vacation I will be flyung with you guyz..Big thanks to all the crew from the pilot to the flight attendants...once again God bless you all!!!
label: positive

text: always try to fly with them, they are a bit more expensive love singapore airlines we styed over for 3 days and nights, as we have a friend who lives there very clean and nic epeople
label: positive

text: Lost passport found and delivered - Thank you, Vish! Full marks to Vish of Singapore Airlines at Auckland! My wife lost her passport and the Airline found it on the aircraft. Luckily my wife has dual nationality and so could use her other passport to enter New Zealand, but a few days later Vish called to say the lost passport had been found and so arranged for it to be delivered to us (at MIQ in Auckland). Excellent service!
label: positive

text: Badly let down by Singapore airlines We had always been told that Singapore airlines was a 5 star airline, so we were delighted to find out that’s who we were flying with on our holiday. Getting to our destination was great, but & this is a big BUT, our return home was a totally different story, we checked in at our destination airport, got given our transfer boarding cards & went on our way. Nothing was mentioned that when we get to our 1st stop off we were going to have to wait nearly 24 hours in Singapore airport, then after that we were going to have to wait another 18 hours in Frankfurt for our final flight. None of this was on our original itinerary & we weren’t informed until we got to our 1st stop off, this change of flights was all done by Singapore airlines & no one informed us on check in. Really poor customer service & no thought of our well being at all by Singapore airlines. I would dread to fly with Singapore airlines & would advise against.
label: negative

text: Premium Economy great Flight leaves 11.50 which is great. Seats good 32 d & 32e and no one was beside us. They do serve a meal not long after takeoff, and then you can get snacks through the night and breakfast served before landing. Seat recline so you can have a good sleep. Staff excellent. The only thing I don’t like is not having toilets in the premium economy section.
label: positive

text: Travelled from New Delhi to Manila via Singapore. The ground crew did not mention anything about the flight delay and did not bother to ask if we had a preferred schedule for our connecting flight. The inflight service was terrible. I asked for earphones from three different flight attendants but was only given one when I typed my request on my iPad. The food was nothing spectacular. The ground crew on my flight from Singapore to Delhi insisted that I have my backpack checked in and argued that it was too big. I have used the same bag on my flights with KLM and Emirates and they allowed me to carry it inflight. I have high regards before with this airline but sadly their service has gone downhill.
label: negative

text: Just a bit disappointed We flew from Sydney to Singapore, Singapore to Moscow, Millan to Singapore then Singapore to Sydney in June and July 2018. Singapore Airline has such a high reputation and I had a good experience before. When I found Qantas did not have the route we wanted to take and as an alternative Singapore Airline had exactly what we planned, I was delighted. It was, however, not what I expected. Seats were ok but staff attitudes and meals were not as good as the ones of Qantas which I usually use. Qantas premium economy has better meals with real cutlery and staff treat the passengers with more care. At Singapore Airline, passengers at premium economy were the same as economy, just seats widths difference. I felt unfortunately it was not worth paying double the price for “premium”.
label: neutral

text: Great airline with excellent staff! From check-in to disembarking Singapore Airlines were wonderful. The check-in agent at ORT airport was so friendly. With my Dad making use of a wheelchair the cabin crew were great. On board service was efficient and seamless. Nothing was to much for them. We experienced the same outstanding service at Changi airport all the way back home to Johannesburg.
label: positive

text: What a shame. Delayed baggage when I arrived at the Paris airport. The representative told me that it would be sent the next day. I arrived on Thursday evening and it is now Saturday evening and I have not seen my luggage. Neither received any calls from anyone. I don't know where is my luggage and I am left waiting for it at home. Even low cost airline provide a better customer service support. I have no idea why it is cited as among the best airlines. It is not even Top 20 in my book. Was my first time flying with this airline and it will be the last.
label: negative

text: MY NIGHTMARE CAME TRUE... Flight bumped I had booked a flight with Singapore airlines to depart from London to Sydney via Singapore, which was leaving in 2 days time... It was only yesterday when they had called me to confirm I had all of my relevent documents for my flight e.g. passport so it seemed very positive. My flight was all "confirmed" on my Singapore airlines account. Not even 24 hours later, I received a call and a guy advised that I was bumped off my flight, which was only 48 hours before I was meant to fly off. They then advised the next available flight will be in 2.5 weeks..... this was not an option for me as I need to get home for work. They were not apologetic at all and gave no sympathy over my situation. This has left me very distressed and I will NOT ever be flying with Singapore Airlines again.
label: negative

text: Relaxed friendliness Great flight with really happy aircrew who just wanted to make sure everything was spot on. From getting on board to the gate in Houston they could not do enough. Thanks it was fun!
label: positive

text: They cancel flights with no explanation. Non existent customer service. We bought return tickets 7 months in advance with free flight change. We chose 1 stopover of 2hrs aswe have 2 kids 6 yrs old. 1 month after we booked we received an email saying one flight on each way has been cancelled. The new flights assigned turned the 1 stopover into 2 stopovers each way. One of the connection allows only 15min between flights! Have they ever taken a connecting flight?! I called multiple numbers, emailed to multiple email addresses with no t a single reply. Simply shocking and extremely rude.
label: negative

text: Comfortable long haul trip The trip was made in 23 hours. Comfortable seats Enough space around you Very good entertainment system with large selection of new movies and big screens for watching Great service and champagne:-) The a380 is more quiet though Good headset is provided if you don’t bring your own. Food is average and you get enough
label: positive

text: Long haul South Nothing was too much bother for the cabin staff and kept me well refreshed on all legs of my journey.Made the connections comfortably and the on board entertainment along with the comfortable seating and clean spacious cabin meant the journey was very pleasant given the distance traveled. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend them for anyone planning a long haul.
label: positive

text: Some Singapore Airline sectors have terrible service The flight service was pitiful both going and returning. From the start the TV was not wotking. My husband asked several times if they could correct this - he waited for hours and finally gave up and went to sleep. The flight attendant then comes around a couple of hours into his sleep and wakes my husband up to let him know that the TV was working!! They give us a menu for food choices and then told us that they had run out of our choice at the beginning of the flight!! Why bother to give a menu then? Time came for drink orders and my husband asked for a brandy/cognac and got nothing. He waited very patiently but had to remind them four times before they finally brought it. We used the same airline from Delhi to Singapore and back - the service on those flights were fine.
label: negative

text: Last Flight In May 2017 we went to STAY in Singapore for 1 week, as we had only passed thru many times since a 1 week stay in 1984, A great visit it was too. The in-flight films etc was NOT OPERATING on flight up, And we were compensated with a gift of tea bags on exiting. Would have preferred the system to have been operational, but not so. Flight was GREAT as was our transit private Mercedes to our accomm arranged by our travel agent, Teresa Turton,Travel Associates, Rockingham. Ph 08 95278812 or +61404448440. BRILLIANT for our final journey to Singapore
label: positive

text: Cancelled flight without notice Letting other travelers know to avoid Singapore Airlines after they cancelled one leg of my flight without any kind of notification. Now, 48 hrs away from travel date and school holidays starting, I have little chance of organizing an alternative. That's right, after hours on the phone they have no help/replacement and urge me to cancel the whole flight instead. Even though flights are available on their website - it is almost as if they would rather resell my ticket. I booked the trip early November last year and expected disruptions. Sure enough, two of the six flights were affected by changes which resulted in longer layovers - this is what I am prepared to accept. However, to leave me high and dry just hours away from the trip, no notice and no help is unacceptable. I have sent three messages to Singapore Airlines via their precious web form: no response; wasted time on the useless chat bot, can't open my booking online as they simply say 'to get in touch with an SA office'. Plus several calls and when I finally got through it became apparent operators are trained to deflect, not help.
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines Comfortable flight. The flight attendants were charming. The seating was good and monitor worked well. The food was ok for economy class. I enjoyed the poached eggs..well cooked! Check in was simple and the airport in Singapore is wonderful.
label: positive

text: Service is excellent, food was terrible What can I say? It was amazing even if we're sitting in economy class. Very accommodating especially with my son who has special needs. However, if you booked your flight to a travel agent, Singapore Airlines-MNL, is useless. They do not want to touch our booking. I want our seat to be upgraded and they can not do anything. Also, they have the worst food.
label: positive

text: Pleasure being with helpful staff Generous luggage allowance 30k,nice helpful staff, flight on time, no delays, what a difference in attitude, a pleasure tofly with them as everything went as it should very smoothy so u made my journey a no d one thanks
label: positive

text: Jakarta to Singapore on the A350-900 (9V-SMD). Check-in was quick since we checked in online and arrived early. Flight left Jakarta slightly behind schedule but arrived on time in Singapore. Flight attendants provided quick lunch service and two drink runs in a short flight (1 hour 20 minutes). Even though they were still very polite and courteous, the FA on this particular flight were not as energized or cheerful as other flights we were in. Entertainment system uses touchscreen system that is very easy to use with lots of choices. Restrooms were clean. Minimum communications from flight deck; we didn't get announcement on which terminal in Singapore we will arrive in and local weather conditions like they usually broadcast before arrival. We have a connecting flight in Singapore from Terminal 3, so I asked several FA for arrival information and they didn't know either. I finally got the informations I needed on arrival terminal (Terminal 2) after looking at the system generated flight informations in the entertainment system; and even informing the FA on this.
label: positive

text: Great airlines, delicious food and good service. Great airlines, delicious food and good service. Some of the staff were more friendly, some less, but overall, no problem at all. Excellent service ! Hope to fly again.
label: positive

text: Best business class seat I have flown many business class flights on 5-star airlines such as Cathay Pacific, Qatar Airways, and Korean Air. However, on long-haul flights, Singapore Airlines' business class B777-300ER has great service, seats, and food onboard. The flight crew is very friendly. They care about me and respond quickly if I request something. The food is really tasty, especially the Western style. I ate lobster thermidor, and it is one of the best foods I have ever eaten on an aeroplane. Besides that, their hard product is the top reason why I chose Singapore Airlines. I chose 11K for my seat on this flight. The bulkhead seat provides a spacious bed, and it is wide enough that my companion and I can sit together.
label: positive

text: one of the best one of the best airlines available. from ground service to the actual flight just could not have anything negative to comment. also to note the efficiency on the internet services and check-in on line. easy to follow and works !!!! great care for children
label: positive

text: Great flight all round! I flew SYD-SIN and really enjoyed my flight on Singapore's A380. The inflight entertainment was great with all the latest movies and TV shows. I was lucky enough to be sitting on the upper deck which offers more cabin space. The food was great and had a good variety of Western and Asian food. The seats were comfortable and had an ok recline. The cabin attendants were friendly and always had a smile!
label: positive

text: Do not live up to Star Alliance Partnership spirit A family of 6 travelling, 2 biz (paid), 4 economy (2 paid, 2 redemption). SQ doesn't offer LAX or SFO connection to ORD for 1 stop, hence we have to book separately on UA and upon check in, they failed to link up the final destination for our baggage and we have to re-checking through the counter again (instead of dropping off on domestic) SQ web recommended 2 stop SIN-FRA-JFK connection with a non Star Alliance JetBlue Airways, this is totally, this outrages that waste our time and our membership privileges were compromised. All your hard earned Gold Status are not put in good use. Why could not they do a better SIN-SFO-ORD (1 stop) connection with UA? after all ORD is UA hub? SQ do away with its own Kris Lounge in SFO. I strongly recommend, do not fly with SQ to US, they are no difference compared to others.
label: negative

text: San Francisco to Singapore via Hong Kong. Beautiful seats with such comfort. Sufficient storage space. If you long for Singapore cuisine there is tons on board. Whilst I did not eat the crew reserved a banana for me before we landed. The SFO-HKG was uneventful as the crew were kind switched off the lights early allowing us to sleep. The HKG-SIN sector departed on time and the HKG ground crew and lounge staff were very courteous attending to any questions I had about my allergies. The crew was quick to get us our drinks and meals and then we settled to do our work or watch a movie. My suggestion is that if the crew is aware that on board wifi is not available for the initial part of the HKG-SIN as apparently the networks are not that great. This will be very helpful.
label: positive

text: Excellent service We had a really good experience on this flight from the moment we checked in - the staff were attentive and gave us an excellent service from the minute we boarded until we were due to leave the aircraft. The 'book the cook' was superb and my lobster was of restaurant quality
label: positive

text: Disappointed Customer service Singapore Airlines took five weeks to reply to my email about my flight that was two weeks after my arrival date 3 hours to check in took 45 minutes to connect customer service by phone flight was good customer service was terrible won't be using them again
label: negative

text: 380 Airbus This was my first time on a 380, considering the size of the aircraft, there was not much leg room as you would think of an aircraft of that size. myself and my family upgraded our seats, only to find it was opposite the door to the crews rest room. this meant for the 13 hour flight there was a constant draft coming from that door. they should put a curtain in place to prevent the draft. However it was a wonderful experience with great cabin crew that catered for all your needs, even more blankets to keep you warm.
label: positive

text: UNFORTUNATELY THE SERVICE WITH A SMILE HAS GONE Singapore Airlines was top of the pops as far as flying was concerned. On this flight however, the stewardess were just doing their job, going through the motions and nothing more. Felt like it was an imposition to ask for anything. Guess service has changed or maybe it was just the crew on this flight.
label: positive

text: Great experience and good customer service Was a great experience flying on this route for the 1st time. The stewardess was prompt to serve and served with a smile.
label: positive

text: Great one way but failed us on return Wonderful service on our trip out to New Zealand via Singapore, flight left and arrived on time, check in was easy and smooth. Sadly, Singapore cancelled their flights from Christchurch, NZ, before we were due to leave due to the pandemic and we're still waiting for a refund (2 months on). If not for this, we would mark them up to 5 stars.
label: positive

text: SQ 469 Had the worst flight ever with Singapore airlines. Service level and quality of the food have declined significantly. Even Srilankan is still better than sia.
label: negative

text: We are long time Kris flyers our flights SQ 224 and SQ 866 7 April 2014 Perth - Singapore Singapore - Hong Kong there were no problems as was SQ 805 22 April 2014. Beijing - Singapore however SQ 223 25 April 2014 Singapore - Perth what a shambles full flight cabin staff were more interested in 'special meals etc'. Eventually after a 1.5 hour delay we were served lunch you read about staff not answering call button this happened to us eventually our call was answered there was definitely a problem. No coffee and tea was brought around eventually my husband took our meal trays down to the back galley only to be met with oh! We forgot! On leaving the aircraft - there was not one cabin crew member to be seen.
label: negative

text: Really been let down Usually I love flying through Singapore and can’t fault their service however on my flight to London I got food poisoning from the eggs not being heated up correctly as they were served barely lukewarm (never had food poisoning before don’t judge me for my poor choice) and I contacted Singapore to let them know and heard nothing back at all, not even a simple apology. After spending 6 hours in hospital on an IV drip because I was unable to stop vomiting longer than 3 minutes I would think the least they would do is apologise? It’s really put me off flying with them next time I come to the UK
label: negative

text: MUC-SIN 777-300ER 5/5/15. Older plane was a bit rough around the edges but it might be one of the ones due for a refit. Flight left on time and arrived on time. Flew economy and had a whole row to myself that said there was still more than enough space if the row was full. Service was attentive with staff coming through often with drinks. All meal option available but it was a half empty plane so was not expecting problems the quality is first rate as always as was the entertainment system.
label: positive

text: This airline is worth the money every time we have flown with them. The staff always moving around the cabin when it is semi dark as some people are not asleep, offering drinks or snacks to keep up the enjoyment of flying. The food from Brisbane is a big improvement from June 2022 but the food on the return Singapore to Brisbane was a let down with cold and tough beef and two rude female cabin staff but otherwise great service on all flights. We had to fly Emirates Airline from Mumbai to Johannesburg and this airline needs to look how Singapore Business Class is five star.
label: positive

text: Up to standard with reasonable fare Satisfied with overall experience. Flight attendants were helpful and friendly. No delay of departure time. Pre-ordered oriental vegetarian meal and it was above average comparing other airlines. Will definitely use their service again.
label: positive

text: Best Airline!! This is my second time flying 4th time flying with Singapore airlines and it never fails to feel me comfortable. It was a long flight and the seats were very comfortable. I really feel secure with Singapore airline. The food was good as well. I Will always travel with this airline. Period.
label: positive

text: Great attention from the flight attendents Plenty of flight attendants on duty for the whole flight, particularly with water and juice during the whole journey. Nothing was too much trouble. Not flown with Singapore Airlines for a few years but will definitely be doing so next time.
label: positive

text: Back to the airline we can trust We loved our flight to Osaka a couple of years ago, but last year we decided to use another airline so we could fly direct from Bangkok to Tokyo. I was not very impressed with this airline, especially the food, so this year's trip we went back to the airline we can trust & were not disappointed. The service is impressive & the hot towels before take off & landing are a great touch. The 30kg baggage allowance is another reason we use Singapore airlines. See you next year!
label: positive

text: I was at the airport early and check-in was supposed to open 3 hours before departure but opened 15 minutes late with long queues for both, economy- and business-class already. No warm welcome back by the leading stewardess. No welcome-drinks, no hot-towel and with the exception of slippers no amenities. For my after take-off drink I opted for a hot sake. Together with satays as canapés I got a tiny 4cl glass of sake and not the full 180ml bottle. One different guest, however enjoyed the whole bottle by his own – another example, that Solitaire-PPS-membership does not pay out anymore. I ordered a Gin&Tonic instead, delivered to me with my own lemons, which I brought from the Lufthansa-lounge. I also brought my own Lufthansa-refreshing-towels, which the crew chilled for me and brought to me after meals and sleeping. The starter (beef pastrami) was tiny but tasty. The chicken roulade with pretzel stuffing was a pretzel roulade with lots of pretzel outside and a tiny piece of chicken inside, dry and almost tasteless. My choice of wine (Australian Shiraz) was disappointing. Ironically, SIA re-introduced a printed menu, even featuring its ‘wine connoisseurs’ – but the actual wine-list was missing, so I could not verify the exact origin of my wine. The cheese-plate was disappointing consisting of 2 small tiny bits only (before it was at min. 3 choices, being freshly cut) with no grapes, as before. At least the Pumpkin Seed Parfait was nice and I was lucky to get the chocolate cake on request. No pralines. My choice of digestive, the Aberfeldy 16 years’ single malt was not catered for and a Japanese whiskey was offered instead. Why then having a single malt on the menu? As SIA doesn’t hand out any amenities to its business-class passengers, I brought my own slippers and amenity-kit from a flight with Austrian earlier. The next disappointment was the economy-class-style breakfast with scrambled eggs or egg-noodles (2 different styles, though) and yoghurt or muesli. The only difference to an economy-class breakfast is, that the dishes are being served one after each other, but the sizes are tiny. I was lucky, there were still the seafood noodle soup from lunch left, so I decided for that. No freshly squeezed orange-juice. Thank you SIA for a good flight-experience before Covid. But now, with all the service and amenity-cuts it’s time to say goodbye.
label: negative

text: Lovvveeee As usual, service was great. Loved the food, the drinks (gin and tonic), in flight entertainment. Usually would use SIA as I book early thus cheap. Only thing is that the plane going there was older so more worn. Need a little touch up
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines great service The seats were comfortable and the leg room adequate The stewards were friendly and helpful and very professional The only problem I encountered was the meal I chose was unavailable as I was sitting in the lasr row and I didn't enjoy the meal I was given None the less free Singapore Slings were a bonus
label: positive

text: A350 very short legroom We first took the A350. The legroom is so short that I couldn't bend. I m at 1.75m tall. The food was terrible. Everything just in a tub n a drink. Like junk food. Never take SQ A350 economy class.
label: negative

text: Inflight entertainment selection is poor…and meals are poor compared to other airlines. The leather seats are hard and uncomfortable. The amenities bag is rubbish - no socks and no eye mask.
label: negative

text: Europe trip Highly recommend to travel via SQ flight for long haul flight. Feels comfy and good service on board. No 2nd thoughts of other flight.
label: positive

text: One of the best airlines known for inflight service Singapore airline’s service is consistently well above average amongst all the premium airlines. We have flown this airline many times and were satisfied each time with their overall performance.
label: positive

text: Cancelled flight then empty promises Unfortunately our flight was cancelled as we sat waiting to board. We reclaimed our cases then stood in a queue for 2hrs. We put on a bus to Heathrow after another hour. Nearly 4 hrs later we arrived at a very busy check-in. During this time we were given a sandwich,bag of crisps & bottle of water as we had missed lunch. We also had missed tea so were given £15 voucher to spend at Heathrow. Unfortunately we had to go straight from check-in to boarding they they were of no use whatsoever. We were told at Manchester that we could claim compensation. I had paid for extra leg room but of course didn't get that on the new flight (13hrs ).We arrived 10hrs 30 mins late and so missed a full day in Singapore. During the holiday I was promised 200SD in-flight vouchers as a gesture of goodwill and then heard NOTHING. I have sent e-mails to a couple of people but nobody is bothering to reply. NOT my idea of the no.1 airline !!
label: negative

text: One of the only airlines I fly This is my second time this year travelling on Singapore Airlines. I have never had any issues for on time travel. The economy seats are comfortable enough, and the in flight entertainment service is included (unlike some) with a great range of recent options. The service by the cabin staff is always exceptional, and the food selections are good. This flight I chose a ginger chicken for lunch and char siu fried rice for refreshment, both good quality. The ability to choose basic spirits (or even a Singapore sling) as drink options is great. Recommended!
label: positive

text: Flight SQ636. Our flight to Tokyo was scheduled for 9:50 pm 20/4/24 but the plane only took off at nearly 1 am 21/4/24. The pilot first announced that an Engineer was on his way to check on the plane as there is a technical fault. After about 40 mins, he comes back on to inform that the Engineer is still on the way and that a part in the plane would have to be checked. After another 30 mins or so, the pilot announced that there will be a need to replace a part in the plane with a nearby plane and that they would have to conduct a full shutdown of the power in the plane. We were left in darkness for about 10 mins with no lighting and fresh oxygen. There was more waiting till a further hour before the pilot announced that the part has been replaced and that the plane would take off in 10 mins - that did not happen for about a further 40 mins. Throughout the entire ordeal, the pilot sounded very cavalier and while he apologised a few times, his tone and voice came across as if it is just a game or that it was no big deal. Why allow us to board when the plane has technical issues? Why isn't there an Engineer on site at Changi Airport SIA is a local airline? Why isn't there ready supply of spare parts that you need to get from another plane? At the end of the flight, all we got was an email apologising to us for the delay. The least that SIA can do to show that it really takes the sloppiness as a serious quality issue is to give all the passengers gift vouchers or free miles. As an airline that prides itself as a top international airline not only was the flight experience my worst one, but the post-sale experience lacked any sincerity and initiative.
label: negative

text: One of the best airlines I've ever flown Food, service and timeliness were all top notch. The flight attendants were really focused and attentive. The only complaint that I had was the lack of a vanity kit but the business class toilet was prerty well stocked so just a minor quibble. Highly recommended!
label: positive

text: Excellent economy flight Hanoi Singapore Absolute food service in an fully packed airplane by SQ Staff . Very attentive to personal needs and always looking that flight is a pleasure. Good meal and Bord entertainement. Much better than Silkair which I Had on the leg Singapur — Hanoi
label: positive

text: Amazing flight Singapore airlines are without doubt the best airline that we have ever flown with. The crew were so attentive on our long flight, nothing was too much trouble.
label: positive

text: Traumatic Rescheduling Experience Recently I booked a ticket from Brisbane to Bangalore, however due to Visa delays I had to reschedule the dates. One of my Sigapore airlines ticket was rescheduled at a nominal fee, which was done through makemytrip. But I have faced a very traumatic experience rescheduling the one with goibibo. I bought the ticket for 38k INR. The rescheduling fee on goibibo website shows 3.5k INR plus the fair difference. Now here comes the funny part. I checked the prices of the ticket before calling and rescheduling and the flights were cheaper, around 35k INR on my preferred date. So when I called them the estimate first time given to me was 25,500 INR. The breakdown was 14K INR rescheduling fee and 11K INR fair difference. I will never know how rescheduling fee got there, neither will I know how the fair difference came in picture. When I called goibibo for the same, I was told that Singapore airlines can adjust the fee(apparently to whatever they want). And when I asked about the fair difference they said, that they cannot book me in the fresh ticket which costs lesser than my ticket, they will book me in some another ticket for which the fair difference exists apparently. Now the next day apparently when I got a call back from goibibo for rescheduling, they are quoting the charges above 1,00,000 INR. Can you believe it? The ticket still costs 35k INR. But if I have to reschedule it, it will cost that much. Here they are practically forcing me to cancel my non refundable ticket. And making me buy a fresher one. So much for the facility of rescheduling? I am attaching the picture of the cost of available ticket on the date I want it rescheduled. Now you decide what is fair? Or maybe learn that how one can loot from another getting a superior position. Do learn from my mistake and do not book such dicey tickets.
label: negative

text: amazing trip Singapore airlines were excellent on all our flights. Good food and excellent service throughout. would definitely recommend.
label: positive

text: great service Comfortable seating great service from the on board staff , heaps of movies , what I noticed was the staff did a lot to help travellers with small and crying children with drinks or treats to minimise the discomfort to other travellers well done Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: Strict airlines Previously I experienced the airline with a flight from Bangkok to Singapore, on business class. It was one of the best flights I've ever been on that time, especially when it came to the staff being amazingly polite, hospitable and soo welcoming. This time, we had a lot of unfortunate events! and some miscommunications of the ground staff! Was totally unexpected based on my experience before. I guess it wasn't our day! The flight itself was good, though again the staff was much different from what I noticed on my first flight, could be due to class being different! may be. The craft was a new one, despite the flight being so short but the seats were amazing, with great choices of inflight internainment to choose from. and Thankfully we landed on time.
label: positive

text: WOW WOW WOW This was the first post covid trip after a long hiatus and i was very excited. The airport experience was a bit different with no express lanes to breeze through security and immigration but it didn't matter I was just happy to smell the jet fuel again.The lounge in Sydney was just right. Boarding was a bit hectic but once on board and seated in 24A I was very happy. The service was as expected, brilliant as was the food and all over comfort. Boarding again in December.
label: positive

text: Could do better The service provided by Singapore Airlines is very inconsistent. I had an exceptional flight from Melbourne to Singapore on the previous day where crew were proactive and helpful, present in the cabin without being intrusive and service delivered with a smile, despite departure being delayed by an hour due to bad weather. However, flying from Singapore to London Heathrow on Tuesday 4th June 2019 was a very different story. The crew were, with one exception surly and sour faced. The crew carried it the first meal service shortly after takeoff and it was carried out so quickly that it became apparent that the crew were more interested in maximising their own break time. The second meal, promoted as pre arrival, was served half way through the fourteen hour flight- not really what I’d call pre-arrival. Definitely had the feel of providing service to suit the crew needs above the passengers needs. If you have the misfortune of sitting in seat 31C (Premium Economy) on the old A380 seating configuration, get ready to be flicked by the galley curtain every time a crew member enters or leaves that particular galley.
label: neutral

text: Excellent service Plenty of legroom, excellent service from the crew but the food was disappointing, particularly the breakfast. They make a mean G&T!
label: positive

text: This airline is world class and knows how to treat it's customers with professionalism and respect. Hands down, the best airline I've traveled with, (and I've traveled a lot). If their standards remain top notch, I'll be a customer for life.
label: positive

text: Best in the air? In nearly forty years of flying overseas from Australia, this was my first experience of Singapore Airlines. I now cannot imagine flying with anyone else. We were able to check in on line and pre-select our meals from an extensive range. Check in was reasonably straight forward and an issue we had was quickly resolved. The Lounges at both Brisbane and Singapore were serene, uncrowded and very comfortable. The aircraft (A350 and Boeing 777) were very clean. The business class cabin in both aircraft has four seats in each row as opposed to other airlines that have seven. Thus there was excellent space and no feeling of being crowded. Each seat had direct access to an aisle so there was no having to climb over a fellow passenger. The only criticism had was that the seats were not 100% comfortable and it was difficult to find a position for a doze without laying out the bed. The staff were uniformly wonderful. They were friendly and respectful. Nothing was too much trouble and they checked on each passenger on a regular basis. The food was much better than we have had on other airlines in recent years. All in all a great experience.
label: positive

text: I flew Singapore Airlines for the first time ever last August. Since then I have flown another 2 times to Shanghai return from Brisbane. I can not fault them. The food service and seats are great. The planes between Brisbane and Shanghai are always full but the service is never lacking. The A380 between Shanghai and Singapore is great as well when I select the exit row upstairs. I will never fly another airline to China again.
label: positive

text: Dusseldorf to Hanoi via Singapore. Both segments were truly pleasant flights. The check-in and boarding were well organized and quick. The cabin crews on both flights were very kind and helpful. On DUS-SIN they frequently served drinks, snacks and apples were available as well. I had the same excellent experience on SGN-SIN and SIN-DUS, so I would definitely fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Prepare to wait an hour or longer to contact customer service. Flight still good though. Traveling, especially international, is so unpredictable during Covid. Anything can happen and you can't help but worry. You or your family could test positive right before a flight, Covid rules of the country you are visiting or live in could change, there could be a new Covid variant making it more dangerous to travel, and so on. We booked a late Jan flight to Singapore in Nov to visit family for the first time in 2 years. Singapore government, although they added more restrictions and hoops to jump through, has a list that you can follow and you are able to email them and get an answer in a few days. Singapore Airlines, however, is almost impossible to contact outside of Singapore. I spent an hour and an half on hold before I was hung up on. I had to contact my sister, who lives in Singapore, to call Singapore Airlines from there. Even though they allow changes at no cost (other than price differences in fare), it is so difficult to get a hold of someone, so what's the point? Once you get on the flight, though, everything is great again. Service is what I remember, and you do feel safer on the VTL flights, where everyone has to be vaccinated. I wish they would enforce mask wearing more though, as I saw some people take off their masks for long periods of time, and they were not eating.
label: neutral

text: Frequently Number One Pretty obviously why. Booked online and you don't need to pay to pick your seat. A generous 30kgs baggage allowance. Many extras you don't get with other airlines. Food is very good, I can't see the justification to moan about food when you're eating so high up! Professional service.
label: positive

text: Awsome service My wife and I are simply amazed with the quality of customer service displayed by the airlines. From the ground crew to the airplane, the service de luxe displayed by the flight attendants, the airline atmosphere inside the plane was simply better than the rest of the airlines I have been flying with. I highly recommend frequent travelers to try Singapore Airlines...it’s simply awsome. I’m scheduling my flight with them in the future! Nobel2209
label: positive

text: Best flight experience Flew to Singapore & Back to New Delhi from Bangkok...most pleasant staff...guess the most comfortable economy seats...the food was very good(Indian)...in flight entertainment is excellent..be sure to take Kris flier membership to explore it to fullest...i booked 3 months in advance & almost saved 50%...truely a 5 star airline
label: positive

text: LHR-SIN. Check-in agent was extremely helpful - even though I was travelling on a reward ticket issued by TACA and booked through Avianca (a tortuous provenance one would expect to preclude changes) I asked at check-in if I could take the later 2230 flight instead of the 2100 I was booked on so I could get more work done in the lounge before the flight (and also as I prefer A380 to 777-300ER). Not only did he manage to do this but having done so he realised my bag had already been tagged and sent down the chute so printed a new tag gave me my travel documents then raced off to intercept my bag and re-tag it somewhere in the bowels of T3. Amazing effort (and obviously successful as my bag indeed made it on the right flight). SAS lounge pretty good nice view of the airfield action. Onboard SQ were using the hi-J config A380 with business class taking up the entire upper deck. My window seat was the last row and on it’s own between the rear exit just ahead and the galley just behind. Service was very nice as usual from SQ and again dispelled the myth that they are smiling robots as I had several nice conversations with different members of the crew. Food was a bit of a letdown (seafood and rice dish very bland) but the bed is so good it’s almost too comfortable - I slept so well that I had awful jetlag for a week arriving at 6pm incredibly refreshed left me hideously out of synch with the local time zone. I will manage my sleep patterns better and ask for some spicy sauce on the side of my main next time but SQ remain one of the best in the air.
label: positive

text: SQ 442 - Get a Better Plane for the Singapore-Kathmandu Route! The Boeing 737-800 had a business class cabin for 12. The seats must have been taken from a provincial bus somewhere in the 1970s and bolted onto the floor of this aircraft. They had no redeeming feature. The recline was almost unnoticeable, The footrest had to be brought up 6 inches from the floor by manually pulling on a lever that seemed obstinate. We had bulkhead seats - there was zero stowage; the pillow and the blanket were in our laps (unless we put them behind our backs and made our ride more uncomfortable than it already was). The entertainment system comprised an iPad with headphones. The food choice was limited, and the wines even more limited. One red (a cheap Chianti) and one white was all that was available. This was a 5-hour flight that was uncomfortable from beginning to end - to put it mildly. Couldn't wait to land in Kathmandu. And this was after paying more than $3,000 each for a Manila-Kathmandu-Manila ticket (via Singapore), Shocking! We chose NOT to fly on this aircraft on the return journey; didn't make much sense in sitting bolt upright for 5 hours at night when a business class seat should be offering you some semblance of lie-flat. Never again! This was a complete rip off.
label: negative

text: A Flight Above The Rest This is a great airline. We flew roundtrip from Manchester to Houston and the flights both ways were exceptional. The crew are super helpful, the food good (as airline grub goes) and the Tiger beer welcoming. Our seats (we only fly steerage) were comfortable and the TV screen in front of you is the biggest I've seen, with much easier access to the many channels available than other transatlantic airlines I've been on. This is our second time with Singapore Airlines and I'm sure it won't be the last.
label: positive

text: Very efficient operation Singapore Airlines was extremely efficient at getting over 200 people & all of their luggage to transfer from one airplane coming into Singapore to another going to Bali in less than 30 minutes!
label: positive

text: Singapore to Sydney. I think Singapore Airlines is overall a very good airline but I think their premium economy compared to Qantas is ordinary. No curtain separating cabins, no welcome drink, meals out of aluminium containers. The only difference to economy is better seats. Not worth the extra money and not special.
label: neutral

text: Wonderful hospitality There’s a reason this airline ranks high on many lists! I’ve flown quite a few airlines (currently traveling the world for 6 months) and this airline by far has been the best! The staff were so attentive and efficient! We were served water and warm towels before take off. Being a red eye flight, I very much appreciated the quick dinner service and minimal announcements! The movie selections were excellent and I was really impressed that they handed out socks and toothbrush kits. The seats were some of the most comfortable I’ve experienced and the blankets and pillows were plush too! I will always pick Singapore Airlines if it’s an option in the future and would highly recommend them!
label: positive

text: Whenever you get the chance, fly Singapore Airlines! A long flight made shorter by very comfortable seats, excellent food, outstanding service and very good entertainment options. We have flown on all of the Middle-East airlines and most of the Asian ones and nothing can match Singapore. The European and American airlines aren't even comparable. The planes are modern, the Business Class seat arrangement is 1-2-1 and compare that to an Emirates or Turkish 777 (both of which we have flown recently) which use a 2-3-2 configuration. The extra room makes for a much more comfortable 17 hour flight. This is how to run an airline!
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Flying in Singapore Airlines is unique The secret of the services is a matter of the training one gets. The maintenance of high quality is the end result
label: positive

text: SQ 15 - Sep 29. SQ402 - Oct 1. SQ5357 Oct 24. SQ16 - Oct 25 2014. I have been flying SQ from San Francisco to India since 1990 when they had their 747-400 Megatop almost once or twice a year. Other airlines have cut down on service rudeness of the cabin crew has increased and fares have skyrocketed. In SQ the service and amenities always amaze me a very polite and professional crew and new equipment. The only complaint I have is how they serve the meals in the Economy class. Special Meals like Asian Vegetarian almost begins an hour before the regular meals and passengers on Long Haul Flights need to be sitting with an upright seat for more than 90 minutes with an empty tray in front of them. Aperitifs for Specials Meals are served well after 30 minutes after their meal when the food/drinks cart makes it way. Similarly the dessert (which is usually ice cream) comes an hour after meals.
label: positive

text: Another great flight~ It was as usual another great flight offered by Singapore Airlines and really no doubt about it. (Actually we only fly this airline) For this time round, it was punctual (on the dot) and yet arrived Taoyuan airport slightly earlier than expected. What made this flight amazing was that, besides taking off and landing where seatbelt sign was on, there was no other moment when this sign was turned on. The flight was very smooth and stable. Contents of the inflight entertainment system (Krisworld) was good though could be better and to offer more options (as like the long haul flights). Meals was nice and ice cream was served too. Cabin crew were extremely attentive, polite and helpful (we were traveling with 2 senior citizens) and they, from time to time, would walk over and asked them if they required anything. They were also very patient in explaining the meals and helping them to clear the tray after they finished their meal. We were as usual impressed with the airline, about its punctuality, smoothness of the flight and inflight service by staff and especially this time round, a great THUMB UP! Will continue to fly this airline in our coming 2 trips. SIA, you are a great way to fly!
label: positive

text: Excellent Service We flew Singapore Airlines for the first time in 10 years and note it's excellence compared to other airlines. First the staff are very attentive and friendly. They aim to please. Seat comfort in economy was good we had elbow room. There was a good choice of in flight entertainment, tho not as much choice as Emirates. The toilets were clean. The food and service was excellent and drinks were included.
label: positive

text: The way to go I travelled on singapore airline full service business class to singapore, then silk air to cambodia.service on both airlines was excellent. Even though Silk air is a level down from the main airplane, the service and staff were excellent.The food on both airlines was excellent, even though i am normally a very fussy eater.Bathrooms were kept very clean.
label: positive

text: Will ruin your trip Went to Maldives with a transit flight via Singapore. First of all, they put us on scoot airways for the first flight, which appeared to be a budget version of Singapore airlines. The plane was old, had no in flight entertainment and was definitely not singapore airlines. Then after being put on a singapore airlines flight for the 2nd part of the journey, to our horror our baggage never made it to the Maldives. We put in a baggage tracking support ticket, went to our resort and waited for 2 days. We had to stay at our resort with nothing but the clothes on our back for two days. Eventually we learned that our luggage had been put on to a flight to Sri Lanka. How the f*** do airline staff do something so stupid? Then instead of sending it direct to Maldives from Sri Lanka, they put it back on a flight to singapore. We received no apology, no compensation and the customer support is impossible to contact. This airline is not worth any chance no matter how good a deal the flight tickets are. Apparently the resort staff also said that it is not uncommon for singapore airlines to lose your luggage too. So yeah definitely avoid.
label: negative

text: Love flying Singapore Airlines This flight was served by SQ's new regional 787-10, as a result in 2018 I have now flown on all the 787 variants. The flight itself was great we left on time and food on board was great. Surprisingly I enjoyed the food on this flight more than on my flight from Munich in business class. The aircraft is comfortable adequate leg room for a six footer
label: positive

text: Do not fly Singapore Airlines Definitely not the best airline and I wouldn't consider it to be anywhere in the top class. Absolutely the worst experience one could imagine. Toilets were disgusting and dirty. Staff were unpleasant and not very friendly. Seating is basically on top of each other so you can't eat. I would highly recommend you utilize another airline for the amount of money you pay.
label: negative

text: New 787-10 This was an amazing flight in a 2 month old 787-10 . The seating was comfortable and there was sufficient leg room and plenty of entertainment options. The crew were helpful providing great food and drink options and support where required.would definitely choose this flight option for future flights.
label: positive

text: The flight Check in was very quick. I had an aisle seat in the middle row which was very comfortable and easy when I wanted to get up. The attendants were very pleasant and helpful. The food was delicious and plentiful. It was quick to get through customs and didn't have to wait long for baggage.
label: positive

text: Italy 2019 Fast efficient friendly service. Very pleasant staff. Flights were on time and smooth. Washrooms were serviced
label: positive

text: my comments were heard? This is the return leg of my trip to bangkok. The first leg, there was a feedback request via email sent to me by SQ. I mentioned about the bread rolls to be warmed up instead on wrapping them in cold plastic bags that bloated up once we are up there in the sky. And also commented that the air stewardess asked me, "what would you like?" when i saw no menu in the poach in front of me and there was no form of any communication as to what food were available. Immediately on my return flight, i was served warm bread from the basket instead of the plastic bags. And of course, was handed a menu before i was served lunch. If these two matters were not coincidental, i would say that i am truly impressed with how serious SQ took their customers' feedbacks. As for the rest of the items on offer like in-flight entertainment and leg room, still the best that i had. Always if possible, booked my flights with SQ if the options were available. Thanks for the great flight!
label: positive

text: A comfortable journey. From the time I walked onto the plane, the seat was comfortable. Service was adequate, with good quality food. Friendly staff.
label: positive

text: Disappointing Disappointed with the service. Was a late evening flight so they wanted everyone to go to sleep. Even though some were watching videos or reading there was little/No cabin service. Breakfast service started a couple of hours out. Breakfast menu limited to one Asian and one European selection. Omelette was dry, chicken sausage tasteless. Pastry selection limited to a selection of rolls only. Apart from the extra legroom business class was not worth the extra money on this flight..
label: neutral

text: Fantastic airlines very enjoyable flight We flew Singapore airlines in March 2019 there were four of us. The flight was great the staff were so nice. Seats comfortable, food was nice and just the right amount. We enjoyed the movies made the flight go quick and there was a good choice of movies
label: positive

text: Back on track For the first time chosen for premium. Good choice, much better then the normal economy. Better selection of food which can be chosen when you check in. Also a bottle of water is provided. Service was much better then the last couple of years. Husband is diabetic and is on Insuline. Boarding was right on time but once in the plane it took a very long time before take off, didn’t get food or drinks in te meantime. Thats where it went wrong. Although we did have a very good lunch my husband got problems with his diabetes. We managed to get some coca cola to get his sugar level very quickly right again. During the rest of the flight they kept asking if he was OK or needed more foor or drinks. After he had the coca cola he was fine again. Although we always carry grape-sugar tablets, coca cola is the fastest thing to give to a diabetic in trouble. Staff was very thoughtfull after that incident.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Jakarta with Singapore Airlines. Disappointing aircraft. The crews are fine. But not necessarily showing great service. Further the mobile apps of the airline was down and most of the time I couldn’t check in online. Bad experience overall. Expensively priced which makes it a very overpriced disappointing experience.
label: negative

text: Outstanding Fabulous flight. Check in and boarding was fast and efficient. We left on time. My seat in Business class was huge and very comfortable. They supplied toiletries, a blanket and pillow. The service was second to none. We pre-ordered our lunch, filet mignon for me and lobster thermador for my wife and both were delicious. This is likely the best flight I have ever been on
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines makes it again.. Our 6th flights with Singapore Airlines in business class, and standard and service is really good as usual. Comfortable aircrafts, wonderful staff with high service level, nice meals and drinks. Singapore Airlines is high end!
label: positive

text: Lovely Flight Flew from Colombo Sri Lanka to Melbourne with a stopover in Singapore. It was a smooth journey from check in to the end. Helpful staff and good meals. On time and efficient.
label: positive

text: Singapore airline review Just brilliant. I went to Bali with my family (all over the age of 12). Service was courteous, friendly - making us feel they went that extra mile for us. We had Hindu vegetarian food which was excellent. I;m tall, so legroom for the journey was ideal for me. The flight was also on time. If I had the choice, I would chose Singapore Airlines where ever I can, having experienced some other airlines.
label: positive

text: Positive flight experience with Singapore Airlines We had a most comfortable and enjoyable trip. The flight attendants were all friendly, efficient and helpful. We would not hesitate to fly Singapore Airlines with our next overseas adventure.
label: positive

text: Great airline Singapore Airlines takes service to the next level compared to most airlines and the food and presentation is better than a lot of restaurants I have eaten in. Window seat is not to all tastes as you have to sleep at an angle, centre aisle seats are better for night flights.
label: positive

text: Bangkok to Singapore. My IFE unit screen was not working as the screen went fuzzy and shaky when turned on. The FA tried to restart my system but it did not fix it. As no other seat was available, I was struck with no movie entertainment except for the music for the whole flight. Crew on this flight of the Singapore Airlines standard. They did the usual greeting when boarding, pre-flight drink and hot towel. Hot Towel is something not many airlines offer. Bangkok is not one of the country where you can book the cook, but the foods were not too bad with a Thai dessert on the tray. The cabin is clean even though this is relatively old plane. That might explain why the guy 2 rows in front of me also has the same problem with the IFE unit. Overall, it is an average experience.
label: negative

text: Efficient, polite and high quality Travelling from London to Singapore it turned out considerably cheaper to go LHR-FRA then FRA-SIN using Lufthansa then Singapore Airlines booked as a single purchase Singapore Airlines lived up to their strong reputation and the A380 is simply the best long distance airliner. The Airline scored through the slightly bigger seating than its rivals and the efficiency of the staff. Talking to some of them they put it down to a family mentality in which teams often work together route after route. The food was ok without being spectacular but we all loved the free snack bar of fruit, crisps and chocolate that was available throughout the flight as a supplement The plane was 10 years old and on the outbound flight the handheld technology was showing its age but usable. Personally I found the film selection very good but the 20 year-olds said Qatar and Emirates was a better choice With so much competition on the route I would still be led by the price but when all is similar Singapore Airlines would be our first choice. A further benefit to us was that we were flying on to Borneo so the tie-in between Singapore Airlines and its sister airline Silk Air made the transfers easy. I understand that by next year Silk Air will be subsumed into Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: Missing luggage My trip with Singapore Airlines-SQ (business class) from Jakarta transit 1 hour in Singapore to Pudong, when check in i already make sure that luggage will directly transfer to Pudong. Arrived Pudong, i couldn’t found my luggage, then i came to Information desk and staff said that my luggage was left in Singapore, and they would bring it with the last SQ flight tonight, but because i was staying at hotel around 3,5 hour from Shanghai, my luggage would be received within 2 days..... can not believe that! very disappointing. How come such a big airlines had bad service ?!. I really helped by the hotel staff and driver where i stay with their quick response and coordination they could deliver my luggage from Pudong Airport to my room hotel early morning. I hope case like this become lessons learned for SQ to improve their service in future.
label: negative

text: Amsterdam to Melbourne via Singapore with Singapore Airlines. I had a wonderful flight on SQ323 to Singapore. The new A350-900 is an excellent plane. I had seat 52C, the leg room was more than sufficient. The cabin crew very good, looking after our wellbeing throughout the whole flight, even on a long 12-hour flight as this one. The food was delicious, I had diet-meals on all flights and they took great care of me. One minor thing: the toilets on the A350 look very small. From Singapore to Melbourne I sat at 37G. This was an older version of the B777-300ER, with an older inflight entertainment system and more important not enough legroom. My knees were stuck against the seat in front of me. Cabin crew good, food was excellent and the 6 hour flight was over in a blink. On the return flight in from Melbourne to Singapore I changed seats the day before and sat at a window seat. This B777-300ER looked more modern and the legspace was much more than on the way into Melbourne. Again a very pleasant flight with a pleasant cabin crew. Only the last hour we had a bumpy flight with thunderstorms above Indonesia and Singapore, but the crew and pilots did a good job. The flight to Amsterdam left much later because of bad weather at Singapore, for almost half the flight we had a very bumpy and tiring flight but staff stayed polite and kept their friendly faces. My overall experience with SIA was very good. Next time this company will take me to Australia again.
label: positive

text: Ok but no ‘Wow’ experience We flew by SIA because it enabled us to fly to Tokyo and depart from Osaka. And it was a direct flight which we preferred. The experience was average where staff were courteous and polite. Food wise was average too. We did not experience any ‘wow’ moments e.g., additional ice creams being served as we heard from other people’s experience. My entertainment system didn’t work on the flight back even after the air stewardess helped to reset the system. It was a boring flight back for me. The Singapore local special meal (fried bee noon) was a disgrace as It didn’t taste nice at all. Nonetheless, the flight was smooth and landing was great. We probably had higher expectations from this airline because it was SIA and the fare was not cheap. We were also surprised to have to pay extra for seat selection prior to check in (similar to budget airline)
label: neutral

text: Never using I used Singapore airlines cuz friends & Co workers said it is very good service. I had problem from the start. First flying scheduled change then the seat cannot be assigned ahead of time unless you pay extra.
label: negative

text: Thought this was the No.1 airline Unfortunately our flight was cancelled just before we were boarding. We stood around for 3 hrs before we were put on a bus down to Heathrow from Manchester. We did receive compensation but we were offered two gestures of good will. Neither of which we could use. Two meal vouchers as we had missed the evening meal but we were given them as we were boarding. Also in flight gift vouchers were offered. We received these 2 weeks after we got home !!! We were told we could order things from their shop and it would be delivered to our home. But we have to pay duty & postage and can only select from a very limited selection. Great PR !!!!!
label: negative

text: Munich to Singapore. First time flying with a baby so we were a bit apprehensive. The flight crew were fantastic making sure we were looked after, from coming over to invite us to board and making sure we have everything we need. The food service was prompt, staff came around with drinks, just before the lights are dimmed they give out water bottles. Flight left 5 min late but arrived 10 min early bags were only the belt when we got out of immigration. I was also told that from Aug 2017 the Boeing 777-300ER will be completely replaced by the A350. Only downside the hand controller stopped working to had to reach the bulkhead to change channels. As a full reset would cause issues for the row behind me and take 10 min I wasn't bothered, the staff said they would do it as soon as the others fell asleep. To their credit 6 hours later once the other dosed off the reset was done. Great flight, they will always be on the top of my list of carriers to fly.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airline Refund I had to cancel my ticket as I had to go for an emergency to Colombo well before the date I was planning to go. I have cancelled my ticket in 20th Dec 2021 and today is 31st Jan 2022. I still haven't received my refund. When I called them they said that it will take 4 months to refund my money. Is this fair according to the Australian consumer law? Or Is Singapore airline taking the advantage of travellers like us.
label: negative

text: My 16 year old son was stranded at LAX I always used to think that Singapore Airlines was a good airline until today. Even after submitting proof that one of their agents clearly stated that they would accept a PCR test 72 hours prior to Mt son's flight time, when my son checked in at LAX, the staff refused to let him board. They gave him a map and told him he had to get a new PCR test which meant he had to jump on a shuttle alone and find the testing station. He was charged $199 for a PCR test with a 45 minute guarantee. This is an insane amount of money! He then rushed back to LAX only to be told he was too late to catch the flight. They refused to issue him a boarding pass even though there was still 35 minutes to spare and he had no bags to check in. They did offer to rebook him on snap alternative flight which meant he would have to spend 14+ hours in the airport. Then he was told that he had to get a guardian to sign a permission form because he was under 18 and traveling alone. There was no humanity in the way staff dealt with this situation. Sll they cared about was following insane rules which ultimately made no sense since my son was only going to transit through Singapore en route to Jakarta. The fact that he submitted a voice memo of a staff member clearly stating he could definitely transit through Singapore with a PCR test taken 72 hours pretty flight made absolutely no difference to Singapore Airlines' staff. We believed that this woman had told us the truth, but ultimately my son paid the price as did I. The incredible stress and anxiety caused by Singapore Airlines policies and unwillingness to acknowledge this staff's recording as clear proof, has not only cost me financially, but emotionally and mentally. My son had to go through an ordeal which was incredibly stressful and challenging on all levels. Afterwards, I contacted Singapore Airlines asking for compensation. Several staff promised to get back to me but they never did. 3 phone calls later, I was told by Lloyd, a supervisor based in the Philippines, that Singapore Airlines would not compensate me. There was no accountability from SIA for their egregious mistake. It's for these reasons and more, that my family nor I will never fly on Singapore airlines again.
label: negative

text: Comfortable journey It was my first time with Singapore airlines and the flight was amazing! Although we had booked economy class tickets, the seat was extremely comfortable. the cabin crew had a superb standard of service. We were given snacks, dinner and refreshments. Also, a pair of pressure balancing socks and a set of toothbrush and tooth paste. The collection of movies, tv shows and games was good.
label: positive

text: Comfortable flying We hadn't flown with Singapore Airlines for several years due to a run of bad experiences with them. It didn't start off well this time either when our chosen seats pre-flight disappeared due to the introduction of a brand new plane. We received an advisory email but the new seats were not extra leg room and also down the back of the plane. To choose new seats cost us an extra $200+. Not good!
