However, on the day of departure the check-in was smooth and the counter staff member very polite, efficient and obliging. Boarding was smooth and hassle-free and the cabin staff bright, helpful, full of smiles and efficient. This set the tone for the entire flight. The seats were comfortable (something lacking when we last flew with them). The entertainment options were great, food and drink delivery super efficient and the meals tasty, plentiful and hot. Singapore actually measured up very well against Emirates and we will put them to the test again when next we fly overseas. Well done Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text: Nightmare experience with a flight journey operated by Singapore Airlines/ Silk Air A flight journey of 22 hrs 35 minutes involving a single stop, became a 46 hrs 22 minutes involving 3 stops eventually. Our original flight was from Hyderabad to Seattle via Singapore. * Hyderabad -> Singapore: Silk Air * 3:15 layover in Singapore * Singapore -> Seattle: Singapore Airlines Total journey time: 22 hours 35 minutes The initial flight from Hyderabad -> Singapore operated by Silk Air was delayed by more than 3 hours and 25 minutes, and hence our entire flight needed to be rebooked. No one gave us a specific reason why the flight got delayed, except the statement: "the incoming flight got delayed". So the new itinerary that was booked for us was: * Hyderabad -> Singapore: Silk Air * 8 hrs lay over in Singapore * Singapore -> Hongkong: Singapore Airlines * 1 hr stop in Hongkong, where we had to deplane and go through security checkin again. Hongkong -> San Francisco: Singapore Airlines * 2 hrs stop in San Francisco where we had to finis our immigration, customs, and then go through the security again. San Francisco -> Seattle: United * Here, due to the incompetency of Silk Air/Singapore Airlines staff, United refused to board us (18 passengers) as the tickets were not be "endorsed" correctly, even though our baggage got into transported in to the plane, and they had enough seats for all of us. Finally, some of us got rebooked to a 05:30 flight and some of us to a 06:35 flight in the morning, where most of us spent the night in the Airport.
label: negative

text: Good, comfortable flight I hate self check in !!!! Luckily there was somebody at Perth to help. The whole flight experience was good , boarding the plane was orderly , nice new plane, plenty of leg room , the food was ok. the service from the flight staff is very good. They really need to rotate the inflight entertainment more often , you get the same on the return flight home.
label: positive

text: Flying on SQ business from DXB-CAN via SIN has been one of the best flights I've taken. The seat turned down into a full flat bed, great food and amazing service. I actually wanted the flight to go on for a few more hours it was that nice!
label: positive

text: Great Long Haul Experience Singapore Airlines is by far my favorite airline to travel with. From handing out extra blankets when I said I was cold, to comforting every nervous passenger, the cabin crew assist everyone they can. The food on this airline is far superior to any other flight I have been on. I would definitely recommend Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: NRT-LAX A380 upon boarding cabin crew guided me to the wrong side of cabin and wrong seat. No menu was provided for the entire flight and I did not know which champagne or wine I was drinking nor did I know what to expect for dinner or breakfast. Only for the main course (entree) did the cabin crew provide a quick booklet which after choosing was quickly taken away again. After asking cabin crew for a little help to figure out how to convert my seat into bed I was asked if it was my first time with Singapore Airlines (I am Krisflyer Gold). Cabin crew never asked if I wanted to be awaken for breakfast (which I did not). After waking me up and providing me with a cup of coffee I waited 50 minutes for breakfast to be served. Again no menu. A rather disappointing service.
label: negative

text: View their non response to request for Perrier Water - misses the point about service Very disappointing but not unexpected response from red-taped, unresponsive customer service. Platitudes that don't get you anywhere. You pay Business Class fare and they cannot provide Water of your choice !. Perrier should celebrate - the most expensive drink in the world beating all champagne. SIA's response as follows (names taken off to protect the officer) : We are writing in reference to our telephone conversation regarding Passenger XXX request for Perrier Sparkling Mineral Water.. As we have spoken, we regret to inform that we are unable to serve 5 bottles of this item on board her upcoming flights. (13 - 14 hours to London and back). We seek your kind understanding that we are not able to cater to passengers’ personal preferences. PASSENGERS - PLEASE NOTE THIS - from the world's purportedly best serviced airline! Should you require further assistance, please do not hesitate to highlight to us.
label: neutral

text: Quality all the way Although were were in economy, we were made to feel first class passengers by the cabin crew. We had heard about the quality service beforehand having not flown with Singapore Airlines before and we were not disappointed. We are seasoned travellers, but I can honestly say the cabin crew and the Singapore airlines brand was the best ever.
label: positive

text: Very very bad Service Very bad service by Singapore Airlines they have cancelled my scheduled flight and give me flight next day. When I have contacted to Singapore Airlines they said we can't help you contact to Virgin Australia when I contact to Virgin Australia they said contact to Singapore Airlines. I have called around 7 times to Singapore Airlines and 4 times to Virgin Australia but no budy help me. They have changed the date and timings also of my flight. I have very urgent work so I have asked to give me the flight accordingly so I can reach on time, they have flights and seats but they asking for extra money I said it's not my mistake but they said you have to pay. I have asked ok give me the flight from Perth to Singapore at 1:10 AM apart from 6:40AM they didn't give me this also, lastly I have asked ok book my seat numbers because I m travelling with kids, they said contact to Virgin Australia I said I already contacted them they said contact to Singapore Airlines. The lady of customer service said I will talk to Virgin Australia then I will call you back but she didn't call me back, everything bad. Very poor service I always book Singapore Airlines for travel but now I will not use it in future and I recommend others also not to use it.
label: negative

text: Did Not Even Try to Help My Pregnant Wife Took a midnight flight from Singapore to Sydney with my pregnant wife. During the flight, the man in front of us was very aggressive for some reason and kept on reclining his chair and rocking it to annoy my wife who was sitting behind him. As my wife preferred an aisle seat, we asked if they flight attendants could speak to the man or switch my wife's seat with someone. They attendants said that because the man was so aggressive, there was nothing they could do. So I gave my wife the middle seat instead and which made her feel claustrophobic. I asked the attendants again if they could switch her seat but because it was a fully booked flight, there was nothing that they could do. I am quite disappointed with Singapore Air because we had heard such great reviews about their service. I also contacted Singapore Air directly via phone, email and web form - all of which have been ignored.
label: negative

text: Excellent flight Our two flights from Sydney to Singapore and from there to Colombo were excellent - leaving right on time, reasonable food for airlines, good legroom, excellent on board entertainment and very polite and attentive staff.
label: positive

text: They cancelled the flight now I have to pay the travel agent £50 for rebooking with Singapore Airlines great!!! NOT They cancelled the flight now I have to pay the travel agent £50 great!!! NOT They dont care about their customers, if they cancel the flight, we just shoulder the additional admin fee for it to be transferred. No offer for pay per lounge . My original booking was only 2 hour wait from Chianggi now it will be 8 hours. I have to bite the bullet and pay the travel agent otherwise I will lose the seat. I WONT TRAVEL WITH THEM IN THE FUTURE THAT IS FOR SURE
label: negative

text: Best flight I’ve been on The staff on the flight are so attentive, decent amount of leg room and great choice of movies. Even though we were on a 9hr flight it flew in. You will also never go hungry as they just constantly bring out food and snacks! I will definitely be flighting with them for my next flight....
label: positive

text: Singapore Airline Mumbai and SG trip is Excellent Overall the service provided by the Crew was great. Air Steward and Air Stewardess took pride in their work and show care and concern to the passengers onboard. One of the Air Stewardess has assisted an uncle with his cabin luggage. There is one passenger who keep asking for more stuffs (Drinks etc), the staffs are very patience and provided all requests. Even though I was kind of irritated seating on the aisle but disturb by fellow passenger.
label: positive

text: Still one of the better airlines Still one of the better airlines although it use to be better. Nowadays, not much to drink. Very happy to have a bottle of water on meso I don’t hydrate. Nearly every flight we make with SA (2x a year) the choice of food is poorly. When half the plain is served there is no choice anymore. Then you have to eat rice or mie, even if you don’t want to. Last time we were realy mad and told the staff to get some food from business class. They did. We are only talking about the eggs. It appeared to be exactly the same as economyclass. So didn’t have to be a problem. It happens very often lately. Every trip the same problem. Is very annoying, problem is probably unsolvable.
label: positive

text: The Singapore Airlines A350-900 is not a comfortable aircraft The legroom is small and the seat seems to be narrower than the other aircrafts operating by Singapore Airlines. The seat configuration or layout is rather peculiar. Seat No: 41C and 41H (seats with better legroom) are practically blocking 1/3 or 1/2 of the passage when coming from Premiun Economy class to Economy class. Sitting on these seats, you have to be careful to avoid any passenger or food cart from knocking into your leg.
label: neutral

text: Singapore airlines My partner and i decided to travel to Australia on Singapore airlines,the checking in at London Heathrow was very easy,the plane was quite comfortable considering a 22 hour trip,the cabin crew were very friendly and acomadating,drinks when you wanted it and two meals to Singapore and plenty of films,tv programmes and music on our individual screens, we had a night in a Singapore airport before continuing our journey to Sydney ,our return journey eighteen days later was good but with only two hours stop in Singapore airport before returning to London ,with the same quality service from Singapore airlines
label: positive

text: Good Flight, great staff We recently flew to London Heathrow from Singapore airport. It was a long flight but the staff made it a slick service from start to finish. Economy is ok, not terrible but obviously not the best. The cabin crew frequently offered drinks both alcoholic and non-alcoholic. The food options were of good quality ,tasty and plentiful. The earbuds were cheap quality and not particularly comfortable, however, the choices of entertainment were very varied. Really enjoyed the films etc on offer. The cushion and blanket were very comfortable. Would recommend airline in future.
label: positive

text: Superb Flight Boarding at PER was very easy, and the flight attendants were super helpful and friendly. The aircraft we flew was an A330-300 and the seats had a lot of legroom for economy class. The hot towels they handed out just before boarding were great; very refreshing. Food was ok, but considering that it is plane food, it was pretty good. Great entertainment selection and seats were very comfortable. The flight was very smooth, along with takeoff and landing. Would definitely fly SIA again.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines from Brisbane to Kuala Lumpur via Singapore. Comfortable seat with ample legroom for economy. The A330 2x4x2 configuration so much better than 3x4x3. Service very good, drinks on take off, brunch, mid-day drinks service, an flight lunch before landing, with regular water / fruit juice runs in-between. Excellent meals for economy class. Overall a 5 star service
label: positive

text: Impossible to talk to a human, website booking can’t be complicated but still the best in the Pacific I have been flying Singapore Airlines for 42 years. There is no question that it is not the airline it once was. However, on this route it is still far far better than any other option. Service is far better as is the food, etc than United. My last business flight with United was shocking. Service was non existant and food on the long flight was just sad. As one passenger said who had slept through a meal - “Do you just have kids food for snacks?”. Cathay Pacific was a form of torture with tight seats and flight boarding that is total mayhem. SIA is trying and still the best. I would warn you that having traveled with them after two surgeries in the past the wheel chair service in Changi is abysmal and the United Polaris clubs are nicer. SIA is also particularly hard to get a status match - even for United 1K or Million Milers. They also have a website that rejects a lot of itineraries meaning you have to book separately. Where they REALLY are TERRIBL is communication as it is nearly impossible to get a human. The chat feature proved useless for me recently, even after he forwarded an itinerary that an agent said was impossible. Very frustrating! At least United has good Milage Plus service and no PIN is needed to contact them. However, I JUST booked a flight with SIA and know I will have several more in the next year. They are the best over the Pacific if you don’t mind the nightmare of their website and customer service.
label: positive

text: My rest begins with the flight. Very well groomed and good manner stewardess. All drinks are free. Food are much better than other airline.
label: positive

text: Very nice flight Its a very nice flight... we had to transit at Singapore... the staff is friendly... the flight meal is good.. the seat is spacious.. the entertaiment flight is up to date.. overall a very good flight..
label: positive

text: Great airline Singapore airline has always been a great airline the service is very good and the food as good as it can be for airline food .a great choice of movies and games my only complaint it’s a bit squishy in the seats.i also like the times of Singapore airline it’s sensible schedules .
label: positive

text: Superb inflight service No doubt , I trust my journey using SQ for the air transpotation. Their services from check in staff till inflight crew are superb. Inflight entertainment very good. Food ok. The surprise is a bday cake for my friend on route Sin-Bkk 28 Feb 2019. Thank you SQ. You always be mu favourite airlines.
label: positive

text: Slight let down I’ve travelled with Singapore airlines previously and it was great, with flight and service. Unfortunately this time their standard has dropped, not in service but quality of meals. You would think I’d be served with Singapore cuisine but instead served with Turkish food. Wasn’t good food. I was also slightly concerned with the landing as it was slightly rougher than normal considering weather conditions were ideal. I’m hoping it was a one off situation but overall it’s a good airline.
label: positive

text: What a great flight Even though we were in economy class we felt like we were treated as very important. The delightful flight attendants greeted us with smiles and offers to help, and made sure we go to our seats (way in the back). The entertainment on the tv screen on the back of the seat in front of us was very extensive and had many choices of things we enjoyed seeing. The dinner and breakfast we were served were outstanding. Even my wife, who is very picky about food, raved about how good the meals were. The choice of beverages (especially the wines) were excellent and we felt like we were in a high class restaurant. (again, we were in the lowest class section). The hot towels before and after meals were appreciated. The flight itself was very smooth, on time, and the captains remarks appreciated. Wouldn't it be wonderful if IS airlines were like this??
label: positive

text: Service, second to none I have flown Singapore Airlines a couple of times now and I always find their service exceptional. The staff are always helpful, kind and caring and nothing is too much trouble. Meals are always terrific and being a vegetarian can sometimes cause a few problems flying but with Singapore, I have never had an issue. Wonderful experience.
label: positive

text: Very terrible check in personal and costumer service!!!! Singapore airlines refused my boarding today. I was at Singapur airline check in desk around 40 minutes today and my check in was still not complete. I asked the check in lady two times ... do we need to hurry up because the flight is soon leaving, right? I did not got any answer from her and trusted she will know. The fact is that 4 ladis where standing behind the desk working on one check in and could not provid proper service so I could board my plain is unbelievable?!?!?! 35 minutes before my plane was leaving they said the boarding is closed. What??? 35 minutes is not enough time to go from the check in to the gate??? Through this inconvenience from Singapor Airlines i missed my connection flights from Jakarta to Singapor, from Singapor to LA, from LA to Mexico City from Mexico City to Huatulco!! 4 flights missed!!! After complaining with singapor airlines management today they booked me the same flight 24 h later but only to LA. I am having additional expenses: accomodation in Jakarta, food, I need to pay another plane ticket from LA onward and I am missing out all my meetings in the following day. A few hours after this inconvenience I found out from my travel agency that my flight was canceled by Singapor Airlines although the plane was actually leaving from Jakarta - just without me. Very weird, right?! I am traveling all my life but such bad check in service, costumer service I never experienced before. First and last time booked with this Airline. Definitely not recommended to use Singapor Airline Service!!!
label: negative

text: Excellent Friendly service Welcomed on board with a smile. At my seat I was offered assistance with putting my carry on bags in the overhead locker and offered a beverage. The seats are spacious and comfortable...the choice of viewing on the consoles are varied, offering new releases and classic movies and TV. Like wise with music... The crew were attentive through out the flight, regularly offering water and other beverages. Food options were very good, fresh and delicious meals, served with good quality range of wines. I would definitely fly with Singapore Airlines again...
label: positive

text: Plane and staff great but food terrible When you first walk on, even though plane is a little older, still looks impressive. Very spacious business class seating, plenty of storage and can lay flat, although slightly odd layout of bed and a little hard. Staff fantastic, very helpful and friendly. But food was awful, at least what we had for breakfast was almost inedible except obvious things like bread and pastries. Not sure I’d use them again unless it was the long haul and got a good price.
label: positive

text: New plane, the longest flight in the world Plane was very spacious on SQ 22, new, clean, comfortable. Staff on board was very attentive and first time they were so good as this is by far, fifth time u fly to NYC by Singapore Airlines to see my Family. Food was delicious, hot, good selections of drinks onboard. Very happy but on my way back the flight attendants weren’t as eager n attentive. I had to ask thrice about a set of Travel size monopoly. Not thrilled w the staff, could hv been better. They took forever to see if there was stock, and only came back many many hours later telling me there isn’t any stock left and told me it’s available online. Whatever. But all the all, the flight fr Singapore to NYC was excellent, wish I can say the same on my way back to Singapore on SQ21. Sigh. Singapore airline staff isn’t consistent, sad to say, which is why I don’t always opt to travel Singapore Airlines. I took this flight bcoz it’s a direct flight to Newark, and it’s much shorter time on board. Not sure if wud fly SIA again next year 🤨
label: neutral

text: Never again Very disappointed with their service. Very rude FA’s to start (on my return) . Bad energy overall. Horrible food, the worst I have ever experienced on any airline. Premium economy is a joke. For double the price it’s absolutely the same as economy. Don’t be fooled. There are way too many choices/companies to fly with. Be warned.
label: negative

text: Worst Customer Service We booked flights to Thailand for 4th February 2022 for our 5th Year wedding anniversary. We checked all the Covid and travel requirements Turned up to Heathrow Airport 3hours before departure time with all the required documents - only to find out on the 1st of February the Thailand Government reintroduced their Thai Pass scheme (which was previously suspended) the Thai pass needs at least 5 days to process and they advise 7 days before you can follow it up. Therefore if we applied for the Thai pass we would not have it in time. We explained our situation at the check in desk and even showed our attendant the UK government website which states the Thai pass is not required. Our Singapore check in attendant went and showed his manager. I also explained to the manager that we have all the required documents other than the Thai pass as it was impossible to attain the Thai pass in the timeframe we had. The manager then just shrugged his shoulder and said tough luck I’m not going to let you board the flight without it. At which point I said “I understand and I really need a help to find a solution because I’m not sure what I can do.” He replied to me saying “it’s not my problem - you have to leave”. The manager was completely rude and showed no empathy towards our situation. We pleaded at the ticket desk for some help but none was available. The staff at Thai Airways showed more empathy and care to answer our questions and explain the process. We literally had to turn back with all of our baggage and get a cab home. I will never book another flight with Singapore Airlines again and will definitely be sharing more segments of my ordeal online. They clearly do not care about their customers and have horrible Customer service
label: negative

text: Very good Airline Very good Airline a value for money you do not to pay extra. The food is ok.I will take this airline again
label: positive

text: A REASONABLE FLIGHT Cattle class is cattle class no matter what airline you fly and a bit disappointed after requesting an aisle seat at time of ticket purchase was allocated a window seat for part of journey Food on the flight Sydney to Singapore was spicy I could not eat but return flight Delhi to Sydney food was reasonable. After all it is airline food which I find quite palatable except for the melted cheeses and over abundant use of spice. I love the air buses as there is room at the end to really stretch out as the seats are so cramped and this reclining thats all well and good except the person behind who then cannot use table or watch the movie Personally I think one should not be allowed to recline Air crew very pleasant check in a pleasurable experience I would fly with Singapore Airlines again
label: positive

text: No longer my favourite Airlines, from bad to worst, it's a shame. First: 5 star for flight attendants, always friendly and helpful. then the rest have dropped dramatically 1: The A350 3x3x3 seats are thin and hard, no room for an average person. 2: Boarding process was very unorganised. 3: Quality of food now is terrible. 4: Disembarking is the worst among all airlines, has to wait at least 10 mins more until all business class passengers to leave then open the curtain. 5: No longer an punctual airlines. 6: SilverKris lounge at Changi airport was chaotic, impossible to find a seat.
label: negative

text: Harrased by the the ground staff at Changi Airport A ground staff member was extremely rude and misbehaved with us yesterday at Changi Airport around 7:30 pm at T3 gate A19. His name was Shiva or Shivam, and he was most likely of South Asian descent. He kept making rude gestures to my parents and me, both senior citizens, and after confronting him, he said he had every right to do so. He kept on changing the queue and continuously harrased us. We were tired and exhausted after 10 hour flight from Christchurch which was delayed. As a passenger I have paid the full price of my economy class ticket. We deserve the same amount of respect and courtesy to be extended to us as given to those in first and business class passengers. This discriminatory classist and racist behaviour has left a bitter taste in my mouth. We deserve an apology. I am very upset and disappointed with the world's leading airline.
label: negative

text: Coimbatore trip it was great flying with Singapore Airlines and Silk Air, We travelled from Brisbane to Coimbatore India and we did not have any issues, enjoyed the return flight and the meals and customer service provided was excellent, will travel again on Singapore Airlines for our next holiday abroad
label: positive

text: Great Airline, Great Service My first long haul flight to Japan. My friends and I spent week in Tokyo. Ten hour flight but with the IFE and meal service, it didn't seem to take that long. The flight attendants were awesome. Very friendly. The food was excellent. Almost too much to eat. Snacks were available the whole flight. Actually took the sister flight back to LAX. An experience I'll never forget. Thank you Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Luxurious flying! Superb comfort and wonderful food ( actually too much food!) My criticism would be that they served meals in accordance with the time zone in Singapore, not where they had taken off from or where they were going! Not helpful to offset jet lag! Everything else was pretty much perfect!
label: positive

text: Comfortable and entertaining Great movie selection, food okay - some meals better than others. Wider seats in economy which is a plus. Would be good to get updated screens :)
label: positive

text: Trip to Australia This is a lovely airline, the stewardesses in their neat uniform cannot do enough for you, and their smiles are so sweet. And the planes are lovely too with enough legroom not to really need spending more to get the ones at the front in Economy class. We flew late 2019 so had a full flight with lovely food and snacks. My wife is semi- disabled and we asked for the full assistance, so when you get to Singapore Airport on stopover on the way out, unless you ask for it, your own wheelchair goes to the next flight with your luggage. This is ok, but, you get taken in one of their wheelchairs to a drop off area inside the vast flat very large terminal which houses all 4 terminals, and dumped. I could have gone to get coffee visit toilet etc, but my wife was stranded for 90 minutes. The nearest shops were 50 yards away, unaccessible to her. The only up side is that when its time to board your next flight you get taken by someone who knows where they're going and when you reach your gate they push through everybody else to get to the front with me following behind going, 'sorry, sorry', to people. the trick is to ask for your wheelchair back at Singapore and it arrives out of the hold in a nice big plastic bag, so you can explore the large terminal and shops to your hearts content, there is even a smoking room 'inside' near the butterfly area-which is very hot!
label: positive

text: Alyssa and crew are amazing I know not all can fly first. But if you are fortunate enough to be able to do that fly Singapore! Alyssa was so attentive. She and her crew took such great care of us. She was filming the northern lights and I woke us and she brought me to see them. That was a bucket list item. Never would I ever have imagined that I would be able to see them while traveling. I cried. She even sent me the photos she took. The captain had alerted her that they were visable. We were the only ones awake. I cannot thank Alyssa enough. I’ve been chasing them all over the globe. Great crew and I can’t recommend them more. Oh and she gave me 4 pages of what to do while we are in Singapore. Thanks you so much for all of your amazing service and genuine care and excitement. So great to fly on an airline that actually cares and love what they do!!! ♥️♥️♥️
label: positive

text: Bring on the new Business Class! The service and food were exceptional as always but the old business class seating is not comfortable. I remember when it was first introduced around 10 years ago but it has never made sense. Crew have to set it up and undo it, it's hard and not long enough for someone of 195cm. I see that SQ are replacing it progressively with the more conventional format. This flight includes a very old plane which is quite worn so it may be one of the last to update alas. But crew service helped to make up. So caring.
label: positive

text: Singapore Flight To Perth with no window on window seat. We were so disappointed with our seating as we booked a window seat. When we boarded our flight our window seat didn't have a window. It was the worse 5 hour flight of my life. I felt very like the whole plane kept closing in on me. I would never have picked a window seat if I had known this. They should have something telling you there is no window on their website letting people know this seat has no window although it is classed as a window seat. Thank goodness we had lovely people in front of us that did not put their seat back. Don't pick seat 57J and 57 k on flight SQ215.
label: negative

text: Superb in All Areas Seamless & uneventful flight which was 18 hrs & non stop. Wonderfully comfortable including the bed. Perfect service, delicious food. The best of the best.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines from Melbourne to Milan via Singapore. When Economy class is completely full, it's too cramped and uncomfortable. With long waits for food, drinks and the toilets, I found the flights to be very long and tiring. Having said that, I'm sure this applies to most carriers. The food however, was very nice and the extra snacks are a nice touch. Service was friendly and professional and there's a good choice of movies. Planes on all four flights seemed a little aged.
label: positive

text: Flew on redemption tickets SQ First Singapore to Seoul and Business back from Seoul. I was very disappointed with the first class. The last time I did First was to New York about 4+ years ago on the ageing 747 that was far better an experience. Pre-flight details were excellent using the Private Dining in T3 Changi. However the food on board was terrible. My wife ordered the Japanese Kaiseki and it was not good. My Wagyu Sirloin was leather tough.However Dom Perignon 2004 did help to wash it down. Fortunately the flight back form Seoul on Business was excellent with good food. I think SQ need to re-look at their inflight food standard outbound from SIN.
label: positive

text: SIA differing customer care SIA has Customer Service Plan that states its commitment to providing airline passenger protection covering assurance of providing lowest fare through that booking channel, prompt refunds and a 24hr free cancellation, etc. All these should be basic and standard BUT THEY ONLY APPLY TO FLIGHTS IN AND OUT OF US! What about a similar customer service plan for flights in and out of Singapore to ensure that its Singapore passengers are treated just as fairly? Other airlines have the same 24hr cancellation policy for all flights not just only those in and out of US which is transparent and fair!
label: negative

text: Flight to India The flight was good and we had no issues, the seats were comfortable - even though they were economy and the service & food were good. We arrived at Changi around 6am and booked onto the free tour of Singapore which was interesting. An enjoyable experience.
label: positive

text: Have not flown with Singapore Airlines for a long time so I was really looking forward to fly with them on this short flight from Singapore to Denpasar-Bali. Both ground and inflight crews were friendly. Food and inflight services were good too! One thing that needs to be updated is definitely the IFE system. Flew on the return leg and was really satisfied with the overall flight experience as well.
label: positive

text: This airlines scams customers Beware, this airlines scams their customers: The airline refuses to refund my ticket. The request to instead rebook my ticket if a refund is not possible was also never replied to. I had contacted the airlines on april 20th via their portal and have not received any answer until now. I had also called their customer service last week and had to wait 1 hour until someone picked up. The person that picked up was not helpful at all, putting me on hold for at least another 20 minutes in total. In the end my request to refund the ticket into credits or money or at least rebook the ticket in the same class for another date was not fullfilled. I was told I could expect another call from a manager in the same week which did not happen. If you think of buying tickets from this airlines please don't, because they clearly do not care about their customers and basically scam them of their money.
label: negative

text: you are a great way to fly nothing short of perfect... except that the business class on the A380 is the oldest although they are going to upgrade the plane soon!
label: positive

text: Excellent Crew and Service making a 13-hour flight a nice and comfortable experience is saying it all. The service and the attention of the crew are excellent. The premium economy is worth the extra money. the only minor point is the quality of the food and the frequency of meals and snacks offered. It is still good but I have the impression that SGP Airlines is on some cost saving here. Please keep your high standards and do not lower them following the competition's trend as this is for us the reason why we always will choose Singapore Airlines above the others.
label: positive

text: The non-stop between Newark and Singapore was an expensive personal disappointment! I can't believe that I spent so much of my own money (over US$7000 RT) for the convenience of a non-stop that was so uncomfortable that I didn't get a moment's sleep (in either direction). Nor could I sit comfortably! In my opinion, the seat design is weird and requires one to twist one's body in order to sleep flat or even sit. I noticed that the leg support only supported 3/4 of the seat so one leg was essentially unsupported -- when it worked. And on my flight between SIN and EWR the leg support malfunctioned and wouldn't stay elevated. There was only one other seat to move to in that section of business class so I guess the seat issues don't seem to bother other passengers. But honestly, I would have been happier paying for United Polaris service with a stop than to be subject to these seats for so many hours!!! For the sake of full disclosure, there are a handful of seats in Business Class where it is possible to sit and lie with a straight spine. Even though I asked for one of these and they were available at the time I booked back in August, SIA said they were reserved for mothers traveling with infants. Well, in reality, on my flights these seats were occupied by businessmen who must have had greater clout than me! I was not very happy.... SIA are reputed to have the best service in the air and that was fine. But this was business class and NOT first class and I thought that this was nothing special.... The meals were ok and not great. The western dishes were almost accompanied by bland carrots and green beans which were too al dente for me to chew. I was slightly happier with the Asian meals. Further, the cabin crew made no effort on either flight to ask whether non-sleeping passengers would like any of the snack options. Nor did I see the packaged ones on a tray where people could help themselves... But what really got me is that there were no amenities to speak of on the way back to EWR whereas there was a kit on the flight to Singapore. I asked for some lip balm and was told that there wasn't any on board. I protested saying that I was given some on the flight between EWR and SIN (although I had to ask for some because it wasn't in the kit). It blew me away when I was informed that lip balm is a First Class item and we were, after all, only in Business Class. I consider that to not be a luxury on a 17 hour flight!!! And then I was informed that the kits were only being handed out in the first 90 days of service but, in fact, my outbound flight had been 3 1/2 months after the initiation of this service.... To the credit of the crew serving my area of the cabin, they appreciated how miserable I was and offered a very small service recovery gesture. It was a kind gesture and probably all they could do inflight but it was woefully inadequate considering the value of my airfare. I'm sure there are enough business people whose companies are willing to pay for the non-stop service but for me this was a SABENA (for those old enough to remember: Such A Bad Experience Never Again)!!!
label: neutral

text: Great service We had multiple flights booked with Singapore Airlines. I had never flown with Singapore Airlines before, I was told by so many people how fantastic the airline and it is advertised as the best airline in the world! So maybe I already had too high expectations of the airline and I found them no better than other airlines I have been with in the past. Flights were a reasonable price and the service of the staff was second to none, nothing was too much trouble, the food was very average and on the plane you actually seemed very squashed in your seat more so than other airlines. It is very expensive to upgrade your seats too in comparison to other airlines. We tried to upgrade in the bid and told unsuccessful but yet half the premium economy seats were left empty. I would fly with Singapore again it was not a bad experience at all but not the excellence I was expecting over and above other airlines. I found it just the same as Quantas, Virgin, British Airways, Thomson flights I have been on and not as good as Emirates.
label: positive

text: Copenhagen to Denpasar via Singapore. I had looked forward to where I could go with the new Airbus 350 and Singapore Airlines with their excellent quality reputation. However, the entertainment consisted of very few new movies. A menu card was handed out, I ordered chicken with Thai curry. The meat was full of cartilage and the rice was dried up. This was accompanied by a cold soft sugar tasting roll. Singapore Airline offer maybe the cheapest red wine I have tasted. Fortunately they offered Tiger beer. Although the crew carried sparkling wine on the wagon, you had not right to this since "it was not in the menu card" I was told. Very strange. On the return flight to Copenhagen the entertainment was slightly better but the food and beverage was far below the standard you get elsewhere like Qatar Airlines. The experience with Singapore Airlines was the biggest disappointment I have had since very long.
label: negative

text: An airline with great service! The crew are always there at your call. Efficient, always smiling and courteous to passengers. They never fast to impress. Check in staff are also very helpful and friendly which makes a big difference overall when you are on a long haul flight. Worth the price difference
label: positive

text: Indeed a Great Way to Fly We flew by SQ because we wanted on time departure and arrival to our destination compared to budget airlines which most of time delay due to no reasons. We unable to afford the delays as we are only going to be in Bangkok for 6 days. As usual, SQ service is always good. Cabin is clean. Flight was smooth. Indeed a Great Way to Fly.
label: positive

text: In the economy range, one of the best I live in Dubai. My go to airlines is Emirates. Travelled first time in Singapore airlines and was pleasantly surprised. Clean interiors, larger screens, good was ok and alcohol on board. Similar feel of Lufthansa or Emirates
label: positive

text: July 2014 SIN-MNL-SIN. Seats were OK for both sectors. Leg space for A330 was narrow but MNL-SIN B777-200 retrofitted seats have more space. However B777-200 'new' PTV shrunk and low resolutions. Both sector's in flight meals were disappointing. SQ's meals standard have dropped in the past one year. They should ask their own chef to try out first before sending to cabin.
label: negative

text: Amsterdam to Singapore - a breeze Returning from Europe back to Australia from Amsterdam through Singapore proved a breeze using Singapore Airlines Premium Economy on that particular leg. Service was quietly efficient, seamless and spot on Meals pleasant and certainly sufficient Seat and leg room terrific and even when the seat in front leaned back in wasn't inconveineced. Thank you Singapore Air. One request, please put Premium on the Perth - Singapore flights
label: positive

text: Melbourne to Hanoi via Singapore, and love Singapore Airlines. The flight attendants and customer service, fantastic. All flights on time. The only downside is that I thought the standard of the meals has dropped, certainly not as tasty as on previous times I have flown with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines to Australia My wife and I flew with Singapore Airlines to our eldest daughter's wedding in March. I was impressed by the attention to detail and friendliness of all cabin crew on all of our flights. The cabin crew actively kept the main public areas of the aircraft clean, also this airlines toilets were the cleanest and best maintained of any airline that I have flown with.
label: positive

text: Great Service, good food The staff are helpful and very welcoming. The food is great. Its always a pleasure flying with Singapore airlines.
label: positive

text: Best I've been fortunate enough to fly Cathay Pacific, EWA Air, Japan Airlines, ANA, United, American, Delta, Alaska, SWA, the last 5 year, but none of them beat Singapore airlines. Our flights were Bali to Singapore (2.5 hours) and then Singapore to LA (15 hours). Their economy section is equal to most other airlines economy plus. Their service was the best, seats, entertainment, cleanliness, food, you name it. I will pay extra money to fly Singapore Airlines especially on a long flight.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Our favourite airline to fly with. Exceptional service every time and great food and beverages as well
label: positive

text: Smooth flight matched with service Flying business ensures a bed for the night flights and this flight was no exception (warning Bus class AKL-SIN on SQ286 has offset seats so the bed is angled not straight on to the tv for those lying down watching films!). Also take the option that SQ offers Bus class flyers in choosing your meals in advance of the flight. Beware tho you may have changed your mind when you get on board!! Not because of the food just your personal preferences. Staff are attentive but not intrusive and always helpful IMHO. The A380 upstairs has no central overhead lockers so it gives a spacy airy fell to the cabin. Great way to fly!
label: positive

text: amazing service and crew and food best airline with good food service and on board seats and entertainment. highly recommended. will book again
label: positive

text: Better than others I heard a lot of good things about SQ from friends, family and office colleges. Experiencing SQ by myself really showed me that your airline is even in Eco a class better than others. The crew is extremely friendly, smiling and helpful. Even in the final hours of a stressful 12 hour flight. There is enough food and drinks. Also the crew was not tight on giving alcoholic drinks (this is what you want in vacation haha). Also a full and delicious meal on a 2 hour flight from/to DPS is just awesome compared to European carriers.Regarding cleanliness, I have never seen a cleaner long haul plane than this. The crew cleaned the restrooms all the time and refilled papers. Also, the crew kept an eye on cleanliness of the galley and aisle and removed papers or whatever trash was on the floor. I have not seen this before. The IFE is basically perfect. The selection of movie, TV shows and music outstanding, also the program is up to date and the touch screen is very responsive. Last but not least, the A380 is an awesome aircraft from a passengers perspective and offer the ultimate comfort for modern day longhaul trips. I will definitely choose SQ again rather than other carriers.
label: positive

text: Premium economy fantastic! The cost of Premium Economy is more than justified once you settle into the larger seat, better foot space, lift up leg rest and ease back the armchair with more arm room also. The only downside for me was they are leather, hence slippery, seats. Otherwise, service, comfort and even Singapore Airlines way of boarding by group, and enforcing it, made our trip fantastic.
label: positive

text: Bad service My recent flight with Singapore Airlines didn't have a happy ending. I didn't get my luggage at my final destination. I receive my suitcases three days later. I have to do some shopping because my stuff was in my checked bags. Moreover, I receive an email 24 hours before departure that I can check-in online. And when I want to check-in, it wasn't possible to choose a regular seat without surcharge. I ended up going to the airport and check-in there. The flight was conducted by SN Brussels and transfer to Singapore Airlines in Milan Malpensa Airport, Italy. Another worst scenario I've experienced, while we're already waited on the specific gate in Milan airport, 20 minutes before the boarding time, they suddenly announced that the gate number has changed. Furthermore, no headsets available onboard - I usually take my own, but I haven't thought about it. I end up watching movies without sound. Singapore used to be one of the top airlines several years ago; somehow, they're not the same anymore. Very disappointing!
label: negative

text: best airlines ever The best service, best hospitality, and the staffs are very polite. Felt very warm and welcomed throughout the flight. 100% recommend.
label: positive

text: Fabulous airline Flew to Singapore en route to Thailand and Vietnam, the staff were so friendly, attentive and caring. There were a lot of families on the flight and the crew were so helpful to the parents. We also used the Singapore airline stop over deal, this allowed us to enter the zoo and various other attractions for free during our stopover. Wonderful airline
label: positive

text: SIN-EWR: Purchased a ticket, with one of the 1/6 Standalone Premium Economy Seats. Check in at Changi quick. Tried to purchase lounge access but was turned down. The gate was opened 50 minutes prior to boarding. Boarding was smooth, on what seemed to be a full flight. Seat, and adjacent stowage bin were perfect. Bin could comfortably hold my Rimowa Attaché, but not Business Class. Took off on time, flew a different route than the incoming flight. Flew asleep, Cabin Crew gently tapped me on the shoulder, to eat. Have had ANA, and EVA let me sleep, and tag my seat returning later. Meal was good, Mushrooms had lots of flavor. Two-three rounds of drinks included. Recommenced sleep, and woke up. Cabin crew appeared taking drink orders, and brought back snacks. Crew continuously smiled, were warm, and professional, throughout the flight. They continued to check in, and ensure I didn’t go empty. Second meal served, again with endless drink rounds. IFE was not up to par, with what I’ve previously experienced on Singapore Airlines. Landed at EWR on time, with my bag quickly appearing. Would definitely fly Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Par Excellence - As Usual We've traveled Singapore Airlines almost exclusively on our long haul flights out of Australia for the past 5 years - and for good reason. Where Qantas and Cathay Pacific seem to have fallen from grace, Emirates and Etihad have stepped up but they are yet to prove their consistency. And that's the secret to Singapore Airline's success - consistency! The service levels are always the same, the airplanes are always clean/new, the food is always tasteful and flights are always punctual - everything just works! This makes for happy crew, happy passengers and an enjoyable trip.
label: positive

text: consistently very good As always with Singapore Airlines, good service, food Ok and movie selection OK. They used to be soo much better but you paid a higher price. No complaints a pleasant flight.
label: positive

text: As always too dark to read The Flight was quite alright , Meals had a good variety , You could order as many drinks as you wanted, we had to change flights in Singapore, enough time to buy too much at the duty free shops there and there were lots of restaurants and food stalls to choose from - all in all we had a good journey!
label: positive

text: Amazing service, ultimate comfort Took the flight with family and it was really worth it. The level of service is impeccable, was traveling with my 2 kids and the flight attendants really made us all feel special.
label: positive

text: Fantastic flights - great service Had a great overnight flight from Sydney to New Delhi with a 2 hour stopover in Singapore (2am their time) Great flight, good food and service and fantastic selection of movies. Singapore Airlines has always been a great airlines, but it is even better today. The flight back was equally as good and I didn't sleep at all. Too many new movie releases to see.
label: positive

text: Very expensive Very expensive, food ok and smooth flight, not much turbulence and spacious seats but the fare is much more higher.
label: negative

text: Travelled Denpasar (Bali) to Singapore on SQ 943. This was a great flight. Gracious and charming service on a 7 year old 777-200 in the old configuration with comfy armchair style recliners. Delicious beef steak with great red wine and champagne. The cabin crew were professional and friendly. The IFE was very old fashioned but that was the only demerit otherwise excellent.
label: positive

text: Best airline in the world? For sure! I have been flying 100,000+ km a year for 20 years. Singapore Airlines is by far and away my preferred airline. The standard in every class is exceptional.
label: positive

text: Pleasant flight which operated on time. Check-in at Changi was smooth and assistance given to me since I didn’t know how to use the check-in kiosk and bag drop. Lunch was provided onboard and advanced special meal requests were catered for appropriately. I like flying this airline.
label: positive

text: I flew Singapore to Jakarta on 28 June. It was an early morning flight. The cabin crew was professional and working hard on this flight to get the meal service underway and completed despite the short flight duration. The seat felt a little cramped. The food was a slight disappointment and the service was less friendly or warm than what has to come to be expected of such a premium airline. Having said that, the crew was careful in ensuring that the pre-arrival checks are properly carried out (seat belts secured, etc) and that the safety of the passengers are paramount as should be the case.
label: neutral

text: best airlines best airlines, best cabin crew, best food...everything best. A must airlines if you fly in asian countries
label: positive

text: Flying Singapore Airlines Excellent service, updated movies, comfortable seating, food was good. Friendly staff. Overall a very pleasant flight.
label: positive

text: Great personal service in modern suites The suites are great on Singapore Airlines, especially the updated ones on the new A380s. There is plenty of space and some of the suites can be combined when there are two travelling. The food is very good and there is loads of it. You can also eat in the private lounges before boarding or when in transit. The new planes carry up to six passengers in the suites (down from twelve in the older planes). There are two huge toilets on the new A380s and i'm pretty sure the most passengers we had on one was five, so there were no queues to use one. There are no showers on the planes, but showers are available in the lounges. Later this year we will be flying Singapore Airlines again. The first leg in an old suite and the 2nd leg we'll be trying out a 777, so just first class. It will be interesting to compare the two cabin configurations.
label: positive

text: Die beste Airline der Welt ??? Singapore Airlines Bangkok - Singapore 17.12.19 SQ975 Singapore - Christchurch 17.12.19 SQ 4295 Dear Mr or Madam, Electronic Check-in at Bangkok: It didn’t works. Check-in Bangkok: The Singapore Airline employee didn’t know that Swiss citizen don’t need a Visa for New Zealand. Check-in Singapore: Your employees were only an unreasonable demand. My partner and I had to wait over half an hour until they started with our tickets. Then the 1. employee, a man, gave our tickets further to a lady. I told her our continuation flight to Christchurch would be in 1 hour and she should now print out the boarding passes. She claimed my name is written wrong, even though the names on the tickets and the Travel Itinerary was written correct. She worked very slowly and called very long with an other persons. The same „game“ happened with the visa for my partner, even she could show it. Then we had to run 15 Min to A21 to get the plane. Flight Singapore to Christchurch: was good. I don’t know what kind of education your employees have. In any case we cold this slowdown strike and plainly not the best service. Yours sincerely Hans Weber Travel Itinerary WEBER/HANS HEINRICH MR EDMONDJONES/BANGOEN PHUNKET MRS Booking reference: S2LOWJ 09 Aug 2019 Singapore Airlines
label: negative

text: A long, noisy flight This flight between flight between Singapore and Copenhagen did not begin well. It was originally scheduled to depart from Changi Airport’s Terminal 3. About 2 hours prior to departure, the electronic departures board indicated a change of departure gate to a gate located in Terminal 1. Consequently, we had to make our way from Terminal 3 to Terminal 1 onboard the “skytrain”. The aircraft for this flight turned out to be one of Singapore Airlines’ older Boeing 777-300s (9V-SWF). These aircraft are due to be replaced on this route by Airbus A350s later this year. It will not be before time! Despite the fact that we were travelling in the retro-fitted Premium Economy cabin, the aircraft was certainly displaying the ravages of time. Our seats were between the window and the aisle at the rear of the Premium Economy cabin. This meant that we were over the wing adjacent to the starboard engine. Despite the fact that we were issued with Premium Economy noise cancelling headphones, the noise from the jet engine was almost over-powering and was prevalent throughout the almost 13 hour flight. We had availed ourselves of the “Book the Cook” service which is available to both Business Class and Premium Economy passengers. Unfortunately, the meals were nothing more than average in quality. As this flight departed Singapore at 11.50pm and arrived in Copenhagen at approximately 7.00am, there appeared to be an expectation that passengers would sleep most of the way. Consequently the lights were dimmed for most of the flight and services were limited to two meal services and the occasional rounds of water or orange juice offered overnight. Premium Economy certainly provided a less cramped experience on this flight when compared to the Economy cabin. However, the age of the aircraft and its noisy jet engines meant that it was still far from and enjoyable and relaxing flight!
label: neutral

text: Hokkaido Vacation Went on family vacation in Hokkado this year. On time and smooth flight. In flight service is friendly but meal is not hot and tasty.
label: neutral

text: First ride on an A380. Flying to London on a A380 for the first time. Economy class Seats 44B/C were a little more roomy than expected although once the person in front of me put their seat back I was cramped up for 11 hours. The food was as one would expect on a long hall flight however the flight crew (Candi, Wan, Shu Ying, Ayan, Farah, Jenny & Aaron) were all very hospitable and helpful. Thanks for making our flight bearable.
label: positive

text: Our Flight Experience When we booked we had middle row window side seats, or back row middle section seats as our choice. Took window side. 24 seats all up. The good stuff. Priority check in. Ample baggage allowance which includes priority stickers, so bags usually come through more quickly. Priority boarding after Business Class. First served for drinks and meals. Menu has a starter, choice of 3 mains and a dessert, plus cheese and crackers. Limited wine choice of 1 white (Sav Blanc)and 1 red (Cab Sav), though it does include champagne. Food choices are pretty much the same as economy. Generally we enjoyed the food, but chicken salad starter had chicken so overcooked it couldn't be cut let alone eaten. The not so good. We had 2 lots of 2 x 10 hr flights and the firm seats were getting rather uncomfortable by the end of all flights. No toilet specifically for Premium Economy passengers, just use the economy ones with everyone else. Seats slightly wider with each row being 2 x 4 x 2. Seats do recline a little more than economy, but when the person in front of you reclines their seat and you are dinning, you can still end up with your wine being knocked over and food pushed on to the floor. Person in the aisle seats still has to get out to let the person beside them get out. Only the front row has more leg room. There is a box (possibly the entertainment box) that sits under all the aisle seats which limits foot room. Good variety of movies and other entertainment to chose from. We take our own noise cancelling headphones, so can't comment on the headphones provided by the airline. The crew are lovely and very helpful and the safety video is beautiful. Is it worth the extra cost for Premium Economy, possibly, but next time we will go Premium Economy on Air NZ, it's far better.
label: positive

text: Faultless Having arranged 4 premium economy seats we were very happy with whole process. Check in at Heathrow was exceptionally smooth and quick. Seats were comfortable with adequate leg room. In flight food and entertainment also very good, but attentiveness of stewards along with maintaining cleanliness of long haul flight was a big plus. Although not frequent fliers we used 3 other airlines for long flights over 5 week period and this service provided us with the best overall experience.
label: positive

text: Top Class Singapore Airlines is up there with the best airlines of the world in terms of safety, service and quality of aircraft. What else do you need to say, everything was as expected.
label: positive

text: Singapore London and return After six years of my last London trip i managed to squeeze a little time of ten days to be there again. Well as usual it was on SIA again. I was happy to take the retrofitted 777 again. There was only four seats in this cabin thus assured me of more privacy. There was only two toilets which meant that i only share the toilet with one other person. Actually i love this retrofitted seat 1F rather than the normal sky suite which SQ is famous for. It was less claustrophobic and gave a nice sense of openness yet gave sufficient privacy. I was happy that even though it was a red eye flight the supper service of five good courses inclusive of that delicate caviar served on a light cauliflower mousse was excellent. The seat which can be converted to a real flat bed of 35 in by 81 in with a comfortable linen duvet really lulled me for a good six hour sleep then. As usual the crews were excellent and they anticipated my needs well. they knew my favourite drinks of a good chilled flute of a third apple and two third Perrier with two ice cubes well and my usual Kenyan coffee well. It was a pleasant flight. I as usual seldom watch any movies but the selections of classical repertoire on board was wide. I managed to read a good book during this flight. By the way the wifi on board was par excellent.
label: positive

text: More than 43 years after my first flight with Singapore Airlines I flew from Guangzhou to Singapore. The night flight on an A333 was not fully booked - just about 70%. I was impressed by the efficiency and quality of service plus the smiles I got from time to time. On this flight of almost 4 hours they offered a full meal with the choice of European/international or Asian/local fare - plus a menu card. The food and the wine were tasty, got one or even two refills and felt fine . Arrival ahead of schedule, swift procedures. Once again a flight on the level they are famous for, they earn their five stars.
label: positive

text: Restful 10 1/2 hour flight. Our original flight booking was from IAD> LAX, Los Angles with Alaskan Air(5 hours), then LAX> NRT, Tokyo with Singapore Air(10 1/2 HOURS), with our luggage checked through from IAD to NRT. 2 seats cost $1,202. Because of my recent surgery, we decided to bid $300 to upgrade to Premium Economy being notified 48 hours before the flight that we won, providing 2 inside seats on a 2-4-2 seating configuration). This gave us more seat width(as Economy had a 3-3-3 configuration, which included a double armrest solving the inevitable encroachment of an oversize passenger. Today my neighbor was a 75 year old born in Arkansas internment camp for Japanese in 1943, who returned to Japan to teach English before retiring. Premium Economy includes gourmet meal choices for lunch and dinner(if selected online before boarding), complementary wine/champagne, and even Ben and Jerry's Cookie Dough ice cream. The beautifully dressed stewardesses twice provided hot towels, and multiple drink and snack selections throughout the flight. At other times the room was darkened for sleeping where many passengers utilized the noise cancelling head phones to utilize the large seat monitors for its huge selection of movies, TV, games and music. We walked back the 2 aisles to share the ample economy restrooms stocked with mouthwash, hand lotion and toothbrushes and toothpaste. This was our best long term flight that we truly enjoyed rather than endured.
label: positive

text: Great Comfotable Flying Experience With SIA The check in was smoothly organised. The flight was smooth and comfortable. The Crew were polite and extremely patient with passengers. Take off, flight and touchdown were all smooth and not too bumpy and soft landing. The inflight menus were delectable with loads of new released movies to watch while you eat and during your flight. Thumbs up as usual for SIA flights.
label: positive

text: The First Suite has a lot of space and a lot of gadgets, and some fellow travelers might be impressed. I was rather disappointed by the outline and design of the suite. The bed is not in the direction of the travel, but across the suite. It is narrow and very hard. If the bed is in the non-sleeping position, then it just hangs at the wall to the next suite like a white chunk of wood. In order to dine from the table one has to turn the chair towards the aisle, or towards the fellow traveller in the opposite suite (which is not very private, when, as in my case, the door does not close properly). On both legs to and from Sydney there were technical issues in the suite: either the door could not be closed properly, or the entertainment system did not work at all, or not properly, the seat belt did not fit into the mattress, etc. To add as well, that Singapore Airlines seems to have cut the quality and diversity of the food and wine on offer. Only the Caviar was nicely presented and met the quality standard of First Class food. (On my way to Singapore I have enjoyed Swiss and their First Class product. For a frequent traveller their product was First Class all over, (only with the exception of the bathroom).
label: neutral

text: A great airline to fly with but the business class bed lets them down. Having had a connection from Madrid we arrived early into terminal two and the Singapore desks were not open but the desks in front were open and we were advised to use these as they could do exactly the same as the Singapore desks and we therefore saved about three hours waiting around for the gates to open, a good tip for anyone. The lounge at Heathrow was a huge disappointment staff were more concerned about gossiping with each other than doing their jobs. Dirty plates were left on our table for an hour, the bar was often left unattended and when I went to use the showers I was shown initially into two showers that had dirty towels strewn on the floor. Checkin was quick and the welcome on board was friendly. The seat when in the seating position was the best I have flown on in business class but when converted into a bed was just too hard to get much sleep, hence the four not the five point rating. A mattress topper would have made the whole journey more enjoyable. I am 1m85cm tall and had no problem with the cubby hole space for your feet in sleep mode and this had been a concern prior to the flight. The meal service was excellent my steak from the book the cook menu was cooked to perfection for me and my partners duck was equally good. Drinks were topped up when needed and water was offered throughout the flight. Arrival in Changi was efficiency at its best. If the bed issue can be sorted out Singapore airways will become my go to airline.
label: positive

text: Prior to flying I had a nightmare trying to rearrange my flight when quarantine rules changed. Emails were not replied to and the UK telephone line required a pin to proceed. The change I required was not possible online. I purchased an aisle seat but I was not allocated one when they changed my booking. The flight was very disappointing. We took off about 12.30pm. After 1 and a half hours were served a curry and rice, a roll and ice cream. There were only two drinks service during a flight of more than 12 and a half hours. Our second meal, breakfast was served 9.5 hours later. Unfortunately my seat was near the galley and the door to staff quarters and the crew slammed the door nearly every ten minutes and were really inconsiderate I thought. I was quite disgruntled so attempted to get a refund on the seats I had purchased and voice my complaints. Yet again I have found it impossible to contact them.
label: negative

text: Awful I don't expect a great deal of comfort when flying economy and in this regard the flight met my expectations. The seat was extremely uncomfortable and cramped. I am a small person and even so the seat and leg room did not afford any comfort. I was allocated a seat amongst families with three infants, which was unfair to me and the families. Service was very poor. The cabin crew were not interested in passengers and systems were disorganized. My husband was skipped at breakfast time ... simply ignored. He thought they must be serving the other row only and going to come back to him. He had to request breakfast in the end. It was difficult to get water. I booked through star alliance network which made managing the Singapore Airlines part of my journey, with seat select etc difficult. I will not fly Singapore Airlines again.
label: negative

text: Meet expectation The boarding procedure was well organised and hence there is no bottle-necked jam. I felt there are enough cabin crew on hand to assist the passengers, hence the smooth boarding. Well, the food are acceptable. The more experienced cabin crew are able to engage the passengers and do pay attention to the passengers' needs. I only find one younger crew member that seems a little stress and she just "shoved" the food and ice-cream to the passengers (It was a full flight), not like the more experienced ones who seems to offer rather than just put it down for the passengers. I believe with a little more time, the particular cabin crew should be able better herself. One more thing, the safety video is very innovative and engaging. Overall, I have an enjoyable flight.
label: positive

text: better than competitor SQ offers better service in premium economy compare to other competitor. From luggage handling to service on board. Their sit place looks neater with leather like cover and personal reading light. They could improve the amenities pouch and lounge service.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines After all these years Singapore Airlines maintains it's position and well deserved reputation of "The Airline other airlines talk about". Excellent and courteous staff, fantastic meals and in flight entertainment made the time from Sydney to London with a 2 hour break in Singapore easy and comfortable travelling. We travelled with a child and the inflight movie and entertainment selection kept him occupied on both flights. The break at the delightful Changi airport gave us a chance to stretch our legs and grab a quick meal then board the flight to London where the cabin was dimmed so everyone could get some rest before arrival. I will definitely be flying with them again and their service is second to none for all aspects of flying. Highly recommended.
label: positive

text: Great entertainment system, great seats (economy) Flew SQ361 and SQ362 Stockholm - Singapore - Stockholm with the Airbus Industrie A350-900. I was sitting in economy but I had reserved a seat with extra leg room as I am 6 foot 3 (193 cm). However, space was fairly good even in the ordinary seats. Entertainment system was great, large clear touch screen with over 90 english spoken movies, lots of other stuff to watch. Kids enjoyed all the video games controlled by the wire remote that is located in the seat. USB charging available. Headrest is moveable. Food was good for being airplane food, mostly asian dishes. Only down side with this fligth was the stop in Moscow where everyone including hand luggage had to leave the aircraft and pass through security. Felt like an unneccesary stop as not many new people left or entered the airplane. Stop was fairly fast, estimation 60-90 minutes. Overall, I will fly Singapore again when I am travelling to far east asia.
label: positive

text: Lets Fly in A Very Fascinating Airlines This is my first time flight with Singapore Airlines and that was awesome! The airline serves passengers very well. They always offer us a variety of services. Before entering the plane, we were offered a headset and newspaper. Then we were given a variety of foods and it tasted good
label: positive

text: Only average I usually take emirates when I fly. but decided to take Singapore airlines for once to try it out with all the great reviews. I felt that the inflight entertainment was quite limiting and difficult to navigate only a small selection of new films compared to loads of old and new alike on emirates. But I would say that I enjoyed having a full HD display. I would say that the crew were above average in the terms of service and gave a hot towel before the flight which was a bit too warm for me. The food was way to salty and had only a western and Chinese options without any curry option as I guess they assume that only people whom order a halal meal like curry. For some reason they would not let me charge my phone during take off and landing. I feel that this airline is not worth the extra money over emirates. I feel some of the good reviews of this airline are from Singaporeans whom pledge loyalty to the national airline without trying out the competition
label: neutral

text: Would not fly with this carrier again Was recommended to fly with airline but never again. There was no leg room, inflight entertainment was appalling and the meal service terrible. We were offered a choice of fish or fish. We are not allergic to fish we just cannot stomach it, but we’re offered no alternative . On a good note the air stewards did have a lovely disposition.
label: negative

text: First flight was the best We had 4 flights in total, and the first flight was the best, mainly due to the food being served which was to our taste. On the other flights the food had mainly Asian tendencies which were not to our taste. The staff were very good on all flights, and particularly good on our first flight when there was a family in front of us who were constantly calling the staff. Lots of choice of films etc. We were disappointed that on our flight home leaving Christchurch at midday we had to pull the blinds down to enable people to sleep, when we would have liked to look out of the window.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines This is one of the best airlines I have ever traveled, the seats were roomy the in flight entertainment was excellent and the bathrooms were very clean. I flew round trip from Bangkok to Singapore and both flights were excellent.
label: positive

text: Safest Airlines I had been to Singapore during the coronavirus pandemic, when I arrived in Singapore the DRDO level was yellow and soon it was at orange levels. My experience during this time was the airlines staff was well versed with the subject and they ensured necessary precautions. They also ensures that all passengers were made comfortable and sufficient care and service wA given during this flight
label: positive

text: The Best in the Sky On our way back from Penang - we flew Silk Air (subsidiary of Singapore Airlines) and it was a good flight. A big surprise was waiting for us on the flight from Singapore to Perth. A Boeing 787 Dream liner. Wow it is big / comfortable and the service is the Best airline service ever. We have flown to either Singapore and Penang a combination of possibly 20 time on different airlines. You cannot beat Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: Familiarity breeds Contempt: Killing the joy of travel While Singapore Airlines used to be one of the best they are now one of the worst. From the app, that seems (from its “features” and user interface as if it were the product of a high school student project, to the rude and uncaring grind staff (Changi) to the poor onboard “entertainment system”-same movies over 5 weeks since our long haul flight out. The plane was visible from the terminal but we were told it had not arrived so we would be delayed. A third world class airline. Very disappointing but never again.
label: negative

text: Long haul flight Long flight, but meals were good, seats were fairly roomy and comfortable. Lots of inflight entertainment and very good cabin crew.
label: positive

text: Always vg A relatively short trip for a few weeks in Singapore. Excellent service as always. Food better than in business in more than a few competitors
label: positive

text: famous reputation by far not fullfilled We've heard and red so much positive about this airline and it's reputation. Although still better than Swiss Airlines, we were dissappointed by this A380 flight. Staff friendlyness was just average (in deed we saw only one flight attendend smiling, all others made a bored impression). Food was ok, but also not outstanding. Sleeping possibility was nearly impossible. As an avarage 1.8m European, I could only lay on my left side in the position like a croissant because the space for legs and feed is beside the seat in front of you. Hipps and shoulder hurts very fast in this stare "sleeping" position. Emirates is by far better, because their seats are able to lay flat and straight.
label: neutral

text: Singapore Airlines Singapore Airlines greet you with a wonderful business lounge at Brisbane International Airport, lovely food comfortable surroundings, they page you when your flight is ready. The onboard staff are excellent, pleasant and seating and onboard facilties are brilliant. Food is lovely choices and on board movies and entertainment are sensational. The seats in business convert to very comfortable beds and the comlementary toiletry bags are a nice plus. Would totally recommend Singapore Airlines for long haul international flights
label: positive

text: A great experience First time with Singapore and would absolutely fly with them again and on the same route. Staff were very attentive throughout and food was good, had requested a non seafood meal which was served with no issues. Entertainment system was excellent and choice was also wide ranging. Seats were very comfortable and had decent enough room.
label: positive

text: Good service in economy Flight was full, but I have to reluctantly admit that the service throughout was very good. Reasonable food quality. Staff helpful & responsive. Adequate leg-room. Flight on time.
label: positive

text: Perth to Singapore. This is an older airbus and seats are ok, with decent leg space. Very happy with the shopping selection for Jun to Aug - the Sulwhasoo selection onboard has expanded again! Food is decent and is served with real cutlery (as opposed to cheap plastic cutlery and cardboard containers on other economy class flights). Service is great. For a 5 hour flight, Singapore Airlines economy class is good value.
label: positive

text: Great airline - consistently so! After years of flying budget airlines all around the world, I have made the conscious decision to return to Singapore Airline. This airline is consistently good - not the cheapest but probably one of the most reliable
label: positive

text: Best airline service I have had yet! In flight experience was extremely comfortable. Service when checking in and on board was perfect. Will definitely be flying with Singapore again!
label: positive

text: The best can be offered in the sky The 787-9 has a wonderful cabin. The service is indeed one of the most coveted to be matched by any other airlines. The flight - best, makes economy feels like first class! The cabin noise is simply sweet lullaby for a baby. Very stable plane despite slight turbulence - was there even one? The in-flight feature is awesome, from USB charging ports to touch screen entertainment as boasted in their advertisement. Like the lightning - simply makes you feel safe and soothed to the max! Fly none other, if not, frequent this flight! Makes the flight the travel itself in the airplane. The food tastes one up, with the portion just right for each meal time. The destination doesn’t matter, is the flight that counts! Comfortable legroom and good seating with comfortable ambiance temperature.
