There is endless entertainment to choose from, including watching the flight path - keeping you updated on the flight telemetry. Great piloting ensured that the most important part of the journey - arriving safely at the destination! Good work captain and crew! The next choice for flight will be this airline again! Be on one flight to know this difference. Will fly again - many times more!
label: positive

text: Best experience in the Sky! Singapore is our favorite airline to fly! From the time you arrive at the check-in counter, to their excellent Lounge in Singapore and their superb inflight service, this is the ultimate flight experience!
label: positive

text: The best airline I always try to fly SingaporeAir when ever possible.The food is lovely the staff are beautifully dressed and Changi airport is a day trip alone just wonderful
label: positive

text: DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS AIRLINE! So I thought hey, let's book with a 5 star airline for my honeymoon! Boy was I wrong, they can't even make the booking? Waited for confirmation and received nothing so I call my bank and they confirm money has been sent, call the airline and on multiple occasions, they tell me they have no booking for me and received no money, after abusing my bank refund as Singapore airlines refused any knowing of this booking, finally received some food news that Singapore airline had a glitch and the money would be refunded in 10 business days, never had I gone through so much stress and I asked for compensation and kept getting oh we cannot confirm any compensation as there was never a booking....
label: negative

text: review none of the flight crews ever offered me a drink. however, i can't help but notice they always offer drinks and attend more to non-asian passengers around me. it was just yesterday flight SQ 318
label: neutral

text: Barcelona to Melbourne via Singapore, a terrific flight on Singapore Airlines. Comfortable seats, great food and wines and exemplary staff. Both crews were very attentive and worked hard to ensure we had good flights. The new A350 seats are well-designed and the Inflight entertainment is easy to use with big screens. I have seen better videos choices, but the offer on SIA is good.
label: positive

text: Singapore airways We have flown Singapore Air before and always found them to be excellent but we are very disappointed by the new airbus provision for economy travelers. The seats are extremely uncomfortable if you are flying long-haul. There is much less leg room and the seat upholstery is just not very good any more. Our short haul flight from Denpasar, Bali to Singapore was great in one of the ‘old style’ planes but Singapore to London was a different story. Flying out in daytime wasn’t so bad but coming back at night trying to get some sleep was difficult. Also just extricating yourself to use the toilet when the seats are reclined is very awkward. We will be looking to see if other airlines are better before choosing Singapore Air again. The on board service remains very good indeed what a shame that economy travellers’ comfort has been compromised to serve the better off.
label: positive

text: In the last 2 weeks I flew from Perth to Singapore to Johannesburg back to Singapore then to Hong Kong from Hong Kong back to Singapore and finally home to Perth! All with Singapore Airlines. Every flight was quite simply the best I have experienced. I actually found myself looking forward to a meal on a plane. All aspects were fast efficient friendly and professional. Economy seats on the 777 are far better than any other airline I have flown IFE was very good with a wide selection all flights on time and onboard staff very good. Quite simply I can see why they are always rated so highly.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Review Great flight, food was good everything was smooth! Leg room was pretty narrow but for the price I can't complain. Service is awesome & price is great as well! Total hours was around 1.5hrs, which is considered fast traveling from Singapore to Seattle.
label: positive

text: A VERY PLEASENT EXPERIENCE The flight was two legs from Bangalore to Singapore and Singapore to SFO. The Singapore - SFO flight is the new generation high capacity and the 19 hours of time was very smooth and incident free. The inflight service was very good. The quality of food could have been a little better as I am a vegitarian & was expecting a higher quality of stuff from Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: No quibble refund after we booked direct with airline I have seen so many bad reviews on major airlines as a result of COVID flight cancellations. I can only say that I have nothing but good things to say about Singapore Airlines from our own experience. We spoke with one of their representatives on the phone after they rang us and she was as pleasant and helpful as anyone we have ever spoken too. She processed the return of our ticket costs after they had cancelled 2 of the flights without any fuss whatsoever. We were told that the refunds could take from 2 to 6 weeks before they would be in our bank account, 4 days later we had the full amount refunded. When all this horrible situation is sorted there will only be one airline we will use to make our trip to see the daughter and grandchildren. Good service earns its own rewards.
label: positive

text: 1st Time with Sing Air If I remember correctly, Singapore Airlines is one of the best airlines in the world and I've always dreamed of a chance to try it. This was proven when I had the chance to try. Yes, price is a premium but comparing to other airlines that has the same price for the flight, I would definitely pick Singapore Airlines. Leg room is great! Entertainment features per seat is good. Flight Attendant service is great as well. Boarding process, no hassle.
label: positive

text: Premium prices for Budget flight for Singapore Airlines I used to have an amazing impression of SQ, until now. I flew to Phuket from Singapore just last week. It was a total disappointment. The plane was small and don't have entertainment screen. The food was served in paper boxes. The only thing good was the service by the crew members. Why am I paying premium prices for a budget flight? The brand name of Singapore Airlines has totally gone down the drain after covid days.
label: negative

text: Friendly flight crew The flight crew were professional and friendly in setting up the bassinet and even assisting to keep and re-heat the meal for my infant when my infant was asleep during the initial meal-service.
label: positive

text: Long flight made easy + COVID safe and Clean Staff regularly checked in on my mom, and for her, it didn't feel like 17 hours at all. On SQ47 flight on Sep 4th, my mom was taken care of by Viona, Alvin, Grace, Albert, Philip Artha, and Cecilia. I am really appreciative of the wonderful service and peace of mind the staff gave me, knowing that my mom is well taken care of. They are the finest representation of SAs reputation. Also a very covid safe experience as they handed out sanitation kits at the start of the flight.
label: positive

text: Don't expect any customer service Be warned, book anywhere else. Singapore Airlines used to be great but those days are gone. They will happily and quickly take your money but good luck ever getting it back if you are owed a refund. I have been given the run around for 8 months now. Call center is absolutely useless with no power. Refund department does not reply to emails for months. You can't talk to a real person in refunds. They don't write down your information in the call center, calls aren't logged with you information. I have provided them my contact details on 5 occasions and when i call, every time they say there are no contact details on file. Basically a fraudulent company using customers as a bank. There should be a lawsuit against this company.
label: negative

text: Great service It was such a great service provided by the airline and especial the crews who took care of my family. It had a great car for infant.
label: positive

text: A smooth trip to Singapore and back Singapore Airlines continues with its efficient and good service. Whilst other airlines oversell their seating, change and cancel flights without notice and have bad check in service, Singapore Airlines keep their long-standing approach of being a good carrier.
label: positive

text: Airline Not flown with them for 15 years as usually fly Emerites or Qatar . Singapore planes looked old to others now . Service good and easy to find way around airport.
label: neutral

text: Long haul flight Sydney to London I found this flight from Sydney to London with a few hours stop over in Singapore very comfortable on Singapore Airlines wide bodied plane...plenty of room in the rear of the plane near the galley to stretch and take a break from your seat. The seats were comfortable and the inflights movies and meals were really good .I would recommmend Singapore Airlines for long haul flights.
label: positive

text: its 5 stars Easy check in, great lounge and boarding goes fast. Friendly staff, short delay but it wasnt a problem. Service on board is great, seats are comfortable. Perfect flight again.
label: positive

text: smooth flight flight from singapore to shanghai was smooth, aboard the new plane - leg space was the same, but the new touch screen entertainment system was pretty cool
label: positive

text: Excellent Airline ! Excellent Service ! Excellent Food on the Flight ! Excellent Airline ! Excellent Service ! Excellent Food on the Flight ! We flew LAX-NRT ( Tokyo Narita ), NRT-SIN & SIN-HYD, w/ a Break of Journey of 5 days at Tokyo, for a Vacation. The Air Hostesses worked VERY HARD & Tirelessly to keep everyone Satisfied ! Even after working 3-4 hrs on their Shift, they Looked Fresh still ! Couldn't be Happier about everything :-) :-) MINUS : As we did NOT want Paid Seats, we were Forced to Book our Seat Numbers 48 hrs BEFORE Each Flight. That was DIFFICULT in Tokyo, as we stayed there 5 Days. MINUS : On the Return, The HYD-SIN Flight was 2.5 Hrs LATE, & would miss the Onward Connection from SIN-LAX. So, they Re-booked Us onto Cathay Pacific at HYD itself. LOTS of DELAY getting that done, at HYD Airport.
label: positive

text: New aircraft nice flight Flew on new A350-900 aircraft from Cape Town to Jakarta with transit in Johannesburg and Singapore. We stayed onboard in Johannesburg for about an hour while the plane was being cleaned and refueled. Big TV with tons of movies to watch. Service was good and food was fine. No delays which was great. Singapore Airlines is pretty dependable. The 48 hour online check in was fast and easy to do on their mobile app. For families travelling in and out of South Africa don't forget to bring copies of birth certificate for children under 18 years of age. The airline will ask for them during check in.
label: positive

text: I love Singapore Airlines! I love flying Singapore Airlines when I get the chance. Service in SQ economy class surpasses the North American business class airlines. My most recent trip on SQ was in business class - an overall enjoyable experience.
label: positive

text: Very professional We elected to fly SIA because we wished to try Premium Economy on the long overnight sector from Singapore to London. Unfortunately they do not offer this service from Adelaide. We broke our journey in Singapore using a SIA Holiday package which is a very convenient option for an overnight stay. The PE was well worth the extra as the seat and service were similar to that offered in Business only a few years ago. The added benefit of SIA is transmitting through Changi deservedly voted as the best airport on the world.
label: positive

text: SingaporeAirlines International Experience The flight from Darwin to Singapore was on the Singapore Airlines budget carrier SilkAir. Jetstar could really do with taking a few pointers from this carrier. The seats are comfortable and the service is excellent. Previous experience with SilkAir was travelling to Singapore then connecting to Dublin on Emirates and they checked our baggage right through to Dublin from Darwin. The airfares were also really good value costing less for my husband and I to fly to Tokyo than for one of us to fly to Perth. We used seat guru to select our seats. We were a bit hot on the flight over to Tokyo but on the flight back we selected seats with only two seats in front of the midsection toilets. We could recline our seats without impacting anyone else, there was plenty of leg room for my husband who is quite tall and the traffic really wasn’t that big an issue. Great service, great onboard meals and value for money. Highly recommend this airline. They have a frequent flyer programme too.
label: positive

text: My first choice for efficient service Always my first choice between London and Singapore. Lucky to fly a recently upgraded A380 one way and a well maintained 777 on the return. Entertainment good. Food very good and great service
label: positive

text: Nice Flights!!! Wanna fly them again! Long flight, with A380. was a very nice one even the cabin VOD was a first version in A380 but movies choices was good and many options. Food as always was great. Cabin crew was just friendly and helpful. Nice experience. Ticket was expensive but you get what you paid......
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines quality has declined significantly over the years. I used to fly regularly but stopped taking it for a while until yesterday on a long haul flight from Houston. Food and beverage - Just above average. Beef bourguignon was overcooked and not tender. Chicken Tikka lacks flavor. Poor wine selection. Only one that was really good was the singaporean crab cake. Premium economy lacks leg room vs others. Pillow case is old and faded in color. Some parts of seat sides not cleaned properly. Entertainment Behind vs others. Live TV doesn’t work. Lacks in brightness and sharpness. Lack of TV series options. Worst, it was down the whole 24 hrs flight during my wife and kids travel on June 18th. They gave compensation vouchers but only for inflight shopping which lacks necessary / useful items. Wifi onboard while it’s free it lacks the speed. Amenities did not get any. Not even eye mask, tooth brush. Cabin crew no longer the proud “singapore hospitality” it once was. Some friendly and attentive, some others just wanting to get the flight over and go home. One even mistook connecting headphone to headphone jack as phone charging so she forced me to take it off during landing and when she realize she was wrong did not say sorry. During my flight from Houston on July 5th I suddenly received notice that baggage is transferred to another flight. While it’s good they notified early and they delivered to my holiday accommodation, had to wait for 8 hours without clothing and basic necessities and ended up doing last minute shopping. They acted as if it’s a normal situation. No compensation. Punctuality I have to say they still excel in this area (hence the two star). It seems likely that SQ has exercised significant budget cuts post covid to increase profitability. However, price is still high vs others so it’s time to take a reflection.
label: negative

text: Very Good flight to Bali! We flew CPT-JNB-SIN-DPS with a chosen 10hr layover in Singapore to do some sightseeing. Overall a very good flight with great service from the cabin crew and the pilot got us home back 30 mins earlier than expected 😊. There were no delays at all. Good legroom in economy class and a fantastic selection of entertainment on board. Toilets were always clean and they offer complimentary toothbrushwith toothpaste, comb, socks, earphones etc. Only disappointment was the food - tasteless in flight meals and not so fresh bread rolls.
label: positive

text: Disappointing premium economy seats My husband and I flew Singapore Airlines premium economy in January from Melbourne to Hanoi. We were very disappointed in our seats. While they definitely had plenty of leg room, the seat was narrow and was impossible to get comfortable to get to sleep as you couldn't turn sideways. Even allowing for me being quite wide my husband is not and we both found the seats uncomfortable. Because if this we upgraded to business class on our return flight and we were very comfortable.
label: neutral

text: Excellent service I used to fly in the economy class often but this year is the first time I flew in the premium economy class and it’s awesome! Food on board was great. I pre ordered the food online before my flight. The carrot cake on the way back from Singapore to Amsterdam was so delicious. I finished it all. Normally I never finished my meal on board I just took a couple of bites and that’s it but not this year 🥰 it was all so good. The stewardess were all very friendly as usual when you fly with Singapore airlines no matter which class you take. They treat you very well. Singapore airlines is the best!
label: positive

text: Great airline, beautiful airport, pathetic service. Flying to Singapore on Singapore Airlines is something people dream of. We took the flight and loved it, the airport was amazing but when it comes to security and immigration, it appalling. The airline is great, economy seats are good, pitch is perfect and a guy like me 185cm sits pretty comfortable and I did enjoy the flight. The greeting by immigration was like "why the hell did you just arrive at midnight, I'd better be in bed". Well, the flight was scheduled to arrive 0010. Sorry guys. Three days later we left to Hanoi, again, the security were nasty and bored, hated every moment of their job. Then on our way back with transit in Singapore Changi. Straight after landing, we disembarked to find a massive amount of passengers in front of us in a Que, wondering whats happening, we finally saw from distance what's the issue, its security checking passengers just as when boarding!!! I couldn't believe my eyes. We just landed and came out of a plane, what possibly could we have bought or manufactured on board a A330 of Singapore airlines? I travel like 6 to 12 times a year on international and domestic flights. Never ever was I required to go through security after landing, just to go again through security at the departure gate (the same terminal). We were delayed like at least 45 minutes till they cleared the 3 A330s and a 777-200 that just landed, I asked why is this check? The officer replied just a random security check! That resulted in loosing our time to go to the duty free and enjoy the airport facilities. Had to run to our gate so we won't miss our flight home. But the airline is definitely A1. The waste of time of passengers in the name of security will cost the Airport it's reputation and the duty free loosing customers like us, we were looking forward to buy few things but our time was consumed by useless unnecessary checks.
label: positive

text: Disappointing experience on Los Angeles --> Singapore --> Delhi Flight I have flown multiple times (using a multitude of airlines) from the US to other destinations around the world. Although quirky, my airline of choice has been Turkish (due to their in flight service, entertainment and the food, which I find above average). I had to make a trip from Los Angeles to Delhi (India) and decided to check out Singapore Airlines as I had heard so much about their food and entertainment. The flying time on this sector is extremely long as the flight (SQ 11) makes a stop at Narita in Tokyo for an hour, before proceeding to Singapore. Let me just say that I was really disappointed - the food was among the worst I have eaten in economy. Bland pasta and hard fish soaked in an unappetizing sauce - really bad! The dessert was just an ice-cream. In contrast Turkish Airline's food in economy is just fantastic. Great kebabs, chicken, excellent warm rolls, tasty dessert... and the ticket costs less (while the travel time is shorter by many hours). The only saving grace was that I had pre-ordered a Hindu Non-Veg meal on one of the sectors and it was delicious. So I guess the trick is to pre-order a meal if flying via Singapore Airlines. The entertainment was lacking too - most of the 'new releases' were old and tired movies and the selection was very limited. Even Turkish Airlines offers a wide selection of movies (and they really do have 'new releases'). The FAs were great and polite - so no issues on that front. It was odd that they never offered an amenity kit to passengers (which Turkish offers to all). In conclusion, I am glad I tried it once, but would never fly with Singapore Airlines again. I am not sure how people find this airline to be good (and how has it won so many awards) - the only thing I can think of is that people haven't flown with some of the other airlines. And am now dreading the long return trip back to the US (23 hours flying time) with them in a few weeks. Maybe I will just pay for the extra-legroom seat and pre-order my meals.
label: negative

text: Silk Air It was a short flight. But the service was good. Nothing to complain about. Silk Air is quite a small aircraft but for a 55 minutes journey it is okay I guess..
label: positive

text: First Business Class Experience I really enjoyed my first experience in biz class. SQ's is its people. They're always attentive and put lots of care and thoughts to their work. Hope I get invited and win a MYSQUPGRADE again. Food was great. Service was great. Seat was great. Everything was great.
label: positive

text: Disappointing business class The lounge in Changi was chaotic and packed out, we had to climb over people and luggage at the entry and it was hard to find a seat when we did it was cramped in with a family of 4 and only one of us could get a snack in fear of losing our spot. Champagne selection was excellent though. Boarding was prompt and easy. The service on board was good, the flight attendants were professional, however being a red eye we felt like we missed out on some perks of flying business. It was midnight by the time we took off and they didn’t have a chocolate or any snacks whatsoever to have before we went to sleep, only nuts on offer. Breakfast was abysmal and on the verge of inedible so we didn’t get to have an impressive in flight dining experience. The seat/bed was hard, pillow very small and for an 8 hour flight, we just expected more. We had a better experience on Silk Air tbh and wish we had of chosen a different carrier to fly with in business for over $6000.
label: neutral

text: The best airline The best airline. The Service, food, comfort you name it. I never use any other airline when I fly to whereever this airline flies. I travel alone and feel safe. Their airport is a vacation in itself. Orchids everywhere. The economy class didn't even feel like ECONOMY.
label: positive

text: Comfortable Seats and Friendly Staff This was one of the most comfortable flight I have experienced. My only regret was that it was relatively short, one of my next flights which was much longer was with Malaysia Airlines and that was atrocious. Thoroughly recommend Singapore Airlines, top class service
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines On time departure, good food and a great aircraft flying from Dhaka to Singapore. Transit at Singapore was a great experience and it was a great time pass. Flying from Singapore to Melbourne on the A380 was a new experience for my family (which included my wife, my son and daughter) and myself and it was a quiet cabin all the way into Melbourne. Overall Singapore Airlines is a great airline to fly with and the experience leaves you wanting for more.
label: positive

text: Baggage claim I’m very disappointed about my flight last night SQ 968 SIN-CGK 06 october 2019, because my baggage still at SG. After i’m arrived at CGK arround 11 PM and still process my complaint to Jakarta Airport Service. Can you imagine how tired i am... FYI all SQ ground staff is already go home.. big applause for your service.. is this your services to passengers who choosing SQ as full services airlines?? Definitely i’m not choosing your airlines for my next holiday... big surprise for me with your service but still have been rewarded by skytrax. Please improved this service if you want to be best airlines in world..
label: negative

text: Krisflyer program Please beware of this, they have absolutely no incentive to keep you on your present Krisflyer status, even if you have not even accrued more needed miles in previous years to re-qualify you for the same status. If you do go above and beyond what is needed, would recommend you fly with other airlines as you may get better treatment.
label: negative

text: Great service but.... We flew from Adelaide to Rome, Paris to Adelaide and felt that the service was great. For some reason, Singapore Airlines don't have Premium Economy on the Adelaide-Singapore (and return) leg of our journey so that remains a disappointment. The Premium Economy legs were so much more comfortable and have spoilt us for travelling Economy for the long hauls, if we can ever afford the extra expense again. The food, drinks and service were great, as in a previous trip, but the IT side of the airline really needs some serious work as we had a ridiculous amount of trouble with the website time and again. So much so, that both times we've travelled to Europe we had to spend ages on the phone while we were overseas trying to sort out an issue. We really enjoyed the service and personnel, but both times we travelled the website was painful and resulted in phone calls instead. The difficulty we've experienced with the website for checking in, securing seats, payments etc, would be the only thing that would cause us to look at another carrier.
label: positive

text: Despicable behaviour to loyal customers Are you considering Krisflyer as a Star Alliance loyalty programme? Forget it! As a Krisflyer gold member for the past few years I haven't redeemed many flights through Singapore Airlines because they make the process so complicated and tedious. Since they are gradually introducing other Star Alliance airlines to their online redemption searches - about 10 years behind other leading airlines - I decided to book a reward flight on SAS from Copenhagen to Oslo. The flight cost 12,000 miles plus US$25. But, since I can no longer travel during this period, I gave advanced notice and attempted to cancel the booking online. Over one week later I get an SMS saying that I need to call them, only to discover that I must pay a US$75 fee to cancel the flight. The only explanation is that it was in the terms and conditions. I have a Oneworld Emerald and Skyteam account with other airlines, and neither of the airlines through which I have redeemed flights in the past charge such ridiculous and unexplained fees. In fact, the entire process is automated and refunds are processed promptly, sometimes immediately. How Singapore Airlines seeks to penalise loyal members for its own outdated practices and systems is unreal. It's a complete disgrace. A single attempt to cancel a reward flight that ends up costing you 30 minutes on the phone to Singapore and US$75. That's loyalty punished right there! I plan to draw down my Krisflyer account and cease flying them altogether. I'll look into a better Star Alliance airline programme and suggest you do the same. Dreadful customer service both in flight and on the ground. Fed up of it. No more!
label: negative

text: Cabin service and comfort We fly SQ business class every where now and find the service from check in to getting off a pleasure. The cabin staff actually welcome you with genuine smile and appear to want to serve you. Very different to another airline I flew recently. The seats are very comfortable and very wide. Crew are happy to make your seat into bed upon request. Food is very good. We normally book the cook. Wife was very impressed with lamb curry etc. Another quality about the crew is that they address you with your name. My sons, his wife, my grand daughter of 3 years, plus us two are flying to Singapore and Bangkok in business class. So you see we will happily ecomend SQ to anyone
label: positive

text: Flight experience Flight departed and arrived on time, kudos to punctuality! Slight disappointment in the in flight entertainment but matter has already been picked up by Singapore airlines.
label: positive

text: A380 Singapore Airline (SQ) type A380, famous airline of Singapore Airline, this is a fantastic airline model, amazing interior double decker design, upper level for first class/business class ... Bigger seat, more leg space, good tv monitor, nice toilet ...
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines the airline above all others The staff were excellent on this flight. Very attentive and could not do enough for you. Prompt on boarding and off. in flight entertainment excellent. Great seat sizes and comfort.
label: positive

text: Almost perfect I have enjoyed their services over the years, and took this for the CNY festival. Service, food, entertainment, seat etc were good. Took the A380 plane which is going to be discontinued! The one blight is probable food poisoning with nausea. Later, another passenger also had the same issue and required medical attention. There was a commotion due to the emergency.
label: positive

text: one of my fav airlines i flew to singapore on my last trip with Singapore Airlines because of flight promotion. The SQ services is great. The schedule is on time too. in flight meal was great too
label: positive

text: Great flight It was a great flight back home. Been on the road for 2 weeks and i was more than ready to go home. The crew on this flight was attentive and friendly. I was surprised they'd address me by name which is amazing considering that there are several hundred people on board. The Business class seat and service is impeccable. As much as possible, Singapore Airlines is my preferred airline. A great way to fly indeed! Keep up the good work!
label: positive

text: They used to be the best, but not any more! Due to Covid, my husband and I have been in separate countries for the last 7 months, him in Cambodia me in Vietnam. My husband was due to fly from Phnom Pneh to LA this weekwhere I would meet him and we would then travel on to Mexico, but because of the ineptitude and attitudes of ground staff at PP this has not happened. We have been in constant contact with the airline since then requesting a refund - they refused him a boarding pass, saying because he travels on a UK passport then he is not allowed entry into the US. This is totally wrong, he only cannot travel to US if he has been in UK in the last 14 days (remember, he's been in Cambodia for the last 7 months). Yesterday I got that in writing from the US embassy in PP. I won't got into the attitude given - that's for another time and place. Back to the refund - they either want to charge us a cancellation fee, or we have to wait until they 'conduct a full investigation' before they will 'consider' issuing a full refund. This is not acceptable treatment from a 5 star airline, and far from what we would expect from Singapore Air
label: negative

text: seats close together & terrible food On all flights London to Singapore + Singapore - Bali, then return, the seats are so close together that it is impossible to watch the TV screen as it is too close to your eyes. There is littel leg room too. The food is the worst I have had for a long time. Singapore Airlines used to be the best but now it it is as if they do not need to bother trying to be good because as long as their prices is the same as others why should they waste money provinding a better service. I will use Emirates next time - but they are not really much better!
label: negative

text: Direct contrast to same class on Air New Zealand We were required to do this flight on a code share basis. In direct contrast to Air NZ (which was great). The seats were small and uncomfortable. Granted there was reasonable stretch out legroom, the technology was dated(we had a reading light on a stalk) and personally i will try and avoid code share flights with this airline. i was very disappointed. Additionally the food was terrible. It was plasticky, overcooked and tasteless. I know people say on board food is generally awful, but in
label: neutral

text: Excellent Service We booked several Singapore award business class flights for regional travel around SE Asia in the fall of 2018. The process of booking award flights was easy and straight forward. Unlike USA legacy carriers and some other alliances, seats were available and released for awards, even for two people. This leg was DPS (Bali) to CNX (Chiang Mai). Excellent service and comfort on A330 and B737. Excellent air crews and attentive service. Slightly disappointed with the Silver Lounge in Changi Airport T-2, with it's dark interior, but it's a minor gripe as we always enjoy the lounges especially as compared to other airlines/alliances. We will continue to book award flights on Singapore Air, the product is very good and consistent.
label: positive

text: Singapore are the best Singapore are the best airline for our family to travel. Comfortable and Changi airport is the best in the world!
label: positive

text: Polite crews! PAL was delayed and we were offered a seat in Singapore airline. The crew were very polite and helpful. Superb customer service!
label: positive

text: Poor lounge.. Prêt à manger has better layout Dear Singapore Airlines, I was looking forward to become a Gold Member (as my company only allows me to fly economy and premium economy) and it’s the highest I can get... I have to say that I’m VERY disappointed with the lounge you offer us. Crap layout, unattractive work space and confortable seatings.. I was a Gold and Platinum member (yes even on economy i could get to Platinum) on Cathay Pacific before moving here and the comparison of lounges aren’t even close by 10001 miles ! Even regular passenger have better seat option within the airport. Simply go check in front of Wolfgang Puck restaurant where I when after experiencing this cheap offer of a lounge. (Don’t get me started of drinks and food offer) PLEASE I BEG YOU ! Make improvements. At the very least a few decent working space and comfortable chairs. Sincerely... Disappointed
label: negative

text: A350's don't live up to the hype The seats are really cramped and in no way better than the earlier 777's. Food was very ordinary, The very same vegetarian for the last 20 years !!
label: positive

text: Superb luggage clearance at Inchon Airport Recently i took SQ 602 to Seoul on 06 Sept 2018,really had a good flight. I am by surprised that at Inchon Airport my luggages were already waiting for us. The immigration was superb. Keep it up SQ
label: positive

text: Excellent service Singapore airlines is a very polished airline up there with best. The female staff are dressed beautifully in their original uniforms, from when I remember from the 1980’s. They are polite and attentive. Just one hiccup was check in at Delhi airport. There was a quite a long queue, suddenly a staff member, stopped us where we were in the queue and told us we could go to another check in point to ease the congestion. Of course we were at the front and all the people behind us hurriedly marched along and got there in front of us! Hmmm,, disadvantaged, seeing as we were up the front originally. Then a woman in front of us was with her two young sons, held us all up for up to 40 minutes as she decided to upgrade to business while checking in. We were furious and called the manager, she wasn’t too apologetic about it. Only explained the reason, which we guessed anyway.
label: positive

text: Very professional and efficient staff; clean and tidy plane; prompt and timely. Very happy with all aspects of the flight - will definitely fly Singapore Airlines again. A lot more comfortable than expected in Economy. I am 185cm tall, and had plenty of room for my legs and elbows. The food was fine - much better than on many other airlines that I have experienced.
label: positive

text: San Francisco to Singapore. My wife and I were planning a vacation to SE Asia, so I bought round-trip tickets between San Francisco and Singapore on the Singapore Airlines web site. The next day I was looking for tickets to Siem Reap for a side trip to Angkor Wat when I discovered on Travelocity that Silk Air had the best flights, and that Silk Air was a part of Singapore Airlines. Singapore Airlines website did not make this clear at all. So I called Singapore Airlines to add these Silk Air flights to my booking. Imagine my surprise and disbelief when I was told I had to pay a $500 penalty because this ‘change’ came two hours after their 24 hour change deadline. I talked to two of their supervisors, but they also insisted on this penalty. It did not matter that Silk Air was hidden deep within Singapore Airlines website. It did not matter that I was adding Singapore Airline flights to my itinerary. It did not matter that I was only 2 hours past their 24 hour ‘deadline’ Since my Singapore Airlines flights were non-refundable I had no choice but to pay the $500 penalty. Just booking the Silk Air flights separately would have cost me an extra $690. In a situation that clearly called for a little flexibility and compromise Singapore Airlines showed none. For that reason they have earned my lowest rating.
label: negative

text: Great airline I love flying Singapore Air! Service is always so good and the flights are always smooth and on time. Connecting flights are also seamless. However, I recently flew their segment with a technical stop in Canberra and I was confused why they needed to have all the passengers leave the plane just to set down or pick up more passengers. They should have explained the reason for the stop. It seemed like it was more than just to pick up passengers. Still, the remaining flight was top quality! Love it 💕
label: positive

text: Cramped for a long haul trip The service was excellent but there is no room in the economy area very cramped for a long haul trip. I have had more space Jet 2 and Easy Jet than i had with Signapore airline. As i said serive cannot fault. Would not use again for long haul.
label: neutral

text: On time, comfortable, value Great flight on SQ231 from Singapore to Sydney. Late night departure (0045) left on time. No hassle boarding. Flight was in an A380 which was comfortable and super quiet. Normal brilliant Singapore Airlines service. Managed 5+ hrs sleep. Arrived in Sydney refreshed. Big recommend.
label: positive

text: Hong Kong to Singapore Premium Economy on this airline is second to none for the service and food. Attendants were pleasant and helpful
label: positive

text: SQ978 from Singapore to Bangkok. Flight arrived 10 minutes ahead of schedule on 13 June 2015, flight attendant was polite and friendly. I ordered the seafood meal and it was delicious. On 19 June 2015 on the way back from Bangkok seafood meal was good and very tasty. It was my fathers birthday and the cabin crew helped to it a special flight and to surprise my dad. In-flight entertainment offered lots of movies. The cabin crew on SQ978 offered top ups of my tomato juice without me having to ask. Economy seat is clean and new.
label: positive

text: Experience wasn't nearly as good as the reviews. This airline consistently rates as one of the best in the world, but this route seems to be a red headed stepchild because there wasn't much to cheer about. --The food was fairly poor by Business standards. (better artisan breads would have saved a mediocre take-off meal) --The furniture is outdated and needs a re-do. The cabin's lie-flat beds seemed like they were from the first generation of true lie flats. You have to manually turn the back down and the average person would have a hard time putting it back up. I saw flight attendants put their full body weight on the bed to release the lock. They were actually pretty good for sleeping, but there was no opening for leg room directly in front of you to stretch your legs while sitting upright. You have to turn cock-eyed diagonal in your seat to put your feet up and twist forward to face the tv screen. --Check-in and customer service is very good and I could see here how they really shine in other "more important" locations. The business class lounge in Changi airport is really, really good. Really. It should be the standard for most of the other big airline lounges. Hope they fix it.
label: neutral

text: Awesome Airline SQ are my first preference whenever I fly... and I fly a lot, never have any issues and can’t beat the service. I must admit though the A380’s are much more comfortable than the 777’s. Keep up the good work 🇦🇺🇦🇺🇦🇺🇦🇺
label: positive

text: Excellent as usual from this carrier! First class service all round and up to the standard we expect from Singapore Airlines. As we also required wheelchair assist this made our long trip much more comfortable
label: positive

text: Enjoyable experience I am please to say flying to Mumbai was a pleasant experience. The flight left on time ,which is always what you want ,however more important when you only have around fifty minutes to change to a connecting flight in Singapore. The check in staff ,on flight were efficient and friendly . 5he food was very good as was in flight entertainment. Definitely would be my first option flying that way again. By the way the price was very competitive.
label: positive

text: Flew Singapore Airlines from Singapore to Auckland. Disappointed firstly we were only given one glass of champagne, not duplicates as advertised. Secondly we chose meals via Book the Chef and we had finished our meals before we were offered wine and then only a small glass supplied. We were offered no snacks and the curtain was drawn very quickly and passengers were quickly sent to the rear of the aircraft if they entered the curtain wall. This was in complete contrast to the flight from London to Singapore which was superb. We were offered champagne top up and crew could not be more helpful. Hope it improves on the return!
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines It was a really good Holliday and I was scary of the company I take for traveling but I really enjoy the fly . Thanks Singapore airlines !!!!
label: positive

text: London to Bali via Singapore. Having not travelled overseas for sometime due to the pandemic, I eventually got back to flying in April/May 2022 and it was so nice as I had normally taken a flight on average 20+ times a year prior to the pandemic. Check in was quick and polite checking my PCR result for entry to Bali security was quick and the Singapore Airlines lounge at Heathrow was okay. Boarding was more or less on time the seat as normal on SQ comfortable for the 12 hours flight. The crew where all pretty nice although I sensed perhaps not the normal expected on SQ, the food service was just okay good enough but again not really SQ standard that said the flight was fine. Arrival in Singapore on time I headed to the lounge to wait my connecting flight which was packed with little seating although I managed a shower. SIN-DPS was on the newer 787-10 which I really enjoyed nice crew food okay. I returned DPS-SIN in economy class again on the 787-10 and I was impressed great aircraft nice crew and the economy food box just fine for a 2 hour flight, I obviously like SQ and will continue to use hopefully service will improve as things return to normal
label: positive

text: ADL-SIN-DME / LHR-SIN-ADL. Four legs with SQ for this trip to Europe. Seems that catering has improved since my last trip in April. All aircraft (330 777-300 & 380) were comfortable and clean. Ground staff and crew were friendly and IFE was excellent. Still offering the best product for international travel by far.
label: positive

text: Perfect every time! Rated best airline in the world and rightly so. From punctuality, safety to brilliant service. I would fly SA above any other in the world. Book the cook just brilliant!
label: positive

text: So Elegant! Fourth time doing the JNB to Singapore return flight, this time with full party of 6. Just love this airline! Everything about their service is graceful and stylish. The overnight flight between cities really helps and makes the trip seem shorter. Even economy is better than a lot of their competitors. Do make use of the seating selection prior to flights.
label: positive

text: Non-stop to Singapore Even though we were a little hesitant about taking an 18 hour, non-stop flight to Singapore it turned out to be ok. The flight attendants were very kind & friendly, always making sure that we were comfortable. The Premium Economy seats were comfortable, there was a great selection of movies & shows. We were able to sleep. The time went by pretty quickly. I would highly recommend Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: SMOOTH TRIP Always enjoyed taking a flight, even it is a short flight, with good service, food and smooth flight. And of course, smiles. Keep it up!
label: positive

text: Quality decline Slow poor service - waited 10 minutes for surly female attendant to respond to call, had to argue to get a drink before meal service, appalling food, uncomfortable seat, cabin freezing even with 2 blankets on! Very limited drinks - no diet alternatives. Will not fly Singapore airlines again. Sad because they used to be very good, how they have declined!
label: negative

text: Consistently good It has been a number of years since I last flew Singapore and the standard is still there. On a A380 so it was quiet as you would expect. The key elements of the flights were: 1. Staff were friendly and helpful 2. Seats were comfortable and a good size - slightly larger with more leg space. 3. Food was enjoyable and catered for both Asians and western. 4. Beverage - the wine list left a bit to be desired, they could improve here. Others such as Bloody Mary's etc were good. 5. Movies - there was an extensive list to chose from, however I felt they could have been better with a few more up to-date one. Also the TV shows were limited. 6. Comfort and safety - cabin was good temperature and the flight was good plus on time. Overall I was happy with the service of Singapore and will fly again with them.
label: positive

text: Only just OK flight We have flown with Singapore Airlines several times and in the past I have been happy with the service. However this flight was not as good as the past. The newer aircraft have squeezed in more seats which makes the economy section just plain uncomfortable for the long flight. Also the seating is designed for six foot males and I am an average sized female and my feet could not touch the floor if sitting up straight in my seat. Not sure how the shorter Asian customers manage. There was a "footrest" in the back of the seat in front of me, but my feet couldn't even reach it. Not much point having it really. Over it wasn't too bad and the time between flights from Melbourne to Singapore, then the second flight to DaNang was about two hours, but on the way home - 7HRS IN SINGAPORE!!! Just too long so well be wary of that next time. There are free city trips for long stopovers, but we were just too late to make one of them. We were able to watch a free movie while waiting and someone told us there was a swimming pool available somewhere in one of the terminals. The quality of the food has definitely gone downhill. My food was just OK. Not what I have come to expect from past experiences. The staff were fine, no complaints, but the edge has gone off the friendly there too I feel.
label: positive

text: Flying can be so annoying I have found this airline to be the most comfortable. personal TV with more leg space. Ozzy planes seem to be so crampt. The service on Singapore airlines is unbeatable. I feel every flying country should take a lesson from Asain hospiality.
label: positive

text: Pleasure Flight Have not flown with Singapore Airlines for a period of times. However, this time I flown with them again for a business trip to Singapore. But they (Singapore Airlines) did not disappoint me one bit. No wonder they still hold one of the best airlines in the world. The cabin facilities are clean, well equipped and still look fairly new for an A380 plane. Entertainment system has great variieties to choose from with headphone are given to keep. Cabin staff service are great and treated everyone with polite manner and respect. Most of the people on the flight seem to be enjoying themselves, no one seem to be cranky (which usually the case on a flight) or in a hurry to get off. Witnessed Singapore’s Air Stewardess handle a crying baby with patience and professionally, as I was seated closed by. Would definitely fly with Singapore Airlines again in the near future. Highly recommended airline.
label: positive

text: Amsterdam to Brisbane via Singapore. AMS to SIN was in premium economy on an A350. The SIN to BNE sector was in standard economy on a Boeing 777. At this stage, Singapore Airlines doesn't offer premium economy to Brisbane. These two experiences were extremely different. In Premium, I paid a little extra to sit in the front row. I was able to extend my legs fully and adopt different seating positions. It was relatively comfortable. IFE was excellent. The large screen, extensive selection and quality headphones made the flight pleasant. Food was nice and the cabin crew were really professional. Changing in Singapore to standard economy - the seat was obviously narrower and my knees touched the seat in front. I could only adopt one sardine like position in my seat. All in all, it was quite uncomfortable for me. The food and service were efficient. The tiny screen was hard to see, having to often adjust the angle and on the 777, the selection was less than on the A350. In my opinion, there is a very distinct difference between standard and premium economy and I think the extra cost if well worth it.
label: positive

text: i cannot believe the service provided first I cannot pre assign my seat till online check in, so 48 hours before , I log in my booking and try to get a window or aisle seat but only had middle seat left to pick. so I had to paid extra for the return flight to avoid middle seat again. on the day of travel, I run to airport to catch my flight, so I don't have my lunch, so very expected the meal delivery.. since I seated in the middle , I had ready my table and looking forward for my meal, but they can forgot to pass it to me , both next to me had meal, just only me... I cannot believe it. when my neighbour inform the crew , she even no apology to me. what is the 5 stars they get from ? I believe only from Business or First class passenger.. I won't take SQ again , which was very bad experience for few times already this year .
label: negative

text: Not that impressive anymore My last SQ flight was about 10 years ago, it was the default airline of my previous company whenever we have business trips to SG. I remember being very impressed with the amenities then. So when I worked for a different company, the default airline became PAL mostly, and for personal flights I’d choose CebuPac. So a couple of months ago, I had a biz trip to Malaysia and I was tasked to book for my own flight. so I booked SQ. Sadly, it wasn’t that impressive anymore- from the flight crews, the cabine ambiance, the amenities, they are just comparable to any other economy flights now. In the flight back, the plane was just half full! Many passengers had the row only to themselves! The verdict- the airfare of SQ (which is more expensive than most airlines) is not worth it for me (to think that the company even paid for this trip!).
label: neutral

text: Sad Paid 3,000 for premium economy.the flight attendants look beautiful. That’s because they don’t do anything. Never again. So disappointed. No service. Don’t pick up trash. You get one bottle of water for a 17 hour flight. Food was awful. Looked like economy. Why would I pay for upgrade??? Dirty. No tooth brush. You might find one in the economy bathroom when flight first starts otherwise forget it. Seats are uncomfortable. You ask a question, they don’t have an answer. Fly another airline. Heard so much about this airline. So disappointed!
label: negative

text: non-existent customer service We flew coach class from SFO to Bangkok in November 2021. We found that Singapore Airlines was not the airline of old. It used to be the best airline in Asia. No more. The seating was cramped, not China Air cramped, but certainly not on par with other competitor airlines such as ANA, and certainly no better than EVA or Cathay Pacific. Their customer service was non-existent. They canceled our connecting flight on their subsidiary airline, Scoot, booked through Singapore Air, from Phuket to Singapore on the return leg. We were notified by email just 16 days before the scheduled flight. We were informed that we had to now fly out of Bangkok to Singapore, not Phuket, and we had to re-book through Singapore Air, not Scoot, and had to telephone a customer service agent to do so. This meant a total revision of our itinerary and losing the non-refundable tickets we had already purchased for flights in Thailand. We spent a total of 4 hours on hold attempting, without success, to reach an agent. We called both the Bangkok and Singapore offices to no avail. We even had a travel agent call for us on the agent's line. She gave up after 1/2 hour on hold. We tried email. They told us they would get back to us in 7-14 days! We had gone to both the Phuket and Bangkok airport Singapore Air offices but both were closed, seemingly permanently. We gave up and flew ANA home. They answer their phones. When we returned we found that all they would refund were the taxes. Sent a letter by post to the corporate headquarters. One month later no response, not even an acknowledgment of receipt.
label: negative

text: world class airlines just the best not just in terms of plane but service, entertainment, and overall experience. SIA is the best.
label: positive

text: Good service Very good service, they actually came straight away when call button pressed and then brought drinks quickly with a smile. Adequate room in Economy onA380. On time. Only thing that let it down was what we considered to be a very poor selection of in flight movies.
label: positive

text: 23 Dec 2013 SQ638 seated row 73. Singapore to Tokyo - red eye flight was bumpy and hard to sleep. At row 73 we could hear the noise of toilet flushing which made it harder to sleep. Cabin service included snack and drink after take off and breakfast 2 hrs before landing were excellent. 31 Dec 2013 SQ 637 seated row 79. Tokyo to Singapore - Full flight food delicious and service even other airlines talked about. Cabin crew smiled all the time.
label: positive

text: Worthy Winners of World's Best Airline Amazing service, top-of-the-line cabin crew hospitality that needs to be experienced to be believed. Even during the busiest periods, every move by each staff member is as graceful and warm as the Singapore summer. Cabin comfort is quite standard, as well as the entertainment and culinary options, though the service is a true benchmark to industry standards.
label: positive

text: Expected better with their reputation All our research told us what a fantastic airline this was, so, maybe my expectations were “ too high” . As we were premium economy, we were encourage to “ Book The Cook”. These dishes were supposed to have been tried, tested and adapted for “ tastebuds in the Sky”. I honestly could not taste the difference between this food and other dishes we had been served in Premium Econy on other airlines. Quite a few customers in premium economy suffered Seat malfunctions, ie, seat would not recline and footrest would not retract back under the seat. Have to say, the aircrew lived up to their reputtation, even if we did have to ask for a second glass of wine rather than being offered - again, as in other airlines in premium economy. Have also have to point out that the seatbelts on this aircraft were THE most uncomfortable belts I have ever experienced. They were very large, heavy and cumbersome. Seriously suggest these be reconsidered.
label: neutral

text: Easy, comfort, good service A350 seat is not optimum for premium economy A380 or 777-300 much better as leg room is unhindered. Boarding, Service, food, drinks, room all good- hard to go back to economy class.
label: positive

text: Five star flying Once again, we chose Singapore Airlines to fly us to Italy via a stopover in Singapore itself. We flew Premium Economy for the extra room (I am 192 cms tall) and comfort of their better seats for the combined 20 hour journey. Once again, we couldn't fault the quality of the aircraft, the cabin crew and the in-flight service. They are certainly one of the best airlines in the world, in our opinion, without being any more expensive than other airlines on the same route. We wholeheartedly recommend Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text: Never Again Received a bottle of water at the start of the 16hr flight, and finally had to walk to the back of the plane to ask for another bottle of water, this after about 7 hrs. Food? One meal at the start of the flight, and as i sit here writing this 11 hrs into the flight, no more food, i.e. meals or snacks. Oh, no stewardesses either. I get better service on a 1 hr flight on southwest!
label: negative

text: SGN-SIN-SYD on 9th January 2014. First leg on B770-200. Excellent and proactive ambitious and diligent staff whether old or young. Seats not lie flat but no need for a two hours ride. Lounge access food and drinks very good. 3-4 options for hot food given! The Bollinger champagne is now replaced. No cheese table could be offered. No wifi available. SIN-SYD on A380-800. The cabins provide some privacy. Beds are flat but not fully horizontal a small angle of 3-4% remains disturb sleeping and annoys. The TV screens are heavily light reflecting and are more mirrors than TVs – what a disaster as compared to the investment. The tray tables are in a funny skew position forcing the gourmand to lean sideways while eating. Disappointed by this seat furthermore its hard to operate. Food is excellent and options are plenty. No cheese table offered. No wifi available. FAs were kind caring and attentive. SQ is the only airline serving stout beer - quite charming. Wines are good and food is good as well.
label: positive

text: Inflight service seems different The usual inflight meal service as expected from SQ. But it seems that now that do not serve the hot drink (Coffee / tea) separately from the main meal. It everything together, It used to be after the main meal is served and packed, they will go another round to ask if you needed hot beverages. Also this flight no not offer ice cream tub, what I had was just a pudding. Nevertheless, the inflight food for SQ is still nicer compare to other airlines.
label: positive

text: Another great flight from Singapore to London. Me and my wife were sat in the upper economy deck which was great! The seats were really comfortable and the service was just as good as my last trip. The food was really good and a great selection of films. I’m so glad I’ve booked with Singapore Airlines for my next long haul trip.
label: positive

text: Would like to shout out a special Thanks to Caitlyn, air hostess who assisted us in flight SQ494 from Singapore to Dubai. My 4 year old son fell sick during the flight and the team mainly Caitlyn ensured to give us the assistance needed, including getting children's paracetemol which calmed his fever down within the 7 hours. Thanks a lot.
label: positive

text: Jakarta to Singapore. I asked for a Vegetarian meal, but they gave us seafood instead. The fish is covered by pasta so we didn’t notice until my wife took a bite. Complain to one of the flight attendants, they said sorry, which to me isn’t enough. This is the 2nd time happens to me, not happy. Shouldn’t trust SQ that much.
label: negative

text: Expectations Exceeded My wife and I recently resumed our regular trips from the USA to the Philippines post pandemic. We decided to try Singapore airlines and flew aboard the famous SQ21 flight Newark to Singapore just shy of 19 hours, touted as the world's longest regularly scheduled flight! As an aviation buff I was stoked to experience this long flight, having flown 16.5 hours I figured what's a couple more hours. First of all, there is no economy class on these flights. It's a premium economy and in price comparable to what the competition is charging for economy. That being said, the seats were so much more comfortable, larger, more room, exceptional leg room and the premium economy cabin is in a 2X4X2 configuration. Traveling as a couple my wife and I enjoyed a two seat row to ourselves, which was awesome not having to disturb a stranger to get up mid flight to use the lavatory or stretch your legs. If you travel solo they offer phenomenal single seats that come with extra inflight storage. There is an additional nominal fee for these seats if I'm not mistaken but well worth the money for a long flight like this if you're traveling alone. The food was very good for airline food. You have two options, choose from the inflight menu or log in to the website preflight and choose the "book the cook" option which not only gives you a choice of gourmet meals but you'll get your meal first! So take advantage of this if you fly with Singapore airlines. The Singapore airlines cabin crews are second to none! The service was exceptional, they are so well trained, so friendly, attentive and professional, we can't say enough good about them! The Aircraft itself was an Airbus A350-900 in the ULR configuration. " Ultra Long Range". It was a beautiful airplane inside and out. I was an aviation buff was able to appreciate the design and sound and feel of it's very powerful and reliable engines. I was very very pleased with the whole experience. This was just one of 6 flights we recently flew to and from the Philippines from Newark NJ/NY 4 of which were with Singapore airlines. I've flown aboard their competition and I can tell you Singapore airlines is the best in my opinion for long haul service US to Asia. We will be flying with them again next year for sure without question. Thank you again Singapore Airlines for the great and memorable flights we really enjoyed them! ✈️
label: positive

text: The airline refuses to refund my ticket for May 2022. The request to instead rebook my ticket if a refund is not possible was also never replied to. I had contacted the airlines on april 20th via their portal and have not received any answer until now. I had also called their customer service last week and had to wait 1 hour until someone picked up. The person that picked up was not helpful at all, putting me on hold for at least another 20 minutes in total. In the end my request to refund the ticket into credits or money or at least rebook the ticket in the same class for another date was not fulfilled. I was told I could expect another call from a manager in the same week which did not happen.
label: negative

text: great service and easy great service and friendly staff. no request too hard or inconvenient. boarding easy and in organised manner -no delays
label: positive

text: Comfortable flight even in Economy Seats of Singapore Airline planes have more leg and width space then other carriers that I have tried. I like that they have individual entertainment screens with lots of choices to view. Crew are all very helpful and friendly with big smiles on their faces always that made me feel relaxed. They deal with both the passengers and their follow crew with courtesy and with the attitude of willingness to serve.
label: positive

text: Excellent Have just written a review for the Heathrow Singapore leg as I was not impressed . However to be fair this leg was excellent . Clean, modern everything worked . Only set back it left from Terminal one . No lounge to have a quick shower after the London flight. Part of why one flies business.
label: positive

text: Bangkok to Singapore was the biggest let down. Okay food but they ran out of certain dishes during the first service run. Service on this flight was understandably rushed due to its 2-hours duration. But it was also terrible. I ordered post-meal drink and notes were taken but they forgot about me. I requested the drink again, but was told too late the bar is closed. We pay premium for business class partly to enjoy the amenities including F&B. Running out of certain dishes and forgetting to serve a drink renders this as a wasted expense and for that we currently do not recommend this airline.
label: negative

text: World’s best airline What can be said about the world’s best airline! The planes are clean, staff are very friendly and helpful, the food is good (for plane food), and the entertainment is good. I have travelled on other airlines, but this airline always get# a 10/10
label: positive

text: Great long haul experience Probably best premium economy flight we have taken. Flight our from Manchester on A350 was best leg going out. Service was very good and extra leg room was really appreciated
label: positive

text: Pleasant red eye flight Wonderful to be flying in SQ, this time to Christchurch. We were the first to board the Boeing 777-200ER. Seats were in 1-2-1 configuration with aisle access to every passenger in business class. The food, as expected, was amazing; keeping in mind that we are in a pressurised cabin 30,000ft up in the air and our taste buds go nuts. Seats were comfortable; better than the 2007 business class version. Lots of thoughtful storage spaces. Managed to get 5 hours of sleep in the flat "bed".
label: positive

text: A good airline with great service I actually booked my ticket through Scandinavian Airlines (SAS) but the whole trip was operated by Singapore Airlines. This carrier comes with a very high reputation and it is deserved. The cabin staff go out of their way to make the journey pleasant. The planes are well maintained and cleaned and the seating is excellent. The beds require a fairly simple action of folding the seat back down and rolling out the bedding. This gives a better bed than the fully reclining seat. My schedule meant that i had a journey of breakfasts. More thought could be given to those passengers, like myself, who were making an almost 24 hour trip. We arrived in Brisbane at 7.30pm. I had eaten nothing since the breakfast i received 6 hours earlier. Better food service would have gained the fifth star.
label: positive

text: This was a very bad experience, as the service quality of Singapore Airlines has noticeably declined. I couldn't understand why the flight was delayed for 40 minutes due to late passengers. While Singapore Airlines uses environmentally friendly cutlery on its short-haul flights the quantity of food served has been reduced. The unbearable thing for me was that I am a Gold member of Star Alliance, but on arrival to Denpasar I had to wait for 50 minutes for the priority baggage of this flight. The plane arrived at the gate at 21:07, but it was already 22:00 when I got my luggage. Finally, although the entertainment system interface was very nice, there were not many good movies and music options for me.
label: negative

text: Fabulous Every Time Flying can be a very uncomfortable experience but Singapore airlines have changed all that. Their attention to detail, service, comfort and dining experience was exceptional. This long haul flight is a killer usually but travelling Singapore Airlines, and yes I am lucky to be able to afford to fly first class, is like being in heaven. I don't want to sleep the in flight entertainment and service is just so good ! Caviar, Dom Perignon Champagne, (or would you rather Krug) is flowing followed by fine dining all the way. When I finally sleep my bed is made up and the size and comfort of this flat bed experience is so comfortable I'm asleep before I know it. The sleep attire is comfortable and cosy as well as smart and the bathroom although not as big as some airlines ( you could improve on this Singapore Arlines) are clean and have plenty of Lux toiletries. I'm traveling again next week back to London and cant wait to do it all again ! Highly recommend this delightful spoil with this fabulous Airline.
label: positive

text: The Melbourne to Wellington flight is an early morning flight, arriving in Wellington in the afternoon just in time for most hotel check-ins. The short-haul international flight serves one round of meals with 4 options for mains available. I went for the cheese omelette and it was great. Cabin service was exceptional as usual. However, the aircraft itself is very dated, especially the seats. The seats are in a 2-2-2 configuration, and it's not the best Singapore Airlines Business Class seats. It's okay for the short-haul flight, as they turn into flat-angled beds. There's lots of leg space and decent width. In-flight entertainment technology was dated, but the content is good in terms of library and variety. All in all, it's definitely the best Melbourne-Wellington offering (when compared to narrow-bodied aircrafts of Qantas, Virgin Australia and Air New Zealand), but it's not the best SQ offering.
label: positive

text: Super Flight Excellent flight, very polite friendly stewardesses - paid for extra legroom, which was great - food was good the service very attentive, lots of overhead room, and the 13 hour flight passed away so quickly - boarding & disembarking went without a hitch just smoothly & well oiled - what a difference efficiency makes - very pleasnt journey - highly recommended
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines never fails to deliver on its excellent inflight service. On this 16 hour flight, I booked the cook for the two meals - baked lobster for the first meal and chicken briyani for the second. Both meals were really delicious . The movie selection was extensive. I watched the latest Mission Impossible movie on board after the first meal. I managed to sleep for a continuous period of 6 hours before waking up for the second meal. Free wifi was available throughout the flight and was of decent speed. Cabin crew were very helpful and helped to convert the seat to bed mode for sleeping. A special shout-out to LS Jim for his personal care and service.
label: positive

text: MEL-SIN Business in December. I was surprisingly disappointed on this trip aboard their 777-300ER aircraft. Granted the newer Business class was not yet installed but overall I wasn't all that impressed with the quality of the seat which looked rather tired. The lounge in Melbourne is barely comparable to a domestic Virgin Australia lounge since they have split it into Business/First and had a very poor food and beverage offering. Despite requesting not to be woken for breakfast service during the flight to maximise sleep I was. Not a picky traveler and not a regular Business traveler either but found myself a little disappointed at the offering considering the hype.
label: negative

text: Never again Damaged baggage, Singapore Airlines refused to acknowledge the damage along with there local handler Menzies. Tried leaving messages but there mail box was full. Sent emails, response was to call if no answer then leave message. After multiple email exchanges was advised they will refer to head office. Head office responded with a flat decline and refused to acknowledge the attempts made at contacting them. More than the damage to the luggage the experience of trying to justify to incompetent staff at Menzies and staff at Head Office who don't understand plain requests in English is better left unsaid. When it comes to professionalism and handling customers concerns Singapore Airlines STINKS. NEVER AGAIN. Buy a cheap ticket a crappy experience is expected but with SA it gets a lot worse especially post travel.
label: negative

text: Perth to London flight Apart from having extra legroom and the seats being roomier, the food was no different to what one would have received in Economy class. As I have severe allergies to certain foods, my agent noted this on the booking (and I saw her duly note these allergies)., Unfortunately Singapore Airlines said they had received no mention of this and anyway they could not deal with specific allergies which I find very hard to believe. ((Fortunately I do carry an EpiPen with me at all times, but I always hope thatI will not have to use it!)
label: positive

text: Singapore Premium Economy Our first flight in Premium Economy. It was an excellent experience. The seats were comfortable and commodious and the service was excellent. Highly recommend the experience.
label: positive

text: Los Angeles to Colombo via Singapore business class. Left on Jan 27 2020 from LAX and returned Feb 21 2020. At their website we were told one can pre-book meals called 'book the cook' which was a joke, no none of the cabin crew knew anything about it. We were given a very generic meal which was nothing to rave about. I complained to the crew and they promised I would have my choice on the return flight - that did not happen either. Their website also bragged about free wifi at cruising altitude, I was able to connect for 10 mins ,after which there was no way to connect for free. Same thing happened when I logged -in under my wife's name - the cabin crew was helpless and could not help. I was told to pay to get wifi , which of-course I did not. The cabin crew were fantastic and did their best to make us feel happy but there was only so much they could do. I travelled frequently on Singapore airline about 10 yrs ago and then I switched to another airline through Hong Kong , regrettably I could not book with them due to the Corona scare in China. My seat on the A350 could not be reclined 180 degrees and my feet hit the front seat and I had to curve my body to fit the space. There was a bed of course -the flight attendant had to lower the vertical back section and fold it down to make a bed, but the hardness and the need to curve the spine made it hard to sleep on this 18 hrs from LAX and 15hrs to LAX. Sorry Singapore airlines you are no longer the top 'dog' in the business. I will think twice before going with you again.
label: negative

text: Best Airline I have travelled with major airlines but Singapore Airline has always been my favourite. For the courteous service and pretty much on-time departure and arrival. And Changi is the best airport I been, in term cleanliness, spacious and neat. Highly recommended both Singapore Airline and Singapore Changi Airport!
label: positive

text: Very Disappointed Flight from Perth to Singapore was comfortable even though I am tall, Singapore to Vietnam,(HCMC) was comfortable, HCMC back to Singapore also okay, but the flight from Singapore to Perth was absolutely dreadful. The plane must of been the oldest in their fleet, felt like I was sandwiched between two people, I had a problem reaching down to get my glasses out of my bag and I am not overweight by any means. I was very disappointed with the airline considering its high rating. If and when I ever fly with them again I will be finding out which plane I will be flying on. I was sent a survey but I wish they had of sent me one for the flight from Singapore to Perth
label: neutral

text: A little Disappointed I have alway quite liked Singapoer Airlines so was looking forward to our trip to Europe. The first leg of the trip (Akl - Sin) was in fact code share with Air New Zealand on one of their 787-900 aircraft. This sector was great with Air NZ performing to their normal high standards. Sadly the net leg on Singapore itself was less than acceptable. Premiunm economy on this aircraft was frankly poor. The seatiing was below par for this class of service and the food was very poor. The flight crew were not at all friendly and the service slow . I thought this may have just been a one of but when we returned (6 weeks later) the service, food and comfort was virtually identical. I do not recommend the Premium Economy product from this airline. Its not worth the money.
label: neutral

text: Not what it used it used to be...shame shame Singapore used to be one of the best but has been going more and more down. Tickets are sold a fortune but the food and service are only going down. Luggages upon arrival wasn't there, got it next day, ok can happen, but I have learnt since then that Singapore airlines has actually been bumping luggages every day for a while and passengers each and every day are missing their luggage upon arrival (same thing happened on the same flight to a friend of me 3 weeks later and other 20 passengers, my flight we were about 15 not to have it) This is not acceptable at all Food who used to be good is very average to not good at all now..... I couldn't even eat breakfast last time as it was really bad. And when you want to change ticket, they are trying to force you to pay the highest rate and the rates are insane. I don't like to travel with them anymore...it's really a pity. Speaking to other passengers from other destinations and they told me also they this airline has been going way down and they do not wish to travel anymore with them. See the only thing they want is to make money on the back of the customers..... Get a hold of yourself Singapore Airlines....we are not money machine
label: negative

text: Friendly and helpful staff The staff made our flight amazing and relaxing. We had our 7 month old child with us and the staff made us and him feel so welcome and calm that the 13 hour flight was relatively easy going. The food on board was nice and the entertainment system kept us and our boy entertained
label: positive

text: Excellent airline Very friendly and supportive. I had forgotten some holiday paperwork at airport and the Singapore staff were amazing. The flight itself was the usual excellent standard. Great food and drinks and lovely smiling faces
label: positive

text: Very good experience, but need to improve to be No 1, again. Overall experience was very good. Covid has played hell with the airlines and people's expectations. The Standard of this airline may have slipped a bit.
label: positive

text: Always a pleasure Always a pleasure traveling Singapore airlines. Comfort comes first for us and this airline always delivers it. Delicious food and a lot of options are available to suit families dietary requirements. Good hospitality and the Info/Entertainment system keeps updating every other year I travel in this airline which is a plus. Fresh fruits and other snacks/drinks are available upon requests anytime during the flight, which is very convenient. As we fly long hours of 10 hours and more, we get served two big meals. In-between the meals the movies/music would keep the travelers entertained and won't feel bored. Headphone jackets do not need a converter which is an added advantage. Some flights do come with USB outlets for charging devices and Wifi for an extra fee.
label: positive

text: Business Class Singapore to Perth Booked a J Class flight back from Singapore to Perth using United Airlines MileagePlus points. Didn't need to check in as had done it at Penang. Spent a few hours at The Jewel after especially coming back through Immigration. Went through to the BC Lounge and had a snack. Lounge was quite comfortable although somewhat crowded.
