As the flight was to Australia, final security was at the Departure Gate which gave me a bit of a scare as the Duty Free Lady was late (probably because the gate was changed). She arrived just as final boarding calls were being made. Flight to Perth was uneventful and reasonably enjoyable. Unfortunately the A330 had one of the old seating arrangements and was not a true lie flat but angled so that you continually feel as if you are sliding down to your feet. At times I found I got better comfort by propping my feet up against the back of the shell of the seat in front (being a shell it is independent of the seat so you don't annoy the passenger in front). About time that SQ finished their upgrade of the seats or retired the aircraft. It certainly isn't up to scratch and detracts from the reputation of the airline for quality.
label: positive

text: Excellent once again I have been lucky to fly with Singapore airlines on several occasions. I have also flown with other big name airlines to similar destinations and quite simply Singapore is easily the best. This flight 13 hours from the UK to Singapore was unfortunately delayed about 3 hours. We were given a £15 voucher to spend in the departure lounge during our delay. Not great I know but last year we’re suffered the same fate with a different big name airline but received nothing. The flight itself was as always great. Good food, snacks in between, and good service from the cabin crew. The toilets must have been regular restocked and cleaned as they were of a high standard throughout the long flight. The Economy seats are good with a decent amount of room with plenty of pillows and blankets provided. The entertainment system in the seat back in front of you is good with a large selection of films, tv shows, games and music. The only negative I have is that I am still waiting to hear from Singapore airlines about my claim for compensation around the delay as I missed my connection meaning I was significantly delayed to my final destination. Under the EU laws this claim should be straight forward but Singapore seem to be dragging their feet a little. Regardless of this issue I would always travel on Singapore if possible.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines A 380 Business Class from Singapore to Sydney From Check in at Changi Airport to Kris Flyer lounge to boarding the aircraft was seamless. My wife had walking disabilities and nothing was too much trouble for the ground staff and also the on board staff. After a meal the cabin crew showed my wife all the features of the Lie Flat bed, TV controls and kept checking on her health all night. Then at 5-00am in the morning for our 48th wedding anniversary a special cake and Teddy Bears for us. On arrival in Sydney the cabin crew ensured my wife was able to get from the aircraft to the wheel chair and right through immigration and customs! I only wish the flight had been longer, if I rate Singapore Airlines Business Class and cabin crew I would have to give 11 out of 10! Perfect service
label: positive

text: long flight really looked after us long flights 2x 7 hour flights i meal and snack on both flights drinks and meals included came round with water and fruit juice a few times blanket and pillow on seat every flightwe were given wet wipes at begining also like a soap bag with toothbrush toothpaste eye mask earplugs in it on each flight had own tv screen and issued earphons each flight very pleasant and helpful
label: positive

text: First Class service in Business Class My flight on Singapore Airlines was the best! 18 hours in a comfortable business class seat with full reclining seat. I slept so well and I usually do not. The food was so tasty and we were able to order ahead. The flight crew was friendly and helpful. I just can't say enough about this flight. I had just flown to South Africa on a long flight and this was so much better- no comparison.
label: positive

text: Poor transfer service at the Changi International Airport We flew from Bangkok on premium economy and the flight was delayed by two hours. So we missed our connection flight in Singapore to Melbourne. Transfer desk at Changi was not helpful. Computer system was down. Had to spend nearly seven hours from midnight at the airport. No offer of lounge access nor accommodation. No meal provided. No seat upgrade as compensation too. What a scam!!
label: negative

text: Flight from Dublin to Brisbane The first leg of our code sharing flight from Dublin was cancelled at the last minute to Frankfurt. Got an email short time later from Singapore Airlines saying we were booked on an Emirates that night. Retrieved our luggage from another terminal and waited at Emirates counter for over 3 hours until their counter closed as Emirates said they never received authorization for our alternative flight tickets. Told to go to Swissport in Dublin who were great and arranged a hotel for the night. After getting to the airport hotel at 11-00pm we rang our travel agent back home shortly after who said she had to converse with Singapore Airlines for over 2 hours to arrange alternative flights. Finally got another flight home later the next day which went off without any problems albeit a day later. Our previous experience with Singapore Airlines has been great but this flight was incredibly stressful and we had a feeling of abandonment in Dublin due to a lack of communication from Singapore Airlines. Hopefully just a one off experience.
label: negative

text: As usual, great quality onboard SGA offers, as usual, a great quality onboard: this time we were on an A350; seat are comfortable, the full flat bed is also very relaxing and allows to sleep well. The dinner -alongwith the list if wines- was very good, and the crew extremely nice. I recommend.
label: positive

text: Flight change We booked to fly Singapore Airlines on both legs to discover we had been changed to Lufthansa on the longer 13 hour leg without our concent. Lufthansa is inferior and tries to charge you extra for seat allocations etc. We were unable to book my wife's vegetarian meals without paying extra for seat allocation. We deliberately took a 4 hour longer flight to avoid Lufthansa only to have Singapore Airlines do this to us. We are not happy.
label: negative

text: Long Flight Flying from San Fran to Singapore was a very long flight. The flight over was fantastic and I said to my wife, this is the best airline I have ever flown on. The food was better then any I have had on a plane and the service was great. They gave us an eye shade, socks, tooth brush and great service for the entire flight. Returning from Singapore to San Fran was a totally different experience. Food was not eatable, no mask or socks, when they served the trays stayed for a very long time and you could not move. Seats were ok, but seemed to be better on the outgoing trip. The air craft was different on the way over. Nothing better then our normal flights on Delta.
label: neutral

text: Singapore Airlines - a great flight We flew fro Sydney on SQ22 on 26 August 2019. We managed to score a seat on one of the bassinette rows. No children int he row! Great leg room. The seats were reasonably comfortable! The service was excellent and so so helpful. I was impressed by the quality of the served meals. This was a great flying experience in the cabin. Both take off and landing were very good as well.
label: positive

text: Poor customer Service over phone Trying to find out about alcohol restrictions on checkin luggage. Nothing on the website. Tried calling customer service in London and in Singapore - automated messages and it is frustratingly circular - after having pressed numerous buttons it left me only with 1 option to send an sms to my phone with a link to the website which has no information on it! Can't speak to anyone - that was 30 mins i will never get back. Please can someone tell me where to find this information??!!
label: negative

text: Last time I flew with Singapore Airlines two years ago I was really impressed so I was excited to travel with them again. We boarded in sections efficiently and were warmly welcomed on board. The seats are smaller and the pitch tighter. We departed on time and as soon as airborne the teen in front of me reclined her seat the screen was a hands length away from my face. Shame that this more expensive airline has effectively negated the positives of flying with them. Yes you still get hot refresher towels and the entertainment choice was pretty good. The food was okay, nothing special but adequate if you like beef. We were seat 45, and the only option left was the beef. The toilets were kept clean and we arrived into Changi on time. However it is the tight seats at premium price I have an issue with. I am divided as to whether I’d recommend, it’s safe and reliable so I’d say yes. However do not expect anything special.
label: neutral

text: Read this first before booking Singapore hotel package by Singapore Airline or Changi airport SIA operates a great airline, but they don't do hotel packages very well. We recently book a Singapore Stopover tour on the Changi website. SIA is a partner of Changi and put together this package which include a hotel, SIM card, transportation to a hotel and breakfast a a fast food outlet, Ya Kun. Getting each of these was like pulling a tooth. Information desk at Changi airport had no information when we arrived. UOB bank was charged with dispensing SIM which they ran out of. The hotel asked for a voucher which was not in the email. And Ya Kun at the location on the voucher had no idea what the deal was and refused to honor it. You may choose to fly Singapore Airline, but don't by hotel packages from them.
label: neutral

text: Flew Singapore Airlines from Jakarta to Singapore. Good short haul with free airport lounge access in CGK. Everything’s good and no regrets at all. Good Ground Services and nice Flight Attendant. For me it’s a real 5 star airline for Southeast Asia. SIA always know how to treat a loyal customer, love it!
label: positive

text: Great service We flew from Singapore to Hyderabad. The flight was comfortable, service was great. This is not our first flight and always Singapore has been great in service, timing, professionalism.
label: positive

text: An excellent flight from beginning to end with exceptional customer service Exceptional airline with top service. No complaints and the attendants were engaged and willing to do whatever they could to accommodate. Smooth flight with great legroom even in economy. Nice touches for economy that are often only seen in first class.
label: positive

text: Not worth paying extra for those seats with extra legroom June, 26th; seat number 47H. Extra payment after I booked already another seat. Not worth spending the extra money. Those seats with extra legroom are very close to the lavatories. and very close to the seats of the staff. You will be constantly disturbed. No need to stay that SQ-airlines are among the better airlines I have flown with during 50 years if traveling. But save your money for something else, don't pay for those seats!
label: positive

text: Outstanding long haul economy experience. All the accolades you’ve read about Singapore Airlines are true. A knock here and there in economy over 16 hours, but all minor in the over all scheme. Looking forward to my next flight on SA.
label: positive

text: No standard food Is not 1st time taking SG, their food standard dropped really bad, even bread also hard & cold. This time lucky only 4hrs, dont eat also doesnt matter. Last flight from SG-NY 20+hrs didn't eat. Now you know why people taking long haul need to eat instant noodles. Although I did call for instant noodles, but can SG try to improve the in flight meal standard. Economy also need to pay extra, next time maybe taking budget better. At least don't bother can sleep through whole journey
label: neutral

text: Sadly disappointed We have flown Singapore Airlines before and been very happy with the service but we were very disappointed with this flight. From Colombo to Singapore we flew with Silk Air (booked Singapore) the plane seemed very old, with no screens, the service was very average and staff seemed disinterested and unhelpful. The flight from Singapore to Melbourne was better but still the staff weren’t the usual helpful friendly staff we are used to. My husband also was quite sick when we got home and we think it was most likely the airline food. We pay a bit more to fly a non budget airlines expecting to get a bit better service and facilities. Very disappointed and I don’t know if I would fly with them again.
label: neutral

text: Comfortable flight Web check-in was easy to use with the boarding pass emailed to us. As we had no check in bags, we could breeze through immigration 5 hours before flight time. Able to enjoy the lounge at the airport.
label: positive

text: Brilliant experience Booked extra legroom seats (41B and C) as my husband has long legs. This was our second round trip experience of SA. The stewards and stewardesses are handsome/beautiful to behold with smiley, welcoming faces. Our seats were just by the entrance to the plane and next to a galley. The standard of service was exceptional. Nothing was too much bother and the food was wonderful and plentiful. My only criticism was that my husband was served his special meal ( he is diabetic) first and I was served last of that sides service. Surely it would not be too much to serve a meal to the accompanying passenger at the same time.
label: positive

text: Ridiculous Customer Service "Enjoy complimentary rebooking for ALL TICKETS issued up to 31. December 2021" . This is what Singapore Airlines advertises on their website. Well, it is not true ! When we changed (online not possible! ) our return flights (same flights, only 2 weeks earlier! ) and originally booked online with Singapore Airlines, we were charged extra. Asking why, they explained it with a different booking class..., on a flight to Singapore that was after all only about 10 % occupied, connecting flight from Singapore about 30 % occupied. After extra payment, new tickets were issued with a lower baggage allowance. Had to call them again, but you must know: The customer service is, if at all, almost not reachable by phone. On top of it, one suitcase did not arrive on time with our connecting flight. Overall: Quite unprofessional service and defenitely one way to loose customers for the future. Bye Bye Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text: Excellent airline Singapore airlines are probably the best airline in my opinion for service and politeness nothing was any trouble I asked them for more leg room as my wife suffers with cramps in her legs it wasn't a bother to them I witnessed one passenger get angry at them because he had a meeting the plane was delayed due to incoming connection flight being delayed so they had to wait for those passenger they never lost their composure if it were me I would have the man was totally out of order then when we were boarding he refused to get on but they talked calmly to him he eventually got on even while on board they were amazing on passenger kept asking for food every hour and they were greeted with a smile never an issue I highly recommend these top class service
label: positive

text: Disappointing After flying a few times with Singapore Economy Class I decided to splurge and try Business Class, but I was disappointed for one main reason: I remember the slogan for Singapore Airlines used to be, 'Singapore Girl, you're a great way to fly!', and this is one of the rare cases of 'truth' in advertising and one of the main selling points and points of difference for Singapore airlines. But obviously, this slogan is not very PC or woke, and is no longer used because of those reasons; but that does not mean it isn't true or effective marketing. But worse than that, the Business class cabin was staffed by way too many male flight attendants; and even worse, the 'team leader' for all the flight attendants on all Singapore Airlines fights I have experienced (business and economy) was a man! So, Singapore Airlines have gone from 'Singapore Girl, you're a great way to fly!', to way too many male flight attendants and not even a Singapore girl or woman being the the boss of the inflight cabin crew! That is extremely stupid and disappointing! For Singapore Airlines to relinquish one of the best and most truthful slogans in airline marketing history because of woke or otherwise pressure is political correctness and 'equal opportunity' gone mad! Isn't it funny that for years women strive for equal opportunity to no avail, but when whining men cry for the same it is instantly realised to the detriment of everybody, including an airline's effective marketing slogan. The vocation of flight attendant is a 'care' vocation, like a tour guide, like child care, like elderly care, men should not do it. I will avoid Singapore Airlines in the future for this very reason: 'Singapore 'Man', you're NOT a great way to fly.
label: neutral

text: Best flight I have ever had it was a great experience with Singapore airlines.the legroom was great and the staff was also very helpful.
label: positive

text: Felt like the old days, friendly, relaxed, great service This flight was like a balst from the past. The cabin crew seemed to be really enjoying their job; the drinks trolley came by shortly after we left Tokyo and was quick and efficient. The real highlight was the Japanese dinner option, probably the best aeroplane meal we have had. And new release films.
label: positive

text: the food was actually edible, the staff were wonderful, friendly and helpful. the food timing from singapore to destination ( the same coming back ) was unusual. a light meal two hours after getting on and then nothing not a drink for about 1o hrs. it was dark i understand , but people were away looking for food. the plane was very clean and the electronic equipment was well maintained
label: positive

text: Flew return from Singapore to Taipei. Flights were a very reasonable hour; early morning departing and early afternoon returning. The flight out was probably only 65% occupied, which contributed to the overall sense of wellbeing. Flight was on the A330 series, with 2-4-2 configuration. If travelling as a couple or pair, taking the window/aisle seats definitely gives you a sense of your own space, so this was a big plus. Legroom was reasonable. Service was up to the usual standards, although the most senior crew were sometimes a bit unsmiling. Food was average to good, depending on your choice, and the AVOD although not spanking new, was sufficient to entertain most for this 4 hour flight. The airplane is probably beginning to show it's age - it was a bit creaky and rattly on takeoff and landing, but everything is well maintained and perfectly comfortable. Singapore Air may transition some flights to the Boeing 787, and many suggest the 3-3-3 economy seating is a nightmare for economy travellers.
label: positive

text: SQ976 to Bangkok from Singapore: okay service on 20 December. SQ981 came back to Singapore from Bangkok: much better service. They left the light on for my father who was reading staff were much friendlier and were happy to serve. Both flights on A330 in-flight entertainment had lots of selection.
label: positive

text: Comfortable Seats Singapore Airline has always been my number 1 Choice. The reason is because the seats is comfortable and space is wide enough for big size and Long legs people. But I realise the food is not getting very good recently. They should improve on this. They have wide range of entertainment on the tv as well.
label: positive

text: First time with Singapore We had return flights Sydney to London with Singapore in May and June. Lived up to expectations in terms of service and staff which was great and up there with the other good airlines we have used. Had Airbus A380-800 on the Sydney - Singapore legs and Boeing 777-300ER on the Singapore-London segments. The Airbus is far superior, larger and newer with better legroom for us. Do not understand why we have the smaller plane on the longer segment. Disappointing but would definitely use again.
label: positive

text: Excellent flight Flight crew were kind and attentive even serving drinks when they were busy with getting the food out to passengers
label: positive

text: Old plane SQ did not use their new plane for this leg. Quite disappointing as no wifi service available. SQ should consider upgrading the plane for the comfort of their passengers.
label: positive

text: AWESOME AIRLINE Such great staff - food excellent - service prompt - clean and in air TV entertainment very good - would definitely fly with them again they made every effort to make sure we were OK
label: positive

text: Comfortable & Pleasant! Guess we were fortunate to get the newly retrofitted A380. Good legroom space & comfortable seat, last us thru' 14 hrs despite only managed 5 hrs of sleep. Let's hope the return flight on B777 will be as good
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines As usual a great airline to travel. very clean, excellent service & good food & list of wines .love to travel again
label: positive

text: Food not the greatest We have flown many airlines around the world and was looking forward to revisiting Singapore airlines as they had a new plane now in service from Adelaide. The staff are lovely, there is no fault there. As we were placed down the back (if you didn't pay extra to pick your seat on this already overpriced fare, being school holidays, the back is where you get placed) by the time the food got to us the best choice had already been taken and the only option was a fishy pasta with the most chewy, rubbery prawns I have ever had, which was disgusting. I know airline food is not always the best but for the past 3 years of flying Qatar, Qantas, British Airways, American Airlines and more, this would have to be the worst. My son was ordered a kids meal but was given an adults meal, which we didn't realise and then had to ask for his meal. There is not too much leg room as with most planes, but the seats and entertainment were good. On the flight coming home, it was supposed to leave Singapore at 11:10pm but was slightly delayed leaving. They don't serve you anything, you have to press service to get drinks throughout the flight. About 4:30am in the morning they wake everyone to eat an average meal. The last time we flew with them (13 years ago) we were given a toothbrush, socks etc but nothing but a blanket and pillow this time. If I was going to Europe again, it wouldn't be with Singapore Airlines.
label: neutral

text: Multi city stop, each leg of the flight great! Flew sydney - tokyo (stopover in changi airport) - hong kong - singapore - sydney with singapore airlines the whole way in business, loved all of it, the staff on each leg of the trip was really helpful, especially on the sydney to singapore and singapore to sydney flights, with the flight attendants assisting with luggage without being requested too, chatting to not just me but other passengers in the cabin asking about their day, talking about the movies they love that are on the inflight entertainment ect. The food was really good, from the starters to desert i ate all of it. The seat was very comfortable even seated upright, the leather was comfy and felt nice to the touch. I had no issues with my baggage, or any of their staff at check in or boarding. Even the safety video for this airline is one of my favourite to watch, as it shows the great sights around singapore. I would love to fly with them again soon.
label: positive

text: Worst airlines experience in 25 years They lost my baggage and destroyed my holiday. No compassion no revert to follow up emails for compensation. Zero accountability airline
label: negative

text: The best airline I have flown to Singapore on long weekend. The airplane is very new and modern. I had the separated seats with my friend, but the ground stuff was very helpful and found the adjoining seats for us.
label: positive

text: Great airline Even travelling economy the service was first class the cabin crew really look after the passengers.my connection flight from Launceston to Melbourne was also very good this airlines was virgin.
label: positive

text: First Timers! Its our first time flying to Singapore Air and it really amazes me because the seats are very clean, wider spaces compared to Cebu pacific and lot of choices for entertainment, as they have monitors and free earplugs (though same with emirates). I am really happy that even Avengers Infinity war is already there. We flew August 2018, and movies and songs are updated. Food are exquisite, really like the red wine and white wine ( to help me sleep). What I don't like is the connecting flight wherein we need to flew first in Silk Air. The space is too narrow, I felt sorry for the couples with babies because only few babies have there bassinets, though its only 3hrs flight, still they need to work on there spaces. But in general, Singapore made us very comfortable and would look forward to book there again.
label: positive

text: The cabin crew are friendly, they provide good service The cabin crew are friendly, they provide good service. The ladies leader with green uniform is helpful. She help to make my seat comfortable when the person seating in front is in-considerate (adjust the seat all the way down)
label: positive

text: Not good for travel to Singapore and beyond from New York City Years ago Singapore Air had a direct flight from Newark/New York to Singapore. It was great! But they stopped that fight when they got rid of those planes. Now if you fly from New York to Singapore, you have to deplane in Frankfort, wait, and then get back on the plane AFTER going through German customs! A real pain. Last time flew I was flagged for drugs on the way home to New York. I am a photographer and had lots of equipment with me. They tore me apart, opening and emptying every bag of photo and computer stuff, making me remove every piece of equipment I had - only to realize that my sleeping pills were showing up as drugs. They were beyond nasty... And Singapore Air's Frequent Flyer department is terrible. I wanted to upgrade from Premium Economy to Business. I was told to transfer the miles and it would be done closer to my trip.The part of my trip from Bangkok to Singapore and back was upgraded, but the Singapore/New York portion was not. When I got to Bangkok from Laos and tried to do the upgrade, I was told that it had to be done in Singapore. When I got to Singapore, I was told that it had to be done in Bangkok and they wouldn't do it.There were plenty of seats available in Business. I lost 40,000 miles because they wouldn't accommodate me! I haven't flown them since. I used to fly them on a regular basis.They lost a good customer! P.S. I traveled before 2018, but had to put a date on this review.
label: negative

text: Singapore to Dubai, and overall, Singapore Airlines lived up to expectations. Hot refreshing towels served followed by some drinks and then our meal. Was slightly disappointed with the meal, it looks unappetizing. Also, was slightly disgusted that the cup holder was stained and the stains were easily removed when I scratched it away with the towel. The compartments around my seats were pretty dirty, namely the earphone compartments, cup holder and magazine holder. I believe this does not reflect on all Singapore Airlines aircraft. Service was very good. We had socks and eye-mask for the flight. Toilets were equipped with mouthwash, toothbrush, toothpaste, comb and cups to ease washing up in tight space. Cabin crew were polite and presented themselves very well. As a Singaporean, I am very proud of our national airline.
label: positive

text: Melbourne to London return via Singapore. Have always Singapre Airlines with high regard until my most recent trip to London. When we booked in January 2015, we could not book premium economy on the MEL to SIN leg, as at that time there was no premium economy on this leg. This has now changed but only on some flights. MEL to SIN in Economy, an older plane with inflight entertainment screen to boot. The screen was awful, so if you flying on another SIA flight, hold back and watch the movies you want to watch on a better screen. Service was very average, IFE was poor, food was very poor. Singapore to London in Premium Economy The only advantage in taking premium economy is the seat pitch and thats it. This is a very poor attempt at premium economy and it is a complete rip off. Inflight entertainment was poor, a much larger screen, so great for movies, the only plus. My small hand held control panel did not work. The entertainment system kept resetting itself at the end of every movie or programme. One ear in the headphones did not work. Service was poor - In premium economy you are placed in front of economy and behind business class. The service is provided by the economy cabin staff. Could not call for service as my hand held control panel did not work. The toilets are down in economy, none near premium economy. Food was very Poor - Economy class food. The only reason why I've given a score of 2 is because they have the book the cook service, but that is still economy class standard food. Remember, you are paying double the price for this seat. Flight arrived 25 minutes late. Return legs London to Singapore in premium economy was exactly the same but this time the entertainment system kept resetting itself, the headphones worked and so did the hand held control panel. Singapore to Melbourne in Economy - the breakfast on economy is as poor as you get with airline food. A cold bread roll, hard cold butter, cold muffin, cold unripe fruit. The TV screen on this plane was up to date but still had issues with it freezing. We had a seat between us, so basically it was the same as flying premium economy but without paying twice the price. I had made a complaint to SQ a month before flying and this complaint has not been responded to. On all counts SQ have really dropped the ball. I would not recommend Singapore Airlines, especially if you are looking to fly premium economy.
label: negative

text: Disappointed with Singapore Airlines On 17th Jan caught late flight out of Singapore to Adelaide. Had all the hype Singapore Airlines using new planes but were surprised to get onboard, be offered no drink, only hot towels, and then lights were turned off very quickly. First time have experienced this happening. Normally get on board. Offered a drink(s) and a meal. I was travelling with 9 members of family, and it was lucky they were not relying on a meal. Are Singapore Airlines cutting back? Forgot to say my grandaughter is a vegetarian and was not amused with the breakfast she was handed. Have flown with Singapore Airlines many times, but will not be in a rush to do so again.
label: neutral

text: Best Economy class experience Travel with my 76 years old mom. Quick check in and very attentive ground staff to offer my mom wheelchair. Upon boarding air crew gently lead my mom that hold her hand to our seat. Very nice and attentive. Food on board was always good from Hongkong. Crew was also take good care of my mom when dissembarked until my mom seat on the wheelchair. Thank you Singapore Airlines, you are a great way to fly
label: positive

text: DIFFICULT TO CHANGE FLIGHT DATE BY PHONE We had a booking for 06 sept to fly to Paris and return to Melbourne from Rome. We needed to change the first leg Melbourne to Paris via Singapore date which you can only do via their call centre. It took approx 1.50 hours to change the date. The first person couldn't understand what we wanted so after 1 hour trying to get it sorted we hung up and called back again - different person who grasped what we wanted and sorted it out for us. The first girl wouldn't transfer us to anyone else and said there was no supervisor we could speak to - very poor service and I'd think twice about booking through Singapore airlines again - changes are just far too difficult.
label: negative

text: Cabin crew attitude My wife and me travelled from Auckland to Singapore on Singapore Airlines ( SQ 0286 ). on 5th November 2018.It was a very pleasant flight even in economy class with the cabin crew attentive and friendly and service the promise of Singapore Airlines. We returned after our Asia tour ( Singapore/Bangkok/Seam Ream Cambodia/Ho Chi Min City ( Saigon ) on Singapore Airlines (SQ0285) also in economy class. Our seat numbers were 61F and 61G which were at the rear of the aircraft.There was nothing wrong with the seats and were quite comfortable. However the cabin crew for this section of the aircraft left a lot to be desired.Either this cabin crew were new or they were just not carrying out their duties with the high standards of Singapore Airlines.The aircraft was delayed on the runway because another aircraft had broken down in front of ours and we couldn't take off.There was cold air blowing on my wife's head and I stood up in front of my chair to see if I could shut off the flow of cold air.This male cabin crew sitting in his crew seat in front called loudly" Sir please sit down". I can understand him doing his duty but we were stationary for many minutes.I immediately sat down. A short time later a passenger stood up and started removing something from his hand luggage fro the overhead locker. Nothing was said to him. At both supper and breakfast which were both unappetising I had to make a special request for salt and pepper. Is Singapore Airlines cutting cost on this basic items? Overall the service was poor and substandard not with what Singapore Airlines prides itself.
label: positive

text: Best airline ever, now and in the past too Terrific airline! Fantastic service, food, drinks, all excellent. Plenty of leg room, great in flight entertainment, Cannot recommend enough compared to all other airlines flown in the last ten years. On return trip, we experienced a delay in Beijing which meant we missed our flight on home to Brisbane. Flight made up for it with plenty of wine and beer, and on arrival in Singapore at midnight, the airline called us up by name and put is up in Changi Airport Crowne Plaza Hotel in a hotel for 7 hours all paid for (with breakfast though we missed it). Very very impressed.
label: positive

text: Bangkok to Singapore. This route not too perfect like long haul flight that operated by SQ. It’s full of people, but it’s not affected to the service. I suggest SQ to change the new aircraft for this route, since so many traveler from BKK airport. Food for this flight is better than flight embarked from SIN.
label: neutral

text: You get what you pay for. I haven't reviewed Singapore Airlines in a while. I recently went on a business class flight to Tokyo and back from Singapore. The flight was almost 7 hours long. The cost of the flight is not cheap in comparison to other airlines but SQ offers much more. Their seat size is huge compared to other airlines business class. This trip I found that SQ has removed all their novelty gifts for business class and first passengers. I actually enjoyed receiving a little gift from them even though its probably already paid for in the cost of your ticket but it was nice to receive a perfume or something or rather. They have just removed that element completely. My husband who is a frequent flyer says they removed it a while ago. I also found service was just average. The staff on the airline I went on on both ways did their job as much as was required from them. I didn't get the extra conversations, the small talk that I used to get on their airline. When I entered the plane, the staff who I passed greeted me and I went to my seat. After that I only saw staff members if it was time to serve a drink or dinner. I remember a time when a staff or two will strike a short conversation with you making you feel a lot more welcome. Maybe it was just my luck, but I felt you can take service to a whole new level with a bit of conversation.
label: positive

text: Sheer disappointment We have flown with SingaporeAir many times over the years. They have always been a pleasure to fly with, until now. Firstly the Changi airport experience is very good. Other airports could learn a lot from them. Boarding is easy. My first complaint is that they have removed footrests?? On a long flight they are necessary, and because they were there on last flight I didn’t take my portable one. This was a full flight in the a380. In March this exact same flight was a pleasure, the reason we paid the SIA, price. So why the changes? Lights out for most of the flight? Only two meals in 141/2 hours! Food nigh on inedible. No pre meal drink. Crew little in evidence. Regret to say true “cattle class”. We had superior service and meals on the Silk Air flight to Phuket, shades of how Singapore Air used to be. All very disappointing.
label: neutral

text: Hanoi to Singapore on SQ187 This was the return leg of our family trip to Hanoi in July. Totally full flight. Operated on an A330. Mediocre food on this flight segment. Large but not too inspiring selection of movies. Efficient check-in and boarding, and the flight landed 20 mins early into Singapore. But then we had to wait a very long time to collect our pram at the gate after disembarking.
label: neutral

text: Bad flight and service Having used the same class on Air New Zealand we presumed we would receive the same high level of service on this flight as part of the Star Alliance network. But no. The area was open to all other guests, the food service was basically the same as Economy and flight crew were uncaring.Seats were uncomfortable and just a little better than economy All together not worth the money spent.
label: neutral

text: Reasons why Singapore Air is #1 Trip started on a bad note with a vehicle incident on the way to airport . Airline very accommodating and rebooked for following day and waived change fee. Flight from EWR is SQ's longest so it's almost impossible to say one is happy spending 18 hours in PE. Over the years I have probably flown several million miles and this was one of best flights on any domestic or international carrier. First, chose PE over business class for price only. Could not justify additional $3,000+ price difference at time of booking. Food was adequate even though I lost my pre-flight menu selections due to rebooking. With 2 full meals and availability of snacks throughout flight, you will not be hungry. Movie selection was not very impressive. Good music selections. The recline feature on seats is great. If passenger in front fully reclines, they do not end up in your lap. Last...the crew was fantastic. Pleasant, professional and totally accommodating. Couldn't ask for better crew interaction. Definitely the #1 airline for a reason.
label: positive

text: Flew from SIN to MNL on Business class and the experience I had with Singapore airlines was an overall pleasant one. Check in staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. The SilverKris Lounge at T3 was phenomenal with amazing wide selection of food, relaxing ambience and the one thing I love most is the private nap room. I took a shower which they had facilities in the lounge. The T2 SilverKris lounge looked dated and the food presentation could have been better. The overall ambience, furniture and interior of T2 SKL felt that it did not fit the branding of Singapore airlines and it just felt crowded and not luxurious or relaxing at all. Flying back to Singapore I took SQ business class while my parents were in economy. I was very disappointed because since two weeks prior to the flight I was not able to select seats for my parents who wanted to sit as far up in the forward zone so that I can assist them asap when needed. I even tried reaching out to Singapore airlines but to no avail and I felt like they had little to no empathy in understanding the situation. At one point while using the live chat on the SQ app, the representative was sarcastic which made me feel so disgusted. I also understand that Singapore airlines also does allow us to do online check in up to 48hrs prior to departure time but for some reason they were already allocated seats even before the check in time. The SQ app nor the website didn’t allow us to purchase seats for them and this was very disappointing. Nevertheless, the staff at Manila airport T3 were very friendly too and the SilverKris Lounge at Manila could also have a better range of food selection. Majority of the food there were just quick bites and I felt there should have been rice made available at least. The whole boarding process for my flight SQ919 seemed pretty messy with no staff managing the crowd properly as well in which I don’t entirely blame SQ but blame the airport management for it. Overall the onboard experiences were good and catering was not too bad as well. I just don’t wish for anyone to experience what my parents and I experience when it came to selecting / pre purchasing seats prior to the flight, it was truly not great experience but an inconvenience we will never forget.
label: positive

text: Enjoyable Night Flight We flew the night flight at 22.05 to Singapore then onto Adelaide....which I would really recommend if you all want to pass a few hours by sleeping...after about an hour we were served a meal..my husband had a veggie meal and I was surprised he ate it as he is so very fussy. The lights dimmed and we all settled down..me hubby and 14 year old...I bet we slept 5 hours. I wore a simple black eye mask and I really think I made a difference...we had cushions and blankets and were quite alright to say it was a economy. On waking we all just started watching the movies again and this passes time. The crew are friendly and are passing thru with water and juice. I did go up to the galley and they greeted mw lovely and offered me goodies...crisps,, chocolate bar , apple and more juice. we looked forward to breakfast as we knew we were nearly at Singapore....then we were all prepared for our onward journey to Adelaide..which at just 7 hours flew by..again with Singapore Airlines. Would fly with them again.
label: positive

text: No more flying with Singapore Airlines.. complete scam Initially bought the ticket for December 2021 for €920, agreed with the complimentary unlimited rebooking with no rebooking fee policy as well as the "Fare difference" I thought in case when i rebook to next year April which is 4 months later, it would not have any "Fare difference"... turns out that's how the airline make money right... they charge 100euro in "Fare difference"!!! and when i go separately to search for a new ticket in April 2022, the price is only €600, so where does the rest of €300 go? and they still charge extra €100 for "Fare difference" ??!!! is this a joke?
label: negative

text: Bangkok to Singapore. Wanted to try the regional business class available on the brand new Boeing 787-10. Feeling like a cocoon, it is very private, entertainment system is really great, enough space to store your book or headphones, seat is comfortable, without the Z on bed position which i think is a real improvement However, the only small negative point is that the seat is a bit narrow with small arms rest during take off and landing, you can push it down during the flight so not a real issue. Aircraft is great even if i was expected a more quiet environment, compared with the A350 for example. I didn't mention the service and the food which were amazing. Overall a great way to fly.
label: positive

text: Perfect flight Wonderful service and great experience, had no problems treated really well and would highly recommend to others.
label: positive

text: Service with a smile It was worth paying the extra, however there are still issues with the person sitting infront of you being thoughtless/selfish, and although asking the cabin staff to address the issue, this was not done. We are paying customers too! However that was only on one(and the first) of the four flights we took, and on reflection it did look like the lady stewardess was very new. Everything done very just so. The other flights were fine. The last flight on the way back from Singapore to Heathrow afforded us the wrong menu, so food was not as advertised, and pasta starter dishes for both meals, both very dry and unappatising. Comfort wise the extra space and leg support made the word of difference. Noise cancelling headphones as standard in PE were a bonus.
label: positive

text: Comfortable non-stop flight Great that SQ added the non-stop flight between Singapore and Seattle. Judging from full flight, it must be really popular and there is a demand for it. Whilst the premium economy seats do not recline fully, it was great that I had the first row (row 31) where there is ample leg space. Food wise, no difference from economy other than having option for champagne and a 3rd food choice. I like the fact of not having a layover.
label: positive

text: Newer planes are better. After 4 consecutive flights with Singapore airlines, we came to the conclusion that their Airbus 330-300 was the better of them all, as it had a better degree of comfort, and bonus, a touch screen for your entertainment during your trip. Something I had trpouble with on the other flights we took during this holiday. But, oh dear, them earphones are a right pain! Surely modern airlines can do better than give one 20cents worth of technology as you enter the plane and look forwards to up to 5 hours of bum numbing entertainment as you catch up on the movies you missed last time around. Ok, the service was good and prompt, the food was average but a good standard, and you even get an ice cream afterwards if you still have room. Loved the touch screen windows which now replace the shutters which seem to annoy the cabin staff every time we land and they are down. Why one asks? Does it make for a smoother landing you wonder as the sun streams into your eyes! Smooth ride Singapore, thank you.
label: positive

text: Flying with Singapore Airlines was Great trip, cabin Crewe attentive, food good, inflight entertainment good. The flight was at all times tranquil and relaxed. Singapore Airlines is our first choice for this long haul flight, we have used them many many times and always had excellent service.
label: positive

text: Disappointing After leaving our cruise ship in Tokyo, we flew to Melbourne via Singapore on Singapore Airlines. I had flown with this airline many years ago and thought that it was good, so I was disappointed by our recent experience of it. The Premium Economy seats were tighter than I expected them to be and, on one flight, the seat in front of me showed signs of poor upkeep. The meals served ranged between poor and scarcely edible. The attentiveness of the pleasant staff was the only saving grace. It will be a long time before I think about flying Singapore Airlines again.
label: negative

text: How to avoid the bus to Sydney to catch the Singapore plane if you live in Canberra Singapore Airlines gained a fifth daily flight from Sydney to Singapore and Canberra received a daily service when SQ introduced the “ loop “ SQ288 flight of Singapore to Sydney then back to Singapore daily . Being a “ loop “ flight it has only the one flight number instead of the “ even “ one way and the “ odd “ the other way . A cunning move . My poor wife , who suffers dreadfully but silently from the auto-immune disease Rheumatoid Arthritis, not to be confused with the common Osteoarthritis, dreads the sub zero mornings that Canberra endures in May to August when daily maximum temperatures may reach only into the low teens . I had promised last year that as I had enough points I would take her to Singapore for 3 weeks in June/July to escape the cold , which I did . SQ 288 starts by departing from Singapore at 10.30 am , arriving in Sydney just after 8 pm , sits there for 1 hour 10 minutes to let Sydney passengers off , collect new Singapore passengers then flies on to Canberra to arrive at 10.20 pm , disembark those returning to Canberra and then taking on Canberrans before flying directly on to Singapore at 11.15 pm , but late this time , arriving at 5.15 am Singapore time , making up time on the flight . A Loop . We flew Business 17D and 17F in the usual super-wide SQ seats as Business cabin is a 1-2-1 configuration. Everyone has aisle access . I always feel I do not get full Business benefit with night flights and this one is no different , a one course main meal straight after takeoff and a light breakfast or a snack straight after takeoff with an American Breakfast in the morning before landing , at around 3 am on this flight . I chose the latter , nothing to write home about . Also , Singapore seems to loose it’s normal “ different to other airlines “ claim by following their lead in the absence of service during the night flight . No staff in sight for hours and I dislike pushing the call button . Despite the large but hard and angled full recline seat I cannot sleep on aircraft and so hang out for the appearance of a flight attendant from whom I can request a drink . Only managed two drinks for the whole flight . I felt short changed as I am not a passenger who becomes rowdy after a few drinks . The cabin was quite hot also , so dehydration may have started . Individual water bottles had run out and no offer to top up was made due to staff absence . On time arrival in Singapore then an easy taxi into the Orchard Road area . The taxi at 32 dollars for an around a 20 kilometre trip was a bargain . With only one flight a day into Canberra , SQ does not have it’s own lounge but Business/First travellers can use the Virgin Business Lounge . Virgin also has dedicated check in counters for all SQ travellers . Passengers who have just boarded in Sydney get ushered into the Transit Lounge at Canberra after just 30 or so minutes in the air on the way down from Sydney. We await the dubious pleasure of the Sydney transit lounge on our flight back . There is a VERY limited Duty Free shopping facility in the CBR transit lounge . This new service is obviously a great benefit to country travellers wishing to avoid the trip to board in Sydney for travel to Singapore, not to mention having to find a car park and/or find accommodation in Sydney . Also , as the flight arrives at 10.20 pm at night Canberrans can avoid the morning jet-lagged car or bus trip back to Canberra after an overnight return flight . If enough passengers would justify a Sixth SQ flight into Sydney early am and then on to Canberra to collect morning passengers , that would give Canberran and country travellers the possibility of over and back daylight flights , not to mention the ability to connect with onward daytime flights to Asia, Europe or London . I realize that old age and deteriorating health , spinal operations for us both , are probably making us more critical but we could only manage a 7 out of 10 for SQ on this leg . Hopefully the daytime return will win us back
label: positive

text: Very good Had never flown Singapore Airlines before and when looking on Skyscanner had the cheapest flight Wellington to Melbourne at short notice (9 days out). I was impressed with the leg room in economy - you could actually stretch out a bit. But the seats were a bit hard on the neck. Ask for a pillow! But the service and food was great. A hot face towel for everyone (even in Economy!) before takeoff. Food was nice. Enjoyed the flight. Flew home again with them as well which was also very good. Would recommend Singapore Airlines and would definitely fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Plesantly surprising experience We travelled economy class on Singapore airlines to Shanghai as part of a tour package and were pleasantly surprised at the level of service and facilities offered. The hot towels and menu offerings were well received and the service was everything one could expect. Flights departed and arrived on time at the nominated terminal and checkin staff were always helpful and courteous. We would recommend Singapore Airlines as a memorable travel experience. The AirBus 350 seems a more spacious plane than the Boeing 777 while the AirBus 380 is a much noisier plane but all were clean and well presented including the toilets.
label: positive

text: Great service refunds We were due to fly to Australia in October. We cancelled the flight 3 days ago, and the Zurich office refunded us the flight fare within 2 days. Should we be able to travel to Australia next year, we will definitely travel with Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines was always noted most for their cabin crew attentiveness, you read it still in their proud history in the inflight magazine. I think the slogan was 'Singapore girl, what a great way to fly'. Nowadays if you are lucky enough to be in business you will still come across one of these amazing women. However, you are more likely to get the totally uncommitted new fleet of cabin crew in economy who view the public as a bit of a nuisance and eye contact has gone. Tragedy that whoever is in charge of training cabin staff for this airline is doing a terrible job and losing loyal customers. On my flight, SQ217, Singapore to Melbourne, 10.45 on July 7, I had a rude male steward ever who did not smile once. Back to Qantas for this frequent Australia to Europe passenger.
label: neutral

text: Foods are plentiful I took the direct flight from SF to Singapore. We took off around 11am local time and arrived in Singapore 7pm local time as well. So I think it was around 16 hours. I know it sounds a Long flight but I did not feel so. The business class seat has a big enough space. I spent my times reading couple of newspapers and magazines. Continuing my readings on my kindle. And watched couple of latest films as well. I slept around 6 hours during the whole flight. The bed was nice. But I do not like how it is slanted. The flight attendants are also friendly but professional. The foods are amazing. Sometimes I felt they are a bit too much. Between the first meal and the second meal there are quite a big gap in term of timing but you can always ask for a nice warm noodle to the flight attendant. I would not take the business class if it was a personal trip though. It can cost you up to 4 times of the economic class. I know it is cozy and all but it does not really worth it.
label: positive

text: The Best Outstanding legroom. They fly a 747 american configuration, not the cramped 747 Asian configuration. The American 747 configuration which also allows greater hip room. Amenities are nice, and it seems that they are much better at staffing aboard the plane.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Hong Kong with Singapore Airlines. The crew were very polite and they smiled every single time I asked for something. The meal was great they had menu for this flight. There were 3 available options for economy class including the vegetarian menu. The inflight entertainment was updated and had many several new movies. This flight was fantastic.
label: positive

text: Took this flight from Hong Kong to Singapore on a business trip. Nice and real business class in a bit of an older style. Service was great. While service and the cabin crew were nice, I was quite unhappy with the cockpit crew. Upon departure the pilot talked about fair weather conditions, nothing unusual. He did not mention with any word that we need to be seated for 2 hours and being shaken around in turbulence. It even got that bad that the captain got the cabin crew seated because he said it is too dangerous for them to walk around. But 5 minutes after that, the captain comes out to go to toilet? It is not a shame to tell passengers that there may be turbulence en route.
label: positive

text: Very Friendly Staff I enjoy the service from Singapore Airlines. Checking in very easy, friendly staff greet me before on-board on the plane. The food also great!
label: positive

text: Singapore to Los Angeles. I know we paid a little extra for this one-way flight, but it was totally worth it! The most comfortable, newest, economy seats we've even seen. Large screen viewer, a separate reading light, bottle of water, socks, toothbrush and toothpaste, sleeping mask, fully reclining, foot rest, complimentary alcohol, premium ice cream, etc. We will fly Singapore Airlines whenever we can in the future!
label: positive

text: After more than 4 years since I've flown with SQ, I continue to be impressed with their high level of service and quality. Despite the aircrafts being one of their older ones in their fleet, it was well maintained and IFE worked perfectly. Their ground service was also really good - I was 10kg over my check-in baggage limit but SQ was kind enough to waiver 5kg of that so I only had to pay the excess for 5kg. Already looking forward to my next trip with them.
label: positive

text: Great service and friendly cabin crew Return from Bangkok yesterday evening .No complains about our friendly and helpful cabin crews on board the flight. Excellent service. The only problem about this flight was the air-con doesn't seems to be working well. Initially, I thought it was me but the others (70A. 71 A, 72A) who was seated behind me and a few others on other rows also complained about the aircraft air-con. Hope Singapore airlines will look into it and do something about it. Thanks.
label: positive

text: Disappointing I knew SG airlines are considered the best out of all but it was rather mediocre or sub par actually. Food was rather bad and they never heat up bread so it was always cold. The stewardesses seemed annoyed when I asked for a beer or any other additional small service. One girl didn't even understand the word "butter" and when I made a gesture of spreading on bread and she thought I was after jam and told me "bread already sweet enough lah"and walked off I wasn't angry or anything and took it as it is what it is but I was a little surprised. Well COVID changed everything and this probably is new normal. At least all my 4 flights arrived on time and I safely returned.
label: negative

text: Best Flight to Hong Kong Bought my flight in December and it was a steal. That said there was no compromise on service and my family and I was well taken care of. Enjoyed the flight.
label: positive

text: Just not all that! After all the hype and paying $300 per ticket extra to fly with this airline, than other carriers. We found the service to be so so and food also. The check in and basically the whole deal felt no different that any other airline. If fact my wife thought that the stewards were if fact a bit stuck up and rude. Oh well next time we will go with the cheaper carrier and spend it on a meal or hotel.
label: neutral

text: Great Airline A great Airline. I've never had any issues flying with them and if I can get cheap enough tickets I don't hesitate to book with them. Fantastic service.
label: positive

text: the art of making time fly Singapore airlines really sets the standard in making flying an elevated experience. Their staff are proactive, smiling and work hard to make you feel cared for. We had a young child and the staff spent a lot of time taking care of her. Food could be served at a restaurant on the ground and people would come back. The business class hardware is solid but not extravagant as Qatar or Emirates- its the service and food standard that still gives them an edge
label: positive

text: First class Life is short everyone should try first class at least once in their life. It is awesome. The crew from Singapore airlines were fantastic and service was second to none. Like the Nike line says. Just do it!!
label: positive

text: No doubt as Most Awarded Airline Comfortable with leg-room. polite and smiley aircrew. food was quite good. and aircrew responded to your needs quite immediate. well done SQ!!
label: positive

text: Excellent flight experience from CGK - EWR/EWR - CGK with ordinary meals and service... Both of me and my wife decided to have a flight experience, with Singapore Airlines, in their longest route (SIN - EWR) during 3rd week of May - currently SQ holds world record for longest flight. We both were glad to have such experience while we could. To make the whole journey more pleasant, we both were able to secure bulkhead seats in all flight sectors which definitely made us fresh once we stepped out of the aircraft even after being in the flight for more than 15 hours. Although it was not our first experience taking a direct flight for more than 15 hours but we both still got so excited. Our 1st experience took place several years back when we both flew BKK-LAX/LAX-BKK route which took approx. 16~17 hours one way. This time, we decided to fly and spend time traveling to East Coast and North East Coast of US during our 21 days' trip. That's one of the main reasons why we decided to fly with SQ to EWR this time. In this trip, we both decided to take the 1st flight from CGK-SIN where we arrived in Singapore in the early morning where we had enough time to explore the city before heading back to Changi airport slightly before 7:00 pm the same day. We decided doing so because we tried not to sit too long in the aircraft and got tired/bored. By spending time in Singapore, we did some exercise (walking) and we tried to make our body a bit exhausted before we both boarded the flight before midnight. Our 1st flight (CGK-SIN) was leaving on time : Our flight touched down in Singapore slightly earlier than its original schedule. We spent more than 10 hours wandering around both in the airport and in the city before heading back to airport later that evening. Once we returned back to the airport, we both decided to enter Krisflyer Lounge and spent few hours there : We were resting a while inside the lounge and had light meals while enjoying the lounge's facility. Our 2nd flight was leaving slightly behind its original schedule but we managed to arrive in EWR almost an hour ahead of its original schedule. The flight experience was as good as we both expected with few notes. The following conclusion is my personal judgement on Singapore Airlines after flying with them for more than 35 years now : Without any doubt, they operate one of the youngest and most modern aircraft's fleets in the world. They also have one of the most entertaining IFEs among airlines in the world, one of the best seats we can find among full service airlines in the world and the list goes on. However, up to today and despite their competitive advantage as described above, I strongly believe they're still lacking particularly in their in-flight service performed by their flight attendants. I carefully evaluated how they all performed in many long haul flights and so far, they were doing average at their best. In my opinion, their in-flight service was not the best one as many passengers had claimed. There are other airlines that have much better work performance than SQ. For instance, Thai Airways, JAL etc to name a few. For me, most of their flight attendants tried to rush their work and which was good sometimes when we flew short distance such as CGK-SIN. However, in many cases especially in longer haul flights (> 2 hours), I felt I didn't get a good quality level of service as they supposed to perform. Second finding : SQ really needs to rectify/step up their food quality. We both flew in premium economy this time (they only offer 2 classes in this particular flight) and I really felt none of their meals they served throughout our flights was outstanding. They were rather ordinary as we could easily find in other flights operated by other carriers. I have flown with Singapore Airlines many times in the past in routes such as CGK-SIN, CGK-CAN, CGK-PVG, CGK-HKG and in longer route such as CGK-LAX and that's what I had observed. Our return flights' experience were more or less the same with our outbound flights with the difference we were landed in Singapore almost 2 hours early than its original schedule although the flight took off, from EWR, almost an hour behind its schedule. This condition gave us 1 1/2 hours extra to spend in Singapore (total 4 1/2 hours layover in SIN). Once again, being able to access Krisflyer Lounge really helped us a lot in getting the much needed rests. One note : SQ only provides lounge access to their business class passengers and Star Alliance Gold card holders. In EWR, they directed us to visit Virgin Atlantic Clubhouse (lounge) where we spent time a little over an hour before heading to the gate for boarding's preparation. Will I fly with SQ in the future ? The answer will be yes since they still have one of the best IFEs and airline seats in the world. As for their service and food quality, it's really not a big issue that makes me stop flying with them.
label: neutral

text: Flew economy Sydney to Singapore day flight. Very happy and a pleasant flight. Had a row of seats to myself. The A380 cabin was clean and did not look to be very old at all. Range of entertainment options was great. 2 meals served and had vegetarian which were both fine. Plenty of water offered and the crew were polite and professional. Despite news to the contrary, there were hot towels and blankets and pillows!
label: positive

text: Bali to Tokyo via Singapore. First leg Bali to Singapore on A330. Ordered special fruit platter meal and tasted delicious. Great choice of in-flight entertainment. Toilet hygiene could have been improved. Second leg Singapore to Tokyo Haneda a comfortable flight on latest Boeing 777-300ER cabin. Both mid-night snack and breakfast were tasty. New, wide 11.1-inch IFE screen offered latest movies, TV programs and nice flight path simulation. Needed to wait for quite a while for baggage but that is airport's fault not SIA's.
label: positive

text: The Lounge and the Flight A 6.30am arrival in the Singapore lounge in Brisbane for departure is an event in itself. However the staff were completely efficient and even suggested that on such occasions a glass of champagne was totally appropriate. The 1am return flight was equally seamless. While 80% of passengers just wanted to sleep, the attendants were more than happy to serve a full meal and make suggestions as to courses. It was a complete experience.
label: positive

text: Good Service and leg room. As usual found Singapore Airlines service very good and the leg room was good. Had a recent return flight from Perth to Singapore using Qantas and the leg room was terrible, for some reason their economy leg room seems to be tighter. If my choice of airline to use i will be using Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: First Rate I have used Singapore Airlines twice this year to fly to Manila with a layover in Singapore. Having previously flown budget airlines in the past (8 visits). There was no comparison in levels of comfort service etc. You really do get what you pay for and flying budget is dreadful. I found the cost only about AUD$100 more and well worth the money, I got two free meals on each flight and got to watch 4 new release movies Highly recommended!
label: positive

text: excellent reputation delay caused plane to arrive at 230 AM good service and food could not check in until 2 hours before flight
label: positive

text: Great flight Took this 18 hours direct flight back to singapore with family and relatives. Flight depart on time and check in was smooth. seat reclining was really comfortable and leg room was good. Meal menu was awesome and wine selection were also plentiful. As this is a new A350 ultra, everything is new and cleanliness was tip top condition. SIA cabin crews always outperformed when it comes to service. Slept really well on this long flight without much disturbance. Pilot’s take off and landing’s skill was amazing .... make me felt real safe and willing to recommend all to take SIA. Try to book early to get a cheaper fare if you want to fly with SIA cuz i realized my fare doubled a month before the departure compared to when i bought few months earlier.
label: positive

text: B787 economy The seats and legroom on this aircraft was much better than the following flight on the A350. Very comfortable. In-flight entertainment screens were clear and very responsive. Only a short flight but will look for B787 aircraft to fly on in the future.
label: positive

text: Exceptional service and food We flew out as first time business class and what an experience it was. Food was pre ordered by us online and was exceptional. I am 6 3 " so quite tall the seat were so comfortable and easy to pull down into a bed. Staff were on hand and wonderful on the Heathrow to Singapore service our final destination was Sydney.
label: positive

text: Great flight, great crew and great product My first ULH flight in premium economy. The hard product was excellent. Seat was comfortable and had good pitch. Entertainment was better than the the standard SQ LH flight. Food was good, especially as the BTC option was available. The crew were excellent, friendly and hospitable. By the end of the flight, it felt like we had made new friends!
label: positive

text: Flying SIA We travelled on the A380 to Singapore. The flight was comfortable as it has a bit more leg room than budget airlines. The return flight was not as comfortable as the seat cannot be reclined properly. I provided feedback after my trip but to SIA credit, they responded to me. Their on flight food was ok, not great. I travelled on many airlines before and most do not have good food in economy class unless you are in first class. You get what you pay for which is fair enough
label: positive

text: Our favourite airline As always our preferred airline and Singapore Airlines did not disappoint. The cleanliness on board is second to none and the hostesses work hard to maintain very high standards. Service throughout the flight excellent. We paid extra for exit row seats and it was well worth it. Will always book Singapore Airlines whenever we can
label: positive

text: Attentive crew, good flight experience despite turbulence Attentive crew, good flight experience despite turbulence. Always smiling and courteous. Topped up drinks. Good selection of in-flight entertainment options.
label: positive

text: Tokyo Haneda to Melbourne via Singapore, we were bumped to an earlier flight in Singapore with the reassurance that our baggages would be transferred to our new flight. Lo and behold, we arrived in Melbourne after enduring a painful flight in an old airplane with terrible food and fault inflight entertainment (had to be restarted twice) our baggages are nowhere to be found. Went to the baggage assistance area and talked to a very agitated agent who refused to explained the situation to us. Very disappointed with Singapore Airlines with this mix up. They are efficient when running smoothly within their protocols but anything out of ordinary reveals poor problem solving.
label: negative

text: Great service I enjoy flying with Singapore Airlines and find the service excellent. Very friendly staff. However, when on a special diet, the food leaves much to be desired. I am on a gluten free diet, but found the food tasteless and very boring . Gluten free does not mean it has to have no taste. And the bread was inedible. It’s possible to make gluten free food tasty.
label: positive

text: as i travel a lot, this trip i will be out of country for 5 weeks on differnt air lines Singapore always deliver. Singapore has one of the most attentive air crew in the business. you never have to request as they are they as you need anthing.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airline surely one of the best in the world, but recently didn't feel the warmth from their attendance as much as used to and others start to invade their friendliness with competing prices as well. still best connection to other countries in the region and their airport is one of the best, if not the best, in the world, so if you have long connection book their in the airport hotel and enjoy really nice but if you have a longer connection they will allow you to take tour of the city regardless if your nationality and in a moderate price surely worth it .
label: positive

text: First trip to Asia I knew it was a long flight but wasn't prepared for how mind numbing it would be. I flew economy, no leg room. If the person in front of you reclines at all they are in your lap. Food was not very good. But they did feed you often and had snacks available. Flight attendants were pleasant. The inflight entertainment had a good selection of movies. I tried to upgrade my seat on the return trip, got a confirmation, but when I went to check in found that the seat had changed to a worse seat then I had originally picked (middle) . They said sorry and to check with the gate to see if it can be changed. Luckily, I was able to move seats during the layover.
label: neutral

text: Dhaka to Melbourne via Singapore, flights operated by A330-300. Check in at Dhaka was fast and professional, the 3rd party lounge there was reasonable. Flight packed but crew were good. IFE good. Did not eat so cannot comment on food. Singapore to Melbourne with a professional crew, the flight was not full which meant crew were very relaxed. Good drink service and tasty food. Bags out in no time.
label: positive

text: Taipei to Singapore. Very unpleasant experience with boarding. They asked to check my boarding pass twice within one minute: the 1st time at the boarding gate, and then at the airplane entrance door. I understood that they did it that way due to their "rigid security policy", but did not train their staff to do it in a professional manner.
label: negative

text: Flight to Singapore Timings from Bangalore are convenient, have travelled 4 times, flight's never been late and very service, average food though, but your best bet when travelling to Singapore ................................
label: positive

text: Service standards are disappointing. My flight was on SQ 298 from Christchurch to Singapore in general for the price of the ticket I expected much better. Food was very poor. For someone with high tolerance in salty food the Chinese dinner meal (rice with pork in gravy) was very salty. Lamb stew served for lunch was undercooked. Choice of meals ran out for both lunch and dinner and entertainment systems were surprisingly outdated (compared to other airlines with touch screen and consoles SIA only had old fashioned consoles). Air stewardesses were decent but not the most helpful or courteous. Having flown SIA and other airlines like Emirates and even budget carriers in recent years I find that the standard of SIA has been poorly maintained and sad to say even though I am a Singaporean who would want to support the main airline of our small country the substandard flight service and appalling customer service I experienced this flight definitely does not live up to the price of its reputation and premium airline tickets. I would not be flying Singapore Airlines again.
label: negative

text: 787-10 Singapore Airlines 787-10 seats configuration for business class is the worst of all their business class seats. It is so small, so difficult to get inside, so difficult to sleep in (even thought it is fully flat) and you will get bruises all over of you try to move around while lying down. And if you are full size, don’t ever think of getting into their seats at all. Choose other plane types and not their 787-10 and you will have a pleasent joirney.
label: negative

text: A Boxing Day treat Flew from Auckland to London Heathrow on Boxing day with Singapore Airlines seated in Business Class. Thanks to it being a public holiday occupancy was only about 25%. This resulted in a very high ratio of stewards and stewardesses to passengers and the service was amazing. Nothing was too much trouble and every request was delivered with a smile. A great day to travel with a great airline.
label: positive

text: Very professionnal team on board! Excellent service, excellent crew, excellent aircraft A380. A peaceful flight in extremely good conditions.
label: positive

text: Good flight Flew Singapore Airline Premium economy, the service was really good friendly and efficient. Really a good quality of service with good quality food. The seats are good and more space available. All in all a good experience
label: positive

text: Short answer: extremely dated and old aircrafts, unpleasant ambiance, cramped seats and broken seats, closed toilets, subpar food. Good attitude of flight attendants. Long answer. The last time I flew SQ was back in 2006 and do remember that it was a very pleasant flight. Since then mostly have been flying Qatar, Emirates, Turkish and many EU/American airlines. First impression, the ambiance of the aircraft is very unpleasant when comparing it to Emirates or Qatar. IFE is small screen with limited choices. No amenity kit of any sort - zero. There was a blanket and a pillow though. One of the toilet from LA to Singapore was closed with an Out of Order note on it, so basically keep waiting for your turn. Food quality is really terrible compared to Emirates/Qatar. No salad or fruit. During the flight no water service. I am used to sitting on 15 hour Dubai flights but never get such pain as this time on Singapore. It is basically now a budget airline but with a 5 star price tag. Even the business class seats look tired and dated. Won't recommend unless you have no choice.
label: negative

text: Overall a Very Good Experience Travelled from South Africa to Bali. Duration of flight 10.5hrs to Singapore and then 2.5hrs to Bali. Slight flight delays was experienced due to bad weather but the captain made it up in the air. Planes are old if compared to Qatar or Emirates Airlines therefore the leg room is less and the economy class movie screens are smaller. A plus is that there is onboard WIFI available which was stable for a good few hours into the flight but it is rather expensive. Service by airhostess was excellent, very friendly and always willing to help. The only downside is that they will wake you from sleep when it is time to eat. I would much prefer to sleep and eat when ready.
label: positive

text: Just meh! Was expecting better from Singapore airlines but premium economy is nothing besides a bigger seat. Food was just ok, No amenities kit, not a great selection of entertainment. The poor passenger in front of me had a seat that wouldn’t recline. Overall it was not worth the price. Definitely have had better experience with other airlines. Only saving grace was the ground staff and flight attendants were wonderful.
label: negative

text: Thank you Erynne I want to acknowledge the excellent customer service provides by Erynne I had booked a week in Phuket with my daughter and had prebooked exit row seats as she is very tall When I checked in online our exit row seats for the first leg had not gone through and there were none available Very stressed and called customer service and spoke to Erynne who called me back after five pm to say he’d been able to change our seats to an exit row Really appreciate his assistance as not only is my daughter very tall but she’s a nurse at children’s hospital who is actually on night shift tonight so will come home in the morning shower then hit the airport Thanks Erynne
label: positive
