text: THE BEST Nothing to say. only UNIQUE you have to travel to see. at the arrival a board, after you seat , Champagne and all the simpaty you can receive. After a Pijamas from GIVENCHY to use and relax and enjoy the trip in you XXXXLarge seat/bed. service /food/Drinks ... all you desire. well teh BEST
label: positive

text: Reasonably good experience Food was fine; Most crews were polite except for one that we encountered. My husband wanted a cup noodles but the crew said it was all gone. But he got it after asking it from other crew. Same with requesting yogurt for my toddler. My toddler didn’t like the kid meal so I asked whether they have yogurt on the plane. She said no. But I got it from asking another crew. FYI, Yogurt was served as breakfast later so there were plenty of yogurt. I could just easily give up my yogurt at breakfast to feed my baby earlier. Apart from that, the experience was fairly good.
label: neutral

text: Comfortable flight Flight was very comfortable. With the Airbus 380 we had enough space for our legs even in the economy class. Also the multimedia was very nice. Service and food was great.
label: positive

text: Very nice On a recent trip from Vietnam to Brisbane, Australia, I decided to try Singapore airlines because they departed and arrived at my destination at a more convienient time than another. I was pleasantly surprised by the service and meals. Booking in took a bit longer and the Singapore airline app takes a longtime to do something. From there on everything was great. Helpful hostesses were on hand for people having difficulty with ridiculosly big, heavy carry on luggage. (I think the weight restriction is not a good idea. People should have to lift their carry on luggage above their heads by themselves). The meals provided were very good, in fact too much. But I guess they have to cater for people who dont like a particular dish. There is a menu and a choice of 2 dishes. The leg room was sufficient. There is also a video screen with your choice of movies or just look at where we are with the GPS. All in all, it was very pleasant trip. A little bit more expensive than some, but by no means exorbitant. Recommend it and will go again.
label: positive

text: DPS-Singapore 28 May 2014. Excellent flight and service. Friendly and efficient staff. B777-200. Singapore - Amsterdam 28 May 2014 B777-200. Although old aircraft again very pleasant and comfortable. Staff very good. Flatbeds - we slept very well. Great flights great airline.
label: positive

text: Good service - tired planes It’s been a few years since I last flew with Singapore Airlines and I have to say I noticed the difference. Tired and old planes have the overall experience a bit of a dampening. I felt the food served was also a bit tired and lacked imagination. The staff were excellent as always and the checkin - both online and on the ground at the airport - we’re both excellent. Overall - an OK experience
label: positive

text: Professionalism I finally understood why this airline continues to win many accolades. The seats in Economy are wide with adequate legroom (for Economy standards). The service is what sets them apart!
label: positive

text: comfortable and enjoyable Good food, no delay, great service with a smile always. Very helpful. Tons of movie and games. Great price.
label: positive

text: Nice sized business class seats The seats were a nice size with ample storage, service was good and we were well looked after. the one critisiem I would make is that being 6' tall the leg space to lie down flat was off set which for me made it slightly uncomfortable on a 14 hour flight. However much better than some other airlines.
label: positive

text: Flying to Europe, 1st leg Brisbane to Singapore - Always good service This is the 3rd time we've flown with Singapore airline and we still enjoy their service. The flight out of Brisbane was on time. We didn't have reserved seats and were given 67J&K and we didn't have anyone else in our 3 seat row so we spread out which was nice. The service by the crew is always professional. They served the meal then the lights were dimmed. They constantly bring water and refreshments around so we kept our fluids up and didn't get dehydrated. The Kris inflight entertainment system is great with heaps to chose from. They have some of the latest movies out so it was nice to watch them. It was only a 7hr flight so nice and short for the 1st hop. The plane landed on time in Singapore to a warm barmy night. Cant recommend Singapore airlines enough.
label: positive

text: Superb Flight was great. Service excellent. Stayed over in Singapore for 10 hours and made use of the free sightseeing trip of Singapore and the SD20 voucher - which we used for the lounge - which was magic and great to freshen up before the long leg home.
label: positive

text: From Perth to Hanoi in comfort What can one say about Singapore Airlines but give them the praise and accolades that they deserve. From the time one checks in their baggage , the service attendants are so courteous and helpful, to ensure our mind are at ease and to ensure our comfort on board will be enjoyed to the full. The on board service hostesses are the best, very attentive and nothing is too much trouble for these beautiful ladies to do for you, as well as all the other on board staff. I will certainly be e using Singapore Airlines in the future whenever possible.
label: positive

text: We travelled on April 26th Brisbane Australia to Singapore then onto Paris. Came back Munich to Singapore Singapore to Brisbane. The trip Brisbane to Singapore very comfortable and the staff were fantastic. The other legs of the journey were OK comfort but found the staff less attentive.
label: positive

text: Long haul As most Aussie’s who have the fortune to fly know, the long haul to Europe is a teeth gritting and keep smiling until it’s over affair. Singapore Airlines makes this just more enjoyable and endurable. Comfy seats, excellent and efficient flight attendants, frequent fluid offers, and ok meals make for a comfy journey. Efficient boarding schedules and kiosk checkins all contribute to an excellent service. And the hot face washers are sooo refreshing. I was extremely late for a flight but they still managed to accommodate me and my luggage without any fuss. Great service and can only highly recommend
label: positive

text: Space between seats. Flew on the new airbus A350 from Singapore to Jakarta and felt like I was on a budget airline because the space between the seats was so tight. The screen on the back of the seat was right in my face and I had barely any space left to breathe when I put the tray down for food service. This is a disgrace especially when you pay a premium price and have to be crowded in like sardines. Normally fly premium economy or business and had no idea things were this bad in economy. Seems like the Boeing 777 had more space in economy. Will definitely not use this airline if they are going to try to squeeze so many seats onto their new planes.
label: negative

text: SQ38 Great Experience SQ 38 on 9th July 2019 Great long haul flight. The crew were fantastic. So welcoming and professional. They are always ready to serve and constantly looking out for our needs. Indeed best airline. The flight was smooth despite some bumpy times but the seats were so comfortable that you can just sleep over the turbulence. Put down the back rest and sleep with the bed. The biz class is so spacious. Well done Singapore Airlines.. and thank you. Looking forward to our return flight.
label: positive

text: Fabulous Airline I have flown Singapore Airlines in the past and been very impressed, but this was my first trip on the double decker. My expectations were more than met. The staff is professional, immaculately dressed, and willing to personally assist as needed. The food was excellent from start to finish, including presentation, taste and variety. I especially appreciated the fact that they didn't over use seasonings. The cabin had tasteful holiday decorations. The bathrooms were well equipped and clean.
label: positive

text: Frankfurt to Singapore was my first trip with Singapore Airlines and the journey was flawless. The staff was nice and helpful, on ground and in the plane, the flight was on time. I had a Boeing 777 on the way in and A380 on the way back, and, since that was my first travel with the A380, I'll focus on this one. First of all, this plane is awesome! It's so massive and super silent. I paid for the extra space seat, which turns out to not be a super good idea. You paiy for more leg room but got an entertainment system in the armseat that is less pleasant than the normal, so, I'd say that's not worth it. But, anyway, service was good, but not extraordinary. Food was not so good to be honest, I was a bit disappointed and the service was nice but, I didn't find anything that stands out compare to any other big airline in my opinion. Seat was ok, I could sleep without too much discomfort, entertainment system was fine, no complaints about it. In the end, I had two nice flights, I really enjoy them but, I didn't find that the Premium Economy in a 5 stars airline was much different that a 4 star one. So, I'd recommend Singapore Airline, but, if you find the same seat category for less money in a less prestigious airline, I'd switch for the second one.
label: positive

text: Just arrived today Jul 31 with SQ892. Flight full, Krisworld connection Wi-fi Inconsistent. Trio Flight attendant serving my row 67A is rude and disrespectful and showing impatient attitude when asking for more drinks and keep gossip nearby galley. Heavy rain and hard landing at 25R at 1345 and long 18 mins taxi docked at gate 5 at 1403.
label: negative

text: Great trip from Male to Changi Having had a ghastly flight from Changi to the Maldives on SilkAir two weeks earlier, I was dreading the return leg however it was 100% different. I'd booked a legroom seat and the helpful attendant said that the whole bulkhead row was free if I really wanted to stretch out, which was great not only for me, but the couple on the front row next to me. The flight was great with good food and super staff.
label: positive

text: Best airline in the sky Economy on Singapore Air is equivalent to business on any other carrier. Seat comfort, food, service, entertainment - all EXCELLENT.
label: positive

text: Flight is old and seats run down. I did not book the Seafood meals, but believe is in my records whenever I travel with SQ. Forget to input my miles. Crew are polite and friendly. Toilet looks old and the seats cover had parts pealing off. Seats cushion not comfortable. Control for the TV screen is not function well - need to press the button very hard. Choice of movies are limited.
label: neutral

text: Best in flight experience First time flying with Singapore Airlines A380. The flight crews are amazing, the service is awesome and very attentive, food and beverage are delicious, on board entertainment also help to make the long journey enjoyable. With Singapore Airlines, it is indeed a great way to fly.
label: positive

text: Good Good flight. Midnight one with children aboard. They are obviously very tired at this time and one fully screamed for nearly 2 hours. Once fed, he fell asleep with not a peep heard. Got a meal at around 1am. And breaky close to landing at Frankfurt. Same boring movies as the previous flight .. food good but even dinner was eggs. Better selection for vegetarians..
label: positive

text: Poor quality in-flight meals served for Premium Economy Class passengers. Quality is no difference from Economy Class. Cleanliness of Toilet can be improved and Premium Economy Seats should be made more comfortable. Selection of movies can be also improved and movies list should be refreshed monthly.
label: neutral

text: Always feel comfortable with this airline I was lucky enough to have 3 seats to myself and as this was an overnight flight I slept the whole way home while my husband had two seats to himself also and as he is over 6ft it made it possible for him to stretch out. The staff are very accommodating and friendly
label: positive

text: Let’s get the food varied a bit! Started in Colombo Economy. Food was very ordinary, especially the tuns and coleslaw (bit like cat food!) chicken with creamy mustard sauce bit rubbery. Service was fine. A group of us were then continuing to Melbourne Premium Economy. Imagine our surprise to get the same menu of tuna etc. Wasn’t good the first time, didn’t want it again within 24 hours. Come on Singapore surely there could have been other food options, VERY disappointing.Once again service good, food very poor.
label: neutral

text: Touch down Flight SQ633 from Haneda Airport to Singapore Changi Terminal 3 landed on 13 Aug 2230 was not smooth. Once the wheel touches the ground, the plane was swinging left to right. Many passengers are swinging left and right. Many are frightened. Hope to have a better landing the next time.
label: positive

text: Questionable service Prior to my flight, I was so excited to be flying with the world’s number one airline. But boy was I disappointed! Hubby and I asked for a drink soon after takeoff, which was not served until well after dinner despite numerous reminders to the cabin crew. Dinner was served on time, but the trays weren’t cleared for the next 45 mins for any of the passengers. Some people made their concerns known, to which the senior cabin crew advised they were working with a new crew and trying something new. But at the expense of the comfort of the passengers? Is it worth it I ask?
label: negative

text: Not as good as Emirates Had a chance to fly first class from London to Singapore on a 777. Whilst the service was very good I thought the cabin and the amenities was not up to Emirates a380 standard. I understand the cabin is smaller but the little things that Emirates do such the little snack boxes make it a better journey
label: positive

text: Singapore airline Good service at the airplane, and amazing airport have many things to do. It is a destination it self
label: positive

text: Good service as always Happy to be flying with SQ again. This time took my son along - so that he can directly experience the service I have told him. Turned out, he was very happy. He liked the movie selections and the sitting arrangement. Furthermore, he had placed a request to be flying SQ again for future trips 😉 >>TK - August 2019
label: positive

text: Very good services and foods Good selection on inflight meals at time of bookings and the presentation of the foods did meet the imaginations and expectations! Cabin crew were attentive and they remembers everyone's last name when you disembark.
label: positive

text: Staff were lovely The plane was clean and the staff were so lovely! Food was good and the movie selection was vast. We had no turbulence.
label: positive

text: Sydney to London via Singapore. First time I've flown with this airline since 1991, and I couldn't fault the flights at all. I'm reasonably tall (5'8") with long legs, but I had plenty of seat room. Service was exemplary, and I liked the extra touches of menus and the little convenience bag, containing socks, toothpaste and toothbrush, and an eyeshade. Food was pretty good, and the entertainment choices excellent. Despite a tight connection in Singapore (50 minutes) I still had plenty of time to catch my connecting flight. I wouldn't hesitate to fly Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: First time to Singapore for my sister. As always a very pleasant flight with attentive crew. The online check-in was so easy. Food and drinks were very good and got to enjoy a couple of movies I had previously missed out on seeing.
label: positive

text: Appalling Absolutely appalling service from cabin crew to the point we were ignored through the entire 13 and half hour flight. Complaint put forward to Singapore Airlines who responded with a generic apology., not good enough especially when my husband experienced bad stomach pains following cold food onboard!!
label: negative

text: Singapore to Yangon with Singapore Airlines and they did not disappoint. Always friendly crew, food was ok but breakfast is not my favorite anyway. The IFE in my opinion had good selection but I think they need to upgrade the moving map, perhaps it is different in a long haul sector but I am not sure. They flew a A330 which was bigger than I thought. Check in was swift and flight took off and landed on time.
label: positive

text: Flight to Hanoi Very clean air craft. The toilets whenever we used them were dry and clean. The cabin staff were extra polite and prompt. The AV system worked well. The diverse entertainment menu was good. The Flight took off on time and landed on time too.The landing was also smooth. Overall a pleasurable experience.
label: positive

text: Very well organised service although I think I would have liked another stop over Well organised flight. I was very impressed with how organised they were with boarding and having flights leave on time. The meals were quite nice - I had Indian vegetarian, although I would say that the food was nicer on the way to London then on the way back. The staff were pleasant. I was also impressed with cleanliness. I'm sure the toilets for instance were cleaned a number of times on the flight. The in-house movies were pretty tired and ordinary looking though. The flight is a very long one so I would like to see an option to have another stopover. I should also say that it was nice that the airline was able to have my baggage put right through to London instead of having to pick it up at Singapore and put it on for the next flight.
label: positive

text: Hoping for change of menu Good service, though a change of menu and a better selection of entertainment would improve the whole Singapore experience. A reliable airline!
label: positive

text: UK trip 2019 This airline knows how to look after their travelers. Check in was easy, the lounge was well set out and staff very pleasant and helpful. The staff on the flights from Brisbane to Singapore and Singapore to London were just fantastic. Very comfortable flight, no jet lag when arriving at Heathrow allowed us to hit the ground running for our holiday in the UK
label: positive

text: Singapore to Perth. Seats are comfortable for economy class. Slight recline. Decent menu - Asian or Western selection. Design of the plane is strange. The entire plane uses a small group of toilets right in the middle of the plane - never heard that many flushes in 5 hours. Good service. Will fly again in a different seat.
label: positive

text: First time with Singapore Airlines This was our first experience of Singapore Airlines, we had heard lots of positives from others that had already flown with them so we had high expectations - these were completely met! We were lucky to bid and be accepted for an upgrade on our outbound journey to Premium Economy, this was excellent, great seats, entertainment, the cabin crew were attentive and their service exemplary. The meal - beef and black bean - was the best thing I have ever eaten on a plane - exceptional! On the return journey we were in Economy but the service levels were no different. Excellent airline, many long haul providers should take note!
label: positive

text: A happy customer I flew SQ890 from Singapore to Hong Kong on 16 August 2019. I would like to commend your staff Mr Heidizayat & his team, for their remarkable customer service that leaves a fond flying experience which definitely captured my attention and loyalty to your brand. Despite changing three times on the headphone, problems still reflected on the sound output system in my seat. While I was about to gave up enjoying the entertainment, Mr Heidizayat and his team patiently searched from empty seat to seats, tested on the audio system till perfection before guiding me to the new seat. Such patient, thoughtful & laudable customer service should be noted and I hope all you can emulate from Mr Heidizayat & his team. SINGAPORE AIRLINES, you are WORLD BEST!! Keep it up!!
label: positive

text: Stupendous Singapore Airlines Food was little of a problem but overall experience is fantastic,,would like to go again.I watched movies and songs and played games to pass time,,speaker phones ,,pillow and sheets also provided,,All crew members were very friendly
label: positive

text: By and large the best flight to take. Having travelled with Thai Airways just a few days before, I could compare both the operators and even though I find the Thai good, Singapore Airlines would be just a notch above the Thai.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines continues to provide consistently high quality on-board service. Cabin crew are always polite, friendly, helpful and professional. Seat design varies according to aircraft type and route. Some work better than others. Lounge quality varies - especially when not operated by Singapore Airlines. Food and beverage quality, choice and delivery remain a very high standard. Cabin service runs like clockwork and team co-operation works well and this shows. IFE was excellent. Priority tags sometimes don't work in that priority baggage arrives anytime - not always first.
label: positive

text: Not as good as Air New Zealand To me the benchmark for business class is Air NZ, and Singapore Airlines has a long way to go to match the service experience they offer. The seat is large, but the lie flat bed is awkward and not as comfortable. Crew onboard were not that friendly and it did not feel like a premium experience.
label: neutral

text: Great Service and Comfort The new Business Class arrangement on long haul flights is great. Plenty of set width and the service, food and overall comfort is excellent.
label: positive

text: Great service that was beyond expectations ! The level of service provided by the crew onboard was unexpectedly awesome ! They were very prompt to attending to the needs of passengers and were all SMILES ! It has made my flight a pleasant and memorable one. I will definitely fly with SIA again.
label: positive

text: We recently flew from Singapore to Christchurch New Zealand. We are frequent Business Class travellers and were extremely disappointed with the service on this airline. The cabin crew were very disorganized although obviously not short of staff. Dinner took a long time to be served. We were not given a sample to taste of the wine we ordered and the wine was poured into a glass in the galley and then brought to our seats without even being put on a tray as were all the drinks such as water tea coffee etc. I woke up early while most passengers were sleeping and the hostess asked me whether I would like breakfast even though we were about 4 hours away from our destination. I agreed but then waited two hours for it to be served. The French toast I ordered was inedible the bread rolls and croissant were cold and hard and the coffee was extremely bitter. The flat beds are uncomfortable and you need the help of the cabin staff to put them up or down. The most disappointing thing was when I reported this to the airline they simply sent back an email saying that "meals are served two and a half hours before landing". I'm not sure what the problem was on this particular flight as our other flights on Singapore Airlines were good. The flight was on 7th February from Singapore.
label: negative

text: Excellent Airline I had never flown with Singapore Airlines before now, but i can say its one of the best. The cabin crew were fantastic. Nothing was too much trouble. The food was fine and the coffee was hot. The inflight entertainment would be my only complaint. There was not much to watch at all. Overall it was great.
label: positive

text: No jet lag after 17 hours flight! Excellent service with lots of entertainment choose from, and movies you really wanted to see. 3 meal choices and champagne. Relaxing time settled in. Pleasantly surprised due to lighting and air circulation no jet lag either in Asia or back home in US.
label: positive

text: Flight service Touched by the service of SQ flight stewardess en route to Yangoon. One of the stewardess addressed me by my name without introduction. She actually over-heard another steward greeting me by my name whilst boarding and registered it in her mind. Although its a small thing only but its the small things in life which really matters, and makes your day great. Well done SIA!
label: positive

text: Ok, but overrated this time Started at airport when the ground staff tried to scammed me with overweight, i said im allowed to bring 40 kilo in business,the wieght scale desk counter was totaly wrong calibrated,and i told them when i showed my hand weight scale and they said i was wrong, and i told to check in another desk and there it was i told them 40 kilo exactly,pls how hard can it be to calibrate the weight scale, and wonder how many they scammed,the flight from Bangkok to Singapore was also a plane change with no flat bed, from Singapore to Copenhagen i felt the staff was stressed to give the food as quickly as they could so they could go sleep, no fill up red wine and no whisky to the dessert,, so nope it fails to be one of the best aircomp in the world will not book again,the wifi didnt work so No No
label: negative

text: Comfort and service 1st half I had a great first flight from Amsterdam to Singapore. The plane travelled in had more legroom than usual and seats more comfortable, the crew were constantly around with trays of water or juice. Each time I got up for a stretch I returned to my seat loaded with snacks which really helped the 6 movies go by. Flight crew were all lovely and extremely friendly, would fly with them again. Main meals were very good. Second leg not so great, legroom almost nonexistent and the seats were nowhere near as comfortable, while the service was still good, this crew were not around the cabin as much and this really let them down, meals very ordinary. Nowhere near as good as the first flight, hence I am giving 4 stars instead of five but overall not too bad for a fully packed plane.
label: positive

text: Dismal hotel arrangement when Singapore airline bump your flights Our flight was bumped by a day, I had to call 4 times before hotel accommodation was finally given for the extra lay over (was supposed to be only a 3 hr stop in Singapore). The customer server rep insisted it was only a 3 hr layover and we had to keep pointing out the date has been pushed out for a day. Wait time for each call was at least an hour. The voucher given to us stated the hotel was $242 USD/night, but it's only listed for $120 on hotels.com. The hotel smelled like wet towel and tobacco, walls were very thin and we could hear next door coughing non-stop. There were food container trays in the hallway. We were told this is the only hotel available, but there were plenty much nicer hotels available. We ended up moving to Marriott (out of our own pocket) down the road, at least 2 stars higher and much cheaper than the price quoted on airline contract. With so many good and available hotels in Singapore there is no excuse for what they put us through. Quite disappointed.
label: neutral

text: Economy good As economy flights go this was pretty good. Boarding take off and landing we’re good and the flight time was quick.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Moscow. When we are about to land, a passenger went into toilet, the Male Flight attendant asked him before he went in “can you hold ?” The passenger shook his head &’went in, subsequently the flight attendant talk to us (all the passengers), this kind of people caused landing to delay. After a while the flight attendant went on to knock on the toilet door & shouted to ask the passenger to come out quickly. Moscow - Singapore 2 Jan 2020. The question is that does SIA inform their passengers how much alcohol they can consume ? I heard a female flight attendant said “he has drank a lot” in Mandarin to another flight attendant. Later the customers in front of me request for drinks & I heard the flight attendant said “this is a plane not a bar”, this is very rude to a customer even you mean well to control consumption of alcohol. SIA has to make a decision, either no alcohol, limited alcohol (informed passengers before booking of tickets) or free flow, find a way to handle it instead of being rude to passengers.
label: positive

text: First class on the 777 Flying Singapore first is such a treat. The 777 only has 4 first class seats and I traveled with my two parents so it felt like we had the plane to ourselves. Food was great, we did the Book the Cook option, and the flight attendant serving us was extremely attentive throughout the 15 hours of the flight. Definitely the best way to get from the US to East Asia.
label: positive

text: The very best !!! Our return flights with Singapore air were exceptional. Once again fantastic service all the way.They also took great care of us, on our return flight that was delayed, due to protests at Hong Kong Airport. Thank you!! I do not want to fly with anyone else and go to extreme measures to fly with Singapore Air to some Destinations, that I know would be quicker and cheaper with other carriers but its Not Singapore Air. Just do yourself a favor and fly with them and you will know what I am talking about. It makes traveling an absolute pleasure. Your holiday begins once you are checking in with them. Thank you for your outstanding Service. Keep it up.
label: positive

text: A LION AMONG ASIAN AIRLINES An air line you can select without fear. Their flying records are clear. This reliable airline has a wide operation network specially in Asia. You can leave all your fear at the Airport and get in to a Singapore Airlines Aircraft.
label: positive

text: Staff and aircraft amazing From check in to reloading in Singapore for Sydney everything was quality. Food was a little weird...Curley or noodles for breakfast, but there was always something for others to eat.
label: positive

text: Excellant Service Both inflight & customer care I flew SQ with my mum who is very old last December to Sydney Australia to visit sister and returned in January I must mention the service was very good.In ground handlings at all places when we needed special assistance it was given Mr Viviann in Sydney Australia has to be thanked especially for this.In flight among the many who took care of us well I have to make special mention of Ms Noel in flight SQ 222.Then Ms Natasya Customer Service Manager who assisted us sorting out many clarifications was of immense help and her conduct was professional & curtious All three I must say are exemplary employees I wish them and Singapore Airlines all the best
label: positive

text: Very impressed with this airline Have flown with most airlines but this one is now my favourite. The staff were very attentive and couldn't do enough for you. Food and drinks good as was entertainment a good choice of films.
label: positive

text: Best airline Super service, entertainment & cabin comfort. Very courteous crew, great seats with plenty of leg room, fantastic entertainment with all the choices you can imagine. It is such a pleasure to fly with them, that I always look forward to this sector of my journey. This is my third trip in the one year.looking forward to the next flight with you.
label: positive

text: business class a350 lucky enough to do this class again and of course everything from check in to the seats is awesome , it was let down by some very average service on board and some sub standard meals but what the hey , you cant beat a lie down seat on long haul
label: positive

text: Happy Holiday Excellent service and very comfortable on A350 900 plane very clean and good movies on the flight Crew very good giving water keeping us hydrated
label: positive

text: Don’t buy Premium Economy for the food Departure from Singapore for Melbourne was on time, however boarding was chaotic. Premium Economy seat was more comfortable, wider and apparently with a greater incline and leg room. I had traveled all of the previous night with a 7:45am boarding in Singapore and the only option on board was a continental breakfast; 5 cubes of fruit, a small burnt croissant but a very nice muffin, inadequate! For lunch I chose oriental style pork: tasteless pork with a very thick sauce, well-seasoned rice and steamed unseasoned vegetables. The sauce (being kind) was so thick it could not be incorporated with any other element of the dish; it was a separate unpleasant gelatinous ‘entity’.
label: neutral

text: Great way to fly, as usual. From check-in to boarding, everything went smoothly. Flight left on schedule. Service with a friendly smile and great selection of inflight entertainment. The food was good by airline standard. Good selection of drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic) and beverages.
label: positive

text: Best cabin crew. Always on time I always flys for business, but nothing like Singapore airlines. What a level of professionality the crew is at. So friendly welling to make ur flight a lively memory. No wonder it is Singapore airlines
label: positive

text: Quite possibly the worst airline company in the world Chaotic scenes and hysteria among the staff at SYD due to downgrading of the aircraft. What’s the point in providing contact information if the company chooses not to communicate with the customers in case of cancellation? No compensation, no lounge access, no upgrade, no apology, no meal vouchers, no nothing, except just go away and wait for five hours. Best airline of the World my ass.
label: negative

text: Singapore hype didn’t stand up to scrutiny I had read so much about how good Singapore Airlines was, however the reality was somewhat different. We flew Brisbane - Singapore- Kuala Lumpur in Business class and I have to say it didn’t meet my expectations as I have flown on many different airlines. The meals had a very limited choice and my daughter’s pre ordered special meal didn’t arrive at all. This wasn’t just a glitch as other customers made the same complaint. The lie flat bed was uncomfortable and no seat covering was offered. On the Singapore to KL leg no alcohol was available for the short 35 minute flight. The Lounge in KL was extremely underwhelming to say the least, it is about the size of a large home lounge room and has one toilet per sex with no amenities. The meal choice in the lounge is very limited, and no champagne! The staff didn’t seem to be in any hurry to clear plates which made the cramped space very untidy. Overall I was disappointed.
label: neutral

text: Tight space, attentive service Overnight flight in an huge Airbus 380 aircraft. However, boarding was orderly despite the large number of passengers. Singapore Airlines offers an attractive alternative to Lufthansa on this route. The flight continues from Frankfurt to Singapore. I was going to Frankfurt. A dinner is served -- a menu card provided. Two entree choices -- no vegetarian option. A small amenity kit provided. Early morning light breakfast provided. Alcoholic drinks complimentary. A good selection of films and other entertainment on the easy to use TV consoles on the back of seats. Power outlets available. Ear phones provided. I was surprised at how cramped the seats were. Should the person in front recline his/her seat, you can neither read, eat, or watch your show. In fact, while serving meals, the flight attendants constantly asked the passengers to get their back seats pulled forward. The plane was late in taking off due to weather problems but arrived on time. You can earn miles on Star Alliance for flying on Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Great flight I flew a late afternoon flight to Singapore and it was good. I was lucky enough to have an aisle seat and it had a decent amount of leg room. The seats were comfortable and certainly wide enough. The inflight entertainment had a very wide range of viewing options, ranging from the latest movies to BBC comedies and documentaries. A lot of Asian and Indian content too, so more than enough to keep you entertained on the flight. The cabin crew were superb (As always with Singapore Airline). They could not be more helpful, cheerful and efficient. A big thumbs up to them. The food was certainly a highlight of the flight for me. I was lucky enough to have, I think it was called Bombo chicken with rice. It was an Indonesian meal and was superb. I mean really tasty and well cooked. For desert was Mrs Beer vanilla ice cream which was certainly a high grade ice cream. The flight was smooth and certainly could not be criticised in any way or form. I will definitely be flying with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: NOW MY NUMBER 1 heres why * Having flown with middle eastern airlines the last 2 years I went back to Singapore for a try. Well I found the business class product better than last time A HUGE IMPROVEMENT! The staff were great, the Sin - Per aircraft was updated from the last time I flew this route 787-10 now. I wanted to fly the A380 from LHR- Sin but was full due to time of year (Chinese new year) so was a bit worried as last time I flew singapore the aircraft was dated and tired looking . However this was one of the updated planes and it was fantastic- I'd say it was one of the best flying experiences in my 30 yrs of travel (incl first class) . I really enjoyed the flight which at 13 hrs is a big plus. The chair was full flat as expected and very comfortable. The ife and The Movies were not as expansive as Emirates but I had work to do so could live with that. The screen was NOT touch screen like the 787-10 which was a pain , I think this has been upgraded now on alot of long haul flights ? I think this is the only let down at the moment they should try and get some more blockbuster New release movies and shows.... Food was top notch I booked the chef and had the lobster (famous for SINAIR ) it was delicious. The wine was good, with Charles Heidseick flowing nicely but I did have to ask when boarded as it wasnt offered with the initial drinks. Had a few hrs sleep no problems and the staff onboard were great with my little kid. The wifi was complimentary but did drop a fair bit but I managed to get a bit done. 5 stars - I'm now won back over, sorry emirates. I will be flying Singapore more often now. WELL DONE on a great product. Singapore lounge is one of my favourite- see my review of it. 5 stars
label: positive

text: Singapore girl....what a great way to fly. Had heard a lot of hype about how good this carrier was and it turned out to be true. Cabin staff very attentive and helpful and the cabin space was comfortable. Good range of tasty meals and drinks to help the time go by.
label: positive

text: Suggestion: Please provide bottle of water to economy passengers. Everything was good....the food, service and entertainment. A major disappointment: they do not provide water bottles to economy passengers on long haul fights. Every time you ask they pour around 100 ml water in a small glass. By the time I reached Melbourne I was dehydrated and fell sick post the flight. I would suggest to buy your own big water bottle before boarding economy to avoid getting sick. Dear Singapore Airlines, you could have reduced some of the so many snacks, instead a good bottle of water would have been appreciated :)
label: positive

text: The most Airline we used for traveling SQ is one of the best Airlines we use to travel every time we go overseas. Why?? The most important is always on time. Even though the price is a bit higher than most of the airlines, but we feel it’s worth it. I am also a member of Kris Flyer. The process of check in is very easy n comfortable. The plane, the food, the service are good. SQ is a very recommended airline.
label: positive

text: Attentive staff make long haul comfortable Check in was fast and efficient and loaded passengers from the back of the plane first. This lessened passengers waiting time to get to their seats while others were stowing their luggage. Much more logical. Attendants regularly came around offering water - not all airlines do this. Economy seats were a little larger and comfortable than others we have experienced. And they still bring the hot towels to you!
label: positive

text: Fraudulent Charges on my Credit Card I book 2 tickets in expedia for S$ 1248. Expedia charge my card S$ 624 per ticket and total sum of S$ 1248 but then Singapore Airlines fraudulently charges S$ 1248 again. I called UOB Bank and bank staff Sanju who was handling fraudulent transaction help line tells me that I need to ask Singapore Airlines to send the message to not to charge this amount. I just hope Singapore Airlines stop this policy to charge again for the booking not made on their website instead made on OTA website. Singapore Airlines can contact me on +65-91808379 to resolve the issue and arrange the refund for the amount not charged or authorized on their website.
label: negative

text: What is all the fuss about. Disappointed with this flight. Thought Singapore Airlines was the gold standard. It was just ordinary. We took off on time which was great as it was a late night flight and arrived ahead of schedule. Premium economy was a small cabin (24 seats) but there was not much to suggest this class and the massive upcharge over economy. The seat recline was quite clever (A350) in that on full recline it slide so as not to encroach too much on the passenger space behind. The noise cancelling headphones were effective and the entertainment screen was larger than in economy with a very good selection of films, music, TV etc. but there was not other amenity except a bottle of water. You could 'book a cook' which expanded the food selection considerably (mainly Asian cuisine though) but nearing midnight, who can face a meal? There were two full service meals. We only had the second one and it was acceptable. The cabin crew did the bare minimum and hid away for much of flight. However, when called, they responded quickly and politely. The wearing of masks did not help their cause, it was difficult to understand them and it felt like a medical flight! The lavatories deteriorated over the length of the flight and things like paper towels etc were poorly managed. I always thought BA were poor but they aren't that bad having now flown Singapore Airlines.
label: neutral

text: Singapore Airlines best way to fly Love this airline because of their service always add a personal touch which goes a long way. Comfortable good entertainment but most important the flying crew are very friendly and approachable .
label: positive

text: Disappointed We recently traveled on Singapore airliner on an 17 hr flight to Asia. With its ticket price I expect a better service than its competitors airlines but am surprised that it has been reduced to average. Other than the hot tower that still remains, the food is average and there is no offer of any snack between meals and very infrequent offer of drinks and no more choice’s of drinks other than water. On the return flight there was a rush to serve meal just before landing.
label: neutral

text: Best & Comfortable travel so far Singapore airlines is one of the best and well known airline in the word.. We had a great and comfortable experience with it while travelling with a kid (2.5yrs old). The staff is extremely warm and helpful, cater to any need of the passengers, spacious aircraft with relaxing seats (& boot space) and hygienic internal surroundings. My parents also travelled to Perth with SA & had a comfortable flight. I always recommend SA to everyone 🙂
label: positive

text: smooth sailing we travel by Premium Economy mostly with our family, and its the best way, the seats are great, big and you can sleep and if the person in front has put their seat down to sleeping you can get out quite easy. the service in this section is good as well
label: positive

text: Not as expected I was looking forward to flying with Singapore airlines. Boarding was ok and the plane was older but clean. The seats were good but expected a bit more padding on the seats given the price. Legroom however was good. I had a special meal which was served an hour before everyone else which was ok. The flight itself was quite turbulent. Some of the flight attendants were polite but others were not. They did offer frequent drinks and kept us hydrated. Why do they insist the window blinds be kept down nearly the whole flight its beyond me. Arrived on time. The experience was good but did expect more from them given they were the best voted airline. Hoping my return journey will be better
label: neutral

text: Flew Singapore Airlines Jakarta to Singapore and back. It’s still a great airline to fly. Seats was still 9 abreast on 777. Food was great. Entertainment was great, but it’s limited compared to Emirates or Qatar Airways but still acceptable. Price was expensive a bit but still worth it. Return flight in the A350 was more greater than this flight. Overall a great flight with SQ and will fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Lapsing sometimes into the ordinary. I can't remember the flight number, but it was the 0720 from Changi. It didn't start well after the Terminal of departure was changed from 3 to 1. The big problem with this terminal, is the gates have no bathroom facilities once you pass security. As we are Kriss Flyer Gold members the boarding was fine and we were soon seated in a new kind of economy seat. They don't seem as deep as the previous ones, but in my opinion, were quite comfortable. An added trial for the crew was the persistent turbulence for the first half of the journey and having to deal with passengers that think the seat belt sign doesn't mean them. This despite the entire crew being strapped in! The meal was adequate and quite tasty, but due to the conditions, the tray remained on your table for a long time. The meal on arrival has really deteriorated into basically a pie! Nothing else but a drink to go with it. Looking around the plane, there were an awful lot of them refused or left. I don't think it is adequate to dish up a dry pie in a cardboard box! It smacks more of Air Asia than a Premier Airline. The crew were courteous and efficient, without being over friendly. Perhaps this is how they are told to behave. Singapore Airlines is still one of the best, but cracks are beginning to show on some flights.
label: positive

text: Great food and staff Very friendly cabin crew and the food was better than same flight with qantas the year before. So full after eating meal . Toilets kept very clean during flight cabin crew happy to assist with eye patches etc firnight floght. The pic is connecting flight to KL don’t have one at Singapore as it was night time and big thunderstorm
label: positive

text: Thankful They were great, l was booked on flights that were departing 3 hrs later than the ones that my friends were on, so when I got to the check in desk extra early with my friends I asked if I could be changed to the earlier flights. Well after a bit of computer checking no problem. And all with a smile and no extra charge which I was expecting. The staff on the flight were just as l thought. Very helpful, helped me with carry on luggage, attended to my requests, meal was tasteful. I would certainly travel with them again.
label: positive

text: Mumbai to Singapore. Great Flight, departed/arrived on time. Excellent service. The hard product was the older seat which was significantly worse than the newer ones. This is because the A330s will be retired soon and replaced with Boeing 787 and A350s. I would advise that if possible you catch the A380 flight which leaves around the same time as it would be a better choice in my opinion especially if travelling in business class. Paid roughly 470 SGD for a return ticket which is a great price.
label: positive

text: Great staff and comfort Great staff food wasnt always good ,they give you hot towels to freshen up,come around with drinks and food through the flight,and you always see them walking around to see if you need anything ,not like some airlines you see sitting down the back doing nothing when not serving food. The entertainment wasn't that great this time not many new movies
label: positive

text: 36 Years Since My First Singapore Flight Still the Best Never had a bad flight with Singapore and despite a long break they still excel. Check in a pleasure and then onto the lounge that was excellent. Good choice of everything to eat and drink. Boarding seamless and expedited. The lovely wide seat and lay flat bed with linen was most enjoyable.singapore seem one of the few airlines able to make food tasty and enjoyable in flight. Transfer at Changi seamless with a top class lounge experience. On arrival in Perth luggage arrived very quickly. All in all they are still the best airline experience.
label: positive

text: When only the best will do I have only ever flown with Singapore Airlines as I find them to be the best whether it is Business Class or Economy they can never do enough for you.
label: positive

text: Excellent As Always Another excellent flight from Brisbane to Singapore and return. Food and beverage service excellent and very comfortable for economy class. Hard to fault this Airline.
label: positive

text: You pay $10,000 for a flight on ANY other airline and … You are on board 45 minutes before takeoff, you are settling in either to do work or to go to sleep because you have precious little time, and you are not besieged with a fully mask policy. Not here. And you are suffocating with masks in a stuffy hot waiting area (and on board). These non-N95 masks do little to prevent anything (half the meetings I just had in Singapore had locals who were suffering from COVID, but I it had been a while since someone in my US world was sidelined). Further, do the epidemiological work of looking at how hyper clean airplane environments provide cleaner air than anything, except perhaps for 100% wearers of N95 masks—and even that is not clear (and, BTW, look around at all the people who are constantly pretending to eat and drink to avoid wearing a mask—who then really believes that masks are doing anything). This is probably a good—maybe great—airline for coach. But for people who pay premium, LET ME OUT of the COVID theater that somehow forgot about the people who pay a little bit extra. And BTW, I am a liberal Democrat who happens to be a fact-based scientist who realizes we need to find a balance between living and an hyper-controlled environment that has kept me from even getting a common cold in the last 3 years.
label: negative

text: Peace of mind on Singapore Airlines As a fairly frequent traveller, I always look forward to peace of mind when doing so, especially as the world is trying to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic. Singapore Airlines gives me that much needed peace of mind, without worries about inefficiency or poor service etc. I really enjoyed my two-way flight between Singapore and New York. The food was amazing on board and the service was excellent as expected. I look forward to flying with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Family reunion We only travel with Singapore Airlines when travelling to Australia, cabin crew are brilliant, friendly and go all the way to accommodate passengers. The service is better than any other I’ve had the privilege to fly with, food top quality and accommodate anyone with dietary needs or anyone who has specific food allergies. The cabin crew make sure that all passengers are comfortable throughout the flight, and also make sure the toilets are spotless during the flight
label: positive

text: Making a trial bearable It's a l-o-n-g way! After doing the trip on Emirates economy last year, I thought that there had to be a better way. SAL economy plus was a great improvement. Even with the occupants in front trampolining on full recline for most of the trip my (6'1") knees had some space. Baggage drop off and boarding were so much better, too. Food was varied, hot and ample, whilst Catherine looked after us in a personal way and made excellent Singapore Slings. The other cabin staff were pleasant and helpful, particularly the manager. The seats, unsurprisingly, became harder by the hour, whilst the economy plus cabin was remarkably quiet, though full. The Airbus on the second leg was much more pleasant than the Boeing 777 of the first leg. On that, all that could be seen out if the window was the wing and, being located near the engine exhausts, the noise was bad. The Airbus seating was in front of the wings and engines. I don't dread the return trip like I did last year.
label: positive

text: Air travel Singapore Airlines Nice to travel. Courtoeus staff. Cleanliness and neatness in saloon of the plane. Good Indian vegetarian food available. Attentive crew members. Recommended for good veg indian food while on Singapore airlines
label: positive

text: Living on Past Reputation Flight to Singapore was good could not fault whatsoever, cabin crew excellent, however to food was appalling not only on the Heathrow to Singapore leg but Singapore to Auckland must do better!
label: neutral

text: Singapore Airlines. Like them a lot This is one slick operation that was run efficiently and effetively from the checkin to the check out. Plane clean, staff good, meals up to standard and level of care high. Really pleased and happy to fly with them again any time.
label: positive

text: 2 flights connecting to Frankfurt from Brisbane Really enjoyed the trip. Seating was great. Good in flight movies and food on the trip. No delays. Good service from the stewards.
label: positive

text: Good flight A380 to Singapore from London, good flight economy seats better than average, service excellent, food good for airline food, plane was really cold though
label: positive

text: You get what you pay for Flight was ok - slept mostly. Stewardess and steward were rather efficient going about their tasks. Friendly, kind of though not engaging, but efficient in meeting requests. Aircraft toilets were not the cleanest. probably passengers were the culprits too. Will be nice to have some air-fresheners or a fan to draw out the staleness. Food quality was ok, beverages were good. Hot towels were a welcome upon boarding and just below landing. Overall flight comfort 8.5/10
label: positive

text: Wonderful service We flew business class with Singapore Airlines from Melbourne to London return in June/July this year. As we have found is usually the case, the service with this airline was fantastic- the staff are friendly and happy to accomodate any request. The food was also top class. The flights were comfortable, with a good range of movie options. This will always be our airline of choice for long- haul flights.
label: positive

text: Always a pleasure We generally fly Air New Zealand who are star alliance partners with Singapore airlines, so often end up on a Singapore flight. The plans aren’t the newest but are always clean and the service from staff is second to none. That’s why this time we booked with Singapore.
label: positive

text: Thrift Air I booked my wife and I on sq136 and 137 round trip to chengdu. At boarding we found the flight was a silk air cattle car complete with a decrepit plane and a useless cabin crew. I agree completely with the previous reviewer who felt the cabin crew was racially biased - on our flights if a passenger were not Chinese you were ignored The return flight is the worst flight I’ve ever flown
label: negative

text: The best plane trip ever From the moment we got on plane till we arrived in Singapore it was like we were treated like royalty Every second we pampered and offered meals and snacks , ice cream , chocolate, chips , nuts meals hot cloths etc They made sure all our need were met and we were comfortable
label: positive

text: Singapore plus upgrade I received an email a week prior to our flights asking if we would like to bid for an upgrade. We did this in good faith only to be charged both bids then receive an email telling us our bid was unsuccessful. The charges are still on our credit card. I am currently trying to get these charges removed. As usual you can’t talk to anyone about it. All communication is via email and you will have to do all the leg work to get these charges removed. Not a good start to a holiday. I have since canceled all further offers as it’s not worth the hassle. We went with Singapore Airlines because we thought they were the best. 🤔
label: negative

text: unbelievable ,extremely poor service when asking for a quotation. my wife and i are planing a trip to melbourne in march ,we were also going to visit family in new zealand for a few days but as it became apparent singapore airlines could not offer any flights to or from wellington ,they said that they had no partner airlines and no code shares so we would need to make our owm arrangements from wellington to melbourne.we were very keen to fly with singapore airlines and especially in the wonderfull suites and keen to book with only one company we decided to drop the wellington part of our trip and simply fly london to singapore, stay at the fullerton hotel for a 3 night stop off then go to melbourne for 18 days with friends then back to singapore for 4 nights at raffles , then back to london. the problem started when i telephoned singapore airlines and passed on my itinary, the chap that i spoke to obviously had trouble understanding what i was trying to say , and i really struggled to understand him. i was put on hold a number of times and when i suggested that he lookup the details and call me back , he said that it was not possible .when i received an email it had not included the hotels that i had requested ,so i sent an email to ask why, I was told that singapore airlines could not book the fullerton hotel so i would have to book it myself ,i then asked to stay at the manderine oriental hotel and again i was told that i would need to book this hotel myself as singapore airlines did not offer this hotel. i m not sure if that is true or if the person dealing with my enquiry just could not be bothered,but i was sent a link to a list of hotels that i could choose from.i was astonished as all of the other airlines that i had sent the same information to had replied with no problems, and because we wanted to travel on a single booking i did not want to book a separate hotel.i sent a complaint to singapore airlines and not only did they not take me seriously but if anything the service got even worse.each time i emailed it took at least 2 days for them to reply ,even though they sent an immediate acknowledgement. when they did reply it was as if they did not understand that all i wanted was a quotation that included the items listed on my enquiry . finally after 9 emails i received a telephone call from a member of staff who seemed to imply that it was probably my misunderstanding before hanging up just as i started to speak. i have sent a follow up email stating that i feel that it was probably time to move on and spend my £19,000.00 with another airline, but i have received no more correspondance . it is a real shame because as i explained to singapore airlines on a number of ocasions, we were both really looking forward to traveling in the wonderful suites.
label: negative

text: Only one issue The actual flight was great, the crew were attentive and the service was excellent, I would definitely recommend them for any flight except one that traverses Istanbul. Being part of the star alliance I had expected to have my suitcases transferred but instead had to pay a fee for a Visa to enter the country, just to pass through the airport, collect my cases and then check them back in. I actually booked the flights because of the star alliance and was very disappointed.
label: positive

text: The way to travel on your own! The whole journey went smoothly with excellent staff and food. Although a connection was missed from Singapore to London there was no issue being but on the next flight an hour later.
label: positive

text: Good food and great cabin crew. We asked to see the suites, and they let us, after people have left the airplane. Our platypus got some champagne!
label: positive

text: They are running some kind of scam in the airport My trip started in New Delhi where my 2 checked bags where checked in all the way to Johannesburg. I arrive in Singapore where I have to get a boarding pass. Cathway Pacific couldn't print it for me. I go to the transfer desk and show the lady my passport, and ticket information from Cathway Pacific. She informes me that I need to pay for one of my bags, the ones that are already checked all the way to Johannesburg. Not wanting to argue I say sure and pull out my credit card. She then informs me it has to be cash. 150 US dollars, well I don't have 150 cash on me. When I travel I use credit and carry very little cash on me. So she tells me to go to an atm, or go out and clear customs and security. Which is a real hassle in of its self. So I leave and clear customs, and security go all the way out to the ticket counter. I arrive and hand the lady my passport and Cathway Pacific paper work just like at the transfer desk. The lady asks me if I have 2 bags, I reply yes ma'am and she prints my boarding pass. Just like that no mention whatsoever about a fee. The fact that this lady wanted cash and only cash makes me think she is scamming customers who fly with Singapore airlines. So be warned if you are transferring through Singapore.
label: neutral

text: Comfortable flight I travelled home from Vietnam a couple of days ago via Changi. Great service, comfortable seat/bed, the meal I had was very good & we were lucky to have very little turbulence. The Airport transactions were also done efficiently . I Would definitely fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Like flying with family This is our go to airline as it is very hard to fault their efficiency & service. Their price is competitive for the service level.
label: positive

text: Still a good choice to fly with but call centre is absolutely useless After reading some of the horror stories on here, I was a bit worried, but my flights went smoothly, and as a gold Velocity member was able to enjoy the Sydney SilverKris lounge prior to my outbound flight, as well as the recently renovated KrisFlyer gold lounge in Changi T3 which is now greatly improved. I travelled on a B777-300ER outbound and Airbus A350 for the return, both in economy and found both to be clean and in good order. The cabin crew were friendly, professional and attentive on both flights. The only real change post covid-19 was the food was not as plentiful as before, and no hot towel was provided. In particular on SQ221, the overnight return SIN-SYD, it was annoying that only dinner is now served - they used to also serve a light breakfast prior to the arrival into Sydney - even a coffee would have been better than the nothing which was provided. While they are great in the air, they are horrible with customer service over the phone to organise/manage bookings. I was making another booking and there was a website error, and when I called the Australian call centre, they wanted to charge an extra couple of hundred dollars or so than the price the website was displaying, saying their system was what mattered and it didn't matter what the website was saying. Isn't advertising a price and then not honouring it illegal under Australian Consumer Law? As I was in Singapore, I was able to visit them in person, and there thankfully they were sensible and realised I should be charged the price the website says even and were able to override their back-end system which said no availability at that price-point. I don't know what I would have done if I hadn't been able to visit in person though; I probably would have referred them to Department of Fair Trading or the ACCC or similar for advertising a price on the website as being available, and refusing to honour it when you get to the very final step of payment.
label: positive

text: Great start to holiday Friendly check in and luggage check in and from then on all else went well. Spare seat between us was a bonus. Service was great during flight and always informed of updates and timetable. Entertainment system state of the art and worked well whole time.
label: positive

text: Experienced warmth n care when I was unwell While flying Singapore Airlines..I experienced a very good service from all the staff.They were so polite and always had a smile . I want to especially mention one particular air hostess..Her name is Penny. After I boarded my flight I began to feel unwell..I started getting a migraine ..a very throbbing pain in my head and even vomiting...I was not in a position to turn my head or even speak.. Penny noticed this and gave me comfort without even asking for it..she gave me warm water and I asked her for a headache pill..... I want to thank Penny for her warm caring nature. Thank you Singapore airlines
label: positive

text: Great airline Singapore airline is a great airline ; can’t fault them at all ; have flown with them before and will continue to do so
label: positive

text: Usual high standard maintained No fuss. The usual high standard from SIA. They are accommodating enough not to turn away passengers in the later boarding group. But steward/stewardness are well organized that these minor hiccups are not a hindrance to on-time departure.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines still has not reimbursed me for my lost bags back in early January. After fighting them for months they finally agreed to give me some money for losing my stuff. They approved it back on May 18th. They said please allow a month for final approval. Here it is July 17th and still nothing. Singapore Airlines has by far the worst customer service I have ever seen. Please do not fly Singapore Airlines.
label: negative

text: My Trip to Bangkok, Thailand on SIA Great Airline to fly with to any destination. However, I find that being serve cold bun, that coms along with the meal, is not really appertizing. I believe many passengers would prefer having warm bun over cold bun. Other than that, the meal is quite good. The inflight entertainment movies should be updated more frequently with latest.
label: positive

text: Memorable and first ever experience with A-380 What a fabulous service and aircraft !!! Spacious seats,warm friendly staff, ample food and drink options and clean cabins. Love the fact that it was comfortable seats and enough leg space and maintained time schedules of flights. Love this airline carrier, and chose to travel again with it, in August 2018,with my entire family.
label: positive

text: delicious food and right on schedule I have the pleasure to experience their economy promo return flight to tokyo before at nov 2018 and it is very convienent. so at this time i am joining their hospitalty again and have the opportunity to taste their delicious food and right on schedule (at least they try because of the heavy traffic for departure from Jakarta Airport).
label: positive

text: My flight on 14 March 2023 was scheduled to depart SFO at 9:30am, but was delayed due to heavy winds. Understandable. Less understandable was the disorganized response, which included vague instructions on updates, a lack of transparency on continued delays after weather cleared. The flight departed late and I was told that my luggage would be on my connecting flight, but when I landed in HKG it was not. When I contacted SIA they refused to offer me any compensation for my delayed flight, and asked for an e-ticket number for my original Scoot ticket (e-ticket numbers are nowhere to be found on Scoot ticket receipts or in the booking on the app, which disappears after your flight date). Everything they did to help was simply a deflection of responsibility.
label: negative

text: Nice flight from HKG to CHC We recently flew to Christchurch, New Zealand with Singapore Airline with a layover in Singapore. The flights were good across the board. Flights were booked online at the Singapore Airline website, email confirmations were received in a timely manner. Check-in at HKG was quick and easy. Our first flight between HKG and SIN departed and arrived on time and was comfortable. In-flight meal was ok, movies and other entertainment fine for a 3 hour flight. Layover at Changi Airport was as good as it gets. This is a great airport when it comes departure area and in-transit experiences. Orchard gardens, butterfly gardens, koi ponds, Osim chairs and other comfortable seating throughout the various terminals makes for a relaxing place to await outbound flights leaving Changi Airport. Our second flight from SIN to CHC was really good. Departure and arrivals were on time. Seats comfortable with plenty of leg space, allowing decent rest during the long flight. We slept surprisingly well during the flight. Meals served were decent, in-flight entertainment was sufficient with a good mix of movies and TV shows. Immigration processing was quick in Christchurch, luggage was received no longer then 20-25 minutes after we had disembarked, customs were cleared and we were picking up our rental vehicle in no longer than 40-45 minutes after arriving. Overall, this was a seamless and good overall flight experience with Singapore Airline.
label: positive

text: Excellent, no hesitation in flying SIA again Having read reviews in advance I was a little concerned that my SIA experience would not live up to expectations …….. I had nothing to worry about. Economy extra leg room LHR to SIN with a 4.5hr layover then SIN to AKL ….. same on return but with a 4 night stay in beautiful Singapore. The service levels throughout were excellent from the cleanliness of the cabin, the poised & professional cabin crew who work very hard, the food service and quality right through to baggage handling. Everything worked like clockwork without a hitch. Wherever possible SIA will be my carrier of choice in the future.
label: positive

text: There's a reason it keeps getting rated the best airline in the world I flew from Bali all the way to Houston with two very short layovers in Changi and a quick transit in Manchester. The premium Economy seats are large and comfortable. They don't lie flat but I was able to sleep just fine. The entertainment screens are huge with tons of options. The staff is so kind and attentive. I was able to order a vegan meal that was quite tasty. I always book on Singapore if it's available.
label: positive

text: Not as good as they were. Used SIA from NZ to London and return in July/August. Do not think they deserve there high rating. Staff are very good but it stops there. Food very average and not to all tastes. Thought the cost of premium economy was way to high for the little benefit of bigger screen, more leg room, better headphones and drinks. Foftunately only paid for the upgrade on the leg from London to Singapore ( which is 14 hrs ) so got it at a lower price. The premium Economy was only 3/4 full yet the Economy was full tells you something.Also costs to pick a particular seat in economy was also too expensive if you wanted to do it early. Did think there online App helpful but most airlines have that now.
label: neutral

text: Best experience ever! Ifedi had the best experience with Singapore airlines best service and amazing stuff you are on s business coast or bot they all make you feel special and very looked after. Thank you for a very nice relaxing trip I recommend to everyone no matter what class that will be.
label: positive

text: Very nice flight Had a great flight. Everything on time and the staff were very helpful. The plain was nice and clean & legroom good. Food was above average - I don’t really like Airline food but this was nice. Served with a choice of drinks plus beer or wine also. Will definitely use Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Great airline Very attentive crew, comfortable seats, food was really nice, loved the hot towels, did not like the long journey
label: positive

text: Trip to Portugal, Spain , France, Ireland and England We enjoy the flight , meals is our taste because we chose asian menu . Only flying time is not suit with our sleeping time. That is day time and reach London over our sleeping time. May choose night time flight for future. No amenity goody bag.
label: positive

text: Birthday Celebrations Professional as always , great flight and service from start to finish .Can’t wait to travel again at Christmas.
label: positive

text: Still Worlds Best Airline All aspects of the flight were great. Boarding friendly and efficient, departure on time, very modern and immaculately clean aircraft, best legroom, excellent on board entertainment system, cabin crew were friendly and efficient, good menu, excellent drink selection, smooth flight, arrival on time. We would highly recommend.
label: positive

text: A better than average experience check in was very good, had a stop in Singapore and had to change terminals, very easy and well marked. Seats ok but not as comfortable as I expected and legroom a bit tight however a huge improvement on economy. Premium Economy still have to share toilets with Economy. Staff could have been more friendly. However polite just a little aloof. Would definitely fly with Singapore again.
label: positive

text: Lovely staff but take some food! On a 13.5 hour flight we were only fed twice: breakfast at take off and supper before landing! No snacks brought round except water! The food was nice when it did come. Otherwise lovely staff; pretty standard cabin leg space, film choices etc. Singapore airport is very pricey! Most expensive pack of mints ever bought from WHSmiths!
label: neutral

text: Singapore to Bangkok return. Staff are friendly and helpful. However on this flight, service seems rushed. It felt that they were rushing to complete many tasks. Although it didn't affect me, their stress didn't give me a very relaxed feel. Knowing that this a short flight, I can understand why they were rushing to complete tasks. If they can mask that stress, that will be perfect. This was an older aircraft so the entertainment system was a bit dated. It didn't bother me much as I had my own book to keep me occupied on the journey. Overall, it was a good flight.
label: positive

text: Great Service! Staff cannot do enough to help you. We did have a problem with a headphone connection and they couldn’t do enough to make us happy. Always feel safe on their flights as their service record is good.
label: positive

text: Attentive Cabin Crew My wife and I were on our way home from a 6 week cruising vacation to Indonesia and Australia. We now find that we need to have Mobility Assistance when we travel and we were looked after very well from check in to the lounge. Whilst the food was not particularly to our liking in the lounge it did not bother us too much. At an appropriate time we were collected and wheeled to the A380 aircraft departure gate and onto the aircraft; all this went very smoothly and we were welcomed aboard and looked after. The seat arrangements vary so much on different airlines, especially when the seats are converted to beds and this is where I had a problem. The 'cubby hole' where my feet would reside when laying down was too small for me so was a little uncomfortable but suited my wife very well. It is a long flight and food and entertainment was very acceptable, but that is what I have come to expect from this airline. On arrival at Heathrow, we were dealt with very proficiently by the waiting PRM service and soon gathered our baggage from the carousel. We have always rated this airline and continue to do so after this flight.
label: positive

text: SQ306 16/10/2014 SIN-LHR. I recently had a block of five flights with Singapore Airlines. The first thing you notice is that they have a modern fleet of aircraft's the cabins are fresh and clean and importantly use the latest technology for passenger use. The service is extremely good onboard the stewardesses are very friendly and efficient as they serve passengers and smile which makes a big difference. The new aircraft's have the better seats they are quite wide for economy the backs give good support but the most important thing for me was the cushioning it seemed about right and after a 14 hour flight on a 777 I found it to be one of the best seats I have sat in on a plane. All flights were very good and I would use them again.
label: positive

text: Outstanding service Very good comfort and exceptional service served by the professional SQ crews onboard. Foods quality is not bad but sleeping on the bed during the flight is nice. Enjoyed seating by the window. Enjoyed Singapore sling and lamb chops. Mee Siam is ok but needs improvement. Was hoping to book the cook - hainesese chicken rice but heard from friends that it's just average. I wish to let you all at Singapore airlines know what can be improved for hainesese chicken rice - apparently more flavour? 🙏😃🇸🇬. The SIA lounge at terminal 3 was very good and got a lot of food choices to choose from. I would definitely recommend to anyone to try Singapore airlines as it's unique air experience. I have been flying with SIA quite a lot and will still use this airlines at some point in future.
label: positive

text: A350 uncomfortable seats Airbus A350 economy seats the hardest and most uncomfortable I have ever had to sit in. If Singapore Airlines staff read this, I suggest they travel economy on an A350 and see for themselves. Of course, when they travel, they fly premium or business so would have no idea. I will never in future travel on a flight using A350
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines lived up to its incredible reputation. The flight attendants, especially the purser, were fun to interact with throughout the flight. The beef rendang choice I had was delicious and the wine and champagne served was truly in-flight dining at its best. The in-flight entertainment had quite a selection of current movies, so we had plenty of options to keep ourselves entertained. We were staying overnight at the Aerotel and the purser gave us some water and slippers for us to have on our journey. Although the cabin was pretty full, the cabin crew made us feel like we were on our own private jet. I'd highly recommend Singapore Airlines, based on this experience.
label: positive

text: Premium Economy Used SA flying to and from Amsterdam/Auckland. We were quite happy with our choice (Pre,ium Economy. Lots of free leg space and very relaxed (2 window seats). Very nice personnel and good food with very nice selections (mostly rice/Nasi). We loved it. Frequent visit by cabin crew with additional food and drinks during the 4 flights (forth and back). We will definately choose for Premium Economy again next time when flying long distances.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines: Simply the Best!! 3/31/19 we flew Business Class on Singapore Airlines Flight 31, an Airbus A350-900, nonstop from San Francisco to Singapore. At check in, the agent stepped from behind the counter and greeted us warmly. Check in was a breeze and we were soon on our way to the United Polaris Club at SFO (No Silver Kris Lounge any more at SFO). I took a hot shower, changed into comfortable clothing for our long flight, and joined my wife for breakfast.
