We were greeted at the door of the aircraft by the very friendly Singapore flight crew who escorted us to our seats in the beautiful Business Class cabin. We soon had a welcoming drink in hand (a mimosa) as we explored our seats and the extraordinary variety of entertainment options. The cabin is very comfortable and quiet. Within an hour after takeoff from SFO, we were served our dinners which had been pre-selected through Singapore's "Book the Cook" option. The appetizer, entrée (NY steak with asparagus, carrots), and dessert (a wonderful mango pana cotta) were all delicious. Mid way through the flight, I had the Chinese chicken stir fry (again, delicious). Finally, prior to arrival, a final light snack was served. This was the longest flight we've ever taken anywhere at 16 hours 45 minutes. But throughout the flight, the attentiveness and kindness of the crew made every minute of this epic flight most enjoyable. This is what an airline should be. We can't wait to fly with Singapore again some day.
label: positive

text: One of my favorites Everything about SA is well done. On time service, quality of the airplanes, meals (!!!), and their personnel. Really a great airline, probably one of the 3 or 4 best in the world.
label: positive

text: A great experience We took the flight from Delhi to Singapore and Visa-Versa. Both the time it was a great experience travelling with Singapore Airlines. From ground service till Cabin Service it was simply best. For us, the seats were comfortable. They provide all kind of amenities like a blanket, a pillow, earphones, earbuds etc. Cable staff were friendly and welcoming, and always ready to accede to your requests. Inflight entertainment was also excellent. As it is a Full-Service carrier, they offered complimentary Food and beverage as well. We got the option between Indian and Continental meal. I will suggest, post-booking the tickets, please update your meal preference so that they can arrange the same accordingly and you can enjoy your meal. They have multiple food options. Few suggestions for Airlines. 1) Please make the TV screens angle adjustable so that any person can adjust the screen as per his/her need. Also, remote buttons are hard to press. Please replace those faulty remotes. 2) Add more collection in the Indian movies sections. 3) I have booked 4 Indian Non-Veg meals, but both the time received only three as it was finished. Please have sufficient meals at least for those passengers who pre-booked their meals. Rest it was very good experience travelling with Singapore Airlines. In future, we would love to fly again with them because of their great hospitality.
label: positive

text: Going on holiday As usual Singapore Airlines service was flawless, from check-in to baggage claim. We had great seats in the exit row. My least favourite thing was the food. It could definitely be better.
label: positive

text: Great planes - quiet and we are tall and seats had good space to stretch Their plans are nice and quiet and good leg space and actually comfortable seats for such a long journey. Actually first time I and my wife have slept for more than a couple of hours (seven) due to cramped conditions or hard seats. Service is exceptional on this airline and staff very nice. Not a lover of airline food but some dishes were very nice but to avoid jetlag we normally only eat very small amounts.
label: positive

text: Check in was quick and efficient as expected with Singapore Airlines. Lounge access was the Virgin Atlantic Clubhouse, which at that time of day seemed to be devoted to SQ passengers. Lounge service was excellent, with a good selection of food and drinks. Boarding was on time and very efficient, with a personalised welcome on board.. settling in was very easy, as there is so much storage available at the seat and above. Pre take off drinks were offered, but only fruit juice and water, no champagne. No amenity kits offered except by request. Food and drink orders were taken immediately after take off, and serve with sosatie appetisers. Meals were served not long after with a varied choice of mains. Book the Cook is not available ex Johannesburg, and also whilst it is possible to preview the menu, it is not possible to order. Not a problem for us, as we were near the front. Decent wines were on offer, although a somewhat limited choice. Food was good, as was the service. The seat is very comfortable and notably wider than most. Flor sleeping it is necessary to fold down the backrest to create the bed, which is easily done, although attendants were quick to help. The drawback to the bed is a small cubbyhole for the feet offset from the bed, although in use this was not a particular problem, and wwe both slept for most of the flight. Breakfast was offered as and when people woke, and arrival in Singapore on time. As usual immigration was a breeze. Our only downside was we found the entertainment system difficult, but this is probably an age thing. Overall a very good flight
label: positive

text: Despite some allegations of cost-cutting measures surfacing across the internet and social media, Singapore Airlines is still unequivocally and undeniably the best in its class. In an era of self-check in kiosks and self-serve apps, the human touch it provides to all its passengers is remarkably special and the warmth and comfort of the human element is something that is irreplaceable by technology. The cabin crew truly went above and beyond to ensure that the passengers were well looked after. In addition to that, every other aspect of the flight from the checking-in process, lounge, boarding arrangements, punctuality, cabin announcements, seat comfort and functionality, meal service, inflight WiFi and timing and baggage delivery was also seamless and flawless. Flying in Singapore Airlines on a premium cabin is truly and quite literally a heavenly experience at 40,000ft in the sky.
label: positive

text: Flights I travelled on Singapore Airlines and I would highly recommend flying with them comfy seats plenty of legroom and movies galore. Food was very good and plenty of drinks and snacks if wanted I will be flying with them again
label: positive

text: Wish they would improve their Singapore - Maldives planes Have flown them many times and funny enough their plane going from Singapore to Bali was the newly style compared to the old planes used for the Maldives >< Singapore route. They charge a good fare for the flight and would imagine flying better planes for such a luxury route. Hope the new airport in Maldives would sort this issue.
label: neutral

text: Awesome flying experience Singapore Airlines... Enjoyed the service... air hostesses are so humble and down to earth... Singapore airlines allowed to choose our seats as well as suitable food through online. Loved the atmosphere... Individual LCD screen display movies, cartoons with different languages... Rest rooms are neat and tidy. Announcements are clear. Toothpaste, tooth brush, socks and blankets are provided. Singapore-Melbourne-Wellington service is started operating four times per week as SQ247 started from 3 May 2018. Return services operated as SQ248 on a Wellington-Melbourne-Singapore routing. Flights are with 266-seat Boeing 777-200s fitted with 38 Business Class seats and 228 Economy Class seats.
label: positive

text: Not what it used to be We have used Singapore Airlines many times as it flies direct out of Adelaide. Our flight over was fine even though the food was truly awful. On our return flight our bag was being transferred from a connecting flight from Vientiane for our flight back to Adelaide. We made it back fine but no luggage. Our bag has not yet been returned even though I have an air tag inside it and I have provided Singapore Airlines with a photo of where the bag is located in Changi Airport. It is so frustrating to know exactly where it is and has been since we landed there and yet still get the standard line...we are still trying to locate your bag. I wonder if any one actually looks? Our positive view of the Airline has collapsed as a result.
label: negative

text: Good Airline. Enjoyed flight with Singapore Airlines, they service on the plane was good and the food was excellent.
label: positive

text: Best Simply the best airlines of this era. Good food. Nice comfortable seating. Take off n landing on time. Best behaviour of crew
label: positive

text: Incredible Service and Tasty Meals If you are traveling for leisure internationally, Singapore is a great option. Not only were we able to score some pretty cheap airfare, the service was amazing. The service began at the check-in, where the employees were very respectful and helpful. Once the flight began, they offered hot refreshing towels. During the flight the team members were very receptive to customer requests and they served 2 meals, one right after take-off and one before landing. Free beer and free wine as well.
label: positive

text: Perth -Singapore-Frankfurt-New York. LA-Tokyo-Singapore-Perth Singapore to Frankfurt was a long flight, especially with tweens but the service and inflight entertainment along with the food was great and made it that little bit more enjoyable. If you can afford the upgrade to at least Premium Economy - do it.
label: positive

text: It was actually my first time going to Auckland in a A350. My Sister's TV screen was not working and they immediately fixed it. This is what I call efficiency. When we took off, about half and hour later, the cabin crew started breakfast service. I chose the nasi lemak and orange jucie. Very good! Only downside was that it was supposed to be fried chicken but the chicken was breast meat. But I don't blame them for that. Cabin crew were extremely friendly. Food was very very good too. I definitely enjoyed the flight.
label: positive

text: Somehow disappointed on the leg Singapore to Auckland , but quite Happy on Singapore to Paris Singapore is supposedly the best airline, We had 2 connecting flight Paris to Singapore and Singapore to Auckland . The set up of the planes are unusual . The service on the first leg was excellent , and on the second leg it was not as good. The food is good but nothing more. . This was a round trip and the the checking on the return ( from Auckland) was poor with a person who hardly spoke English and not sure about what she was doing.
label: positive

text: An okay flight. Good but nothing out of the ordinary. Expected more from this top airline. Service was average and the meal ordered for my wife did not happen.
label: neutral

text: Good way titanic Always a pleasure to fly with Singapore airlines. Ground staff and crew staff most helpful. Food very enjoyable also.
label: positive

text: Overseas Travel The flight was very nice and considering the time on the plane, the attendants made it quite bearable. The attendants are very professional and nicely dressed in traditional fashion. The only downside of the entire experience is the airlines website. I had difficulty trying to check in and get seats. the "manage your booking" tab does not always get you to the correct link.
label: positive

text: Stingy Rich Asians-lah We booked award travel tickets using Kris Flyer miles. Afterward we realized there was another flight available for award travel which would be a better fit for our schedule. Within an hour of original booking, we called Singapore Airlines to request that we change the booking to the more convenient flight. Even though only a short time had elapsed, the airline demanded $50 per person change fee. We asked for a supervisor to reconsider, but the supervisor also refused to waive the change fee. This airline offers a good in-flight product, on par with regional rivals EVA and Cathay Pacific. However, when it comes t extracting fees from travelers, they are just as smarmy as any other carrier. Be careful here, if you make a mistake you will pay for it. Lah!
label: negative

text: Great flight Always like flying with Singapore Airlines. The staff are very nice, and you usually take off on time. This time I found the meal service just a little chaotic, but otherwise nothing to grumble about. Bonus is that I think Changi airport one of the best in the world, so hanging around waiting for your flight is not so bad!
label: positive

text: Dubai to Melbourne via Singapore, and a fantastic flight. The flights departed on time, the cabin crew were polite, and the IFE was up to date with the latest box office movies. I have noticed an improvement in the Singapore Airlines inflight meals, which was a welcome surprise.
label: positive

text: Customer service The Cabin crew on this flight were magnificent. I've flown business class with other airlines, however Singapore Airlines out performed the other operators that I have used. This was my first flight with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Good night Took the almost 11pm flight from SG to Tyo. There is refreshment soon after the plane take off on auto mode. They served me cool wrap since I choose my diet. Not sure about those served by the trolley. After everything is cleared, the cabin lights were dim. Time to sleep. Aircon is just of the right temperature. Slept through till about 2 hours before landing, we had breakfast. Warm eggs with vegi sides & buns. Enjoyed the night on the plane.
label: positive

text: Excellent as udual Love flying SQ for work when I am not paying. Always efficient and reliable from ground to air and back again. Top notch service (warm food, warm bread buns, clean toilets) and Changi Airport .. where do we begin? Nothing makes you more appreciative of our national carrier and our airport terminals than when you travel overseas. Nothing beats Changi and SQ in my book. NOTHING!
label: positive

text: Super! Once again had a very pleasant flight with Singapore Airlines to Copenhagen and also on the return trip from Heathrow London. I prefer the window seat in business class, it seems to be more comfortable. Service from the cabin crew is excellent.
label: positive

text: Nothing premium about premium economy I booked premium economy as I wanted more leg room and a foot and calf rest. I have a disability and need to be comfortable. Staff were excellent on boarding and I was shown to my seat. Leg room was good and seat seemed comfortable. However there is nothing premium about premium economy. After takeoff we were given a snack, but nothing to drink. I asked if I could have a drink and was advised that drinks would be offered later. Why would I want to eat a snack with nothing to drink. I waited and waited. There was no bottle of water in the seating area which should have been there. After 1 hr and 20 mins finally it looked like drinks were being offered. Juice or water only. Me and my husband were missed out. We thought they would realise so waited patiently. Staff had got to economy when I got up and asked if I could have a drink as we had been missed. After waiting nearly 2hrs we finally got a drink of orange juice. Another round of drinks was offered later again juice/water tea or coffee. After nearly 5 hrs we were again offered juice or water. I asked for wine by that stage as sick of juice. To the staff members credit he got it for me. Dinner was offered with a bottle of water only. Once the trays where cleared about finally the drinks trolley with champagne was offered. My seat did not recline correctly and my TV froze twice. The staff are all lovely but there is nothing premium about premium economy. Not enough staff and very slow service. They clearly do not want to offer more than 1 alcoholic drink on an 8hr flight. The seat eventually reclined with the help of staff and was comfortable. Will never pay the cost for premium economy. As no premium food, service , and dirty toilets. The foot rest is poor and the calf rest only very minimally offers support. Emirates premium economy if far superior.
label: negative

text: Chennai to Los Angeles via Singapore. I have been flying this route on Singapore Airlines for about 30 years. Although the overall level of service is good there has been a decline in passenger facilities and comfort. Their Business class lounge in Chennai is a joke with about 20 seats in a small enclosure resembling a neglected warehouse. The seats on the Singapore - Los Angeles segment are flat beds but they are difficult to operate. Most people needed assistance from the flight attendants to switch between the flat bed and regular seating positions. Meals are ok but nothing great. The in flight entertainment is below average. There is the annoying halt for just over an hour in Tokyo where all passengers have to disembark and go through security before re-boarding the aircraft. Overall Singapore Airlines will no longer be my first choice carrier unless they attend to these issues.
label: negative

text: Excellent trip, very comfortable , good entertainment, food ok and lounge very good Yet again, very good flight, comfortable, food ok and entertainement very good..the lounge at Singapore, very good..thank you for making us feel, yet again very welcome..staff not as good this flight, have to say..but nothing to worry about..just not as friendly
label: positive

text: SQ227 in Economy. Booked in April. Fare was Starting at $1600.00USD, luckily I was able to use my mileage for this trip. Gate opened right on time, with Cabin Crew going through Security after me. I boarded last, and was welcomed aboard. Crew made comments on my Attaché, saying "You look like 007", and other nice touches. One asked "I like that! Is that A Rimowa?" Nice to see SQ crew attentive, with small touches. Cabin jammed, Had to go around to get to my seat. I sat 62G, and had no Overhead Bin. So I had to use another one. Throughout the flight nobody disturbed my stuff. Luckily my Attaché fit under the seat. Also there is only 1 Lavatory in the rear of the Aircraft. We got served a lovely dinner. I noticed one of the Female crew members, was in a Suit. Flying with SQ since 2008, had me pondered. After the meal I engaged her in some conversation. She said "I am a Flight Auditor. Do you have any Feedback Sir?'. I didn't tell her about the appallingly horrific SQ check in at FRA, but maybe I should have. I settled in to sleep. One of the Cabin Attendants asked me if I wanted an aid to cover my eyes, but I said no, and I flew asleep. Woke up 90 minutes out, and was served refreshment. Multiple coffee rounds commenced, with crew approaching sleeping passengers for Refreshment. Landed MEL, with announcements on Luggage coming out late, however no SQ Ground Staff at the Luggage Carousel. If I go to Australia again, I would definitely fly Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Disappointed with ground arrangement! We were being informed that flight delayed due to technical issue, without estimate time to resolve. Told them we need to catch next connecting flight but no arrangement being made, just asked us to wait. Fine. What i am disappointed with SQ is that they did not prioritize on travellers with kids, i pity the lady travel alone with his son (around 3-4yrs old) and with language barrier being unattended even though she had attempted the staff numerous times to ask for status, she even video call her husband to speak with the staff but still no staff trying to help her. Next, the person in charge even asked all the staffs to leave the station by leaving all the frustrated passengers unattended (refer to the picture, no staff at the counter). I am really surprised this happened to SQ, one of the best airlines in the world. Disappointed..
label: negative

text: Long Haul Flight 13hrs Heard many great reports for this airline, but not as I expected on such a long haul flight, only glad I was not sitting in economy. Food was average and strange time to provide food, woken up 5hrs before arrival for service after eating 1.5hrs after take off.
label: neutral

text: No improvement Good day, No Improvement. The food was worst than ever. Dosed up on many pain killers, as seats are at a discomfort. My Back has not recovered, never ever again on the worst airline. I have tried emailing but to no avail. They are hiding from criticism. May I suggest fly with their opposition. Norman Russell
label: negative

text: Damaged luggage Service on the ground and in the air good but planes and seats very dated. Leg room ok but design of seat still old style - legs have to be curved to one side when lying flat. On arrival, one of the wheels of my 4-wheel checked in luggage had fallen off. Didn't have time to report the damage as had another connecting flight to Europe. Took photos and when we got to Europe put in a claim to the airlines. Despite numerous emails (each time received an automated acknowledgment) chasing after the claim and making new claims, nothing has happened. Even rang SIngapore Airlines in Singapore and spoke to customer service. Put in more applications and still nothing. If you look at Singapore Airlines' sites in Australia and SIngapore, they are designed not be contactable. Many of the phone numbers are out dated and ring out. They don't want your opinions. They are not interested in what you think. I had a similar issue with a third rate airline many years ago and had the same issue of no follow up after numerous emails and phone calls. I thought SIA is a first rate and premium airline. Most disappointed. It's just another airline with poor customer service. If this is how they approach customer service, how do they approach airline safety?
label: negative

text: Dhaka to Singapore in economy class. The seat, comfort, staff, everything was excellent. They give you hot towels, menus, and steel cutlery for your food which is rare in economy class nowadays. It is the best airline I have flown.
label: positive

text: Smooth flight. Flew Brisbane to Beijing via Singapore. Overnight through to afternoon flight. Very friendly staff, however food & beverage service slow and not much available. Air temp in both flights was quite cold. We were able to change seats to better locations for legroom. Would still be happy to fly SingaporeAir anytime.
label: positive

text: Holiday before holiday I was lucky enough to travel business class to Singapore. I was on the flight for 14 hours and I didn’t want to get off. Imagine someone says to you, have yourself a duvet day, don’t worry about what to eat or drink, we’ll bring you anything you want to drink including champagne and some lovely food at well placed intervals. iPad charger, vanity light to top up your make-up is at hand as is the remote to watch films, tv programmes you may have missed or listen to music. Adjust your reclining chair into a bed when you want to sleep and snuggle up in your duvet. The delightful and exceptionally efficient staff will see to your every need as though you’re a vip and then when you finally reach your destination they bid you farewell as though you’re a personal friend. What’s not to love about this first class airline.
label: positive

text: Wonderful service, hot towel and welcome drink for every passenger. In flight system is ok, new movie and TV series. Food is good, I had three choices of main course. Cabin crews were attentive and good attitude. But it's not cheap, Melbourne to London round trip cost me AU$2600, other airlines such as Thai Airways only AU$2000. The service was worth the price. Wi-Fi is available, but very expensive.
label: positive

text: No enough food served in long flights Over an 8 hour flight, food served once within a couple of hours of taking off and then nothing at all. In the past, I was never hungry after arriving in Singapore airport in the past but this time was very different. Arrived around 10 pm and needed to eat dinner. Airlines did not serve dinner, and no good restaurant or café is around in Singapore airport. I had 22 hours transit and desperately needed to eat good food but nothing is available in Singapore airport. By the way, paid twice as much for the tickets, was hungry on the plane and could not purchase any decent food in the airport. Never again with Singapore airlines and never go via Singapore airlines if there is a long transit.
label: neutral

text: Good service I was very happy with this airlines for my honeymoon. We left shortly after the passengers were loaded meaning we got off the ground ahead of schedule and landed ahead of schedule. This happened with all our flights, and they had information available in flight about connecting flights so we didn't need to stress about finding our way in an unknown airport. The crew was very friendly and helpful.
label: positive

text: Bad customer service/ good inflight service I have a mixed review for SIA. The inflight service was excellent and the staff on the both to and from Kuala Lumpur were excellent. However, the customer service in Changi is terrible. Our flight from Kuala Lumpur to Singapore was delayed by 50 minutes and SIA had changed their schedule, so we had a 10 hour stop-over at Changi. Our request for a meal vopucher or the use of a lougnge was refused. Apparently SIA no longer provides meal vouchers. This came as a bit of a shock to us as we have been flying with SIA since 2008, sans the Covid years, and they were well known for their customer service then. Not anymore.
label: negative

text: This used to be my favorite airline for years. Last week I've got an email saying my flight back home to New York for 25th March is cancelled "due to operational reasons. We will rebook you on alternative flights." But no rebooking, they are unresponsive, sent 10 emails and tried to call many times.
label: negative

text: Great firendly service Found Singapore Airlines staff to provide excellent customer seervice, good food and drink service. Only regret I wasnt in business class!
label: positive

text: Very impressed with Singapore Airlines Very happy with Singapore Airlines once again. The condition of the aircraft and service and meals proved by the cabin crew was excellent.Will definitely travel with them again in the future.
label: positive

text: Trip to Melbourne Being in Premier Economy you also get fast checkin and boarding also, Luggage also get Priority Tags in Mumbai, Seats are comfortable and food is also better. They should have seperate Toilets for Premier economy.
label: positive

text: Gold standard for business class Singapores A380 inter-continental business class sets the benchmark against which similar products should be measured. It’s a nearly flawless, well-priced, high-quality offering, from the personalized greetings, through the expertly designed space with ample privacy (even technically without a complete enclosure), to the hard-working, well-presented attendants who don’t look like someone’s grandma (many US airlines should really learn from this) One would only wish they offer more 5th-freedom routes like this that connect the US and Europe.
label: positive

text: Bangkok to Singapore. Among all the times I have flown with Singapore Airlines, this trip did not feel like Singapore Airlines at all. Firstly, there was a slight delay and the ground staff did not provide any information whatsoever. A bad start to the journey. After boarding the plane, I could feel that the cabin crew lacked warmth and hospitality. Shortly after takeoff, the cabin crew came round to serve the children first. They came to serve my 8 year old Sister the meal however they did not give her two choices to choose from. They just served my Sister chicken with rice. It turns out that the chicken with rice was too spicy. There were actually two choices (beef stew and chicken with rice) which left me wondering why they did not stop to ask my Sister what choice she wanted. They didn’t even tell her that the chicken with rice was spicy! When the cabin crew came round to serve adults, they were very rushed and did not make themselves clear at all. They asked ‘stew or chicken rice?’. They didn’t bother to tell us what meat the stew was. And they also did not offer any drinks. You have to ask them yourselves. The service I experienced was far from the ‘superior quality’ Singapore Airlines used to offer. I understand the need to rush service a little as the flight was only a little over two hours. However that does not mean that they can treat passengers like that. Disappointed with Singapore Airlines this time round. The only good point of this trip was that we could fly in their new Boeing 787-10 with improved amenities. But other than that, this flight could not be recognised as from Singapore Airlines!
label: negative

text: Comfortable Flight Pleasant flight for both of us seated in 46D & 46E. All efficient and friendly at check-in which helped us oldies understand new systems in use. Efficient boarding and on time departure. Well informed during flight. Enjoyed our meal and drinks. Very good selection of movies and music. WIFI available. All good.
label: positive

text: Cramped Seat What a difference to our previous flight. We were seated in 44H and J on the B787. Now I'm on the larger size and I cannot recall ever experiencing such cramped seating on a flight. Legroom was not a problem but the space between seats was. I could not fully deploy the table for the meal service, a half table had to suffice. When the passenger in front reclined the seat, it was very uncomfortable. We did enjoy the services of an excellent cabin crew, a delicious meal served, quality amenity kits distributed, and juices/soft drinks/water served at regular intervals. Felt safe throughout the flight although there was heavy turbulence on occasions.
label: positive

text: Outstanding customer service!!! Singapore Airlines certainly know how to do customer service and I felt looked after from start to finish. Hot towels, snacks and decent food made this one of my more memorable flights of recent years and is now an airline I will definitely use again and recommend to friends. Singapore Airlines well done on a great job!!!
label: positive

text: World's best airline... sometimes, depending on where you are going! It really depends on where you're going. No complaints on the European sectors of our trip - the planes were new and clean and everything was great, definitely a great experience. The Australian sectors however seemed neglected. The planes were old with a grubby, tired interior, uncomfortable seats, outdated IFE technology (no touch screens... on the world's best airline... in 2019!?), and even the food was noticeably worse on these sectors. It's also the only full-service airline I've flown that doesn't serve dinner at the beginning of an overnight flight to Australia - there was only a small greasy pizza snack, making it seem very "budget airline". Boarding was efficient except in Sydney. The staff were great on all flights, always friendly and helpful. The drinks services between meals were few and far between however and some flights didn't have them at all, which is another thing many other airlines handle much better.
label: neutral

text: Old Faithful Always fly this airline when possible. Onboard food was quite tasty, seats as comfortable as economy seats can be, flight attendants are always polite,friendly and helpful.
label: positive

text: SQFever Being first time onboard with SQ and i was impressed with them. Their service was identically Asian culture, sincere smile ( which most of Airlines from Asia does ). Food was nice same goes to their Champagne and French white wine, loved the design of everything by SQ. Can not wait to enjoy their long haul flight BC Sing to Ams.
label: positive

text: OLD FRIEND Revisited Been awhile since we flew SIA and our entire family decided to fly it when we went for our holidays, Everything went well from the time we arrived at the airport counter until we boarded our taxi at Changi. Service was courteous, efficient and seamless that other than our grandson's ears popping upon ascent and descent of the plane, we had another pleasant trip. The only thing we noticed was the quality of the catering has diminished. Thanks to everyone who served us.
label: positive

text: Booked a wheelchair service from Milan to Bangkok. Apart from a slight mishap in Singapore this was one of the best flights I have ever had. The quality of the service was outstanding. Crew worked throughout unlike many European airlines, with great attentiveness. I know because I never sleep. The quality of the food was superb. From my experience both Singapore airlines and Thai have the best training I have come across. Very good entertainment system with many choices. As a yearly flyer there is nothing better than having a long flight where everything works smoothly and people care about you. I can only say thank you. I appreciate your hard work. I will be flying with you again later this year.
label: positive

text: London to Singapore return, and the Premium Economy experience was very poor. Despite booking some months in advance, they neglected to allocate us any seats together and our party of 4 was distributed throughout the cabin. The seat configuration is 2-4-2 and there are no toilets specifically for Premium Economy. Rather than a separate cabin curtained off, Premium Economy is just the front section of the economy section. The seats were functional and inflight entertainment good but seat pitch is less than Air NZ. The food was terrible. We used the "book the cook" option on the return flight and this was no better, though they did manage to accomodate an allergy in our group. The staff were unfriendly and snacks on the 14 hour flight (2 meals were offered, the second 6 hours before arrival) had to be requested via the call button. The flight arrived early and the plane was quite new but would not fly Singapore Airlines again long haul.
label: negative

text: I am submitting this review about a terrible experience with Singapore Airlines wherein my family were subject to a 5-hour delay which then caused them to miss their connecting flight and extend the delay to 30+ hours. The delay according to Singapore Airlines was caused by traffic control between Guangzhou and Singapore and the plane had to be diverted to Kuala Lumpur to refuel for more than 2 hours on the tarmac. We missed the connecting flight SQ38 on August 9th to LAX as a result. We were placed in a hotel by SQ adjacent to the airport for a sudden 24hour plus layover near midnight with a "food coupon" that we had to fight for as we were starving due to the long delay and no food service on the plane. After arriving at the hotel we found out that those food vouchers were not even valid according to the hotel, Capri by Fraser, and no food service was available. Capri by Fraser's on duty manager in Singapore apparently said they don't take "food coupons" from Singapore Airlines for emergency layover guests and that this was a miscommunication with SQ. At near midnight where nearly all restaurants were closed and Capri is far from the city center, how were we expected to get a meal after being misled by Singapore Airline staff at the airport about the availability of food and their miscommunication? What if we were first time guests in Singapore with no knowledge of the local language and not able to navigate the situation? This is a complete failure from a management perspective as logically delayed passengers who miss a connecting flights after a certain time should at least be informed properly if not put in a hotel with 24 room service/dining options in or nearby and given the courtesy of not having to worry about starving on top of rearranging travel plans etc. For an airline with a world class reputation where one pays a premium for the service this just is not acceptable. I submitted a complaint to Singapore Airlines but their complains team threw a response back at me: “as much as we acknowledge the inconvenience you went through as a result of the delay, as an industry practice, and in line with our Conditions of Contract and Carriage, we would like to share that airlines generally do not compensate for consequential losses or inconvenience arising from flight delays.” However, I know international passenger rights stemming from Article 19 of the Montreal Convention. When I brought this up to an SQ customer service supervisor after spending hours on call trying to reach someone who I could speak to about this, I was shocked and concerned to find out that not even supervisor level reps knew about one of the most important international passenger rights conventions. SQ repeatedly mislead and misrepresent int'l passenger rights trying to brush me off. Currently they have ceased responding to my emails and appears to think that ignoring the issue will fix it. I don't know what more I can do at this point but I hope this review will serve to shed light on the holes in SQ's 5 star service and World's Best Airline reputation. I hope no one has to experience what we experienced during that disastrous layover in Singapore.
label: negative

text: Very Disappointing We flew from Melbourne to Singapore Business Class on SQ218 which was and A380. Very disappointing, when you book and pay for business class you expect a certain level of comfort and service. It all started at the Lounge in Melbourne - small and very average food and amenities compared to what is on offer in Singapore The plane was old and tired. My seat didn't work to recline properly. The food was very average and so was the service. The flight itself was good with not too much turbulence. The in flight movie selection had very few new releases
label: negative

text: SQ airline Not surprise at all why they always on the range, it was sooooo good. Comfort Seat, great food, wonderful services, easy to check-in. Well done Singapore airline. For sure that my next trip will be Singapore airline.
label: positive

text: COMFORTABLE FLYING An airline that has professional cabin crew, expert pilots and good food. Singapore airlines will make you feel at ease when flying. They also have spacious leg room and choices of entertainment while flying. Sinagpore airlines is my preferred airline.
label: positive

text: Great Experience Self check-in so easy and quick. Cabin crew were so friendly and helpful. There was plenty to eat and drink and a good choice. A vast range of things to watch or listen to. Will definitely fly with them again
label: positive

text: Awesome airline No wonder Singapore Airlines are always voted in the top 10 best airlines in the world! i flew on the Singapore Airlines A380 from Sydney to Singapore in Business Class. Great plane, very good business class seat, very tasty food with lots of it, and the cabin crew and some of the best and friendliest in the skies. Great service Singapore Airlines. I look forward to flying with you again.
label: positive

text: PROFESSIONAL CUSTOMER SERVICE We have travelled many times to Singapore over the years and always with Singapore Airlines. In September 2019 we had the pleasure of travelling Perth/Singapore/HoChiMinh and SiemReap/Singapore/Perth Business Class and it was everything we could have wanted. Our flights and lounge visits exceeded our expectations and we have again booked Singapore Airlines for May 2020. We received the most amazing customer service from every staff member but the highest credit must go to Patricia of the Singapore Airlines Business Class Lounge in Singapore. Patricia observed that my husband was unwell and a little concerned about the distance from lounge to gate. She used her initiative and went above and beyond by arranging transport for us, and kept us fully informed which was greatly appreciated. Patricia has definitely made an impression on us and we hope to see her again in May.
label: positive

text: Excellent service Recent trip to Singapore we were spoilt with plenty of smiles and both the guys and girls were so friendly and helpful. Very comfortable seats with good size screen to watch movies considering we were in economy. Plenty of leg room. The food was really nice and overall a comfortable airlines to fly with
label: positive

text: Amazing service Superb service, comfortable seating and very good on board entertainment. Even in economy one was able to sleep as the headrests were a godsend.
label: positive

text: Very friendly Crews and they were attentive I usually don’t like direct flight as the fleet is usually smaller and toilets are usually dirty! My recent experience has been a very pleasant one, the service crews are very friendly, personable and attentive. The big smile on their faces made my trip an enjoyable one - don’t you think it feels good to have a set of friendly crews especially when you are on a long haul flight?
label: positive

text: Great flight Great staff, great airline. We purchased extra legroom seats for a modest cost which made the trip very comfortable
label: positive

text: This has good reviews and they are well deserved! We were so fed up with substandard travel we decided to try Singapore Airlines even though it meant travelling to Manchester. Incredibly it was cheaper even after paying train fares and one night in an hotel! The booking system was easy and straightforward, the checking in on line the same, and choice of seats was so easy for us. Once we got to handin in our luggage the staff again were so helpful and made the suggestion to change our seat so we would have three seats to use for the two of us. Passing through security and into the departures was a cinch, We were welcomed on to the aircraft by beautifully turned out crew, who were so welcoming and helpful. The plane was clean and smart, the entertainment system easy to manage. We were offered water/orange juice so regularly throughout the trip, and the food was glorious, a choice between European and eastern. Nothing was too much trouble and they remembered everything they said they would do. I can't recommend them enough, and will be flying with them in the future, wherever possible.
label: positive

text: Great flight as always Brilliant all the way... starting from airport lounge to seating to flight attendants the whole trip was great with no negatives.
label: positive

text: Conmen Recently bought a flight for April 2019. Due to unfortunate circumstances I had to change the flight either into my partners name or move the date to fit my new plans. Both options were absolutely extortionate, therefore resulting in me having to buy a brand new flight and throw away this entire journey. Such a shame and waste of money that people just don’t have to throw away. And all for what? To line your pockets some more.
label: negative

text: Worst airline I traveled with this airline numerous times and I have never had good service. They are expensive, the luggage allowance is less than other airlines and the food is horrible. On one flight the staff didn't even serve me food. I was a breasfeeding mother at that point which also meant my baby had less to drink that day. When I spoke to customer care they played it off as me being fussy over the food and dismissed my email. Hard to be fussy if you arent even served. The check in staff is rude and don't seem to know what they are doing. When I asked the flight attendant for warm water to feed my baby I waited 15min and she returned with unwashed bottle and ice cold water. Everything seems to be to much effort for them. I am so tired of flying with an airline that treat you like they are doing you a favor. They seem to forget that their customers pay to be on their airplanes. Avoid them if possible.
label: negative

text: No leg room Plane was full .. Seats seem to be closer Than ever... food was average .. staff were polite.. couldn’t say anything special about the flight .. same in return flight .. only offered 1 drink even Water wasn’t easy to get !
label: neutral

text: Best airline This is by far the best airline I have flown with. Excellent service, Clean and efficiently run. Excellent entertainment choice. Food best I have had on any airline. We opted for Vegetarian oriental meal and each time food was very tasty. Highly recommend this airline.
label: positive

text: Istanbul to Singapore: SQ391 Cashed in some SQ points to travel in business class back to Singapore from Istanbul. Operated by a B777-200ER but still quite comfortable. Food and service were both very good. Perhaps I enjoyed it all the more as this year I've been taking a lot of flights operated by Budget airlines. Arrived 15 mins early. Only negative was the lounge at Ataturk airport which resembled a zoo - far too many people crowded into the Turkish Airlines lounge. One can only hope that things improve once services are moved to the new airport. Otherwise no complaints.
label: positive

text: Whats-not-to-love ? SQ, everybody loves Flew on SQ21/ 22 EWR-SIN, long-haul 18 flight-hours. I can't say if I like it better than flight with layover. During transit, at least I can do "my business" and stretch out a bit, since I am only flying Premium, not Business- bit time to stretch is definitely help. And if you're claustrophobic, that layover might help a bit? But on the pros- you get to your destination 2 hours faster. But other than that... SQ non-stop service vs. with transit, same quality, superb service as always. Price-point of this P-Econ is good value for the money. And the hours are good. I'm from Indiana, so I can catch early flight to EWR and catch the flight in the AM. Arrived in SIN early AM then continue on with the journey. Return trip was also good. Arrived in EWR in the afternoon, plenty of connecting flight to take me back to IND. Service was exceptional, as always. Meals and snacks were meh. Entertainment choices were awesome. So all in all, good flight. After towel service, was served meal as soon as we took off. Throughout the flight, we offered drinks and refreshments. Second meal happened about 11 hours in. Then provided boxed-snack before landing. That last bites could be better. Felt that 7-11 snacks were actually better. I know... what can you expect from airplane meal. But then again, on flights with layover, from US to SEA, we get 4 full-meals total. We should get at least 3 full service, right. But that's okay. SQ is still one of my fave. Recommend it to everybody!
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines..the best!! As usual difficult to beat the class, the care and sheer pleasure of unhindered, comfortable travel.
label: positive

text: loved my flight had fun travelling with kids...they loved watching the kids movie and also received goodies from SIA.
label: positive

text: Great dog-friendly service Started off shaky because of another airline delayed flight. The gate attendant actually called me to ask if I would make the flight. When I told them I wasn't going to make it, they changed my flight without charge. In San Francisco, they went to great lengths to help me with my ESA dog and seating. Ended up with whole back row to myself and Rousey. Flight attendants during flight were very helpful. Would recommend for anyone needing to travel with animals.
label: positive

text: Great airline We flew to and from Bali with Singapore airlines flying from Tokyo/Japan! It was so nice getting the hot towels to freshen up and the meals were delicious and very filling! On our way to Bali the flight from Singapore to Bali was short and sharp the flight attendant was rushing we felt sorry for her! Then on our way home we got the partner airline silk air to Singapore this was a little disappointing as there wasn’t any entertainment but it was a short flight so that was okay. The flight was delayed I think due to Bali airport but the airline gave us a little food voucher to use in the airport at Singapore while we waited for our new flight that was rescheduled (3 hours was all we were behind so not bad) and then from Singapore to Tokyo was amazing the best plane we had been on! It had nice TVs with very recent movies and it was a great experience to finish our holiday on! The options of food were amazing again and the flight attendant was so kind he gave us a few fizzy drinks and topped us up rather then just 1 cup like some airlines! Would definitely recommend Singapore airlines to people! Thanks so much for the great experience!
label: positive

text: Excellent service, especially good for the disabled We’d flown to Singapore on Thai Airways, but decided to use Singapore Airline for the return, to avoid a long wait in Bangkok (Thai cancelled a good connecting flight). We were much happier with the precautions against Covid-19 in Singapore compared to Thailand. The flight was very comfortable, and we had adequate space in our seats. There was plenty of TV entertainment, but the earphones were cheap and nasty (not as good as on Thai). There were adequate toilets, and we didn’t have to queue for more than a minute or two. I do wish airlines would state the number of passengers per toilet. I’m disabled and this is very important for me. When I checked the seating plan, I thought there were inadequate toilets, but there were more toilets than the seating plan showed! Toilets and the whole plane were very clean throughout the trip. It was a night flight, and we were offered drinks when we were awake on many occasions. The food was tasty, with a choice of Western or Eastern meals. The plane was modern. After using Thai Airways, I was very impressed with the standard of care I received as a disabled person. We were greeted when we entered the plane, and escorted to our seats, the stewardess carried our cabin baggage for us, and stowed it in the overhead locker. Before landing, she came to our seats and explained the procedure (we stay seated until other passengers have left the plane). She then came when the plane had emptied, collected our baggage and escorted us to the exit. We’ve flown with Singapore Airlines repeatedly, and once again felt we had an excellent flight.
label: positive

text: I usually fly Qantas but chose to fly Singapore Airlines this time, I flew Premium economy. Would I fly again, probably not. My first flight resulted in my seat not functioning and the seats were incredibly uncomfortable compared to Scoot (adjoining flight). Service, the female hostesses were fabulous but the male staff were shocking.
label: negative

text: Take the day flight We flew direct to Singapore in economy on a day flight rather than night flight. We found flying at that time to be quite comfortable in economy - the flight seemed to go quickly - we watched movies etc and arrived bright and fresh. I don't like flying economy at night trying to sleep but the day option really worked for us.
label: positive

text: Excellent for economy. Five hours into flight and the seat was still comfortable - soft and firm in the right spots. The breakfast was good for economy. Large enough portions. Taste enough with variation on the tray to add interest. Cabin staff outstanding. Friendly and attentive. Quality tv screen. Easy to operate with a wide variety of programs. My transmitter that enables my wireless headphones to connect, doesn't always work on left and right. No problems on this flight. Power outlets for mains and USB. The best boarding process I have used, why don't all airlines do this? After showing boarding pass and entering the gate lounge, we were seated in boarding groups. Then each seated are group was called up in turn. Much more efficient than calling out the number of the boarding group and hoping every one has heard and no one tries to queue jump.
label: positive

text: good comfortable airline Flight attendants are nice and helpful! Seats are comfortable enough, food is fine, multimedia is fair.
label: positive

text: Best Airline in world for a reason What can you say....this airline is rated best in world for a reason. Staff, selection, lounge and plane itself is just great. The 17.5 hours seems like nothing with this flight. Meals when you want them. Great coffee and just excellent service. I would pay the price again for the airline.
label: positive

text: World class travelling Thoroughly enjoyed my flight from Singapore to Bangkok. The seat is comfortable. Love all the movies selections and enjoyed the services that are rendered. The food is ok not deliciously yummy but for a flight is ok not bad for the hungry.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Athens Had heard great things about this airline but I was disappointed. In economy there were many spare seats with greater leg room but instead of letting people move they had to pay an extra $170+ Service was nothing special either.
label: neutral

text: just hope this Airline finds our Bags that Lufthansa Lost . having finally left Singapore for a final leg of our journey Home, when we arrived at Brisbane Airport and got through passport control , we were waiting at the carousel for our bags to head home , after watching the carousel for what was the 4th rotation I was beginning to think there was something wrong no bags had shown up . I then hear over a loud speaker my friends name and then mine , to go to baggage services and I then had my doubts confirmed by a member of staff that our bags had not left Frankfurt to make the connection to Singapore then Brisbane . I started to panic as I had medical stuff in the bag that I desperately needed and no matter how I tried to explain my situation . all I was told my bags would hopefully arrive the next day , I was told to make a complaint to the first Airline I was on Lufthansa , then Singapore , but no real comfort was ever given or I felt from any of the Airlines, it was a case of no bags made there connecting fights . THATS A FACT ...
label: positive

text: Rudest Customer Service I have ever experienced They changed my flight without proper notification. And then when I asked them for any possible solutions they were extremely rude. They refused to take any responsibility and were just horrible to deal with. I even asked to speak to a supervisor and the guy simply said there is no one else to talk to. They will send an email to your spam folder, tell you that you didn't see it and it isn't their problem. Horrible company will never deal with them again.
label: negative

text: Premium Economy 13 hour flight First time I used the Premium Economy class on Singapore Airlines, chosen due to the long flight and me being not well suited to the small economy class seats for such a long flight. The seats are a luxury compared to the economy class seats but still far from business class. As the trays are not mounted to the seat in front you could remain reclined whilst food is served and could remain asleep in requested. Good leg room and the seats reclined back more than economy. Bigger tv screen and you get your own arm rests so no need to struggle with your neighbours. I upgraded to premium economy from economy class. My employer allows me to claim back economy flight tickets so I only personally paid the cost of the upgrade. For short flights of less than 6 hours I personally wouldn't bother to upgrade but the long flight made a world of difference. It's by no means anywhere near a business class flight experience but better than economy. Just depends if you feel you can justify the extra approximatley 30% higher price.
label: positive

text: Excellent service Our long flight was made less onorous by the excellent staff and service provided by this airline. The inflight entertainment was excellent, catering to a large variety of genres. The food was very good also
label: positive

text: Pleasant & Peaceful Flights It was a night flight to Singapore so we were served dinner. I opted for a fruit platter but noticed there were only 5 medium size pieces of fruit on the dinner plate. Wished they had given more. However the seats were comfortable, staff were friendly and we had a pleasant and peaceful flight.
label: positive

text: Excellence Service We got immediate five-star assistance in no time. Headache is gone. Thank you so much for helping this guest. Flight Confirmation is back for WB7DI7. CHEERS for all your GOOD WORK! Gene
label: positive

text: Flight review I recommend Singapore Airline the best service, good quality of food, ontime flight, comfortable, money worth.
label: positive

text: Very efficient Singapore Airlines crew are always very pleasant and happy to help you. We were lucky to secure seats with more leg room (at a further cost) which was great on such a long flight. The cabin was clean and kept clean constantly by the crew. The toilets were checked by the crew very frequently. Food was good.
label: positive

text: Friendly & welcoming flight crew, on-time and great friendly service Greeted by friendly ground staff and flight crew. On time departures and arrivals, good food, drinks on board and friendly service
label: positive

text: Enjoyable flight by a quality airline Great service and food. Seats were comfortable. We had access to the Sasco Rose lounge before which had some excellent food options. I also loved the fact that our boarding pass gave us discounts at a number of attractions in Singapore including the hop-on hop-off HiPPO bus as well as the National Gallery.
label: positive

text: At last back home! So after a 3,5 hour wait with a change from terminal T2 to T3, we finally get onboard the new A350-900. The legroom is bigger than in the A380 and B777. This airplane is very quiet. Staff was also friendly.
label: positive

text: Great service We use Silk Air airlines to Singapore several times for our holiday and its service is never dissapointing. We love the main food provided during our short flight (around 1.5 hour). We also consider the ticket price is acceptable, considering it is included meals and baggage 30 kg. Compared to other budget airlines, we have to do extra pay for those.
label: positive

text: There are better airlines! Poor food, with snacks served instead of meals. Crew very pleasant, but you have to chase them for a drink! Neither ground crew nor onboard crew will let you upgrade, when you’re more than happy to pay; each says you must speak to the other. I would never book with them myself.
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines Can only congratulate Singapore Airlines on the great service. Soon after take off we were offered warm moist towels to refresh with. Followed closely by a snack pack and a drink. At regular intervals between meals the staff came through the plane with juice or water. We can’t fault the meals they were great and nicely presented. We were also given a menu to read not long after boarding. At all times the staff were well presented and only too willing to help should it be needed. Even in economy the service appeared to be the same standard as Premium a Economy. Well done Singapore Airlines we appreciated your service.
label: negative

text: Great Experience Cabin crew were wonderful & regularly serviced the toilets so they were always clean. The meals were very tasty which is always a pleasant surprise when flying. They continualy offered trays of drinks during the flight which was very welcome. You dont realize how dehydrated you are becoming when flying a long distance. The 14 hour flight was made very enjoyable.
label: positive

text: Poor catering The quality of the food was poor and the choice was poor too. we were seated at the back and when it came to our seat there was no choice. We had to eat what they gave. There was no dessert and the flight attendant was caring a box of ice cream cups and asking everyone if anyone want one or not. There was no water served, no coffee or tea was given unless asked. One soft drink can was served to two or three persons. wine was not even mentioned.
label: neutral

text: Forever spoilt by first class service Travelled in group of 5. Lounge before boarding was comfortable with halal food options. Long flight was very pleasant. Flight, take off and landing super smooth. Very comfortable large seats that opens up as beds in seconds, clean pillows,blankets,socks,slippers provided for comfort. Great selection of in flight movies also sensational mix of easy listening songs. Excellent service, flight attendants always attentive and friendly yet not intrusive. 3 apologised profusely when my meal came without gravy from the SATS kitchen,no fault of theirs and even though the meal was substituted with a comparably delicious one, I was given a $100 voucher! Never felt more pampered than that 13hrs in the air.
label: positive

text: SUPERB absolutely AMAZING WOW, what an airline - breakfast 1.5 hours outside of SIN is incredible. Eggs benedict, Singapore Airlines wow, you are incredible in EConomy, cant wait ti try in Business!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Love you
label: positive

text: Deserted us Travelled out to New Zealand with this airline, however they cancelled our return flight and did not offer to help us find an alternative return flight. We are still doing battle to get a refund for unused return flight. The cabin crew were very helpful, food ok,
label: neutral

text: Always superb Travelled with my 83 old mother to Hanoi in early part of Nov 2018. Food, drinks & entertainment were good. Keep me occupied. Seats were comfortable for both of us. Perhaps, it will be wonderful if there are entertainment available to occupy more matured travellers who are less literate.
label: positive

text: SQ22 Service was very limited despite being 18 hours long. They rushed through the first service since the flight left at 11:30 pm. Then there was no service for another 11 hours. I know they brought around snacks and were happy to help me when needed but honestly wished we would've been pampered more. Food was average at best.
label: neutral

text: enjoyable the staff were very friendly, and help ful, I had a lacto vegetarian meal it was supered, the film's could give been better, and the games might need updating. but all in all I would be travelling with them again.
label: positive

text: Singapore airline flying business class excellent. My wife and myself flew business class from Auckland to Mumbai return flight. The seats were very comfortable, the food was very good & the bed when pulled out was very spacious & comfortable. The service was professional and the cabin crew was very courtious and obliging. We found this airlines the best. Kind regards Godfrey. J.
label: neutral

text: Bad service staff I have on behalf of my friend to purchase air ticket on 2nd Dec 2020. Booking refer : 6RINUW On departure date, my friend when to the counter to get the flight ticket, and counter staff keep on mention my credit card got problem can`t deducted on the Payment. And asking to re-purchase for the air ticket. I did call bank to double check on my credit card, yet bank staff did check for me and say nothing wrong on my credit card and the payment of flight charges of amount have been deducted on my card for the amount of $943.50 ever provide me the refer number X00198, after the call, wanted to show the staff for the transaction number, yet they don't ever want to communicate to me. And my friend have re-puchase flight ticket and re-do blood and covid-19 test to get before back to china. All of this is a extra cost. Very disappointed on singapore airline service. Now asking for refund, it just reply me with check and get back to me, after 2 weeks still no reply yet
label: negative

text: Great flight and excellent service Very professional, friendly staff, service and food served was very good a choice was given and was hot and tasty. Looked after very well was our third time flying with them and will again
label: positive

text: Enjoy the flight The flight was on time. The checking in was smooth and seamless. At the gates the hand luggage was done swiftly. The boarding was done systematically, so that the won't be crowding at the aisle. The SIA team was welcoming and had great smiles. Service was efficient and fast.
label: positive

text: The friendliest airline The crew were all so friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The food on the way to Singapore was absolutely delicious.
label: positive

text: Great service Clean, comfortable plane. Best of all, drinks, food and movies included. Service was given with a smile even when busy. It was a pleasure to travel with them
label: positive

text: Makes you feel welcome From check in to departure was hassle free. Friendly air crew & ground staff. Great choice of in flight entertainment.
label: positive

text: Great service friendly staff 😀 First time traveling on Singapore airlines & we very impressed with how professional hard working and friendly they were. On the way from Singapore to Brisbane the crew were on the go the entire time serving meals drinks cleaning up keeping us humans safe and happy. Very happy and I would be booking again on our next trip.😀👌
label: positive

text: Spoilt Now I've flown Business Class on other airlines and have been reasonably satisfied, however I'm afraid Singapore Airline is a different class, no wonder their always up there in the ratings year on year. The only problem? Next flight I'll know that I'll be disappointed as I'll be comparing it with this airline.
label: positive

text: Flew on A52 from Singapore to Manchester on the 10 January. The cabin crew on this flight were excellent in providing outstanding service. Food and drinks were plentiful and of very high quality. My only issue was the seating which I found to be uncomfortable, but other than that the flight was superb. Very highly recommended.
label: positive

text: BEST Airline in the world - Everytime again I have flewn many times already with Singapore Airlines and I don't have made any negative experience so far. The cabin crew are making their outmost to give you an enjoyable flight, no matter the class you booked into. The food is everytime very delicious, which you can't say often from other Airlines. The uniforms of the cabin crew is very stylish and sexy and they even sell this uniform design on different merchendise (Bags, Books etc.) Entertainment is very well choosen and there is a huge range of movies, music and games. Seating rows got enough space inbetween especially when flying the A380. I would fly Singapore Airlines everytime again.
label: positive

text: A cut above the rest... We recently went to New Zealand and travelled from the UK going west throughout, with the leg from Auckland - Singapore being with Singapore Airlines (the other three legs being with Air New Zealand, see separate review), as the two airlines share this route. We were in Premium Economy (due to a deal from our travel agents - Trailfinders), and the extra cost involved was money well spent in terms of space, entertainment, service, food and drink and general ambience. I've rated it 5 out of 5, but Singapore does not quite measure up to Air New Zealand in my book, and with the choice of more ratings I'd go for 9 out of 10 - don't misunderstand me, it's still very, very good and thoroughly recommended.
label: positive

text: Overall good and comfy Food served is nice and the staff were friendly and accommodating. As the layover is only 1hr, staff also assist to arrange for the few of us to be seated in front so that we can exit earlier.
label: positive

text: Premium Economy is rubbish Had the misfortune of flying with Singapore to and from London on Premium Economy - the service was poor and the seats uncomfortable and cramped. The food was very average when compared to other top airlines like Emirates or AirNZ. Won't be flying with them again.
label: neutral

text: Outstanding service from the cabin crew, who made passengers feel welcome with every interaction throughout the flight. They have been very well trained in hospitality. Food and beverages were plentiful and tasty, and passengers were free to get snacks from the galley (even in economy class) in between the 2 main meals served. The range of options for movies was impressive. I would go out of my way to choose this airline in the future, even if it meant paying more compared to a competitor.
label: positive

text: Terrific flight Terrific flight with very attentive hardworking staff. 12 hour flight seemed a lot shorter due to the comfort, food and excellent service provided by the flight crew. Looking forward to our return flight.
label: positive

text: Great service and food I travelled on Singapore Airlines on 15th January 2019 from Singapore to London Heathrow on SQ318. The service on the airline was great meals were good, service was great. The staff were friendly and professional as always. My cabin crew attendant was friendly and professional at all times. She had no issues with any of queries or request for food and drinks. She was also happy to have a photo taken with me too. I would recommend this airline company to everyone.
label: positive

text: service definately the service of the singapore airline has gone down; food is terrible and not much choice.
label: neutral

text: MEL-SIN on SQ 208. I felt A330 seats were more comfortable than the bigger aircraft A380. Food was superb and you will never go wrong with Krisworld - the inflight entertainment. Staff were attentive and there is no doubt that this is one of the top 5 star airlines in the world.
label: positive

text: fly singapore airlines had four trips with this airline recently, excellent service and attention to detail from all staff. on one trip my suitcase was badly damaged this was picked up by airline staff, who took me to the appropriate desk to report it. a new suitcase of the same size was given to me within half an hour, that to me was sterling service, i was astounded to say the least, i will now look to see if this airline goes to my destination in future, will always be my 1st choice. rgds
label: positive

text: Flug SQ910 Short flight from SIN to MNL. I got a new seat with extra leg space during check in in Frankfurt. Transfer from flight SQ25 to SQ910 was easy and very fast with the skytrain boarding in Singapore was easy and fast. Drinks and food during the flight was standard for a 3h flight. Flight arrived in time in manila
label: positive

text: Full flight, yet not bad experience I had travelled with Singapore Airlines business class before and this time on economy they still did not disappoint. The flight was full, but the crew did everything they could to make it a pleasant experience to all. There are certainly cheaper airlines, but I sincerely recommend them as they make me feel safe with their professionalism.
label: positive

text: Pleasant flight - Comfortable We were boarded efficiently onto the Airbus. However, the seats that we paid extra for, were not as we saw in the original seat map. The flight was not full. We brought the seat issue to a member of the cabin crew. She took our boarding cards and then a male cabin crew approached us. He offered us seats at the very back of the plane. Totally unsuitable and worse than our current seats. However, another female member smartly diffused the situation with a move to bulkhead seats. I think her name was Audrey (I think). She was professional and efficient. No don't get me wrong. We were not being awkward. We had ten flights to take over a three weeks with a four year old child and our seats were chosen with that in mind. Anyway, the plane got away five minutes early and arrived 11 minutes early in Shanghai. The flight was comfortable. The cabin crew were courteous and the food was good.
label: positive

text: Delayed luggages with a smile Our flight was delayed by 2 hours and we were to catch another flight within the next hour. We were thinking we will miss the flight. Arriving at Changi, we were carted off to catch our flight and was told our luggages would unlikely be on board but would arrive at a later flight. At our destination, we went to the luggage counter to explain our situation and we were asked to fill a form and a compensation of $120 US were provided for the inconvenience. Our luggages arrived few hours later at our hotel. How awesome is that!
label: positive

text: Not enough water Great flight. Staff, friendly. the food was good can't really complain. My tip is take some water on board as is gets dry in the cabin. i asked for some socks which they provided thank goodness as it gets cold flying at night. Wear noisecancelling headphones for crying babies and snoring passengers.
label: positive

text: Hong Kong to Auckland via Singapore. Hong Kong to Singapore final call was made 30min before departure time but flight departed 1hr late to schedule. Crew were nice and helpful. IFE system was user friendly and had a large screen, flight map didn't work when landing. Movies were available in different language subtitles but more different types of movies could be included. Meal was delicious with decent amount. Paper menu was distributed before meal. Flight landed in Singapore 45min late which made our transit time a bit tight. Next flight was the same plane. Crew were polite and helpful. Hot towels were distributed. Legroom was decent with a footrest. Amenity kit was distributed. Two meals were tasty. Drinks and sandwiches were given between meals. Flight arrived in Auckland 5 min early. Singapore Airlines is worth it's 5-Star rating.
label: positive

text: My first ever flight is INTERNATIONAL flight!! It's my first ever flight and I was so very grateful that it is INTERNATIONAL FLIGHT and I am going to a very famous country which is SINGAPORE. I always watched videos in YouTube what to do when you entered "airport" and what to do when you ride in a "plane". But I think you don't need to watch anything because every airlines have their own video to teach all of us what to do when riding in a plane and all we need for our safety. SQ will give you so much satisfaction when it comes to your flight. They will help you throughout the flight, they will give you what you need and also they are so very approachable so you will not get shy when you talk to them. My first check-in and for the baggage I don't know what to do but they assist me. I feel so comfortable in my seat even though I am not sitting beside window. And also the food in the plane is good. If you're traveling and you will go to Singapore, you must choose SINGAPORE AIRLINES. If you are first timer like me you must choose it more because you will love your first flight when you choose SQ for sure. Maybe soon I will travel more but SINGAPORE AIRLINES is the best so far!!
label: positive

text: Sydney to Milan via Singapore with Singapore Airlines. A waste of money! Check-in took almost an hour. This was partly my fault as I was over the baggage allowance, although this had never been a problem with other airlines. The explanation was that SQ is strict with their baggage allowances - fair enough. However the amount of time it took was unacceptable. This resulted in having to rush through passport control and the TRS and left me with about 15- 20 minutes to quickly eat something before having to board the 4pm flight. The business class cabin was full of children. I had booked the flight 1 week prior and opted for the afternoon flight as the reservations agent had told me it was almost empty. I understand loads can change, but if I had known I would have opted for the evening flight even though this would have allowed only about 1 hour 30 minutes in Changi before catching the connecting flight. The food was inedible - my specially selected chef inspired meal of Tasmanian salmon was dry, with rubbery beans and overcooked pasta. The breakfast served just before landing in Milan was awful - two rubbery and cold poached eggs. There is no business class amenity kit provided - how cheap can an airline get? It just smacks of miserliness. I sent a formal complaint to Singapore Airlines and their lukewarm reponse was to say sorry. It is simply not good enough. Frankly, this airline has dramatically slipped. It can no longer be considered a top tier airline. The only saving grace is the personnel, who are exceptional. The business class lounge staff and most of the flight attendants were absolutely wonderful. However, this is not enough to redeem this airline. I take 3-4 long haul trips between Australia and Europe per year and will never fly Singapore Airlines again!
label: negative

text: The best cattle class Singapore Airlines flies with the modern Airbus A350-900 between Amsterdam and Singapore. These aircraft are brand new, consequently in good repair and offer a spacious impression. But it is still cattle class, so the seats are cramped and the aisles narrow with the 9 in a row layout. However, the friendly cabin crew, a trade mark of SIA, the extensive entertainment possibilities with the large screens in the back of the seats and the palatable food (palatable for airline standards) are the positive points. Singapore Airlines is to be recommended, even for the cattle class on a 12 hours flight.
label: positive

text: Comfort and entertainment in SQ’s new B787-10 Flying economy on the new B787-10 from SIN to BKK was really great! The seat is wide, foot length is pretty good and the entertainment option is one if the best. The TV screen is easily 19 inch! The head rest is adjustable as well so it can slide up and down to fit your head whether you are tall or short. There’s a small insert underneath the Tv screen where you can place your smartphone in while you are charging or maybe texting on it with the onboard wifi.
label: positive

text: Ken R Best airline I've flown with. Immaculate staff, easy check in, more than ample and tasty food,and good inflight entertainment and service.
label: positive

text: Class service, timeliness and screens I used to like Cathay Pacific for this route but SQ now beats them hands down. We were scheduled to take off 7.55pm but due to late passengers, were only wheels up at 8.20pm. Still landed punctually at 11.55pm. Great entertainment, ok food but class service even in economy. Love all treated well regardless of sex or race. Kudos SIA!
label: positive

text: Comfortable flight Excellent service. Great food menu. Friendly staff all the way. It certainly makes a huge difference on such a long flight. We were fortunate in being upgraded from premium economy into business class for both legs of the trip. Being able to stretch out makes a long journey far more bearable.
label: positive

text: The best AIRLINE till now I have been flying with Singapore airline since I was a little girl. . Their aircraft well maintain and always replace their aircraft earlier than any other airline that I have been flying with. All their crews are well groomed and polished , speaks multiple languages. You do not see any sour face or attitude come from them even though they have been serving you in a long flight. During night time, in one incident a child was screaming, they were gentle to let the parent know to get control and help them as they can to make the child to settle down. ( the last thing we need on the long flight crying and screaming, I have daughter that started travelling since she was 2 years old that I would make sure that she was quite). There is an airline that the crews just let the children running up and down during the night time, very inconsiderate to other passengers. This airline is the compatotor of the Singapore Airline. Their aircrafts also considering luxurious but STILL far from Singapore Airline in service.Singapore Airline invest well on their Crews educations, even if you seat at economy class. This is your hard earned money and you deserve courtesy as you give them a business regardless which class you seat. Just think , if nobody seat in the economy the airline will not survive.
label: positive
