text: Long haul flight, Istanbul to Brisbane and return Have used Singapore Airlines on a number of occasions to fly to Australia, good service all round from check in to arrival. On board service excellent, cabin layout much better than similar airlines. Food and drinks service and selection well above average. Singapore Airlines also offer stopover breaks of varying lengths in Singapore which are excellent value for money, had a six night break on last trip, absolutely first class experience.
label: positive

text: Great service; not so great comfort Service was impeccable: my wife had hurt her knee not long before we flew and found walking any distance difficult. Before we even reached the check-in/baggage-drop desk, SIA had offered to get her assistance. This carried her right to the plane's door - where a squad of stewardesses positively fought over who would help her onto the plane itself. And then the same on arrival. Outstanding customer care. Food was good. Music choice was not quite as wide as I expected but ok: the headphones were good. (Can't comment on film choices.) Business flat bed - well, it's true that it lies flat, but you end up lying diagonally and your feet are in a little cubby-hole. I had several bouts of cramp and can't describe it as comfortable, although admittedly this 777 was better than the A380 on the return flight, which was just simply uncomfortable - far too firm, as a seat and a bed.
label: positive

text: Sneakily booking people on Scoot I'm so angry, Singapore Airlines used to be good, but when booking a ticket to Vietnam, they sneakily put you on Scoot - for an 8 hour flight! I paid for a full price, full service ticket - they clearly must have put operated by Scoot in very small writing somewhere, to say I'm upset is an understatement. I could have booked a Scoot ticket for $200, not the $800 I paid to not have to sit for 8 hours on a horrible plane. My whole trip is ruined, I've been having a really hard time and now I'm stuck on what is going to be a miserable flight. To cancel costs half the ticket price. The same has happened for my return leg! Shame on you Singapore Airlines, this is the last time I will ever book with such an unethical and untrustworthy company! Thank you for ruining my first holiday in years!
label: negative

text: Honeymoon and not a drop of gin to be had! We didn’t go solely for the gin! But it would’ve been nice to have had the choice... Honeymoon trip to Australia - we were so looking forward to the flight (especially as Singapore Airlines has such a good reputation) as it marked the start of a two month tour. Soon after take off we asked for a pre-lunch gin and tonic but were to there was no gin on board! Unbelievable! They offered us a tiny plastic glass of warm sparkling wine and a celebration cake, which wasn’t at all what we wanted. We found it disappointing. The staff seemed stretched and stressed, and the service was not as good as we expected (and we are undemanding travellers) We felt we were being penalised for travelling economy
label: neutral

text: Singapore airlines I fly to Singapore every year and also use their associated airline SilkAir for any onward flights needed. I always book directly with the airline and early booking produces very good prices. The aircraft are always well presented both in cleanliness, facilities and aircrew. In my view there is no better airline to take if you want a direct flight to Singapore. I always feel I have had the best possible experience that any airline can give on long haul
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines provided excellent service and always our first choice For good service, safety record, inflight service and meals, Singapore Airlines has been our first choice of airlines to travel, if given a choice.
label: positive

text: Staff went over and above to help me During this 12-hour flight, I got my period, the toilets do have an amenities draw so I was able to utilise this. There was blood on my olive-green jeans that was very obvious. The staff of the flight gave me a dress to put on and then proceeded to clean the blood off my jeans. They did and then gave them back just as it was time to start preparing for landing. Who on earth would do this? The flight attendants were just so lovely and discreet. i cannot commend them enough for this as I had another 5-hour flight to go in my journey. Thank you ever so much Singapore Airlines, I highly recommend this airline for travel, economy was still very comfortable and we did no go hungry.
label: positive

text: Best of the best I wouldn't think twice about recommending it. All yiu would expect from a top airline like this. They made the long haul as comfortable as possible possible as they could. Full marks from us for all they did for us ☆☆☆☆☆
label: positive

text: A Great Way to Fly Good timing. Fly there in the morning at about 8.20am and reaching around 12+. Service was good which was why it has always been my preferred choice of airline whenever I travel.
label: positive

text: Excellent service by staff we upgraded to Business Class and that was the best thing we could have done, especially on the long legs (Singapore to Frankfurt and Amsterdam to Singapore).
label: positive

text: First time We chose Singapore because it had the friendliest flight times. It was a flight of two halves, SQ51 Manchester to Singapore was great with good service and good food. SQ245 Singapore to Brisbane was rather chaotic with haphazard service and yukky dried up food. How does that happen with the sane airline? Both planes were relatively new, very spacious and comfy.
label: positive

text: Nowhere near the calibre it used to be We have flown SIA in Economy for years and years. The friendly service and great food is what always brought us back. On our most recent flight on 31 August 2022 from Brisbane to Singapore it was so different. The staff were surly and had a particularly poor attitude towards caucasions. They were friendly enough towards their fellow Asians. We have never experienced this before on any airline, but found this particularly surprising in an airline like SIA. We did a further flight in early September in Premium Economy from Singapore to London - see separate review. Lift your game SIA. We won't be back. We did not feel welcome.
label: negative

text: Mediocre service in Premium Economy with Singapore Airlines Oh how the Premium Economy (PE) service has dropped on Singapore Airlines (SA) - not good compared to other PE serviced airlines. In PE you pay extra (a lot extra) this normally includes individual welcoming, a hot towelette and in many cases a drink prior to takeoff. None of this on SA it was an extraordinary amount clutter and confusion through out the PE cabin. One alcohol drink prior to meal service with there wine pours being half a small plastic glass , no offered alcohol drink at meal service, meals through "Book the Cook" were not good at all but oh offered plenty of glasses of water throughout trip. Come on SA what has happened to your past extraordinary service that was legendary. Folks if you choose to have a little more comfort and service, choose another airline as Singapore Air has chosen to be a just another mediocre airline.
label: negative

text: Can't fault it ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ I was happy with the flight, in-flight entertainment. The plane was clean as a whistle, I checked it. The embarking process is interesting as I thought it would ease settling in. However, I had a window seat but found people already occupying isle seats. When flying long haul its always important to wear comfortable shoes and clothes and keep warm. If you don't have the airline provides slippers and socks on request as well as blankets and pillows. They also have tooth brush for those who don't have in their carry-on luggage. Water is always avail for the dry throat.
label: positive

text: Good service and good food ! The Kochi -Singapore route is serviced by a smaller aircraft and it has its problems.the Singapore-Shanghai sector is serviced by larger aircraft with lots of space.The service, timings and food are very good.
label: positive

text: The Bad, The Great and Okay Overall services is good. Remember to use their Krisflyer Apps which helps to remind you of your flight status and easy check-in through the Apps. Fantastic experience to check-in your luggage early through the Jewel and you can enjoy spending time inside The Jewel. Again, the baggage claim is quick and seamless. The seat is tight like all economy flight. Liked best on the flight back to Singapore as the flight stewardess is attentive and helpful & least on the flight to Hong Kong as the flight crew is rushing and messy in serving the flight meal and not attentive.
label: positive

text: first time but not the last First time flying Singapore Airlines. The plane was an Airbus; good leg room in Economy seating; the free headphones were much better than the ones on other airlines. Entertainment selection was good - listened to a BB King album, then George Michael. Didn't watch any movies because it was a short flight, but there was a pretty good choice in different genres.s The lunch was tasty - rice with ginger pork and chocolate ice cream for dessert. Gate and cabin crews friendly and efficient.
label: positive

text: I've just come back from a UK - Perth return trip. I first used them two years ago when I went UK - Auckland return and at that time I could not fault them in anyway this time my experience was different. The food was awful I'm not a person that's fussy about food but every meal was awful. The staff as always were great but you have to ask for everything now that's not standard such as a beer! Don't get me wrong they will get you one but you have to ask before they would ask you. The pillows were dirty god knows with what but you wouldn't put your head on one. I cant put my finger on it but the planes all four were tired. Maybe just a case that they are cutting back the same as everyone else but to me there's no excuse for such poor meals. 3 of us travelled and all of us thought the same.
label: positive

text: Good and comfortable flights The trip went smoothly, and the entertain,ent system worked well. Foodwise, it was okay, but not extraordinary.
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines poor communication being trying to get a refund/credit for an unused flight for over a year! I can see from the reviews that Singapore airlines is not what it used to be in terms of customer service and communication they are atrocious! been trying to get a refund for over a year since March 2022. 1st of all they changed my flight so I said i can not use that flight tried several times on the website to comminicate about it and it was so difficult and response times up to 15 days! finally I had to go to Jakarta to a Singapore airlines office to speak to someone. They acknowledged and accepted my claim but said I can just call to make a new flight resevation at a later date. During that time trying to speak to someone over the phone was impossible. Huge wait times I mean over an hour. I gave up. This year I requested a refund and I received an email saying I would get the refund within 6 weeks? this is after a year had gone by. Still waiting for the refund 6 weeks late no confirmation it had been refunded. I wrote again notifying the airline my email address had changed which I did through the Singapore airlines FF portal on the website. you have to go through a security text message to verify its you to do this. Then I get another email saying they need to verify who I am and I need to send all the information again. OMG sooo Frustrating! Still waiting! I am wrting this review because of my frustration. I will not use this airline agian and want to warn others about my experience. This was business class flight & I am a Gold star alliance member. This is totally unacceptable as an airline and if there is a consumer complaints portal in Singapore I would love to know who to submit my complaint to about Singapore airlines.
label: negative

text: Wonderful Flight to Singapore Very quickly the aircraft was loaded and we were taking off before we knew it. Very efficient number loading made this easy and no fuss. We were only in the air a few minutes when the hostess bought us a lovely warm face washer to refresh us. Then we had constant attention with meals and snacks with any drinks we fancied. We arrived into Singapore after a 10 hour flight feeling refreshed. The best flight we have ever had. Thank you.
label: positive

text: Good flight - shame about the check-in We had booked this flight through Air New Zealand many months prior, because of the excellent price. Three of the four legs on a round trip from Auckland NZ to London LHR were with Singapore Airlines. Unfortunately this meant we were unable to select our seats on any of the SA flights. One leg I was in a separate cabin from my husband (Some might say this was a good thing!). However, the check-in at Heathrow on the way home was a nightmare. We initially tried to go to a manned check-in desk but were told by attendants to check in at the self-service kiosks. This was a complete failure as the system simply kept asking us for our passports, regardless of how many times we scanned them. Eventually we gave up and went back to the attendants who reluctantly sent us to stand in the (by now) enormous queue. The queue was encompassing passengers for all the Star Alliance airlines (at least 6 others), and we shuffled along for nearly an hour before finally reaching a lovely lady at the check-in desk who explained that the kiosks for Singapore Airlines do not accept Air New Zealand bookings - but nobody else seemed to be aware of that fact. The rest of the flight - seats (together, thanks to the nice lady), food, drinks, comfort etc - were all fine, but the check-in experience left a nasty taste in the mouth, and we will probably not be flying SA again. Baggage claim was also less than perfect: one bag came through quickly but the other took another 20 minutes to arrive. Always a gamble, but disappointing at the end of 27 hours long haul.
label: neutral

text: GREAT AIRLINES Their service was excellent and friendly, for go inside they do the best with group boarding pass, in-flight entertainment good, with good leg space, sitting area was comfortable and the cabin was clean. great airlines
label: positive

text: Outstanding customer Service I purchased two nonrefundable business class tickets NZ-AMS return before the coronavirus stopped our plans. We notified Singapore Air that we did not want to fly. Received an immediate reply with instructions on how to apply to get our money back. Full repayment into my account on the day we should have flown. Excellent service.
label: positive

text: No hassle flight. Both legs were hassle free. The slightly more generous pitch gives enough room to be comfortable and although I can't sleep on planes I did manage to doze. This trip I broke the flight with a night layover in Singapore and a good night s sleep made a world of difference at the other end, suffering merely a body clock issue not being over tired. The cabin staff are always friendly and helpful and the food is ok (you don't expect luxury in economy) which is fine as I am not flying for the food! The film selection was not great but the number of to series has increased so I found enough to watch.
label: positive

text: Service During the flight from Zurich to Singapore, we had already cancelled our selection of seafood for our meals on board. This was because during the flight from Singapore to Zurich, we ate the seafood meals and was not really to our liking. So we decided to select from the menu during our return flight. During the meal time, to our horrors, the service crews just passed us and continue serving the guests. I thought what had happened as people are getting the food but not us. I finally asked the steward why are we not served? He was shock that they have missed us during the serving and apologised profusely. He asked us what we want to eat and we told him any food is fine except no seafood. To our horrors, he mentioned there are only seafood left and do we mind taking it. I told him why we do not want anymore seafood. He mentioned he will check and see what can be done. After a few minutes a stewardess came back and apologised and asked us to take the seafood. I told her that we specifically don’t want seafood meals and would have got the other choice if they have not missed us during the serving of meals. She said she will check what can be done. After a few minutes, a senior Stewardess came and enquire on the issue again. She said she will see to it and left. She came back with a plate of mutton stew with rice for me and a plate of pork chop and rice for my Wife. I believe it’s from the other class. She apologised for the lapsed. I would have been very angry if they would force me to accept the seafood. Luckily the senior Stewardess resolved the issue. I am not happy with the chances to get me to accept what they have left which in the first place they should not have missed us out. At the end, I could say besides this issue, the flight and service was fantastic. They handled it professionally even though the lapsed should not have happened, being a reputable airline. I have been using Singapore Airline for a Long time and in fact have already confirmed my flight to Perth in May and Bangkok in August with them. I will still recommend to fly with them.
label: positive

text: great airline and fabulous staff We have flown several times with this airline and the reason for this is that they have a good safety track record, the A380 is a bit more spacious and the crew are so nice and helpful. Nothing is too much trouble and its always service with a smile.
label: positive

text: excellent service Excellent service. I request wheelchair for my mom urgently when we arrived at Changi Airport for transfer and they really help. Also the service lounge for special service was very good. Food also good, they serve the kids first for priority, very nice. My kids enjoy the flight and SQ give my kids some goodies too
label: positive

text: Perfect service Very responsive and friendly staff ‘ always available on request . New plane is another big plus . Food is the only complain that requires attention
label: positive

text: Now a lost airline I had traveled on Singapore airlines for my honeymoon for my first visit to Singapore and had a fab experience With the same hope I travelled Singapore airlines this time with my wife and kids Service has gone bad Courtesy extinct Smile is there but forced Service in flight pathetic is the word did not even serve a cup of tea don’t know why Cleanliness of the seats average as if the seat covers have not been changed for last so many years All in all disappointed as I had traveled twice before on the same airlines with better experiences Think they are going the cheap way cost cutting 😓😓loosing the charm
label: negative

text: Great staff, good food and drinks At the gate before boarding started, I asked about upgrades. Decided it was not worth the money. But, they did move me to an exit row (I had not asked for that, but glad that they did) in coach so that I would have extra leg room for the 13 hour flight. During the flight, I asked if I could try a Singapore Sling (never had one before). So, they made me one to try. The two meals were average airline food. However, I was surprised that one could get extra food (snacks) at almost anytime.
label: positive

text: Disappointing business class Very disappointed as expensive compared to other airlines. No champagne offered had to ask every time also no toiletries bag and told “no we don’t have them” with no offer of anything - even an eye mask! Simply not acceptable for business class. Also no dedicated business class queue in Singapore stood at the end of economy. Really did not feel worth the money at all. Could not care less attitude by staff. Strange seat configuration had to sit diagonally. Old and shabby between Singapore and Perth.
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines - The Only Way to fly To Singapore. We had seats 51J & 51K, to be honest, I would buy Premium Economy when next we fly. Food was good & although they ran out of one meal that I preferred, they gave me one from another area which was appreciated. Staff were great & the entertainment of variety of movies, music etc. was very good. We have flown Singapore Airlines to Singapore a number of times & like their service plus on long haul flights a stop-over especially to not get jet-lag on the way back to Sydney staying in Singapore for us for 4-5 days is ideal. If you find nothing to see in Singapore, then you are not looking, so stay a while & enjoy such a lovely country to visit.
label: positive

text: Friendliest airline The moment you check in, you”ll feel you are pampered already. The check in staffs were so helpful so are the FAs, all the way to Perth, Australia. I like taking this airlines because they care so much of their passengers.
label: positive

text: Great Airline Flew to Melbourne 1st Feb and returned 23rd Feb. Excellent flights, punctual, very friendly and hard working cabin crew. The Ladies dressed beautifully and the male staff very smart. Food satisfactory. Great film choices, toilets cleaned regularly and check in easy. Would definitely use Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: THE MOST DREADFUL AIRLINE BREAKFAST EVER While not expecting haute cuisine, the breakfast aboard SQ295 was just inedible. It consisted of a very highly spiced chicken sausage, greasy roast potatoes and a dish called bread and egg pudding with Swis cheese that had the consistency of rubber. There is no excuse to serve such poor quality food. To their credit the airline staff were charming and attentive and gave me a ham salad bun which was tasty and fresh. We booked early and were able to secure seats of just two but this was an older plane and the seats weren’t particularly comfortable. Sadly I don’t think Singapore Airlines is the airline it once was.
label: negative

text: Singapore airline suite It’s an amazing experiences during this trip. The staff were really helpful and provide good services except they were changed our seat without informing us.
label: positive

text: A good Airline but not as I was led to understand This was billed as THE AIRLINE - well top deck A380 it was going to be good - and sure the boarding was good - the crew friendly and the seat first class - the movies were plentiful - the seat made a good bed and the pillow and cover were of a high standard - my issue comes from the fact it is billed as one of the three best well - I would question that - it is good - the food lets it down - its not great -the lamb was dry - difficult to get right - and the Breakfast was pretty dire - the egg was awful and the veal sausage un eatable - Drinks were served but no refills - this was a 13 hour flight - you did not get an amenity kit you had to ask for the items you wanted - socks, slippers etc - I have to say that on the same route to Europe Finnair would be as good if not better. They have like most airlines reduced costs and it shows.
label: positive

text: Don't be fooled they aren't that great... Poor food quality (Chef stuff-cold multiple times), aging aircraft interior, insincere flight attendants, quirky check in (weighing a backpack,,,really?), below par flight management (ticketing and gate notification). Sorry to say any domestic carrier exceeds them without the fake smiles.
label: negative

text: SQ Ultra-long flights SQ38/37 I was a bit apprehensive about taking these flights due to the length (15 hours outgoing & 17 hours return) as I have major difficulty sleeping on planes (even on flat beds), but the promotional offer that they had beat the next best fares by US$700 which made this a no brainer. I made some adjustments for this trip and bought a neck pillow (firm as opposed to soft) and took a sleeping medication which I usually avoid. Check-in and boarding was quick and easy as there were only 160+ passengers due to the configuration of the A350-900ULR aircraft. Bio-metric boarding was used in both Singapore and Los Angeles. Once settled in after take-off, drinks and dinner were served. Those who reserved their meals using the "Book The Chef" were served first, and I finished omg meal before the rest of the other passengers were served their meal. On the outgoing, I ordered the roast chicken rice and considering that Singapore is their home base, I was disappointed with both the quality and the portion. I was left feeling hungry. There were mid-flight snacks available later but it was western biased. I brought my own instant noodles (comfort food for many Asians, and SQ should seriously consider making it available on the flight - and I was not the only one on board who brought my own instant noodles). The 2nd main meal which was first served about 7 hours into the flight has now changed to 2 hours before landing based on passenger feedback. I agree with this change) and I ordered a nasi lemak this time. Again the quality and portion were disappointing. On the return flight out of Los Angeles, I ordered the prawn sambal rice and dim sim, and they were much better and portions were slightly bigger. The crew were excellent and were proactively going round to ensure we were well hydrated, and happily prepared the cup instant noodles when asked. The seat was comfortable. I was able to select the individual seat at the back which had its own hand luggage compartment. I was not disturbed by anyone else. Even the single seat in the last row was able to recline to its max and was not hindered by the wall behind. I was able to get about 3-4 hours sleep on the outgoing and about 6 hours on the return, which was a first for me. This was definitely helped by the A350 carbon fuselage technology which allowed a higher cabin pressure and more humidity compared to the traditional aluminium fuselage. I felt more refreshed and less tired compared to 8-hour flights in conventional planes. Flight was on-time on the outgoing but was delayed on the return due to a passenger fainting in the cabin during boarding. This delayed the flight by an hour but it was not the airline's fault. The captain kept the passengers informed on the progress during the delay, which was good. The only negative was that a number of fellow passengers were more keen to take photos/videos of the incident and blocking the passageway of those who were trying to help (cabin crew and other passengers). I would definitely consider SQ's ultra long flights as a serious option if I were to travel to the USA.
label: positive

text: Excellent flying experience Wonderful experience. The crew members were very humble and jovial. They are always take care of your comfort. The flight wan neat and clean and the food quality was just awesome.
label: positive

text: A Wonderful Experience On June 30th I flew long haul from Hanoi to Dublin and travelled the first leg of my journey with Singapore Airlines. The flight was on schedule, the check in and boarding was painless and the cabin crew were most attentive and pleasant. I had never flown with Singapore Airlines before and, I must say they lived up to my expectations and well deserve the good reputaion they enjoy.
label: positive

text: Always impressive The service from SQ is so overrated and over-priced, I restrict myself to redemption flights these days. This was a return flight, which I can change the timing of, as it's a redemption, and I did need to do this. I called a week or so to move the return leg 2 days back, and was told this would cost $543. I explained it was a redemption flight, I was using air-miles, but the day I was returning was apparently popular, for no reason they could tell me, so that was it. I said a new flight is only $150, so how can I need to pay that for just moving the date?? But you can't argue with SQ, that's not what customer service is for. SO I booked a new flight with Scoot, just $120 for the new flight. I asked SQ to cancel the return leg and refund the points, which they refused to do until I had taken the out leg, so I called after that, and they cancelled the return leg and kept the air miles, to cover the "admin costs". Unbelievable. The cabin has that 1990s feel, with remote controls (no touch screen) for the TV fitted in the side of the armrest panel so your thigh constantly hits the buttons and interrupts the film. The cabin crew, as usual, refuse to smile, and avoiding eye-contact in case you asked them for something. I had to pay extra for the exit seat that has enough leg room for a westerner, but the recline button wouldn't lock after it released. I used the call button, and eventually someone came and cancelled that whilst I was watching a movie. When I was told just before landing to "put my seat upright", I said "I can't, it's broken", the reply was a predictably curt "just make sure it's upright for landing!"
label: negative

text: They really look after you. Great attention to detail. Politely address you by name! Good choice of food. Even, on return trip Sydney to Canberra (less than 1/2 hr) was presented with a seafood platter refreshment! And it was excellent. Amazing.
label: positive

text: Still top class This was one of the best airlines. The space was great and I loved the foot rest for my feet when sitting up as I have short legs! The service was the best. The attendants are so genuine and caring. My partner had so many problems working the systems out and his attendance was so patient! the food is as usual delicious and choice of wines and spirits excellent. I think the video TV and movie selection is the best and also the easiest to use. Will definitely fly with this airline again.
label: positive

text: YGS trip Board the flight 30 mins before 12pm. The flight is packed with visitors from Taiwan or people going Taiwan for vacation. Selected low fat meal which is not bad and follow with ice cream. The flight is smooth and entertainment is good. But can't completed the 3rd show. Overall good experience.
label: positive

text: Cruise Immersion A great way to fly. The attendants were very professional yet accomodating and approachable. This has been one of my greatest experience. I feel like im a step closer to my dream. Also, this airline made our flight very convenient for us. Showing us how great it is to fly with them.
label: positive

text: Makes long haul travel with children much easier! We travelled with our three children from Melbourne to London with a (very) brief stopover in Singapore. The flights were extremely comfortable, on time, and we enjoyed excellent customer service from the fabulous SQ staff.
label: positive

text: This was my first time flying Singapore Airlines and it won't be my last. The staff at the check in were extremely friendly and helpful followed by the air crew being some of the friendliest faces I have seen in the air for many years and many dozens of flights. as always the economy seats are a little tight but the service, food and in flight entertainment were all top class.
label: positive

text: Comfortable seats with good leg space in the economy class Although the staff were courteous and professional, the meals served were not very good. My first meal on air was fish with steamed rice, beans and carrots. There were no salt and pepper sachets in the tray. The cup of tea was served without a sachet of sugar, but was given on request. The second meal I had was beef served with the same steamed rice, the same beans and the same carrots, again with no salt and pepper. Again, the cup of tea was given without sugar, but upon request I was given sugar. The best thing I liked was my Krisflyer reward which I collected on board. The meals were the least liked part of the flight.
label: positive

text: Travelled from Singapore to Auckland on the 10.25pm flight. Service aboard the flight was excellent. On arrival in Auckland passengers had to disembark by way of mobile stairs. I have to say, while being advised to mind our step as we stepped onto the swaying stairway, due to wind gusts, I noticed there was only one staff member that was there to help with passengers, which I felt was a small let down due to the fact it was a full flight. However, the staff that was helping passengers was absolutely amazing.
label: positive

text: Falling Standards Singapore Airlines or Krisflyer has been a preferred airline of mine for sometime. I always delight in Changi Airport, and decided to extend my transit stopover by 4 days.....Heading home after a great few days, the namesake airline of Singapore is only now a sad reflection of what it used to be. Even the friendly attitude of the onboard crew is, while efficient, now clipped and minimalist. There is NO personal connection....now it's just a job. Sad. The food quality was the poorest I have experienced. On the 3 meals served, there was at least one or two items missing each time, and the food arrived barely warm. No longer my preference.
label: neutral

text: Thank Goodness for the Free Seat Even though it was a double-decker Airbus, boarding and disembarking where both pretty efficient, which is always a boon. Seats and legroom pretty good for Economy, but I do feel that we won the cattle-class lottery by getting 3 seats between the 2 of us - I'm not sure how well I would have coped with 12+ hours in a full row. Unless you can afford an upgrade, I doubt that you'll do much better than with SA.
label: positive

text: Tokyo to Los Angeles. Cabin was clean and with decent space for knee room for a 5'3 female. Complimentary 2 bag check in which was nice. Amenity kit provided complimentary containing tooth brush, paste, and socks. No slippers or eye mask as other airlines. Bathroom needed to be better maintained as waste bin was full by hour 4 out of 12 hour flight, soaps in disarray and bathroom prep tray (mouth wash etc). Special meal service was kind although a bit disappointing as you do not decide what meal you would like to eat but it is already prepared generic “western style” of whatever meal selection chosen. I would’ve loved to pick my meal with the changes applied, especially knowing tickets were booked ahead enough. Food was decent, but often the crew would overlook my seat and miss out several beverage//snack passes due to special needs. This was not at all an issue flying USA to Japan. But an issue on this flight. Main complaint is how crew could’ve done better to handle special requests with passengers. I booked and had a seat arranged, by surprise there were no shows in my row. Instead of privately making me aware of any request, an attendant publicly asked for my seating reassignment so that I may switch places with another passenger so that they my lie across the row with their bad knee. I’m partially deaf in one ear and spinal braced. Instead of privately requesting in writing, the crew member and requesting passenger makes a scene for me to move because I am unable to hear. So speaking louder while in flight should be better. There should be a better way for flight crew to handle those with special needs such as mute, deafness, and hidden disabilities instead of causing a scene or skipping passengers who cannot speak. Be like other airlines that have crew member buttons on the seat panels such where passengers can press for assistance or communicate needs.
label: negative

text: Awful journey We didn’t eat at Singapore airport thinking our £900 fare One way each would include 2 substantial meals. Took off. Got a sandwich and coffee. Maybe a bowl of tiny fruit. 8 hours later a small hot breakfast. Worst catering for a long haul. The seats are so cramped and when the person in from reclines it’s game over for any kind of comfort. Crew lovely but working with a bad service. A few safety concerns such as blankets left on floor around exit door during landing (trip hazard in evacuation). Crew talking during take off and landing (should be focussing in their safety drills in case of sudden emergency). Toilet doors not locked during take off and landing. Also too many announcements which could have been all done at once instead of the constant interruption. Never again. Singapore have lost my vote.
label: negative

text: My connection in Changi was just over an hour, which meant power-walking through Terminal 3 like I was in a fitness ad, but I even managed to window-shop before heading to the gate. Boarding the A380 was the highlight, my first time on the superjumbo, and honestly I get the hype. Quiet, smooth, roomy, and with pillows and blankets already waiting on the seat, it felt like flying in a moving library. Turbulence near Taipei thanks to a hurricane reminded me we were still in the air, but otherwise it was ridiculously comfortable. Seats had generous pitch, adjustable (if slightly stiff) headrests, proper tray table design, cup holders, USB ports, and power outlets. The IFE had a bigger screen than the short-haul jets, and it was slick to use. WiFi was patchy, but that is more politics than technology when flying over certain countries. Meal was chicken egg noodles in honor of SG60, tasty enough to not need extra seasoning. Toilets definitely showed their age, but the crew were absolute stars, friendly and attentive. Bonus points for baggage arriving in Shanghai without drama, plus app tracking so I did not have to play “Will my bag make it?” roulette. If the A380 is a dying breed, I am glad I caught it while it still shines.
label: positive

text: You wont feel youre flying in a giant metal tube One of the best flights in terms of seat comfort , leg room , cleanliness , and food and drinks and best service by the crew .
label: positive

text: Just ok Have travelled business with Singapore a few times and the service was exceptional. This time my family flew a mixture of Premier Economy and Economy to Perth. I have to agree with other reviews you don’t get much extra with Premier economy. Having said that you did get a bit of extra seat width which is the biggest benefit. We paid for extra leg room for our Sons in Economy and they had great seats when flying in the A380. I think paying for extra leg room is very good value for money on these trips to Australia. However they were not at all impressed with the food offering and snacks. All very limited, unless you like Asian food, you will be disappointed. Also if you happen to be the last to be served as we were on our leg to Perth or as my Sons were on the return today to London, food choices ran out! That’s not acceptable when so much money is being paid. Overall I’m not saying I wouldn’t fly Singapore again, but I’ll be looking at other airlines next time I fly to Australia or that part of the world before I make a decision. As an aside, I also think Singapore IT platform needs updating and spending up. The site is clunky, slow and the app isn’t much better. Look hard at your options before booking.
label: neutral

text: Always the best airlines After several time fly with Singapore airlines and this the time to give review. Amazing friendly crew as smile always on their uniforms. Best meal and comfortable chairs. Thank you for always be the best.
label: positive

text: Best airline I've flown with in a long time This is my first time flying with Singapore and I have to say it was excellent start to finish. I did a long flight (over 13 hours) to Singapore and was well fed and looked after. Their in-flight entertainment system functioned perfectly and is up to date with movies etc. Their staff cannot do enough for you. The same was true of the short flight to Bali and I was impressed that I also got a meal on that flight. My only complaint is the leg room is pretty poor (not helped by all the magazines provided to read) and I'm 5'7" so not a giant! Other than that I would happily fly with them again!
label: positive

text: Not a satisfying experience I was disappointed with SA compared to recent flights with Emirates. The food, particularly out of Singapore was dreadful and overall the service offered by the staff was below the standard expected.
label: neutral

text: Unbelievable Booked a flight for my family and my self for the 12/4 2022 from London to Bangkok was sent conformation so ordered a taxi and traveled to air port . After queuing for to hours got to the checking desk only to be told they had no record of my booking. I showed them the conformation and invoice from SingaporeAir they showed me the screen to confirm we were not booked in and as there was no one at the airport from SingaporeAir and no one answering the phone we had to order a taxi home . After calling them everyday for more than a week and being told they would get back to me still waiting . We have now lost the hotel money plus the test and Go . Thai visa and taxi fares not to mention the loss of work .
label: negative

text: Not bad Not much legroom, but otherwise not bad, my pre-ordered food was given to me way before anyone else got food, I loved that... I was really hungry
label: positive

text: Downgrade service of the airline after Covid situation My route is flying back to the US using SQ from Bali, and transit in Frankfurt. Bali to Singapore operated with their low cost airline, scoot. Very basic service like the other low cost airline, so I cannot command much. Singapore to Frankfurt, 12 hours flight: terrible Meals, no snack in between this long hours flight, no in flight meal purchase option despite their terrible meal option. So basically you stuck with their horrible meal and other amenities. Cold bread, no salad or fruit, and very poor meal selection. No game in flight as you need your own device, poor selection of movie. The only thing they offer I observe during my total 20++ hours flight back to the states is WATER. Frankfurt to NY, 8 hours flight, another horrible experience. Same movie selections from the previous flight (Singapore to Frankfurt), the meals option is even worse as the flight attendants refer this as not a long flight despite it is 8 hours flight with no other option of their poor meals and limited entertainment. 1st meal is maincourse, second one is a very basic pork/vegetarian sandwich. The flight attendant mention "we don't have in flight purchase meal or snack for passengers, whatever we have we will give it to you." However, they do not have anything to offer to you. Comparing to my experience with SQ before the covid situation, flying with them in the same economy class, they used to give you warm towels after you boarding to the airplane, and before each meal, warm bread, fruit or salads in every meals, ice cream in between of the flight hours or different variety of snacks, eye masks, which I refer it as a great memorable experience with them. With my recent flight with them, I don't have any good thing to remember during my flight from Bali to NY beside a boring long hours flight. Based on my recent experience with SQ, I don't think this airline deserves a 5 star airline rating if I compare it with another 5 star airline like Emirates or Qatar, flying in the same economy class. For me SQ nowadays is like a budget low cost airline which claim to be a 5 star. For the price that slightly cheaper than Emirates, I don't think is worth it to fly with SQ and I will definitely not recommend this airline for a long hour flight to anyone.
label: negative

text: Jakarta to Johannesburg via Singapore, and this was second long haul flight with Singapore Airlines in the last 2 months. I arrived early in Jakarta and was very pleased when they put me on an earlier flight. The crew were welcoming and worked hard on this short sector. I paid for the preferred seat on the Singapore to Johannesburg leg, and although the leg room is great you are next to the central toilet block on this type of aircraft. The food on the return flight was terrible and even the first meal served approx an hour after take off was inedible. Thankfully the breakfast on the Singapore to Jakarta leg was fresh and tasty.
label: positive

text: In flight service is good and the office is terribly non-cooperative The inflight attendants are very good in service. In flight entertainment is below average. You don't have too many choices of movies. Cleanliness is good. We had horrifying time till almost the day of departure due to change of name (expanded form of surname in place of initials). The office people are merciless and not interested in cooperating to customers' requests in spite of agreeing to pay 50USD for the name change. Had a very bad experience.
label: neutral

text: Always a great trip with this air line. There is plenty of room, good food and lovely staff We love the fact that we can fly direct from our home town of Christchurch to Singapore and from there to pretty much everywhere else. The planes are always in good condition, plenty of space, tasty food and good service from the lovely attenants
label: positive

text: Great flight A fantastic flight experience! Would recommend this airline. The seats are comfy, great movie options and fantastic food! Friendly and helpful staff on board. Very impressed
label: positive

text: No Problems, Economy Competent Airline with no problems. We travell;ed by economy and we got economy, Nothing broke, the food was ok and the seats were of a reasonable size for economy. Good value considering what we paid.
label: positive

text: New air craft, comfortable, clean and polite crews in th plane Still maintain a very good reputation of Singapore airline standard... Well done crews services and courteous crews onboard. Meal was delicious this time as comapre to previous time standard drop... Keep it up. Well done Singapore airline
label: positive

text: call centre was dreadful Waited 45min on the phone to get a first class tkt , gave up and went with Emirates. The most annoying part of this .is the voice message saying that you are next in line after 1 minute (absolute rubbish). sorry Singapore you've lost a very good ex client..
label: negative

text: Best airline I have travelled on other airlines and to me , Singapore Airlines is the best! The excellent cabin crew service, extensive inflight entertainment, toilets are clean, reasonable selection of beverages offered.
label: positive

text: Painless Travel I had a cycle accident breaking elbow and hand, loosing front teeth, upper lip severely cut and face grazed from contact with road surface and after emergency treatment decided to return home to have elbow/arm reconstruction surgery. Sadly I had to purchase new flight ticket but as always had travel insurance. Singapore Airlines staff from moment of arrival at booking counter at Munich right up to baggage collection in Brisbane were exceptionally helpfull. As were the passengers seated next to me on each sector. Whilst I declined the multiple offers staff at each airport viz Munich Changi Brisbane offered to provide transport and assistance with my carryon luggage. I was already a Singapore Airlines supporter but more so now.
label: positive

text: Average and unhappy flight started off from Singapore Separated with my pregnant wife after online check-ins and just realized after we are on-board. Requested to change a seat with the air crew but no respond. Technically the A380 is not so fantastic. The seat itself is not clean and looks very old.
label: neutral

text: best airline Put us in first class because we had a choice to be bumped with a tour of Soul and first class We took it and it was great.
label: positive

text: 5 Stars airlines The service was excelent, and luckily we got to board a new 787 on our way from osaka to Singapore, and the interior was spectacular. The food on our way from Jakarta to Singapore was a uqite dissapointing, the chicken was a little tough. Other than that, everything was 5/5
label: positive

text: On of the best airlines I ever took Very comfortable seats, good and reach food, excellent entertainment program and very helpful personnel
label: positive

text: The Best Airlines Myself and Partner traveled to Brisbane from LHR and after a lot of planning we decided to stop over in Singapore at the teminal Airport Hotel with a 13 hr stopover the 1st part was flying in a A380 BRILLIANT plane even in Economy 5* travel and drinks and Food the service was 2nd to none great hotel at singapore and 2nd Leg in a A360 also Brilliant When its a Journey of a lifetime WE was not Dissapointed and We have traveled with Multiple airlines over the Years INCLUDING 1st class with some ,SINGAPORE is NO 1
label: positive

text: Flew via Melbourne from Wellngton We flew Wellington - Melbourne, Melbourne - Singapore. Usually from Wellington we have to fly to Auckland or Christchurch for our international leg. Since I travelled the Airline has put newer planes on the route which will be an improvement. Our Wellington to Singapore leg was awful, the plane older and the entertainment system was so poor it wasn't worth watching. That made for very long flights. As always the crew were lovely and food pretty good considering. Our Singapore to London flights were good because we were on a bigger and more modern plane. We did a stopover on our way to the UK, taking advantage of the stopover holiday benefits which are good. On the way home we had 13 hours in Signapore, with an early morning arrival. The stopover would have been better placed on the homeward journey.
label: positive

text: Singapore Business Class Had a great flight … great food ( book the chef)...fantastic seating and very good staff who bent over backwards to please.. would fly with them anywhere
label: positive

text: Comfortable flight good service Flight was good arrive ahead of time. Cabin crew staff was helpful with putting hand luggage in the overhead storage. Had a nice inflight meal.Good selection of movies to pass the time
label: positive

text: Good carrier and experience Flew Singapore Airlines from London Heathrow to Bali connecting through Singapore. Had an Airbus A380 from LHR to Singapore which was great, modern and comfy. By contrast, from Singapore to Bali we had an Airbus A330 which seemed a bit dated. Crew very friendly and helpful and patient!! Really detest the self-service baggage labelling that larger carriers seem to be adopting, Singapore Airlines included.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Hong Kong. Original A380 but was swapped out for a Boeing 777, so a little disappointed. My last experience with them was on a Boeing 747 (wasn't great then), and their service has improved considerably since. Check in was friendly and fuss free, and got along my way really quick. The IFE is rather dated but the selection was rich. Cabin interior was cosy and comfortable despite the age of the aircraft, making itself rather distinguishable from their sister budget air Scoot. The most memorable part was the food, which is a portion rather worthy of premium economy or even business class of other airlines. Return to Singapore an A330 looked newer and IFE was touch-screen. Cabin crew quickly served drinks and snacks after take-off, as there was slight delay on the ground. Separately they served the meal, and again they did not disappoint. Topped it off with a Hagen-Das ice-cream. The price was reasonably good as I booked early. If you are particular about having good food on board, this airline is certainly for you.
label: positive

text: Do NOT book Singapore Airlines business class, not worth it. Booked a business class flight from Singapore to Manila on a Boeing 787 expecting a lie-flat seat. Upon boarding, we were informed that there was an aircraft change to a very old Airbus A330 plane without lie-flat seats. Seat was very uncomfortable, not worth a business class ticket. Plane was probably a decade old or more. Inflight entertainment is likewise outdated, not even a touchscreen. Lobster thermidor was salty, rice and asparagus were overcooked. Do not book Singapore Airlines business class, not worth it.
label: negative

text: experience varied on different flights Seating excellent in business class. Seats were comfortable and very roomy. Flat bed was excellent and there was plenty of space. T.V screen was large so made viewing movies very enjoyable. Downside. staff -this varied on different legs of my trip Melbourne to singapore they couldn't care less mimimun service. Singapore to frankfurt excellent. staff attentive food service prompt. return trip also varied although food on morning flight sparce. Singapore to melbourne food service very slow. Took nearly two hours from asking what you wanted to food being served. If you want comforatble seats and a good bed then I cannot fault them. It was excellent. They just need to improve their business class service . I did note that my flights had a very big business class section so maybe they need to increase the staffing
label: positive

text: Perth to Singapore. Older plane but comfortable seats with decent recline and leg room, although probably assisted by my companion and I sharing 3 seats. My vegan meal was a nicely crumbed eggplant with tomato and string beans. My companion had a decent beef rendang meal. Both were tasty but too salty. Entertainment variety was good. KrisShop had a very good range of products too. Service was fantastic. This is my favorite airline.
label: positive

text: World Class Airline Not my first time flying in SQ, never disappoints me for their tip-top services. The crews are very helpful and attentive. In-flight entertainments were good enough to accommodate my 6 hours+ flight. Although the legroom is not as spacious as Emirates, it is still comfortable enough. Always a pleasant experience to fly with this airline.
label: positive

text: Melbourne to Singapore. Cabin crew refused to ask passenger in front of me to pull the chair backup when he served meals. I found it very unprofessional. I asked to speak to his supervisor, he then gave in to ask the front seat passenger to pull his chair up for me to have my meal. No more Singapore Airlines. I got the connected flight from Singapore to Nepal on SilkAir and to my surprise, before even handed my meal, the cabin crew asked the front seat passenger to pull up his chair for me to have my meal. I am not special, they have done that to everyone passenger.
label: negative

text: Excellent !! A great experience once again with Singapore Airline. We were in transit. The boarding was very orderly. On board service was excellent. The crew was very helpful and polite. The only slight problem was the food tray table. It was too small to keep food tray on it and eat comfortably.
label: positive

text: Enjoyable flight Reasonable food, good selection of in-flight entertainment, good leg room, excellent cabin crew, clean facilities.
label: positive

text: Another Great Flight No faults at all. Staff could not do enough. The plane was spotless and the food tasty. My seat was very comfortable and good leg space. Good choice of films and entertainment., to help pass the time. I can fault this airline from the moment we check in to when we land
label: positive

text: Book Specially Prepared Local Food Before You Check In Online. This is still the best way to get to New York from Singapore. No hassle, no rush, in flight food of your choosing, good headphones for the latest movies on seat wide monitors but best of all clean and dry toilets throughout the flight. Same for the flight back from New York except that there's no choosing of local food. However your choice must be made at least 24 hours before the flight ETD. The champagne and comfortable seat helps one to forget that the flight is 18 hours long.The well mannered young stewards on both flights made the journey much more enjoyable.
label: positive

text: Great crew Flew from Melbourne to Singapore and the service was exceptional. The crew was attentive and authentic, unlike some Middle Eastern airlines. The seats in business class was very comfortable and spacious although sleeping at an angle was not ideal. Book the Cook was worth the effort as it was a step up from the norm. Highly recommended.
label: positive

text: very bad customer service flown with them to houston from manchester, flight there was correct, good food, plenty of entertainment and staff on board were very helpfull. on the way back, we spent 8 hours sat in the place before they decided to cancel it, by that time there was no hotel left and it was amost 4am, we should even have landed by the time they decided to cancel the flight, no hot food nor hot drinks offered. we slept on chairs in the airport without anything to warm ourselves up. when we managed to come back i opened a claim to be told they didnt have to refund me and pay me any compensations because they were not a european airline .... cheap !!!!! disrespectful !!!!!! unappologetic !!!!! I am appauled, an airline of this standing that think they are above the law and that their customers do not deserve compensations when they land 24 hours late .... never again !!!!
label: negative

text: Extremely helpful cabin crew! The whole trip was amazing until a small problem occurred. Since the flight was from Japan, there was more fish than chicken on board and by the time the cabin crew reached us, they were out of chicken. We however didn't like the fish being served and decided to not get any food altogether, however the cabin crew serving us would not let us sit on an empty stomach, and soon came back with some food from business class, despite us flying on economy class! However, we couldn't eat the food served as it contained pork, which we don't eat for personal reasons. So then instead of giving up, the cabin crew then offered us cup noodles, which we then ate happily. I've flew to many different countries before and have had a similar experience of a different airlines where they ran out of food, however instead of offering an alternative or apologizing, the cabin crew on that airline told us to wait while 'they got us food' however they never came back and left us starving. Another plus of using singapore airlines is that if you stop over at Singapores Changi airport using Singapore Airlines, they give you 20$ per passenger to spend at any store in the airport (which by the way contains most big brands) and the airport also has a theatre, butterfly garden, a pond, massaging chair and a lot more ALL FREE! What more could a traveller want?
label: positive

text: Still one of the best I flew to Paris via Singapore in November 2019. For the past few years, I’ve done most of my travel with Emirates because they are (usually) significantly cheaper - but you get what you pay for! The staff on my flight were cheerful, helpful and efficient. The in-flight entertainment was good (though any flight that long will stretch even the most up-to-date movie catalogues) and the seat was comfortable. An added bonus is a stopover in Singapore. As far as airports go, Changi remains almost impossible to beat. I’ll definitely fly Singapore again!
label: positive

text: No pillows in economy cabin for a 13hr flight, I was offered an extra blanket to use as a makeshift pillow, hardly comfortable. Meal portions were small, no salad or small starter was offered, no towelette and they don't provide salt and pepper sachets with the meal. WiFi was erratic and terminal 2 is a non event due to renovations ! All in all a highly unsatisfactory experience and we will think twice before flying Singapore Airlines again.
label: negative

text: 🤬🤬🤬🤬🤬 I used to fly business with sia before Covid but with their ridiculous fares now I tried economy premium (business class ) price previous. Not worth the money It seems flying south from Asia is where they rip everyone as friends flying opposite pay way less Very disappointed and will look for alternatives in future. As they say let your feet do the talking
label: negative

text: Once in a lifetime trip This was the trip of a lifetime to New Zealand with a 3 day stop over in Singapore. Right from check-in at Heathrow, use of the business lounge and throughout the flights to Singapore and Christchurch the staff’s attention to detail and customer service was exemplary.
label: positive

text: Smooth and relaxing Excellent Service and seats, outstanding. Entertainment on board is more than enough. Food and Service is heart warming.
label: positive

text: Expected More So disappointing! However the good things with flying on this B777-200 flight was that 1)it left right on time 2) the space between your knees and the seat in front was more than ample. It was a smooth flight and arrived on time. Then the disappointing things mounted up :- 1) my seat had little stuffing in the seat 2) my monitor failed to work after 30 mins 3)the movies choice was old 4) the remote was not user friendly .... disappointing The meal of BBQ chicken was horrible. 1) green vegetables were grey, over cooked 2) rice was soggy 3)the sauce was highly composed of sweetness The hostess didn’t give the elderly woman beside me a chance of a drink but gave her tea without offering a wine. Plus gave her pasta and not offering a BBQ chicken. Poor service ..... disappointing Flying from NZ I would have expected a reasonable good NZ wine but no it was a South American wine!! ....disappointing Finally with 30 mins before landing I still had not been offered Customs Declaration to fill in. I had to go and ask for one. First time in all my travel this has happened. My low score was given as this flight at least got us safely to our destination. My Singapore flight to Wellington a week earlier was outstanding.so I wonder what happened to make this Tuesday flight so poor?
label: negative

text: Beyond Luxurious Hands down without a doubt the best Business Class flight Ive been on. I was luck enough to book this with miles which made the experience even better since I didnt have to pay for it. From the second you sit down they treat you like royality. Food and service were top notch. The seat itself is very spacious and comfortable. Would love to fly this business class product again.
label: positive

text: Broken promises to their customers I was looking to earn 1,800 elite miles to qualify for Silver status (status doesn't mean that much to me, but it gets you further up the waitlist when redeeming miles for flights, which I do care about). I contacted their customer reps prior to booking on a partner flight since I don't live in Asia and was told I would earn elite miles on this partner airline. After I flew, I saw regular miles accrue, but nothing credited to my elite miles balance. I contacted their customer service, who told me they would fix this but it would take 2 weeks. I contacted them after those 2 weeks and was told they would address it, but they would need at least 4 weeks. It's been about a month so I followed up and am now being told I won't be able to get those miles credited. I'm so incredibly angry about the fact that I booked a flight to earn this nominal amount of miles--and had confirmed I'd earn elite miles with them--only to be told I was given misinformation by them THREE times--and that they won't resolve this for me. I've flown with them quite a lot this past year and have an insane amount of frequent flier miles with them and am shocked at how poorly they're handling this.
label: negative

text: As Bi-annual visitors to Thailand, by recommendation, we went with SQ for a change having heard great things about Changi airport. This time we took our adult daughter too - 'the shopper'. Unfortunately, all we saw of Changi was what we saw while running through the terminal, owing to our first connecting flight being delayed, then our second going tek and requiring us to change aircraft many hours later than our departure time. We were handed forms at the departure gate and an invitation to contact Singapore Airlines for future incentives. Infact, what we got in reply, months later, was in short: 'Safety first; we don't compensate for delays or connections - if missed' (all our flights were SQ). Tough luck. Therefore our experience of SQ is one we wouldn't recommend and as they state, they wash their hands of you if you miss a connection even in the event that connecting flights are both SQ. As a former employee of a British airline operating the very same aircraft I feel I have enough experience to say this is at best a poor outcome from SQ. On a positive note, they make it easy to decide who not to spend your time airborne with. Also, my wife is gluten free, although requested, she had to skip some meals because they didn't have the gf option for her.
label: negative

text: Horrible experience in Business class By traveling Singapore airlines is my worst experience all my travel history. I never experience such uncomfortable business class seats the bed is so hard while traveling i developed pain in my back there is no space to straight your legs one has to sleep on a angle i could not sleep in my journey. There is very limited menu for the food specially for a vegetarian. The Delhi Singapore staff is rude and service is very bad. I want Singapore airlines should refund my fair. This my first and last time traveling in Singapore airlines. Will never travel or recommend any one. Raghu vyas well known imaginary realism painter in India.
label: negative

text: GV I don’t think any other Airlines will give such an Excellent inflyt service. The Crews approaches are excellent. They really take care of their Passengers. I always prefer SingaporeAir.
label: positive

text: Great way to fly It was an afternoon flight from Barcelona but because of the time difference we hit night very soon and dinner was served. The crew were efficient and warm. This makes jumping into singapore time a smoother transition. The crew were always asking if we need a drink, a snack, is everything ok? I had a gentleman who is a little big and I was feeling squeezed. I asked if I could move to the back. I did. The stewardess came a couple of times to check on me. Thank you SIA. It was a very pleasant flight and yes the take off and landing was flawless
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines What a delightful airline. We have never flown Silk Air previously. They were efficient, punctual and delightful
label: positive

text: Relax drink and enjoy your flight Have flown with many different airlines including American lines - Singapore airlines the best so far - traveled January 2019, unable to select correct date below
label: positive

text: SQ always lives up to my expectations The service and food quality aboard any SQ flight is always something to look forward to. They have impeccable manners when it comes to dealing with passengers. The food presentation and choice of drinks is also very good.
label: positive

text: Offensive experience of a new launch without respect New evening flight to Singapore from Johannesburg and the day I flew was the launch. If I had known this I wouldn’t have flown on that day. Checked in myself and had my e-boarding passes so went through to their partner lounge and we were notified by lounge attendants that boarding was taking place. Went to the boarding area to find a camera crew, various publicity people and no boarding taking place at all. While waiting they were interviewing people, having a raffle and waited for another 30 minutes while music blasted out of speakers. When it came time to board they started filming people boarding without any consent from me. I was so enraged I had to let them know they were offensive and needed my permission to film me. The gentleman checking Business Class in did apologize and asked them to stop filming but this made me feel like I was in a freak show. The experience on board to start with continued to disappoint me when I was served orange juice with alcohol in it, which I don’t drink, the meat starter and I am a vegetarian and ordered the vegetarian meal! What has happened to this airline that I used to love and respect? Not a fan anymore.
label: negative

text: Sister's 30th Birthday The best airline ever.Excellent service.Delicious food.Friendly & helpful flight attendants.Comfortable seats.
label: positive

text: Lack of customer support and organisation. Originally booked a flight through Singapore airlines for my mother in law to fly from Melbourne to Frankfurt, several hours before her departure the Singapore to Frankfurt flight got cancelled. I spent a couple of hours on the phone talking to both Lufthansa and Singapore airlines to organise the re-booking of her flight, i was bounced back and forth between the two trying to organise it before she had to check in from Melbourne. The calls took so long i made it to Melbourne airport and instead talked to the service desk and asked about the cancellation and they said it will sorted by the time she arrived in Singapore. Her direct flight got switched out for a Singapore -> Delhi -> Amsterdam -> Frankfurt. After receiving the email of the change only half an hour before her landing at Singapore i tried to talk to Singapore airlines to her a replacement direct flight as due to medical and language barriers she would not be able to navigate the multiple stopovers. Two hours on the phone got me nowhere and apparently every flight was booked for the destinations from Singapore to either Munich, Frankfurt, Amsterdam, Brussels, London or even back to Melbourne at which point a family member would be able to her get to her original destination without the insane amount of stopovers. The staff just kept insisting there is no available flights even for the day after her arrival in Singapore.
label: negative

text: Simply the best!! Just flown business class to Perth via Singapore and back. Singapore airlines are simply the best airline we have flown with. From check in to collecting luggage the service is fantastic. The in flight staff are amazing, beautiful people who were perfect in every way. Food was excellent, wines too and the bed extremely comfy. We were 2 very happy customers who would definitely choose you over Qatar,Cathay Pacific or Emirates next time who were all great but not quite Singapore. Many thanks
label: positive

text: Best Airlines for travel to SE Asia Flew Singapore airlines round trip. Premium economy is well worth the extra fee. Not too much to pay for additional room and comfort on a long flight. Food is good and service excellent. Clean airlines. Have used before and will again.
label: positive

text: NO MORE WHAT IT USED TO BE Singapore Airlines has been my favorite airline, and I probably have traveled the maximum number of times. My travel this time has been probably the worst I have ever traveled before. Here is a concise summary of the problems I faced and still facing 1) SQ 31: Bad In-flight service, No snacks were offered. Very slow/ineffective attendants. Bad food. 2) SQ 516: Terrible In-flight service. I ordered a special meal 24hrs before, and it had been accepted in the system, but I was told their printout does not show it. On top of it, while serving the drinks, our row was missed, and when reminded, the flight attendant shouted, saying waaaaaaiiiiiit. No snacks and Bad food again! 3) That's not the end. After all the inconvenience I went through, when I landed, I got an SMS saying my bag was delayed. I went to the lost & found and filed the baggage lost form, and I was told that it would come on the next day flight and would be delivered the following day. Since then, I have made 2 phone calls to the lost & found department (they have been nice) and numerous phone calls to Dalui & Sons - the delivery partner (very very bad service). I finally got the bag after 5 Days. 4) More details on Lost Bag The Singapore air check-in counter suggested checking in small baggage as well, which I did. I had some important, regular prescription medicines in my bag, but the delay due lost bag impacted me. I raised a complaint to Singapore airlines, and they royally ignored it. No response. What a joke this airline has become. Finally, with all this trouble, I am not so looking for my flight back to San Francisco. This would be my last Singapore airlines flight. Not worth the $3000 ticket per person round trip.
label: negative

text: A big difference. The difference between Singapore Airlines and Silk Air was chalk and cheese. I booked to travel to Darwin from Heathrow by Singapore Airlines. The first leg by Singapore was as good as one can expect - friendly helpful cabin crew, smart and always on hand to assist. Food pretty good. All change at Singapore. The Silk Air plane had minimum leg room and all the overhead lockers soon filled so it meant having to sit around bags, for a four and half hour journey. The cabin crew could not raise a smile and were grumpy. Being abrupt when people pointed out that they could not stow hand luggage anywhere. Food poor. Silk Air apparently undertake flight on behalf of Singapore Airlines so Singapore Airlines could do with looking at the Silk Air route.
label: positive

text: Disappointing food Loosing their edge against Emirates especially with the food. New aircraft with all the bells ands whistles but food very average.
label: neutral

text: Surabaya to Singapore. Worst airline in terms of punctuality. I am a frequent flier and i took this flight pretty often. For a premium airline (which is like really premium because Singapore Airlines price themselves higher than other airlines flying the same route) they are offering below subpar performance. Well, taking note their “getting you there on-time” slogan. They obviously getting us there but not on-time. One of the worst airlines where it comes to reliability and accountability.
label: negative

text: Terrible experience for Senior Citizens We have been traveling by Singapore airlines for the past 3 years and their service has always been great. Based on this experience, we decided to book our parents on this airline. Unfortunately, they had a terrible experience in Sydney. They were requested to stay in the flight till the wheelchairs arrived at the Sydney airport. But when the wheelchairs arrived and they sat on it, they were asked to get up and walk. This was completely unexpected and an insulting experience. Please make sure you hire people with the right attitude and who knows how to treat senior citizens with respect.
label: negative

text: Travelled HKG-SIN on 30 September on the A380. Flight departed around 30 minutes later than scheduled but overall the flight was smooth and we arrived on time. Seat was uncomfortably wide but made better by the 2 cushions on each side. It was a pity that the seat including the storage compartments looked dirty old and worn. Maintenance could have been better - have seen older but cleaner A330 from Asiana. Food-wise is the usual Business Class fare nothing spectacular but was of good quality and quantity. Service was prompt and friendly.
label: positive

text: Nice airline The flight ✈️ from Los Angeles to Tokyo about 14 hours- not bad- the flight attendant are very nice & attentive. Return was faster less than 10 hours. Right on time. Checking in was smooth & accommodating. Enjoyed the flight.
label: positive

text: Business class on Singapore airlines is always a pleasure. From Singapore to San Francisco, attentive polite staff, great food, IFE system with many choices, easy check in, and now they use TSA Pre so my connection to a US carrier went smoothly as well. The only negative on the trip was the child in the row behind me who did what small children do from time to time. Ear plugs helped there. With SQ, the miles accumulation doesn't go very far, but ever since the US carreiers devalued FF miles, SQ is the way to go. THe WiFi is slow and $17 for the flight but if you need to check and send email it works.
label: positive

text: A Great Way to Fly Everything from lounges to air Steward and stewardess on the plane are faultless . Service are tip top. Extremely helpful and polite. Indeed a Great way to fly.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Munich. A recently renovated 777-300 was exceptionally comfortable and provided the basis for an excellent trip if only the crew had cared. All crew members were well presented as always but those serving my part of the cabin showed a low level of enthusiasm about their jobs. It started with a 40 minute wait for a glass of wine and water, there was a similar 40 minute wait for a coffee in the morning. Offered a regular meal as opposed to the special meal I had pre-ordered at both dinner and breakfast, indicated that they weren't paying much attention. Not called by name once, just "sir" with a half hearted apology at dinner re the offer of the initial meal and then when asked if I would like desert a pointed response to me when asking what it was, being told "I have no idea, you ordered a special meal". Dinner was very watery as I don't think that the water from the vegetables had been drained and so the gravy was more like a soup. Breakfast omelette was cold. After I asked for the regular cereal to be taken away, I think that they began heating the special meal I had ordered only at this point. When it was served 10 minutes later half of it was cold to the point of being refrigerated. Not offered water between meals, had to go to the galley each time. While not the fault of the airline, it was topped off by a nearly two hour wait at customs. There was no immigration officer at the "crew only" queue and the crew went through our queue so they were off long before the passengers. We were behind a very slow moving contingent of Air China passengers. By the time I got to the baggage so much time had elapsed our flight was no longer listed and had to go to the Lufthansa bag desk to find out which carousel to go to. Landed at about 6:00 am and was in a taxi at about 9:00 am, which is far too long. The slow processing on arrival in Munich reflected the poor quality of the whole experience. Luckily the seat was so comfortable I had slept really well.
label: negative

text: Great direct flight Singapore to Munich Seat had spacious leg room and tv screen large. Had wanted to book a seat with extra leg room but all were sold out despite my early booking. Flight took off about 45 minutes late through no fault of the airline as they awaited their turn to take off. The air hostess serving our aisle appeared inexperienced. We requested for some drinks on 2 occasions to which she replied she will serve shortly. However she forgot and for both times and we had to remind her again after waiting patiently for a long while. She had completely forgotten. Meals were alright.
label: positive

text: Poor Customer Service and Terrible Website 1) tried to book Ho Chi Minh flight on 13 June with mixed miles and card and it didnt go through 2) tried again on 14 june with a $50 increase and still didnt go through. 3) spent 2 hours during working hours to be in a call with a representative who didn't fully explain that i needed to give all my credit card details for booking 4) By policy they only allow credit card details to be given over the phone 5) paid additional talk about $5 on a call to wait for customer service honestly ridiculous
label: negative

text: Great service Really great personalised and friendly service. Anything you can need is on hand or as I did you can just pull on an eye mask and get some sleep. Excellent professional service that arrived early
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines economy class No leg space in economy class. Food and drinks are good. In-flight service is beyond compare. Excellent.
