label: neutral

text: Great daytime flight on SQ in J-class, but it's not for the taller person. Today's flight was really efficient, and well handled by the Chief Purser Kim-Sung. Plane was an A350-900, 9V-SHB and I was in seat 17K. Interior was clean, tidy and didn't look tired. I found the cabin temperature way too high, but am glad that it wasn't an overnight flight. Inflight wifi was being promoted heavily - it was active but could not be connected to. The pair-your-device didn't work at all. Whilst it is classed as a lie-flat bed, for someone who is 188cm tall and has size 11 feet, the bed is not a comfortable one as one's knees and feet can be cramped. No amenity kit offered today, although there are toothbrushes and other items in the well-stocked and clean bathrooms.
label: positive

text: A different class to SQ727 Everything was good with this flight, the efficiency of boarding, the assistance from cabin crew, legroom, seat comfort, entertainment, meals service and quality, just outstanding. Amazing the difference between two flight sectors.
label: positive

text: Los Angeles- Singapore by Sq35 Premier Economy Recently i traveled to Singapore on its new direct 17 hour flight. I have traveled quite a bit on AA, SAS & Turkish Airlines Premier Economy class in the past to Asia & Europe, always had a good experience. I thought SA new direct service should be on par with other carriers if not better. I was wrong! I used its "Book the Cook" online since there was mixed review about in flight meals. On this long flight, SQ served two meals and a snack. I was a bit taken back and in fact shocked when they brought out the first meal. It was in a small plastic tray, with shrimp entree covered in a twisted foil paper, a salad and a desert.( It seems that it missing something like appetizer, since there is empty space on the small tray). It just looked unappetizing and entree portion is very small. The second meal was served the same fashion. In between, they serve donuts and small finger sandwich. I have not touched donuts for years ! But i was starving and had to grab a super sweet donut! Service lacks throughout the flight, though flight attendant seemed to work hard ( i think the flight was understaffed!). No napkin paper provided when serving a drink and nuts. Had to constantly ask for napkins,spoon(for that solid ice cream). Approached the flight attendant at galley for a hot tea, and assured that it would be brought to my seat. The tea never came! The only saving grace is that i was able to grab one of the 6 solo seats at the back of cabin. My seat was comfortable and the plane is brand new. On this same trip, i took a much shorter 3 hour flight from Bangkok to Taipei on China Airlines economy class, i was served one meal in much more respectable way (in terms of presentation, quality and portion). This is longest direct flight i have ever taken-17 hours total. I won't get on this flight again. I work in travel industry and do not take this review lightly.
label: negative

text: Good flight short layover Good flight from Brisbane to Singapore. Flight left at 18.10pm. Definitely book the cook rather than having to choose from inflight menu. Short layover in Singapore. Flight from Singapore to Pudong was on an older aircraft so did not have lay flat seat. Staff were attentive and helpful on both flights.
label: positive

text: Great Consistent Airline Over the years we've used several airlines to make our regular annual visits to Western Australia but Singapore Airlines, in our view, are head and shoulders above other airlines which we have used. Singapore Airlines have the added bonus of flying out of Manchester, which means we can avoid the hassle of Heathrow. The staff are welcoming and friendly and the in-flight service is second to none. Just one small negative is the quality and lack of variety of the food, particularly the vegetarian options. That said, we don't expect 'haute cuisine' but SA, as with other airlines, could step up their food quality/variations. The A350-900 used on this sector is a brilliant aircraft, as is the older 777 used on the shorter sector from Perth up to Singapore.
label: positive

text: Longest Flight in the World -- and a great experience Champagne comes around once wheels up .... a nice way to start a flight. This is the longest flight in the world - 18 hours - that takes you over the north pole, Russia, China and eventually Singapore. The service - in a word - impeccable. Constantly coming around offering liquids. Multiple food offerings - and the ability to pre-order your selected meals - not just "low salt" or "diet" - which are also available. This was our first flight to Singapore -- I thought it was interesting that on both the outbound and return flights, the shades are all closed -- I think to help people adjust to a 12 hour time difference. But, it was hard to get some sleep given that take off was a 10 in the morning! Entertainment options are great -- movies, television shows, games, etc. The seats are a bit funky, they don't recline like other airlines, but rather pivot and rock into more of a reclining position. And, almost forgot, on this flight there is only premium economy (1/3 of the plane) and business. Would have loved to upgrade to business, but at a 3X price factor ....
label: positive

text: Poor customer service We received an email from Singapore airlines notifying us of a slight change of time for our flight. After trying to log in to manage the booking, we were unable to do so. We contacted Singapore airlines to be told that our domestic flight had diverted to a different city meaning that there was a chance we could miss our international flight back to the Uk. After asking Singapore airlines to change our domestic flight to an earlier flight or to a flight the day before to give us more chance of catching our international flight, we were told they couldn’t change our flight to any of the ones we suggested. Extremely poor customer service, especially as their flight prices are extortionate now. If this journey doesn’t run smoothly we won’t be using them again.
label: negative

text: Not a bad 23 hours! A* service once we were checked in! Like many other folk, I suspect, we were on an Air New Zealand flight operated by Singapore Airlines. This seemed too complicated for airport staff to understand! Travelling in Economy you are not able to check in on-line. So you arrive at the airport and staff direct you to a self check in machine - which doesn't work! So you try explaining to Singapore Airlines staff your dilemma, they tell you have an AIr New Zealand flight number so you need to check in with Air New Zealand. Air New Zealand airlines staff tell you you have a shared code,& you are flying with Singapore airlines, to go back go to business class check in there. We did go to business class check in and explain the situation. They did understand and checked us in without difficulty and with profuse apology. We did suggest the need for further training for frontline staff. From there on service was faultless. The plane was clean and comfortable. In-flight entertainment kept me amused for the full 23 hours, I can't sleep on a plane. We had a break of 2 hours in Singapore Changi Airport which by the way is worth a visit it's brilliant! and SO clean. The staff were attentive, polite and nothing was too much trouble. Snacks and drinks were there for the asking in between the meals which were perfectly adequate. I loved the whole experience, can't wait to fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: A pleasant journy Very good air line. Clean and comfortable.Most of the facilities are common but the service was very good. the staffs were courteous ,obliging and attentive. It was a comfortable flight from Colombo to Hanoi through Singapore. The food was good but not very good or excellant.I am unable to say I enjoyed the food. It may be that I didnt get what I was looking for. Nothing to complaint.I will travel again in Singapore Air Line.
label: positive

text: Recent Trip on Business Class B787-10 I was recently fortunate enough to travel on the newish regional business class seat on SIA. Yes, the seat itself is comfortable, but the layout for me was a bit too snug for a business class seat. My arm kept touching the console and either setting off the call button and the monitor. The lights were at an odd level and food tray was odd. Overall it seemed all the thought put into the product was fine, but these finer details makes it a 4 out 5 for me. Unfortunately the current global health issue altered some of the inflight service, even though the cabin was more than half empty. Lastly, my meal was over cooked, which was also a different experience than previous flights on this airline and this cabin class.
label: positive

text: Excellent Service Once again, made use of the Singapore Airlines and must admit that we experienced excellent service with the most friendly staff assisting us from our departure till we landed in Cape Town South Africa. Service on the airline was outstanding and will certainly recommend them to future travellers.
label: positive

text: Hanoi to Cape Town via Singapore. I was very dissapointed with the way things were handled on 3 March 2019 before the flight, I was unable to board my flight, I let Singapore Airlines know via email, also tried calling but was unable to get through. I had to wait until Monday for anyone to help me and then got charged for a new flight ($584) due to missing the flight the day prior, even though I had notified the airline 6 hours before flight that I was going to miss it due to my Visa approval not arriving on time. Having paid this amount along with penalties for missing my previous flight has left me in a difficult financial situation so I'm not impressed.
label: negative

text: A thoroughly pleasant experience, bearing in mind this flight was during the height of Covid-19 and New Zealand had just reopened its borders. Check-in was a bit truncated, given the amount of documentation required and the person managing our check-in was receiving training. Once on board the experience was delightful, food and beverage service was lovely, including signature Singapore Slings. The A350 was very clean, and I particularly like the additional screen on the handset. Legroom was adequate, though better than many others; that said, the flight only had 75 passengers, so my wife and I had a row to ourselves.
label: positive

text: Great way to fly SQ 915 on 14/11/2019 SQ 918 on 18/11/2019 Always great to fly SIA. The meal selection and inflight entertainment are always good. But the outbound checking in was a little bad. The staff was so confused thereby resulting in a longer wait (express lane for Gold and Biz class).. The spread in the lounges is always best among all the other airline lounges.
label: positive

text: Not actually a review but..., My husband and I had occasion to cancel our flights from Brisbane to London via Singapore and return because of poor health and worry about the Coronaviris. I cancelled online (Our trip was in May) and the very next day our money was back in our CC! The full amount, less a small cancellation fee, We are soooo impressed by this wonderful service. We have travelled with Singapore before and they were great, but we will certainly travel with then again! I have put in the date we travelled with them last,
label: positive

text: Good experience flying Singapore Airlines. Good meals and service. Comfortable seating with ample space. Inflight entertainment good. Cabin crew under pressure, maybe under staffed? Notwithstanding, crew were attentive.
label: positive

text: Comfortable & Spacious We have flown with Singapore Airlines even in the past and flying with them has always been a delightful experience. This time since we planned our trip to Bali and there are no direct flights from Mumbai-Bali and vice-versa we planned to stop over at Singapore Airport since its the best in the world! We loved the service in the airplane and the meals that are served.They have really polite and friendly cabin crew. I really enjoy their Apple juice and the chocolate ice cream they serve..they are soo amazing.. Their in flight entertainment system had good variety of movies & music! I was waiting to see a good movie & when I saw Bohemian Rhapsody on the list.. I was jumping up and down with joy.. They also provide you with packed blanket, pillow & Kris Flyer earphones. Loved the seating and the entire experience of 4 hours.. I found it very comfortable and nice. Would definitely recommend all my family & friends to fly with Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text: Service is simply impeccable I fly premium one way, economy the return journey. The first seats are comfortable however the eco seats are really no punishment: there's enough leg space, the chairs go back a fair way to make it comfy. The service is second to none. Cabin crew always serve with a smile on their face. My number 1 airline!
label: positive

text: a hiccup for a very good airline let me start by saying i'm a big fan of SQ. have flown this flt several times economy--and SQ economy is light years ahead of most transatlantic u.s. carriers. have also flown SQ business class and it is very impressive. BUT this is my first SQ premium economy and quite frankly, it was disappointing. the seats look better than they feel plus the trays are in the armrest reducing them further. the food service is essentially economy plus bubbly. the crew seemed lethargic and disinterested (thought i was on United for a moment) very unusal for SQ in my experience. based solely on this flight, the added cost of premium economy was not close to worth it.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines looked after all the way there and back Having chronic Rheumatoid Arthritis makes travelling a bit of a problem, Singapore Airlines made it easier for me by supplying a wheelchair for me and helped for my vife and family who was travelling with me, we were ushered through customs etc fairly quickly and I had the wheelchair service right to the plane, can’t thank Singapore Airlines enough and recommend them to anyone who is travelling with or without a disability. Great flight, great service, great food
label: positive

text: Wheelchair service! As a cancer patient who has just undergone chemo, my hands and feet nerve endings are badly affected. I can’t manage long distance walk and this the second time I had wheelchair service. Everything was a Breeze after I was collected at the check in counter, through immigration, to Priority Lounge and departure lounge. Was first on queue into the plane. The stewards and stewardesses were aware of my situation and were extremely cautious to my needs. Passing me a blanket straight away. Upon arrival I was the last to leave the plane. But all in order I cleared immigration faster than others. To my surprise food on economy class was okay. We were given chicken pasta or nasi lemak.I made a flight on biz class to Sydney in August ,the food was really not up to biz class standard...really sad to say. A relative just came back from Osaka was surprised that economy class food was edible and she finished most of it. I guess it’s the destination that we are going. Salute to SQ crew for their dedication and smiles all the way! Thumbs up! It’s a great way to fly!
label: positive

text: Excellent Flight & Great Customer Service I Had a Fantastic Comfortable flight from Perth To Singapore .The Seats were Great. lots of legroom I Could Sleep on the plane & It made me feel very relaxed i looked forward to the journey .The Food was so Lovely & So was the customer service.The Flight was so smooth .I can Highly recommend Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Friendly service above the sky It was my first long haul flight and also first time using Singapore Airlines. I love the friendliness and of the crews. They really work very smooth and fast during the take off and landing. They also know how to greet the passengers when the passenger were sleeping. I also like the food they, eventhough I didnt take all the sidedish because its too much. Beside the food, what matter most in long haul flight is the entertainment on board. SQ has so many variation of movie and I really love it. If you take young kid with you, there’re some movie and games for them to play too. Overall, I really satisfied with the service and I would like to fly another trip with SQ.
label: positive

text: Excellent Service and comfortable A380 Great Service from Sing Air, one of our favorite carriers, super staff, efficient transfers at Changi
label: positive

text: worst Business class In world There was a time ,everyone loved and enjoyed traveling Singapore Airlines In 1990’s and 2000’s ..it was undoubtedly No1 Airline not in Asia but whole world and retained its Charm and crown till Big three Qatar,Emirates and Etihad Stole that crown away..And believe me their are Valid ReasonsFor the same.I travel around the world 7-8 times.I traveled this week from Del to Melbourne via Singapore SQ 403 business class And I was not very amused and happy to see where Singapore Airline has headed once loved by the world. I traveled just 2 days ago from JFK to Delhi via Abu Dhabi, the service and seats they had was just dream compared to Singapore a 380 ..First I was given a 17 K seat which was Crappiest cramped seat I have been on A 380 business’s Class on any airline I couldn’t stretch my legs on this seat and it Was a nightmare ( see picture below)As I expected business class seats to recline 180 degrees to become full flat beds this seat did not I wanted to take a nap And couldn’t as this was not fully reclining seat, Singapore Airlines has answer why was I fooled into paying business class seat which Did not become 180 full flat as advertised it is a shame and disgraceful. Entertainment Kris flyer is from another era still old fashioned as compared To etihad’s Ebox one emirates entertainment system ICE is world class.If I summerise Ethiad's or Emirates's business class is better than Singapore’s First and and and I was stuck in Singapore Business Class. Singapore airlines should either have disclaimer about this worse seat Or shouldn’t sell these seats giving there customers a raw deal.Check out picture below the front of my seat was like a brick wall one couldn't nudge on this seat..It was really Disheartening to see once a favourite airline of the world and mine Now being disintegrated like this but reasons for the same Are valid and are self implicated. Etihad and Emirates don’t cheat their customers by selling Them something else showing them something else it was really appalling .On Etihad Business class seat of my travel just 8 days ago to JFK on Ey 100.while coming back I was so happy by Etihad service I paid $ 1500 To upgrade myself to first class as I just loved Etihad service and wanted a taste of their best and I was blown over by it.i am so so disappointed ,disheartened That I couldn’t wait to land and write email wrote of this horrible Experience in flight itself ..I wrote to Singapore airlines and got a clumsy response of changing my seat I mean it is so disgraceful and appalling. This may be my last Flight on Singapore airlines ever.God Bless
label: negative

text: Excellent Service and overall experience Safe to say Singapore airlines is the best airline I have been on so far. The staff on board are very nice and professional and they make sure passengers are as comfortable as possible. Services on Singapore airlines make long flights much more pleasant & bearable!
label: positive

text: Friendly service as usual I have taken many of SQ flights and as usual the service is friendly and smooth. Was on a stop over in Singapore en-route to Mumbai. The flight is clean, crew is very friendly and the journey to Singapore was a breeze.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Mumbai on A380. Comfortable overall with an excellent level of service. I've travelled on Business Class a few times on Singapore Airlines. Food wise excellent in choice options. I've used Singapore Airlines 20plus in the last 2 years and I've only had one bad experience in terms of service and twice experienced delays. Taste wise I've had a bad experience once and choice of food option wise I've not been able to select my preferred choice twice both of which was due to me sitting at the back of plane.
label: positive

text: I have flown with them for quite some time now and while their service is usually robotic impersonal and lacking warmth flying with other airlines makes you appreciate how Singapore just does it right. Recently flew from MNL-SIN-DEL. MNL-SIN on a fully loaded B777 the aircraft is up for retirement but it is spotlessly clean and well maintained. The IFE was ancient but for such a short flight I did not mind it. Food was decent and cabin crew were as efficient and reliable as one should expect from SQ. Had a 6 hour layover in Changi which is without a doubt SQ's best asset. It's an airport beyond compare and would not mind a longer layover. Flight to DEL on the A380 with less than 100 passengers. Cabin crew were very laid back and allowed passengers to move about the cabin. The seats were extremely comfortable and food was excellent. Service calls were answered in record time and while one of the flight attendants was a tad cold one of the lead flight attendants embodied professionalism and warmth which made up for it. IFE kept malfunctioning and the movie kept pausing every 30 seconds or so which was annoying. Besides that one minor issue I would fly SQ again. They are extremely reliable their hard product is among the best and while their service is inconsistent when it comes to friendliness their efficiency is one of the best out there.
label: positive

text: Round trip from Singapore to Seoul and back Bought the SQ air tickets since last year and travelled only on 1/3/19 to Seoul. The air tickets were much cheaper as we have booked them way ahead of our travel. The crew were attentive during the flight. The inflight programs offered were pretty new. The food in our return flight on 8/3/19 was much better than on the 1/3/19. We had bibimbap mixed with chicken and kimchi! Lastly, SQ allowed checkin 48 hours before departure flight time. 👍👍👍
label: positive

text: Great Airline Staff very friendly and quick if you need something. Flight was very soft no turbulence nothing. This airline is perfect and I will fly again. Price and quality very good.
label: positive

text: Efficient and On Time Took a short haul flight to Singapore and back recently. Appreciated the on time departures on both occasions and the short flying time i.e. 45 minutes. The Airbus A330 - 300 that was used was comfortable and clean. The seats too seemed in good condition on the journey to Singapore but the the plane of the return journey seemed in less than good condition........seat wise. The seats we had seemed tired and slightly tattered and one of the pockets before us was unattached to the back of the seat. A surprise to to us. The flight announcements on both flights were excellent. The flights itself on the journey to Singapore was comfortable and we did receive a drink. This was not the case on the return journey because of some turbulence.........not much really but that was reason enough not to provide the passengers with a drink on this sector.
label: positive

text: A reliable airline to fly with I travelled to Mumbai from Sydney on 25th December 2018 (on Christmas day). The seating was comfortable, and so the other facilities. The crew were friendly and helpful. The food and the beverages served were quite nice. All in all, I was quite happy with my flight. I returned to Sydney from Bangalore via the same airline on 1st February 2019. The important thing I want to mention about the Singapore Airline is their punctuality.
label: positive

text: Short trip, excellent service I was surprised how good the service was, even flying economy. They gave me a newspaper and the flight crew were amazing, the food, considering is not the best on any plane, was definitely better than other airlines, definitely recommended. One of the best airlines.
label: positive

text: Singapore no more I have just returned to Adelaide with my elderly mother from Singapore on flight SQ279. It was by far the worst flight I can ever remember. I’ve been regular on this service, for over 30 years and also have travelled around the world, using nearly every airline there is. The food and drink service on this flight was appalling. Every time I had used this service, we were all served dinner shortly after departure so we didn’t have a dinner in Singapore. There was nothing to eat at all for around 4 hours when we were served breakfast, which was totally inedible. I tried both options and the standard was totally appalling. We were not offered any drink receiving only one or two small glasses of water. People on the plane all complained. I personally spoke to the supervisor and he offered me apology and sandwich which consisted of a stale roll with some sort of spread. It was also inedible and not of Singapore Airlines standard. You must offer water to your travellers as we get it taken away from us when we go through customs etc. There’s a real problem within Singapore Airlines on this service which I will never use again. The supervisor was embarrassed and he offered his apology and agreed with my complaint. I asked for a customer feedback form of which I never received. I tried to do feedback on the screen, but because I’m not a member my feedback was invalid. I’m never flying Singapore Airlines and everyone in Adelaide needs to know all about this. They all need to be warned and advised to take their own food and drinking water on this Singapore to Adelaide flight. I’ve now tried to contact Singapore Airlines via numerous means, but they appear to be hiding and not willing to engage with me. Very sad.
label: negative

text: Reliably Great We always enjoy flying Singapore Airlines. Their people are helpful and go out of their way to make the trip comfortable.
label: positive

text: Best Flight I've Ever Had I cannot say enough positive things about this airline. We flew 18 hours direct from LAX to Singapore in Business Class, and it felt shorter than a 9 hour flight we took 2 years ago in economy from DFW-Mardid. The flight attendants were kind, friendly and genuinely happy to serve--"No" is not in their vocabulary. The seats were incredibly comfortable, not only for my smaller frame at 5'4", 125 lbs., but also for my big husband (6'2", 205 lbs.). We both got a solid amount of sleep, the food was incredible, and the flight was overall enjoyable. The return flight home was around 16 hours, and was an equally positive experience. We flew from Singapore to Chiang Mai, and then from Koh Samui to Singapore on Singapore Airlines as well, though it was operated by their sister airline, Silk Air. We flew economy as the flights were short. The planes were a little outdated, but the service was excellent. They served a full meal on both flights, and offered full beverage service. All of our flights were on time, if not a little early. I have awful luck with my luggage when I travel internationally, and this was the first trip in years that my suitcase wasn't lost or delayed. We even had it transferred in Singapore on the way home as our flights weren't connected, and they managed to get it to the right place at the right time... with smiles on their faces, of course. I think that American airlines can learn a lot from Singapore air, and they by far set the highest standard for air travel. They have 100% earned their badge of honor as the top airline in the world year after year! Kudos to you, Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text: Best ride to the Far East Seating was comfortable, my special meal arrived before the rest of the economy class meals and was cooked to perfection. No problems at all
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Strikes Again! Well well well… Singapore Airlines strikes again! After yet again another usual delayed flight with Singapore Airlines (FR208), from Heathrow to Singapore, the drinks service was non-existent, the only regular service was for business and premium economy classes. After almost dying of thirst, economy class passengers decided to start collecting their own drinks! Absolutely no effort was made by the captain to make up for lost time in the air, even though there was a tail wind for more than two thirds of the journey! This followed with a lack of communication between the Captain and the ground crew as a parking space for the aircraft had not been allocated on arrival, causing further delays for passengers trying to disembark the aircraft for any further connection flights. Many passengers (about 45) had a connecting flight to bali from Singapore with the narrowest time window possible and yes of course the connection terminal was an early morning marathon as we all had to run from one side of the airport terminal to get to the other side of a different terminal within Singapore airport. All 45 of us managed to board the connection flight but guess what…yes you guessed it…the baggage was not transferred to the flight ! Another outstanding stunt and lack of incompetence from Singapore Airlines. All 45 of us who were on the connecting flight are now on the other side of the world, after a 17 hour flight, with no luggage, having to buy clothes, shoes and toiletries out of our own pockets. Cheers Singapore Airlines, thank you so much for your lack of care, attention, support and customer service. You have ruined our holiday and cost us a lot of money. None of the 45 passengers with missing luggage are any wiser as to where our bags are, as you have washed your hands of speaking to any of us and have passed the blame onto someone else as usual. You do not care care for your passengers once you have had our money! PLEASE DO NOT FLY with SINGAPORE AIRLINES , unless you want to be treated like dirt. If there are any Singapore Airlines social media representatives out there who wish to manage their reputation by responding to this review with fake apologies, then please do not bother, instead, find our bags, compensate us for our expenses, ruined holiday and lost time. Do the right thing for a change and look after your passengers!
label: negative

text: Loosing its Charm Previous experiences on Singapore Airlines were excellent. This time was disappointing as all standards have come down. Our anniversary celebrations were spoilt maybe because we were having more expectations. Condition of my seat in picture attached.
label: neutral

text: What's happened to Singapore Airlines? What has happened to Singapore Airlines? I used to enjoy flying with this airline. My last flight was abominable. Flights were delayed. The food was terrible, just a doughy bit of pizza for dinner. The staff stressed. The seats on the plane were very cramped and im not even a large build person. Not the quality we used to expect from this airline.
label: negative

text: Business Class First time that we. have flown business, absolutely enjoyed every minute of it, doesn’t come cheaply but experience totally different from Economy. Can highly recommend Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: Efficient flight Just a typical economy flight, all went smoothly, food was fine but we waited a long time to get our meals. Singapore airport was interesting.
label: positive

text: They don’t allow seat selection in advance It is really upsetting that they don’t allow for advanced online seat selection. Thus I have to reach airport 3 hours before the flight just to secure a seat which I prefer. Sigh. And their leg room is smaller than other flights like Emirates which is a bit uncomfortable for long haul fight.
label: negative

text: Great Counter & In Flight Staff, Miserable Admin Processes While I cannot fault the counter check-in staff and in-flight crew, my grouse lies with the back room/admin department of this airline. I made a cancellation of a hotel booked on their web site that was part of their Singapore Stop Over vacation booked in conjunction with my air ticket and am still awaiting a refund almost two months from the cancellation, despite repeated follow ups on their web site through chats with their agents. I got an e-mail from them today stating that I was not entitled to any refund owing to a "no show", even though they acknowledged the cancellation and I verified it by going back to manage my booking on the airline's web site, where the hotel arrangement did not show any more. Truly awful service and way, way below what one experiences upon checking in and in the air.
label: negative

text: SIN-SUB and SUB-SIN SQ930/931. A330-300 on both legs. Impeccable service from the minute you board to the minute you get off the plane. Hot towels were served shortly after boarding followed by food. Very courteous and pleasant crew members and at all times kept toilets clean. The aircraft's PTV was good. The seat on A330 was nice can stretch longer than some full services airline in Asia and it's comfortable. Overall a very pleasant experience and it's always a pleasure to fly Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Almost OK Not bad. But had annoying people behind us. We paid extra for leg room, which was good. But the idiots behind us kept coming in and out from their seats on the window side. Stepping on my things and waking me up. On the flight we were on, we had 2 seats together with 3 seats in the rows behind. Pity they didn't use the isle, like everyone else.
label: positive

text: Excellent Food and Service Superb service and food. Always addressed by name which is very much appreciated. Great flat bed for sleeping, find the angle a little more awkward for sitting up, but the seat itself is lovely and wide.
label: positive

text: TIMELY LINK Easy check-in, not too long a wait, the usual crush to board, despite clear instructions, pleasantly surprised at the space (A380, top floor). Very comfortable flight, pleasant attentive staff, reasonable meal. Despite our flight being late (we left ate) and our 1 hour between flights being swallowed up, we had time to transfer terminals and were not rushed when we reached the gateway. Smaller aircraft for the shorter flight Singapore to Colombo squashy, and crowded. But total time shorter even than Sydney - Melbourne - Colombo. Will do again.
label: positive

text: Take ear plugs and an eye mask Chose to fly with this airline again after a good experience on our last long haul more than 20 years ago. the staff were as attentive and helpful as they were last time, but the food was disappointing. Not much legroom in Economy and if the passenger in the seat in front puts their seat back you will find your tv screen too close for comfort. The facilities were clean and we were regularly offered refreshments and snacks
label: neutral

text: SQ051 from Houston to Manchester Flight was only about 50% full so we could spread out a bit which improved comfort a lot. Very pleasant check in and bag drop. Flight boarded efficiently and timely. Flight taxi'd from the gate and then we sat in a long line of aircraft waiting to take off for nearly an hour. Not SQ's fault, probably poor traffic management by local ATC. Despite delay arrived Manchester only about 10 mins behind schedule. As usual with SA, cabin crew very courteous, accommodating and helpful. Good food and service. Nice modern aircraft (A350).
label: positive

text: Superb It's the first time I flew this airline. Had heard such positive reviews. It was actually better than the reviews. Spacious flat beds. The staff are extremely hospitable and efficient. Loved the food. As expected is was bang on time.
label: positive

text: Absolutely atrocious customer service experience Such terrible service from the outset! After making the booking which included a code share arrangement for 2 adults with an infant, everything started well with a bassinet being requested. From that point I had to call at least four times with apparent issues with the names on itinerary even though they were correct from the outset. This issue arises again upon attempting online check in which wasn’t at all possible because one adults name was somehow written in twice, once as a Mr and one as a Mrs. called and requested a business class upgrade. Was told due to code share it wasn’t possible (hello I’m trying to give you my money)! Thereafter we arrived at the airport to a very rude staff member once again telling me the names were incorrect in the system, even though the night before I had the itinerary emailed to me after the initial attempt to check in failed, which confirmed names were correct, I showed this document as proof, lady appeared uninterested. codeshare 2nd leg of journey had tickets produced at Melbourne airport and after being flushed by this too and fro at check in I didn’t bother to check the seat allocation on the 2nd leg which didn’t have bassinet allocation. To our horror we discovered the Singapore Airlines check in lady had allocated us seats in different rows on opposite sides of the plane with a one year old! How can they be so unprofessional? The worst part, when transiting through SIN I approached the transfer counter of the codeshare airline, and this helpful assistance then was able to pair us together, making the MEL - SIN Singapore employees actions even worse. To top it off we cannot purchase additional baggage online due to once again the codeshare arrangement and furthermore we arrive at our final destination and discovered both our suitcases were broken with the wheels coming off before we exited the airport. Having flown many major international airlines overseas, I will never fly with Singapore again. If going Aus to Europe, I highly recommend you consider a Middle East airline that shows accountability and pride in their responsibility to fare paying passengers. My wife and I are absolutely appalled By the service we received from Singapore Airlines. We have made this same journey to Europe 7 times as leisure travellers in the last 8 years and this was by far the worst experience.
label: negative

text: Finest in flight service Singapore Airlines is a clear winner when it comes to in flight service. Having done the CMB - LAX journey many times on different Airlines, I can vouch for SIA’ s par excellence in flight service. My wife and I being seniors, wish to really appreciate the devotion of the staff to maintain these high standards. While in transit all arrangements were once again perfect. So our next flight to LAX is a foregone conclusion.
label: positive

text: Worst flight experience ever Got from dempasar (Bali) to singapure (2h30 flight) in a brand new plane, very nice experience, but for a 11h flight from singapure to Istanbul we got a old plane, not confortable at all- our flight on the 28th of June was terrible, got late to singapure, and when we were boarding my seats which were payed in advance 30dolars got swith to a very poor location because the intertaiment screen was not working. The boarding staff was not nice at all and not helpful at all, and we stayed in a much worse seat and with no apologies. The seats were dirty with food from the previous flight glued to the screen and food table disgusting!!! Don’t know how you could me elected best company last year! For a 11h flight such a poor experience! And the flight attendant on our row was not friendly at all, forgot to give our row towels to clean hands and in one occasion beverage...and when questioned was rude... Worst experience on a flight ever...
label: negative

text: Left late from Sydney Flight left late from Sydney due to high winds. We had a 1 hour stopover, then onto Phuket. The flight was very comfortable and stewards were very attentive. We realised towards the end of the flight we were going to miss the Phuket plane. When we landed we were greeted with a one night accommodation at the Crown Plaza within the airport and dinner, we weren’t able to collect our luggage but were provided with toothbrushes, combe etc. We were dealt we promptly and efficiently, everyone from the baggage handlers to immigration were all very helpful.
label: positive

text: Excellent in every way Everyone from check-in counter to crews is very friendly and genuine. The service is excellent and food tastes great compared to other airlines' I have flown. I can feel the airline really work hard to set themselves apart from competitors. They gave passengers warm towels in economy and premium economy class as well. Even though, we didn't order kids' meal on one of our flight, the crew came to offer us to serve the kids first. Little things like this goes a long way when it come to airline experience. I love Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Clean,friendly and professional we have always used Singapore Airlines when we go to the Philippines and can’t really fault them compare to other airlines we have used going to other places.
label: positive

text: What an airline We have had the best experience flying SIA. Starting with check in we had Sara at Brisbane Airport. So friendly and helpful. I told her we always fly QF and that this was our first time. What a star! Please someone recognise this girl, she is amazing and set us off with a smile. We were in Business on SQ976 on the 20th of December and the staff went out of their way to ensure comfort. They were all wonderful. Thank you SIA for the experience! After flying QF for over 20 years internationally, now I have to reconsider for our next trip! Also I spoke to Jessica in the call centre - another star - helped me immensely. I still love QF with all my heart but encourage you, if you haven't flown with SIA yet to try it. You will not be disappointed!
label: positive

text: Best Pandemic flight service Really impressed by the service I got during my flight back from Phnom Penh to Jakarta via Singapore. I like their green and safe concept of in-flight meals. They also provide us with sanitary kit.
label: positive

text: Very disappointing We purchased a Round The World Fare with the Star Alliance. I was very disappointed with the seats and the level of service that Singapore Airlines provided. Given that we paid double the Economy fate, what we were supplied with was hardly better than economy. There was no extra space to make a long trip more comfortable. There were no wee extras like Air NZ provided, the lounge for Koru Club members was not available as it has a SG code- even though we booked with AirNZ . I would never pay extra for Premium Economy with Singapore Airlines again. A waste of good money.
label: negative

text: Excellent Service as usual This was our first time flying Singapore Airlines during the day, they have always been over night. The experience was just a good as any other time we've flown with them. I took a group of orchid enthusiasts on an orchid tour of Singapore and the airline staff assisted our group well with enquiries, food, drink and more. I'll always fly with Singapore Air, when I can
label: positive

text: Definitely... a great way to fly Seamless online check in, luggage drop, immigration and boarding. Nice comfortable seat, clean cabin, excellent service. Timely departure. Definitely... a great way to fly
label: positive

text: Great Service - Awesome Airlines I want mention that I am really Impressed by Service Offered by Singapore Airlines. On August 15th, I had to book Flights from my Parents from Delhi to JFK in emergency when Emirates Cancelled flight (Horrible Airlines) & offered no support on Rebooking. Singapore Airlines Call Center staff was awesome. They quickly accommodated wheelchair and meal request at very short notice. My Parents informed me that they have never seen in their 40 year travel history such a friendly & caring staff. Flight from Delhi to Singapore was very very good. Also Flight from Singapore to JFK is the Longest. My Parents informed that Crew was so good and they took care of them So well. I am now getting tempted to Fly Singapore Airlines during my Next travel.
label: positive

text: Full flight Melbourne to Singapore. Older 777 plane. Chose two seats together, there are not a lot of these, but they were great. You expect very little in economy these days as most airlines have made economy a miserable experience for passengers. Singapore Airlines still treats economy passengers with respect and I was so impressed. We boarded in sections in Melbourne, it was monitored carefully with some held back as they tried to "skip the queue" as some always do. Left a little late but not by much. the hot towels before you leave and just before you arrive are a nice touch most airlines have stopped. The seat was wider than most economy. We got a refreshing drink and peanuts shortly after takeoff. Two hours in was a meal. I chose non seafood so my seat was stickered accordingly, I had a fantastic lunch. Quality tender chicken breast in a lovely light soy gravy with perfectly cooked vegetables, hot crispy bread roll, crackers, cheese, water, dessert and real cutlery, Drinks though didn't come out until everyone else got their lunch and I did sit with my tray there till everyone else was done too. No big deal. Entertainment was probably the only thing that they fall down on with not the greatest sound quality. Had a nap after lunch, then a mushroom and chicken pie before landing, All in all the Melb-Singapore flight was pretty well near perfect and we even landed half hour early. Singapore to Hanoi was on an older plane again. Seats had some marks in them, pocket torn and window very scratched. The service was good still, but not quite as good as on the ex Melb flight. The entertainment system again not the greatest but watchable. The food too, another lunch seemed to be lacking both in quality and quantity but was still pretty good. All in all, I thought for economy flights, Singapore provides a better experience than I have had in years.
label: positive

text: What a disappointment We spent months with our travel agent organising our trip to Vietnam. We decided to treat ourselves with a 4 day stop over in Singapore. We choose to fly Singapore airlines as they are so good. Our seats where down the back next to the toilet. We had no aircon above us. It was a very long warm uncomfortable flight. They run out of food obtions. It was the last leg of the staff's flight. I really don't think they gave a toss about us. So very disappointed.
label: neutral

text: One of the best airlines no flaws with Singapore Airlines, luxury economy travel. We were on our way to Athens from Singapore and unfortunately for us I selected a flight that was operated by Scoot Airline which was the worst experience over the 11 hour flight with no Movie screen or movie, no food, no drinks. Terrible terrible. Actually a nightmare over that period of time after travelling in comfort from Auckland to Singapore for 1 hours and to have to have the next 11 hours (after 2.5 hour layover) in Scoot. Singapore airlines, do something about this please. My rateing is for Singapore Air not Scoot which would be zero
label: positive

text: Economy at its best Normally fly long distances Premier economy or equivalent. But not on Singapore Airlines as there overall package for this class is one of the best. Attentive crew their aircraft fleet is top league, I didn't even realise we had taken off. Good food, they keep you hydrated, you can grab snacks at any time if you want. Seat fine, entertainment good standard. My husband is 6'2' and he finds seats okay as well. They deserve the status of the world's best airline.
label: positive

text: Ahmedabad to San Francisco via Singapore. The overall in-cabin experience was fine, however, the check-in experience at the Ahmedabad airport was horrible. The staff gave me a hard time with baggage. It took 2 hours and standing in the check-in line three times to get my boarding passes. They weighed the personal bag and made fuss about the weight being 0.2 kgs over in one bag while it was 0.3 kgs under in another bag. I was told that the personal bag, which happened to be my laptop bag, cannot have anything else but the laptop and laptop accessories. I asked them if there was a scale I can use to distribute/adjust the weight across all my luggage pieces and they did not know or were not bothered to find out. Each time I had to go through bag screening and stand in long lines to find out that I still need to balance out 0.1 or 0.2 kgs of weight between my bags. While I was going through this ordeal, the staff is trying to sell me upgrade to business class in spite of telling him no once. I do have to mention that I flew Singapore airlines from SFO to Ahmedabad on Jan 27th 2020 and did not have a similar experience with luggage at the San Francisco airport. Given the coronavirus outbreak, I wish the in-cabin staff had some masks on hand to distribute to passengers requesting it. All of them were wearing it and when I asked for one, they said they do not have any.
label: negative

text: Outstanding service Great flight and the staff as always are excellent and attentive. I just wish BA could travel on one of these flights to help them understand what real customer service looks like and feels like. Thanks SQ for always making it a great onboard experience.
label: positive

text: The Best Economy (Pay extra for better experience) Singapore Airlines is clearly the no 1 for economy class. They are generous in their serving for food (with Haagen Dazs ice cream) and great entertainment (with wide selection of movies). The plane is also new (A380) and seats have enough leg room. The only negative experience is that you have to pay extra if you want to find a good seat. I waited for the free seats 24 hours before the flight and realise there are only left central aisle seats. Thus the experience was less enjoyable despite the good food and entertainment. Paying US $10 is definitely a must to complete the experience.
label: positive

text: Excellent Airline, Great Cabin Crew I can understand why Singapore airlines is always ranked in top 10 airlines every year. Food on the flight was good. Great selection of food in the lounge, particularly at Changi Airport. Flight crew were professional and attentive. I slept pretty much most of the flight from LHR > SIN, and enjoyed the flight from Singapore to Sydney. Business class seats were roomy and comfortable. Tip: If you’re considering premium economy, i would recommend just sticking to economy and selecting seats at the front with extra leg room. I’ve done this in the past and it’s just as comfortable as flying PE. We flew premium economy from SIN to Amsterdam, and we felt the price difference we paid was not worth it - You do get an upgrade on the food selection, plus a tiny bit of extra leg room but it’s not really that more comfortable as an economy seat. If you really wish to be comfortable then spend the money on Business Class seats so you can really sleep in comfort + lounge access + priority check in.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines is like any other airline It is like any other regular airline and infact the flight we did travel was quite old which was obvious to travelers' eyes. Food was ok and the flight attendants were polite. Not have much choice of food when you travel with kids (kids do change minds in the flight) and for my 9 yr old son, when requested for regular packeted yogurt they did not have. So my son traveled without any food.
label: positive

text: Not so much (if at all) Premium. I flew with Singapore Airlines from Singapore to Melbourne (29/07/2016) in Premium Economy as part of a return trip to Colombo. This was my first time flying Premium Economy with Singapore Airlines, though I have flown it before with another large Asian carrier (which was a good experience). I usually fly economy with my partner for holidays and business class for work trips, so have some sense of the competition and product on offer. I'm also tall (194cm) and fairly broad which can make fitting into standard economy seats a squeeze. I had read a few reviews before the flight (all positive) about the new Premium Economy offering from Singapore Airlines and was interested to see for myself. The boarding at Changi was surprisingly disorganised and something of a circus. There was also some delays with take off which appeared to put the staff into such a fluster they forgot to give us menus or the standard amenity pack. The seats in Premium Economy look modern and fancy but are surprisingly uncomfortable for tall people. While they provide a bit more leg room and recline it is hard to make much use of this in a comfortable manner, and forget about getting much sleep. The foot rest offers nothing other than an annoyance and a reduction of leg room. The staff were (on the positive side) not rude but generally unhelpful, unfriendly, looked bored and appeared to go out of their way to not offer anything that might be perceived as an extra (eg. another glass of wine, a second cup of coffee, authentic hospitality etc). The main meal was very small and surprisingly un-tasty. The snack before landing was meant to be chicken fried rice but I struggled within the minuscule dish to find anything other than white rice and a couple of bits of carrot. The meals were so small and mean I was starving by the end of the 7.5 hour flight. The wine/champagne (if you're very lucky you can get one glass) they serve in a plastic tumbler (unlike the ad). The staff also have a habit of leaving you locked in with your empty meal tray for about an hour, which I can only imagine is a crowd control exercise. The entertainment system was good with a reasonable range of titles though annoying compulsory ads at the start of each viewing. It has an bad habit of switching itself on while you are trying to sleep as the controls are right where your knee pushes into the side of the seat. Overall, Singapore PE appeared to me to be a very average Economy with a slightly fancier looking seat, though not one that is well designed or practical for taller people. The service is anything but premium, in fact I've had better service in standard economy for a whole lot less dollars. My experience was nothing like the reviews I have read.
label: negative

text: Short comfortable flight Comfortable flight. Flight seats choosen when booking will enjoy a breeze. Singapore flights are getting better with upgraded planes. please book correct flight timetable to ensure arrival with less people on arrival at customs.To make sure a leisure breeze thru customs with a smile on your face to star the holiday you plan. Bad was with my trip was limited choice of breakfast, and was not served breakfast as was told flight was delayed with time. Guess ////????
label: neutral

text: Business class mixed rating I fly business most times and Sin business class cabin was very good. It’s very modern, comfortable and spacious. Their inflight service was good but slightly above average in customer service. They checked on you infrequently enough where I had to call them a couple of times. Inflight food was very good quality, I am vegan so a bit of a challenge which they met well, and I had to reject the final course as it was too much. The lounge at Brisbane airport was more than adequate. However, a big disappointment was the business lounge at Singapore. It was way over crowded ( they have 3 types gold, first and business) the food was average but tasty enough, alcoholic drink selection was good . I guess the over crowding was the worse part. Luckily I also have a priority pass and left and went into the SATS lounge which I found far better , less drink and food selection ( although make your own laksa was fun) but the decor was bright better laid out and less people was the better part.
label: positive

text: Cool experience On Summer holiday, I went on a trip form Hong Kong to Singapore on an A220 , the seats are not that great but the staff is extremely friendly and helpful also the in-flight entertainment has a lot of choices, overall the flight itself is pretty good and I would definitely recommend it.
label: positive

text: Uk trip The Singapore Airlines was a great airline the staff were very helpful and the you would never go hungry the food was certainly ok no complaints here .the movies all good selection toilets clean and is classed as a very safe airline Overall long trip but very good
label: positive

text: Very lousy service! my check in luggage was damaged! SIA claimed that they are not the handler hence they are not liable! But I checked in my luggage with them and they should be liable! i don’t care whom they outsource to! Very lousy customer service!
label: negative

text: Wonderful trip to NZ I didn’t think I could cope with such a long journey but the bed made a lot of difference. The staff were wonderful.
label: positive

text: Worse airline I have ever flown Just to be sure I am a Gold status member with Singapore Airlines and several other airlines. So I do fly a lot. What Singapore Airlines has recently presented is appealing. I have never seen so much incompetence and ignorance on a flight in the last 20 years. The SG crew has ignored my meal selection 4 times, offered the worse types of food for breakfast. In the end the staff offered Nothing for me to eat. What a disaster. Luckily there are plenty of carriers as alternatives which I will choose in the future. Do not fly Singapore Airlines from London to Singapore.
label: negative

text: jakarta-singapore-jakarta I was lucky I got special price for this flight. Return only paid around USD 100. Good service from the staffs and good meals. hot towel provided before departure. Free earphone for passengers.
label: positive

text: Best airline I’ve ever travelled with.. Wow! This is how to travel.. was a long flight I took and felt so comfortable. I was in economy class and I’m 6ft 4.. I actually had leg room in front of me which never happens. The food was brilliant, the journey felt really safe and the staff were impeccable. Their grooming is perfection. Can’t wait to fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Excellent flight Excellent flight to Singapore- new plane, exceptional service and decent food. Even in economy it felt good. Service streets ahead of many other carriers.
label: positive

text: Great flights Exceptional service, great comfortable seating with lots of space. Good food. Very happy with everything
label: positive

text: Great airline!! Great service from check in to baggage claim. Crew was very courteous and nothing was too much trouble. I would definitely fly Singapore again and highly recommend.
label: positive

text: Consistent & Efficient Smooth and comfortable as always. Service was attentive and adequately staffed. Starters (satay skewers) was good. Special Nasi Padang was a tat cold and chicken drumstick was somewhat small. What was missing was the traditional condiments like Sambal chilli with anchovies.
label: positive

text: Shanghai to Melbourne via Singapore, we had exit row aisle seats and these were not too bad, but it can be annoying to get your feet and shoulder bumped in this position. However, there is plenty of leg room. The biggest grip we have is the temperature of the section we were in, I am not sure what was wrong but people on the flight to Singapore from PVG coughed the whole time, the air appeared to be very dry and was extremely uncomfortable and the second leg the cabin was like an oven! An astute flight attendant made a call and within minutes the cabin cooled, but it was the same on the legs coming back, just too warm. We tried to get business class but couldn't, so we opted for economy which was otherwise not too bad. The Singapore Airlines service was lovely but the most mechanical I have ever had - nice and pleasant but without any personality. The food was just ok, was expecting a bit more from this airline and also they don't give out bottled water so you have to always ask.
label: positive

text: One of the World's Best Airlines Each time I fly with Singapore Airlines I find it so pleasurable, the flight attendants are caring and nothing is too much travel. The planes are also very clean and well maintained.
label: positive

text: Excellent airline with inexperience staff I traveled with my family to Singapore for Christmas Holiday . The trip ,the food and the hotel in Singapore were excellent and we returned with excitement. We arrived at the airport 4 hours before departure . The staff in the counter did not allow us to change to an early flight even though they have a lot of vacancy in the early flight. The staff in the gate changed the seat of my son with the excuse of putting us together. Instead he separated us in two areas. My wife was quite angry with the arrangement and I did not like to be tricked. They could upgrade the other passengers to business class cabinet in case of overbooking because the cabinet for business class was empty. The staff in Cathay Pacific would definitely do such an arrangement. Otherwise, they would ask for change of seat with honesty and courtesy. Stupid!
label: neutral

text: The best Premium Economy Class I ever tried The leg room is more than enough for a 5 hours flight. Good food, but I think they have cut a bit of cost in the past 1-2 years. I like the headphone for entertainment, and the individual reading light when I need to focus and read on board. The reclining seat is one of the most comfortable seats I have tried, I even tried taking Premium Economy on my last trip to Germany from Singapore, 8-9 hours are still manageable, but definitely not as good as flatbeds you get in Business class. But given the price you paid for this class and the comfort you get, it's still quite a good deal.
label: positive

text: Great Service Had a great flight on this airline. Staff are exceptional, especially on the A380. We were upgraded to the exit seats. Would definitely fly Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Worst Premium Economy flight ever What a disappointing flight. Probably the worst crew I ever had, very inattentive, they looked stressed and tired. It was very hard to get any attention at all (the attendant button at your seat was completely useless, no reaction by the crew whatsoever) I had 2 drinks in a 12 hour flight. I wasn't asked for a drink with our meals and the meals unfortunately didn't save the day either. Most of the time we had to queue at the lavatory (the layout of the plane is horrible), because the 2 lavatories were used by Economy as well. The lavatory situation in Economy was much much better, nobody surely had to queue there (11 lavatories according to the seat map!). It didn't help that a family with two toddlers and a crying baby was sitting in the same row. On the positive side were the headphones (even if they had to replace my headphones straightaway) and the entertainment system. Avoid booking Premium Economy with Singapore Air, you have a much better deal in Economy (or Business of course). Another weird point was that Economy class was disembarking before Premium Economy, another novelty for me. There are much better Premium Economy products out there (eg Air New Zealand with more pitch and ).
label: negative

text: Fly either standard economy or business Seats are terrible, small, hard and uncomfortable. Vegetarian food is terrible. Fly either standard economy or go business. If u want to fly premium economy get Air New Zealand or Cathay Pacific. Their product is much better.
label: negative

text: GOOD AIRLINES Hi All , I have travelled from Phuket to Singapore by the Singapore airlines .This airlines is very comfortable for the families and couples , the cabin crews were very kind and the captain was super professional.. You have to try it if you are planning to travel to Singapore !!😃😃
label: positive

text: We were making a return trip from Kota Kinabalu through to London Heathrow via Singapore on 28th February 2015. We checked in at KK in plenty of time we were the first people to check-in! We were issued with our tickets but not told that we would not be able to sit together on the 13 hour flight from Singapore to London we discovered that by checking our tickets before entering departure. We returned to the check in desk and were told that they were unable to change this as it had been 'blocked' (We feel that we should have been told this when we checked in). We were advised to talk to the transit desk when we arrived in Singapore. On arrival we went to the transit desk the staff were very helpful but we were told that we were still unable to sit together. We had explained that my husband was a very nervous flier. When we got to the departure gate they were able to change our seats. Why could this not have been done earlier and alleviated a lot of stress for us. The breakfast meal was not very nice. Initially we were told there was only one choice which was Singapore carrot cake which we didn't want as did most people sitting near us. We were found an alternative meal which was cold! We are regular fliers to Asia and have flown with Singapore airlines many times but we feel that on this occasion the standard of service was not to the standard that we would expect from a premier airline.
label: negative

text: CTN VIA JHB TO CHANGI INT Airport, SINGAPORE The flight was on time, and all expectations were met. From inflight entertainment to inflight service. Food choices was okay. Friendly staff. Bathrooms/Toilets are okay, not the greatest. Definitely will fly with Singapore Airlines in future.
label: positive

text: Old fashion airplane. Old fashion airplane. Business Class seat not very confortable to sleep compared to more recent airplanes. Duty Free items choice limited and far below in respect to the duty free catalog. Good food and good wines. Gobally a little bit disappointed. New trip I will test with another company.
label: neutral

text: Great Airline To Fly With Singapore Airlines is always a pleasure to fly with and a fantastic airlines. We recently flew to New Delhi & Back on Business. The journey has four legs, so I will comment individually Brisbane to Singapore - Small Plane Seats & Average staff, poor food, book the cook is useless Singapore to New Delhi - A380, great seats, fantastic staff and great food. New Delhi To Singapore - A380, great seats fantastic staff and super food Singapore to Brisbane - Small Plane, Small seats, fantastic staff and great food. Singapore Airlines lounge food needs an revamp and upgrade. Overall great experience.
label: positive

text: going back home I almost forgot, my flight schedule was horrible. but its not the airlines fault of course. but I prefer take morning flight from Japan to back home. everything was good, as your expected as 5 stars airlines. I got muslim meals again, kebab as appetizer and rice set for main course. I loved more the movies option from this flights than the 1 before.
label: positive

text: Big Mistake By Airline Having used a free upgrade from Business to Suites, I find it unbelievable that SQ can make such a big mistake in their new cabin. Nothing is aligned, very little storage, could fit my laptop case in the wardrobe. Seat positions dont work for comfort. However, if you ignore the seat, alignments etc, the service from the crew is still top class, but i would much prefer flying in the old configuration anyday over this new one.
label: positive

text: comfortable flight Flight was very comfortable. Good Service. Good In-flight entertainment sufficient leg room good in-flight service
label: positive

text: New A380 Business Class Excellent flight on the new A380 Business Class fit-out. Plenty of space for personal items and cabin bags can be stored under the seat in front instead of overhead lockers (which are available if needed). Seat is firm but comfortable and deploying the bed is simple. I had quite a few hours' sleep which is rare for me on a flight. No problems with sleeping position - some people think they won't like the angle - but there is ample space to stretch out or curl up. Singapore Airlines service and meals are always excellent and attendants always very obliging.
label: positive

text: My initial flight was booked from Singapore to Darwin in April 2022. They cancelled my flight to Darwin for operational reasons and rebooked me after three days. I had to reach Australia earlier than rebooked date. I called the customer line and explained. They charged me to rebook me to a flight to Sydney as they had no other options available to fly me to Darwin. They did not give me a ticket from Sydney to Darwin and I lost a lot of money. Incompetent customer service staff and SQ's attitude to their own cancellation was pathetic. The flight comfort was okay but a big decline in their overall customer care.
label: negative

text: Very Good Flight It seemed to take a very long time to get the dinner service.We were row 58 in economy but it was midnight before we had dinner. take off was 10.30 pm. Entertainment was very good, only disappointment was the food, which was okay, but only ate parts of it especially the breakfast. The flight attendants were all very friendly and overall the flight was a pleasant one.
label: positive

text: Sydney to Singapore on A380 SQ232 and Singapore to KL on SQ118. The SQ232 flight was outstanding. Very efficient crew with turnaround time for bell call being less than a minute. It was a rather smooth ride food excellent and good entertainment selection. SQ118 was a short flight of 45 minutes but again crew was excellent and proved why its still one of the best.
label: positive

text: Trusted airline For someone like me who dislikes flying due to fear of it, flying with Singapore airlines gives me that calm. Knowing they have good standards for safety and try to do great service and their efficiency in Check-ins takes away the anxiety. Cleanliness is super thumbs up!
label: positive

text: Comfortable and clean We first time long haul flyers chose Singapore airlines as our main carrier due to reputation. Our first leg from Akl to Singapore was with Airnz and have to say we were impressed with their service, food and drinks. Expecting even better from Singapore airlines we were a little disappointed. Staff were friendly, food when served was plentiful (cant please everyone's palate) and water was offered regularly. Our first leg was a 13 hour plus flight and after being served the first meal we were then left wondering after 6 to 8 hours when the next meal was coming. When we finally asked when the next meal was to be served found out about 2 hours before landing. Was then told we could help ourselves to snacks ( sandwiches, muffins etc from galley). Have to say sandwiches very nice but if these snacks had been offered earlier or regularly would've given a higher rating. Seating in economy was what you would expect and the 3 of us being around 5 ft tall was ok. Blankets and pillows were on all seats when we boarded but felt compared to Airnz movie selection was a bit poor. The hot flannels handed out after takeoff and before landing was nice as was bag with socks and toothbrush and paste. A bit more information as to meal times and offering snacks ( without feeling a nuisance for asking), would be a positive move. Toilets were generally clean considering the usage and mouth wash, toothbrushes, sanitary products, hand lotion and cologne a nice touch. 8/10 for efficiency and timeliness.
label: positive

text: Beverages served even in Economy Class during delay on ground Swanky new 787-10 came along with all the great new soft products you could expect from a respectable airline like Singapore. While on the ground, we got delayed nearly 45 minutes due to a cargo issue. The cabin crew quickly stepped up to serve all passengers beverages (including alcohol if requested) to keep us calm. Job well done, not many other airlines would even serve drinks on the ground to Economy Passengers while still on the ground during delays since hearing so many feedbacks that they were deprived instead.
label: positive

text: Singapore Air is Price Gouging for people who rebook due to Covid I am disappointed that Singapore Airlines is price gouging and taking advantage of people who need to rebook flight due to covid. I had an oringinal booking from Osaka to Singapore for Dec 23, 2021. I could not travel due to covid and I wanted to push my flight back one year. Singapore Air would not let me do this so I pushed it back to April of 2022 with the intention of pushing that one back to Dec 23, 2022 when I intend to fly. I am now trying to rebook from April to December 2022 and my travel agency (Expedia) told me it will cost over $2000 per ticket to rebook!!! This is outrageous!!! The fares online for that date are $679 USD per person. I paid $569 USD for my original ticket and $130 USD to rebook to April the first time for a total of $699 per ticket. So although the website says its $679 to purchase a ticket in December of 2022, I am being told its the amount I have already paid plus over $2000! This is taking advantage of your customers. I have never flown with Singapore Air and I was excited to experience and see what was behind all the good reviews online. However, thus far, the experience has been much worse than any other airline we have booked through for this trip. Why can't you give me the price that someone booking online would get? This is not fair.
label: negative

text: Best Airline Singapore Airlines is always the best among others. Great service from checked in to disembarked. No fault.
label: positive

text: Degraded SIA service continues I am a regular flyer of SIA on this route. In the recent travel, I found the SIA management has decided to continue degraded service in this route (and in other routes). I am not sure why it is Skytrax's number-one airline. The service level is still a degraded version relative to pre-COVID in this route. --there is no snack packet/fruit juice before meal service -- Toys to kids are of very cheap/degraded quality relative to pre-covid and other top-level airlines such as Emirates, Qatar -- Food quantity remains reduced amount and in smaller boxes (relative to pre-covid) -- Delay in departure continues -- In-flight entertainment options are much less than other top-level airlines
label: neutral

text: Depends on configuration We had a great flight on the 777 from Istanbul to Singapore (SQ391 January 27) as the plane was te latest version. This flight was painful. It was an older version of the 777 with the entertainment unit in the armrest and the seats seemed narrower. We are of a certain girth and the seats were too narrow for comfort. Also, the aisle seat (40H) had a box under the seat ahead meaning there was very limited legroom. The cabin crew were pleasant enough as was the food, but our row had an inexperienced team and we waited with our trays after the meal service for about an hour.. As a very frequent flyer, I will choose Turkish Airlines for this route unless the planes on Singapore are all updated on this 11 hour route..
label: neutral

text: Changi has lost its way I recently transited through Changi with Singapore airlines (business class) .l have flown with Singapore airlines well over 40 times but something is now drastically wrong.. Changi terminal was a nightmare, everything was shut ,despite walking 2km through terminal 1 and 2 l couldn't find a coffee shop open at 9am. Then l was forced to stand in line for over 30 minutes in sweltering temperatures (not adequately air conditioned) only to be herded though like animals. Obviously without adequate staff or screening facilities our flight was going to be delayed, well over half an hour. The flight was not much better. Why send staff around taking drink and food orders only for passengers to wait 30 /40 minutes to receive them.The food was terrible, nothing fresh,tasteless ,in fact l was ill for a couple of days after the flight. So in summary my experience was so bad l won't be using Singapore airlines again.
label: negative

text: Nice! I flew to Singapore with my family in 1964! We departed LHR from the Queens building and flew in a British Eagle Britannia turbo prop. It was my first ever flight and I still remember it to this day ... took almost 3 days and two stops. Roll on almost 54 years... Singapore Airlines A380 to Changi - departing T2 (Queens Building), completely new and have to say clean and efficient. SQ allows you to choose your seats at time of booking and there is no charge. I normally fly BA to Asia (2 or 3 times a year), but this time chose SQ because I got a bit of a bargin. PE seats there and back for a few quid more then Economy seats on BA. From start to go the experience was an eye opener. Great seat, excellant service, meals very good. The cabin crew were round almost every hour with drinks and snacks. The difference with BA was night and day. They did thier best to keep everyone happy. I will definately fly SQ again. They deserve thier Best Airline rating.
label: positive

text: Economy class - fair enough Though the seats spacing is the same as any other airline, they serve good food & are pretty much on time.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines great but let down by Scoot It's a long flight to the Gold Coast and after many years of travelling with Emirates, we noticed that instead of flying to Brisbane we could fly from Singapore to the local Gold Coast airport which would be ideal. So back to Singapore Airlines after a few years absence. The flight out to there was excellent and a couple of days break in Singapore (couldnt believe the price of beer $24 for a pint) was fine (Carlton Hotel was a good choice) caught the Singapore owned scoot flight into Oz. People talk about cattle class and thats how it felt. No TV, Radio, WIFI, food or drink available and in the mean time sat on a cramped rock hard seat for over 7 hours. It made Ryanair seem to be the airline of choice. Never again
label: positive

text: Always fly Singapore airlines for price and routes I have lived in Australia for over 40 yrs and ALWAYS travel Singapore airlines for best price, routes, service. The best stopover in Singapore relives the pain of long flights. Big, quiet, great shops and food court and best of all, showers that you can take for an hour of self pampering!
label: positive

text: Singapore to Perth. We were welcomed on as if we were old pals. This crew were enthusiastic and funny and service excellent. Food was exceptional. And welcome back to amenity bags. Entertainment system very good. Seats not flat bed. Lounge in Singapore needs a makeover.
label: positive

text: Great service but business class starting to show its age First time in a very long time to fly SQ business class and as much as their hard product is good their staff is exceptional. About half way through our flight got a bit bumpy which our 1 1/2 year old really did not like in that he got what we thought was airsickness (later turned out it was Gastro) The staff went above an beyond to ensure the rest of the flight went as well as possible even making up one of the spare seats. The seats themselves are a bit mixed, yes you can lie flay but you need to sleep at an angle as your feet need to fit into a cubbyhole. Also the seat has to be turned into a bed instead of just reclining. The plus is the food and selection of beverages offered and the option of pre-odering your meals.
label: positive
