text: One Of The Best! Probably one of the best airline in the world. The flight staffs were very polite, friendly, fast, efficient. The Airplane were very huge! Love every minute of it! Its better you guys booked your seat via online before your flight. For muslim traveler, dont forget to order your halal meal via the onlne registration.
label: positive

text: Best way to fly! Again, best flight experience! Polite, friendly, helpful crew members. Clean cabin/washrooms. Yummy meal: I usually don't prefer fish, but I did not mind this one. Unique ice-cream flavour, creamy and delicious, also supporting a local ice-cream brand! Wide variety of drinks, including red/white wine! Good selection of entertainment, including some newer movies! Would definitely fly with SIA again!
label: positive

text: Excellent My wife & I flew Bangalore-Singapore-Siem Reap and Phnom Penh-Singapore-Bangalore in August 2018. We had a very pleasant experience on each of the four sectors. Reasonable leg room & elbow room for economy class (better than Emirates & Jet Airways). Over the years, I have flown Singapore airlines many , many times on business - my perception was that it was an excellent airline till about 2014 and then I saw some decline in their quality. I am glad that it has improved now. The one issue I had is that I had forgotten to book a vegetarian meal for my wife at the time of booking the ticket and the website did not allow me to incorporate this 48 hours prior to the actual departure of the flight. However, on one of the sectors, the cabin crew was able to provide vegetarian meal and on another sector, they were able to give her some cookies. I have flown on many airlines and my opinion is that Singapore Airlines, Lufthansa, Qatar Airways and Delta are among the best.
label: positive

text: Sydney to London via Singapore. The seats in business class are awkward, to use the lie flat seat it is necessary to lie at an angle, and because of this it feels cramped. We left Sydney at 7.05 in the evening, and had the on board meal at approximately 8.00 pm, there was a choice and it was perfectly adequate. The flight to Singapore takes 7.15 hrs, there was a 1 hour change over of planes. After take off we were offered dinner again, which having already had an evening meal I passed. The flight to London from Singapore takes 14 hrs 35 mins. Breakfast is not available until 2 hrs before landing. It was served very late. I think the stewards should be aware of passengers who have been on the flights for 22-23 hrs, and be prepared to offer breakfast much earlier. We will not be travelling Singapore airlines again.
label: negative

text: A warm welcoming long-haul flight I always feel like home with pleasant flights with SQ. Our 12-hr flight was impressive and the team presented very high quality of customer services ranging from warm welcoming to small details, like rearranging the presentation of utensils etc. The crews were well trained and put their smiles at any moments I saw them. The in-flight entertainment demonstrated wild range of various films, documentaries, tv shows, songs, games, even language learning app. You would never feel bored during the whole flight. In terms of the meals, SQ also offered different choices to meet any requirements customers might have. You name it, they may have it prepared for you. I, personally, took regular ones and it was good. The mÕvenpick ice cream was like, hmmmm, so good!! But the breakfast was just quite fair to me. Generally, I felt so happy to enjoy the pleasant flight with this ripped off values of money.
label: positive

text: Good flight Good flight, service was was excellent & the staff were the best I have encountered. Food wad good without being exceptional. Only complaint was inhouse entertainment system which was very cumbersome to use & selection was limited.
label: positive

text: Worst meals ever I would not recommend premium economy as the extra cost is not that much better than economy. The meals were the worst and we have been flying for the last seven years. When I sent an email on arriving back in Australia I was pushed aside with vague excuses.
label: negative

text: Goodas usual Still keep up with their standard. On time. Nice to have $20 viucher for shopping at Changi Airport.
label: positive

text: The long journey home Excellent airline to fly with, they make you feel special without trying. Flew to Singapore by Boeing 777 which was fine and had a five hour stop over then on to London in an Airbus 380 (quite an experience). Overall the food and service on both legs of the journey were very good with very friendly and attentive staff. The inflight entertainment was very good and varied as these are long flights and you cant sleep all the time, a good film will always work. I would gladly travel with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: One of the best available Singapore Airlines have upped the game. I've flown on Emirates, British Airways and Qantas in recent years and the new Singapore Airlines services tops the lot - by far. The cabin size, seating arrangement, comfort, service, lounges, attention to detail, food quality, drinks selection and cabin crew were all excellent. It's the cabin which really takes Singapore Airlines so far ahead of the others - although the crew on all of the other recent airlines were fantastic, having a larger, more comfortable seat, in a spacious area makes the world of difference. Not all aircraft are yet fitted with the new "Suites" but as they roll out, I sincerely hope I am able to fly on those aircraft!
label: positive

text: A long flight from Heathrow to Bangkok via Singapore A good service with smiling cabin crew. Food was fine for economy class. Did have a choice from 2 options on the main journey. It is the timing and serving of meals that won't suit everyone. Flight left at 11:50 PM and the dinner served after an hours of flight. So the body clock is at 1:00 AM. Sleep for 6-7 hours and breakfast is served. But apart from that the crew try to make your flight as smoothly as possible.
label: positive

text: Business Class Flight SQ has become my first choice flight ever since this experience. Great service, excellent in flight entertainment and food, SQ has exceeded my expectations for a flight. Can't wait for my next journey on SQ again.
label: positive

text: Ein Wohlfühlug It has been several years that we had a long-distance flight with singapore airlines. Because of the strikes and the distance to Frankfurt( we live 100 km from Amsterdam and 90 km from Düsseldorf) . So we used for flying to Asia:, KLM, Lufthansa and Malaysian Airlines. But now, from Düsseldorf we tried flying Singapore airlines again and it was a very good experience. It was the 1. time in an airbus 350 and we think that it was ( comparing to 380 and 747 and 777) the best comfort we had with our seats. AND the service of the crew was really excellent! They tried to fulfill every wish. They make you feel like a friend. They remember your face and your wishes( like drinking more tee, or having the cheese-sandwich at midnight rather than the turkey-sandwich. They were always available if someone had a need. We were very impressed. Because our experience with the other airlines Is different. They disappear as soon as dinner or lunch is done. That feels not good. This crew was very good! They made us wishing to fly with singapore airlines every
label: positive

text: Bathrooms are disgusting In both flights (Melbourne to Singapore and Singapore to London ) after the first few hours the toilets were so messy and filthy, unlike emirate flights no one takes care of the toilets, they don't even empty the trash during the whole 16 hours flight ! I was really disappointed !!!
label: negative

text: Training on the go! SQ655 My first encounter was the cabin crew at the tail end, I witness for the first time requesting my violin placed in a safe storage from a young stewardess. The Chief Steward Mr Alex Lee took this opportunity to ask her a few question if she knew what’s the procedures to the passenger and she did and also answered well. Good training and guidances from a senior! Unlike the last trip where there’s a team of leading stewards and chief seniors, this was like a group of apprentice and new crew learning and they’re doing an excellent job! Good improvement in the cabin spaces and seat comfort. Legroom increased and I can even cross my leg easily while seated down. Recliner is slightly lower for the 787 and it lowered smoothly unlike its predecessors. However the Side panel control still gets triggered if passenger is too plump eg. reading light and calling steward assistance by accident! As for extra leg room the touch screen is where it’s a slight pain to one who has short arms. It’s mounted on the wall unlike the former fittings where it is housed inside the armrest therefore you may need to stretch a little to reach the touch screen...
label: positive

text: Brisbane Trip Its a long trip so we booked business class with Singapore Airlines based on reputation. This was not misplaced judgment. I am not a fan of airline food for the last 35 years or so and although the food both out and back was not to my taste, it was beautifully presented and served. I have to say that I could not speak more highly of the cabin crews. They were very pleasant, courteous and attentive. They made the unpleasantness of long haul flying as good as it could be. Well done to all of you both out and back. Seating was comfortable and allowed sleep which is a bonus for me. Highly recommended and would be first choice for another trip.
label: positive

text: Great seats and service, below expectations for food The business class seats are some of the widest I have experienced. Very comfortable flat flat with a slight negative comment on the funny angle one needs to place it’s legs. Great entertainment system. I fly Air France often, the seats are much narrower. However my expectations for the food on SQ quickly had to be tamed... little flavours. Below average carrot cake. Needless to comment in the cake. Overall great experience. The A350 900 is a stunning aircraft. Quietest I have been in on. Better than 787.
label: positive

text: Fantastic as always We always try to get this flight if we can as it gets to Singapore the next day at 7:30am so you get the whole day to start with. We have done this trip quite a few times and without a doubt this is the best airline I have flown with . The food and service level of comfort are just spot on.
label: positive

text: Birthday Trip The crew were amazingly attentive and the inflight food was excellent. My wife needed water in the night as she was unwell and the crew came to check she was Ok.
label: positive

text: Where is excellence of Service?? Travelling from Melbourne to Delhi via Singapore Airlines, Customer service by crew was very poor. Due to my medical conditions I have to eat on time and I requested the hostess accordingly but I had to wait for 2 hours and more to get my meal!! Apparently the air hostess forgot all about it, even though I reminded her 2nd time around. Extremely disappointed!!!!
label: neutral

text: Always A Positive Experience I always find 10+ hour trips to be tiring and not the most pleasant. However, my return trips on Singapore Airlines were much easier thanks to the service and quality of flying with this company. The flight attendants work hard but are very polite and friendly and provide excellent service. I paid for extra legroom seats as I find it easier to sleep this way and another benefit is that I was seated across from two lovely flight attendants during the take-offs and landings. Note that if you opt for this legroom option the entertainment systems need to be put away during those times. I always prefer to fly with Singapore Air if possible.
label: positive

text: Good but not as good as some reviews suggest I find Singapore Airlines is always consistently good without being great. Boarding at Sydney airport is a joke but that is more of a problem with gates 60-62 at the airport than with the airline. The seats in premium economy have a decent recline and staff are friendly. It seems to be a cultural thing with Singapore Airlines that once the main meal is served the cabin staff disappear. I've experienced it consistently in economy, premium and business. Don't expect staff walking down the aisles with drinks constantly as you get with Qantas or Air New Zealand, but equally, it is much better overall than the European and American flagship airlines. Overall Singapore is always reliable and Singapore airport is an excellent hub to travel through.
label: positive

text: Short Restful Holiday Singapore Airlines were great to travel on, there was plenty of leg room and the staff were amazing. Check in was quick and even going through that process the service was very quick. Meals were good and lots of variety for entertainment. We have decided to travel with Singapore Airlines later in the year when we fly to London. Overall a great flight
label: positive

text: Long haul non stop to New York Was on the new SQ 22 flight to New York for holiday. Was told happen to be the 3rd of flight since SQ restart non stop to NY. Premium economy was just right for the 19 hours non stop flight. Ticket was a little pricey compare to economy but then the comfort of seat and space make it up. Meals was not that fantastice as would have expected a little more choices. Incidentally took SQ 21 on return three weeks later. Overall good experience.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Perth. The Singapore Airlines Boeing 787-10 is a first class plane and comes with excellent and attentive service from the cabin crew. Very modern Kris entertainment system. Food acceptable but not fantastic. Suggest they provide headsets rather than the earpiece variety which are hopeless.
label: positive

text: SQ is one of my favorite airlines, but unfortunately in-cabin experience is less. Still great inflight entertainment (among the best in the industry) but food service is being downgraded. The round of drinks before dinner/lunch on longer flights, the appetizer on the tray and the hot towel upon boarding are gone. Of course nothing really serious, but with what you pay extra to fly with SQ it is an issue. Check-in process in FRA was efficient (as always with SQ) and the transit in SIN was a little tedious, as Germany (origin of my journey) was Covid-listed again: therefore it was not permitted to "walk freely around" the airport in January 2022 and I had to wait for my connection in a "reserved quarantine area". On the shorter flight to JKT you get now a box with (very) hot food, which is a downgrade compared to what you got before but still is quite ok. On both flights crew was very friendly and interactive.
label: positive

text: SQ11 NRT to SIN. Airbus A380-800. Although it's getting older and older (PTV not touch screen while some other airlines already have one) service is great as usual. Attentive cabin attendants. They even know how to deal with small kids so they don't meddle with other passengers. Food was great except dessert. They used to give out H-Dazs Ice creams for this route but not lately maybe cost cut measure I suspect. All in all a pleasant flight.
label: positive

text: Comfortable seat but long haul We flew with this airline as it was part of package deal with a tour company. Premium economy with Singapore airlines does not include lounge access unlike airnz. The cabin for this class is okay but you have to walk back through economy to the rest rooms.The seats recline and theres plenty of legroom. Try not to get the middle seats as it's hard to climb over sleeping bodies when you need to get up. Singapore airlines newer premium economy cabin has great viewing on the screens with many channels. They provide water socks toothbrushes etc. I would suggest booking a transit hotel in Changi airport if you stop at Singapore. It's worth it.
label: positive

text: Most certainly a great way to fly The flight was on time as scheduled. The seats are spacious even for economy class and the service was great. Full service with meals even though it was just a short two hour flight. In flight entertainment was great with all the latest movies to catch up on.
label: positive

text: Brilliant Staff & Airline Spoke to girls in Brisbane they were brilliant Charlotte & Georgie catered to all our requirements we needed to have a return flight from Brisbane/London, however we were cruising from Singapore to London. Another company we have been with for many years wanted to book 2 one way flights.Singapore made it return without the Singapore to London leg with a substantial saving to us.They booked us on extra legroom to Singapore then Premium Economy home. We could not fault their service. The staff on board each flight were also fantastic nothing was too hard. Overall a brilliant trip.
label: positive

text: Amazing experience What a great long haul flight experience with fantastic service. Pleasant check-in service and flawless transfer. One of the best airlines in the world. The staff are so nice and helpful. Comfy seats, great onboard food and entertainment to make the long journey enjoyable. Cannot wait to fly again.
label: positive

text: Never knew I could run so fast ! Singapore Airlines is without doubt one of the world's safest and most professional airlines. But who dreams up their connections? Just how is one supposed to transfer from SQ185 (Saigon to Singapore) arriving 22:55 (Terminal 2) to connect with SQ225 (Singapore to Perth) leaving 00:10 (Terminal 3)? For starters you always need to add another half hour to arrival times to allow for taxiing, so the estimated time was quite unrealistic. And Singapore airport is HUGE - it can take an hour to get from one terminal to another, although there are buses and trains (if you can find them). Made my connection with seconds to spare. Singapore Airlines - how about booking flights that don't require the athletic prowess of Usain Bolt?
label: neutral

text: Super Economy Experience on SQ I selected this flight because it was cheap, and the timing was good, flying out in the morning and arriving past noon in Perth, and it was one of those special ‘hackers’ Fare found on Skyscanner. My major grouse on this particular flight is cleanliness. The cabin is smelly. Over the years, I have experienced declining quality for the inflight meals on SQ. So, it’s better to fill up before you fly. I can’t complain since I paid a cheap fare for it. Nonetheless, my flight back on Qantas was a much better experience. The bad odour in the cabin must have influenced my rating for this segment.
label: neutral

text: Amazing service & flight The pilot made the flight a smooth & relaxing affair. We were in the large airbus plane & we didn't even realise we have taken off, it was seamless, as was the landing. It was the best flight I have been on. The staff on-board were very pleasant & helpful. Our seats were roomy & the screens on the back of the seats were very good & they have a lot of variety of things to watch. We pre-booked our seats & it was seamless. the only thing is you now have to pay to pre-book your allocated seats.
label: positive

text: Very comfortable flight Flying on SQ from Singapore to Perth was a breeze. The seats were comfortable. I was impressed by the little touches to enhance the comfort of travelers. On the seatback in front of me was a small pocket in which I could put my glasses. I always have trouble finding a place to put my glasses when I fly with other airlines. SQ's attention to detail and little touches enhance my flying experience. Kudos to SQ.
label: positive

text: Awesome experience in Singapore Airlines I had the fortune to visit Singapore with Singapore Airlines flight which was indeed wonderful and memorable one with world class facilities
label: positive

text: Good The plane was very clean and comfort. The flight was saftey. The service was very good. The food was good The chairs were very comfortable and with extra space to the legg. I didn't like the entertainment . I will fly with them again
label: positive

text: Wonderful flight to Melbourne We took Singapore Airlines for our trip to Melbourne in Jun 2019. The flight is smooth and wonderful. The service is awesome. It is our preferred choice airlines for travel. Thumbs up for Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Excellent service by the crew members Great airline to begin with. Food was great served with Udders ice cream. Love the inflight entertainment, full of movies and short films. Fantastic overall
label: positive

text: legroom nice but food isn't sufficient and crew doesn't look happy while serving The flight is nice with respect to legroom and cleanliness. They provide inadequate food in the flight. Even asking an extra butter by another passenger was responded as unavailable. They are highly limited with food and drinks. The crew also don't service happily instead they get agitated if you raise the light and ask them something. Good if you want to just travel from a source and destination without concerns on food or how crew behaves but not a good overall flight experience.
label: negative

text: Tokyo Haneda to Melbourne via Singapore. Due to the coronavirus crisis I had to bring my flight forward by five weeks. Once I got through to it, the call centre's staff were efficient in getting me suitable flights. Check-in at Haneda was friendly and quick. The ANA lounge was comfortable with a great view of the runway, although food and drink options were limited due to antivirus precautions. The Singapore lounge was very spacious with a good variety of food and drink choices. Onboard both flights the seats were very comfortable and the service was impeccable. My Chinese-style vegetarian meal on the first leg was very tasty, but the Indian-style vegetarian meal on the second leg was not as impressive, with little curry and a lot of bread. There were several drinks rounds on both flights. I managed to get a good sleep on a comfortable long bed. Both flights arrived slightly early. All in all, an excellent experience.
label: positive

text: Amazing customer service This was the first time flying with Singapore Airlines and was very impressed. Flight attendants were very accommodating. I wasn't feeling well and didn't take a meal during serving time and they checked up on me a few times to ask me if I wanted something to eat during the flight. Lots of leg room and in flight entertainment was good. I would highly recommend.
label: positive

text: Was August 2017 We had a really good flight from Melbourne to Singapore with a stop over and then flew on to London The flight was excellent , the crew were very attentive and efficient. Our return trip was just as good .
label: positive

text: I flew PER-SIN on a 777 and SIN-SUB on A330 last month. Good points: punctual comfortable seats great food great IFE (when you get the chance to use it). Bad points: On these aircraft types at least Singapore Airlines aircraft don't have individual air vents and it can become incredibly stuffy especially on the 777 where the cabin temperature was too hot - not the first time I have had this problem. Also the Surabaya flight was about 2hrs 15min which should have been enough to take in a 90 minute movie; but they didn't turn on Krisworld until about 30 minutes after pushback then 70 min later they collected the headsets and said they would be turning it off. In fact Krisworld kept running for another 30 minutes and was only turned off 15 minutes before landing. Had I known this I could have continued to watch the movie with subtitles - I think this was very poorly managed. Why can't they have IFE throughout the flight? - Qantas manages it.
label: neutral

text: Friendly staff and OK food Staff were friendly and helpful and the food acceptable. Entertainment was good with many channels and shows to choose from. The plane was modern and seating adequate but like most economy flights not a comfortable ride. Disappointing that not all staff are careful when waking down the isle one steward causing the whole middle isle seats to shake when he barged down the isle and into my seat without an apology.
label: neutral

text: Shoddy service and poor quality of aircraft My wife and I have been extremely disappointed at the deplorable quality of service of the airline in general as encountered throughout the REP-CCU route in Jan 2020. We chose Singapore as we had heard lots of wonderful things about the airline. Our experience was worse than any cheap quality bucket-shop airlines and we thought Singapore was a world standard airline. On the REP-SIN Route my seat had a broken table which I was informed only on the way to the boarding the flight when I was suddenly being pressurised by their ground staff. Although I was waiting at the airport near the gate for over an hour none of their ground staff bothered to discuss this matter with me. It was as if I was being pressured and coerced into accepting their deplorable service. Furthermore the table was only secured with sticky tape which kept falling on my lap and on a couple of occasions fell on my watch! To cap it all having a disgusting experience from REP to SIN we then received further shoddy service from ground staff at Singapore on the Kolkata flight. Ground staff in SIN are rude and egoistic and do not treat customers with respect. We observed this behaviour of their ground staff with other passengers on the same flight. I made the mistake on relying on the name of this airline without realising how miserable their service has become from 10 years ago when we did fly with them to Singapore for the first time and were very happy with the service. Having paid USD 700 for our one-way ticket from REP to CCU I was shocked to be downgraded to an airline with filthy seats, filthy cabin no TV no leg space and in general badly in need of an uplift. You can see in the photo the filthy water trickling out of the toilets into the kitchen area behind the aircraft! To cap it all the cabin staff offered me gifts worth SGD 75 on the plane. This offer got progressively downgraded by their head office to a few miles on their shoddy airline. I refused the offer.
label: negative

text: Return trip to Oz. We left from T2 Heathrow which is much Improved with good facilities. Excellent economy flights with Singapore Airlines, very pleasant helpful staff and good food. Reasonable room in the seats with good inflight entertainment.Overall a good experience with economy flight.
label: positive

text: Budget Air When did Singapore become no frills? I Al not a fan of writing bad reviews but…. I’ve always rated Singapore Air number one. No longer. Definitely now a budget airline and with a premium tariff. Service is still lovely but don’t bother forking out for business. It’s the new economy. Very BYO. PJs, travel kit all those extras that you to forward to when you go premium are gone. Definitely don’t get what you pay for. Disappointing.
label: negative

text: two legs we had two legs of the journey kansai o singapore we were in economy and it was only ok and equal or the same as most economy flights.singapore to manchester we were in premium economy which is much better.i have to say we didnt think it was as good as the same flight two years ago and again we think the competition has caught up which makes them now look ordinary and you can look for other carriers and expect the same.
label: positive

text: Got us home Thanks to government alert email got to know Singapore closing travel and Singapore airlines went out of their way to get us home safe and well asap. Can't thank them enough, as they also helped another 4 Airlines to get there passengers home on the last flight out of Melbourne before lockdown. So many staff losted their job after getting us home. Will never forget this and will hopefully fly again one day? Especially back to Australia to finish our holiday off and use Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: None Stop SF/Singapore MY First No ne stop in a while from SF to Singapore. 17 hours but none stop allowed for much better rest. Service was excellent especially from one Indian stewardess. Very help full and frequent enquiries to help me with any services needed. I would recommend this flight
label: positive

text: my 1st time flight with 5stars airlines Check in & boarding was good. but unfortunately you can't choose your seat until 48hours before flight day. I ask special treatment for my baggage (food and souvenir for my japanese relation). 1 of chips was broke, I am not sure when and how but it still ok. entertainment absolutely good I got front seat of Economic class and the leg space soooo spaces. but I don't have leg compartment for keep my bag. the food is so so, I asked muslim meals
label: positive

text: As part of my student privileges I get 1 free change which they caused unnecessary delays of over 2 weeks to help me with. They have been asking personal information and the exact same documents repeatedly with me talking to different representatives over the same thing again and again. They will act like they want to help but will actually provide no transparency and will only waste your time. In fact, their technical team prevented me from logging in to my account and magically on making a complaint and sending them screenshots of reduced fares, they responded and took 2 weeks more to let me login to my account. Their actions need to be reported.
label: negative

text: Excellent cabin crew Cabin crew went over and above to service and ensure passengers receive top class service. I was very impressed. For eg, I have a slight cough and requested for hot water and they would automatically serve me hot water again when I woke up during my sleep over the 14 hours flight. I felt so pampered!
label: positive

text: Melbourne to Koh Samui via Singapore. Our flights home were cancelled via email a week ago. Supposed to be flying home today. Email stated that we could get in touch via online form, which has taken days and hours to get to actually work. Email response said that they would get in touch shortly, so far nothing. Won't give refund so that we can source other options, only credit for future flights. Unreachable via phone. Can't log on to site at all now. Phone number states not in service. I understand they must be overwhelmed with queries, but feeling totally abandoned and just want a refund so I can find another way home.
label: negative

text: Disappointment at the deterioration of Service Standards Singapore Airlines has always evoked a sense of safety and comfort. I have always enjoyed their flights and their care. So, as usual, I once again booked my family on the Singapore Economy for our vacation to NZ. Right now on board SQ 285 from Singapore to Auckland. Two hours into the flight, no drinks, no food offered till now. I had to press the service button to get a glass of water and the crew wasn't very welcoming. My wife also pressed the button for some water, no one came. She got up, walked back n git her water. I don't know, whether Singapore Airlines has deliberately lowered the service standards in Economy to push sale Premium Economy, but for sure there is a marked deterioration to the earlier famed Singapore Air hospitality.
label: neutral

text: Connecting flight for second job Typical Japanese accuracy on boarding procedure, entry and departure schedule/time. Seat was comfortable, pitty they don't have 'in between class' seat sa. Economy Comfort. Animation and selection of movies is sufficient. Service on board is perfect. Only strange thing was, that the crew only presented drinks 1 time!
label: positive

text: I booked to go to Thailand on the 16/12/21 From Manchester but my wife had a positive covid test so we couldn't fly. I have been trying to get in touch with Singapore Airlines but I am just being ignored. Tried phoning the help line but gave up after 1 3/4 hours. I booked directly with the airline in case something like this happened but it hasn't made any difference.
label: negative

text: Only average new year experience Morning flight, food worse than the good SQ Standard, no second asking for additional coffee or tea, favorite duty free product not available , staff not very friendly, just normal No wishes for new yeAr Overall a disappointing experience this time.
label: neutral

text: Best airline It is always a pleasure entering an airplane of Singapore Airlines. Everybody is very friendly and helpful and you get all you want and or need. This time the plane was new with the new business class seats. You have to find our quite a lot new things.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines do not like Western passengers The ground crew at Singapore airport behaved like riot police, they were snappy, rude and unhelpful. Once on the plane, the cabin crew asked anyone who wasn't Western if they were vegetarian, western people were ignored. I asked for a glass of water but never received it, and my plate was not cleared away after my meal. I thought it might just be the crew on one flight but they were the same on all four flights. The last leg of my journey I sat with two other white women and we were treated appallingly. In the end we could just look at each other and shrug our shoulders. I will never travel with Singapore Airlines again, and would advise any other Western travellers not to use them.
label: negative

text: The best airline in entire Asia Singapore airlines is one of the best and for just one reason. They actually are. Be it their aircraft, punctuality, service, check-in they are just better than everyone else. The seats are spacious and never uncomfortable for the 6ft tall person like me. I would recommend to fly it every time you wanna travel and have a possibility to transit through Singapore.
label: positive

text: Shocking experience Worst staff ever. Asked them why the booking change fee was fourfold the amount on the journey back to Brisbane from Europe compared to Brisbane to Europe (in the same class). They were too classy to even respond to me. Far behind the top 20 airlines.
label: negative

text: Excellent service, nice staff and good quality of facilities Excellent service, nice staff and good quality of facilities. the seat has reasonable space and the multimedia entertainments. The flight attendants are friendly, helpful and professional. Also, the uniforms are excellent!!
label: positive

text: A must for a long trip Singapore airlines are my airline of choice where possible. They are always friendly and helpful and the business class lounge is great.
label: positive

text: Was SO disappointing Robotic cabin crew. REALLY uncomfortable seats for those who have bad necks, head Corder forward so got a headache within hours. Inedible food (Special chef orders just as bad too). Lights off at 3pm, yes 3pm so for 2 flights totalling approx 1 day of flying time, supposed to sleep .. Ummah, hideous for those who don't need hours and hours of sleep. Told to switch my 'night' light off so couldn't read and didn't want to watch any more movies. Return flight packed (This time in ECO as no room in PREM ECO), hot cabin, service stretched ... If you could call it service. I asked to borrow a pen to complete landing card and waited 30+ minutes. Had to ask again. Only thing I asked for in the 4 flights I took. I will NEVER fly this airline again mainly because the crew have zero empathy and the seats are SO UNCOMFORTABLE. If only I'd flown Virgin Atlantic ...
label: negative

text: What not? Best and cheapest way to get from Europe to Australia is via Stockholm . Flight was great in a A350 and A380 - some had brand new seats some the older style Staff is the winner on this airline - while the champagne is not as good as on Qatar the service is as good - there was nothing we could have missed on such a long journey The team really knew how to take care I Customer’s- even one flight out of all of these the staff wasn’t in the best mood - sure the overall best experience was supreme Singapore airline always again
label: positive

text: Order special meals from through their apps. In the flight, I was not served with the chosen special meals, and asked the flight attendant to check. She said that all special meals has been handed out. I had to write a email via the help section to double confirm what's the reason behind this. I was told via email that special meal was not able to be catered on the said flight due to insufficient preparation time. Truly disappointed with these behavior. There is no inflight entertainment for 2.5 hours flight, and the standard inflight meal is small in portion.
label: negative

text: Terrible& arrogant ground staff behaviour PHOTOS REVIEWS FIND FLIGHTS Airline Information Headquarters: 00 65 6223 8888 Airline Website Reviews Write a Review 24,861 reviews Excellent 14885 Very Good 5927 Average 2299 Poor 884 Terrible 866 Language: English There are newer reviews for Singapore Airlines See most recent reviews ricardousana, Thank you so much for contributing. Have any other experiences to share? Write a review “Horror service in Istanbul and Singapore from sg Manila, Philippines To make it short, had a flight with them going from istanbul to manila. On the way back i was denied to enter turkey due to corona virus( foreign passport holder restriction). I went to the singapore airlines customer service, i was told that I either fly with them back to singapore or get my own ticket departing istanbul. I choosed the option to fly to singapore, booked therefore a connecting flight going to bali. Short before departure I was handed out my boarding pass, showing that my final destination is manila, not singapore. Following this I had an argument with the staff, I was treated very arrogant, felt like I did a violation. I was told then by another ground staff that she will email her collegues in Singapore so that I possibly can entry. Once arrived in Singapore I asked the the sg staff if they received and email or call- none. The person in charge was even more arrogant denied any effort to help me or at least refund my travel ticket from sg to bali. Following this I was forwarded to a deportation room, felt like a prisoner there. Was allowed to use my cellphone only for a limited time in a demarqued area. Wasnt allowed to sit during talking even I was deadly tired. The story went on until I reached Manila. In short terms- desastrous communication, arrogant behaviour, chaotic terrible airline& service, never again!
label: negative

text: SQ 421 Hey guys just flew SQ 421 and it was simply awesome. It was a perfect business travel. The lounge in mumbai was quite good and so was the food. Flight was amazing, so comfortable . Travelled with my parents and wife and it was simply amazing. Cabin was great as well. Must try people .
label: positive

text: Worth it On time flight, friendly staff both at the airport and in flight, comfortable seating with enough legroom, clean
label: positive

text: Singapore to Brisbane with Singapore Airlines. Very good, comfortable and relaxing flight. The attention to detail by the attendants was amazing. Great food (for both meals) and the drink service was very good. The most comfortable economy seats with good pitch and soft cushioning. Great entertainment options with KrisWorld.
label: positive

text: Very average This was a real reduction in class from our earlier flight on SQ216; an aged Boeing 737 with drop down TV screens. Annoyed to discover that we had been allocated seats 53C & 53J, not adjacent as expected. So sorry, computer selection. Sorry didn't cut it with us as it was the 5th occasion that the computer had failed to allocate adjacent seating on Singapore/Phuket/Singapore legs of flights with SIA, this was the 7th occasion that we had flown either leg. Luckily for us an obliging passenger switched seats. Cabin crew were friendly but disorganised when distributing the meals. Shame that the same high standards are not maintained across all routes.
label: neutral

text: World Best Airline Never failed to live up its expectation as the world best airline. Good food. Good service. Good cabin crew. Great inflight entertainment and good amount of leg room. Chief Stewardess was gracious and courteos.
label: positive

text: Very disappointing We traveled from Melbourne to Singapore premium economy. I have flown premium economy previously with Virgin Australia and you could not compare the two services. We were not offered a drink before takeoff-on Virgin you are offered champagne or water. The cabin crew also serviced the economy section as well as premium economy but with Virgin you have your own designated premium economy crew. The food was terrible-a doughy pastry and that was all-it was an overnight flight but would have expected something lighter and tastier. This food was the same as economy so no different. Virgin serves you individually and you are given crockery and cutlery not plastic. Also cabin was not really separated from economy- they didn’t even close the curtain dividing the two areas! Also we had to use the economy toilets as there are none in premium economy-Virgin have designated toilets. The seats were spacious but other than that, I am not sure why we paid double the economy fare for this premium economy. Virgin also have a cabinet filled with snacks and drinks which you can help yourself to during the flight -nothing available on Singapore. A generally disappointing experience and definitely not worth the extra money.
label: negative

text: Sydney to Singapore with a stop in Canberra I have flown this route many times on various airlines but Singapore Airlines is my preferred due to my SQ FF status. I get to use the lounge and have better access to preferred seating. This was my first flight on SQ288 departing Sydney daily at 9:30pm with a brief stop in Canberra. The full flight routing is Singapore-Sydney-Canberra-Singapore. May travellers get off in Canberra after a stop in Sydney. The route is serviced by a B777-300ER with First Class if you want. Loads out of Canberra are generally lighter. On this over night flight arriving one hour early at 4:00am I had 3 seats to myself and was able sleep for a while. However, the woman in front of me kept reaching back and touching the touch screen which turned it on and woke me up! What reach back all the time?? I had to keep turning if off in the dark cabin. We are at a hight alert level with the Corona Virus and all fight crew wore masks. They did not have to smile I guess but they said it with their eyes.
label: positive

text: A1 fantastic service from check in to the time we disembarked we enjoyed the flight meals etc .. I have a little trouble walking and Singapore Air had a wheelchair waiting for me at check in at Sydney .. for the transfer in Singapore and at the end of the flight through Customs etc ... a wonderful trip all round and will be using them again later this year
label: positive

text: Great time flight The best flight I have ever experienced. From ticket booking, check-in procedure, land and air crews, ... awesome!
label: positive

text: SIN-CPH April 2014 777 was in good condition. Nice layout in business class. Beds were good I am tall and just fit the bed system which isn't always the case. Service was good and food was decent. Nice lounge in SIN.
label: positive

text: A nice and great flight Although I have written several reviews of Singapore Airlines (SIA) before, this review is the first in 3 years since the outbreak of the Covid19 pandemic as world travel had been limited and restricted since then. As the pandemic has more or less stabilised and traveling has been resumed, I also have restarted my "walk around the world". And all the while, I have been flying with SIA, unless for domestic flights. So I am sharing this recent flight where I flew in the business class of the A350-900 aircraft. First, the ambience was great and cosy and seat was very comfortable. I always prefer the Airbus over Boeing as the seat seemed "larger and more comfortable". And indeed it was! Food and drink wise, very good. I had made my order online and so the crew did not have to ask and served the food to us. They were tasty and nice and during our entire flight, crew kept on coming and asking if we required any more drinks or snacks and making sure we were "well fed". Kudos to the crew team, and of course they were very friendly and polite, not to mention efficient and smiles were always on their faces. Although the check-in and bording process were a little slow (not to blame on the airline itself but the local staff working attitudes and procedures), the service inflight was totally another story, it was outstanding! It's a comfortable flight, and also a stable one too! Even my 80+ mum was very satisfied with the entire flight experience as she didn't like to fly. It's good to be able to fly again and of course great to be back at the Business Class. Moving forward, in 2023, I have plans to travel more with the airlines and "it's a great way to fly, and whose service even other airlines talk about"!
label: positive

text: Racist staff My family and I flew from Jakarta,Indonesia to Mumbai,India. The plane was predominately full of Indians as we were on a flight to Mumbai. The Singaporean staff were curt to the Indians on the plane, and seemed to think they were superior to the passengers. It was clear racism. As and Indian American I have faced many racist situations ,yet this was one of the worst. As I was heading back from the bathroom, the stewardess was in the middle of the aisle, I politely asked if she could move as I needed to get to my seat since the seatbelt sign was on, she curtly replied, “Wait your turn” as she turned back around. It almost seemed as if I was the staff and she was the paying passenger. The very same lady decided to act in a rude manner towards me the entire flight, from meal service, and even where I got of the flight. The flight itself was 5 hours long, and was hard to endure with an arrogant staff. While the facilities on the plane were alright, I would not recommend Singaporean Airlines to anyone who wants a pleasant racism free journey to their destination.
label: negative

text: Bad costumer service Very disappointed for the costumer service staff and help. We will don’t used this airlines anymore after this situation covid-19 getting better.
label: negative

text: The Happy Airline Recently we flew to Singapore to visit friends with Singapore Airlines. If you have to fly economy this company seems to make it as pleasant as they can. From checkin prompts to baggage handling to your actual flight, the staff are pleasant and courteous and smile a lot. This is very important to us. On the plane the food was tasty and hot, free drinks and hot towels. Oh I love the towels! We had the feeling that we were in good hands. Our male attendant even took the time to write down some recommendations for places to eat. Lovely and helpful and caring. On out flight over we sat right a the back with no one behind us which was wonderful but on our return flight those seats had been filled and we were over the wing. I don’t like this so much as it cuts down your view. The toilets were also clean. The onboard entertainment was easy to access and use with a range of music and movies. We would certainly recommend this airline.
label: positive

text: A bit cramped Flew on the A350 which I can’t really say I’m a fan of. I’m only 5’8 but there is very little leg room on these planes.
label: positive

text: Uncomfortable seat and horrible food The business class seats are so uncomfortable and would not be suitable for someone of a larger size. I ordered the Japanese set and it is so horrible tasting. Rice and fish which is supposed to be served hot is lukewarm. The portion is also so small. I think this is the result of cost cutting. SQ instead of improving with the rest of the competitors have lagged behind them now.
label: negative

text: Not as expected No help what so ever, booked business no meals catered for me. Contacted them tens of times no assistance, no number to call localy in my area. NEVER Again, Scoot as well because it runs the flight from jeddah to singapore and its their fault I didnt get my meals though paid for them.
label: negative

text: Always superb We’ve flown Business on SIA a few times. The service, hard product and food are always excellent; you cannot best SIA for consistency. Would highly recommend. Yes, it’s more expensive than other airlines, but we prefer to pay a premium for this exclusive product so that it remains exclusive to a certain type of clientele.
label: positive

text: SIA TO PHNOM PENH The food is again below average. Somehow I think they have cut back on quality of cooking and ingredients on short haul flights. However, CX and Thai Air quality is still good on their short haul flights to Hong Kong and Bangkok.
label: neutral

text: Review on Singapore airlines The Singapore airlines A380 flight is very good. The service of the flight attentands is quick and good too. If you travel on the A380 I would recommend you to travel in business or first class as the experience is scintillating.
label: positive

text: BKK-SIN Old 777-300 Biz with no private TV screen and no inflight entertainment at all. Food was OK. Service OK. Seat reclined but not flat.
label: negative

text: Rude treatment on flight! (Food and Water Trouble) I thought I loved Singapore airlines and it seemed okay (not great) when I flew from Sydney to Colombo. But then I had the rudest experience when I travelled back to Australia. The air hostess (the ones in my cabin) were pretty rude. It's like they just want to get their job done and they don't care about the people. I've travelled a lot on different airlines and Ive never been treated so rudely. For a five star airline, they should be better or equally good than Qatar or Emirates. But NO!! They barely offer water to people. And this time, they ran out of food! I wanted the chicken as i do not eat beef and they wanted me to have the beef and when i said i can't. They took a long time (everyone else had finished eating) to find me some fish meal that wasn't even on the menu. ( However, I must admit that the food is good. Not as great as Emirates. but still good.). But I was grateful. However, that nice gesture didn't last for long. I literally opened my food to eat and the air hostess just dumps an ice cream (magnum) on my tray. I looked at her shocked. Everyone else was happy to get theirs, but I had only begun (not even) eating! I had to gobble my food as i was starving and eat the melting ice cream! In comparison, Emirates has a food bar for long flights like these at the back and also, ice cream is served not as a dessert but as a snack later on for those people who are awake and cant sleep. They walk around with water and juice trays so that anyone can keep themselves hydrated! But here, I have to go after them a hundred times! And on this very flight the air hostess serving me just took the cup in which there was apple juice remaining and poured me water. I took it from her as i was sick of begging for water. I had apple juice mixed water to quench my thirst and keep hydrated. I told myself that's just how rude they are and ended the rest of my flight. I also asked them for water when leaving the aircraft and they hesitated and made me stay the whole time until everyone left to get me the water (which was also a very small cup). I've asked for water in Qatar and Emirates flights while leaving and they've been nothing but happy to serve me and send me off happily with a bottle! Either this airlines is stingy for water or they don't want many people using the toilets or they're just plain rude. On a good note, I must say the flight is comfortable and good. And the food is acceptably good. I'd ask everyone who loves staying hydrated on flights to make sure they fill up their own water bottles!
label: neutral

text: As always - an excellent Flight We have flown with Singapore Airlines for the last couple of years and they are always excellent, from start to finish. Firstly, the staff are always unfailingly courteous and smiling. That is in the air and on the ground. I have seen them in some extreme circumstances and they are always exceedingly professional. Besides who doesn't love a Singapore Girl and guy - right. The food is very good and the entertainment has something for every taste. The planes are new and the seating is very comfortable. Of course in Economy there is always the issue of legroom but it is bearable on Singapore Airlines. I have flown other airlines recently so I have experience different companies. Overall I highly recommend them. The price may be a little higher than some but it is definitely worth the money.
label: positive

text: Chennai has no Business Class line through security so it was a long process, the benefit of this being that once you see the Air India Maharajah Lounge that you don't have long for the flight. The lounge is the poorest I have seen, looked more tired than those of Air Cubana in Cuba. Furniture was in disrepair, there was a bar that didn't appear to have been used for some time, sitting next to a disconnected fridge, no alcohol, food that looked inedible and was hardly warm and stained bulky furniture in the main room (this was full). Boarding was fast and efficient, the first leg meal was a salad of tomato, lettuce, cucumber and carrot with no dressing, butter but no bread and chopped chicken in tomato sauce that was dry and uninspiring. The dessert was melon and was the only thing I ate and went to sleep. The Brisbane sector was better in terms of food but still not great and the first meal I was served I have had four times this year (turkey breast which if you order GF you can also get for breakfast) but the crew on both flights was friendly and responsive. The Brisbane crew in particular was excellent and provided personalised service by name. Slight delay on the tarmac at Changi due to air conditioning warning light that was being checked by the pilot but arrived on time. Bags out within minutes as we were the only flight there. If it wasn't for the crew I couldn't recommend SG this time.
label: negative

text: Below the expectations - Flight attendants were mostly grim and sullen, except few. - Contrary to their image, aircraft was extremely old with an unsatisfactory and old fashioned In-Flight Entertainment system. - Flight attendants were just trying to push us to drink tea or coffee. They didn't give information about other drink options. We tried to find out other alcoholic or non-alcoholic drinks. - Lots of check-in mistakes. For example, they gave apart seat for my 5 years old boy. Thanks to smart airport c/in personnel they found a way to fix it. In short, if you have a long flight re-think other opportunities.
label: negative

text: At last, Singapore Airlines! Overall, very good service. PROS: The toilets remained clean all throughout the flight. Flight attendants were helpful and attentive. AVERAGE: Somehow I expected better food; this experience was only average in quality, in hotness arriving to your seat. No cheese, no bread, except for breakfast. CONS: The bag of amenities was not at all exciting--a pair of orange socks with non-stick soles, a toothbrush, a tiny tube of toothpaste, and ear plugs. Choice of films so-so.
label: positive

text: Great, fantastic and absolut professional service on board, should be an example for some other airlines. Nothing to citicize, absolut perfect service, very nice and professional staff on board. Always took an eye on me and on my medicine which had to be stored in the fridge of the plane. Very courteous staff on the flight, always very friendly. A good reason to take always a flight with Singapore Airlines whereever you can.
label: positive

text: Wonderful service with a smile. . As always Singapore Airlines gave top service. It's flight attendants are always so smiling and helpful. Even if I must pay a little more I always choose to fly with Singapore Airlines whenever possible.
label: positive

text: This version is dated.. but it still delivers in every single way! Over the past few years I’ve flown with a lot of different airlines’s business classes, and I’ve learnt that the key to providing an amazing onboard service is getting a good grasp on all the elements, rather than doing really well with one and letting the others suffer. As we all know, there is no such thing as perfection.. especially when it comes to airlines, and there are always flaws but I’m reasonably confident in the statement that Singapore Air is one of the best and covers all the relevant bases pretty damn well. As I said, no airline is perfect and Singapore airways is no exception. There are definitely things that I would change but on the whole they are one of my preferred airlines to travel with.I’ve flown with Singapore a few times, but this particular review is of their old version business class on their A380-800. For those of you who aren’t plane geeks, the A380 is the double decker giant of their fleet, with downstairs holding 333 economy & 38 premium economy seats and the upper deck holding 60 business & 12 first class seats.You might be lucky to still get a version of the A380 with the old business class but if you do them your in for a treat.. savour the moment as this won’t be around for much longer! Although lacking an onboard bar, SQ's superjumbo’s old Business class is home to some of the widest business class seats to grace our skies. In fact the Singapore air old business class seat puts most airlines’ first class products to shame, it really is a positively enormous seat! Anyway before I get into it, heres some basic useful info for check in that might be useful if you decide to travel Singapore business: * Frequent flyer program: KrisFlyer, Star Alliance. * Priority check-in: Keep a look out for the blue carpet and 'business class' signage at the check-in hall. * Checked baggage allowance: 40kg, raised to 60kg for Star Alliance Gold, KrisFlyer Gold and Velocity Platinum; and 80kg for all PPS Club tiers. * Carry-on baggage allowance: 2x115cm bags at up to 7kg each, plus one additional item such as a laptop satchel or duty-free goods. * Priority security screening: Most airports will accommodate a priority screening lane. * Priority boarding privileges: Business class was called to board with Suites Class (first), and airline members prior to opening the economy passengers. On this particular journey I was travelling back from Singapore to London Heathrow. On the way out I had sampled the New business class on a different aircraft which ill review another day! If you’ve ever been to Singapore you’ll know that Changi airport is one of the best in the world, its beautiful and offers endless entertainment for its guests including its own cinema, butterfly garden, and even a fully kitted out 5* Crowne Plaza hotel inside the airport. But for me, it was straight to the lounge to enjoy the benefits of some of the money id just spent.. With showers, Charles Heidsieck Champagne at any hour and calming instrumental music playing in the background, it's a great place to both relax and be productive.This particular lounge in terminal 3 is also entirely separate to the adjacent KrisFlyer Gold lounge used by frequent flyers travelling in economy, but can also be accessed by airline members flying with SQ in any class of service. You'll also find a SilverKris business class lounge in Terminal 2 should your flight depart from there, although SQ's flights to Australia and Europe all use T3. I highly recommend taking advantage of the lounge if you have time as its a great way to have a much needed refresh before a Long flight, especially if you’re on a stopover. After having a quick shower and freshen up and also making the most of the alcoholic beverages in the lounge, it was now time to board the plane. As I said before, SQ waste no time getting the premium passengers onboard so there is minimal waiting around. As soon as you’re on board you’re greeted with a smile by one of the singapore air staff who are renowned for having some of the best hospitality of any other airline. Once my ticket was checked I was guided to my seat, where I was seated for all of 30 seconds before someone brought me a glass of champagne and a hot towel. A really nice touch by SQ, and one now adopted by other airlines is that the crew have your name memorised from the manifest and for the whole flight you’ll be addressed as ‘Mr Mitchell’.. or whatever. Singapore even go there extra mile and if you’re with their loyalty programme and they have your previous flights on record, they’ll even have noted small details from your previous flights such as you having a coffee before landing for example, and just like Magic they’ll come round and offer you a coffee just before landing. It really is the nice touches like that which I love about Singapore air. Anyway, lets talk about the seat, as thats where you’ll be spending the next 12 hours..Singapore Airlines old A380 boasts one of the widest business class seats in the industry, measuring a whopping 30 inches when upright.. I’m a big guy and you could’ve fit 2 of me in this huge armchair (a squeeze but still doable) it really is crazy big. just to do a quick comparison, emirates’ a380 business class seats are a mere 18.5 inches wide, while Etihad's business seats are at 20 inches.. a massive difference. However after flipping the seat into bed mode this huge width does become somewhat limited. If youve flown Singapore business before you’ll know they don’t use any conventional seat design, its unlike any other, and with these you aren’t able to turn your seat into a bed by just clocking a button. Actually its a matter of getting up and folding the back of your seat over to make it a bed. I always thought this was a bit of a bad feature and a bit of a ’steam method’ compared to other airlines but hey ho. Once this is done because of the seat configuration you have to sleep kind of diagonally so your feet slot into the space in front of the seat in front of you. Its a strange design but I’ve had it before and its not uncomfortable and still offers good space. A little tip, get the bulkhead seats as they don’t have this problem and you’re able to practically starfish in bed! I got the bulkhead on this flight, and even with me being 6Ft1 tall I had plenty of space and it was so bloody comfortable! I was able to get a good 7 hours sleep on the overnight journey home to London.You can also signal that you don't wish to be disturbed from your bed If you don’t want to be woken up for meals. When I did wake up a handy cover in front flips open to reveal a mirror so I could inspect how mental I looked after my nap. Also tucked away are two USB power ports and a multi-country outlet so you can keep your tech juiced! The seats were great as far as size and comfort goes, but regrettably they were starting to show their age after debuting in 2007. the controls and remote were all proper old school and the buttons were mostly worn down. But you know what is just aesthetics and I can forgive them for that. Now I don’t remember a great deal of the taste of the food on this flight because, big shock, I was trashed.. ironically I’m not actually a great flyer and I tend to get a bit heavy on the champers when I’ve got a Long flight.. its basically tradition now and its not going to change! while were on the subject of champagne.. champagne lovers will also take comfort in the 2007 Taittinger Brut Millésimé.. an impressive choice when most other airlines typically reserve vintage bubbles for first class passengers. As for food, I know SQ offer An extensive delectables menu to fill the gaps in between meals, with 13 snack choices including noodles and sandwiches and that kind of thing which I took advantage of after breakfast. Later in the flight lunch was served.. I had the chicken and mutton satay sticks with onion, cucumber and peanut sauce which was pretty damn good. I also ordered a goose liver foie gras which again I really enjoyed. For my main course I was presented with a staggering amount dishes to choose from.. there was literally like 50 choices, which lets be honest is absolute madness.. but pretty damn impressive. After taking my time reading the menu, I opted for SQ's classic lobster Thermidor. Sautéed in butter, flambéed in brandy, sprinkled with cheese and served with creamy mushroom sauce, garlic and spicy mustard, buttered asparagus and yellow rice.. it was mouth watering and beautiful.. it's again something I’d expect to find only in first class.. but it's still a real treat for business class passengers. For the people like me who enjoy using a long haul flight to catch up on movies, lets just talk about their entertainment systems.. KrisWorld, SQ’s inflight entertainment system, delivers a great variety of movies and TV shows on a 15.4-inch seatback LCD screen, or you can also connect your iPhone/iPod via the data ports or something more conventional such as a portable DVD player using standard TV RCA connectors. There was a good selection on my flight and I didn’t even have enough time to watch everything that I wanted! SQ provide Noise-cancelling headphones which do the job perfectly.. although a little uncomfortable on your ears after a few hours they’re a welcome necessity. They offer wifi onboard at extra charge but I wouldn’t use it unless I really had to as its pretty useless at the best of times and pricey for what you get. Service on this flight was totally exemplary, whats great is that because of the small segregated sections of the upper deck you'll generally always be served by the same two or three crew members, who in this case took no more than 30 seconds to answer call bells and were so attentive that often two flight attendants would arrive simultaneously to offer assistance. I expect nothing less from Singapore air and this is of course where they get their ‘best of the best’ reputation from. As I said at the beginning, a great in flight service counts on a good balance of all the elements required. Singapore air time after time delivers on this with a consistently above average service on all counts (with most elements being nothing short of excellent). The service, entertainment, food, and all the little touches are top notch and you really are extremely well looked after throughout the entire flight. Yeah, sure this versions’s seats were a little dated. But you know what? I actually prefer this, if you can get past the aesthetics and concentrate on the comfort then its actually a much more pleasant hard product than some of its more modern versions. The of course, the Singapore a380 also lacks an onboard bar which many of its competitors now offer, but to be honest I always see the bars as more of an unused novelty. I’ve often popped to the bar on a flight for a picture but rarely for anything else. When I can get drinks delivered to my seat at the push of a button I’m not sure why everyone gets so excited about getting up to have a drink at the bar? So its no biggie for me and I wont mark it down for that. Overall, Singapore air is hands down my favourite airline to fly with. Their hard product is always amazing (old or new) for space and comfort, and its also unique in the sense that no other airline has the same as them.. meaning its a totally unique experience. But even as far as their soft product, customer support, in-airport care, lounges, loyalty programmes, onboard service, hospitality, in flight entertainment and food.. they excel in all of them and give all other airlines a good run for their money! Even being on an older plane does not mean you get worse service.. their amazing service is provided throughout their fleet. The only thing they don’t offer which some of their competitors do is airport chauffeurs for premium customers.. which is something they should look into as its a great seeing point and a nice touch. Of course, all these luxuries do come at a price, SQ is one of the most expensive airlines for premium seats but they justify it with the product that they offer.. if money is no object then of course opt for Singapore air as they really are second to none in my books!
label: positive

text: We used this airline both ways to Australia nothing negative to say We flew from LHR to Singapore had an hour to transfer aircraft to go onto Australia and we cant fault the staff. We then flew home the same route but spent 2 nights in Singapore . The flight was comfortable food and drinks were available on a regular basis , staff were helpful friendly and very efficient .All staff were great but I would like to name a very sweet air hostess on our return flight from Singapore to Heathrow on the 22nd March Suwanee Saopiasert she was respectful so sweet and so smiley a credit to your business
label: positive

text: Long flights with Singapore Airlines Not bad for Economy Class. Friendly efficient staff and quite comfortable seats. Food was also good. Had a stopover in Singapore for about 3 hours which broke the journey a bit.
label: positive

text: Hopeless service from SIA. Expect worse service when they biy Air India Useless airline that employ foreign indians to handle customer service. Slow and hopeless service. Dont travel with SIA when they buy Air India.
label: negative

text: Average at best My premium economy seat had a giganic hole in it so it was very uncomfortable. In addition, the seat file in front was broken so the magaizines were falling out on one side thru the trip. The food was cold and unappetizing. Crew was average in service.
label: negative

text: We booked our ticket well in advance for our return trip from India from CCU to Perth via Singapore and after few days SIA changed the flight timing later, from originally scheduled 7.40am to 7.20am. We boarded the flight from CCU and flight landed 1 minute before time. Upon landing we have received the notification that our flight has been rescheduled and it will depart at 9.30am. As mentioned before we booked well in advance and paid extra money for forward seats. However with utter surprise we have noticed that they have allocated us three different seats that too rear of the aircraft. While contacting the Transfer desk the customer service lady told us it is not possible to provide us any other seats so that three of us can seat together. She was very rude and not suitable for this kind of job. Being a Krisflyer Gold member this is very disappointing and not at all expected from SIA.
label: negative

text: Perfect flight Flying solo and for the first time in a number of years I wasn’t looking forward to my journey but I was soon at ease and was so pleased with the comfort of the seat the service was excellent and I really couldn’t have wished for a better journey to Australia. I felt very happy to be travelling with Singapore airlines and I shall definitely fly with them next time.
label: positive

text: Excellent airline Singapore air is simply the best, I love the way cabin is sectioned, feels like your in a lounge. Food and service cannot fault!
label: positive

text: Disappointing Singapore Airlines Premium Economy Singapore Airlines generally have a reputation for providing excellent service, and so we booked a Premium Economy flight SQ308 from Singapore to London, on 18 September 2023. Prior to this flight, we took a Scoot flight Melbourne to Singapore, again in Premium Economy, which was excellent, sitting in seats 1A and 1B. The Singapore Airlines flight was disappointing in a number of areas. We were not offered a glass of champagne on boarding, no flight menu was offered, no amenities kit, and very sparse service of drinks, in plastic cups (not glass). We had pre-ordered meals, my wife’s meal was first given to another passenger who opened it, realized it wasn’t theirs, and returned it to the hostess, who then read the correct seat number and offered it to my wife, opened! I had to request more wine during the meal, it was not offered. All in all, a most disappointing flight. We have Premium Economy flights booked on our return journey, not really looking forward to those. I would chose QANTAS Premium Economy in the future. Not good enough Singapore!
label: neutral

text: Flew from SIN-MNL-SIN. Although a relatively short haul flight the crew were exceptional and never stopped smiling. The great SQ smile. Anyone interested in being pampered at 37000 feet with the best in service opt for SQ.
label: positive

text: First class food Travelled from Man to BKK via Singapore and return. Outbound flight was on an Airbus 590 with the skewed sleeping arrangement which I found to be most uncomfortable. Although the seat was wide it lacked support for the lower back and I thought that the TV screen was much too close to the seat. The flight from Singapore to BKK on the B787 was little better as the seat was very narrow and the partition dividing the seats made it feel very claustrophobic. Again, I found there to be a lack of lower back support. This time the TV screen was further away. The return flights were very similar. However, where Singapore airlines does score highly is in the way that the cabin crew look after the passengers; service was superb and nothing was too much trouble. Food also was so much better than any other airline we have travelled on, especially the Book The Cook option. Also, the lounges, with the exception of the one in Manchester, were first class with an excellent choice of food available. Despite my criticism of the seats I would definitely fly Singapore again.
label: positive

text: Non stop Very comfortable and extremely well catered for. Flight crew were fantastic and helpful. Best long haul flight ever experienced. More than happy to travel with them again , special dietary requirements were not an issue and were well catered for with normal advanced notice.
label: positive

text: Trying to contact them by the call center is a nightmare with a lack of customer service and inefficient. The seats on this aircraft were the new regional business class seats which are not bad. The IFE is also good and we had 100MB free wifi which was nice. The crew were good. However, the food was an utter disaster. For a 7 hour flight, we were given 1 miserable meal which was rubbery eggs and mashed-up vegetables. Book the cook was not functioning on this sector so we had no other choice. No welcome drink either. Standards have gone down drastically from many aspects.
label: negative

text: Good but still economy squeeze Melbourne to Singapore - 777 refitted plane. I last flew two years ago and was so impressed by the space of the seat and leg room I was happy to be going with them again, even if they were the more expensive choice. What a shock. They have reduced the seat and pitch size. We did depart on time and in row order. The teenager in front of me reclined as soon as we were airborne for the whole 7.1/2 hour daytime flight and my entertainment screen was a hands-length away from my face! Ran out of everything but beef by the time they got to us (seat 47). We arrived safe and sound however, but the whole experience was disappointing. Returning on A380 was better. We were on the upper deck economy which was roomier than the 777 plus has the added storage next to the window, plus there was just 2 not 3 in the row by the window (YAY). The food was dire though and almost inedible but at least we had the bread rolls and cheese/crackers were okay. So ultimately it is okay BUT it is still economy and you will have the squeezed in experience with no real bells and whistles. Is it worth paying hundreds more than other carriers? I won't go out of my way to book with them again unless it really suits or they have a deal going.
label: positive

text: Not worth the money Having booked with Air New Zealand for a round trip to the UK we enjoyed our flight over with Air NZ and Virgin Atlantic and looking forward to our first trip all the way back with Singapore Airlines. Oh what a disappointment, paying the extra for premium economy was just not worth it. The only advantage was a bigger seat and priority baggage collection, no welcome drink, same food as served in economy, no nice glasses just the usual plastic, the white wine served was warm and the comfort pouch for overnight did not even include an eye mask. Sorry Singapore Airlines you have a lot to learn from Air NZ and Virgin on how to treat your premium economy customers who have paid a lot extra for their travel. We will not travel with you again.
label: negative

text: Fantastic flight from start to finish. Check in at Manchester was extremely quick and efficient. Change over at Singapore was the same. All staff were very friendly and professional. The quality of food and drink on board was good and service was great. The seats were comfortable and the onboard entertainment was really good. I will definitely fly with them again in the future.
label: positive

text: It doesn't get any better than this Before I could even sit down, Stewardess Tracy helped me out of my coat and made sure that I had what I needed. She continued to be there for me throughout the 18 hours of the flight. She was lovely and gracious to a fault. I must also praise the food staff who provided excellent meals throughout. They even brought out a cheese cart at the end of the two main meals! The wine was great too. Finally, I loved the selection of films on the monitor. There were multiple Asian films with English subtitles that are probably available nowhere else. I look forward to flying Singapore again.
label: positive

text: Possibly the best Just fantastic. Great crew. Nothing too much trouble. It's a long flight but it went pretty quickly. Food, the best we've had on a flight.
label: positive

text: Excellent Recently flew home from Phuket via Singapore and the plane and service was the best have ever experienced will definitely use Singapore airlines whenever possible Thank you for outstanding trip
label: positive

text: Wonderful experience Since I booked my flight this airline has been giving me privilege. I can choose the front seat with no additional cost because I bring an infant. They also provided bassinet for my daughter to sleep on during flight. The aircrew was very friendly and really help me with the baby needs. They give us toy, they would warm your bottle if you asked or even warm the baby food or pack them if you want a go-to.
label: positive

text: Nice trip as to be expected (RT) Had a very pleasant trip on Singapore Airlines. Customer service from the time we checked in to the time we arrived was very good. The flight attendants were very accommodating. The trip was on schedule.
label: positive

text: Good as long as nothing goes wrong - they don't care at all We were migrating to Singapore permanently work work. I was travelling with my whole family. Typically we fly business with Singapore, which is an amazing experience. In this case I was given my marching orders and I had to get on the first available flight. Given our pleasant past experiences with Singapore Air the decision was a no brainer. We arrived at the airport on time but Virgin Australia simply did not process us on time. We spent nearly an hour in the queue and the lady that was checking us in was new and needed support, to which none was forthcoming from the virgin team. Needless to say we missed our flight.
