Virgin were absolutely dreadful, lost our baggage, blamed us for being late even though we were waiting in their queue, then sold us it was not their problem, call Singapore Air, so we did. To make a long story short Singapore did nothing to resolve the issue, left our whole family stranded when I had a deadline to meet, charged us over $6000 and wanted to charge us more for missing the flight, and have not responded to our lost baggage claim or complaint. Put simply you are running a risk if you fly with Singapore because THEY DO NOT CARE AT ALL about their customers. I travel regularly, needless to say it will be with other cariers moving forward. It's a shame because I have nearly 200,000 kris flyer points with Singapore that will now be discarded. BE WARNED, IF THINGS GO WELL YOU MIGHT BE OK, THEY DON'T SINGAPORE AIR WILL NOT HELP YOU AND FIND REASONS TO CHARGE YOU ADDITONAL FEES. THERE ARE NO PEOPLE AT MAJOR AIRPORTS TO ASSIST YOU. FLY AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!
label: negative

text: airlines with the best services? Services by the crew were not as good as I expected - despite promoting themselves as having the 'best services'. the food was not terrible but not great. the seats were not comfortable - I would say seats for Ryanair was better. I was also sitting next to the break room (?) for crew members so they were opening a bright lit room every few minutes throughout the 13 hrovernight flight, and I was unable to sleep. additionally, while the millage for my return flight was added, the millage to Singapore was not added so I contacted them only to get an answer 4 weeks later that the flight is 'not millage applicable'. Terrible wording of the whole email, no respect at all. I will never fly with them again.
label: negative

text: Great but late take off! I am a huge fan of Singapore Air and a frequent flyer KrisFlyer member. I would have given 5 stars but the boarding of passengers was very chaotic, which is normal for Dhaka, Bangladesh. While the crew was very professional, they ignored the dozens of people moving about the cabin near the time of departure. Because of being one of the first to board, I sat for nearly 45 minutes before take off. This has happened to me before on the same route. Nonetheless, I highly recommend Singapore Air.
label: positive

text: A Great Way to Fly! I have always trusted the Singapore Airline for their professionalism and aircraft safety. I am particularly impressed with one of the air steward's impressive customer service standard. As I was seated by the window (seat 57K), I did not get the chance to get his name - a Singaporean Chinese gentleman. His professional and sincerity in helping made my flight experience very pleasant. i also noticed that he will go the extra mile to ensure all passengers' needs were met. I highly recommend the Singapore Airlines anytime as the airline service does not start from the air crew but from the entire travel experience (airport to airport).
label: positive

text: Rude staff and horrible landing We chose Singapore airlines and we were regretting after wards. Plane was good, tv screens were of good size. But crew members were very rude. They were not listening to anything. I asked for a glass of water almost three times during 5.5 hrs but noone gave. Landing was the worst part of our journey. Air pressure was not at all maintained, our ears were about to get burst. We will try to not go for this airlines in future
label: neutral

text: Best Economy Class Still my favorite airline. Best Economy Class, spacious sets with nice legroom, pleasing color fabric on seat covers. Each seat had a pillow and a blanket. You should ask to offer you an amenity kit (with socks, eye cover, toothbrush / paste). Pity they do not have inflight magazine due to covid, (same excuse to save money and weight_ a lot of airlines are using the same excuse). Both flights were on perfect A350 and on time. After takeoff they started the first service which was tasty and there was selection of wine, beer, drinks. After food was desert which was ice-cream. During flight the crew was passing by the bottle of water for the passengers. At the galley there were some sandwiches and drinks. In the WC there were toothbrushes, cologne and cream. One hour before landing the second meal was served which was as good and plentiful as the first. IFE was great with a good selection of movies and easy to use. Great airline, keep the good work.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Zurich in May 2013. In April, to my knowledge, SQ 346 is very often packed and seat reservation might be difficult if you are two but on a different booking. On this particular flight I took a so called P seat which is next to the exit. Actually there is a lot of legroom left on the other side of the metal, there's permanently cold air coming up from the door. As often for a early morning flight 01.20am people are some of harshly due to sleep shortness. The cabin crew is very patient even if some become aggressive sometimes.
label: positive

text: 28 Oct Flt OZ574. 29 Oct Flt SQ609. 29 Oct Flt SQ 237. Clean planes comfortable seats. Attentive staff. Everything an airline should be.
label: positive

text: No sign of economy here We had researched Singapore airlines before we flew and it came up as the best in economy airlines - I really couldn’t see anything economy about it. There was plenty of room for us - my husband is 6ft 1, choice of films was excellent and meals were absolutely gorgeous - cheesecake was yummy!!!! Efficiency of checking in was faultless and always someone around if you did need help. Use them again? 100%,hopefully pretty soon. As a foot note - we flew to Hong Kong with them as well and between Singapore and Hong Kong we flew on the A380!! Fabulous airline and definitely recommend it.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines First Class, Flew 1st class from Scandinavia to Sydney via Singapore. Truly superb. Can heartily recommend doing so. As an aside. It was the cheapest of all the first class flights.
label: positive

text: Excellent !!! Last 28.04.2019 & 30.05.2019 we had a round trip to Dhaka-Narita-Dhaka. First time in Singapore Airlines. Beyond our imagination they provide extremely luxury service . Staffs were very cordial & helpful. All time they were friendly and smiling . I am unable to express all our gratitude and satisfaction to the crews. Always we will be with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Perth to Singapore A happy crew makes a great Airline and our flight had a great crew when we flew with Singapore Airlines good choice of programmes on the flight and meals we were very happy with the total experience at check in and the flight
label: positive

text: Using miles for flights I wanted to express my frustration regarding the difficulties I've encountered while attempting to redeem miles for flight tickets with Singapore Airlines . I've consistently faced challenges with the redemption process, often finding myself placed on waitlists for flights. Furthermore, on multiple occasions, approximately two weeks before the scheduled flight, I've received notifications of cancellations, despite my repeated attempts to secure bookings. This uncertainty and last-minute cancellations have greatly inconvenienced me. Compounding the issue, despite my efforts to utilize my miles within the required timeframe, I've faced expiration of my miles due to these ongoing challenges. As a loyal customer, this experience has left me deeply disappointed and discouraged from further engagement with Singapore Airline. I urge you to review and address the issues within your miles redemption system to ensure a smoother and more reliable experience for your customers. Your attention to these matters would greatly enhance customer satisfaction and loyalty. Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.
label: negative

text: I booked a round-trip ticket on Singapore Airlines. The company touted customers' ability to change their flights for free, even being able to change a flight for free and having one free change after September 30, which would allow them to delay their flight well into 2022. I was able to easily change the flight until mid-September. After that point, I wasn't allowed to change it online and needed to call in which required over 1 hour of waiting. In September I could have changed my return flight to far into the future. In fact, the return leg of my flight was 2 months and 1 day after the initial flight. When I called in to push my flight date back, the customer service agent said I must upgrade my flight to rebook and that there was a minimum required stay of 2 months, meaning I couldn't have a the return leg of the flight more than two months after the initial one. First of all, my return flight was already more than 2 months later and before they restricted online flight changes, I could have changed my flight to much later dates. The agent also told me the flight change would cost over 900 USD, more than the original round-trip ticket. I requested to speak to a manager. She denied my request and said she would talk to her team. After 30 minutes of being on hold, she said I could book my flight a maximum of one month past the current return date. This was not part of the agreement when I originally booked the flight. Now, however, I didn't need to upgrade the flight for some reason, but the change would cost 490 USD. Booking a one-way ticket at that time cost 497 USD. The agent explained that the difference was in the price of the flight. Nothing she said made sense. I am about as likely to trust Singapore Airlines again as I am to fly with them.
label: negative

text: Excellent fight company Me and my partner used Singapore airlines for a 12.5 hour flight. I was dreading flying that long! The economy seats were standard but definitely nicer than some economy flights I had been on like Emirates. The staff looked great in traditional long Singaporean dress it looked very smart and professional. The service was excellent from all crew who were very attentive and friendly throughout. I had ordered ahead online as gluten free and the staff checked/confirmed this at the start of the flight and then served all allergens first, all labelled and coded to the allergen. I got a really gold meal, a tomato and vege chicken dish, salads, veg, GF breads. I was really impressed, for ‘plane food’ it wasn’t half bad - again certainly better than other companies. The flight had great television systems and options for film, flight tracking, games etc. I would be more than happy to choose this company again for a long haul flight.
label: positive

text: Beware, you will be spoiled You will be forever disillusioned with all of the American carriers. Service service service...always with a smile. The flight was over the top. We had a very tight connection in Singapore and there was an agent with a golf cart waiting for us. He communicated with the gate agents on our next flight and they held the gate open within the 10 minute departure time. He let us know our bags would not not make the flight but there would be someone in Male who would coordinate their delivery to us the next day...all true. We were also compensated for our bags not making the connection...wow. Food...amazing. Wine selection...excellent. Lounge in Singapore is fantastic (return trip). My only complaint, and this is pretty minor, I thought the movie selection was very limited for an 18 hour flight.
label: positive

text: OK The Singapore Airlines part was on time and changing aircraft at Singapore to continue to Sydney was very easy; the gate was very close. The internal flights in Australia booked through Singapore Airlines were more worrying because we had no way of checking that they were ok.
label: positive

text: exceptional service getting injured overseas was a nightmare - getting home with singapore airlines made my nightmare fade - the ever helpful staff - superior seating - can we help with anything at all attitude - made what could have been a horror flight into a very pleasant one . need i say any more
label: positive

text: We normally love and prais SQ but this one was simply awful As mentioned we normally enjoy, love and prais SQ. On this particular flight everything was just awful. The crew had zero smiles to offer. One plastic cup of water with no refills during a 2 1/2 hours flight (including wating circles over SIN). Assigned seat for Gold members at the back of the plane and the food was average at best. This flight felt like a charter or low cost airline experience but with the SQ price tag and came with a crew as unfriendly as on ... I've never experienced in 20 years flying SQ.
label: negative

text: Poor service, Liars and generally disgusting Firstly 1 star cause i cant put zero My family and I travelled to the Philippines via Singapore ? To start with a stupid little man split my family up When we realised we talk to a supervisor who said it would be fixed at the boarding gate. It wasn't, we spoke to someone again and we were assured we could sit together ? We couldn't. I took it upon myself to sit with my family, the guy who's seat I took was very understanding and sat in my seat. That was just the 1st leg. We had similar problems on the 2nd leg. I was not expecting to be blatantly lied to not once not twice but 3 times. We won't be using this s##t show airline ever again. I was full of praise for this airline before covid. Now the food I wouldn't feed to a dog. How times and standards have changed, not for the better. There are plenty of choices out there do yourself a favour and steer clear of these people.
label: negative

text: Experience flying Singapore airways Service was reasonable. Vegetarian meal was of a good standard. Hostesses were friendly and efficient. Punctual departure/ arrival times
label: neutral

text: Cozy and comfy... Pros: Had to travel to the Netherlands for a business trip. I have travelled on SQ before but that was a number of years ago. I was pleasantly surprised by the content provided on the in-flight entertainment . Lots of movies; new and classics . Music content is enormous with a broad genre. There is also a vast selection of different news & documentaries available. Not to mention games for the kids, too... Food; as with past experiences; is very tasteful & well portioned. Cons: - Was charged data roaming on the flight. Not the fault of the airline's; but would definitely appreciate more prominent "data on board" signage or even video instructions via the entertainment portal. - Being an audio engineer, this is a pet peeve.... The quality of the provided ear buds is pathetic. In the words of Caroline & Don Davies - "If bad sound is fatal, audio would be the leading cause of death" - And I certainly wouldn't want that... ;-)
label: positive

text: extremely poor service for disabled passengers Extremely poor wheelchair service for disabled elderly mother who travelled with this airline recently.
label: negative

text: Fly with Singapore Airlines This was a great flight with service plus and the seating room is fabulous. You. Get full service with drinks, food, and no extras for luggage of 30 kilos each. I would flight again with This airlines as they are service plus
label: positive

text: Best in class very attentive Service, excellent selection of food and beverages, really flat and comfortable bed, low noise level
label: positive

text: Enjoyable trip. Very pleasant flight, great service from cabin crew, food very good and choice available. Comfortable seat and leg room. Wide choice of entertainment during flight. Would wholeheartedly recommend this airline.
label: positive

text: Best airline for long haul flight This was my first flight with Singapore airlines but I confirm the positive remarks previous passengers have shared. By far it is the best airline!
label: positive

text: Premium service Flight on time. The service on board is excellent. Stewardess are nice and helpful The food was correct. Very good choice of movies and entertainment
label: positive

text: Brisbane to Singapore and return Have recently flown to Singapore and then on to Hong Kong to join a cruise back to Singapore,usually when flying to Europe I fly economy to Singapore then on to Europe Buisness . this time as was only to Singapore then on to Hong Kong and back by Ship I chose to do Premium Economy both ways and was not disappointed in any way . The seats are comfortable and sufficient leg room and only having 3 rows in the cabin made it feel like your own private plane .and the in flight service could not be faulted including noise reduction head sets . Will definitely do Singapore Airlines Premium Economy from now on.
label: positive

text: On a trip to Vietnam via Singapore Great Airline . Nice new 787 . Clean , comfortable, quite, Hi tech large windows with electronic darkening systems. Movies all in HD on large screens. Great food and service Paid a bit more to fly Singapore but it was worth it.
label: positive

text: I took a flight from Bangkok to Tokyo via Singapore and was told that one of my luggages could not be placed on the flight from Singapore to Tokyo. The ground staff in Tokyo explained that it was because the flight I chose had a short connection time. No, no, no, this flight was recommended by Singapore Airlines when I made the reservation, rather than my choice. She said the package was late because I chose it? I have never heard such a nonsensical shifting of responsibility before. Moreover, the ground staff explained that Singapore Airlines is not responsible for checked baggage and that this was agreed upon at the time of booking. Well, this is what I call an irresponsible handling. She further explained that the package would not arrive at my place only after 2 days. In Japan, logistics is so advanced that it is normal for a package to arrive on the same day as the shipping date if it is in Tokyo. When I pointed this out, they finally arranged for same day delivery after a 30 minute wait. In other words, it was Singapore Airlines' fault, but they would not make the best arrangements unless we told them. However, the next day I received another call. They don't know why, but I was told that my luggage was not loaded on the scheduled flight at Changi Airport again and did not arrive in Tokyo the next day. Will my package ever be delivered? I have found this company to be mismanaged, irresponsible, and responsible without any shame. Please be careful, everyone.
label: negative

text: Good as it always is with Singapore Airlines Good as it always is with Singapore Airlines. Planes are clean, Flight attendants are prompt, friendly & professional. Flight was on time.
label: positive

text: Shocking, Nightmare & Worst service I've experience, worse than budget airlines Nightmare transfer followed by god damn aweful customer service on the flight. Experience began from leaving the aircraft. Despite the flight being later arriving and knowing I had a tight connection, I say this to everyone now. There is no assistance for business class customers transferring. You'd think the airline's operations team would pick up business class customers coming in late and on tight transfer windows. Nope nothing at the gate. I got a bus to terminal 2, then got lost nearly went through immigration. Asked for help and directions and got to the gate as the flight was boarding. On board, well again, the food was average and service was shocking. Having run to catch this connection, when dinner was being served, asked for a beer and wine to go with my dinner. The beer to quench the thirst and wine because I love my vino. Was told will bring to you shortly sir. Nothing. Asked again. Nothing. Asked again nothing. 3 times and 20mins later. All too late. Sat there thinking should I travel Singapore airlines as this is some of the worst service I've had, similar to one of the budget airlines. but not they are actually better. Singapore Airlines will fail as a business if this is the level of service offered to premium customers.
label: negative

text: Mix of feelings SQ operates different types of aircrafts. Perth to Singapore was A350, its newest fleet that absolutely a great one. Quite, spacious and modern. Comfortable flat seat with great entertainment - big screen HD display and noise reduction headset. The food and wine were brilliant. Singapore to Jakarta however operated older B777 version. Limited inclined seat and the seat next to me did not even operate properly. Something has jammed the motor, poor customer. The flight was rather short and inflight service was not as expected. The lounge in Changi was top notch, it helped for a couple hours of lay over. In conclusion, SQ is great when you ride newer or latest version aircraft and for longer leg.
label: positive

text: Flight on SQ 712 The flight was pleasant and the meal was tasty. The crew was friendly. This was only a short flight. Luckily a wheelchair was available on arrival in Bangkok and a long walk was made easy for my wife. The wheelchair attendant even took her out to the taxi, great service.
label: positive

text: Worst food served During my recent trip using silk air; had the worst food experience ever on airlines. Uncooked raw chicken meat served; will be the last time i book silk air flight. Ensure when you book singapore airlines you dont get any partner airlines.
label: neutral

text: World's No. 1 Airline for 2019 ... I think not! Having just flown 4 flights with Singapore Airlines (1/ Melbourne – Singapore, 2/ Singapore – Colombo, 3/ Colombo – Singapore & 4/ Singapore – Melbourne) I'm flabbergasted how this airline, across varied award systems, ranks #1 for 'World's Best Airline'. I flew Economy, so my review relates to that section of the cabin only. Also, my review is for 'in-flight' service only, and nothing 'on ground'. (The check-in process at Changi Airport is outstanding – seamless, and so technologically advanced!). Across all flights, the 'welcome aboard' by cabin crew lacked warmth and sincerity (instead is seemed a 'process' and/or 'obligatory procedure'). Having headsets available at the cabin door was both helpful and convenient, and the choice of 3 different styles of ear attachments a very nice touch (ticks there!). Warm (bordering on hot) refresher towels were handed out shortly after take-off (possibly the highlight of the flight!). Then came the menu. Where was the water/juice and mini packet of rice crackers/nuts before meal service? Also, where was the 'comfort pack' (nothing received on the Melb-Sing flight, but we did receive one on the Sing-Melb flight – just socks and toothbrush/toothpaste – no eye mask, and the little bag is very disposable (certainly not reusable like other airlines!). The pillow (left sitting on the seat with blanket) on all flights was filthy (both sides badly stained, as well as having food remains of previous passengers!). Overall, the food was absolutely appalling! The quality of airline food has come a long way over the last decade (or more), but the food we received on all flights was like that of yesteryear! The 'Appetiser' on all 4 flights was tin tuna salad – bound together with a glob of thick mayonnaise, and sitting on either limp lettuce or some shards of cabbage to represent coleslaw (I'm speechless, and some variety would be nice!). Dessert on the Melb-Sing flight was a mini/mini tub of ice-cream (how exotic!) Incomprehensible though, it was handed out 'immediately' after you'd received your meal tray (you hadn't even had time to finish the Appetiser, let alone Main Meal – so by the time you ate the ice-cream, it was 'cream' – almost a drink rather than a dessert!). I can only assume the Hosties were eager to return to their galley and relax – they hardly walked through the cabin offering water, etc, outside of scheduled service times. There was no cheese & crackers with the dinner meal – just Appetiser, Main Meal, Mini Bread Roll & Butter, Dessert & Tea/Coffee. Had the meal at least been appetising, the small amount of food could be forgiven. The Meal Cart carried no spirits (just soft drink, juice, tea/coffee, beer & wine). No separate Beverage Cart followed after the Meal Cart. If you asked for a spirit the Hostie replied "I'll have to get that for you later, sir/madam". The Hostie did return quite promptly (within 5 minutes), but just with a 3/4 full glass (plastic cup) of what you had requested – no mini bottle of spirit, plus can of soft-drink (so that you could mix the beverage to your own liking). The 'Refreshment' served on the Melb-Sing flight was Turkish Pide. I've never eaten anything quite like it! I love Turkish Pide, but this was a doughy, stodgy, tasteless oblong piece, with more-or-less no topping/filling (not sure if it was mean to be an 'open' or 'closed' pide). Breakfast on the Sing-Melb flight was most unpalatable, but I ate it because I was hungry. It consisted of Fresh Fruit, Bread Roll, Butter & Jam & Tea Coffee. The fresh fruit was frozen – it was 2 cubes of watermelon (more seeds than flesh), 1 cube of pineapple & 1 cube of papaya. There was also a horrible mini-muffin (in addition to the mini bread roll) on the tray – bonus! No tub of yoghurt, no egg omelette or egg quiche. What a pathetic breakfast! The Hosties were pleasant enough, when you saw them – though they did seem a little disorganised and confused during service. The in-flight Entertainment System received much hype. Personally, I didn't find it any better than other airlines. Navigating the system on the Sing-Colombo / Colombo-Sing flights was cumbersome. Overall, I was very underwhelmed with the service, and extremely disappointed with the food. I last flew with Singapore Airlines many years ago – when they were truly a wonderful airline! I was looking forward to flying with them again, but have been left feeling extremely disappointed. I have my preferred airline, and it's certainly not Singapore Airlines!
label: neutral

text: Red-eye flight DEL-SIN Departing 945 pm Delhi time. Boarding was a little chaotic, with Krisflyer Gold and Premium Economy boarding at the same line as Economy - don't know why they didn't queue separately. Flight was on A380 version 1, which has Suites in front, premium economy in the middle, and economy in the rear (both lower and top deck). Flight appaeared to be completely full. Crew were patient and friendly despite the normal chaos from an entirely full flight. As usual, a hot towel service pre-departure. We departed on time, and meal service started almost immediately - again, the crew coped pleasantly with somewhat demanding passenger load. IFE was the older KrisWorld system without touch screen, but adequate. Seats had adjustable headrests, and legroom was adequate. Cabin was noisy, though, as there were quite a few young children travelling with the ensuing noisy crying this sometimes entails. It was difficult to get enough sleep in Economy. Just prior to landing (about 40 mins), attendants did a quick sweep through the cabin to offer refreshments, which was much appreciated. Arrival on time, and with a very quiet landing. It was difficult to get enough rest, but at the end of the day, this was a reflection of the passengers and full load rather than SQ. If you are lucky to get a much emptier plane (e.g. my Vistara outward flight), you may have a better experience. Nonetheless, score is for the product, not the experience. I have to say, though, that this leg was much more expensive than Vistara, so it depends whether you feel the premium is worth it.
label: positive

text: Vintage fleet The standard legroom is average, too small for me, 6'3", so I'm forced to pay for a seat big enough for a tall westerner. This means I sit alongside the bassinet seats with the screaming babies, will receive service last, am unlikely to have a meal choice, or time for a second drink, and I can't check in online, or through the machine as they have to see that I'm physically able, so I have to que up to check-in, and yes, I have to pay extra for all this when flying SQ. On this particular trip, the USB port on my seat didn't work, so I couldn't charge my noise-cancelling headset to drown out the screaming babies, and the in-flight entertainment system is so old that when I missed some dialog through the SQ earpiece (no noise-cancellation technology here) then tried to rewind a couple of seconds, it jumped back 8 minutes, so I had to sit through all that again. It's first generation, I've not seen these for some years now. The attendant offered a change of seat, but having paid extra for the babies and legroom, that seemed somewhat unappealing. They also have no air control at the seat, they just hope that all 200 passengers want exactly the same temperature, somewhat ambitious during boarding, where many are hot from the process, and the cabin seems hotter. The attendant told me that the cabin is set for the "ideal cabin temperature", and I remain unsure how this was intended to solve the problem. On the positive side, it was clean, and we didn't crash, which was great, but in the 21st century, we expect a little better than SQ currently provide, especially when they financially discriminate against tall people.
label: neutral

text: It's a great way to fly Great service, on time flight, great seats and bed for a long haul flight. People are friendly and helpful. Just love flying Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: More great service Staff very accommodating as usual. Thanking them in advance with a small set of sweets, got my seat partner and I: 1. Our meal right with the business class folks 2.extra visits with wine, soft drinks etc. 3. Always a smile and asking if we needed anything each time they passed us. I have flown them several times, and have always thought that no one thanks them in a special way ( albeit very small) for their top notch service.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Bangkok return. In the past 10 year or so, we can clearly see many once premium airlines in the world have to resort to cost cutting, due to keen competition from low cost carriers and many other factors. Haven't not been on economy class of Singapore for quite some time, I decided to try it for it's a short haul flight plus it's price factor was very good this time. The usual high standard of SIA is there with the immaculately groomed kebaya-clad crew, and the good condition of the plane and its amenities etc. Hot towel service is still provided in economy class which is a nice touch. Menu is not given since it's a short sector. Hot drinks, cold beverages and meals are all served in one go, which cuts time and makes good sense. However, one can clearly see some cost cutting with the portion of the meal smaller, and the taste was rather bland and mediocre. Boeing 787 on the way to BKK was a fine plane, except the seat pitch and the aisle are all very narrow. Sat at the aisle, I was constantly bumped by the crew and passengers, there's almost nowhere foe me to hide as I wild be spilling onto my neighbour's space. It's quite frustrating really. Also the tray table is so close to my stomach, it's uncomfortable to say the least. Touch screen AVOD was very good, and pre-ordered duty free was dully delivered without delay. On return, SIA has a good lounge on concourse D of BKK airport, which is very close to the boarding gate, D6 or 7. A330, despite being an older plane, actually offered more seat pitch and slightly more space. No touch screen this time. The catering from BKK was better than from SIN. Overall, SIA still manage to being one of the top airlines in the world despite some cost cutting. Take advantage of their promotions, which can sometimes beat the budget airlines by the hands down.
label: positive

text: My wife and I thought we would treat ourselves to Premium Economy on a recent holiday to Southeast Asia on both the main legs, London to and from Singapore. We usually fly BA premium economy, but this was part of a package and we upgraded the flight. We are in our 70's and cannot cope with economy over 13 hours To say we were disappointed would be an understatement. The only good thing is the seat but the service is very poor. Firstly if you "Book the Cook " a pre-ordered meal, it will be served long before anyone else. The promised champagne and drinks service did not materialise and staff did not curtain off the cabin from economy and were constantly moving through the cabin to serve economy passengers. This is an expensive airline with a lot of online hype about the premium economy service. We were allocated Row 31 which has extra legroom but as the seat plan shows it is right next to the galley and we were constantly disturbed throughout the whole flight. Under no circumstances would I use this cabin again - not a patch on BA
label: negative

text: BKK-SIN-MEL. Of course the service could not be faulted. The main problem we had with our return trip is that we had medium haul 777 and on the way over the much more comfortable long haul product. The medium haul has an inclined bed seat that is far too hard and not at all comfortable whilst the long haul has the fully flat (and deliciously soft) bed- more like a cubby than a bed). It was a bit disappointing. As it was a midnight flight both ways the ides of offering meals just after take off or two hours before landing is a great one but the breakfasts on both trips were terrible on the way home inedible. I know the food in economy is much better.
label: positive

text: Be careful of which aircraft Quite pleased with the seat in business but when it came time to sleep I felt like I was ina third class train compartment. 1 absolutely no privacy 2 bed was at a peculiar angle 3 huge obstruction where your head should go. 4 no bedding, it was all folded into the seat. This was the first business class international flight with no amenities kit. Non in stock in the bathroom either
label: neutral

text: Longest flight Flew from Sydney 3pm to 830pm. Stayed up...ate. read. The lamb josh Rogan was excellent...my wife had salmon. Didn't like it Then took the 1135pm to newark. 18nhrs. Good time to sleep. Read. Watch movies. I suggest download netflix series so u have what u want to watch Biz seats are great. Full sleepers. I think they need better choices of food...especially before u land at 6am. Who wants dumplings or beef satay at 6am. How about eggs. Omelets. Yougart? Staff is always great.
label: positive

text: Business class Slipped in last few years , service still good but a little more stilted and less personal than a few years ago , food too has slipped both in availability and flavour, seats not as clean as could have been , you once got a travel pack . So although I like travelling business Singapore airlines with my partner , it is not as good as it once was
label: neutral

text: Best In Class Customer Service I had the pleasure recently of traveling with Singapore airlines both to and from Sydney, Australia - from Sri Lanka and I have only great things to say about the experience. First of all the staff are phenomenal - truly the most hospitable, customer service oriented air crew I’ve ever had the pleasure to interact with. Second - the cabin. Whilst not ground breaking in any way, it was always clean and tidy - something which is sorely lacking on many long haul flights. Third - the in-flight service - that too was impeccable. Finally - the amenities on board (such as the entertainment and meal options) were top class. I used to be of the opinion that Emirates couldn’t be beaten, but I have definitely changed my mind and will certainly seek to fly with them again and wouldn’t hesitate to recommend them.
label: positive

text: We recently travelled business class return to Auckland via Singapore. We used both the 777 and airbus 380. What an experience! A lovely huge flat bed an excellent choice of food and wines and amazing service. How they managed to provide such excellent food 32000 feet up was mind boggling! The stewards and stewardesses were so helpful and friendly nothing was too much trouble. They may charge more than some other airlines but they are well worth the money. They will always be my airline of choice!
label: positive

text: Singapore to Auckland, paid to fly Air New Zealand. Singapore Airlines was the code share. A little disappointed with the Singapore leg which was the return flight. Business class practically empty so crew were not run off their feet. My husband sitting beside me was served quickly but for some reason I was left waiting on both meal times. He had nearly finished before I was attended to. When the meals arrived (dinner and breakfast) they were the worst I have had on a flight. The seats are quite comfortable and you have privacy the way it is set out. The movies are quite a bit out of date and the screens aren't touch screen so hopefully they will eventually have that.
label: negative

text: Wow! Business is SO different to Economy This was my first time flying business due to a frequent flyer upgrade. It's not just more legroom and better food on-board plus lounge access. The attitude of airport staff and cabin crew is very different too. More friendly and personal. I love flying with Singapore Airlines and am happy with economy - it's safe, confidence inspiring and efficient but the warm personal touch added in the air and in the ground makes the whole experience so much better. $3000 better for a 7 hour return flight? No, I couldn't justify it on my salary but I will do what I can to earn the flybuys points to upgrade again.
label: positive

text: Dreadful customer service. My husband and I were to fly home from Houston on March 24 2020. The flights were ancelled because of Corona virus. We were notified 3 times of replacement flights only to have ach one cancelled literally at the last minute. We appreciate the problems at that time but when we tried to contact the airline we got a standard letter about how busy they were etc and would reply within 3 days. Of four or five emails we sent to them, we still have not had a reply to any one of them. Eventually we booked with American Airlines Houston to Dallas, Dallas to Heathrow, Heathrow to Manchester on May 10. The day before we were to fly the Heathrow to Manchester flight was cancelled so we got a train from Manchester.Trying to get a refund from Singapore Airlines for not using the return half of our tickets has been an example of dreadful customer service. We were obviously naive in thinking we should get half the return fare back each which would have been £240 each. The airline is giving us about half of that each, saying they have charged us for Manchester Airport taxes for landing and leaving and for other "taxes". We did not fly home with Singapore Airlines and we did not fly Heathrow to Manchester as the flight was cancelled. Trying to get an explanation of this has been impossible. We have not yet received any refund. We had also booked and paid for the same return trip to fly in September, these flights have now been cancelled but the promised e-mails to inform us of our options re moving the booking to next year or getting a refund have not yet turned up. Despite a flurry of emails from us to the airline to try and get this resolved we have been unsuccessful and have yet to see any refund. This is very sad as the planes, cabin staff, facilities such as comfort, food and entertainment are excellent and the route is very convenient for the UK to the USA. Just hope nothing goes wrong or you will lose out.
label: negative

text: Amazing SQ The travel with SQ is always amazing. Be it the in flight entertainment or leg space, seats, food. All very good.
label: positive

text: A joy to travel with My third holiday this year to Asia and again I only want to fly with Singapore airlines. I always like to pay a little bit extra to get the baggage, entertainment and food included. The staff are always smiling and helpful, a credit to Singapore airlines. I'm a nervous flyer who suffers from anxiety in general so I need to feel comfortable in my surroundings. I never feel anything but comfortable flying with Singapore. Food was delicious as usual and plenty to fill the space in my belly. The only downside which I always find is the tea is not as hot as I'd like. By the time you add the milk it's lukewarm but apart from that small thing everytime I fly with Singapore airlines it's perfect. I've booked for Phuket next August 2020 with Singapore but my trip back to Glasgow in Mar/April 2020 is with emirates as they fly direct to Glasgow and the cost was much better.
label: positive

text: Disgraceful service I paid an overinflated £1299 for an economy return to Singapore. Singapore Airlines is currently monopolising the market and overcharging customers brutally. Services were abysmal from stepping into the plane. Had to ask for BLANKETS and PILLOWS for a long haul flight. Commencing the 12.5 hours journey, we were offered 1 meal within the first hour after take off then absolutely nothing, not even a beverage for the next 9 hours. Despite being a day flight, they switched off the cabin lights 3 hours after departure trying to get everyone to sleep so they don't have to work. I went to the galley to ask for food and was only offered a fun pack size chips and a glass of coke with ice, not the 330ml can. Never felt so dehydrated boarding a flight. We were then served a small breakfast meal just before landing. Only positive is the inflight entertainment with a wide selection of Western movies. This is the worse Singapore Airlines flight I have been on with all the cost cutting measures yet overinflated flights. They do not deserve the 5 star skytrax rating. It feels more like a budget low cost airline. Absolute shambles.
label: negative

text: good airline my wife and I flew business class overnight form singapore Sleeping arrangements were not great on the plane we were on particularly if above average height Service was quite good and food was very acceptable
label: positive

text: Unsuitable business class beds We pay to go business on long haul so that we can have a bed to sleep. On both legs of our flight we could not use this precious facility. The design made it impossible as I have a knee problem and my husband is recovering from a stroke. We normally fly with another air!ine but decided to try Singapore all I can say is we dread the return journey. We will not use them again. Flights were SQ361 and SQ285. I also found the service at mealtimes haphazard and felt neglected at times. We normally fly Qatar.
label: negative

text: Was Not Served Any Meal! This was our return journey on SQ406 (SIN-DEL) after we arrived in singapore 10 days before with them on SQ401 (which was definitely very good) Things took a U-turn here. The crew onboard was RUDE to the core. No courtsey, Zero on management. We were assigned seats at the end of the plane for 5 people. At the time of serving food, they served the entire plane before us, rows ahead of us and rows behind us, but did not offer us any food. after 2 hours of takeoff, with the entire plane almost dozed off after their meals, they came to us only to inform, they have NO food available. Only 1 tray, that too with Fish. We were with a kid, hungry. Had we have known this, we would have had our own sumptuous meal at the airport. On confronting them, they could only apologize. But somehow managed to get a veg tray from somewhere and we fed the little one. The entire journey we got nothing to eat! We travelled without meals. No food! Nothing, not even asked out of courtsey! 6 hours journey. Surprisingly, they had the audacity to bring in meals twice for someone sitting at the back of our row. They had no remorse. Called them to serve water, they did not bother to serve it. The male staff was rude to the core. Shouts at you for no reasons. It was a nightmare of a flight. 4 of us were hungry throughout and were waiting for this nightmare to end as soon as possible. No channel to complaint to anyone. We could have done online checkin and booked our meals beforehand, but with the child, this is not possible to do so online and we had to do a manual checkin. Was this our fault? I don't think so. I would suggest to everyone, either avoid this particular airline (SQ406) or force them to give you seats in the middle, never at last.
label: negative

text: Flight experience A very long flight with a change at Singapore, modern aircraft with excellent cabin crew and service. Good variety of meals and drinks, clean and spacious aircraft
label: positive

text: Efficient And Thoughtful. A pleasurable return journey that seemed to reduce the 7 hours by at least half. Flight staff were attentive to the needs of all, working efficiently and thoughtfully to ensure each person was catered for. Pillows and rugs were on our seats when we embarked on our flight and if there was anything asked for, it was given with suitable speed and grace. Toilet facilities were clan and tidy throughout both flights. Thoroughly enjoyable and a great way to start and complete a holiday.
label: positive

text: Best Services Air Hostess name Gift was just amazing. Her service was superb. We being jain so didn’t consume much food, she was the 1 who had offer so many other things not also that worked she had bring biscuits too. Her nature was soo cool and calm. I appreciate her the most. And yes last but not the least entire flight service is super good must say. One must travel.
label: positive

text: Excellent but with some flaws Singapore Airlines is still the best airline worldwide, but I have to notice that some service and features have worsened over the years. The seat is now much closer to the next one. It is still a flat bed but you have to slide transversally, with limited space for the legs. The overall comfort is reduced. Menu for dinner and breakfast, appear more limite they used to be.
label: positive

text: Need serious revamp SQ970 As SG grows old, same as its SQ fleet. Need revamp on seat and cleanliness. Plastic will look old in years. Seat looks worn out with no vibrancy. Make sure wipe with wet tissue on joystick before use.
label: neutral

text: Shortest times to and from London Singapore Airlines offer the shortest flight times to and from London/Brisbane. Seating is not the biggest available but is the best priced economy seating available. You are not left trying to sleep in airports. You simply land, change planes and your on your way again. Extremely friendly staff, modern planes and good refreshments. It is for these reasons I go out of my way to use Singapore Airlines where possible.
label: positive

text: Always a Great Way to Fly Singapore to Bangkok onboard Singapore Airlines’ new B787-10 was a very pleasant experience. The hard product was great as the seats boasted great leg room and recline which is good for an aircraft that is servicing regional routes. The service and catering is what one would expect from Singapore Airlines and the Krisworld IFE is also world class with a myriad of entertainment options to chose from. Overall, it was a joy to fly with Singapore Airlines, a great way to fly!
label: positive

text: Book early coming 2024 ticket suppose SQ101 launching Jun’24 and now received email say SQ101 is not operating due to operational reason. They suggest swapping my itinerary to one day earlier to SQ127 result long layover time in SIN and aircraft change from Boeing 737-8 to Boeing 737-800NG for real was ex-MI aircraft.
label: negative

text: First Class Airline! Flew Singapore Airlines ti Rome via Singapore. Went Business Class for the first time ever. What an amazing experience it was. Treated like absolute royalty. Everything from the food, the service, the space, the ease of embarking and disembarking, the lounges etc. Loved every minute of our flight. Staff were friendly and very accommodating to our needs. Singapore Airlines all the way for me!
label: positive

text: Brisbane to Singapore on the late night flight. Boarding was on time and proceeded smoothly, with the usual warm welcome from the cabin crew. The seating and space is good, as expected in premium economy, with ample locker space. The seats include a leg support which is ineffective, and the footrest is not very good. There are no pre-flight drinks, unlike other airlines premium economy, and the water bottles had not been put out into the holders. This seems to be a hit and miss affair, sometimes the bottles in place on boarding, and other times only handed out later. Having water available immediately at least compensates to some degree for the lack of pre-take off drinks. Drinks were served with the meal shortly after take off, and again the Singapore attitude to premium economy is apparent. Food is the same as economy served on plastic trays, with no linen or crockery. Drinks are served in plastic tumblers. SQ advertise champagne available throughout the flight, and serve a good quality champagne, but in a tiny plastic tumbler. Service starts in premium economy, but the same crew carry on through economy, and trays remain until service is complete, and no drink refills are offered in the meantime. Water bottles were eventually handed out after meal service. Singapore economy class service is probably the best in the world, and on this flight the crew were superb. Unfortunately they do not seem to be committed to premium economy, and the enhancements which are provided by their competitors are absent. The primary justification for the “premium” price is space and comfort, which is provided, but having paid a not insignificant premium on the fare the expectation of an improved service level does not seem unreasonable. Overall the flight was good, with a superb crew, and it is unfortunate that SQ do not match other airlines with their premium economy service.
label: positive

text: thanks to singapore airlines for very good service. Very good service & organise arrangement.good food quality and service my first time journey my first time experience is very well .
label: positive

text: Trip to Rome with Singapore Airlines Excellent service from the moment I boarded the plane, Very helpful and welcoming staff. Great service, tasty meals and plentiful. Inflght service very good. Will continue to fly with Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Birthday Pleasure Very convenience and great service flight, updated entertainment from movies, music even the updates tv-serial
label: positive

text: Business trip Business almost always with Singapore airlines Great leg room, food and drinks are good Staff are great
label: positive

text: Flight was amazing. The crew onboard this flight were very welcoming, and gave a good atmosphere. The crew serving my aisle goes by the initial “G”. She was very kind & helpful. Gave my mom a bday cake for a late celebration even though it was just a 1hr 45min flight. Seat is well sanitized, legroom is spacious. IFE onboard has many variety of shows, music, etc. Bathroom always kept clean by crew at all times. & Food was delicious, overall this flight is a 9/10
label: positive

text: my flights were the best i've ever experienced everything about the flights was very good , seating , crew, food. very helpful and respectful. entertainment very good .
label: positive

text: Excellent flight It was a great flight. Flying direct makes so much more sense. Food was good for an airliner food, can be pre-ordered.
label: positive

text: Great cabin crew. Nice flight Travel on Singapore airline on jun. Midnight flight or u call it the red eye flight. Staff very polite and professional no matter what hours in the night. Smooth take off and landing tells alot about the pilot and maintenance of the plane. Great airline
label: positive

text: I flew Singapore Airlines from Manchester to Munich back again. We wanted to experience the Boeing 777-300ER. Although I had already flown it with Singapore Airlines a number of times, my friend hadn't, so we decided to make a weekend of it in Munich. Singapore Airlines in-flight product and service have always been top-notch, and this trip was no exception. Flight on time, the seats are comfortable with generous leg room, IFE is very modern and the refreshment served on this leg is very generous considering the flight time is only an hour and a half. Even the little touches such as menu cards in Economy and hot towel they give you upon boarding, go a long way in making the travel experience that bit more special. What is also great is that Singapore Airlines was our cheapest option to get to Munich, it was cheaper than Easyjet. In sum, a highly comfortable and fun flight with warm and attentive service.
label: positive

text: Amazing airline, will be back again We flew in December 2019 from London to Singapore to Sydney and same journey back home, we had short connecting flights but found the plane always left on time, always arrived before due time, quick to board and quick to exit The plane itself is very spacious, even in Econony, there is a great selection of movies on the monitor in front, the staff are so tentative, always open to helping, always quick to answer any query, great delivering the meals and always offering refreshments. they are brilliant with childrem, always serving them first, the toilets are stocked with toothbrushes, toothpaste, combs, mouthwash Delighted overall and will be back again
label: positive

text: Dubai to Manila via Singapore. First time to fly with SQ. I have very high expectations based on reviews and awards. However, my experience was mixed. Food and IFE were great and amazing. Cabin crew always smiling although it sometimes felt mechanical. Simple kit was also provided. DXB-SIN, B777-300ER was great however SIN-MNL aircraft was old didnt even bother using the IFE. Food served was not clearly advised that one option was spicy. I liked the food however overheard another passenger who doesn't like spicy food said that she wished she was told that it was spicy. Had some interesting encounters with cabin crew. First, a cabin crew used his index finger to give instructions to me instead of open palm/hand. Another cabin crew, during beverage serving, gave me the remaining orange juice as if i have no choice to make. Although both were minor hiccups. One funny incident had me cheering silently for the cabin crew as one of the adult passenger (father of another young adult passenger) kept on answering from the opposite row on behalf of his son every time a cabin crew would ask his son thus making a bit of a minor noise/disturbance. Cabin crew reminded the adult passenger that his son is old enough to answer simple questions. Fierce, i liked it. That's why im raising my overall experience score to 8 because of that.
label: positive

text: Terrible experience Disappointing service, paid for extra legroom seats but they re-allocated them, wouldn't refund. Have made several complaints but no responses, just ignore the customers needs, have vowed never to fly with them again
label: negative

text: Still one of the better economy class seats People often expect to be provided the best service on Singapore Airlines, but feel that its service standards are not met in economy class. Definitely you cannot expect business class service while paying only 20% of the price. Product-wise it is still one of the best economy seats on the Boeing B777 are comfortable, but is smaller than the Airbus A380 on the alternate schedule. When the person in front of you reclines their seat, the back of the seat can get too close for comfort if you are watching a movie. In-flight entertainment is where Singapore Airlines shines, with various genres of movies, TV dramas and variety shows on the menu.
label: positive

text: Ok flight Used Singapore Airlines as they are the only airline to fly direct from Manchester to Singapore. They had also been recommended. Not the cheapest and better than some in terms of leg room and seat comfort. Experience spoilt on this occasion as they ran out of food options and ended up with fish curry as the only meal available for breakfast. Not as good as we had expected.
label: neutral

text: Flight to Singapore and return by Singapore Airlines. Took Singapore airlines and paid £11 each way for ordinary aile seat. Plane was 777_300.i requested for aile seat. Normally it is free..Dont recommend what i had done. The flight was very good,food and service is good. Flight very reliable.i recommend taking Airbus 380. Crew are good, helpful and supportive. Overall.....good
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines, total enjoyment Everything went just smooth; from the excellent service at the check in counter, boarding,the waiting time in Singapore Changi and on the plane, that makes even long hours pass. I am flying with them again in three weeks! Looking forward to that!
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines Business Class Auckland to Singapore was the first of three sectors, second was Singapore to Barcelona, third was Frankfurt to Singapore. The seating was spacious, private and comfortable with ample storage for small items. There was a good selection of movies and TV programmes. The flight attendants were friendly and helpful and the customer service was excellent as always. Their business class is hard to beat.

text: Awesome airline! We have always been happy with Singapore airlines, can’t fault anything! Only give it 4/5 for leg room because I’m 175cm tall, so most economy flights are a bit spaceless, glad 8m not 6ft +!
label: positive

text: best airlines we booked flight for mum to singapore. in aug economy class. before entering in to flight we just un sure about set conditions but after . enter in the flight i seen the best hospitality in my life the set we so comfortable and the food was also verry good. we just love there service.

text: Prestige in the sky I always dream to flight with Singapore Airlines because it scream so luxurious and when I did it, I am agree 100%. Even when my schedule was not perfect (has to transfer in the middle of the night and walk 30 minute in Changi Airport because the Skytrain was not operating) but the services really make it up all the hustle.

text: Sao Paulo to Dublin via Munich on Lufthansa booked with Singapore Airlines redemption miles. A refund was agreed upon 3 months ago. The airline is ignoring requests for a date when the tax refund will be paid.
label: negative

text: A great flight from Singapore to Sydney Was transferred from a Scoot flight to this Singapore Airlines charter flight due to capacity constraints. This flight was on an older B777 aircraft but it was a fantastic flight back to Sydney. The crew was very friendly even on a very early morning (2.30am) flight. Plenty of leg room and comfortable seating and very easy to sleep. Breakfast service was great. Overall a great flight.

text: Singapore to London Heathrow on 17th April 2014 at 11.30pm. The best seats on any airline would be in a child free cabin having just returned on another flight having to endure 13 hours listening to a screaming child I think all airlines should ensure children/infants are in a separate cabin.
label: negative

text: Great Onboard really crappy pre flight expereince Pre flight experience is a total mess. Lounges are crowded, dirty tables and empty food containers. It almost felt like I had come to free buffet and riots could break out at any tine. If you expect premium pre flight experience Singapore airlines has totally lost it. Same applied to pre boarding experience (maybe my exp is limited to flights to India) The staff is rude and ill manners and security and boarding is like herding cattle in a barn. The holding area is cramped with barely 1 seat for 3 passengers. I had heard a lot about SIngapore airlines and the experience. This is definitely closer to the worst performing airlines and not best. On-board product was great no issues with that
label: neutral

text: London Heathrow to Singapore Changi onboard Singapore Airlines A380 on the top deck in business class. Seat width very large and about 1.5x bigger than BA's offering on their A380. Seat turned over to create a proper bed with white cotton sheet and duvet and two pillows. TV big and movies were the usual Hollywood classics and recent releases. Dinner was superb - chicken satay canapé followed by crab salad and then duck rice for main with a dessert and fruit / cheese platter to follow. Where BA had the edge over Singapore was in the wine and champagne selection - BA offering 4 champagnes over Singapore's mere one champagne (Tattingger 2007). Also Singapore gave no amenity bag and instead gave the standard economy class sock, eye shade and slippers - I've had better amenity kit in economy in Qatar Airways, Vietnam Airlines, BA to name a few. The magazine selection was poor as well with no suitable magazines for men under 35 years like myself. Service was tip top with attention on tap and lots of pleasing to my requests for their fine TWG tea selection. All in all a much better seat than BA given Singapore do a 1-2-1 config on business vs BA cramped 2-3-2. Would choose Singapore Airlines again so long as price was similar to BA.
label: positive

text: Great airline, comfy seats, awesome food. This is the first time I have ever flown Singapore Air, and it was amazing. The quality of service that we received, even in economy, was phenomenal. You get hot towels to wash your hands/face with at the start of the flight. I am very picky with plane food, but the food that was on my Singapore Airlines flight was amazing. They were very efficient, especially with boarding and unloading the plane. Overall, was one of the best airlines I have ever been on and I will be booking with Singapore Airlines again!!
label: positive

text: Efficient and polite service economy flight Excellent experience flying economy class with Singapore Airlines. Extremely polite serving staff, very attentive to your needs, flying in big 380 plane, timely flight, good mileage points.
label: positive

text: Excellent service and comparatively spacious seating Singapore Airlines impressed us with the extremely innovative flight safety announcement on the video screen. Very imaginatively done video! The seats in economy were reasonably spacious. Food was good. But for Indian vegetarians, prior intimation is advised. Did not like the airline serving drinks in Paper cups but other than that, satisfied with the taste and variety of food. Amazingly pretty air hostesses added to the charm of the flight 😊
label: positive

text: Awesome Service and Hospitality I was very happy traveling via SIA with kids especially. Their service level is first class and for those who are flying with kids in a long flight... don’t worry, they give priorities to kids. They are very fast and efficient. Great crews. Basically, it was an extremely pleasant flight.
label: positive

text: Business Class Superb Not often does the opportunity arise to fly international business class, the service is excellent, meals are perfect and the new seats are superb. Usually fly economy, but even then the service is always warm and friendly. From check in to exit, everything is very smooth
label: positive

text: Service par excellence Our last flight of our holiday, SQ322 Singapore to London. An organised airport is probably the best way to describe Changi. Just two people ahead of us at check in; extremely efficient and polite staff there to help with the process. Had already been to the GST refund service, which, if GST refundable items are in your hold luggage and there’s a spot inspection, must be done prior to check in. Security check was slightly different than in Europe, as in the physical body scan and cabin bag search is done at the boarding gate. Once thru passport inspection, it’s into the retail, lounges and dining experience that puts Changi above so many other airports. Singapore Airlines Business lounge was pretty hectic, as usual. Decent variety and quality of food and drinks. Went thru for boarding as soon as flight showed as it’s quite a long trek to the B gates where flights to the UK usually depart. Absolute chaos at the gate; staff seemed over critical and pedantic. Lots of agitated parents, sweating travellers and crying children for the 23.45 departure. Once onboard, in to the upper deck business class area, it seemed a different world. Calmness and serenity oozed from every smile and gentle word of the cabin team. No sooner were we all seated, hot towels to all to remove the sweaty stress of check in and boarding. As soon as they were cleared away, our pre take off champagne or soft drinks arrived. No delay in takeoff, we were soon airborne. Next came the dinner orders, had we preordered? Oh yes, just to confirm that you still require the lobster Thermidor? White wine with that? Champagne? Red? Soft drinks? Nothing was ever too much effort or a problem for this team. They all worked so hard, so together, so effortlessly. Whilst eating a superb lobster Thermidor, a film from the huge selection was in order, along with a glass or two of bubbles. Meal cleared and following a quick visit to the restroom, I came back to my seating pod to find that my lay flat bed had been prepared for me, complete with duvet and pillows. Plenty of leg room and could lay 100% flat! During our 14 hour flight back to London the cabin team were constantly on the go. Had a good three or four hours solid sleep before being shaken from our slumbers by air turbulence. Shortly afterwards, once back on a level flight path, we (husband and I) were approached by the cabin team, all smiles, despite the hour. ‘We believe it’s your wedding anniversary today’ they said in unison. ‘Sorry we could not upgrade you to first, but as you know (well, I did as I’d tried for the surprise upgrade at check in) all the suites are full, but as it’s been our pleasure to serve you on this flight, we have a bottle of champagne from first, plus a few gifts for yourselves and your grandson who you spoke about earlier.’ We were then given a carrier bag of goodies along with a beautiful card and bottle of champagne. Breakfast followed shortly after accompanied by our champagne, then our decent into London. An amazing flight and excellent service Thank you all!
label: positive

text: Singapore to Bali. Great service, though there was no food choice when the service reached our seat as the other main dish was completely served. Plenty of movie selections with the latest hits.
label: positive

text: Best Airlines Great hospitality. They provided one blanket and also a small pillow for comfort. There was port for charging device as well as individual screens for entertainment. I watched bollywood movie on the plane. You can listen to songs also. They provided yummy dishes with our country flavour. The whole journey was awesome. 👌
label: positive

text: Wonderful in flight staff and services What a wonderful ppl lively food extremely comfortable seats/bed. For it's Business class lounge and free foot message 7 🌟 to Singapore airlines. Though Singapore airlines Economy class is also amazingly comfortable. Food it's presentation all was just perfect
label: positive

text: MEL to CPH Business Should be 5 stars for the excellent attentive service received by staff on board the MEL to SIN leg(One attendant in particular, Soleha is the best Ive ever met). Missing the last star in this review however due to the following. The red wine selection seemed to have slipped, the return trip a month later still had the same entertainment already previously viewed on the way there and lastly the Changi business lounge is getting far too overcrowded when it gets to the point where 3 people cannot fit a spot to sit together. Oh, another useful tip. Their partner airline SAS do NOT give you an empty seat in the middle of 3 in business as most other European short business flights between countries do. They put 3 passengers in a row together and you need to move yourself after takeoff.
label: positive

text: Good Experience with SQ we got the good rate from travel online in Indonesia, the flight was nice, the aircrew was nice, seat was fine, the food was delicious and they gave us Ice Cream. no delay and good location on CGK and HKG airport. we transited on Changi Airport
label: positive

text: We flew Singapore Air;ine (SIA) for the first time. The checkin and boarding was very smooth. The seat was quite large and comfortable. The cabin crew were very nice and friendly. The food on BKK-Singapore route was quite tasty and on Singapore -Seoul route was excellent. They provided Free WiFi on both route wghich make us very happy. The entertainment (Movie, TV and Music) was great. This was one of our most enjoyable flights.
label: positive

text: My son and I flew Business class Singapore to Shanghai in April. The Business lounge in Changi is OK, but nothing to write home about. We ordered ' book the cook' option, one chicken Brest and one Steak dish. Upon boarding we were greeted by a very cheerful crew, the flight manager already knew my name without looking at any list. The seat was incredibly wide,but quite hard in my opinion. My tail bone tells me immediately, as I was injured in a ski accident, and I can't sit in a regular economy seat more than 2 hours. I was a bit disappointed, as Aeroflot Business seat from Moscow to Shanghai was much softer and pampering. After take off I went to the bathroom, and upon my return I found the satay dish awaiting me. I only enjoyed the chicken stick. Then no service for almost 45 min, without one cabin staff in sight .Slowly the magic and excitement were wearing off. Eventually one showed up and asked me if I didn't like it. I said I only liked the chicken and she offered me some more, nice gesture, but I declined. There were maybe 15 passengers in Business class,that I believe can fit 50-60 passengers. Not a tough flight for the crew. Then came a green salad, very average,and then my book the cook meal showed up, which was good. As I like to drink with my main meal, and my glass was almost empty, as it Lasted me through the salad and the Satay, it was time to refresh my glass,but not such offer. I buzzed the cabin crew,and asked for another glass of drink. I kept enjoying my meal awaiting my drink that never showed up. I buzzed the crew again,and this time the flight manager showed up, I asked to have my drink if possible with my meal not with the dessert. The Coke showed up in 5 seconds. Then came the dessert, a dish with Ice cream, no choices, and a Fruit basket, the most basic desert cart I ever saw. At that point I was already regretting the huge amount of money invested in trying to experience the top notch Business class. Then I wanted to rest,but the crew must turn your seat upside down, very weird idea,and even with the thin mattress ,it was far from a pampering bed.IF you feel like sitting down again,you have to call the F/A to flip it over to a seat..Personaly I prefer control of my lying situation, rather than calling the FA. No amenity kit distributed, but I heard that they pass by with a choice of amenities that you may find necessary for your trip - no such basket was offered. My 14 yo son told me after the meal that he still felt hungry. I called his flight attendant who seemed amused by my statement and said she will 'take care of him' - she brought him a small pack of nuts. So much for generosity. At Aeroflot, upon hearing that my son was still hungry (growing boy,) brought him a pasta casserole from Business class. Free WiFi to Business class was a great idea. We arrived in Shanghai wondering was that Singapore Airlines we heard so much about? We really felt disappointment. Nothing really bad, just a very very ordinary trip.
label: negative

text: SQ177 in Economy. Check in at SGN fast. Staff polite, and courteous. They acknowledged I checked in Online, checked my Bag through, instructed me to watch my Bag go through security, and thanked me. Proceed to the gate. We had a Gate Change, and the announcement was clear. However when boarding commenced, Announcements were not clear, and extremely difficult. Volume was low, or speakers were out of service. Boarded, with a friendly, warm crew welcoming us aboard. Overhead storage not available, so had to use 3 rows ahead of me. Pushed back, and got on the Runway. Seem to sit for a while, ready for take. Took off, and right into Turbulence, so limited services. Eventually served a Meal, and Drink. I had the Fish, and Potatoes. As the Captain announced descend, Crew expeditiously coming around to collect Trays, and Trash. Smooth landing, and arrived into Changi T3, with the friendly crew wishing me well.
label: positive

text: Korean Air LH and EK are better than SQ in Economy class I flew one way flight ticket for $880 USD Economy Lite from BKK Thailand to JFK New York City via Germany. It was average than my expectations based on facts: Seat issue: If you are with Economy Lite ticket, your seat is guaranteed in middle row or at worst - in end of economy class cabin. I flew in middle row and in end of Economy class cabin. Economy seat was uncomfortable at A350-800 for 13-14 hours. Painful ride with the uncomfortable hard seat. My legs had spasms and my back was sore and stiff after the poor seat cushion on SQ flight A-350-800 Singapore Airlines to New York City. Koreain Air, LH, and EK would treat you better with seat options that it depends on cost of the ticket and class you paid for. I paid $880 for one way - a long international flight with SQ. Meal Issue: Koreain Air, LH, and EK meals in economy cabin are superior and best quality than Singapore Airlines poor quality meal. I was shocked that SQ provided me a dinner meal: potato with previously frost green beans without a dessert. No fruits and no desserts at all on 13-14 hours international long haul flight. I miss Korean Air, LH, and EK economy class and liked their meals so much delicious not SQ. I asked Singapore Airlines crew members of the flight from SIN to FRA. They said that they do not have any dessert and no fruits. During snack break and down service - there was available only mini potato chips and mini ice cream. Service Quality Issue: Singapore Airlines crew often missed or skipped my requests for 4th time during flights BKK-SIN and SIN-DUS. I noticed SQ lacked punctuality and SQ has flaws with sloppy service that I noticed and observed. I requested for water, snack, and coke. They ignored my requests and continued to smile politely. My fellow passengers were puzzled and they witnessed. LH, Korean Air, and EK crew members are very punctual and attentive with each passenger's request. Economy class overall experience is impressive and wow factors are offered only with international flights on Korean Air, Emirates, and Lufthansa. Do not waste your money for SQ Economy Class trip! There you would not get any better treatment or best experience. Singapore Airlines earned an award only for a business class product and business class service thats all. It is just speculative hype by SQ based on my past experience in economy class. Nothing impressive with SQ Economy class and its service. Fly with Korean Air, Lufthansa, and Emirates instead of Singapore Airlines.
label: neutral

text: Flight from Stockholm to Moscow. Swift boarding. Clean and bright economy class cabin, very comfortable seat. Impeccable service. Very tasty and lavish (for such a short flight) breakfast (s. photo). No wonder the airline keeps being ranked so high in all reviews. Overall impression: very impressive flight with a pleasant aftertaste. Bravo!
label: positive

text: MEAL IN THE FLIGHT ONLY ONE CHOICE AVAILABLE The meal in the flight only one choice available which is BIBIMBAP. My son which don't eat spicy food and also don't like to eat BIBIMBAP have no choice to choose other meal. He did not eat the flight meal.
label: neutral

text: Service on decline Travelling in Singapore Airlines for more then 3 decades, it is noticeable deterioration of service in certain flights. While aircrafts are newer and well maintained, particularity in over night flights the service is not keeping up with other improvements by Singapore Airlines.
label: neutral

text: Jogjakarta to Amsterdam via Singapore. Good aircraft and amazing cabin crew service. I got a special assistant because I flew myself carrying 1 baby aged 6 months and 1 child aged 4 years. it was amazing for me to feel service in the air that I had never received before. While I was carrying a baby, there was a cabin crew coming to calm down my daughter with earplugs. Then came the cabin crew carrying candy and feeding my child. then came the cabin crew again carrying cookies and finally there was another cabin crew carrying some pillows and putting them on my child's back. Thanks for that amazing service.
label: positive

text: Expensive Customer Service If you have to contact this airline by mobile, be warned they will sting you big time for your call. All contact numbers are 08 numbers and you will never get through to a representative in less than 10 minutes. I have had to call them three times over a booking and have been charged 55p a minute each time. Yet another airline rip off.
label: negative

text: Flying to Asia We have flown with many different airlines (ANA, Korean, Hong Kong, China Southern, Sri Lanka Airlines, VietJet) going to Asia and I have to say that our experience with Singapore Airlines has been the best so far. The seats are more comfortable and you can recline more than other airlines. The flight attendants are extremely nice, Korean's were really good as well.
label: positive

text: London to Singapore. Check in area was chaotic to say the least and I had to label my own baggage prior to drop off. The Kris Lounge is a shared lounge and it was bursting at the seems, basically no seating, therefore had to go to local coffee shop. The service onboard was not what I expected from a 5 Star airline like Singapore Airlines. I would put the service down to being pretty poor and with an old aircraft to match. The only really good thing I can say was that the Wi-Fi was good. I expected much more from Singapore Airlines considering they are 5 Star and have recently won the coveted Skytrax Award for best airline.
label: negative

text: We flew from Singapore to Manchester on Sunday 28th October and can honestly say it was the best economy flight we have travelled on. Very comfortable seats tasty food and snacks Exceptionally clean toilets and most of all a great cabin crew.
label: positive

text: Comfortable seats - great inflight service This was a long flight - 16 hours - and it was a great flight. Good food served at reasonable intervals. Lots of movies. In premium economy, the seats were roomy (wide) and had plenty of leg room. We had plenty of storage space for our carry on. The bathrooms were kept clean and we were able to get up and walk around periodically. The only slight downside was infrequent beverage service - recommend taking your own water bottle.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Tokyo Narita. Premium Economy Class Seats: Wider and well-cushioned. However, we were disappointed with quality. The buttons for recline and the foot rest was not working well. We actually had to force the foot rest out. This certainly isn't expected for Singapore Airlines (ANA on the contrary had everything in tip top condition). Entertainment: One of the airlines with the most decent entertainment. However, my headset was faulty. It was replaced but again, not expected. It should have been checked.
