Food: I used "Book the Cook'. I expected the food to be better but found it so-so. Cabin crew took a really long time to clear the food. When I tried to return it, I was flatly rejected, the crew told me to wait. The entire process from start to end took 2 hours! It was crazy! SQ 633 was way much more efficient. Crew was pretty cheerful and the crew made the effort to confirm our meals with us before they took off. They surprised us with an anniversary cake as well. We like the customer engagement they provided. SQ 12 on the other hand appeared grouchy and unhappy to me - no confirmation on the food was made and they took so long to finish the meal service. Premium Economy has a cabin on its own. However, on both flights, the curtains were not drawn. We had passengers from Economy trying to sneak into the Premium Economy seats or use the toilets in Business Class. There were also kids (in Economy class) walking to and fro the Premium Economy cabins. This should have been controlled as my husband was trying to do some work on the plane and I was trying to rest but could not. While I try to be understanding on young children in the plane, it is definitely awful to have a child crying/screaming for 6 hours on a 7 hours flight. What made it worse was that seats with bassinets in the Economy class were directly behind the Premium Economy class. Overall, we were not very impressed with the quality of Premium Economy Class. Singapore Airlines have always been expected to be premium (along the lines with ANA/Qatar/Emirates). For the amount of money spent, I would very much go for ANA.
label: negative

text: First time on Premium economy and with Singapore for some considerable time. We were travelling from Syd via Singapore to NYC. We had a 12 hr stop (air side) in the Aerotel at Changi between flights. The flight from Syd left pretty much on time on SA's A350-900 for the 8hr trip. Premium economy is set up 2 x 4 x 2 and we had seats 32A and 32C for this leg on the left side of the aircraft. The in flight service was pretty much as we would have expected and hoped for - excellent. We were provided with hot towel before a small glass of sparkling wine (new for us). The seating was a step up from economy being slightly wider and with the increased pitch and recline (plenty of YouTube reviews of this). The trays were stowed in the centre partition between the seats that prevented this from being used as might with an economy seat - but wasn't an issue. We took advantage of the Book the Cook option for meal selection, which was quite extensive (but not available for all services). This meant stewards checked and confirmed our orders and we were served early. The food was overall very good on this flight and they provide you with a full meal service, that is individual small salad, separate mains, dessert, condiments, full steel cutlery, ceramic or porcelain dishes, water, cloth napkins and tray liner. Could not complain and food quality was very good. Qantas could learn a thing or three from SA regarding full carrier meals services as their standards have dropped significantly in recent years to a single one dish type of offering. (at least in their economy class) Additional drinks including tea/coffee, wine, beer or spirits were service just after meals were delivered and on request throughout the flight. Some additional snacks were available from the galley or on request. Most importantly the flight was smooth and seamless as was the on time and safe landing at Changi. It was a bit of a treat having experienced Premium economy and would recommend trying this if able to do so particularly for longer flights. We found the 8+ hrs to Singapore wasn't to much to manage in economy. However of our 4 flights despite being great was probably 4th in overall comfort and experience. Flight 2 - SQ024 - Singapore to NYC - A350-900 We had the 18+ hr flight from Changi to JFK in NYC coming up (which is currently the longest commercially operated flight). This flight only caters for 2 seating classes, Business and Premium economy there is no economy available on this flight due to logistical considerations and overall much less passenger load. We were seated in 39A and 39C for the flight. Again departure was pretty much on time and we set off on this epic journey. The staff were excellent and again we had opted for the Book the Cook menu selection for some of our meals. We were very fortunate with this flight path that passed over Alaska/north pole region and had fantastic views over the upper Rocky Mountains and skirted by Mt McKinley (highest peak in N. America). The 18+ hours passed relatively easily and Singapore Airlines on board entertainment suite provided ample selection to keep you amused. Additional drinks etc were offered throughout the flight. JFK arrival late afternoon/early evening was on time.
label: positive

text: LHR-SIN. I couldn't book the open-jaw route I wanted on SQ's awful website so booked it as a codeshare with Virgin Atlantic which made online check-in impossible - VS site said the operating airline was someone else and SQ said the booking had been made through a different airline. I phoned VS and they were worse than useless SQ at least sympathised and the gent I spoke to said he would send a message to LHR requesting the seat I was hoping for. I was one of the last to check-in and indeed a window on the left had been saved for me so kudos for that. Boarding was OK although the cabin crew in my area didn't speak much English which complicated some pax requests for reseating. First meal service was OK lots of movies but not many good ones seat comfortable and managed some sleep. One reason I booked SQ was to enjoy an Asian style breakfast so you can imagine my frustration that despite distributing a lavish eight page printed menu to economy passengers which included three breakfast options (including a tasty-sounding pork and noodles exactly what I'd had in mind) they were only able to offer "chicken sausage with frittata" which was as disgusting as it sounds. Arrived on time and customs and baggage claim was pretty quick. Beyond being deposited at the destination safely and on time SQ fell short of expectations. Will not go out of my way to fly them again.
label: negative

text: Huge payment glitch at booking - Poor recognition of frequent flyers This happened when booking a ticket for a trip in June 2020. Singapore airlines website has a timeout bug at the payment level and I had to book several times the same ticket. After my card got rejected on the fourth attempt I realized that they have been charging my card each time. I had to increase my card limit and top up big time to book a fourth time over the phone with an agent. What follows is a nightmare. Extremely difficult to get the failed bookings payments removed from my card. Took very long (still not over) with all the impacts you can imagine on using my card for any other expenses Singapore airlines proposed to give me 2000 miles for the inconvenience which I refused. This was an amazingly cheap offer for the tens of hours spent over the phone with them, with my bank, organizing conference calls, managing my credit card failed payments and all the emotional impacts this all triggers. Singapore airlines, you are too greedy. Now I understand why in 15 years being with you as a PPS and gold member I have never been upgraded. I will try other airlines.
label: negative

text: Number one My first time flying with Singapore Airline and do not regret it one bit now I know why it was voted number one,
label: positive

text: Service and comfort like no other... From the second I signed in at the Brisbane International Airport till the time I disembarked in Koh Samui, the service and professionalism of the staff is something to behold.. Never would you go thirsty or hungry with this airline, will definitely be flying with Singapore Airlines as often as possible! Well done
label: positive

text: Good airline, unfortunately flying economy sucks Good airline, unfortunately flying economy sucks, especially with sears at back of plane on a 13.5 hour flight. Never enough leg room.unfortunately as there were loads of kids in the flight, all the extra leg room seats were taken. Checked in online 3 minutes after receding email advising check in had opened and all the decent seats were taken. In-flight entertainment was good. The staff are very polite, helpful and friendly. The plane was modern with wi fi (paid for). Meals are above average and drinks and snacks are freely available.
label: positive

text: BEST AIRLINE BUT GONE BAD NOW Singapore airlines just disappointed me this time around when flying from Delhi to Krabi via Singapore and back. I was very disappointed with the cost cutting done by them be it the drinks / food or the overall service. I overlooked other airlines and spent good above 600 US $ for 4 pax extra but it all went waste. The flight even got delayed, then as mentioned service / food / drinks were not as it used to be on this sector and then icing on the cake that my luggage was manhandled and given to me in broken condition for which I am pursuing with them.
label: neutral

text: The best From check in to transit in Singapore and onto Chennai India and baggage collection flawless. Service on board with crew excellent.The cabin tidy and clean with good legroom. When you want the best, you fly with the best.
label: positive

text: Best airlines in all terms They are the best when it comes to travelling with a baby or with a pregnant women! They take care of their guest the best. We got priority security check issues by the airlines, so that we could avoid long queues at Seoul.The airline stewards take good care of our toddler all through the long flight by checking if he was comfortable and wanted anything, to which our son took full advantage off.I would continue travelling Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text: It is really world class It is actually the best airlines in the world and really world-class, the air hostess is genuinely very good and very helpful
label: positive

text: Good......but Well,first off I was excited to fly on Singapore Airlines because of their reputation and secondly i was excited about the “premium” in front of the cattle car economy section. The service was exceptional,just like a few other Asian carriers. Secondly the premium economy section was nice but you are locked in to the seat,meaning the arm rests are secured and cannot be moved. I had 2 empty seats next to me and could not utilize the space. It was frustrating. Premium economy is nice but........Have a safe journey......
label: positive

text: A perfect flight if I could, I would, fly Singapore Airlines everywhere I go. The best service bar none. the best seats...WAY better than BA or Delta. (Equal to Turkish or Jet blue Business Cross country.
label: positive

text: I Can't Select Seats I live in France and am trying to select 2 seats in business class for my wife and me to travel from Toulouse to Melbourne on 10 December 2019. The Singapore Airline's website tells me: "Access denied". Why is this? I am a KrisFlyer member.
label: negative

text: Istanbul to Singapore. Always love the aircraft that SQ use for this route, the Business Class seat super bulky and comfort instead of modern and lacking comfort. Love it!
label: positive

text: Best airline Best airline,best Check in , on flight services was the excellent. We think where ever & whenever we will fly we will chose this airline
label: positive

text: AMS-SIN. Singapore Airlines is a class act. The flight attendants were terrific the cabin was comfortable and inviting and the food was absolutely delicious. Long-haul flights are just more pleasant on this carrier.
label: positive

text: Excellent Service Flew to Brisbane on SQ265 last month and was really impressed with their new Airbus A350-900. The seats in economy were very comfortable and they have simplified their TV system by going only touch screen. The awkward remote is gone and doesn't complicate the seat armrests any further. There is a USB port located under the TV screen as well as an earphone port, making it all fuss free. The service was really good but having flown a few different airlines over the last few years, nothing beats Singapore air.
label: positive

text: Our flight on SingaporeAir It was our first time flying with SingaporeAir and I must say the experience was great. I loved their instruction video, so different from the demonstration with a flight attendant and it showcases some great things about Singapore. Great selection of entertainment. Food was really good. And the cabin crew were very helpful. Definitely will fly with them again.
label: positive

text: The best Airline in the world We've flown with many other Airlines to Europe from Malaysia/Singapore, and Singapore airlines is by far the best Airline in terms of staff, entertainment and food.
label: positive

text: Great smooth Dreamliner 787 flight, as usual Everything from check-in to boarding was smooth... Lots of food options at the Nagoya airport... But we headed to the lounge... and the best part was that they were serving Japanese Kare rice!! It was perfect for us as we didn't get to have it during our stay in Nagoya. The seats were very comfortable as usual; We are also now aware that the seats have a slightly different alternating combination; odd numbered centre seats are separated by a bulky storage compartment... The even numbered seats have the storage compartment nearer the aisles, so couples can sit side by side. Similarly, odd numbered window seats are closer to the windows, while even numbered window seats have the storage compartments against the window, so that you have to lean a little more to look out the window. Loved the graduating tinted windows of the Boeing 787 in place of the regular window shades. The food was average, as with many SQ flights, even when you think you can't really go wrong with the Japanese meal option... Service was excellent as usual; as well as the inflight entertainment.
label: positive

text: So terribly disappointed! A long haul flight Melbourne - Singapore -Rome in premium economy with pretty much no service! We hadn’t pre booked meals and got left over economy food poorly presented! Had to ask for a glass of poor quality wine and no seconds offered! Flight home, Frankfurt-Singapore-Melbourne just as bad! After take off from Singapore the lights weren’t not even turned on! They wanted us to just go to sleep! That flight we buzzed and asked for a drink and snacks, as did most of the cabin! Breakfast the only meal served 5 hours into flight! Bathroom was shared with economy and quite a long walk back! No amenities kit or pre flight glass of bubbles either!
label: negative

text: SIN to Fukuoka, Osaka to SIN The service of SQ flight is always the best. The price we paid for was petty cheap as we planned this trip very early. The service is good, I requested for instant noodles, they got it for me with a bread, just in case I got not enough. They made nice cocktails too.
label: positive

text: there are always two sides to the story I have nothing but the highest praise for the "human" side of this airline and it delivers on its well-earned reputation for service. Even a flight director who appeared regularly to check what was going on for every passenger on the flight! Unless you know the 12 digit code of your flight which doesn't appear on your e-ticket you are in trouble as the out-of-hour "bots" are not really helpful .We had to phone the London office to get our problem sorted which they did do.We tried to log-in before our last flight but it said we had unallocated seats and all were taken but the Humans came to rescue!!
label: positive

text: Good service As always fly with SQ is well known for their excellent full service (meals onboard and entertainment). Perhaps on last flight (at night)is not the luckiest time from me. From jakarta I got delayed for 1 hour due to bad weather in singapore, then it cut off my time for transit. And the flight to Melbourne from S'pore is really full and a little bit crowded, many baby's were crying all night.
label: positive

text: Don't miss your flight on this airline We had purchased 2 tickets plus bought 20 KG baggage allowance for $130.31 to fly from Ho Chi Minh City to Singapore. This was late 2018. Instead of 14.50, I read 4:50 for departure time and we ended up missing our flight. We were not able to purchase tickets at the airport and had to do it on our phone. Unfortunately I kept getting stuck and in the end had to ask for help from one of the women behind the counter. She booked our flight and it cost us $614. This was the same itinerary, just 2 hours later! A grave mistake that we paid dearly for!! But I don't think I'll ever choose to fly Singapore air again.
label: negative

text: The most convenient way of traveling from the middle of Britain to NZ The journey is the least stressful way of traveling to South Island as if you chose a flight which doesn’t stop between Manchester and Singapore. It has. additional advantage if you take the 1100 flight from Manchester you arrive at Singapore at bedtime GMT. Because there is 12 hours between flights you can have a decent sleep in the Transit Hotel in Terminal 3 without leaving the airport. On the return journey it isn’t quite as good as usually there is usually only 7 hours between flights. This is my 19th annual visit to NZ
label: positive

text: Hong Kong to Singapore. I have travelled on Singapore Airlines B777-200 on the last segment of my trip. The aircraft was old the inflight entertainment system is poor and the seat is also old. I was quite surprised to see that Singapore Airlines is still flying with this old thing. Food was just acceptable but nothing special. The meal service (dinner) was very late. This keeps you awake for most of the flight waiting for the dinner and just fall to sleep a few minutes before arrival.
label: negative

text: Flight back to the uk I have travelled on many airlines , however this airline is by far the best. The staff are like robots never stop always smiling and helping that was for 10 hours straight . The food was good , thumbs up 👍
label: positive

text: Trip to Osaka top airlines in the world i am very very satisfied, legroom was comfortable, in-flight entertaiment with touch screen model
label: positive

text: Impeccable service We recently flew Singapore airlines from Melbourne to Singapore with our 4 children. From the moment we got on the staff were friendly and accommodating. The staff were great with the children which made the long flight that much more bearable and even when one of the kids asked for an adult meal at the last minute they did their best to accommodate him. Food was fine, kids meals were great, leg room was ok
label: positive

text: Could not fault them I recently used Singapore airline for a trip to Australia. The staff and the service we received was fantastic. I would highly recommend as a airline to use
label: positive

text: Old aircraft, average food but consistency good in-flight service! To start off with and lay the context, I must admit that I am a fan of the airlines and every trip I take, I will surely fly with it. Every year, on average, I make 4-5 trips, usually 2 long hual, 1 medium and 1-2 short haul flights. In my most recent flight experience with it, my family and I went to Ho Chi Minh City for a short get-away holiday, the city we will go at least once annually. Instead of using an Airbus A330-300 aircraft as usual, it was actually a Boeing 777-200 aircraft (6th Sep, SQ184). This is one of the older aircraft and the airline already have plans to gradually phase it out in the next 1-2 years. The seating plan was 3-3-3. Seat and legroom was generally ok. The aircraft was very much dated and the inflight-entertainment was also very old (non-touch screen unlike the A350) and very insensitive control too. Loading was slow as well. As for the food, it was average and passable and I remembered my previous trips on the same flight (in December 2018), it was much better and tastier. The food was bland (the fish). For the service, it was great and compliments must be given to the pilots and crew. The flight was smooth and on time. The crew were attentive and courteous and for this, they "saved" the day of the flight and it was almost a full flight with many students! Fortunately, this flight was just an hour and 45 mins but I remembered the "horrific" flight I took, again in Boeing 777-200, back to Singapoe from Copenhagen in 2017. Imagine with the poor and unresponsive inflight system, it was tough to pull through over 12 hours in the air. However, on our return trip, it was an Airbus A330-300 which was a good relief for us. Although it was a full flight, it was a great experience and arrived much earlier than the scheduled arrival time! I hope my next coming flight with SQ in December will be a good one! Finger crossed.
label: neutral

text: Watch your weight My wife and I recently flew to Stockholm on Singapore Airlines code share with SAS to celebrate Christmas and took along with a lot of presents for the family. In all our four bags weighed 96kg. We thought this was ok working on the normal SAS business class allowance of 2 x 32kg. However the leg Sydney to Singapore was under an SIA flight number rather than SAS and SIA has a weight allowance of just 40 kg each. This took some frantic repacking at the airport to squeeze under the limit. Incongruously coming back the other direction all the way to Sydney our bags could weigh 2 x 32kg under the flight rules. This would seem to be an anomaly that needs fixing.
label: positive

text: Professional service and comfortable flight A really pleasant flight from Perth to Singapore. The inflight entertainment was top notch, the service excellent and the food was delicious. The comfort on the new A359 is also top quality - you barely feel the bumps it's that smooth! Highly recommend.
label: positive

text: SQ2, best flight to Hong Kong Being a long haul flight, SQ2 that flies from Singapore to San Francisco via Hong Kong, it is the best flight to fly to Hong Kong as they serve on full, and utilize best equipment, i.e. They use the latest 777 with the latest interior (full flat bed). I had the Book the Cook menu of Lobster Thermidor with fresh asparagus, very delicious and well presented. Always choose the bulk head seat of row 11 to get more leg-room.
label: positive

text: Excellent Services Good foods, perfect flight connection, friendly and helpful services from the flight attendants. Typical SQ Standards.
label: positive

text: Euro Trip 2019 Great flight with excellent service and very pleasant staff who were happy to assist with your needs.
label: positive

text: Awesome SingAir B787-10 Dreamliner I flew in Singapore Airlines Business Class on their new B787-10 Dreamliners. Such a beautiful aircraft, so quiet inside and the business class pods are awesome. Fantastic service and food. They serve 1 meal on this flight and I decided to have the meal after take-off, rather than before landing. After the meal I had a few hours sleep and woke up before landing. Even though I had a meal the crew still asked if I wanted to have something to eat for breakfast before we landed. Awesome service Singapore Airlines!
label: positive

text: Jammed in between seats is pathetic and harmful to customers Left Heathrow Airport at 2205 hours and tried to sleep for some of the 13 hour flight to Singapore. This is a big joke and damn near impossible to do with RUDE passengers in front of you WHO just push the button and their seat back as far as they can without even asking if it's ok to do it. Comfort for other passengers with legs should be considered. Hopefully I will not fly with them again.
label: negative

text: I have never come across a company that would ask a customer to pay a penalty fee for switching from a cheaper to a more expensive service. I bought a one way Economy class ticket from the US to Singapore at first, planning to take another airline for the other leg of the trip. Being a loyal customer of Singapore Airlines, I decided to be more generous and pay a lot more to buy a 2-way Business class trip in place for the original one-way Economy class ticket. I cancelled the one-way Economy class ticket after buying the 2-way Business class ticket and found that Singapore Airlines charged me a cancellation fee of US$200. I called Singapore Airlines and wrote to ask for the US$200 cancellation fee to be waived and refunded. The experience was a nightmare and the response was shocking to a long time customer. It took a long time to get through the hotline. My request for refund was rejected with no good reason provided.
label: negative

text: The Best Airline Nothing was too much trouble throughout the flight. (13hrs). You could have food and drink from the takeoff to the landing.
label: positive

text: It’s really disappointing that such a long haul airline has such terrible ground service. Rude of indifferent ground staff. Use really dirty lounges for long haul flights. Their Singapore located lounges are horrendously over crowded. Not an airline to use for business
label: negative

text: Aderage experience We booked this class for the businessclass was complete. This class is overrated and much to expensive for what you get. The seats were somewhat more spacious but not that much more as in the economy class. We sat in the middle on the fourseats row. Because we sat on the last row the chairs had less space than the other rows. The food was not bad. The staff was not very friendly, a little bit moody I would say. At the return flight we sat on the row with two seats. That was somewhat better. The flight attendants were doing their jobs, and that was it. Overall I would not choose for this airline again, there are better airlines with better prices.
label: neutral

text: Very poor service from flight attendants. There was no menu and couldn’t understand what the attendants were offering for a meal because of the mask. Food was served few hours into flight. Wine selection was bad. Never saw the flight attendant after the first meal on an 18 hour flight Was woken up 8 hours into flight to ask if I needed lunch Never saw the flight attendant after that. No toiletries provided.
label: negative

text: SFO-HK I was disappointed in the overall experience. It appears to me the airline is cutting corners and not keeping up with the ME carriers. The seat although wide is not particularly comfortable in the seated position. The fully reclined position was better but the bed was hard. They would do well to add a comforter on the sleeping surface to provide a softer experience. They used to provide an amenities kit- no longer. The food too was just not as good as it used to be. If they want to retain their ratings they better spend a bit more on their business class product.
label: neutral

text: Mumbai to Singapore to Mandalay with Singapore airlines and silk air. great experience , smooth flight thru singapore / silk air takes good care of you and .you are well fed and hydrated.
label: positive

text: Smooth and pleasant flight We haven't flown Singapore Airlines for a long time but I wish we had. This was such a great flight. The flight attendants were lovely and went out of their way to help. Plane was nice and new, seats comfortable, good inflight entertainment system and tasty meals. I will definitely give Singapore Airlines a high priority when choosing to fly overseas in the future. The five hours literally flew past in a jiffy!
label: positive

text: Top quality always, in all aspects Singapore Airlines is the best airline I have ever tried. The aircrafts are modern, economy class seats are spacious enough for me (1.87m height), the onboard entertainment provides an ample choice of films, all genres and for all ages. The cabin crew is EXCELLENT! I highly appreciate their professionalism, their dedication to provide the highest level of passanger experience. In-flight meals are also of high quality and great taste. The price of this airline is fair for the quality of the service they provide. Plus the Singapore layover is already an experience which can spice up any travel, to and from any parts of the world! Thank you for the outstanding experience, I am sure to be flying with you again soon!
label: positive

text: Love the direct flight The flight was pretty enjoyable. My favourite airline although a bit on the pricier side . Service could have been much better . But nevertheless safe and good flight. Toilet was not as clean as expected. Love the hot towels !
label: positive

text: Flying with young grandchildren Flights on time and information to keep us up to date with late arrival. It was an overnight flight but the young children were made welcome and comfortable. The crew were kind and friendly and while an overnight economy flight is not ideal it was made as easy as possible. Thank you crew.
label: positive

text: Superb crew Sin/Maa flight on 16Sep operated by Excellent crew. All crew members were excellent and friendly and helpful. Suggest to passengers please board and put you bag in the over head compartment fast so as not to delay other passengers
label: positive

text: Excellent choice when flying This airline has put itself head and shoulders above every other airline I’ve used; from the reasonable cost for a direct flight (paid about $600) to the value for your money - it’s downright unbeatable. For that low price you get to check 2 bags and one carryon (most other airlines charge more for just the flight and then make you pay extra for the luggage), EXCELLENT service on board (very friendly staff, great food and lots of it, very comfortable seats, excellent in-flight entertainment with your own personal screen and choice of movies, video games, music and if you wish you can synchronize with your phone). In-flight WiFi is available for purchase (think about $20) and is actually a pretty good connection. I still have no idea how they do it or if the other airlines are even aware of them or trying to be competitive. It’s also one of the few direct flights for this route - most others have at least one stopover. Highly recommend this Airline to anyone flying this route.
label: positive

text: SQ air crew does not know the A380 plane well enough Caught an early morning flight SQ2171/LH983 @ 05:55AM from Dublin to Frankfurt. At Frankfurt, after scanning my boarding pass at the gate hold area, I was informed by the ground grew to head up the stairs and turn left from my flight SQ25 back home - Singapore. Proceeded as instructed and only realized at the door of the plane that it was the upper deck. So I politely told the SQ air crew that my seat is on the lower deck of the A380 and I was directed wrongly by the ground crew. I then requested if I could use the stairs to get to the lower deck. The SQ air crew informed me that there are no stairs and not possible to get from the upper deck to the lower deck within the plane. He then said I had to go all the way back to gate hold area and head to the lower deck. As I did not want to cause a scene nor argue with the air crew (even though I am 100% sure there are stairs within the plane connecting the upper and lower decks), I made my way back to the gate hold area and then to the lower deck and got seated. I then requested to speak to the IFS once we are airborne. When the IFS came, I explained the above experience to him. The IFS was also shocked that the air crew did not just let me use the stairs. The IFS was very apologetic and offer to be of personal assistance to me during the flight - offering red wine from business class etc. which I decline. I explained to the IFS that what I hope for, is that air crew does not make the same mistake in explaining to passengers. If there was a boarding regulations or safety concerns for using the stairs then just explain it clearly. Rather than trying to hoodwink passengers by saying there are no stairs. Passengers are not dumb. There folks who does not want to cause a commotion and rather take the extra effort. So do not think that passengers are flying for the first time on A380 - especially your frequent flyers. Hope SQ learn from this and share with other air crews. Thanks!
label: neutral

text: Well oiled machine. Singapore Airlines have the customer service aspect down to a fine art. Hot towels for economy passengers are a bit of a rarity as are printed menus. The plane on this leg was a rather tired 777. Attentive staff constantly offered water and juice through the trip and there was a snack bar to help yourself from down the back of the plane. I was surprised by the excellent quality of the food. I wasn't expecting much from economy class food but it was really tasty. Very bravely, they served Brocolli as part of a starter and it was perfectly cooked. Even when I cook Broccoli it's tough or mushy. They also have cracked serving bread that is edible. Economy travel on 11 hour flights is more of an endurance test that a pleasure but Singapore does its best to make the experience as painless as possible.
label: positive

text: Don’t book A flight to Bali with Singapore Airlines. How this airline wins any awards for ANY aspect of its service is beyond me. Flights delayed, bags lost, completely incompetent customer service. I can track my pizza delivery down to the last km, but Singapore Airlines cannot tract a bag, if you have a choice, don’t book this airline. Emirates are so far ahead of these guys in every single aspect, it’s hard to believe how they survive. Nice friendly cabin crew, that’s where it ends. Let’s see if our bags turn up today ??
label: negative

text: Very excellent services and prompt Singapore air line is very expensive compare to other airlines. But, very reliable and problem free than other airlines. It is worth for money.
label: positive

text: SINGAPORE GIRL WHAT A GREAT WAY TO FLY Sydney to Singapore was a Boeing 777. I will not review this part of the trip, except to say it was great as usual. The Singapore to Rome flight was on an Airbus A350. This was my first experience of this type of aircraft and I was much impressed. It was comfortable and spacious even in Economy. My son is over 6 feet tall and he found it comfortable. WELL DONE SINGAPORE AIRLINES. The seats felt a little thin in the padding, but were comfortable and with a bit of a walk around occasionally did not fatigue you at all. The entertainment system as always was varied and easy to use. Headphones I would suggest you take your own, particularly on a long haul flight. Service was excellent as always. What more can I say.
label: positive

text: Home in the skies Singapore is probably one of the best airline I have flown. The staff are extremely attentive and the planes are well maintained and clean. Inflight food and drinks is good and the portions are good. In flight entertainment is great with a huge selection of movies, TV shows and even games. Something that is not often mentioned, the toilet to passenger ratio is decent.
label: positive

text: Holiday First time I've travelled with Singapore Airlines. From check in everything was to a very high standard. Flight attendants were very helpful and professional. Food excellent and plenty of choice. Came round throughout the long flight with drinks and snacks. Entertainment was excellent plenty of choice. Would recommend the airline. Would travel with them again.
label: positive

text: Arrogance at its Finest Probably the worst airline experience I’ve ever had thus far after maybe 5,000 hours of flying experience. My first and definitely my last time flying Singapore airlines. Despite its reputation as a high flyer, Singapore airlines certainly did not live up to its reputation. While the hard product is quite good, the service was abysmal, and could only be described as self entitled and arrogant. Perhaps SIA should stop offering economy class tickets and only service its business class customers since all the glowing reviews seem to be about the business class product. I, for one, will from now on certainly pay a premium NOT to fly Singapore airlines again.
label: negative

text: Seat Seat wasn’t as comfortable as hoped for. Though there were seat recline and foot extension features, we somehow couldn’t get into a comfortable position. But since it was a red eye fl, I slept through most of the 6 hours flight. The gaps behind the seat caused some small items I placed on my seat to drop down to the areas below the passenger behind. I could only retrieve my items once we landed and parked. One disappointment for my daughter was that, though there was larger leg room near the emergency exit door, the entertainment screen was rather far from from the seat as they were mounted on the wall panel. The food was alright, flight was smooth and service was polite and adequate.
label: neutral

text: Nice flights.. Singapore airlines flights are superb. No motion sickness. As u donot feel any movement.Food should me somewhat much better. Veg Food is ok ok. But other services n best.
label: positive

text: The best I fly to Australia at least once a year, sometimes twice and have flown with most airlines, i find Singapore the best for a number of reasons, the seats are more comfortable, the hub airport is in my opinion the best in the world, the service is exemplary, the down side it is also the most expensive, every so often there is a window of opportunity with a lower fare and then I travel with them, the luggage allowance is more than most at 30 kilos, if I can find the right fare (and I am prepared to pay a little more) this is my airline of choice.
label: positive

text: Generally good, still room for improvement I used Singapore Airlines this time flying from Hong Kong to Perth and return. The outbound leg: departure delayed by 25 minutes, plane actually took off an hour after the scheduled departure time. Arrival time delayed by 20 minutes, shortening my transit time to 60 minutes. Luckily the transfer was within the same terminal. Inbound leg: I was surprised that being Singapore Airlines, they used a gate (A6) at T3 (for Singapore to HK) which necessitated walking down a flight of steps (no escalator or elevator), for transfer on a shuttle bus to get to the plane. This is unsatisfactory, if you need to walk with assistance or are pushing a pram. The meals are still good (Economy Class). The S$20 transit voucher is generous. However, the in-flight entertainment and in-flight magazine are not as good as those on Qatar Airways, in my opinion. No free wifi for Economy Class.(Compare again: Qatar Airways provides free wifi for 30 minutes for Economy Class). As for Changi Airport: the carpeted floor is not good for wheels (suitcases, trolleys, prams, etc. this has been my impression since I used the airport many years ago); the arrangement whereby you need to show your passport to register to get a password for using wifi is super unfriendly (this has been in place for ages for as long as I could remember). I have not used another airport which requires such cumbersome control in the name of security. Think again, Changi Airport.
label: positive

text: Most disappointing Used to be a big fan of the airline till they screwed up one time too many. To be sure, the actual service on the flight is great, but the lead up to it is anything but. The website is slow. The customer service representatives do not respond to emails at all. The people on the chatbot are not very useful. With my latest trip, I just found out that after confirming my seat, that was cancelled and I now have to book another seat that is in a worse location. Yet the airline can't offer any satisfactory explanation. For an airline that is charging a serious premium over its peers, this is unacceptable. Will not be flying with Singapore Airlines again in the foreseeable future.
label: negative

text: Always on time In my experience Singapore Airlines always leave within minutes of scheduled times and arrive the same. The staff are always friendly and helpful and make the flight a pleasant experience.
label: positive

text: Great flight A great flight wouldn't fly with anyone else, although the food wasn't that great , I think they have gone down hill a bit with their food but I still wouldn't use anyone else
label: positive

text: We flew From London to Auckland via Singapore. on an Airbus 380. The review is based on all 4 flights as there was little to choose between them. The service was consistency high; attentive friendly and helpful The best I have flown and I am a regular traveller. The only disappointment for me was that the Book the cook meals were somewhat disappointing. I would have been better off with the standard meals. My wife found the beds hard and difficult to lie diagonally but they were fine for me. I would choose Singapore every time if I could.
label: positive

text: Great Economy Flight to and From Perth Despite travelling Economy, we were well treated and very comfortable throughout our flight. Excellent cabin service from very professional crew. Highly recommend.
label: positive

text: Great Airline All services were great. I am elderly and got a bit stressed and was reassured and helped to check in. Cabin crew were great and.
label: positive

text: Simply amazing Although the lounge area was a little tired, we were fortunate to be on one of the new Singapore planes. The set up is fantastic, and leaves you wanting nothing. The food was very good and possibly too plentiful! We arrived very comfortable and well rested. We were travelling on our honeymoon. At one point we were congratulated by the crew with a special cake. From that moment on, the staff automatically switched to calling me my married name. Amazing hospitality (and great memories!)
label: positive

text: Great Airline Great Airline - I would highly recommend using them. Flights arrived early or on time. The food served was delicious.
label: positive

text: comfortable enough space for seats. took a midnight flight, light snacks provided and breakfast. plane relatively new, better touch screen, USB port and charging port available to use
label: positive

text: On a company paid trip So let's just say I was pleasantly pleased with this flight I am normally a business class traveler so on this trip I had no choice but to travel in economy. I enjoyed it. If I must do it again I will happily do it on Singapore Airlines
label: positive

text: High class standard When we travel from Bali via Singapore to Amsterdam, my wife had diarrhea and through out everything. The cabin staff was really helpful and take care fore her. She even get some “alternative medicine” When we become at home she feel much better. I can recommend Singapore to everyone!!
label: positive

text: SIA Suites - Simply Amazing Flight Took suites for the first time with wife. It was to be the most memorable and enjoyable flight. Time seem to zoom past when you are pampered with the finest in service and food/snacks. The staff were truly exceptional! Kudos to SIA - stay on top always!
label: positive

text: a long comfortable trip It was a long trip, about 12 hours. I spent the time watching films (there were a lot of interesting titles), eating (at least 3 complete meals), drinking (you can drink what you want alcoolic or analcoolic drinks when you want, just ask to the staff) and sleeping (before take off, the staff give to the travellers a cover and a pillow). I usually don't like so much travel with plane, but in this case I had a good trip and I would do it again, of course with Singapore Airline.
label: positive

text: From check in to Landing its all very easy From checking in on line, to queing to get onto a delayed flight, due to some pretty horrid weather, I was glad to be on the ground rather than flying through that storm. Checking bags in, was improved by the Singapore staff stopping a 6 males who decided they could push to the front of the queue and check in at their timings. They were sent to the back to the amusement of other passengers. The flight was fantastic, the staff could do no more and every request was greeted with a smile and fantasic service. Nothing was to much trouble and the service is so subtle, it works amazinly well. The seat was comfortable and so well designed to allow free movement and the ability to change seating positions and angles. The selection in in flight entertainment was adequate and plenty to choose from, films to music to games enough to keep anyone amused.
label: positive

text: Flight Experience Was Great But The In-Flight Entertainment System Could Definitely Be Improved Firstly, I'd like to say, Singapore Airlines is a great airline. No doubt about that. The cabin crew were extremely hospitable and friendly and always ready to assist me and my friends (we were on a school trip to Phuket). For a fact, I know that different planes in your fleet are somewhat different in their own ways. For example, the size of a TV screen on the newest Airbus A350-900 and the Boeing 777-300 will definitely not be the same. On my flight SQ955 from Jakarta to Singapore, I sat on a Boeing 777-300 (the original version, without the 'ER'). The TV screen size was unbelievably small (I could've sworn, my iPad was bigger than that screen). The navigation system was sub-par (no touch-screen) and somewhat unresponsive. Additionally, as one of the world's very best airlines, one would expect more than a pair of earbuds. Even Malaysia Airlines provides decent quality headphones, and certainly a bigger screen with better resolution (yes, I hope that gives a perspective of how small the screen was). So, I think I'm don.... ONE MORE THING. Singapore Airlines, where is the in-flight charging port?! A five-star airline, without a charging port?! I spent ten minutes looking for a charging port that was never even there! Really unacceptable, if you ask me, for an airline with such an excellent reputation. So, top tip. Next time when you're booking a Singapore Airlines flight, check the type of plane they use on that route. Use a flight tracking system (flightradar24, flightaware.com). For example, you're looking for a morning flight on the Jakarta - Singapore route. You see two suitable flights - SQ955 and SQ957. However, there's a massive difference between those two flights. SQ955 uses the old Boeing 777-300; SQ957 uses the brand-new Airbus A350-900. I bet you know which flight to choose now!
label: neutral

text: Great service We often fly with Singapore Airlines as they have the best transit times, and flight dates that we prefer.
label: positive

text: Disappointing The seat was comfortable and flat bed very good. Entertainment was limited. Dinner was good with enough choice of food and drink. The service was a little slow and less thank enthusiastic. Continental breakfast was appalling quality, tough bread and pastry and fruit. No yogurt and no cooked option. Not what you would expect from business class.
label: positive

text: Treated like. Royalty Even when travelling in economy your treated like first class here, from the time you step aboard until you leave the crew go out of there way to look after you attending to all your needs.The food and service is outstanding so I hate to think how good it must be up the front of the plane.
label: positive

text: MEL-JFK over three separate legs. Encountered crews ranging from good to excellent on these flights. Catering was mainly Book the Cook and very good (FRA food is never as good as most other ports). Choice of DOM or Krug and great wine selection. SQ are still close to perfect in first class.
label: positive

text: Very relaxing Only second time flying Business class but overall was a great experience. Everything from the food to the drinks and service was great. Would most certainly go again on a long flight if i had enough points.
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines has become our airline of choice when travelling to Europe Second year in a row to Europe with Singapore.They are a great airline,with the most attentive staff. The food is excellent and the in-flight entertainment vastly improved from our last flight. The wine unfortunately was not the best, but the beer and spirits were fine.Singapore treats everyone well and the staff are very friendly. Nothing is too much trouble.The overnight leg from Singapore to London was a bit cold in the cabin, but a lot of airlines appear to have this problem. Changi airport is also a wonderful place to stop as unlike Dubai you can actually get a seat to relax. Will fly with them again hopefully next year.
label: positive

text: Not worth the cost Having flown Premium Economy with J.A.L. we were expecting the same facilities on Singapore Airlines, as their cost was higher than J.A.L. We were flying on a 777-333 ER. We were shown to our seats which were wider than the usual seat and that was it. There were no extension leg rest; there was no extra leg room...I had my knees almost under my chin...the refreshment trolley arrived and I one very small plastic glass of champagne and that was it; there was no amenities pack; the meals were just; the seat tipped back, so for the entire journey my seat was kicked, pushed and thumped. Singapore Air Premium Economy is over-priced and I do NOT recommend them.
label: neutral

text: Money for nothing! Having paid considerably more for the premium economy service I was extremely disappointed with the meals and in flight entertainment, The meals were identical to those in economy even though we had paid a not inconsiderable premium. However the two meals served on the flight were inedible. eg. Carrots you could not cut with a serrated knife, broccoli brown and over cooked, pasta undercooked: hard and powdery, Some sort of muffin which was very stale... Suggest SA take a trip in Air New Zealand Premium Economy to see how it should be. The 777 aircraft had only 4 toilets none of which were located near the premium economy seats. The inflight entertainment whilst had over 300 titles it seems most were B film and unheard of. The cabin staff announcements over the PA were inaudible which could be dangerous in some circumstance. It should be said that the cabin crew were courteous and the seats were reasonably comfortable. However I cannot see how SA can justify the considerable hike in price and then serve up unedible food. If you have to travel suggest you at least only go economy to get the same poor quality
label: neutral

text: Great Service We have 6 members of family with 2 child 1 infent and 1 senior citizen to avail singapore airlines while travel to Malaysia. The mentionable good things are 1. Cabin crue are extremly supportable. 2. They are taken care of child and todler nicely. 3. Food standard is good 4. Time conscious and good management. Negative side: May be from Bangladesh they are not using upgraded Plane so that we feel so jerking sometime without bad weather. Overall it was agreat journey in both return way.
label: positive

text: Best Airline! We have flown for over 15 hours with this airline. Lots of food and unlimited amounts of drinks was provided. It the bathroom they had tooth brush, tooth paste, hair brush, socks. There were over 600 channels in many languages on TV. Even when we were on 2 hour flight, we still got fool meal.
label: positive

text: Amsterdam to Singapore. I was looking forward to fly the A350. After booking the flight I received an offer to upgrade to Premium Economy, but I rejected after reading a number of reviews. The flight was departing behind schedule due to passengers who did not turn up and a time consuming de-icing process. I am glad I did not take the Premium Economy upgrade offer. Walking through the Premium Economy section during boarding I did not experience much added value by looking at the hard product, compared to Y. The seats look pretty narrow as well and not that much pitch. The business seats look great though. The Economy product is very nice in my opinion. Seats are maybe a little bit narrower than in the Boeing 777-300, but the pitch was good (I am 1.80m tall, enough space), decent recline and a huge entertainment touch screen which was awesome. The cabin felt spacious because of the high ceilings. Also higher humidity. Great aircraft! I was very dissapointed in the cabin noise level. Yes, take off was less noisy but not during the flight itself. I think it will be less noisy in front of the aircraft but not sure about that. Customer service was good (not exceptional) and the meals were delicious. One of the best meals ever had on a plane. I appreciate the metal cutlery and hot towel cloths. Overall, it was a great flight and I am looking forward to the next one! And I made my connection flight (which was very tight) thanks to the very efficient airport of Changi.
label: positive

text: I flew with Singapore Airlines from London on a 11.30am local time arriving in Singapore 7.30am local time next day. For some unknown reason this airline serves breakfast at 1.45am Singapore time. I and other passengers were woken up so we could have a breakfast. Once breakfast was finished we still had 5 more hours of flying time. How stupid is this. Dreading my flight home. I have travelled with this airline in the past but it now is on a par with a low cost airline. Very disappointed.
label: negative

text: It was OK, but not so great No snack was served from KUL to SIN during this 1 hr flight. Then waited 2 hrs for connecting flight, only a small sandwich was served after boarding. Full breakfast was served only before landing. Seat was not so comfortable, quite narrow than imagine. Service was OK, not great. First time flying SQ economy, flew on SQ J class before, service level is not comparable.
label: neutral

text: Best Service By Far Singapore staff are truly amazing. Service and food is the best. Leg room and comfort vary from plane to plane as the are not all the same A380 and A350 are great planes for economy. More room. The Boeing 777-300ER is very squeezy for long haul in economy. Staff are still exemplary though. Will be traveling with this airline in the future 100%
label: positive

text: Disappointing flights We were disappointed with our Flight from Melbourne to Barcelona and return. The food was only average, we were not given a travel pack, only socks and eye shade and the seats were not very comfortable. We felt we were not treated any differently from economy class passengers- needing to ask for help to set up our bed - which was not easy. The bed was very uncomfortable and you had to lie at an angle as the section for your feet is set off to one side. When we arrived home we had very sore hips and backs from the poorly designed bed. The other complaint we had was that the Business Class lounge at Barcelona was appalling - overcrowded, worn out seating and very little food. It was a shared lounge and was full of Flight staff and their luggage! We did write to the airline with our issues and they responded quickly and offered us vouchers to spend at their at their Flight shop - which we appreciated.
label: neutral

text: Best airline in my view! I have travelled several times to Australia with this airline and on every occasion the service has been exemplary. The cabin staff are polite courteous friendly and efficient. The choices of food are reasonable considering they have to cater for a wide variety of tastes. The airline is also very reasonable on pricing compared with other airlines. I will definitely use them again.
label: positive

text: Best flight ever! I had some issues getting checked in for my flight and could not be happier with the service I received at ticketing. Betsy, Deborah, and especially Marybelle were all so patient and helped me get everything sorted out. They were professional and friendly while I waited to find out if I could board the flight first to Singapore, then to Bali. I wish all airlines had employees like these ladies - I will only chose Singapore Airlines any time it is an option in the future. The aircraft was very nice, and the flight attendants were all amazing. Even though I was in economy, I was able to rest comfortably, and the food was good. Great choices of in-flight entertainment as well.
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines - Meal Options for Economy Class Not Available Dear Customer Care Team of Singapore Airlines, I have travelled many a times through your Airlines and always had a feeling that it is one of the best Airlines I am travelling in terms of everything including on flight amenities. However, this time I noticed that the option to select meal has been withdrawn for Y Class travellers. May be this is one of the austerity measure to control cost. In my view, the meal option should be restored and travellers be given opportunity to select their meal choices before they board on to the flights because : a) One feels bad and dejected when someone notices that meal options are available for Business Class and Premium Economy Class but not for the Economy Class b) More than 90% passengers travel in economy class and one should not (rather can not) afford to displease the major customer base by numbers c) Major top line revenue comes to any airlines comes from this segment d) Any drop in revenue in this segment will have major proportionate impact on the bottom line of the company e) In any case you are providing meals in the flight so giving an option would not have major impact on cost cutting. To keep the cost under control you may reduce the options to Veg vs Non Veg ONLY without giving them more options with each category. Some of the veg customers may find it difficult to have anything in sectors not touching India where Veg options in flight are very limited to do not exist at all. Hope this will be taken seriously by the management of Singapore Airlines. Look forward to your rely. Tarun Kalra
label: neutral

text: MORE THAN A FIVE STAR AIRLINE Had not flew with Singapore Airlines for some years. Recently flew SQ to Nagoya and back via Tokyo. Service was superb. Cabin staff that took care of us were cheerful and attentive especially Aldora and Eddie Neo. We had some problem with the screen and both of them were very apologetic. Looking forward to fly with SQ again
label: positive

text: I use Singapore Airlines a lot so obviously like the airline, and having Gold Frequent filer status does help when flying economy. fast track check in and lounge access to make things a bit smoother. I fly economy on Singapore Airlines but this was the first time in economy on a SQ long haul flight for about 6 years. Boarding was fine, quickly to my seat 45A, departed a little late but once in the air for around 1 hour service was started. Crew where okay food served quickly and again nothing special just okay. The flight lasting 12 hours passed fairly quick, I found the seats a bit uncomfortable after 4 or 5 hours, the crew where around a little bit and the 2nd meal served 3 hours prior to arrival was okay. Connecting to Bangkok pretty easy and the 2 hour uneventful flight on a new 787 was pretty nice. Returning Check in at Bangkok was quick security and immigration done quickly too, used the Krisflier lounge which was pretty nice, the flight to SIN I was seated in seat 42A, food and drinks where offered but the crew after requesting my choice forgot to deliver the food or a drink, It was a bit odd and the crew on this flight where actually a bit rude anyway. Connection in SIN good again, my flight back to London in Premium Economy, so a chance to compare. Yes of course we are paying for the space, but food and crew are the same as economy. Premium Economy wise I think SQ is okay, I will continue to use, because it's normally consistent but there are better and much cheaper Premium Economy options around.
label: neutral

text: Disappointing We flew the Singapore Business Class from Zurich to Singapore. We were really disappointed about the service. We were sitting on the D an F seats and we eat separately. The D row was always served faster than the F row. It disturbed us very much. Additionally the toilets were very dirty and bad smelling. We could not understand. The food was nice. The flight attendants were not friendly all the time, seemed to be stressed!
label: neutral

text: Great options SSH If you fly Singapore airlines and want to have a short break on the way home, check the SSH. Singapore Short Holiday. It’s great value, there’s a wide range of hotels to choose from, with varying prices and the extras offered are great value. We really enjoyed our stopover. The flights are good too with great service and ample food and drinks. Will travel with them anytime.
label: positive

text: Efficient, friendly and comfortable From checking in our luggage, to boarding the plane, everything was run smoothly and the staff were very friendly and helpful
label: positive

text: comfortable It was a 9 hour flight and wasn't tiring. First ground crew was helpful. Then the attendants were helpful in the plane.
label: positive

text: Warm hospitality by Singapore Airlines Crew Took the RED EYE flight from Spore to Seoul which took off on schedule, plane was new with big screen TV. Korean BF served before arrival was good....
label: positive

text: Long trip home Very professional airline. On time and smooth service (announcements, food, etc). However, this is my second trip with this airline where I felt that the air hostesses were giving us the economy service. On a 10 hour flight, surely you don't have to rush me with my food and drinks? A few times I was also asked why I had called for service (in a slightly rushed manner) when the call was from someone two seats down the row. Just felt "economical" with their "friendly" service. On board entertainment is super with lots of options of movies/TV/books/games. Kids were kept entertained. Good flight and well managed.
label: positive

text: Excellent service The in flight entertainment, meal and service of cabin staff are of high standard. The cabin was clean. I like the staff always wearing sincere smiles. Also, the security check counter at boarding gate is highly efficient, and the staff there are so nice
label: positive

text: Singapore Airlines is always a safe and reliable air carrier, friendly crew members, best flight Singapore Airlines is a international high standard carrier, you will be served by friendly crew members, clean cabin, comfortable seats, nice food and many choices of movies, whether new released or classical. My family is surprised by the hot pipping food served to us. Check in and boarding are hassle free. best airline!
label: positive

text: Not Happy Singapore Air we,have travelled with sq many times , and always have excellent service until this last one on 14 February. My husband had booked the cook , and ordered steak, which had blooded pouring out of it when he got it. He complained to the FA, and it was taken away for about 10 minuites and then returned to him in much the same condition.The only other thing they could offer him was 3 tiny pieces of chicken in horrendously hot sauce, that he couldnt eat. He ended up with a couple of crackers and a slice of cheese, this was his business class meal. I had some chicken satee , which tasted fine , until 10 minutes later I was very sick, spent some time in the toilet. Had to ring several times before our male FA answered the call button. These flights cost $10000.00, so not happy jan.
label: negative

text: Recently returned from Melbourne via Singapore. The seat on the trip from Singapore to Manchester was really uncomfortable as a result I have a bruised coccyx which is still painful. The stop in Munich is a complete pain and makes for a horrendous journey time about 16 hours. Would think twice before booking with Singapore again.
label: neutral

text: I had hoped for a better experience I appreciate that i only flew economy so shouldn't expect too much. I did pay for extra legroom seats but this also meant that there was nowhere to put those bits and bobs you need nearby. The fold out TV screen bracket was also broken. The Flight attendant kindly stuck it all together with bits of card and sticking plasters, but then I was stuck with it for the 13 hour trip. The crew were helpful and friendly enough but the aircraft was just tatty, tired, and broken. So not 'good', not 'bad' but decidedly 'average'. I have used Emirates three times prior to this flight, and was very impressed with them.
label: neutral

text: Comfortable in Economy This was probably the most comfortable economy flight I have taken. The menu and the standard of food was good. The staff were attentive and came round very regularly with drinks. Would certainly recommend.
label: positive

text: A pleasure to fly with. From the moment we boarded we felt welcome staff were friendly and helpful while still maintaining efficient boarding procedures. Travelling with us was our 13 year old son and the crew made him feel valued yet not condescending to him at all. The seats were comfortable and had enough leg room to endure the 8 hours to our destination. The in flight entertainment unit was glitchy in parts but worked mostly so if you wanted to watch or play it kept you amused.Food was satisfactory but brilliant and not horrible but served he purpose. Overall would be more than happy to fly with them again.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Perth. Seat layout was 1-2-1, although no skybed for such a short flight. The seats were narrower but still comfortable. I fell asleep even before take-off and then woke up after to set my seat flat. Due to jetlag, I spent the entire flight asleep and the air stewardess asked if she could get me something else to eat when we were about to touch down. Great service. I will definitely fly Singapore again - although I am not sure if business class is worth the short trip.
label: positive

text: Positive experience but can improve Overall positive experience where little things like hot towels, variety of decent meals, cleanliness of toilets, aircraft, etc matters especially on long haul flights. Great service by friendly staff. Was a bit disappointed when our 2 prebooked economy seats upstairs in the a380 was unexpected downgraded downstairs due to ‘change in aircraft’. The a380’s are starting to show their age especially with the seats, entertainment etc. Was quite pleased with the Old Chang Kee chicken curry puffs! Would definitely fly again with SIA but other airlines have lifted their game in terms of newer aircraft, price competitive, premium economy/business class options and service
label: positive

text: Terrible customer service / no response Purchased business class LAX- Singaore - they canceled flight 5 months in advance- rebooked us with a 27 hour layover. To get on a flight on the correct dates they put us in coach- without offering a refund for downgrade of service. finally 6 months later- after over 30 hours on hold received a whopping $352 credit- This review is based on their lack of response and basically stating at the gate I was lucky to be going to the maldives at all. Our friend who we booked with had to fly in a day early after being dropped by airline completely....so maybe we were lucky.
label: negative

text: Nothing special. I'd heard many good things about Singapore Airlines so was looking forward to travelling with them but was sadly disappointed. We flew economy in a 777 and although we paid for extra leg room it still felt very cramped. The seat was so uncomfortable, the noisyest flight I can recall ment there was no chance of being able to grab a couple of hours sleep but the worst thing for me was the entertainment screen was not working despite 2 resets I was left staring at the bulkhead for 13 and a half hours. The lead stewardess took my E mail address and promised compensation for the broken screen but a week on an I've heard nothing from them. Hardly one of the world's best airlines I'm afraid.
label: neutral

text: First time long haul traveller I had my first experience with Singapore Airlines, I was going on my first Tour Group hoilday to Thailand. I loved Singapore airlines, the staff were lovely and helpful, food was ok with 2 choices for dinner, I had breakfast and Dinner. Comfy seats with a pillow and blanket, hot towels before take off and landing, toilets were clean. A truly memorable experience.
label: positive

text: Brisbane to new Delhi Excellent service, delicious food, spacious seats and friendly staff. Singapore Airlines offers the best service any traveller could ask for. Amenities and great and the flight is exemplary.
label: positive

text: Flown nearly all European and Asian airlines and these are definitely the best for comfort and food. Flown nearly all European and Asian airlines and these are definitely the best for comfort and food.
label: positive

text: Always Good to Fly with them Always good to travel Singapore. My travel agent rates them highly and I admit, I have to agree. I usually fly Singapore when I am all over Asia.
label: positive

text: LHR-SIN-SYD and return. A380 for the first and third legs B777 for the second and fourth. Booked early enough to get the upstairs economy cabin for the A380 flights seats in rows of two with a storage bin on the window side. Only quibble which is trivial is that the library of movies and audio books wasn't that great. Helpful cabin crew rebooted non-functioning IFE very promptly on one leg. Fruit option for meals excellent. Hot towels and regular juice/water supplies much appreciated and the service across the board could not be faulted - the crews seem highly efficient anyway but it helps that there are enough staff for them not to get irritable through needing to work at breakneck pace. We've done this journey with Qantas when they flew Heathrow-Sydney Singapore but switched because a Dubai-Sydney leg is just too long. T3 at Changi is an oasis of calm compared to Dubai and if you book flights with a medium layover you can be asleep in the airside transit hotel minutes after landing. A definite choice of airline and route when we next make the trip.
label: positive

text: Best Airline by far Flight from Brisbane to Singapore was great with excellent service from all staff (far exceeds Emirates who we flew with last year). Our flight from Singapore to Bangkok had a hiccup when the aircraft had to be replaced. We were fully informed by staff and each were given a snack pack whilst we waited for the new aircraft. The thing is they were honest and kept us up to date frequently. Well done Singapore Air.
label: positive

text: Great entertainment. Service excellent. Food so-so. As always, SQ never fails to disappoint in terms of flight efficiency and outstanding service standards. The air stewardess serving our row is clearly still a newbie, guided and assisted by several senior staffs throughout the flight service. Although nervous and made a few clumsy mistakes, she was very sincere and hardworking. The calm and helpfulness of her senior colleagues were also heart-warming to see. Taste of food has declined over the years with SQ, so was not expecting much.
label: positive

text: 2hr delay We had a 2hr delay for a flight which caused a different linked flight and we couldn’t choose our own seats. We paid fir the choosing of own seats but when we tried to complain about it got no where. The 2hr delay meant it was over lunch time and all they offered was $14aus (£7) for refreshments not lunch. It which was not enough to cover lunch at airport prices so not good enough Singapore Airlines. Will not fly with them again. Wifi was at a cost too.
label: negative

text: " SINGAPOOR" Dont Fly Singapore if you are Coeliac or want to use the club lounge Having flown many airlines the expectation was high that Singapore would live up to the hype, they failed on all fronts, First despite having checked when we joined, before we left and whilst we were away that access was available we were not allowed into the Kriss lounge at Heathrow as we were not Gold, but assured yes you can use the one in Singapore, Not the case. "Meals" thats a joke if you are a coeliac, refer to the picuture of what was actually provided vs the claimed menu as provided by Singapore airlines. As I don't drink alcohol it was necessary to chase up a soft drink as nothing was supplied at the time of the meal. Surely they could have supplied some rice or something for the flight. CONTINENTAL BREAKFAST • Fruit Appetiser: Seasonal fruit. • A portion of margarine • Diabetic jam • Non-dairy creamer • Sugar DINNER • Hors D'oeuvre: Buckwheat salad, canned pear slices, sliced roasted chicken thigh and shaved pink radish • Main course: Beef, thyme and onion stew, roasted rough cut potato, roasted pumpkin and sautéed peas and onion • Dessert: Exotic puree with lemon verbena jelly and poach pineapple with lemon verbena. Finally the Seating was not cleaned properly rubbish in the seat pockets and food left on the seat from previous flight. Still waiting for some clarrification from Singapore as to the menu fail. Sorry but very disappointed in the flight and treatment of issues raised.
label: negative

text: Flight Cancelled due to intoxicated pilot The cancellation of this flight was incredibly poorly managed. It was a flight en route to Delhi, for a lifetime travel experience, The only reason I got to meet my connecting trip in Delhi was because of my persistence in insisting I got to Auckland before the end of the day. Rebooking was shambolic with 2 personnel organising 200 passengers rebooking. It was inefficient, impersonal, unprofessional and incredibly stressful. A giant fail for Singapore airlines followup procedures when things go wrong from me. I will never fly with you again!!!
label: negative

text: Holiday We have travelled with Singapore Airlines in the past and found the service impeccable. We flew Singapore Airlines to Singapore and then SilkAir from Singapore to Male. These legs of our journey were very good and we couldn’t fault them. The service coming back to Singapore from Male was good even though we were experiencing turbulence, the flight attendants were still able to give us a meal and plenty of drinks. It all unraveled once we boarded in Singapore to come back to Sydney. Our seats were fine it was just the service. We declined the meal and I wasn’t even offered a drink, ever again. When we woke for breakfast by the time they got to us there wasn’t anything eatable left. The people beside us couldn’t even eat theirs. This is so unlike the airline we have flown with before. I was able to get an OJ, thankfully. I will be hesitant to fly with them again the service was terrible.
label: negative

text: Very cold luxury It takes about 13 hours to fly from Istanbul to Singapore. Almost all services were satifying but the temperature in the plane was extremely cold. A couple of passengers warned the crew about the situation but the temperature has not changed, they only said "it is regulated as necessary". We could not be able to change their opinion despite all the passengers put their coats on and took blankets. Personally I've got cold and flu. This situation was exactly the same on the way back.
label: positive

text: Travelling with a wedding dress & honeymoon treat Top tip for flying with your wedding dress: Before flying to NZ from the UK, I tried many times to get a clear answer from Singapore Airlines about the best way to take my dress on board (obviously not going to put it in my checked luggage!), with all answers being vague and with no guarantee that dresses can be hung in the cabin. In the end I bought a special wedding dress box which fit Singapore's carry-on dimensions (must be 115cm or less in total), but the total weight of the box + dress was over the 7kg limit. So I ended up carefully stuffing my dress into a small carry-on sized suitcase and it was just fine. Wrapped in tissue paper and plastic, there weren't even many wrinkles when I opened it. Another top tip: if you're on your honeymoon, let your travel agent know and you may get a lovely treat like we did! A couple of Singapore Slings and some chocolate cake were a lovely way to end our very long flight back to the UK.
label: positive

text: Efficient assistance for my mobility problem. The crew were very helpful at the start & end of the flight. My partner lost his ring & they removed the cushions to find it. The food was good.The cabin was clean & there was adequate leg room.
label: positive

text: Pre Covid ..The Best // Post Covid .. An Expensive Mistake Pre Covid. The A380 Suites are superb. The crew are attentive but discreet. As regular 1st Class travelers, my wife and I would not dream of flying with anyone else. The 777 flight Auckland to Changi is OK, the private room is a bonus while we wait for our next flight to Paris CDG on SQ's A380. The suites and service 'WERE' incomparable. Mid Covid (June 2020). The A350 used on the Changi - CDG leg was frankly a disgrace. It was old, tatty and dirty. The crew were at their usual best. The seat was uncomfortable and in need of new upholstery. This aircraft was a salute lesson on how to disappoint a customer. However, we blame Covid. Post Covid (June 2021 and 22). Same awful aircraft, nothing has changed. Crew are still superb though. The purser on board whispers to me that lots of passengers are complaining. Post Covid (June 2023) We have booked on Emirates A380. NZD18K each. These fares are insane. At least we're not an old clunker that needs to be retired.
label: negative

text: Great way to fly Great service. Clean planes with a variety of in flight movies and games to entertain you throughout your journey. Delicious menu and most important of all Always on time. No delayed flights unless unforseen circumstances. Guaranteed to reach your destination as planned. Good work Singapore Airlines. Keep up your excellent service. Will always fly Singapore Airlines.
label: positive

text: Mishandled baggage, poor food, poor inflight experience Our stroller wheel was broken and the cupholder tray was scratched. Food was very sub starndard. No vegetarian baby post weaning meal was available for my baby. Restrooms were dirty. Food plates were not removed immediately after service. May not fly with them again.
label: negative

text: Excellent in all ways Comfort and hospitality is what comes into one minds from the first moment you enter the plane untill you leave.
label: positive

text: Departed Sydney airport 26 November three hours late due to severe storm so we missed the connection to Johannesburg/Cape Town in Singapore. The airline went out of their way to accommodate us at the Carlton Hotel, provided transport to and from the Changi, then rebooked us on Qatar Airways. We then flew Singapore to Doha on Qatar Airways new A350-900 and from Doha to Cape Town on Qatar Airways Boeing 787-800. Seating comfort on their B777-200ER was better than the Boeing 787-800. Food service excellent both ways. Cape Town to Sydney via Singapore was without issues, crew friendly and service impeccable, Singapore Airlines Boeing 777-200ER may be getting old, seats however better than newer aircraft. Singapore Airlines are still our airline of choice.
label: positive

text: 12.5 hours is a long time when lie flat bed is uncomfortable Took an eternity to get in the A380 in the air due to traffic build up at Frankfurt and this resulted in us being 30 minutes behind schedule.
