Still on board staff were superb, meal and snack options were excellent, and drinks list was also excellent. Negatives were the poor movie choices and the poor layout of the seating capsules. Meant the space was quite crowded and the lay flat bed was a little uncomfortable. Will be interesting to compare to our last leg later this week in a Boeing 777.
label: positive

text: Super Flight Seamless check in at Sydney airport. Seats on board very comfortable, great in-flight entertainment and good food. Cabin crew very accommodating and friendly. Easy transfer (and only 60 mins in transit!) at Changi Airport. Flight to London just as good. Would definitely recommend Singapore Airlines, best premium economy we've flown.
label: positive

text: Flew Singapore Airlines to avoid cheaper budget airlines thinking it would be a better experience by paying more for the flight. Sadly disappointed, food choice was not available then the offering provided was cold. No drinks offered, seats were stacked so close together to squeeze as many as possible into the available space. Inflight entertainment is really bad. Appears Singapore is trying to extract as much money as possible from its passengers while offering nothing better than budget airlines. Will not fly them again and urge others to look at options.
label: negative

text: Comfortable airline travel to Singapore Easy online booking, and seat selection. Checked in online was also easy. No wait at airport, and no issues with boarding, except we were delayed both legs by some airport issues, no related to aircraft. We enjoyed comfortable travel in exit row seats, and the airline staff were very polite and courteous to us at all times. Food was supplied along with a good range of both non alcoholic and alcoholic beverages, and the hot towels to freshen up before meals was greatly appreciated. We’ve flown with Singapore airlines previously and are very happy repeat customers.
label: positive

text: Excellent service Amazing service on Singapore airlines, attendants were constantly offering refreshments and snacks between meal time, the seats were comfortable and good entertainment
label: positive

text: Comfortable in Economy plus My wife and I flew Singapore Airlines from London to and from SE Asia. Arrivals were right on time allowing us to catch the tight connection to Chaing Mai on the way out and right I time arrival in London four weeks later. We paid extra for the premium economy class and it was worth every penny... excellent service, good food and free drinks. ... making the 13 - 14 hour flight tolerable.
label: positive

text: Very comfortable The Singapore Air Premium Economy is a great example for others to follow. Excellent leg room (which is most important) and quality entertainment system and great service from the ladies
label: positive

text: Amazing Service Great service and excellent facilities. This was my first time flying business class and enjoyed every minute. Best part was the food and being able to lay completely flat. Would recommend to all.
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines all the way Having flown Singapore airlines before and being impressed we decided, for such a long trip from Perth to Rome and then our return leg from Paris to Perth via Singapore in both directions we decided to fly with them again. A decision we glad we made. The service, food, flight itself and the experience of new planes, such as the 380 was fantastic. They are so much quieter and this helped me as I am not a good flyer. One good recommendation if you are not a good flyer is to have a couple of days break somewhere on the way to your destination and on the way back if it is a long trip such as this. We did this coming back by stopping in Singapore on the way home and it was perfect but going to our destination we didnt and it was a bit too long if you are not a good flyer. The inflight service and entertainmemt was great with lots of choices of movies, music, kids stuff, games and comedy or TV programs. Overall the experience of flying with Singapore Airlines was fantastic and one we would always do for such long trips again. Excellent.
label: positive

text: Comfortable Flight I traveled First time with this Carrier but found them really Professional. Truly Asian Flight gives Warmth and Comfort to the Travelers. Service, Attention, Accessories everything is a Class of Next Level... Better than Jet or Air India
label: positive

text: Long haul from Australia First time I have flown with Singapore Airlines I was very impressed with the quality of service the attentiveness of the stewards/stewardesses. The food was okay for airline food and the staff constantly offering drinks to keep you hydrated.
label: positive

text: "so far the best flight experience" the plane was new , the seats are comfortable. upon entry to the plane you will be getting your own new ear phone, not recycled. the monitor in front of you is responsive, easy to use. the flight crew were all accommodating. anytime in the flight , they will accommodate your request. the food serve was delicious and so are the choice of drinks.
label: positive

text: 50/50 experience Have flown BA before and found the planes old and worn. Recommended Singapore Air and was expecting a lot more. Check in at Heathrow was good and easy. Firat leg on 380 to Singapore was good. Small P.E. area with its own washroom facilities and dedicted stewards. Whole area was spotless and new. The calf rest is useless if the seat in front reclines which also means leaving your seat requires a limbo manouvre. We had book the cook but the food was not good. Regular food lookd better. 1.5 hr change in Singapore is a long, long, long walk. Shall have assistance on return. Singapore to Sydney was very old, very worn Boeing 777. Had to go through Economy to washrooms which was a long walk through narrow aisles on a very bumpy flight. So many people using washrooms meant they became untidy. The seats were not comfortable, calf rests useless as on earlier flight. Seat pockets in front were broken and exposing sharp metal fixings. Stewards on both legs were helpful and very pleasant. I do not think we got Premium on the second leg, felt very let down. Would definitely not do Singapore Air 777 again. Not sure I would even do Premium Economy for the 380. This is really NOT value for money.
label: positive

text: Jakarta - Singapore - Milan July 9-10. Everything fine cabin crew excellent as always. Still my favourite airline.
label: positive

text: This time it was quite disappointing- Old airline, old films Ma first Singapore experience is more than 10 years agor and was for a flight to New York. It was a great flight, service perfect and all modern and new. This time I was looking forward to a flight from Singapore to Frankfurt. Such long flight to be expected of similar experience. unfortunately I found an old plane with old technology. Service was still good but not as it once was. The flight with LH to Singapore was nicer. What a pitty. Image can be ruined quite quickly.
label: neutral

text: Heathrow-Singapore-Auckland return Nov/Dec 2014. All four sectors were on the A380 and I had economy seating on the main deck for two trips and on the upper deck for the other two. Smoothest take-offs I have experienced and smooth quiet flights in general. Excellent service from flight attendants who treat you like they want you to fly with them again. They would come back and check on people who had questions or didn't understand how to operate the entertainment system. Adequate legroom and very good entertainment system to help you pass the hours. Most meals were excellent and flight attendants came through at non-serving times to offer snack items. Only minor issues: the entertainment system would lag a bit on playback of films and the tray table/seating areas could use a bit of a deep clean. Otherwise this was the first time I had flown Singapore Airlines in nearly five years and it remains as good as I remember - my favourite airline. Highly recommended.
label: positive

text: My baggage was delayed on both my onward and return flights. I requested compensation for my trip to Kochi, as I had to purchase clothes and toiletries. However, I was only offered AUD 50. I spent AUD 150 on these items. The response from the customer service team of Singapore Airline was very poor.
label: negative

text: Singapore Airlines never fails to please We have flown Singapore several times. Seat comfort, food offer and steward/stewardess service is always top notch. Our first choice when flying to Asia.
label: positive

text: Premium Economy? More Economy than Premium Ok, I'm not expecting Business Class for the cost of Premium Economy but apart from the very welcome extra seat width and pitch very litlle else seem to be offered. Check in was poor. We were unable to check in on-line as an 'Air New Zealand' customer so we got to the airport early. The ONLY seats left were two centre seats which is always a pain as you have to climb over someone else to get out. Someone has to have them but when I asked how to check in early to book a seat (which presumably others had done) I was given a blank look by the staff. Cabin staff are excellent and faultless. They did their very best. A glass of water in a plastic beaker was offerred after the plane took off (no sparkling wine as others) Food appeared to be same as economy and was served with plastic cutlery and 'glasses' (water in a pot with peel back foil lid that spills as you pull to open). Drinks were adequate but again appeared to be the same trolley as economy. A 14 hr flight is never too enjoyable but the Premium Economy service was well below that offered by both Virgin and Air New Zealand (which we thought was excellent) Am I expecting too much? Perhaps, but Premium Economy was well over twice the price of economy and in this instance just not worth it. I had always believed Singapore to be about the best around. This was not my experience.
label: neutral

text: Great seats. Great Service. This is an early morning Airbus 330 taking passengers from Changi to Perth. We left from a small enclave in Terminal B that houses gates B1-B4 behind an additional security check. Leave time for that. Once you are inside the enclave there is only a very limited cafe for food. Flight was delayed due to weather. Seats have lots of storage areas. They offered a wide selection of magazine and newspapers to read. Breakfast was served.
label: positive

text: Wow not what I expected We normally fly Virgin or an American company when we fly to the states. I was sceptical when I saw the flights to Houston, non stop flights for 2 at £760 for 2 in economy. You get 23kg allowance per passenger, also a piece of hand luggage each with no extra charge. Flights to Orlando were coming up at £1200 on cheaper airlines done a gave it a shot. Wow I was really surprised by how good it was. It's obviously not a massive tourist destination but both there and back we had no one also on our row of 3 so we could stretch out. Seats were quite comfy for economy and I did not feel like a sardine. Sat up right with both legs together and forward I would say I had around 3 to 5 inches distance from my knees to the back of the seat in front. Each seat has it's own seat back entertainment system. This has games, music, TV and a large range of movies from Hollwood, latest releases, indie, foreign and subtitled. The staff were very friendly and helpful throughout and genuinely were happy to help. The plane was modern and clean also. The service they provided could not be faulted, the drinks service was spot on and came round several times during the flight. You were given snacks, and we got at least 2 full meals in the flight. The food was very nice also, your given a menu and 3 options to choose from. I could not fault the flights or service at all, it as on a par if not better than Virgin. I will definitely use them again.
label: positive

text: Premium economy Recently flew premium economy from Dubai to Auckland via Singapore with the 2nd sector operated by Air NZ in premium economy. I had high expectations that were not met. Narrow hard seats that had slippery leather so pillow kept slipping when trying to sleep. Food was ok just a normal economy tray. Air NZ experience far better and it had own canin with private lavatories unlike Singapore airlines you had to share with economy class. It not worth flying premium on DIS just fly normal economy as there are no real perks
label: neutral

text: Singapore to Melbourne, and the plane I took seems like it is older than others in Singapore Airlines fleet and the seats were a bit more spacious. All the cabin crew were nice but since I was taking a midnight flight, you would hardly see cabin crew talking to passengers or walking past. There is not a lot of choices on the inflight entertainment, but overall, the flight was pleasant.
label: positive

text: Pack a lunch for business class or go hungry Although Singapore Airlines has a great reputation our experience was not particularly impressive in a good way. We flew business class. The pod was ok for sleeping but if you are tall, the angle is a bit awkward for one’s feet. I was more comfortable on Lufthansa business class and United’s Polaris. However, we starved. The food we were served was tasty but inadequate for a 19 hour flight. We were served dinner shortly after taking off and then another meal about half way through the flight but on the way over were then given just a small package of Oreo cookies. On the way back when I woke from a nap I saw other passengers in business class eating sandwiches with some bags of chips but when I asked for a sandwich I was told there weren’t any and was offered a small bag of nuts. That was it for the 9 + hours since our mid flight meal which is really skimpy especially given what we paid for the ticket. The airline couldn’t spare another few dollars for a sandwich? Even in economy United serves a sandwich a few hours before landing on a flight that long. I will say though that they handled their baggage glitch well. Although we were practically the first customers to check into the flight at JFK because we had a layover so our bags should have made the flight, for some reason they didn’t and after waiting at baggage claim in Singapore for our bags not to appear and we went to the baggage services office. As soon as we gave our name we were told that our bags were still at JFK and given some paperwork to complete- they had already prepared most of the form- along with some money to buy essentials. Apparently, the airline was well aware that the luggage was left behind and was prepared. Our bags were delivered the next day to our hotel. The airline did handle the baggage issue well but I never imagined I would have had to pack a lunch for business class. Also, although we had access to the airline club as is common when flying business or first class internationally we were only allowed in 2 hours before the flight which isn’t common. I’ve never had a time limitation before and that exacerbated our hunger because we didn’t have much time to eat during the limited time we had in the club and then had to leave to walk the gate to board. Our experience wasn’t awful and it is good to have a nonstop to Singapore but I’d select another airline for another route.
label: neutral

text: Medium haul flight from Singapore to Bangkok. The plane was a rather dated B777. Nevertheless, the cabin was well maintained, and the seats were comfortable and offered sufficient legroom. The food was very tasty. However, I was most impressed with the service of the cabin staff. I was wearing a suit, and the flight attendant asked me whether he could put the suit jacket on a hanger, which has never happened to me with any other airline.
label: positive

text: New Dreamliner Flight from Singapore on the new Dreamliner was really comfortable service excellent definitely would travel on this flight again.
label: positive

text: Charged twice for the extra bag This is our worst experience. We booked and extra baggage via online and paid for it. But the online system doesn't show that. We called customer care, and they assured us the booking went through and we won't be charged. But at airport they denied any booking and again charged us for the bag and told us to sort out the issue with customer care. We called the customer care multiple times and everytime we have to describe the. exact same thing and they ask for receipt and documents. We upload and they assured us we will be refunded. I AM NEVER FLYING WITH SINGAPORE AIRLINNES AGAIN, BAD SERVICE IS ONE THING, BUT THEY ARE SCAMMING PEOPLE FOR EXTRA MONEY.
label: negative

text: Manchester to Houston. Boarding, food, space of seats, customer service etc all excellent. 10/10 and will use again. I booked this flight as it was good value and a direct flight for our trip. First time using Singapore Airlines and would say they are the best airline I have been on. Looked after so well on the flight. Even getting different seat options to give us more space. Just great service.
label: positive

text: All good, except the food Thursday 19th September and our adventure in Lombok and Bali was coming to an end and the first leg of the long journey back to the UK was due to begin on board Singapore Airlines flight SQ949, from Bali to Changi Airport, Singapore. Our flight was due to depart at 21.45 arriving in Changi at 00.20, a scheduled flying time of 2 hours 35 minutes. We were airborne by 21.55. We were informed that the actual time would be 2 hours and 20 minutes flyingtime. We actually landed at 00.10, which was good news as our connecting flight to London was departing at 01.10. About 45 minutes into the flight food and drinks were served, the food option was fish and potatoes or chichen and rice. We opted for the chicken, it looked uappetising in fact it was disappointingly awful and was not eaten. The legroom was very good and the seats were comfortable and the Cabin Crew were attentive and charming. Both previous flights, outbound, with this Airline, were rated as excellent, sadly the food affected this rating.
label: positive

text: A major disappointment Having flown in from PER on a relatively short flight in a 787 we found ourselves in a decrepit A350 for a 7hour flight. AV was outdated, not intuitive & provided zero news channels & staff not very interested to find one. On the way from PER I was watching BBC News broadcast out of their Singapore studios ?? There was however a basic instruction clip for the seating so found the missing 787 armrest. Good food service, first hot meal of the day as breakfast out of PER was barely warm. BUT, a lousy wine selection to pair with my boeuf vigneron by George Blanc. No trace of a French vigneron red, except in the meal ! Just a Chianti & Barossa Shiraz for the reds & 2 whites. I had a better selection on QF BNE/PER !! What is the point of a G Blanc menu if you skimp on the wine ? Crew lightweight on product knowledge, no idea about G Blanc & not interested in the AV issues. It would appear adequate training is missing -- How the mighty have fallen !
label: neutral

text: Early flight Very early morning flight to HK- left on time with smooth check in time. Easy and comfortable with good food.
label: positive

text: Sydney to Rome via Singapore. First time travelling business my seat was literally located within 50cm of the toilets at the rear of business class. During this long flight these toilets were continually in use not only by business class but also economy class, and i was kept awake. I believe that these seats should not be offered as business class given there location. I would have rather spent the flight in economy class rather then being next to the toilets
label: negative

text: Always a good and safe Airline SQ has a good record and that is why we fly it. Premium economy can be a little cramped but well worth the extra $$. My partner is gluten free and it seems if one has "special" dietary requirements they are sat in the front row. This is ideal as there is miles of leg room and no problems getting up for a stretch. And, the meal looked Ok to me ! The service is so much better than Qantas and not quite as good as Virgin. We fly Virgin to the US and SQ to London.
label: positive

text: good kaiseki lunch good food, helpful and pleasant and accomodating staff smooth flight Only drawback..no priority for immigration queue unlike other airports e.g. Heathrow
label: positive

text: Vaping in Singapore/Changi Airport As an avid vapour I was worried about what to do once hitting Changi Airport as vaping is prohibited in Singapore. So here is how it works. I traveled from Auckland to Vietnam with a transit stop in Singapore for 3 hours and was panicking about my vape which was in my checked in baggage. This was not an issue but my plans had me coming back to Singapore for 3 days later in my travels - here's what I found out. While transiting you can carry your vape and use the smoking areas in the international terminals as long as you do not go through immigration. On my return to Singapore 2 weeks later I was going through immigration/customs so you can put your vape into baggage storage BEFORE going through immigration - in terminal 2 the baggage storage is behind Prada right beside the immigration gate and there is storage in every terminal. When I flew out I was going out of terminal 3 so I went through immigration at T2 picked up my stuff and headed over to T3 - easy peezy. You will either need to smoke cigarettes or use patches while in Singapore - I used nicotine lozenges which were no issue at all through customs. I was there late August 2019. Happy vaping...
label: positive

text: melb to singapore we travelled from Melbourne to Singapore in November and as usual found it to be as pleasant as flying economy can be, we have travelled with Singapore airlines several time now and apart from a couple of very minor issues, have always enjoyed it. great service, pleasant and efficient staff, good food and entertainment.
label: positive

text: Terrible customer service Horrible customer service. Suddenly they announced that transit is not allowed for Indians. No one responds. Beware booking with them as they may hold your money and not give any information and ask you wait until ur travel date to finally say your booking is cancelled. I had good experience with other airlines like Lufthansa even during pandemic.I will never take this airline.
label: negative

text: Cancelled our return flight, didn’t notify us and now refuse to refund us. While on holiday in NYC in December we logged on to choose seats for our return flight. When we entered our booking details the website responded that our flight had been cancelled. We checked our emails and text messages - nothing. My wife rang our booking agent who confirmed that Singapore Airlines had cancelled our flight. We asked for a booking on an equivalent premium economy flight on the same day, but we’re advised that none were available. After a lot of back and forth with the agent we were advised that there were seats available on a Scoot flight (Singapore Airline’s budget carrier). With no other options open to us and commitments back home we had to keep, we agreed and got home OK. Since then I have been chasing Singapore Airlines for a refund of the difference between a budget grade Scoot flight and the premium economy flight that we paid for, and perhaps an apology for cancelling our flight without notifying us. I have had no response. Airline says to take it up with the booking agent. Booking agent says it is the airline’s fault for cancelling the flight. Complaint has been referred to some third party called ‘Aunt Betty’ who seem to be some affiliate of Flight Centre. Singapore Airline’s premium economy service was poor. Conditions were cramped, food was terrible - nothing premium about it. Scoot was even worse - uncomfortable seats and no in flight entertainment. After sales service is non-existent, but they get a gold star for failure to communicate and for giving the runaround. Avoid at all costs!
label: negative

text: Loved flying with them! This was the first time flying with Singapore Airlines, and it was a truly wonderful experience! From the time I was greeted at the aircraft door, to the service on a flight that was 18 hours long (first flight) to Singapore, the flight attendants were very attentive. It seemed that no request was too much. On long haul flights (or just short flights) I have never seen restrooms so clean and neat. This may seem like a strange remark, but I have seen restrooms that were in such a dreadful state by the end of the flight you didn't want to use them. These were kept clean and tidy which was really nice. Flying Premium Economy was a good experience. Having a calf rest and footrest made sitting for such a long flight somewhat more comfortable. To perhaps repeat myself, I loved flying with Singapore Airlines. It was easy changing gates in Singapore, and people were friendly, with a smile and a warm welcome. I look forward to flying with them again, and if you have the opportunity, fly with them. I don't think you will be disappointed, I wasn't!
label: positive

text: Pompous ground staff! Too many seats cordoned off for handicapped customers in the boarding area. We took a seat there because there were a lot of empty seats as opposed to the other side which was standing room only. Rude supervisor approached us and told us we had to move even though there were a lot of empty seats. Seemed like they really didn’t care about customer service. Absolutely, no common sense. They just wanted to exert their authority at the expense of the customer.
label: neutral

text: A flight of fantasy Could not have been treated better. The cabin staff were brilliant and almost constantly enquired about our welfare. The service and food were excellent and we enjoyed the flight. On top of that we were offered a free stop-over in Singapore at the Carlton Hotel which is owned by the airline. We took that offer and were offered a second night at half-price which we took. I fully recommend them.
label: positive

text: SQ175 HAN-SIN on March 9 2014 seat 16D Airbus A330 300. Pros: nice food and wine very good entertainment and service. Cons: although seat is indicated full flat it is not possible for aircraft designed for short distance. Relatively low choice of magazines no menu for food they only show it to you very briefly. Very small overhead locker even my specially designed cabin luggage would not fit into any locker of the ATR 72. Slightly chaotic situation if you change seats at check-in.
label: neutral

text: Great Flight Attendants who played with and comforted my baby Though it was a 17 hour flight with challenges for our Baby Serah who was regularly crying, flight attendants came regularly to our place to play with the baby and make baby always happy. Flight Attendant 'Alvin Chen' was playing with the baby to remind himself of his daughter of same age whom he was awaiting to see. Another flight attendant 'Summer' - (forgot her real name which is tough) always played and talked to the baby as she hopes to have a baby like her in future. Service was excellent. I did not experience the so called hierarchy culture of Singapore in that particular flight as crew was made to feel equal to their bosses.
label: positive

text: Great Service as allways I recently flew with Singapore Airlines from Melbourne to Denmark through Singapore return trip with my 4-year old. As it turned out, I got caught in the SAS pilot strike on a connecting flight when I had to return to Melbourne, and if it hadn't been for Singapore Airlines' brilliant customer service, I would have been stuck! Within 6 hours of emailing Singapore Airlines, I had a customer representative calling me offering me an alternative flight home, re-booked at NO EXTRA COST!! I am super impressed and grateful, and this is one of the reasons why I ALWAYS try to book Singapore Airlines before any other airlines! Service and comfort on board the flights (MEL - SIN, SIN - CPH and AMS - SIN, SIN - MEL) were great with extra attention being paid to my pre-schooler with plenty of chats and making sure he was entertained. The child meals are also great, and I find it fantastic that they are served first, about 20-30 min before the normal meal service, giving a parent the chance to help feed the kid first and be able to eat my own meal while warm :-)
label: positive

text: Singapore airlines luxury! This was an upgrade we considered for a long flight from Amsterdam to Brisbane for some time before committing, and I am pleased to say this was a great choice, it was the most enjoyable long haul flight either of us had ever experienced. The seating is one plus one, no pesky middles with elbow wars... all very comfortable, and quite easy to sleep (if you feel the need). The entertainment system allows time to drift away, and without doubt this is helped along significantly by the noise cancelling headphones supplied. The A350 is a little louder than an A380 - not too bad though, and the majority of the flight I had headphones glued to my scone. Definitely did not feel any noise issues, with or without the headset. In flight food was very good without quite being up to the Emirates gold standard. Our final leg of the trip involved a switch to the front seats in this premium block, while still very comfortable, the screens are a little more distant, so what you gain in legroom you lose in entertainment standard, this worked in well anyway as I needed some beauty sleep, I am after all only here as eye candy. On the whole, an excellent trip, and well worth the upgrade.
label: positive

text: Melbourne to London with Singapore Airlines. Premium Economy is totally inferior compared to Qantas. No private feel to the cabin and no private toilet - just a silly curtain for separation. You have to outright ask for the Champagne which is meant to be part of the privilege of paying double the economy fare. Never again for this former SQ traveller.
label: negative

text: Travel to Singapore by A-350-900 Flights were punctual and the seating was cofortable with adequate leg room.The one minus point was that the dinner was served very late in the night about 2 hours after we took off which was around 1.15 am.So we were deprived of our sleep as well thereafter.
label: positive

text: Most amazing flight experience 5 star experience. Cabin crews are very friendly and helpful, food is very tasty, take off and landing is smooth, more than enough leg room even in economy class, perfectly on time everytime. Will definitely fly with Singapore Airlines again.
label: positive

text: Very comfortable & well serviced flight Singapore Airlines provided excellent service during this trip. It began with a very efficient check in at Heathrow. The flight itself was very comfortable and we were well provided for during the flight - quite good food and wine. And of course, Changi airport in Singapore is always a good airport to wait at for the next flight.
label: positive

text: Worst service ever I am very very very upset with Singapore airlines and it's staff. The treatment my mother and I have received at the Auckland airport from Linda Gu and Laura Yip was beyond disappointing. We have everything in order for my mother to travel to Malaysia vis transit in Singapore today at 1.15am. They made us wait at the counter standing for 2 hours while they went back and forth wondering if my mother held a valid visa. I have advised them I have confirmation from immigration prior to the booking of the flight to ensure everything will be done smoothly. They we unsure and kept snapping pictures of my mothers visa and sending it via WhatsApp to God knows whom to enquire if it's acceptable- is that standard process? Snapping pictures of personal identification /passport and forwarding then on an unsecured platform?. They made us wait until the last 10 minutes and denied her boarding getting an executive decision from the manager NOT Malaysian immigration, who I have just gotten off the phone with and they have confirmed that the visa IS valid and she IS entitled entry into Malaysia. I am unable get in touch with anyone from your contact center to have this matter looked into as they have wrongfully denied my mother boarding. This has given us so much stress and anxiety and this is so appalling for what is touted to be a world class airline! If they had told me upfront that they will not be boarding her as they are unsure and given us some notice we could have gotten immigration on the phone and done something. Instead they waited untill the last moment and just walked away. This is beyond belief
label: negative

text: Unfair Charges Due to Government border shutdowns, I decided to bring my flights home forward by 2 days. Supposed to be no rebooking charges, but they charged me an extra $520 AUD to do so, with a far worse delay at Singapore Airport! This was far more than double what the original flights cost.
label: negative

text: Efficient and Excellent We flew Melbourne Via Singapore to Colombo, and on our return Colombo to Australia with a 5 day stop over in Singapore. All flights were on time and the service brilliant, Will fly with Singapore Airlines on our next overseas journey.
label: positive

text: Attentive / efficient. We recently travelled with Singapore Airlines, we have done quite a few long haul flights with different carriers. This rates as one of the best, the A380 was "newish " so well appointed and equipped. The timing of the food was well spaced and the choice / quality was excellent. Most of all the Staff were extremely friendly, attentive, curtious, efficient and polite. My only criticism is with other providers a "wash bag" was provided to freshen up - but not so with them.
label: positive

text: Travelling with Singapore irlines I cannot speak highly enough about our flight with Singapore Airlines the flight attendants were very helpful, nothing was a bother to them, the food was great far better then a lot of other airlines flight, entertainment good and the seats quite comfortable.
label: positive

text: Terrible customer service We couldn't board the flight because I tested positive for Covid pre-flight. The rebooking process was a nightmare. We called their customer service so many times, each time almost an hour of waiting and talking. They always promised to follow up after a manual fee calculation has been done. But they never called, and the whole process repeats itself again and again like in a horror movie. In my last call, the lady was very rude, so I have to write this review to let people know that Singapore airline is not what it used to be.
label: negative

text: So disappointing This is not the airline I have travelled with so many times in the past. Terrible waiting time for boarding...so disorganised. Food disappointing too. Wouldn’t recommend them anymore
label: negative

text: Excited about going on an A380-800 but the plane was already delayed. I was excited about going on an A380-800 for the first time as Id never flown in one before, however that was tainted by already receiving an email at 6am that morning to say that they had rebooked our onward connection from Singapore Changai to Brisbane international into a 12 hour layover as the flight out of JFK NY left 3hrs late and we wouldn't be able to connect to our original flight. We checked in ok and got a 15 euro meal voucher each to spend at the airport for food due to the delay. The plane came in to Frankfurt on the new scheduled time and was turned around quickly by the ground crew and we were soon boarding for our flight to Singapore. We had booked seats as I wanted to be able to see the engines and the seat was excellent for this. We booked seats 43A&B which were forward economy seats so we were the last group to board. The seat was a standard economy seat with the only issue being a small metal box cutting into the footwell for seat 43A. Not much but just enough to be a pain. I really enjoyed take off and landing with the view of the engines. The service again from the Air Singapore crew was excellent. Very attentive and professional. The inflight entertainment system, KrisWorld, is excellent and has something for everyone. It was a 12hr flight which is long when flying in economy. The A380-800 was very clean inside. One thing I did note on the bottom level window seat was the bulkhead is about 9 inches away from the seat so it makes resting the pillow against the window impossible to sleep on. When on the A350's, the gap is better for this. Still, an excellent flight and great service from the Singapore team. Although we had a delay, they had rebooked everything and informed us every step of the way and helped everyone make connections when the plane landed in Singapore. Still not a fan of 12 hour layovers though, but they did their best for us. Will definitely fly these guys again.
label: positive

text: Pleasant flight Long but pleasant flight. Its the go to flight for long trips. The staff is very friendly, helpful and make you comfortable. They have a great menu for both lunch and dinner. They also have an up to date, all packed KrisWorld for great entertainment.
label: positive

text: simply the best The service is simply perfect. Friendly, helpfull and furfilling all wishes. (The Singapore Sling was excelent) Very good food (with choice) over 200 films, over 200 TV series, over 200 Lp's.... super more space to relax than other airlines. simply the best !
label: positive

text: Flew BNE-SIN return in Economy class. All flights departed and arrived on time. Aircraft was modern and clean A330 with nice interior. Seats were not the most comfortable and felt a bit cramped. IFE was very good user friendly. The cabin crew are wonderful very helpful kind and courteous. Food was of high quality however the continental breakfast was a let down. All kinds of amenities were available and snacks provided on request. I did enjoy my trip with Singapore Airlines maybe a tad overrated. I feel other Asian airlines such as KE CX CI are just as good but still one of the best airlines you can fly!
label: positive

text: 14 hours of unexpected comfort. Despite being in economy, where we are used to bare minimum service and in flight entertainment, we had incredible service as well as wide range of stuff to do, also the food actually made me look forward to eating plane food instead of dreading it.
label: positive

text: Surabaya to Singapore in economy class. It's visible from beginning it's good quality airline. I made online check-in to reserve seat before, all process without any problem. On the airport, baggage drop and boarding pass printing process went very smoothly. Because of small traffic on Surabaya airport security control process did not take much time. Also lounge was very nice and spacious. Boarding process was well organized. On board the service is on really good level. Staff speaks good English and is kind. Meal service was really tasty. Our plane was quite old and it was visible in the entertaiment system. Screen in my seat had some problems with touch screen and it was lagging but with additional remote I was able to use it. Before landing we got some information about connecting flights. All services was on time. I highly recommend this airline.
label: positive

text: SQ is best! One of the best airlines. Very attentive, very friendly, (and also very good looking) flight attendants. Great aircrafts with spacious seating. Excellent food. Top in class logistics (flights always on time, luggage is transferred quickly, etc).
label: positive

text: Almost made me enjoy flying Flight was fine, food ?? dinner ok, breakfast not so. Attendants were fantastic. Bags missed flight but were waiting for us, at our hotel, the following morning. Excellent communication with staff at airport. Flew on to New Zealand and had the same great service. Would recommend them to all. Best customer service bar none.
label: positive

text: I've never had a more frustrating experience trying to book a flight .. website saying unable to proceed, customer service tell me to keep trying different flights until one works. Then several credit cards declined. Customer service tell me to send an email, they say they'll call me back .. never do. Absolute frustrating mess!
label: negative

text: Great service as usual Wonderful service by the cabin crew and a smooth and safe flight from the start to the end of the flight.
label: positive

text: Comfortable and lots of movies variety The new seat is very comfortable and quite a good amount of leg space. The screen is also big and there are lots of variety of movies selection in SIA inflight system.
label: positive

text: Flight to Singapore Flew Premium Economy on a direct flight to Singapore Changi airport. Cabin crew were very attentive, food was good and entertainment choice excellent
label: positive

text: Sydney to Kuala Lumpur via Singapore. My first experience on Singapore Airlines A380. The cabin crew were very attentive, friendly, but could smile more. They addressed me by my name and dealt with a few difficult passengers professionally. IFE has an excellent selection. The seats are comfortable (I o had the whole row of 4 to myself!) with handy power sockets on every seat. Food was amazing and beef rendang cooked to perfection . The Singapore Sling is a must try.
label: positive

text: Singapore to Frankfurt. I was a frequent flyer with Singapore Airlines. I was redeeming my miles and booked my ticket through SIA directly. I received E-Ticket confirmation. But, when I reached airport with my family, they told me my child ticket (3 month) had not been issued. They didn't knew why. They ask me to pay a full price one way ticket at $800, instead of the $102 it was supposed to cost. I sent a letter after the trip and ask explanation and reimbursement. They replied after 1.5 month. They said they made a mistake with the code share partner and apologised, but they didn't reimburse the difference between what I was suppose to pay and what I paid without having any choice at the airport. In short they made a mistake but don't take responsibility. I have stopped using this airline. In addition we were not even together on the first row with bassinet despite there were available seats.
label: negative

text: Reliable airlines with excellent service I am delighted to use SQ, schedule is on time, and in flight meal is good. I used to think that sq fare would be expensive. But, thanks to travel fair, travel with SQ became affordable, must have a good plan in advance.
label: positive

text: Worth the additional cost for the extra leg room First trip to India - check-in was slow due to the need to check e-visa and vaccinatation documents but was otherwise smooth and fairly rapid. The boarding process could have been improved (no fault of the airline) as no queues were organised. Considering that this flight was over 4 hours, I had chosen to pay a small additional fee that gave me a window seat which no seat in front of me. Being free to stretch my legs as much as I wished as well as being able to simply walk off to visit the washroom outweighed the slighly annoying requirment to have my inflight entertainment system stowed during take-off and landing (as compared to other passengers with seat-back systems). I was glad to see flat trays (rather than heat-retentive boxes, or were the latter only for short flights) were used for meals. The 'chicken and rice' option (actually a sort of briyani) was rather tasty although a little more meat would have been ideal. The crew also did well keeping everyone hydrated, as well as the toilets clean, throughout the flight. And a shout-out to Flight Steward Brandon Sim (I believe that was his name) with whom I had a friendly general exchange with about planes and flying.
label: positive

text: Rude ground handling, especially for my kids. This was the most traumatizing experiences with an airline for my family, especially for my two kids. On that day, it was our last day in Netherland after I finished my study there and we will leave for good. I already counted my luggages (many luggages) both checked in and cabin. All based on our past experiences with different major airlines i.e. Etihad, KLM, Emirates, Garuda, ANA Air, Qatar Airline, etc. That we will be okay. So, at the airport as per our calculation all the checked baggages went it without problem. The rest is the cabin baggage, which were 1 cabin suitcase and 1 handcarry for each person (with additional kids backpack, for each of my kid). So, all went well until we were at the boarding gate. The ground officer there (male officer) said rudely that: "what are you thinking? Bringing that many luggages to the cabin?" And then he try weighing all my luggages based on his "instinct" and said that we overweight 30 kilos and must pay 856 Euro. I start panicked, my wife crying, my kids crying. So I choose to throw away all those luggages ans board the plane. But then, after almost entering the plane, they came chased us and yelled I cannot throw my luggages like that. So how I am supposed to do?!?!?! Then, I choose to pay. I had 400 euro in my saving and the rest by cash, so it should be enough. But then, they said they cannot accept debit and/or cash, only credit card! At that time my credit card was not enough to cover that amount. So ultimately, we were kicked out and all of our checked baggages were dropped off. Our flight then re-scheduled to the next day (thanks to the nice lady). So, we sorted everything and throw away many important goods, memento from our life in Netherlands, etc. We wnet again to check in and met again with the male ground handling officer. All the baggages checked in and now they wanted to see our cabin carry on, we were treated like a criminal, my kids were scared to death. After long check, the male officer was pointing at my kids backpack, said that those too already too much for a cabin carry on, I mean...its just a 5 and 8 years kids backpack for god sakes! And, so I told the kids that we must throw their backpacks away. So we did that. Then we went through the boarding process all over again. We were separated from the rest of customer by the same male officer, again, like we were a criminal. He test each of our cabin baggage again with his instinct, after long tiring process, we can board the plain. Interesting fact was, when we transit in Changi, we saw several person that brought three items to the plane, cabin suitcase, backpack and carry on bag (one of them I manage to took the picture). So where is the absolute strictness of 1 person 1 cabin baggage gone? Is it only applied to specific country, or what? So, I just told my children that I will get them a new bag, better than the bags they forced to threw away and also promised them that we will not fly with Singapore airlines again, ever.
label: negative

text: Unrivaled excellence Exceptional service on board, dedicated caring personnel, professional and always smiling, keeping the cabin clean and tidy all the time on this 12 hour flight, maintaining the toilets spotless. The seats are great, flat bed of course, lot of spaces 1/2/1 seating configuration, corridor access for all, excellent privacy, just one problem with the remote control on the side is very sensitive and can be easily triggered inadvertently. The Airbus A380 makes the flying experience exceptional, smooth, silent flight. The food is within industry standards, nothing special, boarding quick, flight on time. An excellent airline because of its committed people and its great seats.
label: positive

text: What has happened to Singapore Airlines My daughters flew Singapore Airlines from Sydney to LHR and return, arriving home today after a month in the UK. Over the last decade we have regularly flown with Singapore Airlines (SA) and have found them to be really good. Well, it seems things have really changed and not for the better. SA are now running Airbus 350s on the SQ241 route which have very reduced leg room in economy ( 18"). They do not provide a dinner meal on the SA 305 route from LHR to Singapore or the connecting flight to Sydney SA 241. Refreshments and snacks very available on the SQ 305 leg and the service was good. The SA 241 leg was unsatisfactory with poor meals very limited service in economy, no water and soiled toilets from early in the flight. They felt it was more like a budget flight..ie..Scoot with a SA logo. Seems you either pay for PE or BC or your really are in cattle class with Singapore..so very disappointing that SA has followed QANTAS down the cheap and nasty route! Unfortunately, given past good experiences wit SA my Wife and I have booked with SA to go to Europe next year! Will have to review that decision!
label: negative

text: Extremely disappointed I was told by many people how reliable and fabulous this airline was, so I booked my flights through them. I travelled from Melbourne to Singapore and then Singapore to Melbourne aboard Singapore Airlines. I was bitterly disappointed on my journey home as, despite travelling with my partner, they decided to separate us. Not just a row or two but, 10 rows and a wall separated us. When we mentioned it to the crew in India, the male staff member basically told us it was too bad and we would have to arrange something ourselves once we arrived in Singapore (the 2nd leg of our flight home). Upon arrival in Singapore we were shocked and horrified to find that we would have to speak with the passenger ourselves to sort something out. The airline made an error and we have to sort it out!!! Long story short, we managed to sort it with the fellow traveller but it should never have been left to us to sort. Staff are friendly, food is reasonable and seats are uncomfortable for long haul flights. I would fly Singapore Airlines again but, only if they could ensure me from the get go that when two people are booked together, that they are actually seated together.
label: neutral

text: great service, excellent foods, large movie collection My flying experience is better with Singapore airline. they work on the time and excellent in-flight service.
label: positive

text: Mr Very disappointed with our overnight flight from Singapore and would be hard pressed to go with them again. After take off the staff came with a tray of water, juice and white wine. I asked for something else but never received it. The staff then all disappeared until breakfast was served about 6 hours later. Supper would have been nice. This must be the he easiest roster in Singapore Airline.
label: negative

text: FLY DURING THE DAY Just wish they could give you a little more leg room. It's just so cramped in Economy. On the way to Japan we had a nigh time flight it was almost imposable to sleep as it's just too uncomfortable. On the way home we had a day time flight I feel this is better as you can read watch movies or play games the time seems to go more quickly.
label: positive

text: As economy travel goes, pretty good For a three-hour regional flight, I doubt if we could have done better. The leg-room wasn't great, but the food was edible and the wine drinkable. We left on schedule and the timing was good, getting us to Singapore late afternoon. My only complaint would be that we didn't get the seats we had booked online. For our return leg, checking in online a good 36 hours before departure, all aisle seats were already booked. Still, I'd choose SQ over Cathay every time!
label: positive

text: Longest there is Epic. Cabin crew knows your name. Food chice excellent. New airplane smell. Singapore arrival makes USA arrivals look like third world. Best flight ive ever had. Period.
label: positive

text: World's Best Airline vs Low Cost Airline I left my wallet on seat 58E. Ten days later, SQ Customer Service informed me that the wallet was found handed in by their staff but no money inside. Three years ago, my cousin left his wallet in the seat pocket in one of the low-cost airline, he got the wallet back with no cents missing. Be very careful as there might be a thief on this World's Best Airline.
label: negative

text: Still one of the best Always use Singapore Airlines when our family flying abroad. Great service, great in flight movies selection, especially when you travel with young Children
label: positive

text: Excellent service Cabin crew were, as usual, very hard working on this busy night time flight. Pleasant smiling helpful cabin crew can make or break your experience. Check in with Singapore is always super efficient as is baggage handling.
label: positive

text: lack flexible special diet menu service is very good. they hand out hot towel to clean hand before meal.They have good menu with a lot of food. except I dont see any flexible special diet request. I dont eat pork and shell fish but none of the special menu fits me ,Muslim diet doesnt have pork but they eat sea food. and I dont like vegetarian diet or kosher diet So I had to risk anything I cant eat in the regular menu. Hope they a special flexible diet for request
label: positive

text: Generally good but beware of a potentially unplesant issue Singapore Airlines is deservedly a 5-star airline for many reasons. It's hard to stay ahead when it's a benchmark for other airlines, but one area it has featured heavily is a renewal of its inflight cabin experience. We flew this return following a family holiday, and I was quite excited to experience the new slim line seats on the airline's newest Airbus A380. First, the good stuff. Fantastic inflight entertainment, decent-to-good meals (even for economy) so that going hungry is almost unknown, clean suroundings, and service from the flight crew was all we've come to expect - friendly, guest-oriented and helpful albeit a little robotic at times. The rather unexpected issue was actually the new economy seats. In their upright position, we found them fine with adequate room (if there is such a thing these days). However, the seats reclined in a such a way that when the fellow passeger in front does so to the maximum, the inflight screen came very close to one's face. This automatically limits the personal space it a little tricky to get out of one's seat. And what's worse, my fellow passenger below didnt take kindly to me reclining my seat and shoved back with enough force that it forced my seat back to its near-original upright position (I didn't even realise this was possible until this flight). Obviously, this made for some tension between us. While I can certainly understand how he felt (after several months of cooling off), I have to say that this would qualify as my most disappointing flight so far on this legacy airline.
label: neutral

text: compact design with good legroom, friendly crew BUT you may not get your PRE-PAID selected seat Seating was comfortable for me who is of medium height and built. Food was quite reasonable, with continuous wine supply albeit of single selection red or white. As for paying extra to select our seats, we did not end up getting what we chose and there was no refund. Airline still reserve their right to move you around for their own convenience. And there was no recourse!
label: positive

text: Airline is good, food was very much average The airline, amenities and staff are all great. However the food is beyond average. Literally a chicken or fish option and everything offered was not appealing at all. Honestly throw me a sandwich any day instead. I ended up taking on a packet of chips rather than eating the meals.
label: positive

text: Wonderful Equipment and Great Service The A350-900 is a great plane. Enjoyed the comfortable seats and spaciousness even for economy. The entertainment system is one of the best I have used and the selection of content is good. Of course, the SQ service on this flight is everything you would expect.
label: positive

text: Great service, unusually decent food Excellent onboard service; and the food served in economy - for which I had low expectations based on other airlines - was unusually tasty. Granted, Darwin is not a busy airport, but the ground staff were extremely helpful and efficient.
label: positive

text: Not worth paying the extra for Premium Economy Crew were absolutely wonderful both flights I have to point out but premium economy is just not worth the additional expense. The food served on both flights was really poor quality. The seats had slightly more room but really very little difference in overall comfort to an economy seat. No boarding priority- only benefit was early check in which was helpful so I could explore Changi airport without lugging my suitcase. To be perfectly honest I wouldn’t choose to fly Singapore Airlines again after this trip.
label: neutral

text: Simply perfect! Zurich to Singapore and back from Denpasar to Zurich via Singapore with my family. I bought the tickets online through their web site taking advantage of a special offer they extremely cheap. Upon reservation I was immediately allowed to choose the seats and special meals (I am vegetarian). Every flight was perfectly on time or landed early. Seats are comfortable and inflight entertainment excellent. My special meal arrived at the same time of other meals warm and very good other meals were also good. Large variety of drinks and good wine. Several times during the flight they offered water juices and snacks. I was travelling with a 4yr old child who was continuously spoiled by the cabin crew with gifts and additional food. We asked for sandwiches and snacks several times and they offered them immediately. Getting in the aircraft on the way back I remarked that the seat belt on my seat was broken. Ground staff arrived immediately they dismantled the seat and changed the belt. The whole operation did not take more than 5 minutes! A special word to the cabin crew it was not my first flight with Singapore Airlines and I am always astonished by how lovely caring and professional they are! They are always smiling never get nervous or stressed and are extremely efficient they never forget something you ask them!
label: positive

text: New Business class cabin! There is a reason why SQ is consistently voted the number one airline for its services. The new BC cabins are fantastic and luxurious. Service was impeccable and the inflight entertainment like no other. Had a good nights rest before landing in SYD
label: positive

text: Flew in to Hong Kong on SQ856 Amazing flight on SQ suites. Product was undoubtedly faultless, especially the huge washroom. Loved the privacy of the seat, I was in 2F. Dev and Lucy were super accommodating and I would totally fly again if I knew they were on my flight. Thanks guys!
label: positive

text: WHERE HAVE ALL THE SMILES GONE? Seat were good, food was good, entertainment system good, boarding good, but service with a smile gone. I use to value Singapore Airlines as one of the best airlines in the world but something has changed with the on board staff. Don't get me wrong, they do their job but the genuine smiles have disappeared.
label: positive

text: Excellent Economic Class Although it's economic class, this flight has the most confortable seat with a great pillow. The food are good for Asian, can't say about another type because I didn't have it.
label: positive

text: Excellent Flight Excellent service, excellent food, excellent entertainment choice, will fly again. The flight crew were very friendly, the seats and leg room was good. Good to fly with family.
label: positive

text: Pretty good Best thing about Singapore airlines is the hot towels provided during the start of the flight which freshens you up. Legroom is pretty average but comfortable. Service is good, meals provided in the flight are pretty good. In flight entertainment options needs to be improved. Most of the apps are not working during the flight.
label: positive

text: Very good Love Singapore 🇸🇬 and of course Singapore Airlines is amazing 😉 don’t have to say anything about it the best of the best!!!
label: positive

text: 4.5/5 Safety: 5/5 Cleanliness: 5/5 Customer Service: 5/5 Quality of Food: 4/5 Value for Money: 5/5 SIA has always been my preferred airline worldwide, primarily for its safety track record. This time around we flew with our toddler of 16 months, and the ride was very manageable due to the friendly service staff, they were a great help to the 7-hour ride on the plane with a toddler. Kudos to the team!
label: positive

text: Always a pleasure to fly with Singapore Airlines 11am flight from Singapore to Melbourne, quick and easy check in and bag drop and through customs without a hitch. Lounge is large and well stocked. Welcome drink offered on boarding (champagne, water or oj). Seats are a little tired now compared to the newer iteration but the seats are wide and service cannot be beaten.
label: positive

text: Fabulous This was a fabulous flight the staff were fantastic,and the food was great . Was very comfortable and would definitely use this airline again .
label: positive

text: Worst Experience Ever, Unlike The Usual Experience This is the worst experience that I have had with Singapore Airlines or any other Airlines. I have been part of the Travel Trade for over 25 years and have always vouched for Singapore Airlines. I never expected such carelessness & casual attitude from Singapore Airlines. My bad experience started with the Singapore Airlines office in Ahmedabad. They personally know me as well as our company for over a decade now. We have been giving them business for almost 2 decades. Since, I was traveling myself, I requested for certain good seats, if possible. However sometimes the Airlines sell these seats (emergency row seats with more legroom) and hence I had only requested them to keep a small message in their airline system to allocate these seats to me if they are not taken till last minute. They promised the same but never did anything. In fact they blocked 2 seats for me & my wife on two separate rows !!! I had selected special meals when I booked the tickets, almost a month in advance. It is also printed in my tickets - AVML meals. However when we boarded the aircraft they had no instructions about our meals ??? We are strict vegetarians and hence we said that we will not eat in this case. Later a junior air hostess came to us and told us that they have some different kind of vegetarian meals for us. She told me that some other guests refused to eat their meals and hence she was obliging us !!! I do not understand if the staff is trained to present the matter in better way ? We felt like beggars who were given food because someone else decided "not to eat". This could have been simply presented in a better manner I also don't know if the staff is trained to identify between veg. and non veg. food ??? They gave us lamb meat and presenting the same as vegetarian food. When I opened the food box, i realized that it was not vegetarian food and hence I asked the air hostess again to re-confirm. She showed the label on the box, which she claimed to mention that it was vegetarian food. However she was not ready to see the actual food.....only looking at the label and insisting that this was vegetarian food. I was still skeptical and hence I requested to call her supervisor. It took quite some time and in the meantime, my wife already started eating the food, trusting her word. The supervisor came and immediately understood the matter. He took both the food packets and confirmed after some time that it was lamb meat. My wife being highly religious and strictly vegetarian felt sick and was deeply hurt emotionally. She could not forgive herself for trusting the airline staff...........they later apologized several times but the damage was already done beyond their imagination. We later tried to sleep to forget the entire episode. However it seems that blankets given by the airline staff were not properly washed or had some kind of bugs. Both of us 8-10 dark red rashes on our legs. Something bit us or there was something in the blanket which was allergic and we started to itch like crazy in both the legs. My wife was also bleeding in couple of places when we landed at Singapore airport. These 3 incidents made it the worst experience of our life time. This review is based on my last experience and hence cannot to generalized for all other trips.
label: negative

text: Can't fault the Singapore Airlines Service Of course you expect a better service in Business Class, and Singapore Airlines deliver. Very attentive staff who greet you by name, great food and drink options, and nothing is too much trouble. My wife's seat table developed a fault (after the meal service) and could not be stowed. Four staff were involved in getting it fixed over a period of maybe 10 or 15 minutes. Later in flight there was an invitation to spend some money from the in-flight shopping, to make up for the inconvenience. This was above and beyond, and was not asked for or expected. Thank you Singapore Airlines for a great trip.
label: positive

text: Excellent service Staff are thoughtful and efficient as well as caring. We had a sick passenger on board and the capatain had to divert the journey. He kept us informed all the way. Staff were outstanding in their care of the passenger.great service
label: positive

text: Frankfurt to New York. Friendly smiling crew made a huge difference on this flight. Good food and entertainment, comfortable seats, on time departure. I have used Singapore Airlines for over 30 years and they continue to be my favorite carrier.
label: positive

text: Excellent service Second time to fly Singapore Air - and I can not brag enough on the service you receive on their airlines. The staff is very professional, extremely attentive. We have thourghy enjoyed our trips on their planes.
label: positive

text: Great service We had a great flight and the staff and service was first class Everything we asked for was there My partner did not like the main course for dinner so was offered Somethong that was not on the menu
label: positive

text: Wonderful flight This airline is our first to go to for any of our overseas holidays. Great service by all plane staff. They are always kind, thoughtful and looking after our every need. The airline constantly updates us of any of our flight changes. Great and tasty food and amenities are always clean.
label: positive

text: Waiting more than six weeks for a refund I requested a refund on 18th June and I not heard heard from Singapore Airlines. I tried emailing, but my booking reference number is not valid so it can't be sent. I tried calling too but I got a recorded message stating that it not the number to enquire about the refund. Singapore Airlines I used to love, but now I don't trust this airline. I should never have booked with the airline. I have booked other airlines and got the refund quicker.
label: negative

text: Top 3 Airlines in The World We have taken this Flight a Few times to Singapore,Always a Great experience.Due to Business Class ,we were able to use The Polaris Lounge at SFO,i have to say we were very surprised by the Lounge in US.we have been using the AA Lounge and PP Lounges all over But this was very Good.check in was Great,Service always Top Notch! Seats were Good ,Turn Down Service Good,Only Blemish may be the selection of movies.Food was the Highlight!
label: positive
